title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram/ISWAP invaded some communities but were repelled by soldiers. Two residents and scores of the insurgents (assuming at least 40) were killed. A local church was also razed.

title: Anglican Priest, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed Venerable Edwin Achi, an Anglican priest, about a month after his abduction on October 28, 2025. His abductors initially demanded a ransom of N600 million for his release, but later reduced it to N200 million. His wife and daughter remain in captivity. It is believed that he was killed in the community where he was abducted.

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Bandits killed a hunter and a resident during a foiled kidnapping attempt of students. Members of the Kiri Vigilante Group swiftly mobilised and rescued students who the gunmen had initially kidnapped.

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Troops of the 12 Brigade Nigerian Army killed a bandit and rescued a kidnapped victim. The bandits were reportedly crossing the Oshokoshoko Obajana corridor with some abducted persons when they were intercepted.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 152 Task Force ambushed and killed 2 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists who were crossing into Nigeria from Cameroon.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 192 Battalion and hybrid forces ambushed and killed 4 Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters. Others were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries.
place: Gwadale general area in Pulka–Gwoza axis

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 192 Battalion ambushed and killed a Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorist. Other insurgents reportedly retreated into the Mandara Mountains.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: Bandits killed Alhaji Muhammad Bakoshi, a community volunteer and the Jama’atu Izalatil Bid’ah Wa Iqamatus Sunnah (JIBWIS) Zalau Discipline Officer, and abducted his wife. He was killed in his residence.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: Bandits ambushed police men on a mission to curb farmer-herder conflict and killed DSP Ahmad Muhammad (SID), ASP Mustapha Muhammad (10 PMF), Inspector Amarhel Yunusa (10 PMF), Inspector Idris Ahmed (10 PMF) and Corporal Isah Muazu (AKU). 2 other officers were injured.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A vigilante member, Tukur Bala, died from gunshot injuries sustained during an encounter with bandits who raided a Fulani settlement to rustle cows. The victim and his colleagues repelled the attackers.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits allegedly loyal to Bello Jurji, a notorious bandit, killed 2 people and abducted 10 women and a man. They also injured 2 people.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits killed 3 people who were at their farm to retrieve harvested rice. They also kidnapped 4 rice farmers. One of the dead victims was a vigilante.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Attack, Yobe
description: Suspected Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) members killed a police officer during an attack on a police formation. They also set ablaze two patrol vehicles and took one away.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits killed 3 worshippers during an attack on a church. Over 30 others were kidnapped, while others were injured.
place: Christ Apostolic Church (CAC), Oke Isegun in Eruku
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: School Attack: Gunmen raided the Government Comprehensive Girls Secondary School, killed the Vice Principal, Hassan Yakubu Makuku, and abducted dozens of students.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram reportedly killed 4 civilians and 4 vigilantes. The date and location were not reported in the source. It is therefore assumed that it occurred in Bama town and was backdated by 2 days from its report.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Kaduna
description: Church Attack: Bandits abducted a Catholic priest, Reverend Father Markus Samari and killed one Emmanuel Yaro. The father was whisked away at gunpoint shortly after he returned from church.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed Alhaji Umar S-Fada, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC). He was attacked while travelling to Kaduna State. 3 people also lost their lives in the attack, while 64 others were kidnapped.

title: Soldiers Kill Gunman, Imo
description: Troops of Operation Udo Ka killed a gunman and arrested others in the Southeast. It is assumed the incident occurred in Imo State, where clashes between government security forces and unknown gunmen are rampant. It is assumed that the incidents occurred on November 14, 2025, and in the Municipal area, since the locations were not reported.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Policemen, with the help of vigilantes, killed a bandit during an operation. Arms and ammunition were also rescued.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Police operatives killed one of the eight bandits who invaded the residence of Alhaji Sani. Two Kidnapped victims were rescued, while 2 suspects were arrested.

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmers, Borno
description: Boko Haram killed 4 farmers harvesting crops on their farms. They also abducted some residents in nearby communities. This event is backdated by 2 days as no specific date was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) reportedly killed a suspected bandit during a raid on a criminal hideout. They also recovered 2 AK-47 rifles, one G3 rifle, five AK-47 magazines, one G3 magazine, one hand grenade, two BAOFENG radios, 162 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition, and a motorcycle.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai, in conjunction with the Civilian Joint Task Force, reportedly killed 8 Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents and recovered arms and ammunition.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kwara
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed some bandits in operations in the North Central. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Cult Violence, Osun
description: Four people were killed in related cult incidents. The crisis started after a cultist was killed during his wedding. His members retaliated by killing 3 rival members. Police arrested 14 suspected cultists in connection with the killings.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed some bandits in operations in the North Central. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Taraba
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed some bandits in operations in the North Central. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits suspected to be Lakurawa fighters raided a community and killed 4 people, including a pregnant woman. Many others sustained gunshot injuries.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kogi
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed some bandits in the North Central. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Banditry, Nasarawa
description: Bandits killed 3 youths who were sent on an errand by the elders of the clan to inform a family of the death of their member. Another youth was kidnapped by the gunmen.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Enduring Peace killed some bandits in Plateau and Kaduna states. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of Operation Enduring Peace killed some bandits in Plateau and Kaduna states. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 4 people and kidnapped 12 others, including Rev. Istifanus Dunga of the Evangelical Church Winning All (ECWA). The victims were young men aged between 27 and 30.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 people who were protesting the murder of a resident were shot dead by security operatives. They were killed when the operatives were trying to disperse them. 2 others were injured.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: NAF neutralised an unspecified number of bandits during an operation. The victims were fleeing on their motorcycles when they were intercepted. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported. It is assumed that about 5 bandits were killed.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed some bandits in operations in the North Central. It is assumed that 5 gunmen were killed in each state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened between November 10-14, 2025. Since the locations were not reported, this event is localized in the state capital.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF killed scores of Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists and recovered some arms. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) of insurgents died in the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops under Operation Fasan Yamma killed several bandits during a clearance operation. They also destroyed key bandit's logistics hubs. It is assumed that at least 10 bandits were killed in the operation.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) killed 2 army officers and 2 CJTF members in an ambush. The officers were returning from an operation when they were attacked. The brigadier commander, General M Uba, who led the operation, was reportedly abducted and killed a few days later.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits raided some communities, kidnapped 42 residents and killed 16 vigilantes. The victims were ambushed during the rescue of some kidnapped victims. Many of the vigilantes were also injured.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 192 Battalion killed 3 ISWAP/Boko Haram fighters and recovered an AK-47 rifle with five rounds of ammunition. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Supremacy clashes between Boko Haram and the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) claimed about 200 lives. ISWAP reportedly suffered more fatalities than Boko Haram. Over the years, both groups have engaged in power tussles and territorial control.
place: Toumbun Gini, Dogon Chiku in the Lake Chad region
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (204 ) , Nigerian Tribune (200 ) , Vanguard (100 ) , Other newspaper 3 (204 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation ENDURING PEACE killed 2 bandits who recently attacked some communities in the area. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 2 brothers, Alhaji Bishir and Alhaji Surajo, and kidnapped many residents during a raid. Both victims were regarded as pillars of leadership and moral guidance in the community.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: Troops of Operation FANSAN YAMMA killed a terrorist scout and recovered a motorcycle, mobile phone, and other operational items. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported. It is assumed that the incident happened in the state capital since no location was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 25 Brigade, Damboa, killed an ISWAP/Boko Haram insurgent who tried to infiltrate the troops’ location. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Two elderly community leaders, Alhaji Bishir and his brother, Alhaji Surajo, were killed, while several residents were abducted as bandits invaded their community with sophisticated weapons.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Armed bandits believed to be loyal to notorious kingpin, Bello Turji, killed 5 women and abducted 9 others. The attackers raided the community on motorcycles.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Soldiers, with help from the Air Force and CJTF, repelled a Boko Haram attack and killed 6 insurgents. Follow-up strikes by NAF further killed scores (assuming at least 40) of the insurgents. Arms and ammunition were also recovered.

title: Bandits vs Politician's Convoy, Niger
description: Bandits suspected to be Lakurawa terrorists ambushed the convoy of Hon. Jafaru Mohammed Ali, a member representing Agwara/Borgu Federal Constituency, killing about 6 soldiers and injuring others.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Troops of Operation Fansan Yamma killed several bandits in the North West. Some of the incidents within the timeframe in Katsina and Niger were already captured. This event assumes that soldiers killed 5 bandits and rescued some kidnapped victims in the state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened within the first 7 days of the reported timeline (November 3 - 10, 2025).

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed several Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists in Borno and Adamawa states. The incidents in Borno State within the timeframe were already captured. This event assumes that no fewer than 10 people were killed during the encounter between soldiers and the insurgents in Adamawa State. Since no location was reported, it is considered that the incident occurred in Yola. The troops also apprehended 45 terrorists’ informants, collaborators and logistics suppliers, and rescued a kidnapped victim.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Troops of Operation Fansan Yamma killed several bandits in the North West. Some of the incidents within the timeframe in Katsina and Niger were already captured. This event assumes that soldiers killed 5 bandits and rescued some kidnapped victims in the state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened within the first 7 days of the reported timeline (November 3 - 10, 2025).

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: A 28-year-old man, identified as Joseph Dauda Mwanti, was killed by suspected bandits, while a 33-year-old Joshua Mwanvwang was injured.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kano
description: Troops of Operation Fansan Yamma killed several bandits in the North West. Some of the incidents within the timeframe in Katsina and Niger were already captured. This event assumes that soldiers killed 5 bandits and rescued some kidnapped victims in the state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened within the first 7 days of the reported timeline (November 3 - 10, 2025).

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Fansan Yamma killed several bandits in some states in the North West. Some of the incidents within the timeframe in Katsina and Niger were already captured. This event assumes that soldiers killed 5 bandits and rescued some kidnapped victims in the state. It is also assumed that the incidents happened within the first 7 days of the reported timeline (November 3 - 10, 2025).

title: Fualni Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: A farmer identified as Bitrus Dakwan was killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community and shot sporadically.

title: Market Crisis, Rivers
description: A butcher identified as Ejike was attacked and killed by a group of meat sellers from the North following a disagreement over N500. A man who tried to rescue him was also stabbed in the ribs.
place: Obio/Akpor International Market, popularly called Amaechi Market

title: Cult Crisis, Ebonyi
description: Two young men identified as Ifeanyi, a barber and alleged member of the Neo Black Movement (NBM), also known as Aye, Nweke Obumneme Emmanuel, a Keke rider, were killed by suspected members of the Vikings confraternity.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herders killed 4 herders who were working in their farmlands. Their corpses were found with several machete cuts. Among the victims was a barbing salon operator, identified as Mr. Thomas Edeh. Residents were displaced, while some were declared missing.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected herdsmen killed a community leader and former LGA Councillor, Mr. Atindiga Tsebee, in an ambush. He was returning from a security meeting convened by the state government to address rising insecurity and attacks in the area.

title: Banditry, Kano
description: Bandits killed 3 residents and kidnapped 3 others after their efforts to attack some communities in a nearby LGA were foiled by security operatives. The attackers were believed to have come from Katsina and Zamfara states. The state government had notified the Federal Government of the infiltration of border communities in the state by bandits from other states.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (25 ) , Vanguard (25 ) , Other newpapers 1 (22 ) , This Day (22 )

title: Communal Crisis, Delta
description: 49-year-old Jerry Aduara, the chairman of an Urhobo vigilante group, was killed by Itsekiri militias while on a peace mission.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: The acting village head, Hussaini Alhaji Yawalle, and two other villagers were killed while several residents were abducted, and over 40 cattle were rustled by bandits. Security operatives rescued 6 kidnapped victims.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Kidnap Victim, Niger
description: Bandits killed a kidnapped victim, Usman Buhari, after collecting N70 million ransom from his family. He reportedly suffered torture from his abductors. It is assumed that he was killed a month after his abduction on September 29, 2025.

title: Troops Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 192 Battalion, in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF), launched a well-coordinated offensive against ISWAP and Jama’at Ahl as-Sunnah (JAS) fighters and neutralised two terrorists.

title: Leadership Tussle, Rivers
description: Mr. Paul Oduveh was stabbed to death during a youth leadership crisis. Two groups laid claim to the exalted position, with their supporters solidly behind them. Angry youths allegedly set fire to the palace of the community’s traditional ruler, Eze Christian after the news of the victims' death broke out. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Bandits Kill Pastor, Kaduna
description: Reverend Yahaya Kambasaya, the pastor of The United Church of Christ in Nigeria (UCCN), also known as HEKAN, was killed while taking refuge in the farm. Several villagers were also abducted.

title: Leadership Tussle, Taraba
description: Two people died in a violent clash over the leadership of the Central Jummat Mosque. The crisis stemmed from a disagreement within the Muslim community over who should assume the position of Imam of the mosque. Many people were injured, while houses and shops were destroyed.

title: Leadership Tussle, Enugu
description: 2 brothers, Chukwudi and Onyekachi Alum, were killed over a community chairmanship dispute. Several houses, vehicles and other properties were set ablaze or destroyed during the crisis. About 27 people were arrested in connection with the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Lakurawa/Fulani Attack, Kebbi
description: Ten Fulani Herders were killed, and several others were injured in a reprisal attack for the killing of a vigilante member by the Lakurawa bandits. It was erroneously believed that the Fulani masterminded the killing, prompting residents to raid their settlement.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai of the Nigerian Military killed 10 Boko Haram insurgents who tried to infiltrate a community. Arms and ammunition were also recovered. This incident occured a few days after nay insurgents were killed in a similar circumstance (See event in IBD033595).

title: Troops Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of the Operation Hadin Kai killed 10 Boko Haram insurgents who attempted to infiltrate a community.
place: Gamboru Ngala from the Flatari axis

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided a police station and killed 3 pupils and their teacher. Among the victims who were between the ages of 9 and 13 was Aisha. They were reportedly mistaken for being the children of police operatives.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Boko Haram/ISWAP coordinated attacks on military locations were foiled by troops of Joint Task Force, North East ‘Operation HADIN KAI’ (OPHK). About 17 insurgents were killed, including some of their commanders. Similar attacks in Borno State were foiled, with many insurgents also killed (See event in IBD033595).

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Soldiers intercepted and killed about 100 bandits who were crossing into Kebbi State from Sokoto. The operation was reportedly successful with support from the state government, which provided the security operatives with 100 Hilux vehicles and 5,000 motorcycles.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , Other newspaper 3 (100 ) , Daily Trust (80 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation HADIN KAI (OPHK) foiled Boko Haram/ISWAP attacks and killed over 50 of them in multiple locations across Borno and Yobe States. While 17 insurgents were killed in Yobe State as reported by Daily Trust, 33 others were assumed to have died in Borno State. Among the victims were 5 ISWAP commanders identified as Ari Kolo, Ya Muhammad, Abu Aisha, Hamzalah, and Abu Rijal. Also see the event in IBD033601.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed two people and injured another. One of the victims was identified as Mr. Pam Choji.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided a community and killed Mrs. Agnes Zafaniya. They also abducted many others, while some were injured. Some of the abducted victims were rescued by soldiers.
place: Idijiyi Unguwan Danladi Village in Kallah District

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Several bandits (assuming at least 20) were killed in NAF operations. They were moving a herd of rustled cattle when their convoy was reportedly hit. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
place: Yabawa, Bazana, Awallah, Dankolo, and Kumbashi

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 202 and 222 Battalions killed 17 Boko Haram insurgents in an ambush. They arrested 85 suspects and rescued 10 kidnapped victims.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram killed an Army Commanding Officer, 6 soldiers, 2 Civilian Joint Task Force members, and 2 vigilantes in an ambush but lost over 30 fighters. The operatives were on a clearance operation when the insurgents ambushed them. A source reported that dozens of insurgents (at least 24) were killed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (41 ) , Daily Trust (35 ) , Other newpapers 1 (35 )

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 10 security personnel, comprising policemen and members of the Zamfara State Community Protection Guard (CPG), popularly known as ‘Askarawa. During the attack, some bandits were neutralized. It was assumed that 10 bandits were also killed in the attack.
place: Gidan Giya village along Tsafe- Funtua Highway
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Bandits vs Miners, Kaduna
description: 7 people were killed in a violent attack involving bandits and illegal miners in an attempt to extort gold from miners at gunpoint. One of the sources reported that the attackers were herders.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , The Nation (11 ) , Daily Trust (7 )

title: Banditry, Katisna
description: Bandits killed one person, injured another, and rustled dozens of cattle during a raid. The attackers, reportedly numbering about one hundred, also attacked other communities where they displaced residents and also rustled their cattle.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Soldiers intercepted bandits during a military patrol, killed some (assuming at least 5), and rescued 9 kidnap victims. Some LGAs in the state and adjoining communities in Kogi have come under bandit attacks. Anti-banditry Operation FANSAN YAMMA has been ongoing in those communities.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Soldiers from the 17 Brigade repelled an attack and killed a gunman. They also recovered three AK-47 rifles and 11 motorcycles. Two soldiers were wounded in action but were reported stabilized.

title: Troops vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Troops of the 34 Artillery Brigade neutralized one Indigenous People of Biafra/ Eastern Security Network (IPOB/ESN) fighter and arrested two others during a raid on their hideout.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised several armed bandits during a fierce gun battle when the bandits, who arrived in large numbers, engaged the troops in a heavy exchange of gunfire. It is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the attack

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 8 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). They got information on the arrival of the victims and laid an ambush for them. This event is backdated by 2 days from its report since no date was stated.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers on a clearance operation killed 4 Boko Haram fighters. Some kidnapped victims were rescued while the money, assumed to be ransom, was recovered.
place: Zundur, along the Gajiram – Bolori – Mile 40 – Gajiganna axis

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a military base and killed an unspecified number of soldiers. It is assumed that at least 5 soldiers lost their lives. There were reports that the attackers also suffered some casualties. Since no figure was reported, it is assumed that 5 insurgents died.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers on a clearance operation killed 5 Boko Haram fighters. Arms and ammunition were also recovered. According to the report, no casualties were recorded by the soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation HADIN KAI successfully repelled a coordinated Boko Haram attack on a military post. In the process, four soldiers died while five others sustained injuries.
place: Ngamdu along the Damaturu Maiduguri highway
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits raided a community and killed Mr. Ndako. They also abducted his step-brother, Audu. The victims were raided while they were asleep.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Ekiti
description: Soldiers on special operations killed 2 bandits and recovered 2 AK-47 rifles. The operation was conducted along the Ekiti-Kogi border. This incident is backdated to October 6, 2025 which is within the reported timeframe.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Armed bandits stormed a village, killed a resident, and abducted the traditional ruler. The attack occurred during Maghrib prayers.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Two suspected bandits were killed during a midnight raid on a community. The attackers had successfully kidnapped 2 women and taken them into a bush, but were pursued by vigilantes who killed 2 of them.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 151 Task Force Battalion killed 5 ISWAP/Boko Haram insurgents in an ambush. Details of the incident were not reported. The incident was assumed to have occured on October 4, 2025 which is within the reported timeline.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of North East Joint Task Force ‘Operation Hadin Kai’ killed scores (assuming at least 40) of Boko Haram fighters in a failed ambush on their convoy. Three soldiers also lost their lives, while others were injured. Arms and ammunition were also recovered.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A traditional ruler, the Hakimi of Dogon Dawa, was killed by Ado Allero, a bandit leader who was at the forefront of peace talks in the North-West. Allero's gang was alleged to have been responsible for the kidnapping of 40 worshippers from a mosque in the LGA.

title: Herdsmen vs Youth, Enugu
description: A 30-year-old man identified as Onuchukwu Ogbaki died in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. He was attacked on his farm.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: About 10 travellers were killed and abducted when heavily armed bandits attacked commuters. It was reported that the gunmen laid siege to the busy highway, halting vehicles and forcing passengers into the surrounding bushes. One of the victims, Abubakar Lawali Sardauna, was shot dead after resisting abduction.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Soldiers on a clearance operation killed 2 suspected bandits. The victims were reportedly conveying to plan an attack when they were hit. Arms and ammunition were also recovered.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Brigade ambushed and killed two terrorists and also rescued 8 victims. Seven AK-47 magazines, 180 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition, and two motorcycles were also recovered.

title: Bandits Kill Imam, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed an Islamic cleric and abducted 2 councillors during a raid on a tea shop. The victims were seized while relaxing in the tea joint after the Maghrib (Sunset) prayer.

title: Bandits Kill Hunter, Kwara
description: Oluode Ologomo, a powerful hunter whose charms used to protect him, was stripped of his amulets and shot dead by bandits. The incident is believed to have happened in the last week of September 2025. September 30th was assumed as no date was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers on a rescue operation killed some fleeing bandits and rescued 5 hostages. It is reported that several fleeing bandits were killed. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits lost their lives. It is also assumed that the incident occured on September 30, 2025, which falls within the reported timeframe.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Four people were killed, eleven sustained injuries, and nine others were kidnapped during an attack by bandits. Among those abducted was Barrister Isyaku Muhammad Danjuma.

title: Troops vs ISWAP Terrorists, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed a violent extremist and rescued 10 abducted passengers.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kwara
description: Security operatives killed a notorious kidnapper, Maidawa, during a clearance operation. Several of his associates (assuming at least 10) were also killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Gwoza
description: Boko Haram raided a community, killed a civilian, but lost a member when security operatives intervened. The attackers burnt down a palace and several houses. The latest attack came a few days after a member of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) was killed in an ambush by insurgents (See incident in IBD033419).

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kwara
description: A combined security forces killed an unspecified number of bandits during a raid on their hideouts. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits were killed. However, there was no report indicating if the operatives recorded fatalities. The raid was an aftermath of an attack on residents that claimed about 15 lives (See incident in IBD033436).

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Troops of 1 Brigade killed 2 bandits in an ambush and rescued 8 kidnapped victims. They also recovered arms and ammunition from the scene.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Suspected bandits killed a Bororo man and a Fulani trader during a raid on a community. Details of the incident were not reported. It is assumed the incident occured in the last week of September, 30th precisely, when other nearby communities came under similar attacks.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits launched a violent attack on a village, leaving one person dead and another injured. The raid occurred during a heavy downpour at night.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits attacked a community and killed 10 people, including the village head (Baale) and 2 children. They also abducted an unspecified number of people and injured several others.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , Daily Trust (12 )

title: Bandit Raid Mosque, Zamfara
description: Bandits raided a mosque, killed 5 worshippers and abducted others. The victims were attacked during prayers. A similar raid and abduction was reported in an event in IBD033334.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Student Drowns, Ogun
description: School Fee Crisis: Violent protests over the collection of illegal fees by the staff of Ilugun High School resulted in the death of one person and the destruction of school property. The victim, identified as Babalola, drowned while escaping from being arrested by Amotekun operatives, whom the school administration had invited to disperse the protesting students.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A member of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) was killed in an ambush by Boko Haram insurgents. Many passengers were injured while 6 vehicles were set ablaze.

title: Children in the Car Booth, Borno
description: The lifeless bodies of Zannah Jaridama, 2 children, and his neighbour were found in a car boot. The incident happened days after Zannah, a prominent political supporter of the governor of the state, posted a viral video and social media post attacking alleged “cabals and hypocrites” around the governor. This incident is linked to a political crisis in the state.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Heavily armed bandits struck in large numbers, killing Sabitu Hamza and badly injuring Gambo Abdulkadir. Residents complained that attacks on their community have remained unabated.

title: Communal Crisis, Cross River
description: A commercial driver and several people were killed in a communal crisis between the Ochon in Obubra LGA and their Alesi neighbours in Ikom LGA. The conflict, which has been raging for several weeks, has left many people dead, houses set ablaze, farms destroyed, and commercial activities grounded in both communities. It is assumed that 10 people were killed in the latest crisis.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits raided a community and killed the Village Head (Baale) and 14 others, including vigilantes. Many were also believed to have been injured.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram raided a community at night and killed 4 residents. They also set shops and churches ablaze. Many residents were reported to have sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 26 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed during offensive operations in various communities across Borno and Adamawa States. The troops recovered several arms and ammunition, and intercepted large quantities of urea fertilizer abandoned in shops. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed the incident happened in Adamawa State.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 19 Battalion and 25 Brigade killed a terrorist after they intercepted ISWAP/JAS logistics elements. Two AK-47 rifles, 36 hand grenades, IED materials, desert camouflage trousers, four uniforms, 32 bicycles, large quantities of drugs, chemicals, red oil, mosquito nets and other sundry items were also recovered.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Five people were killed, while over 14 people were kidnapped when armed bandits stormed a village. A 14-year-old girl, Fatima Ahmadu was also shot during the incident but survived.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers stationed to protect civilians foiled an attempt by Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists to attack a community. It was reported that the terrorists suffered huge casualties, while a soldier died. It is therefore assumed that no fewer than a score (20) of terrorists died. This incident happened a day after soldiers foiled another attack on the same community. See incident in IBD033362.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (21 ) , Other newspaper 3 (21 ) , The Nation (21 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Two vigilantes, identified as Junaid Mohammed and Bello Muhammad, were ambushed and killed by bandits while escorting residents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF killed 25 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists in Borno and Yobe states. It is assumed that 12 of the victims were killed in Yobe since the reports did not distribute the fatalities per state. A subsequent report stated that 5 civilians and a soldier died in the encounter, bringing the total number of deaths to 17, including the insurgents killed.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , The Punch (17 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: NAF killed 25 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 13 of the victims were killed in Yobe since the reports did not distribute the fatalities per state.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (13 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits raided a community and killed a vigilance group’s commander, popularly known as Tetengi. He was murdered on the line of duty.

title: Security Operatives vs Kidnappers, FCT (Abuja)
description: A joint team comprising the Police command’s anti-kidnap unit, the military, hunters, vigilantes, and DSS operatives killed 2 notorious bandits/kidnappers, Abdullahi Umar (alias Duna) and his lieutenant, Buba Ahmadi (alias killer) and Habi Sule (alias Maikudi) durign the rescue operation of an abducted civil servant, Nafiu Idris, a staff member of the Department of Urban Affairs of the FCT Administration.
place: Zinda Forest, behind the Nigerian Army Estate in Kurudu
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A farmer identified as Bala Dankos was killed while working on his farm by gunmen suspected to be bandits.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Soldiers on a special operation killed many IPOB/ESN. Many were also injured and others were arrested. A cache of arms and ammunition was recovered.

title: Boko Haram Insurgency, Borno
description: NAF raided Boko Haram/ISWAP strongholds and killed scores of insurgents. It is assumed that no fewer than 40 insurgents died.
place: Bula Madibale in the Gezuwa general area
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Soldiers killed a bandit in an ambush. Arms and ammunition were also recovered. Some of the bandits were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Gunmen killed 4 farmers and kidnapped 40 worshippers in a mosque in a location. The victims were killed while harvesting their crops. The gunmen were believed to be responsible for the abduction of 40 worshippers in a mosque during an early morning prayer.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), killed 8 Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) fighters during an ambush. The slain terrorists included Modu Munzir of Dogon Chukun and Abu Aisha Quaid. Both notorious insurgents operated in the Lake Chad region, spanning Nigeria, Niger, Cameroon, and Chad.
place: Garin Giwa along the Baga-Cross Kauwa Main supply Route (MSR)

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits ambushed NSCDC operatives and killed an officer. 4 others were also injured. More details of the attack was not reported.
place: Along Dafa village Yantumaki- Danmusa road

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A bandit kingpin, Ado Aliero, killed a traditional ruler, the Hakimi of Dogon Dawa. The gang was reportedly responsible for the abduction of 40 farmers in a nearby community, where they killed 4 farmers.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kogi
description: Troops of the 12 Brigade, Nigerian Army, under Operation ACCORD III, in collaboration with other Hybrid Forces, killed a notorious bandit commander, Babangida Kachala, who was the second-in-command to Kachala Shuaibu, leader of a gang operating within Masalaci Boka and Ofere Forest areas of Kogi State.
place: Within Ofere Forest and Ayetoto Gbede general area

title: Soldiers vs Terrorists, Jigawa
description: Troops of 6 Brigade Nigerian Army/Sector 3 Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) reportedly killed 2 bandits and recovered a cache of arms and ammunition. The armed group was identified as Bojo Terrorist Group.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Bandits Kill Policemen, Kogi
description: Three police officers were killed on duty by bandits. The attackers stormed the checkpoint and engaged the policemen in fierce battle.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Troops of the 12 Brigade, Nigerian Army, under Operation ACCORD III, killed Babangida Kachalla, a notorious bandit kingpin, in a major operation against banditry. A fully loaded magazine, 31 mobile phones, a blood pressure machine, packs of Tramadol tablets, fetish charms, and other items were recovered.

title: Bandits Kill Herder, Kwara
description: Bandits killed a herder identified as Mohammed Mumini and rustled about 300 cows in 2 locations. The victim had identified one of the attackers before he was killed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Troops from Forward Operating Base Malumfashi, in collaboration with police and vigilantes, engaged terrorists who had attacked Na’lma Special Hunters Camp in a shootout. A bandit was killed and an AK-47 rifle with 21 rounds of ammunition was recovered.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits raided a community, killed a driver and abducted another resident. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 3 people and abducted many others. They also left several residents injured. Some of the kidnapped victims were reportedly readied to be married off to some bandit leaders.

title: Market Crisis, Anambra
description: Four people, including a pregnant woman, were killed, and many others were injured when Operatives of the Operation Clean and Healthy Anambra State (OCHA Brigade) clashed with traders. The victims were identified as Ebuka Orakwe, Orum Oluebube, Anthony Kosisochukwu, Ifeoma Ezema, Chinwe Igwe, and two others whose names could not be ascertained.
place: Near the Emeka Offor Plaza, Main Market, Onitsha

title: Banditry Attack, Zamfara
description: Five soldiers, many bandits (assuming at least 10) and 10 villagers died in a gun battle between soldiers and bandits. The attack occurred when troops were escorting traders to Gusau market, and the assailants, who had laid an ambush, suddenly opened fire on the convoy. It is assumed that 10 of the bandits were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (25 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herders who were tracking their rustled cattle killed Gideon Jise (41), Fidelis Usman (49), and Job Amis (28) and injured another person. The victims were working on their farms when they were attacked. They were killed in separate attacks.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 3 residents and abducted 3 others. They shot at residents, killed the victims, and injured others.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed a resident and injured another during an encounter with security operatives. The attackers had raided the community but were intercepted by the operatives. 5 kidnapped victims were rescued by the operatives.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits raided some communities and killed 6 residents. They also kidnapped about 130 others within a week.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 7 people and abducted many others during an attack on a community. No fewer than 11 people were also injured. Those killed were listed as Elisha Paul, Japhet Bitrus, Obadiah Joshua, Luka Augustine, Ishaya Paul, Bawa Bulus and Ezekiel Augustine.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Two residents drowned while fleeing bandit attacks on their community. The attackers abducted about 49 residents during the attack. It is assumed that this incident occurred 2 days before its report.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Bandits raided a community, killed 1 person, and abducted 8 others. The victims were attacked with guns and clubs.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Bandits killed 7 miners and injured 3 others during an attack. The victims were raided while mining in a location.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops from the 192 Battalion, with Hybrid Force, killed an Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP)/Boko Haram fighters during an encounter.
place: Kwatara Kasa Village along the Gwoza–Limankara Road

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed more than 60 people, including 7 soldiers, in a nighttime assault. Most of the civilian victims were IDPs.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Soldiers killed a suspected bandit and recovered an AK-47 rifle, livestock, and other items.

title: Boko Haram Insurgency, Borno
description: The NAF component of Operation Hadin Kai, working with ground troops, neutralised more than 30 insurgents in three successive strikes.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (30 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 2 Immigration officers – Buture M Ibrahim, Head of Border Control and Otojah, Head of JTF, at Monguno- during an attack on their residence.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Seven people were killed in an attack by bandits. The night attack threw the community into panic as the criminals opened fire indiscriminately. Other reports have it that bandits ambushed the community Watch Corps, killed 8 of them, and set two of their patrol vehicles ablaze.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: A police officer and a member of the Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF) were killed in an ambush by armed bandits.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Soldiers on a special operation killed 2 bandits in an ambush. They also recovered a motorcycle and a phone from the victims.

title: Bandit Gunrunner, Plateau
description: Troops of the 3 Division of the Nigerian Army and Joint Task Force Operation Enduring Peace (JTF OPEP) killed a notorious gunrunner and logistics supplier to a major banditry network. A cache of weapons was also recovered.

title: Boko Haram Insurgency, Borno
description: NAF killed 15 Boko Haram insurgents in a deadly raid on their stronghold. Their key structures were also reportedly destroyed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , The Guardian (15 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Residents launched counterattacks against bandits, rescuing kidnapped relatives and killing at least 15 of the attackers.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Soldiers killed a suspected bandit and recovered an AK-47 rifle with ammunition during an ambush. The incident occurred a few days after a man was killed near a mosque in the LGA (See incident in IBD033228).

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: Troops of the 22 Armoured Brigade on a special operation killed a bandit and recovered assorted arms and ammunition. A bandit killed the victim.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 13 Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) fighters in a failed ambush and IED attacks. Arms and ammunition were also recovered from the insurgents.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated 15 terrorists. The operation was carried out in an air and ground offensive where the terrorist hideout was destroyed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen killed 6 farmers in separate attacks. Some of the victims were killed while returning from their farms, while others were killed while working on their farmlands.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A herder was killed and many farmers were abducted during an attack on some communities by bandits. The herder was shot dead while resisting bandits from rustling his cattle.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits killed 3 people and kidnapped a community leader and an Imam. Residents protested against the killings by blocking a major highway in the LGA.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 117 Task Force Battalion, with support from vigilantes and the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF), killed a suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent. They also recovered an AK-47 rifle, a magazine, and 24 rounds of ammunition.

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmers, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed five farmers who were working on their farms.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops on a special operation killed several bandits. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits were killed since no figures were reported. Many abducted victims were also rescued.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits attacked some communities and killed 2 people. About 15 others were also kidnapped while many residents were displaced.
place: Aske Dodo, Tungar Barke, and Jandutse

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed 12 Islamic State West African Province fighters during an operation. They also recovered eight AK-47 rifles and eight AK-47 rifle magazines loaded with 7.62mm rounds of ammunition, and an assorted cache of drugs and medical supplies
place: Tamsu Ngamdu, Dalakaleri, Gaza and Loskori Kura

title: Boat Mishap, Zamfara
description: 15 people were reported to have died, while three others were declared missing after a boat capsized when they were fleeing from bandit attacks. The crowded boat capsized due to overloading.
sources_of_information: The Nation (16 ) , Other newspaper 2 (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 3 people in a community and also destroyed several houses.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen launched a deadly attack and killed 2 farmers identified as Jerry Terhile Saatan and Gerald Aondokaa. They were killed while working on their farms.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: DSS and the Nigerian Army reportedly killed about 50 bandits and rescued 7 kidnapped victims. The attackers had attempted to attack a DSS camp in the area but were repelled. Rustled cattle were also recovered during the operation.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Troops of the 22 Armoured Brigade killed 2 bandits who tried to infiltrate some communities. Many of the bandits were reportedly injured while some sol;diers also sustained gunshot injuries.

title: Bandit Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits attacked a community, killing 8 people and injuring 9 others. It was reported that the attackers destroyed several homes.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Gunmen reportedly numbering over 100 raided some communities, killing a vigilante commander and another person. They also abducted many residents and displaced others.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A notorious bandit kingpin, Habu Dan Damisa, was eliminated by security forces during a raid on a bandit enclave. The victim and his gang were believed to have held the area hostage for a long time.

title: Community Clash, Ebonyi
description: An Internally Displaced Person, identified as Victor Chidera Ejem, was killed in the crisis between Effium and Ezza Effium over land.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits raided the residence of one Anas Ahmadu, abducted him, his wife, and his daughter. They also killed a local vigilante identified as Abdullahi Muhammad.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Gang Kingpin Kill 3, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A terror kingpin, Ifeanyi Okorienta Eze, popularly known as “Gentle the Yahoo,” shot 3 of his boys dead over allegations of robbing civilians with his guns. The video of the execution circulated online on August 26, 2025. It is therefore assumed that the victims were killed the same day.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Seven youths identified as Jacob Zakka, Felicia Francis, Magaret Mathias, Veronica Paul, Delight Paul, Confidence Yakubu, and Sati Markus, were killed by Fulani herders. 8 others were also injured.

title: Market Crisis, Lagos
description: A clash between land grabbers and traders resulted in 3 deaths. A policeman and 2 others were also injured. A source reported the incident as a cult clash. The policemen were believed to have come from Nasarawa State. The Inspector General of Police (IGP) ordered an investigation into the matter, with the Force Criminal Investigation Department handling the matter.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Market Crisis, Lagos
description: A fight between two market runners spiralled into a violent confrontation that claimed 2 lives. Both victims fought while scouting for a customer. A source reported that after the Igbo trader stabbed the Yoruba colleague to death with a broken bottle, he was lynched by a mob of Yoruba extraction.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herders raided some communities and killed Mr. Kaananfam Nyamikume, Mr. Mson, Mr. Saaondo Mundu Azaye and a medicine seller. They also burnt down several houses and injured many people.
place: Tse Mku in Tombu Council Ward.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state.

title: Soldiers vs Lakurawa, Sokoto
description: Lakurawa: Soldiers killed two suspected foreign bandits, known locally as Lakurawa. The victims were ambushed when they went to buy food and other items from a local market.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 4 (2 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state.
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, Other newspaper 3

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops killed 20 Boko Haram members in operations that cut across different locations in Yobe and Borno states. It is assumed that 10 insurgents were killed in each state. It is assumed that 2 insurgents were killed in each of the affected LGAs in Borno State.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A raid by NAF on bandits' hideouts claimed the life of a child. 76 kidnap victims were rescued in the operation. The notorious hideouts were reportedly operated by a bandit kingpin, Babaro, who was believed to have masterminded deadly attacks in different communities (See event in IBD033101). Some reports stated that 35 bandits were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Vanguard (35 ) , Nigerian Tribune (35 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Abu Nazir (Munzir of Juye) and Abu Fatima (Munzir of Koloram), top commanders of Boko Haram and 11 insurgents were killed in a counterattack by soldiers and CJTF members. The victims reportedly planned to attack some villages when their plans were foiled. Arms and ammunition were also recovered from the insurgents. It is assumed that 7 insurgents were killed in Gwoza and 6 in Bama, as the report stated that the operation was conducted in both LGAs (See incident in IBD033135)

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Anambra
description: Police operatives, in collaboration with the state Vigilante Group, Agunechemba, raided an IPOB/ESN camp and killed 4 secessionists. A kidnap victim was rescued, while arms and ammunition were reportedly recovered.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of 21 Special Armoured Brigade, with support from NAF, repelled a night attack on their Forward Operating Base by well-armed Boko Haram insurgents. Over 20 insurgents were killed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (35 ) , Daily Trust (35 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Imo
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 2 people. They also kidnapped 2 men. Other sources reported that the attack left a vigilante leader dead and others missing.

title: Bandits Attack Mosque, Katsina
description: Bandits raided a mosque and killed 13 worshippers during an early morning (Fajr) prayer. Many others were injured. The attack was reported as a reprisal for the recent killing of many bandits and the rescue of kidnapped victims by security operatives. (See the event in IBD033102).
place: Unguwan Mantau, Gidan Adamu Mantau, Unguwar Yar Mai Dabo, Makera, and Burdigau,
sources_of_information: The Punch (13 ) , Daily Trust (23 ) , Vanguard (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed a soldier, a policeman and two Civilian Joint Task Force volunteers who were providing cover for farmers. An unconfirmed number of farmers were also abducted.

title: Bandits Kill Farmers, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 5 farmers who were returning home and injured 3 others. The attack was a retaliation for the murder of a bandit by local vigilantes from Niger State.
place: Kakangi community in the western part of Birnin Gwar

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Suspected bandits killed 1 person and injured 3 others. Residents alleged that the attackers operated at will despite the presence of three soldiers stationed in the area.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Abu Nazir (Munzir of Juye) and Abu Fatima (Munzir of Koloram), top commanders of Boko Haram and 11 insurgents were killed in a counterattack by soldiers and CJTF members. The victims reportedly planned to attack some villages when their plans were foiled. Arms and ammunition were also recovered from the insurgents. It is assumed that 6 insurgents were killed in Bama and 7 in Gwoza as it was reported that the operation was conducted in both LGAs (See incident in IBD033134)

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Several bandits (assuming at least 20) were killed during an operation by security operatives. Two days later, the bandits raided a mosque and killed 13 worshippers in reprisal (See in event in IBD033101)

title: IED Explosion, Borno
description: Two children were killed and six others injured after an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) detonated. It was reported that the children, who were unaware of the danger, brought the explosive into town as scrap metal, and it detonated on them.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Gunmen suspected to be loyal to a notorious kingpin, Bello Turji, raided some communities, killed scores (assuming at least 40), and abducted many others. They also rustled some cows.
place: Garki, Turtsawa and Faru villages near Sabon Birni town

title: Bandits Attack Mosque, Sokoto
description: Bandits stormed a mosque and opened fire on the congregants, killing a worshipper and abducting several others during Subh (dawn) prayers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Kidnappers Kill Ritired Teacher, Edo
description: Mr Andrew Imuekheme, a retired teacher and farmer, was abducted and killed by bandits. He was returning home when his attackers ambushed him. Vigilantes later found his motorcycle, shoes, and body after an extensive search.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Troops of 134 Artilery Brigade raided an IPOB/ESN camp and neutralised a criminal and recovered a pistol with ammunition, cartridges, radios, improvised explosive device components, and mobile phones.
place: Ndeji community a border area linking Anambra, Abia, and Imo States

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a failed IED ambush on soldiers. It is assumed that no fewer than 40 died in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Yobe
description: Soldiers, in conjunction with the Civilian JTF killed a gunman in an ambush. They also recovered an AK47 riffle.

title: Airstrike Kill Bandits, Zamfara
description: Nigerian Air Force troops of Operation FASAN YAMMA neutralised over 400 bandits in a coordinated air and ground assault. The victims were planning to invade a farming community when they were intercepted.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , Nigerian Tribune (400 ) , Daily Trust (100 )

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 residents were killed and livestock were stolen by cattle rustlers. The victims were identified as Alhaji Sagir, Hassan and Muhammad. Both of them are from the same household.

title: ISWAP Kill Hunter, Borno
description: 53-year-old Habu Dala, the chairman of the hunters’ group in Garjang village, was abducted from his home and executed by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: Troops of the Special Engineer Regiment killed a gunman when they intervened in a communal crisis between Iyimagwu and Ekpomaka communities. They reportedly came under fire from an abandoned building and returned fire, killing the victim and recovering one G3 rifle, 50 rounds of 7.62mm Special ammunition, 16 rounds of 7.62mm NATO ammunition, and four hand grenades. Another report stated that many people, including women and children, died in the encounter. It is assumed that at least 5 people died.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by NAF operatives. Many of the victims were targeted when they were trying to escape an onslaught by government forces. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 insurgents died. Among those killed is a Boko Haram/ISWAP commander, Amirul Fiya (aka Abu Nazir).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Nation (10 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Banditary, Kwara
description: An unspecified number of residents (assuming 5) were killed when gunmen suspected to be bandits raided a community in the daylight. A source reported that the victims comprised 3 policemen and a civilian.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , This Day (4 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits ambushed soldiers and killed 1 mobile policeman, 5 Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) members, 4 community guards and 3 civilians. The lives were lost when the soldiers tried to rescue kidnapped individuals.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram raided some communities and killed several soldiers (assuming at least 10). They also abducted a school girl identified as Aisha Muhammad Aja.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits raided a community, killed four people and injured 1 other. They also broke into shops and stole goods, including mobile phones,

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Katsina
description: Armed bandits ambushed a military Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC), killing a soldier and critically injuring two others.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits abducted a traditional ruler hours after the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) strike killed scores of terrorists. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 bandits were killed in the air strike.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Pastor Gideon Katings of COCIN Suwa, Sunday Ringkang, and Meshach Bukata were killed by suspected bandits. Many others sustained injuries and some were displaced.
place: Suwa and Ding’ak villages in the Mushere chiefdom

title: Police Kill Bandits, Zamfara
description: A joint team comprising police officers and members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) killed 8 bandits during a gun duel.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Abubakar, Murtala, Aminu, Bello and another person were killed and many others were kidnapped when bandits raided 16 villages. They also looted foodstuffs and other valuables in the villages.
place: Dan İsa, Kyatawa, Tudu, Gidan Haruna, Tsunburburawa, Gidan Juli, Tokarawa and Gidan Bako
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (11 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: Armed men on motorbikes killed 11 people and kidnapped at least 70 others, including women and children. The community was raided after failing to pay taxes imposed by the bandits.
place: Sabongarin Damri, Sade, Tungar Tsalle, Tungar Musa Dogo and Tungar Sodangi

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the North East Joint Task Force, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), eliminated 17 Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents during clearance operations. They also recovered assorted weapons from the insurgents. It is believed the operations were conducted on August 2, which falls within the time frame reported.
place: Ajiri, Bula Daburu, Alau Dam, Bitta, Kawuri, Algambari and Bulabulin

title: ISWAP Terrorists Kill Village Head
description: Goni Kinnari, a 65-year-old traditional ruler of Kinnari, was shot dead by the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) during a raid on his community.

title: Troops Kill Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of the 401 Special Forces Brigade/Sector 1 Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS), in collaboration with local hunters, conducted a successful clearance operation during which a notorious bandit was killed and their operational camps destroyed.
place: around the Tatough general area of Makurdi

title: Bandits attack, Katsina
description: Gunmen attacked a community and abducted five persons, including a businessman, identified as Alhaji Babangida Maigoro. It was further gathered that two of the victims escaped while members of the community killed one of the attackers.

title: Bandits vs Teenage Girls, Kogi
description: Two teenage girls identified as Ajuma Simon and Omojo Shuaibu were killed in an ambush by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers or bandits. They were also dismembered.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nine Boko Haram terrorists were killed as troops thwarted Boko Haram terrorists' attempt to lay mines on a bridge. They also recovered 2 heavy IEDs from the terrorists.

title: Bandits Attack, Plateau
description: Bandits ambushed a joint team of soldiers and vigilantes, killing 2 soldiers and 2 vigilantes and also carting away some rifles. They were ambushed.Bodies of six bandits were recovered from the bushes 2 days after the encounter.

title: Farmers vs Herders, FCT (Abuja)
description: A crisis between farmers and herders led to the death of a farmer, identified as Dahiru Yakubu, while three herders were also injured. It was reported that Dahiru was on his farm working when cows entered and destroyed his crops, leading to the crisis. A subsequent report placed the fatalities at 2.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Benue
description: Soldiers attached to the Joint Task Force under Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) killed an armed bandit and seized a cache of weapons during a clearance operation.

title: Troops Kill Boko Haram Fighters, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed two Boko Haram fighters and recovered logistics items. They were killed in an ambush.

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Soldiers on a counter-terrorism operation killed 2 bandits. Three AK-47 rifles and a motorcycle were recovered at the scene. This incident is backdated y 2 days as no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several top commanders and fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed in a series of airstrikes launched by the Nigerian military around the Nigeria/Lake Chad region. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 terrorists were killed.
place: Southern Tumbuns area of Borno in the northern part of Nigeria

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: At least five people were killed by bandits in Madam Forest, which borders Taraba, Plateau, and Bauchi-Alkaleri. This was attributed to the rising tension due to the influx of people migrating into the state from other states, coupled with a rapidly growing population and pressure on land and resources.
place: Madam Forest, located in the Duguri district

title: Banditry/Kidnapping, Zamfara
description: Thirty-five kidnapped victims were slaughtered by their captors loyal to the notorious bandits’ leader, Dan Sadiya, for failure to pay N35 million ransom. 18 other hostages were released by the bandits.
sources_of_information: The Punch (35 ) , Daily Trust (35 ) , Other newspaper 4 (37 ) , Vanguard (38 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Niger
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army and hybrid forces from the Department of State Services, DSS, killed 45 bandits terrorising the community.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Three notorious terrorist kingpins, Kachalla Nagomma, Gurmu, and Ali Yar Daribiyar, were killed in an ambush by troops of the Joint Task Force North West, Operation Fansan Yamma (OPFY).
place: Mallamawa and Mazau communities, in the Tsamaye/Mai Lalle District

title: Gunmen Kill 18, Imo
description: 18 people were killed in bars, shops and residential areas when gunmen sporadically shot at them. Police blamed the attack on IPOB and their military wing, the Eastern Security Network (ESN), but the group denied any involvement. A paper reported scores of deaths (assuming at least 40), with many injured.
place: Ndi-Ejezie, Umualaoma, and Ndiakuwata Uno villages in Arondizuogu community
sources_of_information: Vanguard (18 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Undergrauduate Student, Ondo
description: Domestic Violence: Miss. Joy Adeyemi, a student of the Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko (AAUA) and a Point-of-Sale (POS) operator, was allegedly murdered by her boyfriend. Her decomposing body was found in her apartment, barely 2 weeks after 2 other students, Andrel Okah and John Abbah, were kidnapped and killed (See incident in IBD032821). The recent murder triggered protests by students of the institution.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: An unspecified number of residents were killed when bandits raided about 30 communities. They also kidnapped many others. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 people died in the raids.
place: Wonaka, Kanawa, Chuna, Ruwan Bore, Fegin Mahe, Ladiya, Tsauna, Kundumau, Bita, Ajja, Koshiya, Tudun Wada, Gangara and Agulawa amongst many others.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram commander, Ibn Khalid, the group’s cameraman and scores (at least 40) of fighters were killed in an encounter with troops of Operation Hadin Kai. They were trying to infiltrate the community when they were intercepted.
sources_of_information: The Punch (41 ) , Other newspaper 3 (41 ) , Daily Trust (41 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 200 bandits were killed during an encounter with soldiers. The bandits had written a letter of threat to the community, threatening to attack them. Attempts to carry out the threat and rustle their cattle were repelled by soldiers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (200 ) , Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , Nigerian Tribune (97 ) , The Nation (200 )

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 3 farmers during an attack on the family of Tyozungwe. They also abducted Tyozungwe's wife.

title: Boko Haram Attack JTF, Borno
description: Members of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) killed seven individuals, comprising hunters, Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) operatives, and community watch members.

title: Bandits Attack, Sokoto
description: Armed bandits invaded a community, killed one person, and abducted several people. It was reported that the attackers stormed the community in the morning, shooting sporadically and targeting households.

title: Banditary, Zamfara
description: 6 people were killed and hundreds kidnapped by bandits. The attackers reportedly laid siege to the town for nearly two hours before taking their captives.

title: Bandits vs Security Guards, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed nine personnel of the Zamfara Community Protection Guards (CPG) while they were protecting farmers working on a farm. A source reported that the victims were farmers and that the attackers kidnapped 15 others.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , Other newspaper 2 (9 )

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Kill Immigration Officer, Niger
description: A Superintendent of Immigration, simply identified as Suleiman, was killed at a service outpost by fighters of the Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP). It was reported that they set his body ablaze along with their carbine.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 2 bandits were killed by soldiers after they tried to attack a community. Some of them were believed to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Suspected kidnappers killed a police inspector, Joshua John, and a vigilante, Joshua Garba. The policeman was shot from close range when he went after a group of gunmen parked in a lonely place in the community. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Bandits Attack, Nigeria
description: Six farmers were killed and several others sustained serious bullet wounds in an attack by bandits.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: About 27 people, mostly farmers, were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herders. Scores were also injured while properties were destroyed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (27 ) , The Nation (27 ) , Nigerian Tribune (27 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits attacked a police formation and killed a police inspector and 3 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). The operatives under Operation Restore Peace were stationed to protect the community.

title: Troops Vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of 1 Brigade engaged bandits in a fierce battle, killed 1 and recovered a motorcycle used by the criminal.

title: Troops Kill 2, Plateau
description: Personnel of Operation Safe Haven neutralised two bandits and recovered arms, ammunition, and a motorcycle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent was killed in an ambush by soldiers, in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) and hunters. This incident is presumed to have happened on July 12 since no specific day was reported.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: Police operatives foiled an attack and killed a bandit in the process. It was reported that the police engaged the bandits in a gun duel while robbing villagers.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits attacked worshippers during a church meeting, killing 5 and injuring 3 others. The attackers targeted when members of the Evangelical Church Winning All, ECWA, were holding a church service.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Suspected bandits killed 2 people, abducted 25 others and rustled several cattle. A local blacksmith, Muhammadu Kasu and Aminu Abubakar were among the victims.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits reportedly killed a vigilante who was trying to defend the village. An unspecified number of residents were abducted by the attackers.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Operatives of the NAF under Operation Fansan Yamma killed several bandits in a series of coordinated airstrikes. The precision strikes targeted a large convoy of bandits migrating on motorcycles. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 bandits died in the encounter.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers on a clearance operation killed 6 Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents. They were killed in an ambush. Motorcycles and bicycles were recovered from them.

title: Troops Kill several Bandits, Kebbi
description: Several bandits were killed by the 223 Light Battalion of the Nigerian Army when over 400 armed bandits attempted to overrun the community. It was reported that the soldiers engaged the attackers in a prolonged firefight, resulting in the deaths of numerous bandits.
