As the source reported heavy casualties on the bandits, it is assumed that no fewer than 200 gunmen lost their lives in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (200 ) , The Nation (200 ) , The Punch (200 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Seven passengers were killed and several others injured when suspected bandits opened fire on a commercial vehicle.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: The troops under Operation Hadin Kai eliminated six Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists in an ambush. Motorcycles and bicycles were also recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents were killed during a military raid on their enclave. Arms and ammunition were destroyed while the camp was destroyed.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A police officer, 2 vigilantes and 11 residents were killed in an attack by bandits. Many others were injured. The attackers overpowered policemen and local vigilantes before raiding the communities.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , Other newspaper 3 (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (13 )

title: Mysterious Death, Kwara
description: The ugly experiences of kidnapping people and forcing them to pay millions as ransom, which defied military interventions, forced some spiritually powerful Nupe women to storm the arena, leading to the death of over 20 bandits in a mysterious way.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops, in conjunction with the Civilian Joint Task Force, killed a Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent while conducting clearance operations at a known ISWAP/JAS enclave.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent was killed during an encounter with troops. His gun was also recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Troops, in conjunction with hunters, killed a Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent during a raid on their hideout. His motorcycle and gun were recovered.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: About 30 bandits and 5 security operatives died during a clash. The bandits raided 3 communities before they were repelled by the operatives. The bandits were killed in an airstrike by NAF.

title: Undergraduate Students, Ondo
description: The corpses of two undergraduates of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba-Akoko (AAUA), Ondo State, Andrel Okah of the Department of History and International Studies in the Faculty of Arts and John Abba of the Department of Economics in the Faculty of Agriculture, were found in a forest at the border between Ondo and Ekiti states 3 weeks after they were declared missing. This incident was backdated by a week since the date of their murder was reported. Prime suspect in the student murder case, Femi Oladele, died a few days after confessing to the crimes.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Vanguard (3 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 security operatives were killed when suspected herders ambushed a joint security patrol team comprised of operatives from the Police Mobile Force (13 PMF, 58 PMF), State Intelligence Services (SIS), Operation Zenda, Counter-Terrorism Unit (CTU), NSCDC, Benue State Civil Protection Guards, and local vigilante groups. The attackers were burning houses approximately two kilometres from the expressway when they were sighted by the operatives who were on routine patrol.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Plateau
description: About 70 vigilantes lost their lives in an ambush by bandits. The victims had gone to confront the bandits due to incessant attacks on nearby communities, but ran into an ambush. However, there were conflicting reports on the number of fatalities from the incident.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (70 ) , Daily Trust (70 ) , Other newspaper 3 (70 ) , This Day (70 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgent was killed when troops carried out a night ambush at their crossing point. Others reportedly escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Bandits Kill Pastor, Katsina
description: Bandits stormed Bege Baptist Church, killed the presiding pastor, Rev. Emmanuel Na’allah, and a church member, Mallam Samaila Gidan Taro. They also abducted a female worshipper during a worship session.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram/ISWAP logistic suppliers were killed in an ambush by soldiers. Bicycles, sacks of slippers, several torchlights, batteries, detergents, salt, and rubber shoes and other items were recovered.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers on a fighting patrol killed 3 Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents. The incident is assumed to have happened on July 5th when other insurgents were killed in similar circumstances.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents who were trying to infiltrate an IDP camp were intercepted by soldiers. One of them was killed when others reportedly escaped with gunshot injuries. Rounds of ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suspected Boko Haram insurgent was killed in an ambush by a combined team of soldiers, vigilantes and hunters. His members reportedly escaped but motorcycles, pesticides, food items, and other items were recovered from them.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents were killed in counter and clearance operations by soldiers, the Civilian Joint Task Force and hunters. They were reportedly seen moving from Sambisa forest to the Timbuktu Triangle and were intercepted.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Two Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents conveying logistics were intercepted and killed by soldiers. Sundry items and foodstuffs were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists raided a an Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) and killed 11 people. They also set fire to a local hospital and several government buildings. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported in the source.
sources_of_information: The Nation (11 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , The Guardian (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation HADIN KAI killed a suspected Boko Haram fighter during an operation. Other insurgents were believed to have fled.

title: Lakurawa Attack, Sokoto
description: 15 people were killed by bandits suspected to be members of Lakurawa. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the village while residents were observing the Zuhr (afternoon) prayer.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (15 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Soldiers attached to Operation Hadin Kai attacked Boko Haram terrorists’ enclaves in the Lake Chad Basin and killed 10 of them. A huge cache of arms and ammunition were recovered from the scene.
place: Along the Road Rann – Gamboru Ngala axis, close to the Nigeria–Cameroon border

title: Vigilante Clash, Kwara
description: Six people were killed in a gun battle between bandits and security operatives. The victims include five vigilantes and a police officer. Two soldiers, two police officers, and about six vigilantes also sustained gunshot wounds.
place: Gada Woro, along Patigi Road near Gbugbu

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram commanders were killed when NAF targeted their enclaves. It is assumed that scores (assuming at least 40) of the insurgents were killed.
place: Wa Jahode and Loghpere in Mandara Mountains.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 )

title: Troops Kill Terror Kingpin, Sokoto
description: Troops of Operation FASAN YAMA, a military operation against bandits/terrorists in the Northwest, supported by Hybrid Forces and the Nigerian Air Force, killed a terrorist kingpin, Yellow Danbokkolo, during a fierce battle.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: The Civilian Protection Group (CPG) ambushed and killed Kachalla Yellow Danbokolo, a notorious bandit and close ally of Kachalla Turji, 6 bandit commanders and 182 other bandits. Danbokolo was alleged to be one of the most dreaded bandits in the North West.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: A bandit was killed in an ambush by troops of the 6 Brigade Nigerian Army and Sector 3 Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS). Other bandits were reportedly injured but escaped, while arms were recovered. This incident is backdated by 2 days of its report since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Gang Kingpins Kill 4, Imo
description: An IPOB/ESN: Two notorious Biafran agitators, Ifeanyi Okorienta Eze, popularly known as “Gentle the Yahoo,” and Monday Ogu, also known as B44 killed 4 members of their group over allegations of sabotage. They were accused of selling the gang out to security operatives who foiled one of their operations. This incident is backdated by 2 months as reported.

title: Political Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: Mr John Monday Marcus, the Ward 2 chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), was killed in a bloody fight with a faction of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). His death resulted in a free-for-all fight at the venue of a meeting.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 40) were killed when NAF bombarded their stronghold. The victims were also associated with cattle rustling. This incident occurred 2 days after 17 soldiers were killed in the LGA.

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 4 people were killed and 10 others injured when an IED planted by suspected Boko Haram insurgents exploded. The victims were travelling when the minivan ran over and triggered the IED.

title: Banditry, Kwara
description: One person was killed when bandits raided a community. It was reported that the attackers shot sporadically, causing panic and forcing residents to flee.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Four people were killed with an unspecified number of people sustaining various degrees of injuries when their vehicle stumbled on an IED planted by members of Boko Haram.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Policemen killed 2 bandits. They were robbing a compound when they were intercepted.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: It was reported that villagers killed scores of alleged bandits and kidnappers. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the incident happened on the 26th of June 2025.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 15 people lost their lives when bandits raided a community. Details of the incident were not provided for in the report.

title: Lakurawa Attack, Sokoto
description: Lakurawa bandits ambushed and killed six farmers working on their farms. They had earlier raided some communities where they were repelled for cattle rustling. They regrouped and attacked the community where they killed the victims.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Daily Trust (8 )

title: Bandit Attack, Kwara
description: 35-year-old Timothy Paul, 51-year-old PDP leader Alhaji Abdullahi Shehu, and his 22-year-old son, Abdullahi Muhammad, were killed during a raid by bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A wanted terrorist leader, Ali Kachala Kawaje, a terrorist bomb expert, Machika, Dan Muhammad, 38 other commanders and their foot soldiers were killed by the military. About 159 others were arrested.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were reportedly killed when they launched an attack on a military base. It is assumed that at least 40 bandits were killed in the encounter. There was no report on whether any soldiers died.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Niger
description: Bandits attacked a military base, killing about 17 soldiers. Scores of the bandits, assuming at least 40 (2 scores), died in the encounter. Some soldiers were also injured.
place: Forward operating bases in the general areas of Kwanar Dutse Mairiga and Bok
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (57 ) , The Punch (57 ) , PM News (60 ) , Vanguard (60 )

title: Market Explosion, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Mrs. Ngozi Umeh died in an explosion that rocked a market. The IED was believed to have been planted by IPOB or their military wing, the Eastern Security Network (ESN). There were different reports on the number of fatalities, with some reporting 5 people injured.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A clash between notorious bandit Bello Turji’s gang and security forces claimed at least 100 lives. Details of this incident were not reported. Another source reported that the operation was conducted by the Civilian Protection Group.
sources_of_information: PM News (100 ) , Nigerian Tribune (100 ) , The Guardian (100 )

title: Bandits Kill Security Operatives, Zamfara
description: Notorious bandit leader Bello Turji killed 40 members of the Joint Task Force (JTF) and four soldiers. He also executed an ex-bandit, Bashari Maniya, accusing him of helping security forces.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (45 ) , The Punch (100 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Mrs. Alheri Danzaria was killed while 2 others were abducted by bandits believed to be escaping with rustled cattle. The kidnapped victims were later released by the bandits.
place: Ungwan Sarki Hausa village, Rimau community

title: Wedding Guests, Plateau
description: 12 Northerners en route to a wedding ceremony in Kaduna State were mobbed when they stopped over to ask for directions. They were mistaken for bandits. 22 people were arrested in connection with the murder.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 14 people were killed when bandits raided a community. Many others were injured while cattle were rustled. Houses were also destroyed. The date of this incident was not reported. Therefore, it is assumed that it happened 2 days after its report on the newspaper.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Bandits raided a community and killed 16 people. Many were also injured while properties were destroyed. The date of this incident was not reported. Therefore, it is assumed that it happened 2 days after its report in the newspaper.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 12 people lost their lives when a female suicide bomber detonated explosives at a local trading area. The bomber, who was believed to have affiliations with Boko Haram or the Islamic State West Africa Province, died instantly. About 18 people were injured.

title: Bandits kill Police Inspector, Katsina
description: Bandits killed a police inspector during an attack on an Armoured Personnel Carrier in which the deceased was. alongside some of his colleagues.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A 60-year-old resident, Alhaji Danmalam, was critically injured during a raid by bandits. He later died from the injuries he sustained during the attack.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 2 dozens) were killed in an air strike on their stronghold. Their IED-making factory and vehicles were also destroyed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 12 bandits were killed in clearance operations by soldiers. The victims rustled 22 cattle from residents but were chased to an enclave where they were killed. A vigilante died in the encounter and a soldier was injured.
sources_of_information: The Punch (12 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Other newspaper 2 (13 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 20 farmers, 3 other residents, and a community watch corps operative, popularly called C’watch were killed during a raid by bandits. They also kidnapped some residents and rustled some animals.
place: Marmara, Yargoje, Kwakware, Danmarke, Gidan Dawa and some from Burdugau.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Scores of bandits and their wives (assuming at least 40) were killed when soldiers and vigilantes raided their strongholds. 4 vigilantes lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: The eldest son of notorious bandit leader Ado Alieru, Sale Ado Madele (alias Sarki), was reportedly killed by soldiers. 10 other bandits were killed when they gathered at a filling station to plan attacks. This incident is backdated by 2 days from its report since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A vigilante and 5 others were killed when bandits raided some communities. Properties were reportedly destroyed and residents were displaced.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A terrorist kingpin, known as Auta, his key figures, Abdul Jamilu, Salisu, Babayé and 13 others, were killed during a raid by troops of the Mobile Strike Team, under Operation Fasan Yamma.

title: Herders Attack, Benue
description: Sunday Dutse, the younger brother of a former Chairman of Agatu LGA, was killed by suspected herders. The vehicle he was traveling in ran into an ambush by his killers. One of the sources stated that Sunday was not killed by herders but by masked gunmen during an argument inside a vehicle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Malam Jidda, a terrorist kingpin and the Ameer of Ngorgore and Malumti villages, was killed alongside scores of his fighters during a military operation. It is assumed that at least 40 of his fighters died in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (41 ) , The Punch (41 ) , Other newspaper 3 (41 )

title: IPOB/ESN Kill 2 Drivers, Imo
description: Two truck drivers, Haruna Muhammad and Adamu Ibrahim, were killed and their vehicle set ablaze by suspected IPOB members. The victims were transporting 'garri' to Port Harcourt when they were confronted and killed.

title: Mosque Attack, Zamfara
description: One person was killed while two others were injured when heavily armed men suspected to be bandits attacked Muslim worshippers during Isha (Night prayer) in the mosque.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: Three farmers were allegedly killed by armed Fulani herdsmen, while another person was declared missing. One of the victims was identified as Isaiah.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers foiled an attack on troops' location by suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters. Arms and ammunition were recovered while scores (assuming at least 40) were believed to have been killed by the troops.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents were killed and their key logistics structures destroyed in an air strike by the NAF. It is assumed about 20 insurgents were killed.
place: Tumbumma Baba and Chiralia in the Southern Tumbuns

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were reportedly killed during a special operation by soldiers. The ground operation was supported by the Aur Component of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It is assumed that 2 scores (40) were killed in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: A bandit was killed during a shootout with soldiers. Others were alleged to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: 45 bandits were killed by a team of the DSS and the Nigerian military. The victims were reported to be loyalists of a notorious bandit, Dogo Gide. A source reported that 3 vigilantes and hunters died in the encounter.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: No fewer than 30 people were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Many were also abducted while houses were razed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (30 ) , The Punch (18 ) , Nigerian Tribune (18 ) , Vanguard (18 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 suspected bandits were killed during a military operation at their hideout. Weapons were also recovered.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Nine passengers were killed and several others were injured by IEDs reportedly planted by Boko Haram insurgents. The unfortunate incident happened when the commuters were waiting to board vehicles at a local bus stop.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 notorious bandits were killed during an operation by soldiers. They were ambushed by the operatives.

title: Miliatry Air Strike, Zamfara
description: Five vigilance members and over 20 bandits were killed in a coordinated air strike carried out by the troops of Operation Fansan Yanma. The victims were earlier warned to withdraw from the area.
place: Maraya and Wabi villages in Maru
sources_of_information: The Nation (25 ) , The Punch (25 ) , Nigerian Tribune (25 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Two members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) and a community guard were killed during a raid by bandits. There were also multiple abductions during the ambush.

title: Army vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: A notorious Boko Haram/ISWAP commander identified as Amir Abu Fatima and 59 others were killed by troops of the Special Forces of 19 Brigade under Sector 3 of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire at the terrorist's hideout. It was also reported that 59 members belonging to the deceased were also killed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters, assuming at least 40, were killed by soldiers during a raid on their hideouts. 2 soldiers died in the encounter while arms and ammunition were recovered.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (42 ) , Other newpapers 1 (42 ) , The Guardian (42 ) , Vanguard (42 ) , Other newspaper 3 (15 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A man was killed and another was declared missing after suspected Fulani herdsmen ambushed them on their way back home.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 3 bandits were killed in an ambush by troops of the 3 Division and Operation SAFE HAVEN. It was reported that some weapons were also recovered by the troops.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 20) were killed in a foiled attack on a military base.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Suicide Bomber, FCT
description: An IED reportedly killed one person and injured another. The victim was alleged to be a suicide bomber. The sources did not affiliate the suicide bomber who targeted a military cantonment to Boko Haram or the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP).

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 40) were killed during an operation by a combined team of soldiers and DSS. The bandits had earlier killed a man identified as Ayuba Isah before they were repelled.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (42 ) , Vanguard (42 ) , This Day (42 ) , Other newspaper 2 (42 )

title: Troop Killed Bandits, Taraba
description: Troops of the 6 Brigade, Nigerian Army, engaged some bandits in a shootout and killed a gang member. The bandits had earlier attacked some communities. where they killed over 30 people (See incident in IBD032477).

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Katsina security corps commander and 4 others were killed in an ambush by bandits. They were en route to a community to foil an attack when they ran into the ambush.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: A suspected pro-Biafra agitator was killed in a gun battle between soldiers and members of the Eastern Security Network. An officer and a soldier were injured in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: A bandit was killed during a raid on their hideout by troops of the 3rd Division, operating under Operation Safe Haven.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: No fewer than 16 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a foiled attack on a military establishment. In recent times, insurgents have attacked military bases in the state, leading to loss of lives and property.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: About 21 bandits were killed in a raid by troops of the 17 Brigade Strike Group of the Nigerian Army. Many of them were also believed to have suffered different degrees of injuries.
sources_of_information: The Nation (21 ) , The Punch (21 ) , The Guardian (12 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: A 32-year-old breastfeeding mother was killed and 2 others were injured during an attack by suspected herders. They were ambushed while going to their farm on a commercial motorcycle.

title: Gunmen Kill Soldier, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Udoka, a soldier was killed by suspected members of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) when he sneaked into a strippers’ party titled “Ladies’ Jamboree” in his military camouflage.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: A lieutenant of Turji Bello identified as Shaudo Alku was killed in a military raid. Belloe was reported to have escaped the onslaught. The victim was believed to have been invited from Niger Republic to have a meeting with Bello.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 15 farmers were killed and 3 others were injured when bandits raided a community in the evening as they were leaving their farmlands.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 15 people, mostly traders, were killed in ambushes by suspected Fulani herdsmen. They were returning from the popular Oweto market when they were ambushed. Many were also injured.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 19 people were killed and several houses were burnt by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the attackers stormed the community at night and shot sporadically at the victims. It was also reported that 10 people were abducted.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (19 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (19 ) , The Punch (19 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Four women were killed while 20 other residents were abducted during an early morning raid by bandits. The attackers had initially selected 24 victims for abduction but killed the women who resisted.

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: 4 people, including a woman and 3 young men, were killed by bandits who invaded a community at night. It was reported that the victims were ambushed on their way to attend a market in a neighbouring town.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 2 bandits were killed and weapons were recovered by troops of Operation Safe Haven (OPSH). It was reported that the troops laid an ambush on the bandits at the crossing point.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 23 farmers and fishermen were killed by the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) insurgents. Most of the victims were beans farmers.

title: Banditary, Taraba
description: 2 bandits were killed and over 1000 cows recovered by troops of the 6 Brigade Nigerian Army Sector 3, in collaboration with troops of “Operation Safe Haven. The bandits launched a cattle-rustling operation targeting a Fulani settlement but were repelled. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 soldiers were killed and 6 others were injured when Boko Haram insurgents invaded a military base in a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by troops of Operation Safe Haven (OPSH). It was reported that arms and ammunition were recovered after the operation.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Several people were killed and others were injured by bandits who invaded a community at night. Many others were abducted and houses were also set ablaze. Due to the nature of the story, it was assumed that 25 people were killed.

title: Explosion, Anambra
description: Three children were allegedly killed by a cannon from a Nigerian Air Force military helicopter. Another person was seriously injured and was hospitalised. The incident was denied by the Nigerian Air Force, and the Eastern Security Network (ESN) was accused of the explosion.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram/ISWAP attacked a military formation and killed 5 soldiers. Among the victims were Shehu from Kaduna State and Patrick Franklin from Delta State. Some soldiers were reportedly captured alive by the insurgents.
place: Forward Operating Base of the 153 Task Force Battalion
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 2 travellers, identified as Blessing Luka and Gideon Bitterleave, were killed in an IED explosion that Boko Haram reportedly planted. The victims, staff members of the Damboa Local Education Authority, ran through the IED while transporting mangoes in a Toyota Hiace van.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unspecified number of Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents were killed during an operation by soldiers. It is assumed that about 10 insurgents were killed in the encounter. Some weapons were also recovered. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed during a gun battle. The attackers had raided 4 Fulani settlements and rustled over 400 cows. They came in contact with the soldiers when they were escaping with their loot.

title: Gunmen vs Travellers, Imo
description: Several travellers were killed and many vehicles were burnt by gunmen, suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and Eastern Security Network (IPOB/ESN). Due to the nature of the story, it was assumed that 15 people were killed, as the number of casualties was not stated.

title: Herdsmen vs Traditional Ruler, Benue
description: 2 people, including a traditional ruler identified as Chief Tony Adejo, and Jerry John were killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the deceased was killed at his farm.

title: Boko Harm vs Security Operatives, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram members, an Army Captain, and a soldier were killed during a clash between Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened at a military location.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 2 vigilante members were killed and 1 other was injured by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the incident happened in the afternoon.
place: Kontagora-Minna highway between Kampanin Bobi and Wamba

title: Banditry Zamfara
description: 12 people were killed and many others were abducted by gunmen. The attack was in response to the killing of bandit kingpins in a nearby LGA (See event in IBD032314).
place: Zamfarawa, Kurukuru, Dogon Daji, Dan Hayin Zamfarawa, Tungar Zabo, Burmukai, and Dambawa

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 3 bandits were shot dead by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened at the bandit's hideout, where they were planning to launch an attack on a community.

title: Soldier Kill Bandits, Taraba
description: Soldiers killed a suspected bandit and recovered arms and a motorcycle during a special operation. The operatives ambushed their victims at a crossing point.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Bauchi
description: Suspected bandits launched a deadly attack and killed 11 vigilante members and civilians in a coordinated assault on three villages. Among the victims was Malam Rufa’i, a vigilante.
place: Duguri, Mansur, and the Dajin Madam
sources_of_information: The Nation (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , The Punch (19 ) , Daily Trust (25 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Yobe
description: About 4 soldiers were killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided a military formation. Military assets were also destroyed. This incident was the latest attack on military posts in the Northeast. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported for its occurrence.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Lakurawa Bandits vs Hunters, Sokoto
description: 13 hunters were killed by suspected Lakurawa terrorists. It was reported that the victims were ambushed during their seasonal hunting expedition in a forest.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 ) , Other newspaper 3 (11 )

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed in a landmine explosion. They were escorting some commuters when their vehicle ran over an IED allegedly planted by suspected Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 mourners were killed and several others were injured by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the insurgents stormed a funeral prayer ground in the evening and opened fire on the mourners.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (15 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , Vanguard (14 ) , Other newspaper 4 (14 )

title: Boko Haram vs Hunters, Adamawa
description: Terrorists killed 10 hunters and members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). The armed insurgents, suspected to be members of Boko Haram or the Islamic State West Africa Province, stormed the border community on motorcycles, overpowering local defenders with superior firepower, and burned many houses.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 3 people were killed and many animals were rustled by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 15 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a community. No further details were given on the attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Fishermen, Borno
description: 18 fishermen were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a riverine area. It was reported that the deceased were being punished for conniving with the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was also reported that several others were missing after the attack.
place: Fadana Garuwa River in the Duji Ward

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 12 people, including firewood scavengers and members of the Civilian Joint Task Force, were killed, and 2 others were injured by Boko Haram who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims were ambushed.
place: Kirawa road and Bokko Ghide community of Pulka District

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several people, including soldiers and hunters, were killed and others were injured by suspected Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a community at night. Due to the nature, it was assumed that 15 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 farmers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened at the deceased's farms, where they went for clearance in preparation for the rainy season.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Attack, Borno
description: An IED exploded and killed several travellers. The explosion occurred when the vehicle conveying the victims ran over the IED planted by Islamic State West Africa Province insurgents.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Vanguard (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (8 ) , Daily Trust (17 ) , The Punch (26 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 28 people, including miners, were killed and several others were injured by gunmen who invaded 3 villages. It was reported that the incident happened in the afternoon.
place: Gobirawa Chali, Damaga, and Lugga Villages

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani militias ambushed three Irigwe youths, killed two of them and injured 1. About 20 farms belonging to various members of the community were destroyed. Those killed were Adamu Bala (38 years), and Gado Trra (45 years).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A driver and 2 passengers were killed when bandits ambushed them on a major highway. Among the victims was one Fachi, a member of the Community Protection Guards in the state.
place: Tashan Kuturu, a known flashpoint on the Anka-Mayanchi route.

title: Gunmen Kill Man, Nasarawa
description: A newlywed man, Alu Anzaku was killed and his wife abducted just 13 days after their wedding. He was murdered in his residence. His killers were reported as Fulani bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 people were killed in separate attacks that were described as unprovoked and devastating.
place: Dolen Moriki and Kaiwa Lamba villages

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 11 people were killed in a renewed attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The attack came a few days after about 28 people were killed in the same LGA (see event in IBD032207).

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Kwara
description: A vigilante member identified as Yusuf Samba was killed during a routine patrol in the Kainji National Park. Three bandits were reportedly injured but no death was reported on their side.
place: Kainji National Park area near Kemanji
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 6 people died in a renewed clash between members of the Ezza community in Ado LGA of Benue State and their Effium neighbours in Ebonyi State. The crisis between the two communities has lingered for decades

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: A young man known for selling oil was killed during a clash between local vigilantes and bandits. The attackers had successfully stolen a huge sum of money from a businessman before they were repelled by the vigilantes.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Vanguard (1 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Good Friday Attack: Worshippers who were going to church for Good Friday were attacked and killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. About 56 corpses were picked in 2 LGAs- Ukum and Logo. It is assumed that 28 people were killed in each of the LGAs (see event in IBD032207).

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Good Friday Attack: Worshippers who were going to church for Good Friday were attacked and killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. A few days later, the number of deaths rose to about 28.

title: Vigilantes vs Mahmuda Terrorists, Kwara
description: Mahmuda: 15 vigilantes were killed by a new terror group identified as Mahmuda, aka the Mallam Group. The group is believed to be a breakaway faction of Boko Haram with suspected links to extremist cells in Niger and Mali, and has been blamed for a string of kidnappings in rural communities across the North Central.

title: Terrorists vs Police Officer, Katsina
description: A mobile police officer was killed in an ambush by bandits. The bandits lost 8 of their members, with several others injured when police operatives repelled them.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: The former sole administrator and retired permanent secretary identified as Saminu Suleiman Morai, his former counselor, Alhaji Akilu Liman, and 2 others were shot dead by gunmen. It was also reported that Morai's wife and children were abducted.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed and several others were injured by gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that 20 people, including children, were also abducted.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram terrorists killed 2 soldiers and an unconfirmed number of civilians (assuming at least 5). The attack came after the insurgents wanted to infiltrate Gwoza town but were repelled by the military.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Adamawa
description: 7 people, including a vigilante member, were killed and several houses and properties were destroyed when a bomb planted by Boko Haram exploded.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Vanguard (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko terrorists (assuming at least 40) were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF), Air Component of Operation HADIN KAI (OPHK). It was reported that the incident happened at the hideouts of the terrorists.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Troops of 6 Brigade Nigerian Army/Sector 3 Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) killed 2 bandits and recovered assorted arms while their hideouts were destroyed.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed when gunmen suspected to be Fulani militias invaded a community. There was an upsurge of killings in the state by suspected herdsmen since the beginning of April.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 people lost their lives in a landmine explosion that was planted by Boko Haram. All the victims were passengers of a Hummer bus. Some passengers were also injured.
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , Vanguard (8 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (9 )

title: Father and Children Killed, Plateau
description: A 56-year-old man identified as Weyi Gebeh and his two sons, Zhu Weyi, 25, and Henry Weyi, 16, were killed when the bandits invaded their community.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 6 bandits, including a local commander, were killed during a military raid on their enclaves.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: A bandit was killed and one fabricated pistol was recovered by troops of Operation Safe Haven (OPSH). It was reported other bandits allegedly escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Some gunmen (assuming at least 5) were killed and 3 others injured in military operations. Five kidnapped victims and two students of the Federal University of Dutsi-Ma were also freed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian troops raided some hideouts of Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents in some LGAs and killed some extremists. While the report was not specific on the locations of the incidents, and only listed Konduga, Kukawa, Abadam and Mobbar in Borno State, it is assumed the terrorists were killed in Konduga. It is also assumed that no fewer than 10 insurgents died in the encounters.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Many bandits were killed during military operations in different LGAs in the state. A terrorist kingpin, Bello Kaura, was also neutralised in one of the air interdictions. It is assumed that the gunmen were killed in Tsafe as the report was not specific on the LGA. It is also assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits died in the incidents.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Gwaska, a second-in-command to an ISWAP-linked leader, and 100 other bandits were eliminated by soldiers of the 17 Brigade and 213 Forward Operating Base (FOB) of the Air Component of the NAF. Their enclaves were also destroyed.
place: Mununu Bakai, Zango, Jeka Arera, Malali, and Ruwan Godiya areas

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 5 bandits were killed in an ambush by the Katsina State Police Command, in collaboration with the military, the Departments of State Services, members of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps, and the vigilantes.

title: Lakurawa Attack, Sokoto
description: Two fishermen and a farmer were killed in an ambush by Lakurawa insurgents. The victims were identified as Zubairu Kusugu, Aminu Ibrahim and Salisu Dangwati. The bandits also stole livestock, including cows, camels, sheep, and goats.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Several corpses (assuming at least 10) were dumped at a village entrance. The victims were believed to have been killed in revenge attacks by bandits who previously lost 3 of their members in the community. It is assumed the victims were killed a day before they were dumped in the community.

title: Herders vs Farmers, Ondo
description: 3 farmers were killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning when the deceased were going to their farms.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attempted to invade a community but were repelled by troops, hunters and vigilantes. A soldier was killed in the process.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 2 residents in revenge attacks for the murder of their kingpins. About 60 people were abducted in different communities by the attackers.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A bandit was killed in a joint operation by the police and Katsina Community Watch Corps (C-Watch). Six women and 4 men were rescued from the bandits.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Imo
description: A female farmer was killed on her farm by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An Army Captain, a corporal, and scores Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 40) were killed during an attack on a military formation. They reportedly overpowered the military, but a reinforcement of hunters and vigilantes mitigated the attack.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 3 bandits were reported killed by soldiers who also destroyed over 70 camps used by the gunmen to launch attacks.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: One person was killed by bandits in a reprisal attack for the murder of a bandit warlord, Kechalla Yellow, by the Zamfara State Community Protection Guards and the police. The attack was reportedly carried out by Kechalla's elder brother, Adamu Aliero and his foot soldiers.

title: Baditry, Katsina
description: Bandits kidnapped 53, including men, married women, young girls, and children, and killed four people. This incident is linked to the event in IBD032118.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Lakurawa Attack, Kebbi
description: Heavily armed bandits suspected to be members of the notorious Lakurawa group stormed two villages, rustled an unspecified number of cattle, and killed 6 people.
sources_of_information: The Punch (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , Other newpapers 1 (16 )

title: Banditry Attack, Katsina
description: In coordinated attacks by bandits, 53 people were kidnapped and 2 others were killed. This incident is linked to IBD032116.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A driver and a passenger were ambushed and killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. 13 other passengers in the 18-seater bus belonging to the Benue State government-owned Benue Links Transport Company were also abducted by the attackers. A source reported 3 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A policeman was killed when he and his colleagues were patrolling the Police Mobile Force Training College (PMFTC). The insurgents opened fire on them, and the bullet hit the victim.
place: Police Mobile Force Training College camp at Limankara

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Ten people were killed and many others were injured in a series of attacks on five communities by suspected Fulani herdsmen.
place: Mongor, Daffo, Manguna, Hurti, and Tadai communities
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 4 (60 ) , The Nation (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , The Punch (52 )

title: Gunmen vs Transporter, Ondo
description: The son of a popular transporter identified as Muihili Adebayo was killed, and his mother was injured by suspected bandits. It was reported that the deceased father was taken away.

title: Stray Bullets, Sokoto
description: In an exchange of gunfire between security forces and some bandits, a stray bullet fired by the bandits struck a 35-year-old resident, Sule Ummaru, as he tried to flee the scene.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Sokoto
description: 11 farmers were killed by a notorious bandit kingpin, Kachalla Bello Turji, and his followers. It was reported that the bandits invaded the community when the victims were returning from the Sallah celebration.

title: Chieftaincy Tussle, Ondo
description: An assistant secretary of a community, identified as Idowu Joel Lowo was killed by hoodlums during a leadership crisis in a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram raided a military formation, killing at least 4 soldiers and injured many others. 3 other soldiers who were drafted to repel the attack died in a landmine explosion that was triggered by the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were reportedly killed and others injured after the convoy of the Brigade Commander of ‘Operation Hadin Kai’ struck IEDs planted by suspected Boko Haram insurgents. A source reported that many soldiers died. Therefore, it is assumed that about 5 soldiers lost their lives in the encounter. They victims were rushing to foil a raid on a military formation (See IBD032017)

title: Troops Kill Bandit, Plateau
description: Troops of Operation Safe Haven (OPSH) killed a notorious bandit during an intense clearance operation. The victims, an alleged member of the Auta-led banditry syndicate, had been operating in Wase and Taraba State before he was killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents raided a military formation and killed at least 20 Cameroonian soldiers. Some weapons were either stolen or destroyed.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kogi
description: 2 people, suspected to be vigilant operatives, were killed and a woman identified as Mrs. Ruth Williamns was abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the night.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Zamfara
description: 10 Zamfara State Community Protection Guards and local vigilante group members were killed by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the guards, in conjunction with the state's security forces, attempted to raid the bandits' hideout.

title: Bandits Attack, Sokoto
description: 1 person was killed when bandits invaded a community. It was reported that the attackers stormed the community on motorcycles and attacked their victims.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: A farmer identified as Mr. Daniel was killed by some Fulani herdsmen. He was attacked in his farm while working.

title: Kidnap Victims, Kaduna
description: Three members of Surubu Community Development Association, Obadiah Dangana, Emmanuel Moses (popularly known as Bobbling Guy), and Danjuma Sardauna, were kidnapped and killed by bandits despite paying ransom. Their bodies were later discovered in the forest by security operatives.

title: Security Force vs Lakurawa, Kebbi
description: A team of joint security forces killed two suspected Lakurawa bandits while several others escaped with gunshot wounds during an operation. The joint security forces conducted the operation based on credible intelligence and surveillance reports.

title: Herders vs Farmers, Ondo
description: 5 farmers were killed in their farms by suspected Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident sparked protests in the community.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Vanguard (25 )

title: Banditary, Katsina
description: Some bandits were killed during a clearance operation by NAF. The victims were reported as high-value targets. Their hideouts were also destroyed. It is assumed that about 10 bandits were killed by the operatives.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A well-fortified Boko Haram/ISWAP hideout in a mountainous area was hit by NAF, and an unspecified number of insurgents were killed. It is assumed about 10 of them lost their lives.
place: Mandara Mountains, and at Yuwe, within Sambisa forest

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian military attached to the air component of Operation Hadin Kai bombed a terrorist enclave. An unspecified number of Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents were killed during the operation by the NAF. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 insurgents lost their lives.
place: Chiralia, an enclave within the Timbuktu Triangle.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Yobe
description: A vigilante member was killed by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the deceased was traced to his residence.
causes_of_violence: religious issue, road accident, Daily Trust

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 12 bandits, including a notorious commander, Dogo were killed by troops of Operation Fansan Yamma.

title: Gunmen vs Herders, Enugu
description: 5 Fulani herdsmen were killed by some gunmen while 8 others were missing.
place: Eshi River, between the Opanda community and Amaeke community

title: NAF vs Bandit, Katsina
description: 22 bandits, including 2 kingpins identfiled as Gero ( Alhaji) and Alhaji Riga were killed by airstrikes of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the incident happened in their terrorist hideout.
place: Funtua-Gusau road, between Yankara and Sheme villages
sources_of_information: The Nation (22 ) , Nigerian Tribune (22 ) , Other newspaper 2 (22 ) , Daily Trust (21 )

title: Vigilantes, FCT (Abuja)
description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits, killed 2 vigilante members and injured one other person. The gunmen attempted to invade a Fulani settlement when the vigilantes swiftly engaged them in a gun duel but lost two of their members.

title: Bandits vs Worshippers, Nasarawa
description: 3 worshippers were killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded a church. It was reported the bandits stormed a church camp during a night vigil hour and targeted a hostel.

title: Lakurawa Bandits Kills 11, Kebbi
description: 11 people were killed and 2 others were injured by Lakurawa bandits. The attack was a reprisal for the killing of their kingpin, Maigemu, by security forces. It was reported that several homes were set ablaze and 6 villages were destroyed during the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (11 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Other newspaper 3 (13 ) , Daily Trust (13 )

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Yobe
description: A 32-year-old vigilante member identified as Modu Bulama was killed by some suspected Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 12 security operatives, including the Zamafar State Community Protection Guards and local viglantes, were killed and several others were injured during a clash with bandits. It was reported that some residents were abducted.

title: Boko Harm Kill Police Officer Children, Yobe
description: Boko Haram terrorists broke into the house of Malam Jibrin, a police inspector, slaughtered his two sons and set their corpses and the house ablaze.

title: Herdsmen vs Vigilante, Delta
description: Fulani herdsmen who were armed with guns and other dangerous weapons shot dead Mr. Nonanzu, a leader of the community’s vigilante team.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers of the Nigerian Army killed a wanted and notorious terrorist Commander, Abba Alai (Amirul Khahid of Alafa), and scores of other terrorists in Sambisa forest during an encounter. It is assumed that 20 people were killed along with the commander.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 17 people, including vigilante members, were killed and several others were injured by bandits. It was reported that an unspecified number of people were abducted.
place: Radama, Ungwan Baki, Ungwan Buntu, Mai Daura, and Yar Mai Kakgo Villages

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 2 notorious bandit kingpins, Kachalla Na-Allah and Dogo Basullube were killed in an operation by troops of Operation Fansan Yamma.
place: Hegin Mahe, Ruwan Bore, Mada town

title: Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: Two farmers identified as Lucky Salami and Julius Arewa were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen, while the third person identified as Omokhagbon Abu, popularly known as Udugboya, was injured.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 people were killed and others were injured by some terrorists who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims, who were farmers, were attacked on their farmlands in the evening. The attackers were assumed to be Boko Haram or ISWAP.
place: Damboa town, along the Damboa-Maiduguri highway

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Niger
description: 9 farmers were killed and 6 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Landmine Kills 2, Borno
description: 2 members of Civilan JFT died and 5 others were injured when their military convoy ran over a landmine planted by some Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists. It was reported that the troops were sent to the area to repair a bridge.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Scores of people were killed, and several buildings, including schools, churches, houses, etc. were burnt by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident was a dusk-to-dawn operation.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 4 people, including the Chief Imam of the Maru Jumuát Mosque identified as Alkali Salihu Suleiman, his 2 children, Khuzaifa and Kabiru and his grandchild, were killed by bandits after receiving a N11m of the N20m ransom demanded. It was reported that the deceased were abducted 4 months ago.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Ishaya Soda was killed, while a man, Sunday Maiwayo, and his daughter were abducted by bandits who invaded a community.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 4 people were killed and several others were abducted by bandits. Among them was a sick man who died while fleeing from the bandits.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Ayuba Buzaru and 3 other bandits were killed, and 3 kidnapped victims, JafaruAlh. Bawa (52), Delu Alh. Amadu (40), and Huzaifa aka Zulai Alh. Bawa (27) were rescued by the NSCDC.

title: NAF Kill Bandits, Zamfara
description: 23 bandits were killed while others were injured in NAF's ongoing efforts to dismantle terrorist strongholds and curb cattle rustling, which remains a key source of funding for bandit groups.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A terrorist was killed in an ambush by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened at the terrorist's hideouts.

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: 2 members of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) were killed and several others were injuredduring a clash with the opposition party, the All Progressive Congress (APC). Both parties opposed each other over the conduct of the local government election.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 1 person was killed and 10 others were abducted by bandits who invaded some communities in large numbers. It was reported that an unconfirmed number of cattle were rustled.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram fighters were killed, and some weapons were recovered by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during a raid on the terrorist's hideouts.

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: The reinstated Council Chairman of the All Progressive Congress (APC), identified as Remi Abass was shot dead, and several properties were destroyed during a clash between the PDP and the APC over the LGA election in the state.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: 2 members of the PDP were killed and 20 others were injured during a clash with the opposition party, the All Progressive Congress (APC). Both parties opposed each other over the conduct of the local government election.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Kidnappers Attack, Imo
description: A man identified as Chidera Anywocha known as NEPA was shot to death by some kidnappers suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that another youth, Marcus was abducted a few days ago.

title: Army vs Villagers, Katsina
description: 7 villagers were killed by military airstrikes. It was reported that the incident occurred during the LGA election in the community where 2 police officers and an operative of the state-owned Community Watch Corps (CWC) were killed by bandits.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 bandit commanders were killed by troops of Operation Fansan Yanma of the Nigerian Military. It was reported that the incident happened during a thorough stop and search operation.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: One person was killed when bandits raided a community. Several others were also abducted.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: 3 suspected IPOB/ESN members were killed, and some weapons were recovered by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened during a raid by the police while targeting the IPOB/ESN terrorists.
place: Ezioha Mbaitolu, Nkwukwo Forest, near the boundary with Ubachima Forest
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN Imo
description: 2 members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed, and 7 AK-47 rifles were recovered by police operatives. It was reported the incident happened during a raid by the police operatives in collaboration with other security agencies at the camp of the IPOB/ESN.

title: Bandits vs Traders, Katsina
description: 12 traders were killed and 4 others were abducted by gunmen who ambushed them. It was reported that the victims, tomato traders were attacked while coming back from a market in a neighboring state.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: No fewer than 44 bandits were killed and their camps destroyed by soldiers. About 25 injured in a coordinated assault across multiple fronts.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 2 people were killed and several others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community at night. It was reported that 13 kidnapped victims were rescued by police operatives who engaged the bandits in an exchange of gunfire.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 6 bandits, including 2 commanders, Kachalla Gwammade and Kachalla Shehu, belonging to a kingpin, Bello Turji were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened at the bandits hideout.
place: Ruwan Village, Hannu Tara camp along the Magami DanSadau HighwaysTufan and Mashima highways

title: Bandit vs Vigilante, Niger
description: A vigilante called Aliyu Aminu was killed by bandits who invaded their community at midnight. Some girls were also kidnapped.

title: Police vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: 2 suspected bandits were shot dead, and some weapons were recovered by police operatives during a joint raid with some hunters. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.
place: Dajin Madan Forest in Gwana District

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 2 people, including Adamu Yakubu lost their lives and 4 others were injured when their vehicle stepped on an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the vehicle was conveying the victims to a market.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: 7 Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) and Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of Operation Hadin Kai, in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force. It was reported that the incident happened at the hideouts of the insurgents.

title: Herdsmen vs Hunters, Benue
description: 5 hunters, including an All Progressive Congress (APC) Councillorship aspirant, identified as Amedu Agaba; Peter, a.k.a JPG, and Moses were killed and several others were injured during a clash between suspected Fulani herdsmen and hunters. It was reported that the incident was a reprisal for the killing of one of a herder in IBD031669.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 )

title: Security Operatives vs Hoodlums, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 35 hoodlums, including some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by joint security forces during a raid operation. It was reported that the incident happened at the hideouts of the hoodlums in a forest.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 5 people including a couple and their child were killed by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night while the victims were sleeping.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 people were killed, and 24 others were injured by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that bandits also attacked a mosque in the area.
place: Jangeru, Shanawa, and Birnin Yero Villages in Shinkafi Town

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were reportedly killed during an air interdiction by NAF, under the Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai. The victims were killed in camps under the command of Ali Ngulde, a known Boko Haram leader. It is estimated that no fewer than 2 scores (40) were killed in the encounter.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ondo
description: 5 people were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victims, labourers were attacked while working on farmlands.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Bandits vs Herder, Niger
description: A herder identified as Usman Shehu was killed, and 2 others, including Adamu Usamn (56), were kidnapped by bandits. It was reported that the victims camped in the bush with their cattle when the bandits attacked them.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 Civilian JTF members and many soldiers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened during a three-hour operation at the border. Due to the nature of the story, it was assumed that 30 soldiers were killed during the attack.
place: a border between the Damboa and the Gujba Areas

title: Police vs IPOB Members, Imo
description: 6 people linked with the activities of IPOB and its military wing, the Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed during raids by the police.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A 27-year-old man, Piti Ezekiel, was killed, and 5 others were abducted by suspected bandits. Many residents were displaced after the incident.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 20 soldiers, including a military commander and two senior officers, were killed and others were injured by Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened at an army base.

title: Boko Haram vs Fishermen,Borno
description: Scores of fishermen were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning when the victims were working.

title: Bandits vs Boko Haram, Niger
description: 20 Boko Haram members associated with Sadiku were killed and 1 other was injured by a notorious bandit leader, Dogo Gide. It was reported that the Boko Haram fighters were overpowered while trying to eliminate Dogo Gide. and his fighters.
place: Kwatankoro Forest situated between Niger and Zamfara States

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 11 bandits were killed and 85 kidnapped victims were rescued by police operatives. It was reported that some weapons were recovered from the bandits.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Aminu Kanawa, the deputy to the notorious bandits’ kingpin, Bello Turji, was killed by soldiers attached with Operation Fansan Yamma. Turji’s younger brother, Dosso was also killed in one of the raids.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP IED Explosion, Borno
description: The vice chairman of the Kawuri unit of the Civilian Joint Taskforce identified as Abba Godori lost his life after stepping on an explosive device believed to have been planted by Boko Haram or ISWAP terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened while the deceased was on a patrol in a community.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 24 top commanders of a notorious kingpin, Turji Bello were killed during an encounter with soldiers. It is believed that 12 were killed in each state (See incident in IBD031567). Some of the commanders killed were identified as Abu Dan Shehu, Jabbi Dogo, Dan Kane, Basiru Yellow, Kabiru Gebe, Bello Buba, and Dan Inna Kahon-Saniya-Yafi-Bahaushe.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , The Punch (12 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 24 top commanders of a notorious kingpin, Turji Bello were killed during an encounter with soldiers in Sokoto and Zamfara states. It is believed that 12 were killed in each state (see incident in IBD031566).
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , The Punch (12 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kogi
description: A bandit was shot dead, and 4 others were arrested by police operatives. It was reported that some weapons were recovered after the shootout.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 7 bandits were killed during a raid on their hideout by security operatives. About 109 rustled animals were recovered.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Bandits, including the son of a kingpin, Bello Turji, and his foot soldiers were killed during a raid on their hideouts by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the bandits recorded high casualties during the encounter. It is therefore assumed that over 20 bandits died.
place: Shinkafi, Kagara, Fakai, Moriki, Maiwa, and Chindo Areas
sources_of_information: The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 )

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Yobe
description: About 27 soldiers were reportedly killed after a suicide bomber drove an explosive-laden van into a military camp. This incident reportedly happened in January 2025, but no day was reported. It is therefore assumed that the incident occurred on the 15th of January.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram commanders and 67 foot soldiers were killed during a clearance operation by soldiers. 22 soldiers lost their lives in the encounter. The killed terrorist commanders were identified as Talha (Special Forces Commander), Malam Umar (Operations Commander) and Abu Yazeed (Brigade Commander).

title: Bandits Kill Medical Doctor, Katsina
description: Dr. Dandashire Murtala Sala, a medical graduate of Ahmadu Bello University, was killed by bandits. A staff of the hospital was kidnapped when the attackers raided the general hospital in Kankara.

title: Boko Haram vs Security Operatives, Borno
description: 50 men, including civilians, a joint task force, and local vigilantes were killed by Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists. It was reported that the deceased was ambushed while trying to recover the dead bodies of farmers earlier killed by the terrorists in a neighbouring community. Some soldiers and civilians were reportedly missing days after the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (50 ) , Other newspaper 3 (50 ) , Daily Trust (50 )

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 40 farmers were killed by members of the Boko Haram/Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) in an ambush. It was reported that the incident happened when the victims went to negotiate payment of levy to grant them access to their farms with another group of ISWAP fighters. Another version of the story reported that some of the victims were fishermen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 siblings were killed when Boko Haram raided their community. The attack was perpetrated when residents were still asleep. A church and residential building were looted.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, FCT (Abuja)
description: A farmer was killed and his wife was reportedly raped by suspected Fulani herders who attempted to graze on their farm. Their children escaped unhurt, but their father was macheted to death when he attempted to save them.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 25 bandits were killed by soldiers, and 7 kidnapped victims were rescued. The camp of notorious terrorist leader Bello Turji was reportedly destroyed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (25 ) , Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 ) , This Day (40 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Over a Dozen people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a community. There were no further details about this incident.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Mr. Sadiku Saleh and Mr. Aliyu Kabiru were killed by bandits who invaded their community at night. It was reported that the bandits also looted shops and houses.

title: Police Kill Bandits, Sokoto
description: A joint patrol team consisting of police officers and members of the Sokoto Community Guards foiled a banditry attack on a commercial vehicle, killed on the attackers and rescued 13 passengers on board the vehicle.
place: Kwanar Maharbar, Along the Goronyo-Sabon Birni road

title: Security Operatives vs Bandit, Katsina
description: Several bandits, including a kingpin identified as Bako Bako, were killed by a combined security force involving the Nigerian Army, Police, and others. It was reported that the incident happened at the bandits hideout. No fatality figure was reported. It is assumed that about 20 bandits were killed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 30 people, including members of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps and residents, were killed and several others were missing when gunmen invaded some communities. It was reported that the victims were returning from a condolence visit in Batasri when they were ambushed.
place: Barebari, Charanci, Burji, Jibiya , Kaita and Baure Villages
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , The Guardian (21 ) , Other newspaper 2 (21 ) , This Day (23 )

title: NAF Airstrikes, Katsina
description: About 28 people were killed when NAF bombarded a location. The victims were most officers of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps and vigilantes who were mistaken to be bandits. The victims had reported foiled an attack by bandits and were monitoring their movement from a mountainous region when they came under intense bombardment. Many were declared missing, while others were injured.

title: Soldiers vs Terrorists, Sokoto
description: 8 terrorists, including a second-in-command of a notorious kingpin of Bello Turji, identified as Aminu Kanawa (assuming that they are Lakurawa members) were killed when soldiers conducted offensives on their hideouts. Arms and ammunition were also recovered by the operatives.

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: 6 soldiers were shot dead by terrorists linked to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was reported that terrorists on trucks and motorcycles launched an attack on the military base when the soldiers were unprepared.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Daily Trust (24 ) , The Nation (34 ) , Vanguard (42 )

title: Military vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Military air components conducted air interdiction on BH/ISWAP terrorists Wiulade and killed several terrorists, an estimated 30.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 18 people lost their lives during attacks on different communities by gunmen. 9 of them were killed in a drinking joint and discovered with deep machete cuts. The killers were suspected to be carried out by members of IPOB and ESN members
place: Umukabia, Eziawa, Ihittenasa, Umuhu, Amaoku, and Amaebe, all communities
sources_of_information: The Punch (18 ) , Nigerian Tribune (18 ) , Other newspaper 2 (18 )

title: Military vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops on credible intelligence ambushed and neutralised some terrorists. It was reported that some terrorists sustained fatal injuries. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits were killed in the encounter.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit leader identified as Sani Rusu and scores of his foot soldiers were killed by troops of Operation Fansan. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire. It is assumed at least 2 scores of the bandits were killed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 4 people, including the Chairman of the Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association of Nigeria (MACBAN) identified as Amadu Surjo were killed by bandits. His second wife and daughter were abducted while several others were injured.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Vanguard (4 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 80 bandits were killed and others were injured in a joint operation by the Air Component (AC) of Operation Fansan Yamma, troops of the 17 Brigade of the Nigerian Army and other security operatives.
place: Kadoji, matso-Matso, Bagga, Dogo Market, and Takatsaba Areas

title: Lakurawa vs Police Officers, Kebbi
description: 2 police officers were shot dead by Lakurawa terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire at a checkpoint. It was also reported that the bandits rustled unspecified numbers of cows during the attack.
place: Alhaji Lawal Block Farm and a Fulani Settlement in Natsini village along the Argungu-Kangiwa Road
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several civilians and displaced villagers were killed by Boko Harm insurgents who attacked a community. There were no further details about this incident, it was assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Gunmen Kill 7, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN Sit-at-home: 2 policemen and a well-known businessman, popularly called Oluebube, were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be IPOB/Eastern Network Security members enforcing a sit-at-home order.
