The businessman was killed at his rental company site while supervising workers mounting canopies for a ceremony while the operatives were shot dead at a checkpoint.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Chieftaincy Crisis, Delta
description: One person died while three others were injured in a bloody clash arising from the conferment of a chieftaincy title on an indigene of the community. The clash was between members of opposing factions in the chieftaincy conferment.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A 7-year-old girl and 2 others were killed during a raid on their community by bandits. The attackers also rustled cows and looted local shops.
place: Kuki village, located on the Kaduna-Niger border.

title: Cattler Rustlers vs Herder, Ondo
description: Aliu Yunusa, leader of the herdsmen in the state, was killed by gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers and kidnappers. He was overpowered, and killed while trying to rescue his kidnapped wife and rustled livestock.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: One person was killed and 5 others were injured when bandits on motorcycles raided a community. 2 other indigenes were wounded in the raid.

title: DSS vs Bandits, Niger
description: 3 bandits were killed in an ambush by DSS operatives. Many others allegedly fled with gunshot injuries while three AK-47 rifles and three motorcycles were recovered.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Soldiers, Imo
description: 2 soldiers and one suspected member of IPOB/Eastern Security Network were killed in 2 separate incidents. While the officers were killed while returning from a routine operation, the IPOB members was killed during a clearance operation.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit kingpin known as Alhaji Ma’oli was killed by troops of 1 Brigade in Sector 2 Joint Task Force North West, Operation Fansan Yamma. He was reportedly responsible for imposing illegal levies on residents of some communities in the state. A source reported that many of the kingpin's supporters were killed in the encounter.
place: Maisheka village, near Kunchin Kalgo town

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Borno
description: 2 people were killed and 3 others injured in a Boko Haram suicide attack on mourners.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed by soldiers while attempting to pick ransom for 3 abducted herders. The victims were later rescued by the soldiers with the help of hunters.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Soldiers from the Joint Task Force North West Operation Fasan Yamma, destroyed several terrorist camps and killed some bandits. It is assumed that about 5 bandits lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Explosion, Niger
description: A farmer identified as Dauda Haruna was killed and 4 others, including 3 siblings, Mail (20), Nehemiah (14) and Jona (15) were injured after stepping on an explosive device planted by some bandits. It was reported that the deceased was on his way to the farm.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Vanguard (2 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 gunmen suspected to be IPOB members and 2 police officers died in a shootout. Two suspects, David Ifeanyichukwu (20) and Abuchi Joseph (24) were arrested during the operation.

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: 2 herders were killed by bandits and many cows were rustled. They attacked the Fulani settlement on motorcycles.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 suspected IPOB/ESN members were killed by soldiers who were on routine patrol. Items recovered included one AK-47 rifle, two loaded AK-47 magazines, and three Dane guns, while a house belonging to one of the IPOB commanders and a shrine used for their fortification were destroyed. The group denied that the victims were their members.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (13 ) , Daily Trust (13 )

title: Church Factional Clash, Taraba
description: Three church members, Elisha Masoyi (27) died during a clash between worshippers of the United Methodist Church in Nigeria (UMCN) and the Global Methodist Church (GMC). 7 people were arrested in connection with the crisis. It was reported that 2 of the deceased, aged 4 and 2 years were siblings who died when their home were set ablaze by some attackers.

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 suspected members of IPOB and their military wind, the Eastern Security Network (ESN), were killed during a clearance operation by Task Force members of the Operation Udoka, in conjunction with the police, army, DSS and NSCDC. 5 gunmen were arrested by the operatives.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Herders vs Youths, Gombe
description: A clash between herdsmen and youths resulted in the death of one person while several others were injured. It was reported that during the clash, several houses were set ablaze. The crisis started when youths allegedly attacked herdsmen crossing from Kuri village and killed 5 cows. The victim was identified as Ali Abubakar.

title: Explosion, Niger
description: 1 person was killed and 4 others were injured after stepping on an explosive device planted by some bandits. It was reported that the explosive device was targeted at members of the Joint Security Task-Force recently deployed to the area.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Vanguard (1 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 8 people were killed and scores abducted during a raid on some communities by bandits. Many were also injured by the attackers led by Bambara of Gidan Gamji.

title: Corpses Found, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Several decomposed bodies were recovered in shallow graves at the hideout of gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) by security operatives. It was reported that some weapons were also recovered. Due to the nature of the story, it was assumed that 10 corpses were recovered.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 40) were killed during an encounter with the personnel of the Joint Task Force North West, Operation Fansan Yamma. The operatives were invited by residents who came under attack by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Armed terrorists killed an elderly man and abducted 13 residents, including a two-month old baby and his mother. It was reported that the attackers moved swiftly, rounded up their victims and retreated into a nearby forest.

title: Suspected Herdsmen Attacks, Ogun
description: The body of a community chief, Ogunleye Olaegbe, alleged killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen, was discovered on his farmland. He was suspected to have been shot while farming on his land.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of Sector 2, Operation Hadin Kai, in collaboration with local vigilantes killed five Boko Haram members. One of the deceased was a Boko Haram commander identified as Abu Shekau.
place: Sabon Fegi community in Buni Yadi

title: Security Operatives vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Scores (assuming at least 40) of suspected IPOB and Eastern Security Network members were killed during an encounter with security operatives under Operation UdoKa. Pump-action guns, IEDs, IED-making materials and charms were reportedly recovered from the victims.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers and 5 Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed during a shootout. The insurgents reportedly fled a Chadian military offensive and took refuge in remote villages within Kukawa after forcing residents to flee.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Abia
description: ESN/IPOB: Troops of the Joint Task Force in the South East, Operation UDOKA, killed 8 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and its armed affiliate, the Easter Security Network (ESN).
place: Umudi and Imuezeosuru Forest in Umuaku

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were decimated by the Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). Their food depot and enclave were destroyed. It was reported that the air strikes wiped out the sanctuary of the terrorist commanders and fighters.
place: Jubilaram in the Tumbuns area of Lake Chad Basin

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: The body of 9 bandits who might have been neutralized by security operatives were found in a community. It was reported that the bodies were found in two locations.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 13 people were killed in an ambush by bandits. It was reported that the bandits had been terrorising and kidnapping members of the community.

title: Gunmen vs Lawyer, Benue
description: A lawyer and an activist identified as Mike Ofikwu was shot dead by some unknown gunmen. He was attacked at his residence just after coming back from work.
place: Otupa Street in Otukpo Town, Idomaland

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: A 34-year-old suspected bandit drowned after an attack on the family of Nura Musa. He fell inside a deep well and died while trying to flee with his accomplices after the attack.

title: Gunmen Kill Policemen, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen were killed during an attack at a police checkpoint. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the killers were members of the Eastern Security Network, the militia wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram and Islamic State's West Africa Province terrorists attacked troops of the Nigerian Army and killed 5 soldiers. It was reported that 10 soldiers were wounded while 4 were declared missing. It was reported that troops also killed many of the terrorists. It is assumed that the troops killed 20 terrorists.

title: NSCDC vs Boko Haram, Kaduna
description: A special squad of the NSCDC ambushed and neutralized 59 Boko Haram terrorists. The convoy of the special monitoring squad comprising of 9 officers and 71 other ranks, drawn from the Commandant General Special Intelligence Squad (CG SIS) operatives, FCT and Kaduna State commands was conducting a patrol of the national grid installation in Shiroro LGA when they came in contact with the terrorists.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Anambra State Vigilante was killed and others were injured by gunmen suspected to be members of the Idengious People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened during the enforcement of the Monday sit-at-home order in the state.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 members of the Anambra State Vigilante were killed and 2 others, including the President General Of Ukpo town, were injured by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened during the enforcement of the Monday sit-at-home order in the state.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: About 20 soldiers were killed in an attack on a military camp by Islamic State fighters. The attack, which included a suicide bomber in a car, led to the destruction of a military vehicles.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Taraba
description: A farmer identified as Wanda Maibultu was killed and 6 others were kidnapped by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims were attacked while they were working on their farm.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits, including key loyalties identified as Dan-Isuhu and Dogo Sule and some leaders, were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the terrorists were intercepted at their hideout while planning to launch an attack military targets. Due to the story, it was assumed that 50 terrorists were killed in the operation.

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: A vigilante member was killed and 4 family members, including a father, mother, and their two children were abducted by bandits.

title: Gunmen vs Soldier, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 soldiers of the 14 Brigade were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire at an army checkpoint.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Mr. Garba Aliyu was shot dead by gunmen on motorcycles. The attackers went straight into his house where they shot him for feeding security agencies with information on their operations.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 hunters were shot dead and 3 herders were abducted by suspected bandits. The victims were returning from hunting when they were ambushed. Another version stated that 3 of the victims were 3 bandits killed by soldiers.

title: Banditry Katsina
description: Terrorists killed 2 people and abducted more than 30 others in two communities. It was reported that 25 people, including women and children, were abducted while dozens sustained injuries.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 people were killed and dozens of fishermen were kidnapped by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.
place: Malamyawri, Cross Kawu Ward, near Lake Chad

title: Mob vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 corpses of bandits were set ablaze by a mob. It was reported that soldiers had raided the hideouts of some bandits , killed 3 and rescued 6 villagers who were abducted.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Three bandits with wielding sophisticated weapons invaded a Fulani settlement and attempted to rustle over 100 cows belonging to one Alhaji Wakili Ibrahim. 3 of them were killed by soldiers.

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai killed many Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at destroying the terrorists.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Katsina
description: 2 security operatives, including a member of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps and a Vigilante member, were killed and 5 others were injured by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.
place: Kaída, Unguwar One Boy, and Danmark quarters in Jibia Town

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network were shot dead by security operatives comprising the Nigerian Army, the Police, and the DSS personnel. 2 security were injured.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Corpses of 2 bandits believed to have been shot be soldiers were discovered inside a forest. Soldiers raided a hideout used by the bandits to carry out on some communities. This incident is backdated by 2 days of the report since no date was reported.

title: Bomb Explosion, Imo
description: 2 people were killed while others were injured in a bomb explosion that happened in a market. The victims were the hoodlums who attempted to set up the Improvised Explosive Device (IED).

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Niger
description: 10 farmers, including 2 women, were killed by bandits. Six of them were beheaded and their heads were taken away. Many people sustained bullet wounds during the attack. The women refused to be raped and were killed. The incident happened when the victims were observing their early morning prayers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Nation (10 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 5 bandits, including one of their leaders, Kachalla, were killed by troops attached to the Forward Operating Base (FOB) of Operation Safe Haven. It was reported that the incident happened in the afternoon.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 terrorists were killed by Chadian soldiers during an exchange of gunfire. It was reported that some fishermen were also killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 loggers were killed and others were injured when a pickup van transporting them drove over an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Boko Haram insurgents.
place: Masunfanari and Dogo Wire Village along Maiduguri/Damboa

title: Army vs Bandits, Borno
description: Several terrorists were decimated during series of air strike targeting three significant enclaves of Islamic West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The precision strikes focused on the strongholds of the terrorists. It is assumed that 2 dozens were killed in the encounter.
place: Tumbun Daribiyar, Jubularam, Buluwa and Tumbu Karfe

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits roaming the area where Shiroro-Kaduna transmission line is located were killed by NAF operatives who were deployed to provide cover for electricity workers repairing the line. It was reported that the bandits were planning to wreck havoc on the critical facilities and possibly kill the electricity workers before they were neutralised.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Nation (40 )

title: NAF vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: About 99 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed by NAF. The victims were part of the 169 terrorists that were killed in a joint military offensive on terrorist camps in Kwallaram and Arianna. See event in IBD031186.
sources_of_information: The Nation (99 ) , The Guardian (99 ) , The Punch (99 ) , Other newspaper 3 (50 )

title: Terrorists vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 13 vigilantes were killed by terrorists when they tried to invade a community. It was reported that the bandits also abducted commuters from fiver vehicles during the incident.

title: Police vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: 6 bandits were killed and some weapons were recovered by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire with the operatives.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 3 bandits lost their lives during a clash between some members of vigilante/security operatives and bandits in a community. It was reported that 1 vigilante member was killed during the attack.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Imo State Police Command killed one IPOB/ESN member, foiled a violent attack by the same group and recovered one AK 47 riffle with 15 rounds of live ammunition.
place: along the Owerri/Aba Road near Owerri Airport

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Sokoto
description: 4 farmers were killed and 4 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the farmers were ambushed on their way to the farms.

title: Cult Killing, Edo
description: 8 people were killed during a clash between rival cult groups. It was reported that the incident happened while the group was trying to resolve a crisis during a meeting.
place: Tipper garage in the Idogbo area of Upper Sokponba Road
sources_of_information: Vanguard (8 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead and 4 farmers were rescued by some soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened in a forest during an exchange of gunfire between the bandits.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Kebbi
description: A clash between farmers and herders claimed a life while one other person was injured. The crisis started when the some cows were seen eating crops belonging to Hausa farmers.

title: Bandits Kill 4 Officers, Katsina
description: Bandits attacked a police base and killed 4 officers and 2 other people. It was reported that one officer sustained injury during the attack.
place: Mobile Police base in Garagi, Yartsamiyar Jino village

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of 82 Division Nigerian Army and the Joint Task Force South-East code-named Operation Udoka killed scores of fighters of the Eastern Security Network. The incident happened when the troops invaded the camp of the armed groups.

title: IPOB/ESN Kill 2, Abia
description: Armed masked men in black shirts and trousers with hoods suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra killed two people while enforcing a sit-at-home order. One of the victims was identified as caretaker of a nearby house.
place: around Old Express off Sameck junction, near a popular slaughter within the area

title: Bandits vs Army, Zamfara
description: 5 bandit members were killed and 1 other, identified as Lieutenant Rambo was injured by the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire with the bandits at their hideouts.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 2 travellers when they shot at moving vehicles. They also kidnapped the Zamfara State Coordinator of the Revenue Mobilisation Allocation and Fiscal Commission (RMAFC), Alhaji Bashir Abara Gummi and several others.

title: Bandits Kill Villagers, Niger
description: A driver, a girl, and one other person identified as Alhaji Ibrahim were killed during an attack by bandits. The victims were passengers in a car heading to a market.
place: Bangi and Kotonkoro community in Mariga
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: A woman identified as Lami was killed by bandits after collecting a ransom from the family. It was reported that the deceased and her husband, Yakubu Dada, were kidnapped some months ago by the bandits who invaded a community.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 3 residents, including Rabe Mai Shayi, were killed by bandits during a foiled kidnap incident. Some kidnapped victims were rescued by the police.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Katsina
description: Bandits attacked a village and killed 2 people, including a member of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps (KSCWC). They also abducted 13 people, including women and children.

title: Bandits vs Herders, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed two herders and rustled several cows and sheep. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning when a large number of bandits invaded a Fulani settlement and gunned down the victims on the spot.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the deceased were Red Cross members who were working in a community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers gunned down two bandits while they were attempting to collect N1.5 million ransom for four abducted victims. It was reported that the soldiers later rescued the abducted victims.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A man, his son and 3 others were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Others were injured while others were displaced to nearby communities.

title: Gunmen vs Security Personnel, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A severe clash between security personnel and gunmen left many people dead and others injured. It was reported that the incident happened when security personnel were ambushed by the gunmen believed to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
place: Aba branch area of Ehime Mbano

title: Inferno, Delta
description: 1 person was killed and several others were injured in an explosion at a dump site. It was reported that the explosion emanated from an improvised explosive device used by one of the scavengers at the site.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 person was killed while two others were injured when Boko Haram terrorists attacked a community. It was reported that a Cameroonian soldier under the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) got missing during the incident.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Mr. Istifanus Mallo, Mr. Innocent Istifanus Mallo, and Lois Istifanus were killed and 4 others were injured by suspected bandits. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening.

title: Gunmen vs SuperSports Crew, Anambra
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) ambushed crew members of SuperSport. A cameraman, a police officer and a bus driver were killed. The victims were travelling from Lagos to Uyo when the incident happened.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed a commercial driver and 8 personnel of the Zamfara State Community Guards (CPG) known as Askarawa. The victims were ambushed near a checkpoint.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Vanguard (9 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 11 people were killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded some communities in the morning. It was reported that several others were abducted.
place: Kukasheka, Ammararwa, Dan Gani, and Tudu Villages

title: Bandit vs District Head, Kebbi
description: A District Head identified as Alhaji Isah Daya was killed by bandits. It was reported that the deceased was abducted a few days before his death.

title: Political Crisis, Rivers
description: A life was lost during the post-Local Government Area election violence that erupted between factions loyal to Governor Sim Fubara and FCT Minister, Nyesom Wike. The victim was killed on the road leading to the Rector of Ken Saro-Wiwa Polytechnic lodge.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Political Crisis, Rivers
description: A life was lost during the post-Local Government Area election violence that erupted between factions loyal to Governor Sim Fubara and FCT Minister, Nyesom Wike.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers, 2 members of Civilian JTF and a son of a Village Head in Marte, Mai Musenima, were reportedly killed when Boko Haram ambushed a military convoy. The victims were among those deployed to provide security cover along Dikwa- Marte road.

title: Bandits vs APC Chairman, Kebbi
description: Bandits killed the All Progressives Congress chairman of Suru Local Government Area, Alhaji Bako Bala, in his hometown. The circumstances surrounding the killing was not stated.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of The Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) was killed and 4 kidnapped victims were rescued by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened at the terrorist's hideout.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Katsina
description: Three members of a vigilance group were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits ambushed the security agents, killed the three and injured one.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 10 Boko Haram militants were killed by troops of Operation Lafiya Dole, 159 Battalion led by Lt. Col. Sadiq Rikoto. It was reported that the troops ambushed the terrorists who were planning to attack a community.

title: Bandits vs Security Agents, Katsina
description: 9 security operatives were killed while 1 was injured by bandits. It was report that victims were members of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps and Vigilante Corps. The victims were identified as Mubarak Shuaibu Labo, Muhammad Hassn, Mubarak Shuaibu, Babangida Doza, Ibrahim Rishi and others.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed and 7 kidnapped victims were rescued by soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened during a raid by the soldiers on the bandit's camp.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A violent clash between rival bandit groups led to the death of 20 prominent leaders and followers of the bandits. It was reported that the battle started as a result of territorial battle between the bandit groups in a community. The bandits engaged in prolong gun battle during the clash.

title: Soldiers Kill Bandit, Kaduna
description: Soldiers gunned down a suspected bandit while attempting to evade arrest. It was reported that the suspected bandits had been declared wanted by the troops over a month.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Boy, Edo
description: A young boy was kidnapped and killed by some Fulani herdsmen after ransom was paid. Youths in the community tracked and caught the perpetrators who confessed to have killed many other people in similar circumstances. It was reported that a youth was shot dead by the police as youths protested the freeing of the Fulani perpetrator. The incident caused the youths to burn down the police station and properties belonging to the Fulanis. The youths also killed some of the perpetrator during the reaction.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 5 farmers were killed and 15 others were abducted by Boko Haram members who invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased were attacked while working on their farm. A Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) member, Jubril Zarana who participated with the security agents to foil the attack was also killed.

title: Suspected Herdsmen Attacks, Benue
description: 37 motorcyclists and a teacher were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. They were killed in ambushes along a busy expressway.The incident happened in the past 2 months. This incident is therefore spread within a month.

title: Mob vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits' corpses were set ablaze by some mob members in a community. It was reported that the corpses of the bandits were found by some hunters while raiding a forest.

title: Bandits Kills 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people, including the candidate of the PDP in Pari Ward of Kauru identified as Mr. Raymond Timothy, and his brother, James Timothy were killed by bandits. It was reported that the deceased was attacked while returning from a political campaign.

title: Troops vs Terrorists, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead and some weapons were recovered by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during an operation at the hideout of the bandits.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident during a raid on their hideout.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 kidnap victims lost their lives during a rescue operation by security operatives. They were shot by their abductors and died before rescue. 6 others were rescued by the operatives.
place: Funua-Gusau Road at Unguwar Boka village

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during an operation strike in a forest.

title: Banditry, Zamafara
description: 2 people, including Malam Isah and a teenage boy, were killed and 40 others were abducted by gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Troops vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: A notorious bandit was shot dead and 22 cattle rustlers were arrested by troops of the Nigeria Army in an operation in a community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed two bandit kingpins, Sani Black and Kachalla Makore. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents in neighbouring communities before they were neutralised.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Troops Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJFT repelled an attack by Boko Haram terrorist, killing 5 and injuring others.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram/ISWAP Terrorist, Borno
description: A Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorist was shot dead and 16 kidnapped victims were rescued by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists were trying to escape with some kidnapped victims.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Troops vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Yobe
description: 4 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed and some weapons were recovered by soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened during an ambush at the terrorist's hideout.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram/ISWAP Terrorists, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed and some weapons were recovered by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the terrorists were ambushed while planning to raid some villages. It is assumed that the incident occurred in Gwoza since no village was listed.

title: Bandits vs Imam, FCT (Abuja)
description: An Imam identified as Ahmad Maidara was shot dead and a transporter, Alhaji Salisu Danfulani was abducted by some bandits who invaded a Mosque. It was reported that the incident happened in the night after prayer.

title: ISWAP Fighters Drown, Yobe
description: 17 members of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) drowned while attempting to cross a river between Nigeria and Niger Republic. The terrorists were caught by strong wave currents which swept them away.
place: between Kafetoa and Bulabulin Gaidam communities

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Kachalla Tukur Sharme, a notorious bandit commander who was linked to the kidnap of 121 Bethel Baptist High School pupils in Kaduna State and 2 members of another group were killed in a rival violent clash.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Bandits vs Army, Zamfara
description: A soldier lost his life while four others survived an ambush by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the soldiers were ambushed by the bandits.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: 2 vigilante members were shot dead by bandits who invaded a Fulani settlement in a community in an attempt to rustle some cows. It was reported that some foodstuffs were stolen during the attack.
place: Gidan-Kaura Community, Aturu and Mai-Ido Villages

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: Suspected bandits shot dead two farmers and escaped with their motorcycles. The incident happened when the bandits were escaping after soldiers raided their camp and rescued 13 abducted victims.

title: Bandits vs Army, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed two bandits and recovered weapons during an operation aimed at clearing out the hoodlums. The troops laid ambush for the terrorists who were moving along a road and engaged them in a fierce gun battled.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed and 20 kidnapped victims were rescued by troops of Sector 6 Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the incident happened during a patrol on the terrorist route.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Three policemen were killed members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), the militia arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The incident happened when the miscreants were enforcing the Monday sit-at-home in the community.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 gunmen were killed while several others were injured when the Local Government Divisional Police Headquarters was attacked by members of Eastern Security Network, the militia arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The corpses of 2 bandits were set ablaze by a mob. The victims were injured in an encounter with soldiers and were later found dead in a forest.

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed while 30 others including the Pastor were kidnapped when bandits attacked the church during a Sunday worship service.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: 3 bandits were killed and 3 others were arrested by soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire in a forest.

title: Gunmen vs Market Leader, Enugu
description: Stephen Aniagu, the Chairman of the Ogbete Main Market Traders Association (OMATA) was shot dead by unknown gunmen who operated in a Toyota Corolla car. They stole the victim's Toyota Corolla vehicle. 2 suspected, Chukwudi Aboshi and Ani Innocent Ebuka, were arrested in connection with the murder.
place: Moses Ogbodo junction near Topland Market in Amaechi area
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Witchcraft, Adamawa
description: 3 people, including Lazaruz Bashiru, Galion Isa, and Ajasko Yakubu were tortured to death by a female herbalist, Salestina Bala (30), and others. It was reported that the deceased were accused of witchcraft.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 38 bandits, including a notorious kingpin identified as Halilu Sububu were killed by Troops of Operation HADARIN DAJI of the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the incident happened during a follow-up exploitation mission by the troops.
sources_of_information: The Punch (39 ) , Other newspaper 2 (39 ) , Daily Trust (39 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: Operatives of the Department of State Services (DSS) killed two bandits and arrested many others on the outskirts of the community.
place: Hayin-Nasara community, off the Abuja-Kaduna highway,

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 soldiers and 5 policemen attached as orderlies to a road construction company, Satraco Nigeria Limited were killed by bandits. They were escorting foreign engineers when the bandits struck. It was also reported that 4 others and some bandits were killed in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Security Operatives vs Boko Haram, Niger
description: Security operatives killed 28 suspected Boko Haram terrorists in a community. The incident happened when the terrorists invaded the community in the early hours of the day and started shooting sporadically. It was reported that a woman and a little girl were shot on the mouth while two boys were shot on their hands when the terrorists were escaping.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (14 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (28 ) , Nigerian Tribune (28 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed by troops who were returning from an operation. It was reported that the bandits were caught while trying to invade a herder's settlement in the community.

title: Gas Explosion, Ebonyi
description: Mrs. Chioma and her husband, George Buchi were killed in a gas explosion. There were also suspicion that the explosion could have emanated from a solar light battery or an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted in the house. The woman was the sister of a popular musician, Partoranking.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 bandits were neutralised and 4 abducted victims were rescued by soldiers who raided a bandits' camp in a forest. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops, led by two hunters, stormed the forest to dislodge the bandits who have been menacing the neighbourhood.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, FCT (Abuja)
description: 5 bandits were killed by security operatives. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire with security operatives.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A vigilante member identified as Marcus was shot dead and 3 farmers were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening.

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: 5 people lost their lives while many others were kidnapped after bandits attacked a community. The victims were Garkuwa Alfarma, Buhari Maidiga, Uba Auta, Yakubu Thomas Gaku, and Atabata Naallah.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: One person was killed and 6 others were kidnapped when bandits raided a community. It was reported that 2 nurses and an unspecified number of patients were kidnapped at the health center in the community.
place: Bakin Pah in the Maro Ward
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: One person was killed and 4 others were kidnapped by bandits. The attackers operated for about 30-minutes before leaving the area.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed and several others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Police vs Bandit, Kebbi
description: 1 bandit was killed and 2 others were arrested with some weapons by security operatives. It was reported that the bandits were caught while running away after kidnapping someone.

title: Vigilante Kills IPOB Coordinator, Anambra
description: IPOB: One of the Coordinators of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Mazi Emeka Akubuo, was killed by the Anambra Vigilante Group (AVG).

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed security operatives and set the several office buildings ablaze. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 people were killed in the incident which happened at night.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Niger
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members beheaded two farmers during an attack on a community. The insurgents were part of the terrorists fleeing from the war against insurgency by over 200 local vigilantes who are targeting their hideouts.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB: A police corporal was killed when gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra attacked a police station in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the militant arm of the group identified as Eastern Security Network threw petrol bomb at a civic centre and a police station, causing the death of the personnel.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 11 people were killed and large farmlands were destroyed by gunmen who invaded two communities. It was reported that the attackers were Fulani herders.

title: Gunmen vs Policeman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A police officer was killed in his house located in a community. It was reported that the gunmen entered the compound where the victim was living and identified him amidst student nurses residing in the same place. They slaughtered him with a knife.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: An armed bandit was killed by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire between the police.

title: Hunters vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by local hunters. It was reported that the deceased were caught while trying to abduct some farmers in the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram/ISWAP Terrorists, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed by Troops of the Joint Task Force Operation Hadin Kai and 192 Battalion. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandit informants were killed by soldiers. It was reported that the deceased were caught while trying to escape after they were arrested.

title: Soldiers Kill Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers gunned down three bandits and also rescued four victims abducted by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 herders were shot dead while 132 cows were rustled when bandits raided a settlement. The victims were killed when they tried to stop the attackers from moving the cows away.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed many villagers, mainly farmers and worshippers, and set their houses and shops ablaze. The incident happened in the evening when residents were returning from their farms.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (34 ) , The Punch (34 ) , Nigerian Tribune (100 ) , The Nation (34 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (80 ) , Other newspaper 2 (125 ) , The Guardian (102 ) , Other newpapers 1 (34 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (127 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: About 76 terrorists were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army. The troops also arrested many of the terrorists.

title: Youths vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The corpse of a bandit was set ablaze by some youths in a community. It was reported that the deceased was arrested and shot dead by local hunters in a forest.

title: Boko Haram vs Students, Yobe
description: 3 students identified as Shaheed Ahmed Abdurraham(22), Shaheed Muhammad Saleh(21), and Shaheed Abudllahi Unguwar Karau Kawo(21) were killed and 1 other, Sani Haruna (25) was injured by suspected Boko haram members who invaded a school belonging to the Islamic Movement in Nigeria(IMN). It was reported that the incident happened at midnight.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: A man identified as Felix Chuks was killed and his wife and kids were abducted by gunmen suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the deceased residents at midnight.
place: Zone A, back of Primary School, in Ushafa in Bwari Council

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 8 bandits during clearance operation. It was reported that the troops engaged and neutralised the bandits and recovered three AK-47 riffles, eight magazines (4 empty and 4 loaded with a total of 120 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition) and magazin carrier.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Army Kills 1, Kaduna
description: Soldiers killed a notorious insurgent leader and inflicted injuries on his members who fled with gunshot wounds. It was reported that the army recovered weapons and equipment from the bandits.

title: Residents vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 37 bandits were killed during a clash between villagers and bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village but were ambushed and overpowered by the villagers. It was also reported that 3 villagers were killed during the clash.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people were shot dead by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that 160 cows were rustled by the bandits.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Niger
description: A clash between some villagers and suspected Fulani herdsmen resulted in the killing of no fewer than fiver persons from both warring sides. The incident started when a prominent farmer, Sule Mohammed, went to his farm with his son and discovered that cows had invaded and eaten up his crops. He was killed when he complained to Fulani herders.

title: Soldier vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead and 1 informant was arrested by soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened in a village where the bandits were hiding.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division Nigerian Army killed one terrorist and recovered 4 AK-47 magazine. The incident happened when the troops were on a clearance operation. Some of the terrorists fled with gunshot injuries.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Kaduna
description: A vigilante member identified as Saleh Aliyu was shot dead and 4 farmers were abducted by gunmen. It was reported that the victims were attacked while returning from their farms.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Airstrikes by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai killed scores of terrorists and destroyed their logistics bases. The incident happened during a clearance operations. It is believed that at least 2 scores were killed.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: Boko Haram killed 4 farmers in a border town. It was reported that the farmers were working on their farmlands when they were attacked and killed by the terrorists.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 27 gunmen including some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra(IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by security operatives. It was reported that the incident happened at the hideout of the terrorists.
place: New Artisan Market, Akwuke community, Akegbe-Ugwu, Four Corners, Awgu, Mgbowo, Emene, Eke and Afa in Udi
sources_of_information: The Punch (27 ) , The Guardian (27 ) , Vanguard (27 ) , The Nation (30 )

title: Bandits Kill Farmers, Niger
description: 13 farmers were killed by gunmen who attacked them while they were working. It was reported that the victims were in their farms when barbaric bandits attacked them.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (13 ) , The Guardian (13 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits, assuming no fewer than 10, were killed in NAF airstrikes on their strongholds.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 suspected bandits were killed by soldiers while a pregnant woman and her 2 kids were rescued. The woman and her kids were returning from farm when they were abducted.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army raided bandit's hideout and found the body of police officer who was abducted by the hoodlums. It was reported that 15 bandits were killed during the clash while three soldiers were confirmed dead in the incident.

title: Herders vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Two herders were shot dead and several cows and sheep rustled after bandits invaded a herders’ camp.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 people were killed and 5 others were injured by bandits who invaded a community.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 policemen were killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that policemen were conducting a stop-and-search at a checkpoint when the gunmen ambushed them.

title: NAF vs Boko Harm, Borno
description: 40 Boko Haram members, including some commanders, Munzir Arika, Sani Dilla (Dan Hausawan Jubillaram), Ameer Modu, Dan Fulani Fari Fari, and Bakoura Arina Chiki were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the incident happened at the camp of the terrorists.
place: Arina Area, located at the Southern Tumbuns
sources_of_information: The Punch (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army on Operation Forest Sanity thwarted an attack on a community by some terrorists. It was reported that the troops on patrol killed 2 of the terrorists and recovered one AK-47 rifle, one AK-47 magazine loaded with 23 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition and 11 motorcycles during the incident.

title: Army vs Boko Haram Commander, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed Boko Haram terrorists, including a commander identified as Abu Rajab during a raid on the terrorists' enclave. They recovered two AK-47 rifles and mobile phones.
place: Bula Daloye area of the Sambisa Forest

title: Gunmen vs Project Coordinator, Nasarawa
description: A man identified as Hassan Yayaya Egwa was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the deceased was a Fadama III project coordinator in the state.

title: Boko Haram Kills 2, Yobe
description: 2 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorist who invaded 4 communities with a ward. It was reported that the insurgents also displaced about 475 households during the attacks.

title: Police vs Truck Driver, Abia
description: A truck driver identified as Samuel Chinedu Ukwu(62) was shot dead by a police officer. It was reported that the incident happened when 2 teams of police shot at each other with one team thinking that the other was members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. Another version stated that the assailant was killed by unidentified assailants.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A grandmother, Binta Malam Danladi, was killed while 13 others were missing after gunmen invaded a community. It was reported that the grandmother was murdered while she was protecting her grandson.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: 2 drivers were killed and scores of passengers were abducted by bandits who attacked some vehicles.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 5 Boko Haram member during a clearance operation. They recovered 2 Rocket Propel Gun (RPG), bombs, two Dane guns and one RPG bomb charger.

title: Bandits Kill Farm Manager, Niger
description: Bandits raided two farmhouses and killed a farm manager. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day. They also abducted three staff that work with the farm.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A captain in the Nigerian Army identified as Ibrahim Yohana was killed by some bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A farmer was killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded a community in the evening. It was reported that many cattle were being taken away by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A farmer was killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded some communities in the evening. It was reported that many cattle were being taken away by the bandits.
place: Durgu, Bobi, Kurigi, Wamba, Mongoro, Igwama and Kasuwan-Garba Communities

title: Bandit vs Army, Sokoto
description: Bandits ambushed soldiers on patrol and killed 4 of them. It was reported that two others were injured during the attack. The bandits also burnt their patrol vehicles.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Mark Hussaini was shot dead by bandits who invaded a community. He was attacked on his farm.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen attacked policemen who were on duty at a checkpoint. The policemen on duty tried to confront the gunmen when one of them threw an improvised explosive device at the police team, killing one of the policemen died instantly.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Two people were killed and their vehicles burnt after they were looted by Boko Haram insurgents. Seven passengers were abducted in separate attacks.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 6 suspected bandits were killed during a gun duel. 220 rustled cows were recovered from the rustlers. 3 corpses of the bandits were later found a few days after the incident in the forest and it was set ablaze.

title: Banditry, Benue
description: 15 people and two police officers were killed in an attack by bandits. It was reported that the attackers who came in large number shot sporadically at residents, killing their victims and injuring many.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (41 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , The Punch (50 ) , Daily Trust (74 ) , Other newspaper 2 (75 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people including a village head identified as Chief Emmanuel Idani and Mr Paschal Eze were shot dead and 14 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits' informants were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the army recovered a motorcycle and drugs from the hoodlums. The incident happened in the morning.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided some communities, killed 6 and abducted 26 others. Many residents deserted the affected communities.
place: Sabon Gida Libere, Ungwan Ganye, Ungwan Nabara, and Kadi communities

title: Bandits Kill Man, Katsina
description: Mallam Garba who took the demanded ransom for his daughter’s release by himself to the kidnappers was taken captive and his daughter was released after collecting the ransom. He was later killed.

title: Soldiers vs Kidnappers, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits who attempted to kidnap passengers were killed by soldiers on patrol. The attackers had wanted to abduct passengers of a bus which broke down along the expressway.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) and Boko Haram were killed and others were injured during a clash. It was reported that the Bakoura aka (Abu Umaima) led by JAS Buduma fighters launched a surprise attack on the camp of ISWAP.

title: Gunmen Kill 7, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 7 community leaders were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be IPOB/ESN (Eastern Security Network) members. They were rounded up during a meeting. 3 people were injured.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Vanguard (7 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Bandits Kill Farmers, Sokoto
description: 8 farmers were killed while working on their farms by cross borders fleeing bandits from the Republic of Mali. They also rustled at least 1,260 domestic animals comprising 260 cows, 1,000 sheep, and goats belonging to people in Gudu communities.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several fighters of the Boko Haram terrorist group were decimated during air raids by the fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force. The jets fired at the improvised explosive device factory of the terrorists and their hideouts. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed in the attack.

title: Political Crisis, Kano
description: 10 people were killed and 7 others were injured during a protest about #End Bad Governance by some youths.

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: A hunter identified as Samari Yakubu was captured and beheaded by bandits. He left home for hunting in a forest but never came home, His headless corpse was found riddled with bullets.

title: Protesters vs Security Operatives, Borno
description: Hunger and Bad Governance Protest: 4 workers of Kime Filling Station were allegedly killed by security operatives who had fired grenade and tear gas canisters on protesters against hunger and bad governance in Nigeria. Some reporters blamed the attack on Boko Haram insurgents while many others blame it on NSCDC and police officers. 7 people were reported to have been injured.
place: Kime Filling Station , around Bolori Junction, Maiduguri
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide attack at a local tea joint claimed 19 lives and left over 20 others injured. The attacker was among the dead.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (19 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (16 ) , Other newspaper 3 (19 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by soldiers while attempting to steal cows in a community. It was reported that the corpses of the deceased were set ablaze by some mob.

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN Sit-At-Home: A man was shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened during the enforcement of the sit-at-home order in the state.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed and 1 other was injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the night. 20 others were abducted during the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Gunmen, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) was shot dead by soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened during the enforcement of a sit-at-home order in the state. It was also reported that 1 security personnel was injured.
place: Enugu-Aba-Port Harcourt Expressway at Arise and Shine Junction by Umuosu
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN Sit-At-Home: 5 people, including police officers and a POS operator, were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra(IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the police officers were ambushed while on duty in a mechanic village. It was also reported that Simon Ekpa, a Biafra agitator, sponsored the killing.
place: Onitsha Road, AA Rano and Gbobal fuel station, Irete Village
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: The senior accounting officer of the Education Department of Damboa LGA, Shettima Mustapha, was killed and others were injured in an explosion. It was reported that the victim's vehicle stumbled on Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) planted by Boko Haram terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A police officer and a female civilian were lost as policemen repelled an attack by Boko Haram terrorists at Jakana Police Barracks. A police patrol van was burnt by the attackers.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Corpse Found, Kaduna
description: 2 corpses of bandits were found in a forest. It was reported that the deceased were suspected to be bandits who escaped during a military invasion in their camps.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram/Islamic State West Africa Province terrorists were killed during a counter-terrorism/counter-insurgency operation by troops from the 151 Battalion, in conjunction with Hybrid/Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). It was reported that some weapons were recovered during the operation.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 6 bandits were killed by police operatives of the JTF group. It was reported that the operatives engaged the victims in a gun duel during a raid on their camp.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Security operatives comprising the military and vigilantes neutralised some bandits in a village. It was reported that the bandits were crossing from one village to another in their large numbers when the security operatives ambushed them. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed. Troops recovered 125 assorted weapons and 1,522 assorted ammunition such as 41 AK47 rifles, one PKT gun, 24 locally fabricated guns, 28 Dane guns, one pump action gun and 755 rounds of 7.62mm special ammo from the bandits.
place: Kundu village along the Zungeru-Tegina road
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (101 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (100 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed in a gun duel with soldiers. 5 abducted victims were rescued by the operatives.

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised 13 Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists. They also recovered seven AK47 rifles, five fabricated rifles, one PKT gun, 143 rounds of 7.62mm special ammo, 94 rounds of 7.62mm NATO, four magazines, four motorcycles and one mobile phone amongst others.

title: Gunmen vs Student, Ondo
description: A student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba identified as Emmanuel was shot dead by some gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened at night in the deceased hostel.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The bodies of 8 bandits killed by troops of the Nigerian Army were found in a forest. It was reported that the bandits were killed when the troops raided bandits' hideouts.

title: Bandits Kill 18, Benue
description: Bandits invaded a community at night and butchered 18 villagers. It was reported that the bandits assembled the victims in a place and shot them dead.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: Operatives of the Benue State police command killed 3 suspected bandits during an intense gun battle. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising some communities.
place: Mbafyan area of Mbachir Council Ward

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 11 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that many others were abducted.

title: Bandits vs Chief, Kaduna
description: Gunmen shot dead the Village Head of Kurmin Kare, Ishaya Barnabas, and abducted 3 residents.The atatckers invaded the community on motorcycles and headed to the chief's house where they shot him before proceeding to a neighbour's house.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Suspected bandits killed one person and abducted four others. The victims were returning from their farms when they were attacked by the bandits.

title: Hunters vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed when hunters attacked bandits in their hideout. It was reported that the villagers later burnt the corpse of the bandit.

title: Gunmen vs Farmer, Kaduna
description: A ginger farmer identified as Alhaji Awwalu was shot dead by bandits. It was reported that the bandits who came on motorbikes went to the farmers house and shot him before proceeding to another community where they abducted 6 family members.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that several others were abducted.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 men were killed and 150 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. Some of the victims were identified as Sabiu Daudu, Haruna Akyarkyara, Abdulmutallib Rabiu, Bashar Idris, and Zaharaddeen Aliyu. Many people were injured in the attack.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 1 person was shot dead by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that many others were abducted.

title: NAF VS Terrorists, Kaduna
description: Some terrorists were decimated when Nigerian Air Force (NAF) bombed their hideout. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at ridding some communities of the terrorists. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 )

title: NAF VS Terrorists, Kaduna
description: Some terrorists were decimated when Nigerian Air Force (NAF) bombed their hideout. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at ridding some communities of the terrorists. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 )

title: Bandits Kill Farmers, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot 2 farmers dead and abducted 4 others, including a woman, for failing to pay the N100,000 tax that will grant them access to their farms.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 11 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that several others were abducted.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 people identified as Bala Ruhuwie, Gawah Gudu, and Naágo were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased were attacked while returning from a function in a neighboring community.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A policeman and a security guard, Alhaji Isiya Lalan, were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the son of the security guard was abducted.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 suspected Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed by troops of Sector 3 of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF). Assorted arms and ammunition were recovered from the extremists.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits
description: 2 bandits were killed by vigilantes and hunters while they were attempting to rustle cows belonging to one Alhaji Rabilu. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening when the bandits wielding sophisticated weapons invaded the livestock farm.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Vigilante, Imo
description: Three members of a vigilante group were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that a teenage girl was also shot dead by the attackers while another person was injured.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed while 19 others were abducted by the bandits who stormed a community. During the incident, one of the bandits was killed by residents.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed and 22 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 11 Islamic State West African State (ISWAP) terrorists were killed by soldiers during an operation. Arms and ammunition, including 99 rounds of 7.62 x 54mm on metal link, 19 rounds of 7.62 x 39mm, three AK-47 rifle magazines, two 36 Hand grenades, and two locally made guns, were recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai eliminated several terrorists in an aerial bombardment of their hideouts. It was reported that the hideouts were located near some mountains. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.
place: Degbewa and Chinene in Mandara mountains

title: Bandits Kill Lecturer, Katsina
description: Dr. Tiri David, a lecturer with the Federal University Dutsinma, FUDMA, in Katsina State, was killed in an attack on his community. His 2 daughters were also abducted.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed while trying to abduct some villagers. They had earlier abducted 3 people before the villagers resisted.
place: Rugar Sojidi, a Fulani settlement near Issan Makaranta

title: Soldiers Kill 2 Terrorists, Kaduna
description: Soldiers deployed for counter-terrorism killed 2 bandits who were on a mission to attack some communities. It was reported that some of them fled into the forest with gunshot injuries.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Jigawa
description: 3 people were reportedly killed in a clash between farmers ad herders. Crisis started when herders from Katsina were moving to Jigawa upon invitation by indigenous herders and destroyed farmlands in the process .Farmers who mobilised against destruction and clashed with the herders. It is assumed the incident occurred 2 days before it was reported.

title: Kidnap Victim, Katsina
description: 5 people lost their lives in a raid by bandits. 5 others were abducted. They were killed in different locations.
place: Gurbin Magarya and Zaure in Kukar Babangida area.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 4 villagers in the early hours of the day. They also kidnapped scores of residents during the attack.

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Katsina
description: 4 mobile policemen were killed and two others injured in an ambush by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the officers were travelling to purchase necessary supplies.

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: A 40-year-old woman identified as Madam Alice was killed and 4 others were abducted by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 2 bandits were killed when they engaged the police in a gun duel to resist invasion into their camp but were overpowered by the superior firepower of the police team.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attacks, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers denoted IEDs at 2 locations, killing many and injuring over 100 people. There were reports that one of the twin blasts occurred at a wedding and a funeral ceremony. A source reported that the first explosion claimed 18 lives while the second killed many.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (32 ) , Daily Trust (32 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (31 ) , Nigerian Tribune (32 ) , The Nation (32 )

title: NAF vs Terrorists, Niger
description: An unspecified number of terrorists, assuming from the Boko Haram or Islamic State West Africa Province factions, were eliminated from operatives from NAF. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 terrorists died in the encounter since no number was reported. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Jigawa
description: 8 people were killed in a clash between farmers and herders. The crisis started when some herdsmen attacked farmers and released their cows into their farmlands uncontrolled. many people were injured while properties wee destroyed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 11 people were killed by marauding bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that reported that the bandits attacked in the night and burnt some victims.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen were killed gunmen numbering 6 at a popular junction. They were on their a stop and search operation when they were attacked.
place: Opobo Junction axis of Ogbor Hill, along the Aba-Ikot Ekpene Expressway

title: Gunmen vs Traders, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 6 traders were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened in a market area.

title: Troops Kill Terrorists, Sokoto
description: Soldiers deployed for counter-terrorism operations in a gun battle foiled a kidnap attempt, killed 5 terrorists, and rescued 2 hostages.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: 3 vigilante members were killed and 20 farmers were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening at the camp of the vigilante.
place: Shuwaka Area of the Western Kamuku forest under Kakangi Ward

title: Bandits Kill Lecture, Zamfara
description: The Deputy Vice Chancellor of Usmanu Danfodiyo University Sokoto (UDUS), Prof. Yusuf Saidu, was killed by bandits while travelling to Kaduna State.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Banditary, Kaduna
description: 4 vigilantes and Mobile Police Force (MPF) officer were killed during a raid by bandits. Many residents were also abducted.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 7 people were killed and several others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community at night. It was reported that several houses, shops, and other valuables were burnt during the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , Daily Trust (9 )

title: Army vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were eliminated through the coordinated ground and air strikes by troops of Operation Whirl Punch of the Nigerian Army. One top bandit identified as Alhaji Kachalla Ragas was among the dead.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , Vanguard (40 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A local hunter identified as Garba Sarki was beheaded by bandits. He was ambushed and had his throat slit with a knife after bullets could reportedly not penetrate his body.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram terrorists was killed in an ambush by Nigerian troops. Some arms and ammunition were recovered while 16 hostages were rescued. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A community was attacked by bandits and 5 residents were killed. The victims were attending a meeting when they came under attack. Houses were set ablaze while many residents were kidnapped. Those who died included Mamuda Tanimu -Ungwan Sarki, Yusuf Paul – Bauda, Amuse Wasika – Chibiya, Laraba Timothy – Chibiya, Saratu Amuse – Chibiya and a visitor.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a terrorist and recovered one AK-47 rifle, 7 rounds of 7.62mm (Special) ammunition and 7 bicycles. It was reported that the incident happened during offensive operation against terrorists' enclave.

title: Gunmen vs Fishermen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 fishermen were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the group also held 9 fishermen hostage.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 people were shot dead by rampaging gunmen who were chased from Nnewi to Nnobi community. It was reported that in a bid to escape, the gunmen killed a 9-year-old child, 2 women, one of whom newly got married, and others. This incident is linked to IBD030024.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Vigilante head identified as Hon Eloka Onyejekwe and one other person were shot dead by gunmen who invaded Nnewi community. It was reported that the hoodlums stormed the community but were chased away to Nnobi by the vigilante. This incident is linked to IBD030027.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Several terrorists were killed and 45 motorcycles were burnt by Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the airstrikes was conducted at the hideout of the terrorists.
place: Gidan Kare Village in Ruwan Godiya Ward

title: Soldiers vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed and some weapons were recovered by soldiers of Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in a community.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The corpse of a suspected bandit was found inside an incomplete building. It was reported that some troops of the Nigerian Army raided the hideout of the bandits a few days ago and killed 3 of them.

title: Bandits Kills Man, Kaduna
description: A 27-year-old man identified as Abba was killed by some bandits after delivering ransom to them. It was reported that the bandits invaded a village a few days ago and abducted some people.

title: Police vs Bandits, FCT (Abuja)
description: Operatives of the Federal Capital Territory killed a bandit and arrested 3 others during a clearance operation.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Troops of Sector 6 Operation Whirl Punch killed a notorious bandit, Buharin Yadi, and 35 others during an encounter. The operatives raided the hideout in response to intelligence reports on bandits’ movement.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (36 ) , Other newspaper 2 (36 ) , The Punch (36 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
