description: Troops of Sector 4 Operation Whirl Punch and 198 Special Forces Battalion of the Nigerian Army killed 6 bandits during clearance operation.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were decimated by the operatives of the Nigeria Police Force. The incident happened during a raid in a forest where the gunmen were camping.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Niger
description: 3 people were killed and scores were injured by Boko Haram members who invaded some villages. It was reported that the victims were attacked while coming back from a nearby village to get food.
place: Lantan, Makuba, Rumuchi, Allawa, Chukuba and Kusasu Villaes

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police officers and a civilian were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the gunmen stormed a police checkpoint and shot sporadically at the victims.

title: NAF Airstrikes, Katsina
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) neutralised 29 bandits following an airstrike on the enclave of the hoodlums. It was reported that the operation led to the liberation of several kidnapped victims, including the daughter of the village head of Ruwan Godiya, who had been held captive for months.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (29 ) , Daily Trust (29 ) , The Guardian (29 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Saminaka Garba was killed and 31 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A bandit was killed and 410 cows recovered by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened at the bandits' hideout.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by troops of Operation Whirl Punch and Operation Forest Sanity II. Many others were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries while arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: 50 farmers including 4 mobile policemen were killed by gunmen suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the deceased were attacked on their farms.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 4 police officers, members of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps (KSCWC) and 20 others were killed in a raid by bandits. The officers were ambushed while responding to a distress call. 2 people were reported to have been injured in the encounter. Many of the victims were believed to be farmers.
place: Yar Goje, Gidan Boka and Dan Nakwabo villages

title: Troops vs Banditry, Kaduna
description: Troops on patrol killed 5 bandits and recovered assorted arms, ammunition, motorcycles and radio sets
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Terrorists Attack, Katsina
description: Several people were killed and others were injured by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that several other residents were abducted in the night to dusk raid.

title: Army vs IPOB, Abia
description: Soldiers attached to the Operation Udo Ka killed 6 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and its armed wing, the Eastern Security Network (ESN). The operation was a retaliatory strike for the killing of soldiers by IPOB as captured in IBD029883.
sources_of_information: The Nation (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Guardian (6 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Two bullet-ridden corpses were found in a community close to a forest. It was reported that the decomposing corpses were discovered by some hunters who reported to villagers. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the victims were killed by bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Troops responding to a distress call killed 2 terrorists who tried to abduct occupants of a Toyota Corolla car. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits who doubled as kidnappers were killed by the police. The attackers had raided some communities and abducted many residents. The victims were all rescued according to the report.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Niger
description: 10 youths were beheaded, 10 others killed by suspected Boko Haram insurgents . Also 4 children were drowned while trying to flee the attack. Kabiru Salihu and Abubakar Karaga, were among those beheaded.
place: Lanta, Bassa, Kasimani, Unguwan-Madi and Makuda
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (8 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that some of the victims were attacked in their farms.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 12 people including some policemen, a member of a community guard identified as Askarawan Zamfara were killed and several others were injured by bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded the community in the morning.

title: Assailants vs Security Guard, Lagos
description: A security guard manning the residence of a legal practitioner was killed by some unidentified assailants. The house where the guard was securing got attacked by three masked gunmen.
place: Rosam Church Street, Iyanu Bus Stop, Ibeshe

title: ISWAP Attack, Yobe
description: A 60-year-old man identified as Dahiru Muhammadu died from an injury sustained from the attack by the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) in their community. It was reported that the incident happened at midnight.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 15 people were killed and others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits attacked several villages.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , Other newspaper 2 (29 )

title: Boko Haram vs Passengers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 3 passengers plying on the Biu-Damaturu Road. They were coming from Biu when the attackers stopped their vehicle, picked 4 of them who are Christians into the bush, and killed them.
place: Kamuya village along Biu-Damaturu Federal highway

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 15 people were killed and others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits attacked several villages.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , The Guardian (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (23 )

title: Army vs Rustlers, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army shot dead two suspected bandits who were attempting to rustle cows and sheep from a settlement. It was reported that the troops were on patrol when they came in contact with the bandits who had already perfected plans to invade the settlement in order to rustle the cows and sheep.

title: Army vs Boko Terrorists, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army lost 6 of their operatives during a clearance operation of the enclaves of the Boko Haram terrorist group.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 17 people including, some farmers, and a driver identified as Dan Mashi, were killed and several others were injured by some bandits who attacked commuters returning from the market. It was reported that 2 people were abducted. I
place: Dan Marke Village along Kankara-Marabar Kankara road, Katsalle Community near Mabai and Unguwar Daudun Noma

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits in large numbers stormed the residence of Zamfara State Hajj Commission chairman, Alhaji Musa Mallaha, killed his son and abducted 3 relatives.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of terrorists were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during an operation. It was reported that the strikes was conducted by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch on the terrorist's hideouts.

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people, including Nbechi Ndu, a former councillor were shot dead by suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra(IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). The gunmen were enforcing the sit-at-home order imposed on residents of the region by the pro-Biafra group.

title: IPOB vs Army, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 soldiers were killed when they were attacked at a military checkpoint by gunmen suspected to be Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) agitators enforcing a sit-at-home in honour of the victims of the Nigeria-Biafra War. The soldiers were identified as Sergeant Charles Ugochukwu, Sergeant Bala Abraham, Corporal Gideon Egwe, Corporal Ikpeama Ikechukwu and Corporal Augustine Emmanuel. 6 civilians were also killed in the encounter while many others were injured.
place: Military checkpoint in Obikabia Junction, Aba
sources_of_information: Vanguard (11 ) , The Punch (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Independent (11 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 6 bandits were killed and 3 informants were arrested by troops of 1 Division of the Nigerian Army and Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the incident happened during a special operation by the troops.
sources_of_information: This Day (6 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 12 traders were killed during a broad daylight attack on a market by bandits. The attackers shot indiscriminately at the traders, killing their victims and injuring others.
place: Maro Junction market in Maro Ward
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (12 ) , The Punch (12 ) , Other newpapers 1 (13 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 31 fishermen were killed while 40 others were declared missing when Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists attacked a fishing community.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were shot dead and 2 informants were arrested during a raid by soldiers. It was reported that the troops, in conjunction with vigilantes, stormed the bandit's hideout in a forest and engaged them in an exchange of gunfire.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits raided a community and killed 15 people, mostly women and children. They attackers had banned farmers in the community from going to farm.

title: NAF Airstrikes, Katsina
description: 30 terrorists were killed in series of airstrikes by the Nigeria Air Force (NAF). It was reported that NAF attacked the bandits in their hideout.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (30 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 )

title: Bandits Kill 25, Katsina
description: 15 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. The bandits also injured many other people.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (25 ) , The Guardian (25 ) , Daily Trust (25 )

title: Bandits Kill 16, Katsina
description: 16 people were killed by bandits who attacked 2 communities. The bandits also injured many other people.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (16 ) , Daily Trust (16 ) , Other newspaper 3 (16 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 bandits were killed in an ambush by soldiers. The operatives also recovered arms and other logistics from the victims.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 4 members of the Military Joint Force and 3 villagers who were gunned down while trying to escape into the bush.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man was killed and 5 women were abducted by bandits. The attackers operated in the community for days before killing their victim.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A bandit was killed by Nigerian troops and 18 people, including a male, 9 females and 8 children were rescued. A good number of cattle were also recovered from the bandits.
place: Near Maidabino River Line and Kanawa villages

title: Bandit's Informants, Kaduna
description: 2 suspected bandits’ informants were shot dead by security operatives. They were conveying foodstuffs and drugs on motorcycles to the bandits when they were intercepted by soldiers. The incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Man, Imo
description: Members of the Indigenous People of Biafra popularly called Umuoma arrested a man identified as Obiefula Emesibe and beat him to death. It was reported that the man had a misunderstanding with his brother who reported him to the hoodlums.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Bandits attacked a community and killed over 40 villagers. It was reported that the bandits also injured many including members of a vigilante group who were supporting security forces in dealing with criminalities in the district.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP vs Police, Borno
description: A Superintendent of Police, Sunday Pius was killed by suspected Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. 2 others were injured. The victims got a distress call from a health worker but were ambushed when they went after the terrorists.

title: Bandits vs Sarkin Hausawa's Son, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed the son of Sarkin Hausawa identified as Safiyanu Ibrahim. It was reported that the victim was killed for insisting on marrying a seconde wife who is a girlfriend of the leader of a group of bandits.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 terrorists were killed by soldiers in collaboration with the Hybrid Force and the Civilian Joint Task Force. They were ambushed near their crossing point. The troops recovered one General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) and 40 rounds of 7.62 by 51 mm belted ammunition.
place: Near Shetimari, Sabon-Gari, and the Amarwa Bulamari Exchange Point

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Plateau
description: A combined team of security personnel comprising of the DSS and other security operatives neutralised 7 bandits. It was reported that the incident happened during clearance of the bandits' enclave in a forest. It was reported that the bandits retaliated by attacking a close by community where they killed 9 people.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army decimated 2 terrorists and recovered 2 motorcycles from them. It was reported that other bandits ran away during the clearance operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by operatives of the Nigerian Army. The army recovered one AK-47 rifle from the terrorists together with 12 rounds of 7.62mm (Special) ammunition and 8 bicycles.

title: Army Kill 3, Imo
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force Operation Udo Ka killed two kidnappers and one member of the Eastern Security Network (ESN). The troops foiled an attempt to kidnap a man.

title: Police vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: A police team neutralised two bandits and recovered arms and ammunition during a gunfight. A version of the story reported that the bandits had earlier killed a 60-year-old man before the actual accident.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 farmers identified as Magaji Danmalam and Shehu Gambo were shot dead by bandits. It was reported that the bandits who came with AK-47 rifles surrounded the farmers, opened fire on them and killed 2 of them on the spot while 2 others escaped unhurt.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: No fewer than 150 people were killed in recent attacks across 80 communities by bandits. Many others were abducted during the incident while unspecified number of residents were displaced.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 3 people, including a pastor with the Evangelical Church of West Africa (ECWA), were killed and scores were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased were working on their farm close to the church when they were attacked.
place: Majure Village, 10 kilometers to Sarkin Pawa

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The leader of the Jamát Ahl group identified as Sunnah lid-Da'Kai wa'l-Jihd know as Boko Haram, Tahir Baga was killed by the troops of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in a forest by the troops. He was an ally to Abubakar Shekau.
place: Shababul Umma, Garin Panel Beater, and Lagara Anguwan Gwaigwai in the hearts of the forest

title: Bandits Kill Soldier, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a soldier identified as Yahaya Ayuba while trying to kidnap his stepmother. He was shot with an AK 47 when he confronted the kidnappers. The woman was later abducted.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Terrorists vs Army, Zamfara
description: 4 soldiers of the troops of Operation Hadarin Daji were killed and 8 others were injured during an exchange of gunfire with some bandits.
place: Kuran Mota Village, as well as along Road Alikere-Yarmalimai Village
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Punch neurtralised 4 bandits including one of their notorious leaders. The troops conducted the special fighting patrol in two communities and recovered a range of items including a motorcycle, a mobile phone, gas lighter, tobacco, assorted charms and a polythene bag containing petrol.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Over 200 heavily armed terrorists, led by a notorious bandit kingpin, Ado Aleiru, stormed a military camp, killing 5 soldiers, a 30-year-old vigilante, Aliyu Tukur and several civilians, assuming at least 20 civilians. However, they reportedly suffered heavy casualties. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (46 ) , Other newspaper 2 (46 ) , The Guardian (46 )

title: Communal Crisis, Benue
description: A traditional ruler and 3 others were killed while 17 houses and 10 bikes were burnt in a land dispute between the people of Amla in Otukpo Local Government Area (LGA) and the Okete people in Ohimini LGA of Benue State. it was reported that the dispute has lingered for about four years.

title: Decomposing Corpse, Kaduna
description: 3 decomposed corpses suspected to be of bandits were discovered by two hunters who were returning home. It was suspected that the bandits might have sustained bullet wounds while fleeing from a military air bombardment on their camp.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Enugu
description: 2 policemen were killed by suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the incident happened at at night when the officers, serving in Ogui Division, were conducting a stop-and-search operation. A version of the story reported that a woman identified as Ukamaka and 2 other civilians were shot dead during the incident.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits killed the villagers and burnt their food stuffs, silos and other properties worth millions of naira.

title: Decomposing Corpse, Kaduna
description: A decomposed corpses suspected to be that of bandits was discovered in a community.It was reported that the corpse was shattered with bullet wounds.
place: Maraban Bishini, one kilometre from Azzara village

title: Gunmen vs FIRS Official, FCT (Abuja)
description: An officer of the Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS), identified as Khalid Bichi was shot dead by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened at night in the deceased neighbourhood.

title: Farmers vs Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 farmers were killed by bandits when clearing their lands for farming. A few others escaped the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A renowned Islamic cleric, Mallam Makwashi Maradun Mai Jan Baki, and another person were killed by bandits. He was killed while working on his farm. In retaliation, residents killed 24 bandits.

title: Banditry vs Football Fans, Kaduna
description: Yaro Agayi and a mechanic identified as Samuel were killed and while 15 people were abducted while watching champions league match between Real Madrid and Bayern Munich. The attackers headed straight to the viewing centre where they killed their victims. It was reported that the bandits also killed a pharmacist identified as Chinedu.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 49 people were killed when bandits raided 5 villages in an LGA. The affected communities have constantly come under attacks by bandits.
place: Farar-Kasa, Dangulbi, Duhuwa, Tsatsomawa and Yar Sabaya villages

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 8 people were killed and several others were abducted by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community and shot at people sporadically.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed while 8 others were injured in a fresh attack carried out by bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded the community in the night and unleashed terror on residents. They moved from house to house during the operation.

title: Banditry, katisna
description: Suspected bandits killed an operative of the Katsina State Security Watch Corps (KSWC), Kabir Abdullahi, and 2 others. They were attacked while returning from work.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed two bandits during gun battle between the troops and hoodlums. The incident happened during a raid on the bandits camp.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 4 travellers died and 7 others were injured when a vehicle drove over landmines laid by Boko Haram insurgents. The vehicle was part of a wedding convoy conveying a bride from Damno to Dikwa.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Bandits, numbering over 50, invaded a community and killed 7 residents. They shot sporadically on the victims.

title: Extra Judicial Killing, Enugu
description: ESN/IPOB: Mr. Richard Okoye lost his life when security operatives comprising of soldiers and policemen invaded a community in the night, burning houses and shooting sporadically. It was reported that the incident was linked to the killing of a police officer and 2 others in a farm settlement by gunmen suspected to be members of the Eastern Security Network, the militant wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). A version of the story stated that 2 policemen and 3 vigilante operatives otherwise known as Neighbourhood Watch Group were killed during an attack on them by a gang of rampaging hoodlums.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 24 people were killed while several others were wounded in an attack by bandits. It was reported that the those killed were mostly vigilante members who came out to confront the bandits. The attack was described as a reprisal over military offensive on the bandits' hideouts.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Niger
description: Many Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were killed during airstrikes by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets. The incident happened during the clearance operation aimed at ridding the areas of the terrorists.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists were killed during airstrikes on their hideouts by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). The incident happened during clearance operation aimed at ridding the areas of the terrorists.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Soldiers, in conjunction with policemen and operatives of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps killed a bandit. The incident happened when the operatives engaged the terrorists in a fierce gun battle, killed one of them and recovered an AK 47 rifle, 2 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition and a motorcycle.

title: Bandits vs Community Protection Guards, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 3 officials of the Zamfara State-owned Community Protection Guard (CPG). It was reported that the bandits ambushed the CPG officials, and took away their weapons and bikes.
place: At Tungar Nayarciga on their way to Faru town Jambako area of Maradun

title: Bandits vs Community Leader, Kaduna
description: A community leader identified as Malam Kabiru Mohammed was killed by gunmen who invaded a community. His house was set ablaze.
place: Marke Village in the Dandamisa Ward

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided some communities and killed 8 people. They also abducted the village heads of Kakangi and Kisaya communities on their way to another communities as well as some farmers, including 8 women. The victims were killed as they tried to rescue the captives.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits led by gang leader, Isyaku Majo, attacked the palace of the Emir of Zurmi, killing the 3 palace officials and abducting the Shamaki (chief details) of the Emir, Buhari Yusuf and many others.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: Intra-communal crisis between the people of Ezza Effium and the Effium communities claimed the lives of 10 people, including children, old men, and women. Buildings, including the health center, were burnt.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Vanguard (10 ) , This Day (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (11 )

title: Troops vs IPOB Fighters, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The combined team of the Nigerian Army, in conjunction with other security agencies, killed an Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) expert of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) known as Tochukwu, alias Ojota. 3 other people were also killed in the operation.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (4 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 3 people lost their lives while motorbikes, foodstuffs, and other valuables were reportedly carted away during an invasion by suspected Fulani herders. Several individuals were declared missing after the attack.

title: Herdsmen Kill PDP Ward Chairman, Delta
description: The pioneer chairman of the PDP in Ward 10 in Abavo, Elder Francis Amamosa, was allegedly killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. He was attacked in his farm. A singer, Goodnews Emuemu, aka Gnewzy and 2 other farmers were abducted by the attackers. A middle-aged man was also killed in the community 3 days before the current incident.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits were eliminated by NAF. Their hideout was targeted after they targeted a unit of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). 3 of the victims were the groups; kingpins. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 5 people were killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen clashed with youths from the Anchiha Mbamar kindred. The incident was over access to the community’s only source of drinking water.
place: Anchiha Mbamar kindred in the Mbasombo Council Ward

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Bandits ambushed and killed 9 members of Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). Many of the were left with different degree of injuries. While fleeing from the military, the bandits were ambush by soldiers. It is assumed that no fewer than 10 bandits were killed in the ambush.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 5 people were killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen raided some communities. Many others were injured while others were displaced.

title: Bandits Kill Hunter, Kaduna
description: Three hunters, Yakubu Alhassan, Sani Galadima, and Iliyasu Musa were shot dead while a couple and 14 others abducted by bandits.

title: Boko Haram IED, Borno
description: 8 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) were killed and 3 others were injured after stepping on an Improvised Explosive Device (IED). It was reported that the landmine was planted by the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP).
place: Maiduguri-Gamborou Ngala highway near Gajibo village
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (8 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Vanguard (10 ) , Daily Trust (26 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits including their kingpins, Mallam Umar and several other commanders, were killed during a hit on their hideout by NAF. The raid came a few days after some soldiers and vigilantes were killed in the LGA. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40 bandits) lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Auto Crash, Ondo
description: 2 siblings and a motorcyclist were crushed to death by a speeding vehicle. The victims were Joshua Ogbeye (20 years), Eniola Ogbeye (13 years) and the motorclist, Idowu Omitogu. The driver of the vehicle, a student of the Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko, fled the scene after the crash for fear of being attacked.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 2 people were killed and 30 others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community at midnight and shot ar residents sporadically.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 7 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army, in conjunction with the team of the Department of State Services (DSS). It was reported that several weapons were recovered after the incident.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: A clash between Boko Haram and ISWAP fighters claimed about 85 lives. The clash led to the dislodgement of the Boko Haram faction from several Islands previously seized from the ISWAP groups.
place: Tudun ShawakkiI, Tumbum Bakwarram, Mallam Basiru, Kwaleram, Kandahar and Tumbum Ali Island
sources_of_information: Vanguard (85 ) , Other newspaper 3 (85 ) , Nigerian Tribune (140 ) , Other newspaper 2 (140 ) , The Nation (140 )

title: Terrorists Attack, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed and 3 others abducted by gunmen suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Terrorists Attack, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed and 3 others were abducted by gunmen suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 2 peace negotiators, a woman and children (assuming at least 2) were killed by bandits.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF), the Air Component Of Operation Hadin Kai and the Nigerien Air Force destroyed terrorist hideouts and eliminated many of them. Their structures were also destroyed. It is assumed no fewer than 20 insurgents were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 )

title: Bandits vs Army, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed during an encounter with bandits. The victims attempted to kidnap villagers but were intercepted after a distress call to security operatives.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people lost their lives when bandits raided a community. One of the victims was a vigilante leader. 8 others were kidnapped by the attackers.

title: Passenger vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A suspected kidnapper was killed by some passengers. It was reported that the passengers overpowered some bandits who ambushed them on the highway.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 people were killed and 3 others injured during a shootout between bandits and operatives of Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD). The attackers reportedly dressed in women's clothing and camouflage.

title: Kidnappers vs Security Operatives, Bauchi
description: 8 bandits who double as kidnappers were killed by the police, in collaboration with hunters. 3 kidnapped victims were rescued from captivity.
sources_of_information: The Nation (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 people were allegedly killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The community had been having meeting to curb the clashes but were surprised latest attack occurred.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army troops, in collaboration with a hybrid Force, carried out a clearance operation and neutralised 2 terrorists. They also recovered two AK-47 rifles, one motorbike, six bicycles, and other sundry items.

title: Boko Haram, Niger
description: Scores of gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram fighters were killed in a gun duel with security personnel comprising of soldiers and vigilantes. About 6 soldiers and 2 vigilantes lost their lives in the encounter while a Captain was allegedly abducted but was later found dead. It is assumed not less than 2 scores (40) of the bandits were killed.
place: Masigo, Lolo in the Allawa axis
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (48 ) , This Day (48 ) , Other newpapers 1 (48 ) , Nigerian Tribune (48 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Scores of people were killed during a clash between bandits and Yan Sakai vigilante members. The clash started when the vigilante leader of the Gidan Hashimu village, Alhaji Dahiru, made a move to arrest and interrogate a notorious cattle rustler seen loitering in the market but was killed. In reprisal, over 50 people were killed in Fulani communities.
sources_of_information: The Punch (60 ) , Other newspaper 2 (60 ) , Other newspaper 3 (60 )

title: Kidnap Victims, Oyo
description: 8 kidnap victims were shot dead by their abductors reported as Fulani herdsmen. A member of the gang who had accompanied a man to fetch water was killed by soldiers. 2 of the kidnap victims, including a man and woman, died of exhaustion. The victims, which were about 11, included Omogbolahen Olakunle, Oriade Jolaiya, Fawaz, Panko and a 13-year-old boy.
place: Maya axis of Lanlete Eruwa road

title: Fulani Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 6 people were killed and several others were injured by gunmen suspected to be Fulani Militia. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: ISWAP IED, Borno
description: 16 people were killed and 20 others were injured when a commercial vehicle stepped on an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) allegedly planted by the Islamic State's West Africa Province (ISWAP).

title: Bandits Kill Villagers, Kaduna
description: A large number of bandits invaded a community, fired gunshots sporadically, and abducted dozens of residents. It was reported that 23 people were killed in the raid while 5 others were injured.
place: Anguwar Danko village under the Kakangi constituency

title: NURTW Clash, Lagos
description: A transporter, Ajayi Michael, was allegedly killed during a crisis among road transport workers. The factions were fighting one another over who collects revenue for the union.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed when bandits raided some communities. 7 others were abducted while some sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Benue
description: 3 bandits were killed in an ambush by the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened at their hideout. Some weapons were recovered.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 abducted victims over their failure to raise N5 million for ransom. They also threatened to kill other victims if their relations failed to pay their ransom within 7 days.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by the Nigerian Army troops. It was reported that the troops laid an ambush on the bandits at their hideouts. It was reported that some weapons were recovered after the raid.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF reportedly killed top terrorist leaders including Ali Dawud, Bakurah Fallujah, Mallam Ari and about 30 fighters. They were raided in their hideout. Vehicles, motorcycles, and logistical assets were also destroyed
place: Kolleram village along the shores of Lake Chad
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (34 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Nigerian Tribune (34 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: No fewer than 13 people were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Several houses were also burnt.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 12 terrorists were killed and many others were injured by the Joint Task Force Northwest Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD). It was reported that the incident happened at the camp of the terrorists. Some weapons were recovered from the bandits.
place: Babban Doka, Gobirawar Challi and Kabaro axis
sources_of_information: The Nation (12 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 )

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by the police operatives when their hideout was raided.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Farmers, Benue
description: 2 farmers in an attack by gunmen suspected by Fulani herdsmen. Two other people were injured while another was abducted.
place: Umogidi community in the Entekpa Council ward

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Catechist, Enugu
description: A catechist identified as Chinaza Odumejeogu, with the All Saints Anglican Church was killed and 2 others, John Ede and his daughter were kidnapped by suspected Fulani. It was reported that the victims were attacked while working on their farm.

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Borno
description: The Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) executed a police officer abducted along a road. The officer was with his wife and children before he was kidnapped as they were travelling for Eid break.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Some bandits killed about 30 members of local security outfit called Yan Sa Kai. It was reported that some of the bandits were also killed.

title: Military Airstrikes, Katsina
description: Several bandits were killed in military airstrikes carried out by the Air Components of Operation Hadarin Daji and Hadin Kai. The incident was a clearance operation aimed at clearing out the bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 3 bandits during an ambush. The gunmen were killed while on transit to repair their motorbikes. Troops recovered one AK47 rifle, on stock

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 7 people, including a Lieutenant, A.S Maidawa, were killed by members of Boko Haram during an ambush. It was reported that the deceased, mostly soldiers from 135 Special Force BN FOB, were on their way to Damaturu on a motorcycle when they were ambushed.

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Kaduna
description: A community leader identified as Mr. Philibus Andrew was shot dead and 13 others including Mr. Abraham Dangana were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Three bandits were killed by security operatives during clearance operation. Some guns were recovered from the neutralised bandits. Some of the bandits were injured.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A man identified as Ahiru Nagoma was killed and 2 others were kidnapped by bandits who invaded a community.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Troops of 21 Armoured Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai, killed 3 Boko Haram terrorists during a clash. 9 captives were rescued from the insurgents. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Several terrorists, including a notorious bandit leader, Mudi, and his son, Murtala lost their lives during a clash between Jammatu Ansarul Musulmin Biladis Sunna known as Ansaru, and Dogo Gide's group of bandits. It was reported that the incident happened as a result of supremacy over the control of mining sites. It was assumed that those killed were about 25.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Enugu State Police Command killed 2 members of the Eastern Security Network, the militia arm of the IPOB. The incident happened when the police raided the hideout of ESN. It was reported that the operatives were met with high resistance by the unscrupulous elements but were subdued by the superior firepower of the security operatives.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 gunmen suspected to be IPOB/ESN members were killed during a raid on their hideout by gunmen. Scores of the gunmen were alleged to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Soldiers raided the camp of Hassan Yantagwaye and killed 3 bandits. It was not reported if the kingpin was among the victims large cache of arms were destroyed.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 8 suspected bandits were killed during a raid on their hideout by soldiers. 3 locally fabricated guns, military uniforms and ammunition were recovered from the victims.
place: Shawu Kuka, Shinda, Tafki, Gidan Surajo, and Citakushi in Kabai I and Kabai II
sources_of_information: The Guardian (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided 8 communities and killed 2 herders. They also rustled several cows after they shot their victims.
place: Anguwar-Doka, Kurutu, Mai-Ido, Hayin-Dam, Awom, Arikon, Gidan-Makeri and Rijana

title: Bandits vs Abductees, Niger
description: 9 villagers who were part of 50 abductees from a village were killed by their abductors. The victims were killed while they were being moved to a different location.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 2 bandits were killed by police operatives. It was reported that some stolen cattle were recovered. It was also reported that some weapons were recovered.

title: Army vs Bandits, Taraba
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised a bandit during a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops encountered the gunmen and they responded with superior firepower. They also recovered a locally fabricated FN pistol, two rounds of 9mm ammunition and a mobile phone belonging to the criminal.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Sheikh Ahmad Rufa’i, the Chief Imam of the Central Mosque in Keita village was killed by bandits shortly after Muslims observed the isha’i (night) congregational prayer. Scores of people were also abducted.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A terrorist suspected to be a member of Boko Haram /Islamic State of West Province (ISWAP) was killed by soldiers, in collaboration with the Civilian JTF. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation at the terrorist's hideout.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Katsina
description: Several security operatives, especially members of the vigilante and Community Watch Corps (CWC), set up by the government, were killed by bandits. The attackers raided a military checkpoint and a police station.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army while conducting an offensive operation at their camps. It was reported that the troops recovered some weapons and rustled cattle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A terrorist suspected to be a member of Boko Haram /Islamic State of West Province (ISWAP) was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army in collaboration with hybrid force. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation at the terrorist's hideout.

title: Bandits Kill 9, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 9 villagers, including the village head, when they attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising the villages.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a notorious terrorists' leader, Junaidu Fasagora, and scores of his fighters. It was reported that the victims were killed in a ferocious artillery bombardment and ground battle. They were reportedly responsible for the kidnapping of 137 Kuriga School children.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Malam Aminu Muhammad, a commander of the state’s Community Protection Guards (CPG) in charge of Tsafe, and one other personnel, Ibrahim Kabiru were killed when bandits raided some communities. About 6 others were abducted while many people were injured.

title: Hausa vs Fulani, Sokoto
description: A clash between Hausa and Fulani residents claimed the lives of 4 people. It was reported that the crisis started over a land dispute between Fulani herders and Hausa farmers.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Katsina
description: 2 worshippers observing Ramadan prayers were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits also abducted a woman and her daughter during the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police officers were killed and 4 others were injured by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that their vehicles were set ablaze.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldier, Yobe
description: A military personnel was killed and their military van destroyed by suspected Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists drove into the military base and engaged them in an exchange of gunfire.

title: Banditary, Niger
description: So many people were killed when bandits invaded a market. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (65 )

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: A bandit was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. It was reported that some weapons were recovered after the incident.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A terrorist masquerading as a police officer was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army in collaboration with vigilante operatives. It was reported that some weapons were recovered after the operation.

title: Gunmen Attack, Niger
description: The district head of Pangu Gari and 4 other people were killed by bandits. The bandits have been terrorising residents of the community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: An IPOB/ESN fighter was killed during a raid on their enclave. Details of the incident were not provided. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army, acting on actionable intelligence, raided a terrorists' hideout and killed 2 bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. The army responded to credible intelligence on the presence of the victims.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Taraba
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 terrorists during a gun duel. The incident was part of the on-going clearance operation aimed at ridding the state of banditry.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Mr. Christopher Zamani was killed and a woman, Mary Isah, along 8 others, were kidnapped by gunmen who invaded a community.
place: Banono settlemet under Angwaku community in Kufana Chiefdom

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kaduna
description: Bandits who abducted about 61 people from a village killed 5 of their victims. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village in the early hours of the day.

title: Bandits Kill 7, Plateau
description: About 7 people were shot dead while several others sustained injuries when bandits invaded a market in community.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 2 members of the Katsina State Community Watch Corps and injured others. The incident happened in the afternoon when operatives were carrying out surveillance activities.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian army killed 2 bandits during clearance operations. They also recovered three AK-47 rifles, 8 magazines, 57 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition, three Baofeng radio sets, 12 Baofeng radio chargers, and one handolier.
place: Dan Birgima, Ungwan Noma, Katoge and Pauwa villages

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army. The operatives also recovered one AK-47 rifle, 3 fabricated guns, 2 rounds of anticraft ammunition, one motorbike and 2 solar panels.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in conjunction with hybrid force elements, neutralised 8 Boko Haram fighters. The incident happened when the troops tried to clear a notorious terrorist enclave.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 terrorists, including a suicide bomber, were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during a raid operation at the camp of the terrorists.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A woman was killed and 15 Tsangaya students were kidnapped by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at midnight inside the school premises.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram fighter was killed when soldiers raided their hideout. Some arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: Medical Negligence, Lagos
description: The wife of Prince Ovwiomodiowho, a registered nurse anesthetist, identified as Mrs. Loveth Ovwiomodiowho and their son Oghenetega (Jason) died in a hospital as a result of the private hospital's negligence and failure to provide adequate care.

title: Communal Crisis, Imo
description: Gunmen killed four youths in a community during an attack. They were dressed in military camouflage when they invaded the community, opened fire and killed the youths. One other person was injured in the attack. Another version of the story reported that the incident a neighbouring community rift.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists, including a suicide bomber, were killed by soldiers. Their camp was also destroyed.

title: Mosque Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed and others were abducted by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened during a Jumaát prayer at the mosque in the community.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Scores (assuming at least 2) IPOB and ESN fighters were killed when soldiers raided their headquarters in Mother Valley. Many of them were believed to have sustained various degrees of injuries while assorted arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: School Kidnap, Kaduna
description: A vigilante was killed by bandits while over 280 pupils and teachers of Government Secondary School and LEA primary school were abducted. A report has it that a student who attempted to escape was also killed.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 6 persons including 4 police officers were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire between the gunmen.
place: Ebyia Bridge Checkpoint along Hilltop Nwofe Road
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of members (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed by the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the incident happened at the bandits hideout.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 2 suspected terrorists were killed by soldiers who were alerted of the attack. Some kidnapped victims were rescued.

title: Army vs ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 5 suspected fighters of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), the militia arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra. It was reported that the troops recovered a significant cache of dangerous weapons.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Soldiers raided the stronghold of the infamous bandit leader, Maudi Maudi, and killed scores of his fighters. Many were also believed to have been injured. It was unconfirmed if the kingpin was among the dead. It is assumed at least 2 scores of bandits were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a notorious terrorist leader, Maikusa, who was the second-in-command to the infamous terrorists know as Modi Modi. Maikusa was gunned down with three other terrorists during the clearance operation. The story stated that the encounter between the army and the terrorists happened in Kurfi and Safana LGAs.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A bandit was killed and 15 kidnap victims were rescued by soldiers of Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD). The attackers had raided some communities in an attempt to kidnap residents. A distress call alerted the operatives who quickly moved in to salvage the situation. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Members of a local vigilante group killed about 200 bandits. Details of the incident were not reported.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A Chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) identified as Alhaji Shafiu Abubakar and 2 others were killed and 3 others were injured by bandits. It was reported that the victims were attacked on the expressway.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 herders were reportedly shot dead and several cows were rustled by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits invaded the community in large numbers with sophisticated instruments.

title: Army vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 20 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army, in collaboration with other security operatives. It was reported that some weapons were recovered by the troops.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , The Nation (20 )

title: Army vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) was shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation at the gunmen's hideout.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers in conjunction with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) overran the stronghold of the Boko Haram terrorist and killed 3 insurgents. They also recovered a Mine Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) vehicle.

title: ISWAP/Boko Haram IED, Borno
description: 3 persons were killed by explosives devices allegedly planted by the Islamic State of West Africa Province fighters (ISWAP). It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation. They were were riding o their motorcycles and mistakenly stepped on explosive devices.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Joint Task Force North West Operation Hadin Daji (OPHD) killed scores of bandits and rescued 8 kidnapped victims. It was assumed that about 20 bandits were killed in the attack. Since the LGA was not given, it is assumed it happened in Gusau, the state capital.

title: Gunmen vs Photographer, Niger
description: A 33-year-old man identified as Zacheus Salawadeen was killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the deceased, a freelance photographer was attacked at his residence.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Explosive Device Kills Two, Borno
description: 2 construction workers were killed and 5 others were injured in an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) explosion. allegedly planted by Boko Haram. It was reported that the incident happened when the victims were transporting bricks to a section of a primary school under construction and ignorantly conveyed an IED.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed and 17 others were kidnapped by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that several animals were also rustled by the attackers.

title: Bandits Kill Policeman, Zamfara
description: Bandits attacked a police checkpoint in a village, killing a policeman and injuring others. It was reported that the bandits who carried out the attack rode on 40 motorbikes.
place: Tazame village, less than a kilometre from Kwatarkwashi

title: Youths vs Militia, Rivers
description: 1 person lost his life during a clash between some youths and operatives of a local security outfit. The crisis started when community members went to carry a corpse for burial and were attacked by the operatives, popularly called Amama soldiers.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Oyo
description: 1 person was killed by hoodlums suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Bandits Clash, Zamfara
description: 5 prominent bandit leaders and scores (at least 40) of their fighters were killed during a factional supremacy clash. It was reported that the incident happened when one of the groups attempted to kidnap some villagers but were stopped by another group loyal to bandit kingpin, Ado Alero.
sources_of_information: The Punch (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , Daily Trust (45 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 wanted bandit leaders, Baldo and Baban Yara, together with scores of their fighters, were eliminated by Nigerian troops on clearance operations. The bandits were behind the coordination of the movement and exchange of kidnapped victims with camps in the Zamfara/Katsina axis.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Some bandits invaded a community, killed 2 people, and abducted 16 residents. It was reported that 5 people sustained gunshot wounds.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 20 bandits and 6 members of a Community Watch Corps (CWC), including their leader, Sanusi Hassan, were killed during a gun duel. It was reported that the incident happened when the security operatives were on a mission to dislodge some bandit's hideouts in the area.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 notorious bandits identified as Boderi and Bodejo Isyaku, and some members of their gang during a gun duel between his gang and the military. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising citizens of the state and several other states.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Land Crisis, Bayelsa
description: 2 people were killed while others sustained injuries following a land dispute between two neighbouring communities.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Soldiers vs Military, Borno
description: Three notorious ISWAP commanders, Abacha, Bakura, Ba-bangida and 22 other fighters were killed during a confrontation with soldiers. The terrorists were trailed to a remote village where they had operated from.

title: Bandits vs Police, Zamfara
description: Bandits attacked a police station when they invaded a town, killing a Divisional Crime Officer, Shitu Musa in charge of the station and setting it ablaze. It was reported that the bandits attacked the police station following the killing of 3 of their men by a vigilante group in conjunction with policemen.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 12 people were killed while 9 others were injured by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits set 17 houses on fire during the attack which started when residents were sleeping.
place: Gindin Dutse Makyali village of Kufana district

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: The State Publicity Secretary of the All Progressive Congress identified as Hon. Sylvanus Namang was killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the deceased was attacked while returning from a trip.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot dead 6 people when they invaded a community. It was reported that they kidnapped several people and injured many. The bandits moved from house to house during the incident.
place: Kwassam, Kurera and Kan Makama communities
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , The Punch (9 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Yobe
description: 4 members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by troops of Sector 2, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in a community.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 1 person was killed and several others were kidnapped by some gunmen. It was reported that the victims were ambushed while coming back from a market in a neighbouring community.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 persons were killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the community in Toyota Hilux vans and shot sporadically at residents. It was also reported that 20 others were abducted.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: Bandits who invaded a community killed 3 people and injured several others. They also kidnapped many people.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 persons were killed and 3 others were injured when suspected bandits invaded a community.

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Zamfara
description: 2 policemen and 2 other residents were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits who invaded the town in the early hours of the day shot indiscriminately and abducted about 40 people. This attack was carried out by Dan Sadiya and his gang as a reprisal for the killing of his wife and children by the Nigerian troops as captured in IBD029040.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 9 persons were killed and several others were injured by gunmen. It was reported that the deceased, traders were attacked while coming back from a local market. The gunmen also burnt the two buses that were conveying the traders.

title: Gunmen vs Police Officer, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A police officer was killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) who invade the police station in the area. It was reported that 7 inmates were freed in the operation.

title: Gunmen vs Lawyer, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A lawyer identified as Barr. Victor Onwubiko was killed by some unknown gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). It was reported that the incident happened while he was returning from a trip.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 2 persons were killed and 5 others were injured from Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) planted by Boko Haram members. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in the community.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A vigilante identified as Ubale was killed and 12 farmers were abducted by bandits. People who tried to recover the corpse were ambushed although none of them was killed.

title: Police vs Kidnappers, FCT (Abuja)
description: Several kidnappers, including a kingpin, Musa Wada known as Sabo Magaji were killed and many others were injured by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits engaged the police in a gun duel at their hideouts.

title: Boko Haram vs Construction Workers, Yobe
description: 2 persons were killed and 3 hunters were kidnapped by some Boko Haram members. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the town at night and started shooting sporadically at the residents.

title: Assailants vs Student, Ondo
description: Ifeoluwa Adekunle, a 300-level female student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko, was stabbed to death by assailants. The victim was killed by her attackers in her room which is located off campus. A version of the report stated that the victim was killed by a final year student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko, identified as Olubodun Sanni who stole the victim's iPhone XR.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: The Nigerian Air Force killed several terrorists during a joint operation by the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji and troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the operatives struck the terrorists' hideout. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed in the incident.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: One Mallam Suleiman Mai Rake, the father of a member of the Katsina Security Watch Corps identified as Isa Bawa Yantumaki was brutally murdered in his residence by bandits. The incident happened in the early hours of the day.

title: ISWAP vs Police, Borno
description: 4 police officers were killed during an attack on a police station by suspected members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was reported that the gunmen also set the station ablaze.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A group of bandits riding 7 motorcycles struck in a community, killing one Shehu Armaya, a member of the Katsina Security Watch Corps and 2 others, Lawal and Mamuda.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed the wife and children of a bandit leader, Dan-Nagala Sadiya. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in a community.

title: Gunmen Kill Policeman, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Armed men attacked policemen on patrol and killed a policeman. It was reported that the attackers operated in an ash-coloured Toyota Sienna without registration number.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Borno
description: 18 people were killed in multiple female suicide bomber attacks on a wedding, a hospital, and a funeral. Dozens were also injured.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several terrorists, including 2 of their leaders, were killed by Troops of the Joint Task Force, North West Operation Haddarin Daji during a clearance operation at the hideout of the bandits. About 20 kidnapped victims were rescued by the troops.
place: Rukudawa, Dumburum, Tsanu, Birnin Tsaba Magare and Shamushale General Areas

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 6 farmers and a driver lost their lives when their vehicle ran over an IED planted by suspected Boko Haram members. Others in the vehicle sustained injuries. Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists have repeatedly launched attacks along the route.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The air component of the special joint military Task Force attached to Operation Whirl Punch eliminated about 30 bandits who were terrorising residents of some communities.

title: Bandits vs Man, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot dead a man, Joshua Bawuna, his 16-year-old son, Ayuba Bawuna, and abducted 14 other people in a village. It was reported that the incident happened at night when the bandits attacked the village.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An improvised Explosive Device (IEDs) detonated, resulting in the deaths of 6 Quranic school pupils popularly known as Almajirai. The incident occurred when a metal scavenger unknowingly collected and stored various metallic items in a building.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed seven bandits during clearance operation. It was reported that several other bandits escaped with severe gunshot wounds.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed during clearance operations by troops of the Nigerian Army. The troops also recovered one AK47 rifle, one magazine, 7.62mm special ammunition and 2 motorcycles.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a bandit when they responded to an intelligent report on terrorists movement along a road. The troops forced the remaining bandits to flee.

title: Police vs Kidnappers, FCT (Abuja)
description: 3 kidnappers suspected to be bandits, including their gang leader, Mei Gemu known as Godara were killed and 19 others were arrested by police operatives. It was also reported that the incident happened at midnight.

title: Kidnap Victims, Niger
description: The wife of a policeman and another person were killed in captivity by some bandits for a late ransom payment. It was reported that the deceased were among the victims who were kidnapped from their community by gunmen.

title: Army vs Bandits, Taraba
description: Troops of the 6 Brigade, Nigerian Army stormed bandits' camp and killed three of them. 2 AK-47 rifles, a motorcycle and a cache of 40 rounds of 7.62 MM special ammunition were recovered.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Bulu Magaji (41-years) was killed by bandits who invaded his home. He was beaten to death.

title: Gunmen vs Couple, Anambra
description: A couple were killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that their corpses were dumped in the boot of their vehicle Toyota Camry marked EE-621-EU.
place: Tempo Junction, Umunya axis of the Enugu-Onitsha Expressway
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Police vs Bandits, FCT (Abuja)
description: Operatives of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) police command engaged some kidnappers in a gun duel. One of the suspects was killed while 14 abducted victims were rescued.
place: Ukya village via Nasarawa State bordering the FCT
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Suspected terrorists killed 3 people, including a 65-year-old Imam and a 12-year-old boy simply identified as Haruna while 32 others were abducted.

title: Army vs bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 40) were killed during military operations by troops of Operation Hadarin Daji under 1 brigade. It is assumed that operations lasted for a week since no date was reported.
place: Sunke, Gando, Munhaye, and Kuyanbana forests

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: An attempt to rustle cattle was resisted and resulted in a full-scale mayhem that claimed 8 lives. Many others were injured while many could not be traced after they fled their houses. Residential houses, mosques, and churches were reportedly burnt during the crisis.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Several bandits were killed by Soldiers from 1 Battalion Nigerian Army Dukku Barracks, and Vigilantes members during a clearance operation. It was reported that some kidnapped victims were rescued after the operation. It was also reported that some weapons were also recovered.

title: Explosion, Kaduna
description: Zaidu Usman, died while 10 others were injured in an explosion. The incident occurred when children went into the bush to fetch firewood and returned home with a strange object suspected to be an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) which exploded on them.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Mallam Ahmadu Adamu, a father of 16 was killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped 21 villagers during the incident.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: A man was killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped the victim's wife and children but they were later rescued by security operatives. The bodies of a kidnapped woman and several graves were found in the forest. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 dead bodies were found in the forest.
place: Forest between Fakai and Koko area

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Air strikes by the fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) killed a notorious kingpin popularly known as Janari and several members of his gang who had been terrorising citizen of the state. The bandits were massing up for a likely attack or kidnapping of vulnerable civilians before they were struck.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The school principal of Government Secondary School (GSS) Kuriga, Mallam Idris Abu Sufyan, was killed by bandits for resisting kidnap attempt. His wife and daughter were kidnapped by the gunmen.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 3 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped 13 people during the attack on the community.

title: Security Agents vs Bandits, Benue
description: 2 bandits were decimated by a team of security personnel. The incident happened when the operatives engaged a gang of bandits in a gun battle, killing 2 of them and recovering arms and ammunition.
place: Tse Gaagum village in Ukemberegya council ward

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 2 members of the Borno State Civilian Joint Task Force were killed and 8 others were injured after stepping on an improvised explosive device suspected to be planted by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened while the victims were on a routine operation in a community.

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 3 Boko Haram members were killed by some vigilantes group. It was reported that the incident happened while the insurgents were trying to cross the border of the community to another state. It was also reported that one of the vigilant was killed and 1 other was injured when they stepped over an explosive device planted by the insurgents.

title: Bandits vs NIS Operatives, Kebbi
description: 2 Nigerian Immigration Service (NIS) operatives were killed by some criminals. The incident happened when the bandits attacked an entry point where the victims, Isa Nafiu (II) NIS No 34057 and Garba Haruna Fana (II) NIS No 17796, were manning.
place: Garin Garba entry point, about 12 kilometres away from Kangiwa

title: Land Dispute, Nasarawa
description: A land dispute between Gbagyi and Bassa ethnic groups led to the death of 7 people. It was reported that the crisis broke out when some members of the Bassa ethnic group stormed a community where Gbagyi people had settled for farming and attacked them.
place: Gbagyi and Bassa in Kudu village

title: Bandits Kill 3, Zamfara
description: Rampaging bandits killed 3 people, including a vigilante during an attack on a community. It was reported that the bandits also abducted 50 people, including about 36 women. Several other people were injured during the attack.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Gunmen killed the village head of Kukar Babangida community, Haruna Abale, his 2 sons, 2 watchmen working for Tinna Tech construction company and 6 others. It was reported that an unspecified number of women and children were abducted.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Several bandits were neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army. It is assumed that no fewer than 20 fatalities were recorded in the encounter.

title: Army vs Bandits, FCT (Abuja)
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army decimated several bandits during clearance operations. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents in the area.
place: Tungan Kwasau Village, off Dei-Dei Zuba Expressway Suburb in Bwari area

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents rounded up a group of poker players and opened fire on them resulting in the death of 6 people. 4 others were injured.
place: Bakassi Joint on the outskirts of Gajiram

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 persons are feared dead and many others sustained varying degrees of injury when 2 commercial vehicles stepped on landmines planted by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised several Boko Haram and Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters during clearance operations aimed at ridding the state of terrorists. It was reported the troops also cleared 25 camps belonging to the terrorists.

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Taraba
description: Bandits killed the Head of Wuro Musa village identified as Jauro Kabiru Gambo when they stormed the community. The incident happened when the deceased was abducted alongside 17 people including 7 women.
place: Wuro Musa village, Jauro Kabiru Gambo

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 17 people were killed and 38 others were abducted when bandits raided some communities. Many people were believed to have been injured in the raids.
place: Kunkurai, Dokan Karji and Angwan Sako communities

title: Army vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: 20 terrorists were killed and several others were arrested by troops of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the incident happened at the hideout of the terrorists. It was also reported that 40 kidnapped victims were rescued by the troops after the operation.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 7 persons were killed and several others were injured in an ambush by some bandits. It was reported that the victims were returning from a market in another neighborhood when they were attacked.

title: Boko Haram vs Pastor, Yobe
description: A pastor of Church of Christ In Nations (COCIN) and 5 other people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents invaded the house of the pastor and killed him alongside others before setting the church (COCIN) ablaze.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: A farmer was killed while 22 villagers were abducted by bandits who invaded some villages. The villagers have been under siege by the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 4 civilians and a vigilante were killed during an attack on a community by suspected Boko Haram insurgents. 6 others were injured. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force North West Operation Hadarin Dadji (OPHD) killed 5 terrorists and recovered arms and ammunition including operational motorcycle and communication gadgets. The incident happened clearance operation.
