title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force North West Operation Hadarin Dadji (OPHD) neutralised 5 terrorists and recovered arms and ammunition including operational motorcycle and communication gadgets. The incident happened when the operatives raided the enclaves of the bandits.

title: Robbery/ISWAP Attack, Nasarawa
description: 4 people were killed during a robbery attack on a supermarket. Scores were left with bullet wounds. There were unverified allegations that ISWAP was involved in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Web Newspaper (4 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 6 people were killed while one person was injured when bandits raided a community at night. Some people were alleged to have been kidnapped by the gunmen.

title: Soldiers vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The leader of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorist group in Nigeria, Ba’a Shuwa, and scores of his fighters,bwere killed during a major military offensive. Ba’a Shuwa and his groups of terrorists were mostly responsible for attacks, ambushes and IED/mine laying in some parts of Borno and Yobe states.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed 2 wood-loggers in a bush. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists ambushed the loggers in a mountainous area.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 people lost their lives in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. 2 people were injured in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram terrorists killed 10 people and burnt several houses. They attacked the residents during the New Year celebration. Some people were also kidnapped by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (11 ) , The Punch (12 ) , The Guardian (11 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits raided a community, killed 3 people and kidnapped 8 others. Soldiers were drafted to the community to scare the attackers aware.

title: Banditry, Nasarawa
description: 2 friends, Ango Habakkuk, a.k.a (Ango Gentle), a technician and Ewuga Williams, a security man were killed by fleeing bandits.

title: Vandals Kill NSCDC Officer, Borno
description: An NSCDC official died when vandals bombed 3 power transmission towers. He lost his live after stepping on a minor line while inspecting the vandalised electricity tower.Vandals, believed to be Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgents have targeted transmission towers in Yobe and Borno states and disrupted power in some parts of the states.

title: Found Dead, FCT (Abuja)
description: A corpse suspected to be that of a herder-bandit was found in a forest near a community. It is assumed that the victim was one of the bandits who were killed when security operatives raided the forest some times in the past. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 weeks.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Suspected bandits burnt a mother, her daughter-in-law and two children alive in an attack on a community. They were killed inside their room.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 villagers and abducted 7 others. The incident happened during a night invasion by the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members attacked a community and killed 2 people. The attackers raided the community on motorcycles and carted away food items.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed in an ambush by soldiers. An AK-47 Rifle, one magazine, five rounds of 7.62 mm, three motorcycles and one baofeng radio were recovered from the gang.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers killed 5 bandits during a clearance operation. Their camp was destroyed and 12 motorcycles were recovered.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: Mr. Abege Ulam an elder in the NKST Church, and 3 farmers were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The elder was killed when he heard gunshots and attempted to know what was happening.
place: Turan community at Dasa in Gaambe-Tiev

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. A AK-47 Rifle, one AK-47 Rifle magazine, one Dane gun and two motorcycles were recovered.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: 2 bandits were killed by soldiers who were on clearance operation. Some arms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents while 13 kidnapped victims were rescued.

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: A pastor affiliated with the Redeemed Christian Church of God (RCCG) and 3 others were killed during raids on 2 communities. Many residents were abducted during the raids which spanned within a week.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: No fewer than 16 people were killed in an attack reportedly carried out by suspected Fulani herdsmen.Houses were destroyed while many residents were displaced.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , The Punch (14 ) , The Nation (16 ) , Daily Trust (22 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers on clearance operation killed 3 bandits in an ambush, rescued one kidnapped victim, and recovered N50,000, two mobile phones, one motorcycle and two cutlasses.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed a man for not allowing his daughter to marry him. Rather, the lady was given to another man. After the lady's daughter was killed, the bandits asked the husband to divorce the lady to allow the bandit marry her. Their wish was granted and the lady was remarried and taken into the forest. This event was backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Police vs Bandit, Enugu
description: Operatives of Enugu State Police Command serving in the Hawk Tactical Squad killed a bandit who was part of a gang that kidnapped some travelers. It was reported that the operatives engaged the bandits, killed one of them and rescued the kidnap victims.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The terrorists went on rampage, shooting sporadically, burning houses and looting food items.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Sokoto
description: Bandits raided a community, killed 1 person, abducted 6 others and burnt 2 motorcycles. The attack was carried out in the morning.

title: Police vs Bandits, Taraba
description: An Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP), Aminu Nuhu, and three bandits lost their lives in an exchange of gunfire. The incident happened when men of the Taraba State Police Command clashed with the bandits.
place: hills of Yoro and Mararaba Kunini area
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 )

title: Bandits vs Ansaru Militants, Kaduna
description: 5 members of Ansaru militants were killed by some bandits during a clash. It was reported that some bandits were also killed during the reprisal attack by the Ansaru militants.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 4 people lost their lives when bandits opened fire on a moving vehicle. Several other people were reportedly injured in the attack which happened on a highway. The incident happened in the night.
place: Dogon Karfe on the Gusau-Talata Mafara highway

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 4 farmers and abducted 8 others. The victims were harvesting their crops when the attackers struck.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: Landlord vs Student, Delta
description: An undergraduate of Delta State Polytechnic, Ishie Abraham, was shot dead by his landlord, Mr Ajari Ajaska Felix. What led to the shooting was not reported.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: A man was shot dead by some assailants. The gunmen killed the him when they attacked the community.
place: Shurum of Dorowa Babuje before Marit District

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 1 person was killed and burnt in a mini shop. Foodstuff were looted during the attack.

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Troops of the joint Task Force North West Operaction Hadarin Daji (OPHD) killed 3 bandits and rescued 6 victims during a raid on the terrorists' enclave. The troops recovered ammunition and other working tools from the bandits.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of terrorists including a kingpin "Yellow Jambros" were killed by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch (NAF). It was reported that the terrorists were trailed to their hideouts.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 4 people were killed while 6 others were injured in renewed attacks on some communities by gunmen suspected to be herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits' informants were killed and 6 others were arrested by some soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened at the bandit's hideout.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A commander of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN), identified as Ebube Virus was killed and others injured by police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened during a gun duel between the gunmen in their hideouts.

title: Bandits Kill Driver, Niger
description: Bandits shot dead a bus driver and kidnapped 8 passengers. It was reported that the commercial bus was burnt down completely.

title: Bandits vs Soldier, Kaduna
description: A Soldier was killed and 11 others were kidnapped by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the night when the bandits riding on motorcycles stormed the community and attacked the residents.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 3 persons were killed and 1 other was injured by gunmen suspected to be bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 5 persons were killed and several others were abducted by suspected bandits. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by their Improvised Explosive Device (IED). It was reported the incident happened while they were planting the device along the patrol routes of the military army.

title: Bandits vs Hunters, Taraba
description: 50 bandits were killed by police operatives in collaboration with other security agencies. It was initially reported that 18 hunters were killed in the attack by bandits. It was a retaliation by the security operatives after the attackers had raided the community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , The Guardian (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (50 )

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen suspected to be IPOB members enforcing the Monday sit-at-home order killed 2 policemen in a filling station and a civilian. They arrived the busy junction and shot sporadically at people.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Vanguard (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 loggers who went to fetch wood in the bush were ambushed and beheaded by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the bodies of the loggers were badly dismembered by their attackers.
place: Bush around Bali, a village near Damboa

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits including their leader, Bala Wuta, were killed by combined security operatives. It was reported that the incident happened when the police and the vigilante engaged the bandits who opened fire on them while on patrol in the community.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Zamfara
description: Bandits, led by one of their notorious commanders, Damina, killed a resident and abducted over 100 others. It was reported that the bandits struck the community at night.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF air strikes killed over 100 Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters. Among the victims was a wanted Boko Haram commander, Abu Asad.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 persons lost their lives while in captivity. It was reported that some kidnappers invaded a town a few weeks ago and abducted many residents. It was also reported that during the raids several properties were destroyed.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 11 people were killed during a raid on come communities by bandits. Many others were injured while others were abducted.
place: Yangtu Special Development Area, Tukwog community along Takum-Manya Road.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Taraba
description: 2 people lost their lives during a raid on some communities by bandits. Many people were injured while properties were destroyed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 terrorists were killed by Troops of the Joint Task Force North-West Operation Hadarin Daji. It was reported that the incident happened during clearance operations at the various hideouts of the terrorists. It was also reported that weapons and some cows were recovered after the incident.
place: Tazame, Mashema, Gandaya, Maje, and Doka villages surrounding the forest in Gandaya Village

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed and several others were arrested by Troops of Operation SAFE HAVEN (OPSH). It was reported that the incident happened during a search operation in a village.

title: Gunmen vs Locals, Plateau
description: 4 natives employed by soldiers to clear a bush for the establishment of a new camp for soldiers were killed by some bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 6 bandits were killed by Troops of Operation SAFE HAVEN (OPSH) while on a fighting patrol. It was reported that some arms were recovered after the operation.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A policeman was killed by bandits who abducted 17 people, including women and children. It was reported that the bandits number about 150 stormed the village at night on 50 motorbikes with each bike carrying three people. It was reported that a monarch's wife was part of those kidnapped.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 people who went to an outskirt of the village to scavenge for firewood were gunned down by suspected members of Boko Haram terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists ambushed the security convoy of Governor Mai Mala Buni of Yobe State, killing one policeman and injuring 3 others. The security convoy of the governor ran into the ambush of the terrorists.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several terrorists were killed during a clash between Boko Haram and the Islamic State for West African Province (ISWAP). The clash was a retaliation for the killing of ISWAP members a few weeks ago.
sources_of_information: The Punch (60 ) , The Nation (60 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The air component of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) killed many terrorists belonging to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). The terrorists were travelling in canoes before they were decimated by the security operatives.
place: Baranga village on the shores of Lake Chad

title: Bandits vs Pastor, Kaduna
description: A pastor with the Evangelical Church Winning All (ECWA), identified as Mako Maraya was killed by bandits while his wife was kidnapped. It was reported that the deceased son was injured by bandits a few weeks ago when they invaded the house.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Sokoto
description: Unknown gunmen killed 1 person and injured 4 others when they stormed 2 communities at night. It was reported that the communities were near the Usman Danfodio University, Sokoto.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen were killed by unidentified gunmen who attacked a patrol team. It was reported that the operatives were on patrol on the outskirts of the city when the armed hoodlums in a tinted Highlander vehicle with an unknown number attacked them. A version of the story stated that about 12 people were killed in the attack.
place: Nwofe Road on the outskirts of Abakaliki
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (12 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Kaduna
description: Dozens of Boko Haram fighters and commanders were killed when NAF bombed their hideout. The attack was carried out after surveillance revealed the presence of their kingpin known as Boderi and his foot soldiers in an area. It is assumed that no fewer than 2 dozen of bandits (assuming at least 24), were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (24 ) , The Punch (24 ) , Nigerian Tribune (24 ) , Other newspaper 3 (24 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 6 bandits during clearance patrols in some communities. It was reported that several weapons were recovered from the hoodlums who had been terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: The Nation (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , The Guardian (6 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A driver of a vehicle, a woman, Sharifa Noma with her twin babies, and 5 other people were killed by marauding bandits. The incident happened when the bandits attacked some communities.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by Troops of 1 Divison of the Nigerian Army and Operation Whirl Punch during a clearance operation. It was reported that some weapons were recovered from the victims.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Oyo
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herders killed 1 person and kidnapped 2 others when they stormed a community. It was reported that the bandits had been terrorizing the community.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits were killed and many others were injured by police and vigilantes operatives during a clash. It was reported that the bandits on motorcycles had earlier invaded the community, killed 8 people and rustled cows.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 4 persons were killed and 3 others were injured by bandits who invaded some villages in a community. It was reported that 17 people were abducted after the incident.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 4 persons including Nasir Alhaji Sule were killed and 30 others were abducted by bandits who invaded some communities.
place: Gidan Kakale and Ruwa Wuri's Road

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Division 1 of the Nigerian Army and Operation Whirl Punch killed three terrorists at different operations. The clearance operation was carried out when the troops encountered the terrorists.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: A female student of St Paul's College was killed and several others were injured by bandits suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen. It was reported that the bandits attacked the victims while they were going home after school hours on their school bus.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Mine Explosion, Borno
description: Two civilian JTF commanders and 4 lieutenants were killed in a mine explosion. The General Commander of Gambarou, Bukar Goni, and the Commander in charge of Ngala area, Malam Cede were among the people who died when they encountered the Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by the roadside by suspected Boko Haram members.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Air strikes by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets killed many terrorists and destroyed their gun trucks. The air strikes also destroyed terrorist enclaves situated in the area.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 5 persons were killed and several others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. Injured victims were taken to the hospital for treatment.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The corpses of 2 farmers were discovered in a nearby bush a day after bandits raided the community. The attackers imposed taxes before allowing them to harvest their crops. Those who fail to comply are attacked and killed or injured.

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits killed residents after they collected ransom from their families. In retaliation, members of some vigilance groups stormed the hideout of the bandits and eliminated 27 of them.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 11 persons were killed and several houses were burnt by some bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that several others were injured and animals were taken away.
place: Gidan-Buwai and Maikujera Villages in Gandi District

title: Bandits Kill 5, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed while several others were injured by armed bandits who stormed a village with sophisticated weapons. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Plateau
description: 4 bandits were killed and 19 kidnappers were arrested by Troops of Operation Safe Haven. The operatives were on clearance operation.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by Troops of 1 Divison Nigerian Arny and Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation by the Troops.
place: Maidaro, Ngade, Ahla and Rikau Village

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed during a joint security operation by soldiers and vigilantes. The suspects were behind the abduction of Reverend Andrew Amana of St Francis Catholic Church Godo-godo. Weapons were also recovered from the suspects.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: About 25 people were killed and 30 others were injured by bandits who stormed a Maulud procession in a community. It was reported that about 21 people were abducted.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (25 ) , Daily Trust (25 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 9 farmers were and scores were declared missing when suspected Boko Haram terrorists invaded some communities. Many of the victims were rice farmers who had gone to the fields to harvest their crops. They were attacked for refusing to pay N.6m tax imposed on them.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (9 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 2 people and abducted 4 others. One of the abducted victims is a lecturer of the College of Education Maru, Dr. Nassiru Anka.

title: Boko Haram vs Businessman, Borno
description: A businessman identified as Alhaji Gana was killed by terrorists while working on his farmland. It was reported that 4 persons were abducted by the terrorists.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed by Troops of 1 Divison Nigerian Arny and Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation by the Troops. It was also reported that some weapons were recovered after the operation.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: One Dantala Gyara Miya was killed and 4 soldiers were missing when bandits invaded the community. It was reported that the terrorists ambushed the village while on their way to the market.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Nigerian soldiers killed scores of bandits during an operation. The bandits had ambushed the soldiers but ended up losing their fighters when soldiers cleared the ambush. It is assumed that at least 20 scores of bandits lost their lives.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralized 2 bandits during a clearance operation. The incident happened when the troops made contact with the bandits. They recovered one AK-47 rifle, one AK-47 magazine, 4 7.62mm Special ammunition, one Honda motorcycle and one Techno phone.
place: Kankomi, Juji, Gwantu, Kujeni, Kikwari and Kaso

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an operation by NAF. Their hideouts were targeted in the operation which was conducted on communities along the Kumadugu/Yobe River and Mandara Mountains in Borno and Yobe states. 160 terrorists, including their commanders, were killed in the operation, It is therefore assumed that about 80 of the victims were killed in Borno. Also see incident in IBD028321
sources_of_information: The Guardian (80 ) , The Punch (80 ) , The Nation (80 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian army, together with some farmers, went after some bandits who had been terrorising the farmers. They killed one of the bandits while others ran away with gunshot wounds.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 6 persons were killed and 4 others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night. It was also reported that several others were abducted during the incident. While battling the bandits, a philanthropist, Alhaji Mamman Duhuwa, was accidentally shot dead by a vigilante. He died from gunshot injuries.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an operation by NAF. Their hideouts were targeted in the operation which was conducted on communities along the Kumadugu/Yobe River and Mandara Mountains in Borno and Yobe states. 160 terrorists, including their commanders, were killed in the operation, It is therefore assumed that about 80 of the victims were killed in Yobe State. See incident in IBD028322
place: Bulabulin and Degbawa villages along the Kumadugu/Yobe River

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division Nigerian Army and Operation Whirl Punch killed 4 bandits who were terrorizing the locals. During the operation, troops recovered one AK 47 rifle, one AK 47 magazine, one machete, one mobile phone, and 14 motorcycles from the criminals.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Soldiers raided Mai Solar’s camp, destroyed it, and killed several terrorists. The NAF airstrikes took out clusters of enclaves used as hideouts by the kingpin and his boys. It is assumed that no less than 10 people died in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Several bandit commanders and fighters were killed in airstrikes by NAF. The camp of Bandura, a notorious bandit kingpin, was destroyed. It is assumed that not less than 10 people were killed in the raid.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 21 mourners, mostly women and children, were killed when a tricycle was struck by an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Boko Haram terrorists.
place: Goni Mittiri village near Gumsa town, Nguro Kayayya

title: Villagers vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: Residents of Jajuwal village confronted gunmen suspected to be kidnappers who invaded their village and killed one of the hoodlums. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village to abduct villagers but were repelled. The villagers rescued the abducted victims.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a farmer, injured two and abducted 25 others in a community. The incident happened when the attackers invaded the community with guns and machete while locals were sleeping.

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Borno
description: A mobile officer, Inspector Luka attached to MOPOL 53, was killed by Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists on his farm. It was reported that the terrorists, who hid in a tree, captured the victim and seized his rifle before removing his uniform, killed him and left him with boxers.
place: Mohammed Indimi Estate in Bama Town

title: Soldiers vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: Soldiers arrested four suspected bandits’ informants and one of the gang members, Bala, was shot in the leg while trying to escape which later led to his death.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: No fewer than 39 residents were killed when Boko Haram raided 3 villages. Houses were burnt while many others were injured.
place: Nguro Kayaiya, Goni Mittiri and Jororo communities.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 17 youths who were between the ages of 20 to 30 were shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents while young children and the old were spared. It was reported that the insurgents took the measure after several warnings to the villagers to pay their taxes but to no avail.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (17 ) , The Punch (40 ) , Vanguard (20 ) , The Nation (24 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised a wanted notorious bandit nicknamed Mai-Nasara in a forest. The operatives also killed 2 other suspected bandits who were part of the same gang.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: NAF vs Boko Haram Terrorists, Borno
description: 22 terrorists were killed by members of the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the incident happened based on the intelligence from the Land Component of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was also reported that two gun trucks were destroyed during the operation.
sources_of_information: The Nation (22 ) , Other newspaper 3 (22 ) , Other newspaper 2 (22 )

title: Bandits Kill Teacher, Kaduna
description: A primary school teacher identified as Mr. Sunday Akorh and a couple were killed by gunmen. He was the only classroom teacher in the primary school of Unguwan Dorowa Bakhira settlement.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A chief Imam identified as Mallam Goni Muktar was killed and 7 others were abducted by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the deceased residence at night on a Volkswagen Gulf.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who invaded a village at night. It was reported that the bandits also abducted 16 other people, including a 13-year-old child. They came in large numbers and wielded sophisticated weapons.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Abia
description: 2 operatives of the Nigerian Police were killed by some gunmen. It was reported that the policemen were trying to effect an arrest before they were killed by the gunmen. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that they were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits who invaded a community with the intention of killing the emir killed 5 members of the community. It was reported that the palace guard also killed one of the bandits.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the 233 Battalion of the Nigerian Army killed 4 terrorists and recovered arms from them. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the 159 Battalion ambushed, killed 6 insurgents and recovered weapons including 2 AK-47 rifles, 2 motorcycles and a mobile phone.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandit informants were killed by Troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation in a community.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a vigilante member and another person in an attack on a filling station. 3 others sustained varying degrees of injuries.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 4 bandits were killed and others were arrested by Troops of Operation Safe Haveb (OPSH) during an operation Hakorin Damisa IV. It was reported that 4 victims were rescued.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits, after an attack on a filling station, killed a middle-aged man in a community not far from the filling station and abducted his wife and children.

title: Ansaru Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 persons, including an Imam identified as Malam Mamuda and a worshipper, Kabir were killed while 2 others, Bilya Mairabo and Ashiru Mairabo were injured when Ansaru terrorists invaded the mosque in the area and opened fire on them.
place: Sabon Layi, Kakangi Ward, in Ga Allah Babba Area
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Several bandits were killed by military men during a reprisal attack. It was reported that the bandits had earlier attacked the village but were repelled by the local security, resulting in 2 deaths.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of the 146 Battalion, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), neutralized 9 Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists and arrested one of their logistic suppliers. The victims were killed during a fierce gun battle while others escaped with gunshot wounds.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 9 persons, including a police officer, were killed and 10 others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that 7 others were kidnapped during the raid.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (8 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: 1 bandit was killed and 3 persons were rescued by a joint combined security operatives. It was reported that the operatives engaged the bandits in a gunfire.

title: Army vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) was killed by the Nigerian Army during an operation.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 50 bandits were eliminated by troops during air interdiction carried out by Nigeria Air Force fighter jets. The incident was aimed at ridding the state of bandits.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 6 members of the Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) were killed by troops of 5 Brigade Operation Hadin Kai in an ambush. It was reported that the troops engaged the terrorists in an exchange of gunfire in a bush.
place: Binduldul General area along MSR Maiduguri, Gubio-Kareto-Damask Road

title: Boko Haram vs Customs Officer, Yobe
description: A customer officer identified as Usman Gombe was killed by some Boko Haram terrorists who attacked their office. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the customs office in a Volkswagen Golf and a Land Rover and started shooting.
place: Maine Soroa Road in Geidam town

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: A leader of some bandits and kidnappers terrorizing residents was killed by military personnel. The victim identified as Yau was killed by the operatives after a long period of terrorizing and kidnapping residents.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A herder identified as Musa Haruna was killed and 1 other, Alhaji Auta Baba was kidnapped by gunmen. It was reported that the bandits also rustled some animals away after the incident.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 2 persons were killed and 3 others were abducted by bandits who invaded the community. A version of the story stated that the bandits killed three people in the attack.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 3 persons, including a hunter, Bashir Unguwar Shekarau, and 2 commercial drivers, Mustapha Adamu and Malam Muktar known as Teacher were killed and 3 others were injured by bandits who attacked them on the highway.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen raided some communities and killed Joe Igba, Nyali Akula, Donald Tarvihi, and Tyozenda Orkoho. Many people were reportedly injured in the attack.
place: Nagi Camp in Mbachohon council ward

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Ayev Jôgunô (Mbavihi-Mba- zar), Faiga Mwuese Apefan (a k.a. Sixteen Sixteen) (Mbazar), Msendoo Tertese Vaachia (Mba- gum), James Mhen Nyerga Ior- liam (Tse-Ihyôôn-Iwendyer) and Orgbee Mnguerorga (Tse-Nyajo- Mbaiwem) were reported killed during a raid on their community by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Many others were injured.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 persons were killed and 11 others were injured by some armed bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that about 50 people, including the district head and his 8-year-old daughter, were abducted during the incident.

title: Boko Haram kills 7, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed and 3 others were released by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the freed victims who were farmers were abducted while working on their farmlands.
place: Rijiya Biyu, behind the University of Maiduguri

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 people and abducted 14 others from a village. The incident happened when the bandits attacked the village in large numbers and whisked away the residents. 2 bandit informants, Hussain and Ziru were later killed by soldiers.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Bauchi
description: 9 members of a local security outfit known as Yan Ba Beli were killed and others were injured in an ambush by gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened while the victims were in search of the bandits in a forest who were terrorizing the community.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Other newspaper 2 (9 )

title: NAF vs Terrorists, Borno
description: Several terrorists, including Boko Haram and ISWAP members, were killed by air strikes of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 40 terrorists were killed.
place: Bukar Meram, near the Lake Chad region
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Vanguard (100 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: A farmer was killed on his farm by suspected Fulani herders. Attempts by operatives of the Oyo Security Outfit, Operation Burst to foil the attack resulted in more injuries and deaths. The operatives were ambushed when they went to foil the attack. A source reported that many were killed. It is assumed at least 10 people lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Gunmen vs Registrar, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The decomposed body of the deputy registrar of the Federal Polytechnic, Uwana Afikpo, Ebonyi State identified as Innocent Obi Dee Onye Army was found after he was macheted in his residence and abducted at night by gunmen dressed in Military and police uniforms. The attackers were reportedly pro-Biafra agitators.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandits vs Ransom Bearer, Kaduna
description: An unidentified man was killed by some bandits. It was reported that the deceased was killed after delivering ransom to them for a kidnapped victim.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: About 50 bandits were neutralized during air strikes by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). The bandits were in a convoy of about 70 motorcycles when they were killed.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 4 persons were killed and 5 others were injured by bandits who invaded a community. It happened shortly after the state governor visited the LGA.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Malam Usman Sarki, the Village Head of Zazzaga in Munya LGA of Niger was killed by bandits during a raid on his community. Scores of residents, including children and women, were abducted by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Delta
description: Some Fulani herdsmen shot dead a member of the Ubulu-Uku Vigilance group identified as Sule Ukah. The incident happened when the gunmen laid ambush on the victim. During the exchange of gunfire between the herders and some men of the vigilante, a commercial motorcyclist and a woman were killed..
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A yet-to-be-identified gunman was killed by angry residents in the wee hours of the day. It was reported that many of the insurgents were injured. Members of the community also recovered 150 rustled animals from the insurgents.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 4 persons were killed and 5 others were injured by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that some abducted persons were set free when the police engaged the bandits in a gun duel.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Kidnap Victims, Kaduna
description: 5 infants among the 17 people kidnapped by bandits a month ago in some communities died in captivity after their mothers fell ill and could not breastfeed them. The bandits had earlier collected N19 million from the community but only released 4 of the captives instead of all of them.
place: Anguwar Danlele and Anguwar Bawa villages

title: Banditry, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed and 11 others were missing when some bandits invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased were cattle traders who were coveying their animals and goods to another community.

title: Communal Crisis, Osun
description: 8 persons were killed and many others injured in a renewed communal clash that erupted in Ifon/ Orolu communities. It was also reported that many houses were burnt while sporadic gunshots rent air.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 )

title: Bandits Kill LGA Councillor, Katsina
description: Samaila Buhari Mairago, the councilor representing Nasarawa Ward was killed when bandits raided his community. His abductors made attempts to demand ransom but later killed the victim.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits killed 3 people and abducted several others during an attack on a community. It was reported that the bandits who came in large numbers also rustled some animals.

title: Army vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and Eastern Security Network were killed and 4 others were arrested by the Troops of the Joint Task Force, South-East. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation at the suspect's hideouts. It was reported that the troops found several other corpses in the den of the IPOB. Due to the nature of the story, it assumed that 10 corpses were found.
sources_of_information: The Punch (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (12 )

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram commander in charge of Sambisa and Gwoza axis identified as Ali Gana Alhaji Ali was killed in an ambush by fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). Both groups have been enmeshed in supremacy battles.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: ISWAP Kill 1, Borno
description: 1 person was killed by fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). The incident happened when the terrorists attacked some communities for leaking information to the army about their presence. They abducted 2 people during the attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Kukah Yari was killed while 19 others were kidnapped by bandits. The kidnap victims were identified as Yakubu Abba, Basiru Maiwada, Keziya Silas, Peace Silas, Lami Istifanus, Habila Musa, Bege Liazarus, Joshua Abuki, Juliana Habila, Stella Yohanna.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Borno
description: Fighters of Boko Haram terrorist group killed a police officer. It was reported that the officer was killed while he was working on his farm.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army decimated several terrorists belonging to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). The incident happened during a clearance operation by the army.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several terrorists were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) military. It was reported that the terrorists were ambushed and their base was also destroyed.
place: Tumbun and Tumbun Shittu areas along the fringes of Laka Chad
sources_of_information: The Nation (13 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 )

title: Bandits Kill 6, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed while 4 others were injured when bandits attacked a community in the night. The bandits invaded the community in the night and opened fire on two houses.
sources_of_information: The Nation (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Troops of Forward Operating Base (FOB) killed many bandits during clearance operation. The incident happened when the troops tried to dislodge the bandits from a forest. It is assumed that 20 of the bandits were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A soldier and 5 passengers were killed when Boko Haram terrorists ambushed security vehicles escorting motorists. 5 commercial vehicles including a security patrol van were set ablaze, and many passengers were unaccounted for.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 10 farmers and abducted several others. They came roving across farms in search of food and cash and when the farmers said they couldn't afford the amounts they requested, they killed 10 of them, all men, and went away with others.
place: Fields between Bulakunkumma and Maiwa villages of the Baram Karowa ward

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed about 5 bandits when the gunmen abducted some female students of Federal University, Gusa. The incident happened during a shoot targeted at foiling the kidnap incident.

title: Gunmen vs Nursing Mother, Osun
description: A nursing mother identified as Adijat was killed in her residence by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened at night while the deceased was taking her bath in the bathroom.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 21 bandits were killed by a combined team of security operatives, vigilantes and hunters. The bandits had earlier killed 2 people including Marafan Mai Inuwa and abducted many others who were rescued by the operatives.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (22 ) , Other newspaper 3 (23 ) , Nigerian Tribune (23 )

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A combined security force killed 3 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra(IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) at their hideouts. It was reported that the suspects were planning to enforce the illegal sit-at-home in the state.

title: Army vs Gunmen, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 members of the Biafran National Guards were killed by Troops from the 14 Brigade. It was reported that the army ambushed the terrorists in a forest which was being used as a base.
place: Igboro forest, a boundary between Ohafia and Arochukwu
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Bandits, Niger
description: 4 people were killed while an unspecified number of others were abducted by gunmen suspected to be bandits. The bandits, riding on several motorcycles, each carrying two or three persons wielding dangerous weapons, invaded the community and shot sporadically into the air.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 10 persons were killed and several others were injured by some bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that houses and shops were set ablaze during the incident.

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmers, Borno
description: 2 farmers were killed in their farms by suspected Boko Haram insurgents. It was alleged that the attack was to discourage farmers from harvesting their crops.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 4 others were abducted by some bandits. It was reported that the bandit invaded the community with guns and shot sporadically at people.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed and 3 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.
place: Dogon Noma Village, within Maro Ward
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Sokoto
description: 4 people lost their lives during an attack by bandits. It was reported that the bandits abducted 18 people and made away with livestock and other valuables.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Indigenous People of Biafra was shot dead when police raided their hideout. It was reported that several members of the group escaped during the raid with gunshot injuries.

title: ISWAP vs Fishermen, Borno
description: 2 fishermen were killed and others were injured by the Islamic State West African Province terrorists (ISWAP) fighters. It was reported that the incident happened while the victims were fishing.
place: Falinkime and Madangwiya Island, Lake Chad Area
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 )

title: Police vs Kidnappers, Delta
description: Operatives of Delta State Police command shot dead 4 kidnappers in a gun battle. The incident happened when the police tried to rid the state of bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Man vs Wife, Borno
description: Domestic Violence: A repentant Boko Haram terrorist killed his wife, Hafsat. It was reported that Dauda clubbed his 45-year-old wife to death and buried her on the farm.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 6 persons, including a 2-year-old child, were killed and several others injured by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that some cattle were killed during the attack.

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Nigerian Air Force airstrikes decimated several fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) and Boko Haram terrorists in a clearance operation. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack. Some papers reported that scores of the insurgents were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: A housewife, identified as Patience, was killed by bandits while a police officer was shot and some of his family members were abducted.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 2 persons were killed and 6 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Villagers, Enugu
description: 3 villagers were killed by masked gunmen who invaded a community. The victims were identified as Hillary Uche, a popular dealer in block and cement, Kingsley, a machine part dealer, and a young man known as FM.

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmers, Borno
description: 6 farmers were killed in their farms by suspected Boko Haram insurgents. It was alleged that the attack was to discourage farmers from harvesting their crops.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Bandits Kill Seminarian, Kaduna
description: The parish house of Saint Raphael’s Catholic Church in Zangon Kataf LGA of Kaduna State was burnt by bandits and a seminarian, Stephen Danlami, was killed in the process. He died from the smoke he inhaled while trying to escape from the fire. Some of the killers were identified as Mato and Ahmad Khalifa.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Guards, Benue
description: 2 members of Benue State Community Volunteer Guards (BSCVG) and a lady were shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the attacks also left several people injured in the 2 separate attacks.

title: Kidnappers Kill Director, Niger
description: The Director of Works of Mariga LGA of Niger state, Alhaji Yakubu Bala, was killed by his abductors 3 days after he was kidnapped. He was kidnapped alongside 23 others by bandits. It is assumed he was killed a day before the discovery of his corpse.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Sector 3 Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) killed one terrorist and recovered arms and ammunition during a raid on Boko Haram enclave.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 7 persons were killed and 2 others were injured by some bandits who invaded a mosque in the area. It was reported that the deceased were inside the mosque praying when the bandits attacked them.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , The Nation (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Boko Haram vs Imam, Borno
description: An unidentified chief Imam was killed by some terrorists who invaded a community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: An 86-year-old man identified as Joshua Deme was killed by some gunmen at his farm. It was reported that the deceased was attacked while working at his farm by the gunmen who were fleeing the area.

title: Bandits vs Customs Officers, Kebbi
description: 2 officers of the Nigeria Customs Service, Kebbi State Command, were killed by bandits while they were on patrol duty. The deceased were identified as Abdullahi Mohammed (Customs Assistant II) and A.K. Shehu (an Inspector).

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several terrorists and their commanders were killed during a clash between Boko Haram and the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP). It was reported that ISWAP fighters came on canoes and invaded the hideout of the Bakoura Buduma-led Boko Haram fighters.

title: Bandits vs Pastor, Kaduna
description: A pastor, of the Tawailu Baptist Church, Rev. Mayau, was killed by some bandits while working on his farm.

title: Bandits vs Army, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed when a group of bandits waylaid troops of the Nigerian Army. Four motorcycles and 2 AK 47 riffles were recovered from the bandits during the attack.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person was killed while 2 others were arrested when men of the Nigerian Army foiled an attack on the Forward Operating Base by the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) fighters.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A man identified as Rabilu Tukur was killed by some bandits. It was reported that the deceased, a staff of Danmusa LG was returning home after dropping a passenger at a village when he was attacked.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 persons were killed and several women were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed and a woman was abducted by some bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandit stormed the community at night and attacked the resident.

title: Police Officer vs Tricycle Rider, Kogi
description: A tricycle rider identified as Abuh Wada known as Abuh Keke was shot dead by a stray bullet from the gun of a police officer. It was reported the deceased was hit by the bullet while coming out of his house trying to quell a crisis in the area.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed while 7 others, including the son of the Emir of Bungudu, Abdulrahman Hassan, and former State Programme Officer of the International Fund for Agricultural Development, IFAD, Abubakar Bungudu were abducted by bandits who invaded the town.

title: NAF Helicopter Crash, Niger
description: A NAF helicopter that was on a casualty evacuation mission crashed. The pilot was believed to have died in the incident. There were reports that about 8 soldiers lost their lives. It was unknown if the helicopter was shot down by bandits as rumoured in some quarters.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (13 ) , Other newspaper 2 (12 )

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmer, Borno
description: A kidnapped rice farmer was killed by Boko Haram after his family failed to raise the demanded ransom. 5 other victims who were kidnapped were released upon the payment of N1 million ransom. They were rounded up by the insurgents while working on their farms.

title: Banditry vs Soldiers, Niger
description: 50 bandits, 13 military personnel and many vigilantes (assuming not less than 10) were killed during an encounter. Soldiers had ambushed the bandits who were crossing a river with a large number of rustled livestock. Among the fallen soldiers were a Major and a Captain.

title: Army vs Bandits , Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were killed and 10 kidnapped victims were rescued by the Nigerian Army during a gun duel. It was reported that 1 Ak-47 rifle and other weapons were recovered after the operation.

title: Fulani herdsmen Attacks, Plateau
description: 2 women were killed and 2 others were injured by some gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the community and laid siege on the victims who were returning from a nearby market.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 2 persons identified as Suleiman Garba and Aminu Abas were shot dead by some bandits. It was reported that the deceased, who were Islmaiya teachers were among the ones that were kidnapped by the bandits who invaded a community a few weeks ago.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: 3 operatives of the Eastern Security Network of the Indigenous People of Biafra were killed by the police. The incident happened when a combined team of Police Special Forces and Operatives serving in a local government raided the camp of the hoodlums.

title: Fulani Attack, Plateau
description: About 21 people were killed when two communities were attacked by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the communities have been experiencing constant attacks by the gunmen.
place: Batin and Rayogot communities in Heipang district

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 100 fighters of Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) lost their lives in clashes between both groups. It was reported that both groups engaged in a week of supremacy battle.
place: Kukawa, Madayi and Kwatan Mota axes

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram members were killed by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai during an ambush. It was reported that the troops recovered some weapons during the operation.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed and 14 others were abducted by some terrorists who invaded the community. Among the victims was the son of Tudun Ali ward head.
place: Yakkaka , Yallagwada , Maiturmi village in Tudun Ali Ward

title: Bandits Kill 3, Taraba
description: 3 people were killed during an early morning raid on a community. The victims were murdered when they were getting ready to go to farms.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 terrorists were killed by Troops of 1 Divison who were on a clearance operation. It was reported that 1 AK-47 rifle and other weapons were recovered after the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Hadarin Daji killed 10 suspected terrorists during a rescue operation for some kidnapped suspects. One of the victims, a female, was killed by the kidnappers during the exchange of fire with the troops. Arms and ammunition were recovered from the suspects.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Katsina
description: 3 bandits were killed and 2 soldiers were injured during a routine patrol in the community by the Troops attached to Sector 2 (OPHD).

title: Villager vs Bandits' Leader, Kaduna
description: A yet-to-be-identified villager engaged some bandits who attacked him on his farm and killed the leader of the group. It was reported that the bandits came to abduct the father after killing 3 of his children in the past. The man fought the bandits, snatched their gun and shot the bandits' leader identified as Wizi.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Borno
description: 11 Boko Haram members were killed and 4 others were arrested in their hideouts by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). It was reported that the terrorists were ambushed by the troops during a clearance operation.
place: Garin Ari Shira and Kashimri in Sambisa Forest

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit was killed by police operatives during a foiled attack on Muslim worshippers who were observing their Friday prayers.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 7 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims were attacked while working on the farms.
place: Unguwar Gajere comunity in the Kutemeshi Ward

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 people were killed in different attacks on some communities. No fewer than 63 people were kidnapped and 1000 others were displaced in the attacks.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were killed by the troops of the Joint Task Force North-West Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD). It was reported that the troops engaged the bandits in a gun duel.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 people were killed while many others were abducted during an attack on a community by suspected bandits. Many houses and shops were destroyed while cattle were also rustled.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: 2 persons were killed and 13 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning when the bandits stormed the community and launched their attack.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Plateau
description: 3 people, including a vigilante, were killed by suspected bandits and a large expanse of farmland was destroyed. The victims were attacked while they were asleep. While 2 of them were killed in a community, the 3rd victim was killed in a separate community.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 11 persons were shot dead and 1 other was injured by Boko Haram terrorists who invaded a community. It was reported that the farmers were attacked while working on their farms.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed when troops, in conjunction with other the Civilian Joint Task Force, laid an ambush on them. Arms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force bombarded the fighters of the Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) with fighter jets. Several of the ISWAP fighters were decimated in the clearance operation carried out by the air component of Operation Hadin Kai.

title: Bandits vs Immigration Officers, Sokoto
description: 2 officers of the Nigeria Immigration Service were killed and others were injured by some bandits who attacked them at a checkpoint. It was reported that the gunmen abducted some officers during the attack.

title: Kidnappers Kill 2, Plateau
description: Agada Sambo and Azi were killed by bandits who doubled as kidnappers when they were delivering ransom for their kidnapped relatives.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an ambush by soldiers belonging to the Joint Task Force North East Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). Arms and ammunition were recovered from them.

title: Bandits Kill Muslim Leader, Kaduna
description: A Muslim leader, the Vice-Chairman of Jama’atul Izalatul Bid’ah Wa Iqamatus-Sunnah, JIBWIS, Birnin-Gwari branch, Malam Yakubu Bugai and three farmers were killed by bandits. Scores of people, mostly farmers, were abducted during the raids.
place: Sabon-Layi, Kurgi, Yelwa, Tashan-Keji, Shiwaka, Unguwan Danfulani communities
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Soldiers attached to the 'Mangu Peace Project', a military exercise that was established to quell the herders/farmers clashes in the council, intercepted some bandits and killed many of them. It is assumed that about 10 of the bandits lost their lives while arms and ammunition were recovered from them. 10 suspects were also arrested by the soldiers.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 7 soldiers of Hadarin Daji. The bandits, who were in large numbers, ambushed the troops and invaded a village where they also killed 10 residents. Several bandits were also killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (30 ) , Daily Trust (29 ) , Nigerian Tribune (32 ) , Other newspaper 3 (27 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A notorious bandit identified as Alhaji Nashama and many of his followers were decimated in several airstrikes conducted by the NAF fighter jets. Their enclaves were also destroyed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Nasarawa
description: A commander of a vigilante group identified as Baba Gambo and 1 other member, Bashir, were killed by some gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen attacked the deceased in an ambush in a forest.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Vigilante, Enugu
description: Operatives of the Eastern Security Network, the militia wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), shot and killed 2 personnel of the Neighbourhood Watch Group. The incident happened when they were enforcing their illegal sit-at-hom order.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 bandits were neutralized by troops of Operation Hadarin Daji. The incident happened when the troops got information that the bandits were preparing to attack a village.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 2 members of a robbery gang were killed by DSS operatives and soldiers during an attack on the corporate office of Rock FM in the early hours of the day. The bandits also stole several items during the attack.

title: NAF vs Terrorists, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram members were killed by troops of the 21-Armored Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), in collaboration with Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) during a clearance in three communities.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Amaifeke Vigilante Group was killed and others were injured during a gun duel with members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN).

title: NAF vs Bandits, Katsina 2
description: About 22 bandits from the bandit camp controlled by a notorious kingpin Alhaji Abdulkareen Lawal, aka Abdulkareen Boss, were killed in strikes conducted by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD) in 2 LGAs. It is assumed 11 of the victims were in Batsari LGA while the other 11 were killed in Jibia LGA See incident in IBD027574. Both incidents were backdated by 2 days since no dates were reported.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Katsina 1
description: About 22 bandits from the bandit camp controlled by a notorious kingpin Alhaji Abdulkareen Lawal, aka Abdulkareen Boss, were killed in strikes conducted by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD) in 2 LGAs. It is assumed 11 of the victims were in Batsari LGA while the other 11 were killed in Jibia LGA 9See incident in IBD027583. Both incidents were backdated by 2 days since no dates were reported.

title: Gunmen Kill Traditional Ruler, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The traditional ruler of Ezuhu Nguru, Eze James Namdi, popularly called Mmiri Oma, was killed by gunmen. He was murdered in his residence at night.

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Delta
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and Eastern Security Network were killed by some security operatives. It was reported that the deceased was killed during a confrontation with a combined team of Nigerian Army, Police, and Department of State Services Personnel in a gun shootout.
place: Obodogwugwu Area of Okpanam Community, Fuji Junction area
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Vanguard (3 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed 6 terrorists and arrested 8 other terrorists' collaborators. The incident happened when the troops stormed the hideouts of the terrorists.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke neutralised 9 bandits and arrested 10 suspects. The troops also rescued 9 civilians who were kidnapped by the bandits. They also recovered one AK47 rifle, one fabricated pistol, one locally made pistol, one pump action ammo, 14 rounds of 7.62mm special, one motorcycle, cartridge, one mobile phone, machete, axe, fake Nigerian Police ID card and N35,000.

title: Gunmen vs Traditional Ruler, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A traditional ruler was killed by some gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Securuty Network (ESN). It was reported that the gunmen stormed the palace of the ruler and shot him dead.

title: Air Force vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 11 members of the Islamic State West Africa ISWAP) were killed during raids on their hideouts by NAF. Another terrorist was killed while escaping through a boat to a nearby community.
place: Lake Chad Tumbus. Koolaram and Arinna/Chiki camps.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed during an encounter with soldiers. Some motorcycles belonging to the bandits were also destroyed.
place: Sabon Birni, Maidaro, Dogon Dawa, Damari and Saulawa villages

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 3 bandits, including, Katzing Zwalnan Zingfa, a dismissed member of the police Constabulary were killed by Troops of Operation Safe Haven (OPSH). It was reported that the troops upon receiving a distress call, intercepted and engaged the bandits in a gun shootout. It was also reported that several weapons were recovered after the operation.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Zamfara
description: 4 policemen were ambushed and killed near a checkpoint along Gusau – Bungudu Road by bandits.
place: Near a checkpoint along Gusau – Bungudu Road

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Ebonyi
description: 2 enforcers of the sit-at-home order by the Indigenous People of Biafra/Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by the police. While was killed instantly, the second victim escaped with gunshot injuries but later died when he was arrested by the police.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some members of the House of Representatives were killed by some bandits who attacked them.

title: IPOB/ESN Kill 2, Imo
description: 2 people including a commercial tricycle operator were killed when gunmen were enforcing the one-week-sit-at-home order declared by IPOB/ESN. The rider was hit by a stray bullet when the gunmen shot sporadically into the air to scare traders.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: 4 enforcers of the sit-at-home order by the Indigenous People of Biafra/Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by the police. They were intercepted while trying to snatch a commercial vehicle owned by the Enugu State government at gunpoint.

title: Cult Killing, Lagos
description: 1 person was killed and many others were injured in a cult clash. Quadri Yekini (32) and James Segun (22), were arrested for their alleged involvement in the crisis that grounded human and vehicular movement.
place: Opaleye Street in the Ajegunle area

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 suspected kidnappers were killed by soldiers while the 24 people who were abducted were reduced. The victims included a minor,9 females and 14 males.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram members were killed during a clash with the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) and Boko Haram fighters. It was reported that the ISWAP fighters, on motorcycles raided the hideouts of the Boko Haram fighters and engaged them in a gun duel.
place: Bula Alhaji Garwaye in Sambisa Forest, near the North East

title: Fulani Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 4 persons were killed by some gunmen suspected to be Fulani militias who invaded the community. It was reported that the deceased were attacked on the expressway while coming back from their farms.

title: Gunmen vs Guard, Benue
description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits shot an officer of Benue State Community Volunteer Guards (BSCVG) dead. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted 2 people identified Abraham Yangeve, the principal of Ugondo College in Ugba and the wife of a proprietor of Gifted Nursery and Primary School in Ugba.

title: Gunmen vs Motorcyclist, Osun
description: A commercial motorcyclist identified as Toromade Adewale was shot dead and 1 other was injured by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the victim was celebrating the election of the new executives for the union.

title: Bandits Kill Woman, Niger
description: Bandits killed a nursing mother and spared her 7-month-old baby strapped on her back. She was among the 6 passengers, including an SS 2 student of the Maryam Babangida Girls’ Science College, Minna, Hauwa Aliyu, shot dead on a major road a day before Sallah.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Scores of fighters from the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed during raids on their strongholds by NAF. Many of them were also believed to have been injured in the raid.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed and 1 other was injured by some Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the terrorists attacked the deceased on their way to farm.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Benue
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed one farmer. The attackers have been terrorizing residents in the area.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits invaded the house of a vigilante leader, Mallam Nabanje and killed him. They also raped women and set the house ablaze.

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A deadly clash between Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters and Boko Haram fighters led to the death scores of Boko Haram fighters. Boko Haram insurgents ambushed the ISWAP but lost many of their members.

title: Gunmen vs Security Operative, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A security operative identified as Onyebu Idoko was killed by some gunmen. It was reported that the deceased, a member of the Central Neighbourhood Watch in the community ran into the gunmen while coming back from work riding on his bicycle.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: 3 farmers, including Anas Sabon Layi, Abubakar Dankibiya, and Harisu Lemu were killed and others were abducted by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that the bandits attacked some travelers who were going to the weekly market in the town.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 people, mostly youths, were killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack on a village. The young boys were killed while logging firewood in a bush. Some of them were injured.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 6 members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by the Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force 9CJTF). It was reported that the terrorists were ambushed.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Borno
description: 5 fighters of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISAWP) and Boko Haram were killed by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the terrorists were intercepted by the troops in an ambush between the Cameroon-Nigeria border.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 14 persons were killed and several houses were destroyed by some gunmen who invaded a community.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (14 ) , The Guardian (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (14 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 7 persons were killed when gunmen invaded a community. It was reported that the attackers raided the community at night when the villagers were sleeping. It was also reported that several houses and other properties were destroyed during the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: Bandits Kill 6, Plateau
description: 6 people were killed in different villages and about 100 cows were rustled. Many houses were set ablaze before hunters and vigilantes intervened.
place: Kai, Rapyam and Nding Sesut and Lohalla of Fan District

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kaduna
description: A traditional ruler, the Ardo of Birni and Kewaye of Zazzau Emirate in Kaduna State, Shuaibu Mohammed, and his four children, Adamu Shuaibu, Musa Shuaibu, Abubakar Shuaibu and Ibrahim Haruna were killed in their residence by bandits. Their killers also rustled about 100 cows.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 5 terrorists were killed and their leader, Abubakar Idris, was arrested by police operatives in conjunction with vigilantes and hunters in the area. It was reported that the security operatives raided the camp of the terrorists and engaged them in a shootout.
place: Marake, Garin Yara, and Garin Labo villages in Batsari and Jibia

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) Super Tucano fighter jets killed 2 Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) commanders. The victims were identified as Malam Bello and Amir Musa Modu. Scores of terrorists were also killed.
place: Shores of Lake Chad, Riverbanks of Jibularam and Sabon Tumbum

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked and slaughtered 15 people in coordinated attacks on two communities. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the communities at night.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 1 terrorist was killed by the police operatives during a shootout. It was reported that the bandits on sighting the police during a kidnap operation engaged them in a gun shootout.

title: Bandit vs Doctor, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed a medical doctor and abducted ten people including members of the slain doctor's family. The incident happened during an attack in a community in the early hours of the day.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Forest Sanity, in conjunction with the Defence Headquarters Special Forces, killed about 6 bandits. The incident happened when the security operatives raided the hideout of the terrorists.
