sources_of_information: This Day (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , The Nation (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 100 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in coordinated military airstrikes conducted in a mountainous area. The airstrikes were conducted by the Nigerian Airforce during clearance operations.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Niger
description: Several persons were killed by bandits who invaded some communities in the area. It was reported that the attackers numbering about 100 stormed the villagers on motorcycles and attacked the residents who were mostly farmers. It was also reported that several others were abducted during the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (38 ) , Other newspaper 2 (13 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji neutralized 3 bandits who have been terrorizing residents. It was reported that the incident happened when the security operatives stormed the camps and hideouts of the bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed some terrorists and recovered two AK47 rifles, 4 AK47 magazines, 16 rounds of 7.62mm special, assorted drugs, and other sundry items. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Bandits vs Trader, Abia
description: A female trader identified as Mrs. Chinonso Onyeukwu was shot dead by some bandits suspected to be armed robbers. Attackers invaded the deceased shop looking for her husband, but in a failed attempt to find him, attacked the wife and stole her bag containing some money.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamafara
description: 4 terrorists were killed in an ambush by Troops of Operation Hadarim Daji. It was reported that 4 AK-47 rifles and other weapons were recovered after the operation.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A 25-year-old herder was killed by some gunmen who invaded the community. It was reported that the gunmen also kidnapped some residents and took some cattle of the deceased away.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: 5 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by operatives of the Joint Task Force on Security (JTF). The incident happened when the operatives stormed the gunmen's camps.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Anambra
description: 5 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by operatives of the Joint Task Force on Security (JTF). The incident happened when the operatives stormed the gunmen's camps..

title: Gunmen Kill Over 25, Benue
description: Over 25 people were killed when gunmen suspected to be local bandits raided some communities. Many people were injured while houses and other properties were destroyed.
place: Imande Mbakange community and other neighbouring communities in Mbacher
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (26 ) , Daily Trust (13 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 people and abducted about 30 locals. It was reported that the bandits attacked the locals for refusing to pay levies imposed on them.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits raided some communities and killed about 37 people. Attempts to bury the victims were resisted by the bandits. The communities were allegedly attacked over their refusal to pay the levy imposed on them by the bandits.
place: Raka, Raka Dutse and Filingawa communities
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (37 ) , The Nation (37 ) , The Punch (50 )

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed when terrorists belonging to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) attacked troops with a vehicle improvised explosive device (VBIED).

title: Gunmen vs Community, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: About 50 people were killed and more than 170 building burnt by gunmen who have been terrorising residents. Some of the victims were identified as Benjamin Nwadirigbo, Nwabu Onuigbo, Obieze Ajaere, Izuka Izuaghanwa and Chike Izuaghanwa.
place: Izombe, Agwa, Ejemkwuru, Awa, Akabuo, Mgbele and Ogbaku
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (50 ) , Daily Trust (50 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: ISWAP Fighers Drown, Borno
description: 82 Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters and members of their families drowned in a river. The incident happened when they were running away from the onslaught of the troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), in collaboration with Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) and Hybrid forces, killed 11 suspected Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened when the security operatives took the fight to the enclaves of the insurgents.
place: Bale, Tirke, Mandari, Molgoi, Bego, Yarwa and Ngurna

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Alhaji Tasiu was shot dead by some bandits. It was reported that the deceased and his wife, with other residents, including his children were kidnapped by some gunmen some weeks ago and taken to their hideouts.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Several persons, including a vigilante leader, Dahiru Dangamji, and some miners were killed by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that 10 of the bandits were also shot dead by the vigilante members during a reprisal attack at the hideouts of the bandits. It is assumed about 30 people died in the encounter.

title: IPOB Sit-At-Home, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Mr. Philip was killed when the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) declared a sit-at-home order in commemoration of the extra-judicial killings of innocent Igbo sons and daughters killed by security forces.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Police operatives killed 2 bandits in a foiled kidnap attempt. The victims who were identified as Sani Kokaya and Ummara were on Police wanted list before their death.

title: Boko Haram vs Troops, Borno
description: 3 fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) who were on clearance operations. Arrms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.
place: Malam Fatori in the Lake Chad Region

title: Army vs Bandits' Informant, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralized one Juwoli who was acting as an informant to bandits. The victim was killed during a clearance operation close to a forest.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 26 fighters of the Islamic State West Africa terrorists and Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that it happened in the state capital.

title: Gunmen Attack, Benue
description: 12 persons were shot dead by some unknown gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that 2 of the gunmen were killed by a combined team of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS), a military troop, the police, and some Community Volunteer Guards (CVG) in a shootout.
sources_of_information: The Nation (14 ) , Daily Trust (18 ) , The Punch (18 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A police inspector was shot dead by some gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The policeman was killed in the night at a checkpoint.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed by some Fulani herders who invaded the community. It was reported that the herders invaded the community at night and also raped some women during the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Gunmen vs Policemenm, Imo
description: 2 policemen were killed at a checkpoint by gunmen suspected to be members of the Eastern Security Network, a militia wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). Their rifles were taken away by the gunmen. The 3rd policeman was injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Two brothers, Halilu Shittu and Muhammadu Shittu, were shot dead by bandits who also rustled over 1,000 cows. The brothers were shot dead on their farm where they were producing charcoal.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 9 people were killed by bandits while others sustained injuries during the attack and were rushed to the hospital. Many others fled from their homes due to fear of a fresh attack by the bandits.
place: Ungwan Dakwa village, near Dogon Dawa ward

title: Kidnap Victim, Niger
description: A man was killed by bandits over the failure of his family to pay a N2 million ransom within 48 hours. The victim was kidnapped alongside three other travelers and the bandits reportedly gave a timeline during which ransom must be paid.

title: Troops Kill Bandit's Informant, Kaduna
description: A bandits' informant identified as Malam Goma was killed during a raid on his hideout by soldiers. Before his death, he was declared wanted over incessant kidnappings around Kagarko and neighbouring villages.

title: Gunmen vs Brothers, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 brothers, Aaron Onuoha and Obeinechi Onuoha were killed by some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and The Eastern Security Network (ESN) who invaded a community.
place: Ohanku by Udoka Street/Amucha, off Ngwa Road

title: Gunmen vs US Mission Officials, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 7 officials of the United States Mission Nigeria were killed by gunmen who waylaid their convoy while on a humanitarian mission. It was reported that 2 of the victims were policemen.
place: between Amiyi and Eke Ochuche communities
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , The Guardian (7 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Kaduna
description: A man suspected to be a Boko Haram suicide bomber blew himself up with an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) to avoid being arrested by security operatives.
place: Ibrahim Haske Road in the Keke community of Kaduna Millennium City
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Terrorists Attack, Zamfara
description: 18 persons were shot dead and others were injured when bandits invaded a community. It was reported that the attackers stormed the community at night.

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: 3 Nigerian Soldiers were killed and 12 others were injured by the Islamic State West Province( ISWAP). It was reported that the incident happened when the troop's vehicle hit an improvised explosive device (IED) while they were going after the terrorists.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: bandits raided a community and abducted several people including the village head. While moving the abductees to a location, the bandits were attacked by fighter jets and lost many of their members, assuming not less than 20. It was not reported if any of the abductees died in the process. Another source reported that scores (At least 2 scores) were killed in the incident.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Rivers
description: An officer attached to the Counter Terrorism Unit of the Delta State Government House, Asaba, identified as Solomon, was ambushed and shot dead by gunmen. The incident happened when the victim, among others, was on a mission to River State.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 13 people lost their lives, several houses were burnt and many residents were displaced during a chieftaincy tussle between the Karim Jo and the Wurukun communities. The crisis started following the appointment of a second-class chief. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Communal Clash, Akwa Ibom
description: 4 persons were killed during a clash between Amazaba and Ikot Akpan Udo communities. It was reported that the crisis which started some years ago has led to the loss of many lives and properties between the two communities.
place: Amazaba community in Eastern Obolo and their Ikot Akpan Udo neighbors

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed and many houses were burnt down by some Fulani militias who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night when residents were preparing to go to bed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army on operation killed 2 terrorists and arrested five others while responding to an attack on a village. The hoodlums have been terrorising residents.

title: Fulani Gunmen Kill 9, Kaduna
description: 9 people were killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani militia. Several houses were burnt while residents were displaced.
place: Runji and Warkan in Atyap chiefdom

title: ISWAP Attack, Borno
description: Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) killed 3 IDPs that went to fetch firewood while 1 other person returned with bullet wounds.

title: Vigilantes vs Herders, Oyo
description: 11 members of the Fulani community, including 3 pregnant women, 4 nursing mothers and their children, were brutally massacred by some vigilantes and hunters. The assailants also burnt the 72 houses belonging to the Fulani community.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several fighters of the Islamic States of the West African Province, (ISWAP) were killed by the Troops of Operation Hadin Kai, in conjunction with the troops of the Sector 4 Multi-National Joint Task (MNJTF). It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation. Some of the top ISWAP commanders killed were identified as Fiya Abouzeid, Qaïd Abou Oumama, Qaïd Malam Moustapha, and religious leaders.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (30 ) , The Nation (30 ) , The Guardian (55 ) , Other newpapers 1 (55 )

title: Police vs IPOB, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Police operatives in Anambra shot dead 5 hoodlums who were members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The gang leader of the hoodlums was identified as Odumodu-Imo. He and his gang have been terrorising people.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 )

title: Hunters vs Bandit, Kebbi
description: Some bandits including their leader known as Yellow were killed by some local vigilantes and other joint security. It was reported that the notorious leader was ambushed by the hunters during an operation.

title: Bandits Kill Vigilant, Niger
description: A vigilante commander died alongside 4 of his men during a gun duel with bandits numbering over 100 on motorbikes.

title: Troops vs ISWAP, Borno
description: An unspecified number of Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by the Nigeria troop while 12 people including eight soldiers were wounded. It is assumed that 10 ISWAP fighters were killed.

title: Found Dead, Ondo
description: A graduate of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba-Akoko (AAUA), Ondo State, Gbenga Moses, was found dead inside his room in an off-campus hostel. It was reported that the victim was awaiting mobilization for the National Youth Service Corps(NYSC) before he was found dead. It was alleged that he died from food poisoning.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed during a gun duel with police operatives. It was reported that the police during a patrol engaged the terrorists, who were dressed in a military camouflage uniform in a fierce gun battle and recovered one motorcycle.

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Benue
description: An attack on a community by suspected Fulani herdsmen left 1 person dead. Many others were injured and robbed of their valuables.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army fighting terrorists killed 2 bandits when they made contact with the hoodlums. It was reported that the troops also recovered several weapons from the miscreants.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were killed at a military checkpoint by some unknown gunmen who attacked them.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed by policemen attached to the Anti-Violence Squad. They were intercepted when the operatives were on a surveillance mission. Arms and ammunition were also recovered from the bandits.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Youths, Plateau
description: 2 persons, Dachung Gyang and Zam Sunday, were killed by some gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims, who were youths were killed beside a military checkpoint in the community. The death toll has risen to 4. It was also reported that the attackers were Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Osun
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen allegedly killed a pregnant woman, her husband, and their son. The attack was believed to have been connected with the killing of a cow.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: Suspected herdsmen attacked some villages and killed 12 people. Many houses were destroyed and people were injured and displaced. The crisis started when a boy destroyed a sugarcane plantation with his herd and was beaten to death. The owner of the plantation was killed in reprisal and the crisis escalated.
place: Tattara Mada, Migini, and Angwan Barau
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (13 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Daily Trust (13 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Youths Clash, Niger
description: One person was killed while several others were injured when some youths clashed in a community during Sallah. It was reported that the crisis led to restiveness in the area.
place: Lim,awa, Obasanjo complex, Ogbomoso, Lagos Street, Mobile Rounbabout to Keterin Gwari, Barki Sale and Soje A are Minna

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: A soldier was killed by members of the Islamic State West African Province during an attack on a community. The soldier was killed while the terrorists were being repelled.

title: Mob vs Cultist, Imo
description: A man identified as Chima was burnt to death by some mob for stabbing a mechanic to death. It was reported that the cultist, Jasper, stabbed the mechanic in the lower abdomen during a quarrel.

title: Land Dispute, Niger
description: 8 persons were killed and several others were injured during a clash between Dogo Jede and Ali Kachala bandit factional groups. It was reported that the crisis was a result of a territorial struggle for land for their cattle.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 7 persons, including a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Chinaka Nwagu, and 5 police officers were killed by some unknown gunmen suspected to be pro-Biafra agitators. It was reported that the gunmen attacked and killed the policemen who went to eat in a restaurant and took away their rifles.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 )

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Bauchi
description: Some bandits killed about 20 people, burnt their houses, and looted stores of grains. The incident happened when the bandits stormed the village and terrorized villagers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 18 Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the clash lasted for about 30 minutes before the terrorists were decimated.

title: Cultists, Rivers
description: 2 people were killed following a supremacy battle between factions of Deygbam cult groups. The crisis started during disagreements over who controls the booming illegal oil bunkering activities in the area. The killing led to a reprisal attack where three more people were killed.
place: Elechi Beach axis of Mile 1 Diobu, Port Harcourt
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: ISWAP Kills 10, Yobe
description: The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists killed about 10 people in an offensive on a village. The villagers were killed while searching for Shettima Dawi, who went to fetch firewood and was not found.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (10 ) , This Day (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 9 persons, including 4 vigilante members, were killed by terrorists who invaded a community. It was reported that the terrorists abducted some people and took away some animals after the attack. While fleeing after the attack, some of them were killed by the troops of the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 8 people were killed when bandits raided a community. Many people were also injured. The attack came a few days after 10 people were killed in a a similar attack in a neighbouring community.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 suspected bandits were ambushed and killed by soldiers. Arms, ammunition and cash were recovered from them.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Hoodlums vs Policeman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed a police inspector identified as Augustin Ukegbu when he came home for the Easter holidays. It was reported that the hoodlums abducted him from his house but his corpse was found in a nearby bush.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Kidnappers, Kogi
description: A traditional ruler, Chief David Obadofin, and another person were kidnapped while a female domestic worker was killed in the process. The attackers were believed to be bandits who stormed the community while people were still sleeping.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 members of the Boko Haram terrorist group were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened during a raid of the suspected terrorists' enclaves.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed and others were injured by police operatives. It was reported that the bandits attempted to attack the community but were repelled by the police.

title: Gunmen vs Security Operatives, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 officers of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), Assistant Superintendent 2, Onwusuruke Sixtus, and Corp Defence Assistant 1, Simon Simon were killed by unknown gunmen who ambushed them.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen were shot dead when unknown gunmen attacked a police checkpoint. There was an exchange of fire which eventually led to the death of the officers.
place: Police checkpoint between Kenyatta Market and the University of Nigeria, Enugu Campus (UNEC) Stadium

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) stormed the hideout of Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists and killed 41 terrorists including their leader, Abu Zahra while others fled.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 1 person was killed by some Fulani Herdsmen who invaded a community and attacked some of the residents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram members were killed by Troops of 222 Battalion Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was reported that the troops recovered some weapons belonging to the terrorists after the operation.

title: Army vs Boko Harm, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram members were killed by Troops of 222 Battalion Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was reported that the troops engaged the terrorists in a fierce gun battle after they made an attempt to attack their military formation with gunfire.
place: Konduga trenches, 40 kilometers East of Maiduguri

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Benue
description: 1 person was killed in an attack carried out by suspected Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the attackers were terrorizing the community for some time.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot dead a soldier during an exchange of gunfire. The other soldiers and civilians were injured. The incident happened when soldiers tried to stop the bandits from rustling over 100 cows from a village. A version of the story stated that 3 villagers were killed during the exchange of gunfire between soldiers and the bandits.

title: Political Violence, Bauchi
description: Election Crisis: 1 person identified as Ukasha was killed and 11 others were arrested after the Governorship and House of Assembly elections in the state. It was reported that some political thugs attacked the area in protest over the concluded elections.

title: Troops vs Bandit, Zamfara
description: Ummaru Nagona, one of the notorious bandits terrorizing residents of North West and a motorcyclist were killed in an encounter with the military. They were taken out on their way to respond to a military attack on the gunmen’s camps. It was also reported that 4 other people were killed by the operatives.

title: Election Crisis, Kogi
description: Governorship Election: A young man was gunned down at a collation center by security agents. It happened when two leaders of rival parties engaged in an altercation and in the process, the supporters started throwing stones at each other, and a security operative who was on electoral duty was hit, and he shot and killed a man.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 3 persons were shot dead by some security operatives in an area. It was reported that the incident happened during the Governorship and House of Assembly election in the state when the suspects, members of cult groups, opened fire on the joint security personnel.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Assailants vs Party Agent, Osun
description: House of Assembly Election Crisis: 2 party agents were killed by some assailants during the House of Assembly election in the state.
place: Isedo 1, Oloponda ward 2, Unit 5 in Ila-Orangun Area

title: Political Violence, Borno
description: Governorship Election Crisis: Several terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai during an exchange of gunfire in a community. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists, suspected to be members of the Islamic State of West Africa (ISWAP), stormed the areas with gun trucks and attempted to attack the army base serving as the collation center for the governorship and State House of Assembly elections but were repelled.
place: Ajari Ward polling unit, Mefa Town

title: Political Violence, Lagos
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A party agent with the Labour Party was shot dead by some political thugs. The victim, Onyeka Abali, was the LP polling unit agent.

title: Political Violence, Ebonyi
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 1 person identified as Nweke Peter was shot dead by some gunmen who invaded his polling unit. It was reported that the deceased, the chairman of Ezza North Area and a member of the PDP, was beaten to a coma when the attackers stormed his polling unit during the Governorship and House of Assembly election.

title: Political Violence, Niger
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 1 person was shot dead by security operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly election. It was reported that 1 political party agent was arrested by the EFCC team for vote buying in the center.

title: Political Violence, Lagos
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A security guard identified as Mr. Akinsola Ahmed was stabbed to death by some political thugs during the governorship and house of assembly polls. The victim was killed when he stumbled on the thugs thumb printing on some ballot papers.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A member of the All Progressives Congress (APC) identified as Chisom Lenard was shot dead by some political thugs. It was reported that the deceased, the campaign coordinator of Tonye Cole, was attacked while trying to prevent them from taking some of the election materials in his polling unit. Another version of the story reported that some political thugs loyal to the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) were behind the attack.

title: Political Violence, Cross River
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A man identified as Joe was shot dead by military personnel during the election process. It was reported that the deceased, a member of the All Progressive Congress (APC) and an Okada rider, arrived at his polling unit and started creating unnecessary tension, and also pulled out a gun in front of the soldier. It was also reported that 7 vehicles were also burnt.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Political Violence, Delta
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 3 persons were shot dead by some security operatives while others sustain injuries during the Governorship and House of Assembly election. It was reported that the incident happened during an exchange of gunfire between some thugs and security operatives in the polling unit.

title: Political Violence, Benue
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A man was shot dead by some soldiers. It was reported that the incident happened at a polling unit center of the Governorship and State House of Assembly voting exercise when the deceased was seen snatching a ballot box. The victims were killed in different locations within Gboko.
place: Abagu, NKST Primary School and Hausa Quarters in Gboko
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Vanguard (6 )

title: Political Violence, Lagos
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 1 person was killed by police operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly in the state. It was reported that the incident happened when some hoodlums attacked various polling units and chased away voters during the election.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Political Violence, Ebonyi
description: Governorship Election Crisis: A PDP party agent identified as Oyibo Nwani was shot dead by some political thugs. It was reported that the incident happened when the deceased got into an argument with them over an attempt to snatch ballot boxes. A version of the report stated that the victim was shot dead by one Emmanuel who was his friend but double as a political thug.

title: Political Violence, Akwa Ibom
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 6 people were killed by security operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly election. It was reported that the accident happened at the polling units between some hoodlums and security operatives.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Hularia Hussaini Ardo, the senior wife of the Fulani Chief of Rugan Ardo, Abubakar Ardo, was killed by bandits after collecting a ransom of N2m from her family. The incident happened when bandits invaded their residence and kidnapped some of the Chief's wives. The chief Iman of Nomadic Central Mosque, identified as Isyaka Adamu was also shot dead by the bandits.

title: Terrorist Attack, Katsina
description: 15 persons were killed by Suleiman Iliyasu (28), a bandit. It was reported that the suspect, known as Yar'bushiya, was involved in banditry, kidnapping, etc. in different states before he was arrested by police.

title: Councillor, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Mr. Ogbonnaya Ugwu, the Councillor representing Achara Ward 2 in Okposi Community, popularly known as SPACO, was killed by gunmen. He was accosted while returning from his shop, a popular drinking joint in Okposi, known as Angle 90.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Bandits vs Pastor's Son, Kaduna
description: A pastor's son was killed by bandits who attacked a community. They also kidnapped the victim's wife and three others during the attack which lasted for more than an hour.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 gunmen were killed and 2 others were arrested by the police operatives during an echage of gunfire between them. It was also reported that 2 AK-47s and other weapons were recovered by the police after the operation.

title: Boko Haram vs Fishermen, Borno
description: 35 fishermen were slaughtered by Boko Haram insurgents. The incident happened when the victims went on a fishing expedition and were attacked by the terrorists. Several other people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (35 ) , Other newspaper 3 (25 ) , The Guardian (26 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 ) , This Day (37 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Some armed Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed some people. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 people were killed in the attack which happened near a church.

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Borno
description: A policeman was shot dead by Boko Haram fighters. The incident happened when the terrorists attacked a police crash squad in a town. They snatched a Hilux vehicle from the team.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 people including a bandit were killed and 1 other, Jamilu Ahmed (25) was arrested when police operatives engaged them in a fierce gun duel. 1 AK-47 rifle was recovered from the hoodlums.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 6 people, including a six-month-old pregnant woman, were killed and several others were injured by some terrorists. The attackers also abducted about 50 people before they were repelled by the soldiers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person was killed and 2 Siena vehicles were set ablaze by suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and Eastern Security Network. It was reported that the gunmen invaded the community in the morning and started shooting sporadically into the air while enforcing the sit-at-home.

title: Gunmen vs Village Head, Kano
description: Some unknown gunmen murdered the village head of Maigari known as Alhaji Dahiru Abbas (70 years) at his residence. The incident happened in the early hours of the day.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Zamfara
description: Bandits invaded a community and killed the Divisional Police Officer, an inspector and three residents. The DPO mobilized his men to counter the invaders but was killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Herdsmen vs Man, Nasarawa
description: 1 person identified as Matthew Apande was hacked to death in his house by suspected Fulani Herdsmen. It was reported that the herders stormed the community at night with guns and cutlasses, and started shooting sporadically.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 persons, including a pregnant woman identified as Furairaand 2 teenagers, were killed and 5 others were injured in an airstrike by NAF airstrikes during a raid. NAF targeted some bandits who had fled into the village but mistakenly shot at civilians.
place: Sabon Gida village of Fatika District

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: ISWAP Commander, Modu Bashir Okocha, led a team of ISWAP fighters to attack a Boko Haram position, killing 15 Boko Haram members in the attack. ISWAP members also seized their weapons and motorcycles.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Sector Four of Operation Whirl Punch and Special Forces of the 167 Battalion cleared a bandit hideout during a fierce encounter with the hoodlums. It was reported that a bandit was neutralized while 14 villagers were rescued.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Rivers
description: A vigilante member identified as Ewor Orikkoha was killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen invaded the community and attacked the deceased, a member of ONELGA Security Peace and Advisory Council (OSPAC). They also kidnapped chief Shedrack Orikkoha, a septuagenarian.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 23 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community in the afternoon, moving from house to house, shooting sporadically, and abducting some of the residents in the community.
place: Dogon-Daji community, along the Abuja-Kaduna near Kagarko town

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) killed about 200 Boko Haram terrorists and their families in a deadly rivalry clash.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (200 ) , This Day (200 ) , Daily Trust (200 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: Presidential Election Crisis: A 42-year-old man, identified as Mr. Ozoemena Nkwuda was shot dead by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the deceased, a chieftain, was killed by some political thugs during the presidential general election in the area.

title: Election Crisis, Taraba
description: A young man riding on a motorcycle was shot dead by security personnel in the early hours of election day. He was flagged down but refused to stop.

title: Gunmen Attack, Delta
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons, including a police officer, were killed by some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the IPOB members invaded the community and started shooting and chanting.
place: Ugbolu Community, Mi-5 Road, near 63 Brigade, Nigerian Army Headquarters
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Boko Haram/Election Crisis, Borno
description: 1 person was killed while 3 others were injured when Boko Haram insurgents launched rocket-propelled grenades at two different places to attack voters, thereby disturbing the electoral process.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The Troops of 1 Division, the Nigerian Army, and the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch neutralized 5 bandits and recovered 10 motorcycles in an exchange of gunfire that lasted over 48 hours. Items recovered by the troops included two AK-47 rifles, five Improvised Explosive Devices, two mobile phones, bandits' uniforms, and magazines
place: Mando-Sabon Birni-Maidaro -Dogon Dawa, Galadimawa, Saulawa, Farin Ruwa, and Polewire villages

title: Political Violence, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A police officer rendering security for the presidential and National Assembly elections was killed by gunmen. The identity of the victim was yet to be ascertained.

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: About 5 members of the APC, Tunde Ejoka, Ibrahim Adeyi(Omo Alhaja), Ebenezer Alao, and Saidi Oyegunju were gruesomely murdered across Eti-Oni in Atakumosa East, Oke-Aga, and Ilesa, in a Political clash between the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC). C).
place: Across Eti-Oni in Atakumosa East, Oke-Aga, and Ilesa,

title: Political Violence, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 6 people, including the senatorial candidate, Oyibo Chukwu, representing Labour Party (LP) were killed by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the gunmen attacked the convoy of the Labour Party candidate.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: APC unleashed a killer squad on members of the PDP after Governor Ademola Adeleke led a campaign. Rafiu Quadri Abiodun and Elijah Baba Ewe were killed while the third victim, Gbenga Femi is in a state of coma presently.

title: Gunmen vs Woman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: An elderly woman was burnt to ashes when gunmen razed the house of Prof.Nnamdi Obiaraeri, a former Commissioner for Information, Youth and Sports and Land and Urban Planning under governor Ikedi Ohakim and Rochas Okorocha. It was reported that the gunmen also burnt down the houses of several other people.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attacjk, Enugu
description: About 6 people were killed in attacks on residents. The attacks were carried out in different farm settlements. Some people were alleged to have sustained various degrees of injuries. The attack was suspected to be a reprisal for the murder of a Fulani herdsman who was on his way to Opanda.

title: Gunmen vs Police Officers, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 7 people, including 4 policemen and 3 suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed during an exchange of gunfire between them. It was reported that the incident when the unknown gunmen invaded the police station and were repelled by the police officers. It was also reported that the unknown gunmen burnt the police patrol van and 3 other vehicles on the station premise.
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Political Violence, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person identified as Emeka was shot dead by some unknown gunmen who invaded an area. It was reported that the incident happened during the campaign meeting of the All Progressive Congress (APC) in the state when some gunmen started shooting sporadically into the venue. It was also reported that the gunmen burnt 2 cars, a Toyota Hiace and an ash-colored car before leaving the place.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 police officers were killed by some unknown gunmen who invaded a police station. It was reported that the gunmen while approaching the police station started shooting sporadically and also threw IEDs, and petrol bombs while gaining entrance into the facility.

title: Hoodlums Kill 4, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 people were killed by hoodlums who have been terrorizing residents. Due to the nature of the killing, it is assumed that the victims were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A combined security operatives involving soldiers and Navy killed 7 bandits during a gun duel. It was reported that the incident happened during clearance operation.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: PBOB/ESN: The police operatives in Anambra State foiled an attack by armed men suspected to be members of ESN/IPOB on the Ogidi Police Station, demobilized one of the armed men, killed one, and recovered many expended cartridges and 25 liters of PMS. The hoodlums had been suspected to have come to burn down the police facility.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Police Kill 2, Katsina
description: 2 terrorists were gunned down during a gun duel with operatives of the Nigerian Police Force. The bandits invaded a village in large numbers before the police intervened.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Yobe
description: Several Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists were killed by Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai in a community. It was reported that the troops chased the terrorists and engaged them in gun duel battles with guns and bombs.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 suspected Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the 21-Armoured Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), in collaboration with Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). It came barely 24 hours after the Super Tucano fighter NAF jets killed 27 terrorists in the forest while meeting at two hideout camps.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (34 ) , Daily Trust (34 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army and Air Component Operation Whirl Punch neutralized 4 bandits and captured arms and ammunition in a clearance operation that lasted for 48 hours.

title: Market Crisis, Bauchi
description: 1 person was killed and scores of others when miscreants entered the venue of the PDP presidential campaign rally. They terrorized people by snatching cellphones and bags, and also injured many people with the dangerous weapons they held.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: 1 person was killed while another was injured by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. The victims were identified as Anike Nwaogbu and his brother Emma Ogbu.

title: Gunmen vs Security Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 members of vigilante operatives were killed and several others were injured by some unknown gunmen who invaded the area.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Herdsmen vs Soldiers, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed and 3 soldiers were injured during a clash between troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) and suspected Fulani herdsmen.

title: Gunmen vs Judge, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen stormed a Customary Court and shot dead the Chief Judge identified as His Lordship Nnaemeka Ugboma. The incident happened when proceedings were going on in the court.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person was killed and another injured by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen in Siena vehicles, armed with IEDs, and other weapons stormed the office of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) and a police station, and shot sporadically.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Some bandits attacked some communities and rustled cattle and other animals. It was reported that the bandits killed an unspecified number of people in the attack. Many vigilantes who had gone to attack the bandits were ambushed and killed. Some days later, more corpses were discovered while some people who were injured later died, thereby increasing the number of deaths to over 100.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (100 ) , Nigerian Tribune (43 ) , The Nation (50 ) , PM News (102 ) , This Day (100 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were shot dead by gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the policemen were at a checkpoint when the gunmen attacked them.

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons were killed by some gunmen who arrived at a market area and shot sporadically. It was reported that one of the victims was beheaded by the gunmen.

title: Man vs Colleague, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: An operative of the South-East Security, an Ebubeagu identified as Ajasm Aja was shot dead by his colleague during an argument over the sharing of money given by members of the All Progressive Congress (APC) to secure their governorship rally.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 32 terrorists, including their commander, Abu Iliya were killed by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai Force (OPHK), in conjunction with Civilian Joint Task Force(CJTF). It was reported the troops raided the hideouts of the terrorists and led an ambush on them.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (32 ) , Other newspaper 2 (32 ) , Daily Trust (32 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Enugu
description: 2 soldiers were killed by unknown gunmen. The gunmen killed the 2 soldiers at a checkpoint in Enugu before proceeding to the Enugu-Ebonyi border where they opened fire on policemen again.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 2 persons were killed and several others were injured by some terrorists who invaded a market area. It was reported that the bandits also burnt many vehicles and rustled several animals away in the community.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons, including Ogbo, were shot dead by some unknown gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased, vigilante operatives were attacked at their security post by the gunmen at night.

title: Bandits vs Miners, Niger
description: Bandits killed three miners after they were repelled from another location. It was reported that 3 of the miners got drowned in a river while trying to escape from the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 vigilantes were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits operated for hours before leaving.

title: NAF vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: Several vigilante members were killed and several others, including their commander, were injured by a NAF aircraft bomb. It was reported that the incident happened when the vigilante men were preparing for an operation against bandits who invaded the community and kidnapped several villagers and cattle.

title: Political Killing, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The Ward Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Christian Ihim, a.k.a Zako was killed by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. Five other APC members were abducted by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Forest Sanity killed two bandits and rescued 16 kidnap victims during a clearance operation. The troops responded to distress call when the bandits struck.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Forest Sanity killed one bandit and rescued some kidnap victims when the troops responded to distress as some of the bandits struck in a community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Several bandits were killed and others were injured by the Nigerian Air Force and other states' joint security Task Force. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning at the hideouts of the terrorists.

title: Police vs Kidnappers, Kwara
description: 3 members of a kidnap gang and cattle rustlers were killed during a gun duel with police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened when the operatives engaged the suspects in gunfire in their hideout inside a bush.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The Sole Administrator of Ideato North Council, Christopher Ohizu, was beheaded by some unknown gunmen after being kidnapped. It was reported that the deceased and 2 others were kidnapped in his residence but was killed after a ransom was paid by his family members.
causes_of_violence: political issue, The Nation, Nigerian Tribune, Daily Trust

title: Assailants vs Man, Kogi
description: A man identified as Iye was shot dead by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the deceased was killed at a local hotel where he lodged. Another version of the story reported that the victim was allegedly identified as an armed robber who went on an operation and killed 1 person and returned to the town with a new car.

title: Gunmen vs Ebubeagu Commander, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) killed one Charles Nwankwo, the commander of Ebubeagu Security Network in Ogboki Ward. The gunmen stormed the victim's house in the night and shot him dead.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Armed herdsmen killed a family of 6 and some others in a night attack on a community that hosts Internally Displaced Persons. It was reported that the marauders who left several persons with gunshot wounds also beheaded some of their victims.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , The Nation (9 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the hoodlums also kidnapped 13 other people during the attack.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Imo State Police Command killed three terrorists who mobilized to attack a police facility. The hoodlums were suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that the incident happened during a routine patrol in the community. It was also reported that the Troops also recover 2 AK47 rifles and three MCs.
place: Maidabino Danmusa at Danali and Dunya in Dangeza Village

title: Bandits Kill 3, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 3 people and abducted 6 others, including a pregnant woman. The bandits stormed the community and terrorised residents. 3 people escaped with gunshot injuries.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Several bandits were killed by Military fighters in different communities. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits were returning from their illegal operations.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed several terrorists in a community. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 members of the Boko Haram group were decimated.

title: Cult Clash, Edo
description: 4 persons were killed during a rival cult clash between the Eiya and Arobaga cult groups. It was reported that the crisis happened as a result of mistaken identity.
place: Ozaze Odewengie's guest house, Eriaria around a pure water factory in Erediauwa Area

title: Bandits vs Priest, Niger
description: A parish priest identified as Rev. father Isaac Achi of St. Peters and Paul Catholic Church was burnt to death and 1 other, Father Collins was injured by some bandits in the community. It was reported that the priest's house was set ablaze with him inside by the bandits.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 1 bandit was killed by police operatives in a community. It was reported that two other bandits were arrested after the operation.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several members of the Boko Haram group were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened during clearance operation.

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: Unknown gunmen killed 4 people when they attacked the country home of the spokesperson for the Coalition of United Political Parties, Ikenga Ugochinyere. One of the victims was the uncle of the spokesperson. The gunmen also burnt many cars in the residence and around it.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits who have been terrorising residents were decimated by security operatives. The victims were killed in a village.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen attacked operatives of the Anambra vigilante Service, killing for our them. It was reported that the gunmen who attacked the secretariat at night also razed some buildings. One of the security operatives was beheaded. A version of the story stated that 3 security operatives were killed. One of the gunmen was shot dead.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 bandits during an encounter with the hoodlums. It was reported that the troops also recovered two AK-47 rifles, 51 rounds of 7.62mm special, four AK-47 rifles magazines, five mobile phones, motorcycles and N206,000 among other items.

title: Bandits Kill Community Leader, Kaduna
description: A community leader and member of the Fityanul Islam First Aid Group, Malam Ibrahim Abdullahi, and his nephew, Zakari Yau, were killed during an attack by bandits. 4 women were also abducted in the incident.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Policemen vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: 2 bandits were killed by a combined team of police operatives in conjunction with local hunters. The incident happened when the security operatives stormed the hideout of the bandits.

title: Bandits vs Man, Bauchi
description: A 70-year-old man identified as Saleh Umar aka Saleh Burga was killed by some bandits who invade his residence. It was reported that the deceased was shot several times by the bandits.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Kaduna
description: 12 security operatives including 7 NSCDC officers were killed in a mining site by bandits. The personnel were attached to the state Ministry of Mines and were killed while on official duty. The attack was believed to be a reprisal for the murder of a herdsman employed by the bandits. Some sources reported that scores of the operatives lost their lives. It is therefore assumed that the fatalities would not be less than 2 scores (40).
sources_of_information: The Punch (12 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , The Nation (12 ) , Daily Trust (13 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot dead one person among 12 people they abducted from a community. The leader of the kidnappers shot the victim in the presence of his relative who brought 3.5 million Naira ransom to them instead of the 50 million they demanded.

title: Police vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: A police Inspector, Yusu Jafaru, was shot dead during a gun duel between cops and bandits. It was reported that 2 bandits were also shot dead in the duel.

title: Youths Killed, Ondo
description: 2 people were killed when youths clashes during the Ondo Year Carnival. Houses and shops razed, and properties worth millions of naira were destroyed. The crisis started over the venue for a carnival.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person identified as Hon. Ike Okolo, the President General of the Obosi community was shot dead by some gunmen. He was killed in a petrol station by his atatckers suspected to be cultists.
place: Obi Maduka's compound, within Nodu village square, Obosi Community
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 people were feared dead when some armed men opened fire on them and drove off immediately. The incident happened on new year's day.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 terrorist members, including 3 Boko Harm commanders were killed by strikes of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the Super Tucano fighters engaged the terrorists in their hideouts. It was also reported that some of the ISWAP fighters were also killed during the operation.
place: Bula Jitoye, Halka Kojoy, Halka Alai and Bulamaye in Sambisa Forest

title: Police Kill Bandit, Zamfara
description: A bandit was killed and 6 others arrested by policemen. The suspectes allegedly engaged in banditry, kidnapping and cattle rustling. Two AK 47 Rifles, 104 rounds of live ammunition and two magazines and charms were recovered.

title: Gunmen vs Ebubeagu Commander, Ebonyi
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) killed the pregnant wife of Kalu Chima (aka Oyeku), the Ebubeagu Commander in a village. The hoodlums took the woman outside, shot her in the neck and set the house on fire.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when soldiers from Operation Forest Sanity engaged the bandits in a gun duel in a village. It was also reported that some weapons were recovered after the operation.
place: Rafin Sarki and rafin Taba Villages
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Political Issue, Sokoto
description: Alhaji Iliya Agajhiba the ward chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC) alongside his elder brother was killed by bandits. The killing was believed to be politically masterminded.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Police vs Kidnappers/Bandits, Bauchi
description: Several bandits (assuming at least 10) were neutralised and dislodged from their enclaves while others escaped in disarray into deep forest with possible bullet wounds.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 3 persons, including Mr. Charity Ogbe, were killed and 30 houses were destroyed during a clash between two communities. It was reported that the crisis started due to a land issue between the two communities.

title: Police vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: A joint security taskforce operation led by Bauchi State Police Command killed scores of bandits and recovered two AK-47 rifles. During the operation, several bandits were neutralised and dislodged from their enclaves, while the remaining sprinted in disarray into the deep forest with possible bullet wounds.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: 20 people were killed while scores sustained injuries when bandits attacked some villages. The attack was a reprisal attack for the killing of 12 bandits by some vigilantes.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: About 10 people were killed by bandits that attacked some communities. Some residents sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: About 10 people were killed by bandits that attacked some communities. It was reported that the incident happened at night when the gunmen invaded different communities in the area.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Niger
description: 1 person was killed and another injured by an explosive device (IED) in an environment. It was reported that the explosive device was planted by members of Boko harm in two communities. It was also reported that the cause of the IEDs was to serve as a protection for the Boko Haram element and a signal of warning for security operatives in their camps.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 10 persons were killed and several others were abducted by some gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) in the North East and the Civilian JTF have killed 8 Boko Haram terrorists. Motorcycles and an AK 47 riffle were recovered from the victims.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: 4 persons were reportedly killed while many others were injured when terrorists invade the community.

title: Assailants Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons, including a traditional ruler, Eze Anyanwu, Ugochukwu Olewuike, known as Taco, a youth leader in the community were killed by Chinwedu Nwangwu, known as Onyearmy and his gang who invaded the community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A subgroup of the Kwayam tribe, who were known for spiritual warfare, killed 2 Boko Haram suspects. The terrorists were killed in an ambush with bow and arrows.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 2 people were killed while 10 others were abducted by bandits who attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits stormed the communities in large number.

title: Boko Haram vs Herders, Borno
description: 17 herders were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The terrorists attacked the herders guarding their cattle at a pasture in a village and took away all their cattle.

title: Bandits Kill Captive, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits killed one of the 7 people they abducted around the Federal Capital Territory and threatened to execute more. It was reported that bandits abducted the victim when they stormed a community. The deceased was identified as Olayinka Ogunyemi.
place: Kuduru community near Bwari Area Council

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Niger
description: The village head of Mulo village identified as Usman Garba was killed by some bandits after they abducted him and 4 others.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Bornon
description: 26 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) during a clearance operation. The incident happened when the terrorists were travelling on a road into a forest.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 bandits during clearance patrol in a community. It was reported that the troops also recovered one AK-47 rifle and 2 magazines loaded with 52 rounds.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Forest Sanity killed 4 bandits and seized motorcycles during patrols in some areas. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: The village head of Mulo community was killed by bandits. The incident happened after he was kidnapped alongside three other members of his community.

title: Bandits vs Pregnant Woman, Niger
description: A pregnant woman was gang-raped to death by bandits who attacked a village. The woman was ambushed by the terrorists when she and others were escaping from the terrorist.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) killed 150 Boko Haram terrorists with Super Tucan fighter jets. The incident happened during a clearance operation. It was reported that 2 terror kingpin identified as Khaids Tukur and Bakura Jega were among the dead.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (150 ) , The Punch (102 ) , The Nation (110 ) , Daily Trust (114 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Ebonyi
description: Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were neutralized during a raid at their camp by troops of the Nigerian Army. The troops also recovered several arms and ammunition.
place: IPOB/ESN Camp at Amagu village, Nkalaha community
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Bandits Kill 37, Kaduna
description: 37 people were killed during attacks on two communities by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at night.
place: Malagum 1 and Sokwong communities of Kagoro Chiefdom
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Vanguard (28 ) , The Nation (28 ) , The Guardian (39 ) , The Punch (38 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 10 soldiers, 68 villagers, and scores of bandits were killed following a gun duel between soldiers and bandits. The incident happened when the bandits sighted the soldiers and opened fire on them. The Nigeria Air Force personnel bombed the criminals who went to hide in a market where people were trading, leading to many deaths.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A village head, Mallam Usman Garba, was abducted and killed by bandits. 4 others were abducted in the incident.

title: Kidnappers vs Monarch, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The traditional ruler of Amanze Obowo Autonomous Community, Eze Basil Njoku, was killed by some gunmen who kidnapped him. It was reported that the gunmen, suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), killed the monarch after collecting ransom from his family.

title: Fulani Attack, Enugu
description: Fulani herdsmen and residents from Agala communities in Benue state attacked and killed several people in Ebor community in Enugu state. It was believed that over 25 people were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (25 ) , Vanguard (25 ) , The Guardian (25 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 )

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 15 bandits were killed when vigilantes repelled an attack on a community. The armed bandits attacked the community but met fierce resistance from vigilantes who overpowered them and killed 15 of them.

title: Bandits Kill 20, Zamfara
description: 20 people were killed and a majority of male population were kidnapped by bandits loyal to notorious kingpin, Lawalli Damina. The bandits attacked the community over missing rifles.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 notorious terrorists on a wanted list identified as Abu Na-Iraqi and Abu Na-Masari were decimated by the police. The incident happened when the police command received a distress call that a number of bandits were shooting sporadically with AK-47 rifles.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra(IPOB) and Eastern Security Network(ESN) were killed by the police operatives during an invasion of their camp. It was also reported that one of their commander, Sunday Ubah, known as Bongo was arrested during the operation.
place: Obegu, a boundary area between Onicha-Isu and Ishielu

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits stormed a community and abducted some residents. It was reported that the bandits shot dead the son of a Fulani chief, Alhaji Hussaini Ardo, and the Chief Imam of Nomadic Central Mosque, Isiyaka Adamu.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 1 bandit was killed, 8 others arrested and a 7-year-old boy, Musa Suleiman was rescued by the police operatives. It was reported that the incident happened when the police raided a kidnap hideout in the area and rescue some victims who had spent four days in captivity.

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Some people were killed as gunmen shot sporadically during their operations.People ran for safety, even as business operators and commercial banks hurriedly shut their shops. The attack was in a bid to enforce the sit-at-home order. It is assumed that 5 people were killed in the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Two policemen and three gunmen died during a gun duel between the police and members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) who came to raze the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC). It was also reported that the assailants were Chinwedu Nwangwu, known as Onyearmyg, and his gang.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Gunmen vs Pregnant Woman, Borno
description: A pregnant woman identified as Mrs. Mary Barka was killed by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened as a result of a failed kidnap operation by the bandits on the deceased husband, Mr. Barka Paul Sawa.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) in their hideout. It was reported that the terrorists were killed and their camp destroyed by the troops of the Nigerian Air Force ( NAF) during an aerial patrol.

title: Communal Clash, Ondo
description: Many people, including policemen and Amotekun operatives, were killed while motorcycles, livestock, and over valuables were destroyed and set ablaze in a land dispute between Kajola and Koseru villages. Other reports have it that a Councillor was also killed in the crisis.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Vanguard (4 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were neutralized during air raids by Nigerian Air Force. The incident happened during clearance operations carried out to rid the state of bandits.

title: Bandits vs District Head, Zamfara
description: A district head identified as Kogo Hamza was shot dead by some bandits who attacked him on the road. It was reported that the bandits shot the deceased in his car while he was coming from a meeting.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Katsina
description: 4 traders were slaughtered by bandits who intercepted them on the road. They were intercepted on their way to a weekly market.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were gunned down by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra who were enforcing a sit-at-home order issued by one Simon Ekpa that lives in Finland.
place: In front of the Enugu University Teaching Hospital, Parklane

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: 17 people were killed in some villages by bandits who invaded the villages. The bandits stormed the villages and opened fire on residents without any provocation. It was reported that several bandits were killed after the attack by soldiers. it is believed that not elss than 10 bandits lost their lives, brining teh total fatalities to 27.
place: Rimi village within the Yankari Game Reserve forest

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Many members of the Eastern Security Network were shot dead by the police during a gun duel. It was reported that the incident happened when members of the ESN were trying to enforce a sit-at-home order by one Simon Ekpa in Finland. Some policemen were also killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed in the shootout.

title: Gunmen vs Policeman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman identified as Prince Chidi Iheme, the elder brother of Nollywood actor, Osita Iheme, was gunned down by gunmen identified as members of the Eastern Security Network while riding in the same vehicle with the Commissioner for Solid Minerals. The incident happened when the gunmen were enforcing a 5-day sit-at-home order by Simo Ekpa who lives in Finland. They also macheted the Commissioner for Solid Minerals, Martin Eke.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Expatriates, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra shot dead 2 policemen attached to 2 expatriates as they kidnapped the expatriates. The victims were supervising the ongoing construction of the Phase 11 of the Owerri-Okigwe Road when the incident happened.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra killed 4 people as they tried to enforce a sit-at-home order declared by on Simon Ekpa who lives in Finland.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were gunned down by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra during the enforcement of a sit-at-home order given by one Simon Ekpa who lives in Finland.

title: Gunmen vs 8 Northerners, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra who were enforcing a sit-at-home order issued by Simon Ekpa who lives in Finland, killed 8 people who were mainly from the northern part of the country. Some of the victims were mechanics who had gone to repair a vehicle.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: A man was shot dead when troops of the Nigerian Army engaged operatives of Eastern Security Network, the militia arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra, in a gun duel.

title: Banditry, Gombe
description: 3 persons, including a 90-year-old man, were killed and 3 others were injured by some terrorists who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at night when the terrorists attacked two villages, burnt one of the deceased while he was sleeping, and also burnt several houses and foodstuffs.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops and Special Forces of the Nigerian Army neutralized 9 bandits during fierce battles. It was reported that the troops cleared several bandit hideouts, killing some of the bandits. The troops also freed some hostages.

title: Policeman vs Gunman, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman and a gunman were killed during a gun battle. It was reported that the incident happened at a checkpoint where the gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) came on a motorcycle and opened fire on security operatives.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were killed and others were injured by the Troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. It was reported that the terrorists were apprehended at their hideouts in different locations around the interstate boundaries by the troops.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 24 Boko Haram members were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the insurgents were hibernating in some communities.
place: Bulakulari, Gwari-Gwazo, Loskori, Limanti and Gaza villages in the Mafa-Dikwa axis

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 7 terrorist kingpins and several foot soldiers were killed during airstrikes undertaken by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch at identified terrorists' hideouts. Some of the neutralized kingpins were identified as Jibrin, Gurgu, Isa Jauro and Tambuwal. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 other bandits were killed in the operation.
place: Alhaji Ganai location, Buhari new location and Dogon Maikaji

title: Troops vs Terrorist, Katsina
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed many terrorists and apprehended 5 bandits’ collaborators with the sum of N19.5 million in their Point of Sales (POS)machine. It is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Sokoto
description: 6 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that several others were injured in the attack. They broke into shops and stole lots of assorted goods.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Sokoto
description: 1 person was killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that several others were injured in the attack. They broke into shops and stole lots of assorted goods.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: The mother of a Divisional Police Officer, and his brother, Usman Lawal Karzaje were killed by some gunmen who invaded the community. It was reported that the deceased were attacked at their residence. The incident led to a protest by the mob in the community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Political Violence, Kaduna
description: Mrs. Victoria Chintex, the Labour Party woman leader of Kaura LGA was killed in her residence by some unknown gunmen. Her husband sustained gunshot injuries and was rushed to a medical facility for treatment.

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
