description: Several Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by the Super Tucano fighter Jet Air force. It was reported that the terrorists were killed while they were moving in a convoy of gun trucks to attack the nearest military base.
place: Kau-Shoro, Damboa axis of Sambisa Forest

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Muhammed Malik, a top commander of the Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP), was killed by troops of the air task force during a clearance operation. Scores (assuming at least 40) of fighters were also killed in the air raids.
place: Sabon Tumbun area of Lake Chad axis

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was reported that the terrorists were moving in a convoy of gun trucks and motorcycles when they were ambushed by the troops.

title: Political Crisis, Borno
description: 1 person was killed while scores were injured, and vehicles and other properties worth millions of naira were damaged during the campaign of former Vice President Atiku Abubakar and PDP presidential candidate.

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko Haram fighters were killed in an ambush by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) during a clash. Both groups have clashed several times this year.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra were gunned down during a gun duel with security operatives.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Rivers
description: 2 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen with AK-47 riffle. It was reported that the rampaging herders also injured many people during the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: 8 people were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the killing spanned a couple of day as the herders went about killing people unchallenged. 2 of the victims were daughters of a pastor of the Apostolic Faith Church.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Many bandits were neutralized by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch. The bandits were members of the group loyal to one Alhaji Ganai.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A police inspector attached to Orba Police Area Command, Mr. Oluchukwu Omenogor, was shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The officer popularly called Babylon was killed during night surveillance.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were shot dead in a community by some gunmen suspected to be members of IPOB. The incident happened when the gunmen invaded the community and killed Ikechukwu Nnamani, a former President General of a crisis-torn community, Oruku Community, and one Ndubuisi Nnamani.

title: Bandits vs Police, Kaduna
description: A policeman identified as Aminu Muhammad was shot dead when some bandits attacked the convoy of Mr. Timothy A. Zalanga, the Managing Director of the Railway Management Company Limited, a subsidiary of the Nigerian Railway Corporation (NRC).

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 operatives of Ebubeagu Security Network, Ebonyi State, were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be IPOB members.
place: Popular Ebebe junction along Ogbaga road
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Boko Haram Insurgency/Witchcraft, Borno
description: 15 women were killed by the Boko Haram members led by their leader, Ali Ngulde. It was reported that the victims were killed after being accused of witchcraft.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (26 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: The police in collaboration with vigilantes and hunters killed seven bandits in a community. It was reported that 2 vigilantes sustained bullet wounds during the operation.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 )

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Some bandits were neutralized by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch. The bandits have been terrorizing residents before the strikes which were targeted at their enclaves.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 )

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Many bandits were neutralized by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch. The bandits were terrorizing residents before the strikes which were targeted at their enclaves.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 )

title: Bandits vs Imam, Sokoto
description: Bandits killed the chief Imam of Gangara community. The Iman identified as Liman Na-Kimba was killed while he was coming back from Sokoto where he went to collect his pension.

title: Man Stab One, Bauchi
description: A 30-year-old man identified as Abdulrazak Ibrahim was stabbed to death at a drinking joint by Monday Ajasco (29). It was reported that the suspect stab the deceased while on their way home as a refused to buy a drink for him at the joint.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 Boko Haram fighters were killed in an ambush by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) . It was reported that the incident happened when the NAF fighters conducted an aerial and ground on the border area.

title: Gunmen vs Family, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 9 family members and 2 other victims. It was reported that the during the attack which happened at night 8 people were injured.
sources_of_information: The Nation (11 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 )

title: Gunmen vs Ebubeagu Operative, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: An operative of the Ebubeagu Security Network identified as Joseph Nwanja was killed by gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. It was reported that the gunmen cut off the head of the victim.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Abu Hassan, a Boko Haram Commander (Munzir) and 13 others were killed in an encounter with troops of "Operation Hadin Kai". The victims were killed after a gunner in the troop's patrol convoy fired at the fleeing terrorists' position, with an Anti-Air Craft gun

title: Gunmen vs Monarch, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen shot dead the traditional ruler of Obudi Agwa autonomous community identified as Eze Ignitus Asor. It was reported that the hoodlums also killed two of his aides and wounded other persons as they tried to flee the community. A version of the report stated that the victims were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Sokoto
description: 2 farmers were killed by bandits in a village. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped 6 other farmers during the attack.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army repelled a terrorist attack on a village and killed one of the bandits while another escaped with gunshot wounds. The attackers attempted to infiltrate the location housing the troops but were engaged in a fierce gun duel that lasted for an hour.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 terrorists were killed and some kidnapped victims were rescued by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). It was reported that the incident happened during aerial patrols by the NAF in the hideouts of the terrorists.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: 3 villagers were killed by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits were fleeing from soldiers who repelled their attack.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a bandit leader identified as Kachalla Gudau, his aide, Rigimamme, and several other bandits. The bandits have been terrorizing several communities before they met their waterloo.
sources_of_information: The Nation (12 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Daily Trust (12 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A police inspector and a constable were shot dead during a night attack at the Divisional Police Headquarters by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The gunmen also freed all the detained suspects in the police division.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed one bandit during a clearance operation. It was reported that two terrorists fled on sighting troops, leaving behind their motorcycles.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 people were killed when some gunmen engaged soldiers at a checkpoint in a gun duel. The incident which happened in the early hours of the day caused pandemonium.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Niger
description: 1 person was shot dead by bandits over a delay in paying his ransom. It was reported that the bandits kidnapped 3 farmers, Salihu, Aliyu, and Ishaku a few months ago and decided to release them by collecting ransom from their family members.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several terrorists were killed by the Military personnel called Buzu. It was reported that several bicycles and animals were also recovered after the operation.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Jigawa
description: 2 persons were killed and others injured during a clash between some farmers and herders. It was reported that the crisis started when some group of youths suspected to be farmers attacked the Fulani herders in an attempt to chase them away from the area. It was also reported that 2 horses and 19 donkeys were burnt by the youths during the clash.
place: Cukuma and Gunka villages of Suletankarkar

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: 2 persons were killed and 20 others were injured by some gunmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the afternoon when the bandits on motorcycles stormed the community fully armed and started shooting sporadically into the air.

title: Communal Attack, Benue
description: 28 were killed in a crisis between the Effunn and Ezza people. The crisis started in Ebonyi State and escalated to communities in Benue State. It was believed that someone from one of the communities desecrated one of their shrines, and instead of settling their crisis in Ebonyi, they moved the crisis to Benue.
sources_of_information: The Punch (28 ) , Other newspaper 2 (28 ) , Nigerian Tribune (28 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Scores of bandits were neutralized in a community during a gun battle with the Joint Security Task Force in the state. It was reported that 2 members of the vigilante corps were killed by the bandits during an earlier ambush. Three days after the incident, the bandits trailed teh4 son of a village head whom they bvelieved betrayed them to his resident and took him to their camp where they shot him dead.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Niger
description: 5 farmers were killed while dozens sustained severe gunshot wounds when bandits attacked some communities. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Kefas Obadiah, a kidnap victim was killed after his family paid 3 million Naira for his ransom. It was reported that the bandits started asking the family for 10 million Naira before they will release the corpse of the victim to his family.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: An unidentified military man was shot dead by some gunmen who invaded a community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops attached to Operation Hadarin Daji neutralized some terrorists in a village. It was reported that the terrorists were trying to harvest farm produce at the village when the incident happened.

title: Bandits vs Cook, Katsina
description: 1 person identified as Alhaji Lawal Kambarawa was killed by some bandits after kidnapping him on his farm. It was reported that the deceased, chief cook to the Katsina governor, Aminu Bello Masari was kidnapped a few days ago while he went to inspect some of his farm produce. It was also reported that he was killed after his family members paid a ransom of N5 million to the kidnappers.
place: Katsina-Jibia International Road to the Niger Republic

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Abia
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army raided the enclave of members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and killed 2 people. It was reported that some of the members fled with gunshot injuries.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Abia
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed three members of the Indigenous People of Biafra during an encounter. It was reported that one soldier was killed during the gun duel.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram fighters were killed by the Troops of Operation Hadin Kai. The soldiers, in conjunction with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF), intercepted some terrorists and engaged them in a gunfire exchange.

title: Bandits Attack, Kebbi
description: Over 70 bandits invaded a village at night and killed Abubakar Magaji, the head of the community, and one other person. They also killed 2 other persons on the way as they fled the community.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Anthony Mutala Tekung was killed while 2 people escaped and 2 other females, Jessica Francis and Margret Francis were kidnapped. Anthony was killed by the kidnappers during a joint rescue mission.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 gunmen were killed during a gun battle with a combined team of soldiers and policemen. The victims had different charms on their bodies, including legs, necks, waists and hands.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an airstrike carried out by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF), with support from ground troops. The terrorists were hit while moving in a convoy of gun trucks and motorcycles.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The Operation Stop-and-Search team of the police engaged gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) in a gun duel and killed one of them. They also recovered a Sienna vehicle, one AK-47 rifle with 15 rounds of ammunition, 2 English-made pump action guns and 10 rounds of live cartridges and assorted charms.

title: NAF vs Terrorists, Katsina
description: Scores of Boko Haram and The Islamic State's West Africa Province (ISWAP), fighters were killed by the Operation of the air component. It was reported that the incident happened when the air component of Hadarin Daji carried out an attack on the terrorist's location.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (44 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Multiple airstrikes by Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets killed dozens of the Islamic State of West African Province terrorists. The terrorists were eliminated after two Super Tucano fighter jets bombed their convoy.

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in their hideout by the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters. The attackers also recovered some weapons from the victims.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 person identified as Lawan Yashin, a terrorist was killed by some Troops in conjunction with Civilian Joint Task Force while trying to escape.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Bandits vs Passengers, Katsina
description: 2 passengers lost their lives while three others were kidnapped after a team of bandits armed with sophisticated weapons attacked a community. The terrrorists have been terrorising residents.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: About 30 bandits, including 3 high-profile commanders, Hailu Buzu, responsible for the supply of arms to all other terrorists in Zamfara and Katsina state, Yellow Kano, Alhaji Gana were killed in airstrikes by the Nigerian Air Force’s fighter jets during a raid on terrorists’ hideouts. Since no location was reported, it is believed that the incident happened in the capital city.
place: Anka (Bayan Daji) and Bayan Ruwa axis

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed and others were injured by the Troops of the air component in their hideout. It was reported that the incident happened at the terrorist's hideout.
place: Abulum and Njibul near Sambisa Forest
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (44 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 3 terrorists including their leader identified as Ibrahim Chire were killed when the troops attached to Operation Hadarin Daji engaged the terrorists in a gun duel.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Troops of the air component. It was reported that seven gun trucks and other materials were recovered after the operation.
place: Tunbum Aliyu, near Lake Chad in Southwest
sources_of_information: The Nation (30 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (44 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army engaged some bandits in a shootout and killed about 30 of them. It was reported that the troops engaged the bandits in a fierce battle. They also rescued some kidnap victims.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (30 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (30 ) , The Guardian (30 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 policemen and 21 others were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Scores of residents flee the affected communities in a bid to avoid further attacks. The incident was a reprisal for cattle rustling. the victims include Mtem Torpav, Eje Abraham (Police), Zege, Afam Abama, Akor Jem, John Nor, Torlumun Orabende, Orpandega Terseer, Bem Nyichia, Atseva Ortwer, Mrs. Torsar, Nyave Tyoulugh, Kpaver Tion, Ugba Joseph, Mbakumbur Peter, Moses Pav, Apeseza Baba and Unduun.
sources_of_information: The Punch (36 ) , Nigerian Tribune (23 ) , Other newspaper 3 (23 ) , Vanguard (36 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Gunmen attacked and killed the village head of Nyalum community identified as Salisu Idris. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted several people during the operation and carted away motorcycles.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 49 Boko Haram and the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by the Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK). It was reported that 2 Chbok girls with their babies were rescued during the joint patrols.

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 persons suspected to be fighters of Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by the troops of 152 Battalion, Banki Operation Hadin Kai in an ambush.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: Bandits shot dead one farmer and released 15 others abducted on their farms. The victim identified as Salihu Usman was shot dead when he attempted to escape after untying himself.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 terrorists were killed and 1 other rescued by the police operatives in a gun battle with the terrorists. It was reported that some weapons were recovered by the police after the operation.
place: Idasso area of Kidandan in Galadimawa District

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed the commander of the Anambra Vigilante Group popularly called Shaba, and 2 of his orderlies. He was at a bar in the company of his orderlies when they were killed.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Herders vs Farmers, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 5 farmers when they invaded a community in the night and shot at people. They attacked the farmers with guns and machetes.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 villagers were killed when terrorists invaded a village. It was reported that the hoodlum attacked the village in the early hours of the day and killed the victims before the police stormed the place.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 10 bandits were neutralized by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that 7 of the bandits were arrested in the operations while 32 civilians were rescued.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: At least 2 dozens (24) Boko Haram terrorist fighters were killed by the troops of the 21-Armoured Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) in an ambush.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF), neutralised 19 Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists.

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Taraba
description: A vigilante group killed 12 bandits terrorizing residents and communities. The activities of the bandits resulted in the death and abduction of many people in a Fulani community. The assailants went to the community wearing uniforms and posing as members of a local vigilante group but were rounded up by the vigilante.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: About 7 people were killed by bandits who invaded three communities. It was reported that a community leader was also killed during the attack. Several households were displaced.
place: Kulias Community, Batura by Government College
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 27 bandits were killed and 393 victims rescued by police operatives. It was reported that about 1,503 terrorists were arrested by the police during an operation.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: 7 farmers were killed by suspected herders. It was reported that the incident was a reprisal for an attack on Fulani herdsmen in the community.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 )

title: Cult War, Cross River
description: 6 members of a cult group were killed during a disagreement over a stolen motorcycle. Crisis started when a member of one of the groups stole a motorcycle belonging to a rival member.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of motorists and travelers were feared dead as they stepped on IEDs allegedly planted by suspected members of Boko Haram. Several others reportedly sustained injuries. It is assumed at least 2 scores (40) died in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Terrorists raided a community and opened fire on fleeing residents. 3 people were killed by the attackers who also looted shops before setting residential houses ablaze.

title: Terrorists vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Ansaru terrorists killed scores of bandits in a village. They made a surprise return to the community which use to be their stronghold.

title: Gunmen vs Security Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 soldiers and a civilian were killed by gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the area during the day and opened fire on the soldiers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Vanguard (6 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Bandits vs Farmer, Kaduna
description: A farmer was killed by rampaging bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the communities for a long time.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person identified as Oluwakemi Isreal Oluwatosin was killed and 3 others, Douglas Silas, Treasure Yohanna Victor, and Precious Oderinde were kidnapped by some bandit who invaded a community.

title: Gunmen vs Army, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 gunmen and 1 soldier were killed during a gun duel. The incident happened when about 15 gunmen swooped on a military checkpoint. The gunmen made away with one General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG).

title: Terrorists vs Soldiers, Zamfara
description: 3 soldiers including Major Emos were killed while another soldier was injured by bandits during an ambush on a vehicle. The military personnel got intelligence information that the bandits were planning to attack a village and were on their way to foil the attack when they were ambushed.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The vigilante group of Kanoma town, in conjunction with vigilantes, killed 31 bandits. They got the information that the bandits were planning to attack the town and quickly mobilized the vigilantes from the neighbouring communities.

title: Bandits vs Police, Katsina
description: A policeman identified as Inspector Idris Musa was killed by rampaging bandits who ambushed a security outpost. It was reported that the bandits also abducted several passengers plying the road and moved them into a forest.
place: Makera village along the Katsina-Jibia road

title: Army vs ISWAP, Yobe
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed many fighters of the Islamic State in West African Province (ISWAP) in clearance operations. The terrorists met their waterloo when they gathered to carry out an attack on troops.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Bandits Kill Lecturer and Village Head, Adamawa
description: Joram Bengo, a lecturer with the Federal College of Education (FCE) Yola, was kidnapped after he delivered a ransom of N2 million to secure the release of Sallau Manu, the village head. It was reported that the terrorists murdered both the village head and Bengo after collecting a ransom of N7 million.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 persons were killed and 8 nursing mothers were kidnapped by some terrorists who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community on motorcycles and started shooting sporadically into the air to scare people away.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: A man identified as Mapack Linus was killed by bandits who attacked residents. The attackers were reportedly targeting vigilante members frustrating their activities.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons identified as Sanusi Zubairu and Kabiru Zubairu were killed and 12 others were kidnapped by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits also looted some shops in the community during the attack.
place: Hayin Gada of Damari Community in Kazage Wards

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 11 people, mostly worshippers, were killed and others injured by some terrorists who attacked a mosque. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits stormed the area and went straight to the community's central mosque where people gather for the Juumat prayers.
place: A mosque in Ruwan Jema Community
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , The Nation (15 ) , Daily Trust (18 ) , The Punch (18 )

title: Hoodlums vs Police, Edo
description: A police officer was killed and an operational burnt by some bandits in an ambush. The attack was believed to be a reprisal attack on the security operatives for an earlier incident (See incident in IBD024844).

title: Air Force vs Terrorists, Zamfara
description: Operatives of the Nigerian Air Force killed 50 bandits who were terrorising residents. The incident happened during clearance operations.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 7 Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists were neutralized in an ambush by 73 battalion in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF).
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Gunmen, who struck in the early hours of the day in a community, killed 2 people and abducted 3 others. One of the victims was a member of the Vigilante Group of Nigeria (VGN).

title: Bandits vs Children, Niger
description: 5 people, including 4 children between the ages of 1 and 5, were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the attackers also kidnapped 15 other people during the operation.

title: Bandits vs Driver, Katsina
description: Bandits shot dead a commercial driver and also abducted an unspecified number of passengers. The victims were moving from one community to another raiding households before they intercepted the vehicle.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: A Major of the Nigerian Army lost his life in an explosion planted by some gunmen suspected to be IPOB members. Two captains were severely injured. Reprisal attacks by soldiers led to the killing of other people. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 5 people were killed by the soldiers.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits, including their wives and children, were decimated during airstrikes by the fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force. The incident happened when they gathered at the home of a notorious bandit known as Turji for the naming ceremony of a baby born to the family.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Punch (22 )

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Power Tussle: Several Boko Haram fighters including 2 commanders, Abou Hamza and Abou Ibrahim, were killed by the Islamic West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists were ambushed in their hideout by the ISWAP fighters who stormed their camp.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 36 Boko Haram terrorists were decimated by troops of Operation Hadin Kadin in airstrikes. 2 top commanders identified as Abu Asiya and Abu Ubaida (A'Quaida) were among those killed.
place: Parisu and Sheruri in Sambisa forest axis

title: Bandits vs Businessman, Katsina
description: A businessman identified as Tukur Makeri was killed by some bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped several residents.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: A combined team of security operatives raided the camp of the Indigenous People of Biafra and killed many of the members. It was reported that the operatives destroyed the camp. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 of the victims were killed.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Niger
description: 1 vigilante member was killed and 1 other sustained injuries when gunmen invaded a village. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the village and went straight to the vigilante office where they attacked them. It was also reported that several villagers were also abducted by the gunmen.

title: ATF Troops vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorist fighters including 3 commanders were killed by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the incident happened during a raid operation between them in an area.

title: NAF Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorist fighters were killed by the NAF aircraft component of Operation Hadin Kai. It was reported that the Troops neutralized the bandits who were moving in 2 vehicles.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 80-year-old District Head of Dusai, Alhaji Sani Mahoro, his son and another villager were killed by kidnappers. Alhaji Sani and his son were kidnapped from their residence before they were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Some bandits were killed when troops of the Nigerian Army embarked on a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops also rescued about 10 kidnap victims.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai neutralized 7 Boko Haram and Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The terrorists were ambushed when they planning to go to the market.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Some bandits were killed when troops of the Nigerian Army on a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops also rescued about 10 kidnap victims.

title: JTF vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 9 bandits, including their leader identified as Solar, were killed when they attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits were shot dead by members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF).
sources_of_information: The Guardian (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , The Nation (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) decimated several members of the Boko Haram group when the Air Force jets struck at the enclave of the terrorists. It was reported that the structures of the terrorists were also destroyed during the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operatives of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) decimated several members of the Boko Haram group. The incident happened when Nigerian Air Force aircraft struck a target identified as health facility used by the terrorists. It is assumed that about 10 terrorists were killed.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operatives of the Nigerian Air Force killed about 40 member of the terrorist group. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Niger
description: Operatives of the Nigerian Air Force killed some terrorists during clearance operation. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that about 10 bandits were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army decimated 52 members of the Boko Haram group during a clearance operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Katsina
description: 10 terrorists were killed in an ambush by the troops of Operation Hadarin Daji. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops led an operation to arrest terrorists and other criminals in their hideout.

title: Leadership Tussle, Delta
description: 1 person was killed and 3 others were injured in a clash by some gunmen. It was reported that the deceased was on a bus when some gunmen opened fire on him and fled. It was also reported that the cause of the crisis was a leadership tussle over sand dredging in the community.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Several people were killed and many others were injured in an attack by some bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the attackers stormed the villages in the morning and shot sporadically, leaving many dead, injured, displaced and houses.
place: Kukawa, Gyanbahu, Dungur and Keram Villages

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Operation Whirl Punch eliminated some terrorists during clearance operations. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army intercepted some bandits and killed 2 of them. The victims tried to ambush the soldiers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 8 bandits were killed by security operatives during a special operation aimed at clearing off bandits from some communities. Several firearms were recovered from the bandits.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: 15 bandits were killed by security operatives during a special operation aimed at clearing off bandits from some communities. Several firearms were recovered from the bandits.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 7 bandits were killed by security operatives during a special operation aimed at clearing off bandits from some communities. Several firearms were recovered from the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 2, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits on a rampage killed 3 villagers and abducted about 12 farmers. It was reported that the bandits wrecked havoc on the village, shooting sporadically at anyone in sight.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Zamfara
description: 3 terrorists including Dan Nijar Bala, a notorious terrorist were killed and several others injured by the troops of Operation Hadarin Daji in a gunfire encounter. It was reported that other terrorists escaped with gun wounds during the operation.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Soldiers on anti-banditry operations killed 3 bandits and recovered two AK47 rifles. It was reported that the army also recovered nine magazines, seven Baofeng communication radios and other items.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Boko Haram vs Worshippers, Borno
description: Terrorists attacked a mosque, killing the Chief Imam of Gima and three other worshippers. It was reported that many people were injured as the terrorists invaded the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian army killed 4 terrorists belonging to the Boko Haram group. The incident happened during clearance operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 70 Boko Haram members drowned in a river due to an air bombardment by Operations Hadin Kai. It was reported that the incident happened when the Nigerian Army in collaboration with Civilian Joint Task Force ( JTF) attacked terrorists in their hideout.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 3 farmers were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits also blocked the Brinin-Gwari-Funtua Highway and ceased 30 vehicles from some travelers.
place: Kurgin Gabas community in the western part

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigeria's 199 Special Forces and the 222 Battalion Joint Operations eliminated scores of Boko Haram insurgent including 5 wanted terror gang leaders identified as Abou Hauwa, Amir Shettima, Akura Buri (Nakif), Abou Zainab and Abou Idris.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , The Punch (40 ) , Web Newspaper (40 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 49 terrorists were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army and Nigeria Airforce. It was reported that the incident happened during a series of airstrikes targeted at the terrorists.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army made up of troops of 34 Artillery Brigade, together with troops of the Nigerian Navy, Air Force and other security agencies killed 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The incident happened during a clearance operation.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed members of the Indigenous People of Biafra while others fled with gunshot wounds. The incident happened when the troops came in contact with IPOB members.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra were killed by operatives of the Nigeria Police Force. Several cache of arms and large quantities of hard drugs were also recovered from the hoodlums.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Plateau
description: Bandits killed a young man when they attacked a community. It was reported that the dumped his corpse on a road.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 4 people were killed and 5 others were injured by some bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the deceased were all males whom some terrorists abandoned after attacking.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: One Mallam Isah Majema was butchered by bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the bandits also abducted three children of one Alhaji Wada during the incident.
place: Majema and Tashar Gero villages in Tandama area

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A man identified as Malam Hamisu Barebari and a woman were killed by bandits. The woman was killed when she went to grind corn while the man was killed when the bandits invaded a community and abducted 7 people, including women.

title: Leadership Crisis, Lagos
description: 2 people were killed when hoodlums invaded the palace of Oloto of Oto Awori Kingdom, Oba Aina Kuyamiku during coronation. Vehicles belonging to the monarch were destroyed, while some shops in the area were also burnt. The crisis broke out after a disagreement between 2 monarchs in the community over an anniversary.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of bandits were killed during an encounter with soldiers. Among those killed was Musti, who led the deadly attack on the Nigerian Defence Academy, Kaduna last year.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Zamfara
description: 3 soldiers and several terrorists were killed during a shootout. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists ambushed the troops' vehicle while on their way to repel an attack.
place: Fanda-Haki, Yar Katsina, and Karrakkai Communities

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram insurgents were killed when troops in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) raided their illegal market. Dozens of insurgents and their logistic suppliers were allegedly arrested in the raid.

title: Bandits vs Soldier, Kaduna
description: A soldier was killed and 2 other civilians, including a Zimbabwean national, Mr. Charlse Choko, were abducted by some terrorists who invaded a village. It was reported that the incident happened at a farm company.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, FCT (Abuja)
description: One John Ibrahim was shot dead by some bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits kidnapped five residents when they attacked the community.

title: Communal Clash, Gombe
description: 3 persons were killed and 11 houses were burnt during a clash between suspected Fulani herdsmen and indigenes. It was reported the incident happened during the killing of a herder whose cows invaded farmland, thereby leading to a reprisal attack by some indigenes.

title: Gunmen Kill Urhobo Chief, Delta
description: A prominent chief of Ughievwen Kingdom, Olorogun Emmanuel Bikogha was attacked and killed by unknown gunmen. More details on the attack were not provided.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: 2 villagers were killed by bandits. The first person was Sarkin Komo who recently moved into the village while the second person was a blind man who was hit by a bullet.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 12 bandits, who were members of the banditry group run by Bello Turji Kachalla, were decimated by the airstrikes of the Nigerian Air Force. The incident happened when the Air Force targeted to take out the bandit leader but he escaped.

title: Army Major, Anambra
description: ESN/IPOB: An army officer, Major Churchill Orji, was killed by unknown gunmen in part of the state known to be a den of the dreaded gunmen. Details of his death were not provided.

title: Gunmen Kill Political Appointee, Lagos
description: Francis Oguntulu, the Deputy Chief of Staff to the Oshodi-Isolo Local Government area Chairman died from injuries sustained when he was shot and axed by unknown gunmen. It was not clear if the deceased Oguntulu was the target or if he was hit by stray bullets.
place: Adeyemi Street, in the Oshodi area
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandit vs Police, Kebbi
description: Police tactical team, in synergy with the Nigerian Army and local vigilantes, foiled bandits’ attack, neutralized a bandit and recovered one AK47 rifle
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Assailants vs Town Union President, Enugu
description: Unidentified gunmen shot dead Chief Linus Nwatu, the President-General of Oruku Town Union. The incident happened in the early hours of the day in a renewed gunmen attack on the community following a protracted communal crisis.

title: Leadership Tussle, Delta
description: Mr. Felix Edenughe, the Vice Youth Chairman of a community, was killed and 3 others were injured in a fierce disagreement over the election of the new Executive Committee of the Ofuoma Community Development Union. It was reported that the violence took place as a result of the leadership crisis in the area.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: A high-profile ISWAP commander known as Uzaifa, the Minzir or fourth in line of terrorist leadership structure was killed during joint air raids and land mop-up operations by troops of the Nigerian Army. The victim was killed alongside 37 others.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Modu Tafjid, a top improvised explosive devices (IED) specialist of the Islamic State West African Province ( ISWAP), and 3 other terrorists were killed in an ambush by troops in conjunction with the Civilians Joint (CJTF). Weapons and other items were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Army vs Terrorists, Niger
description: The Nigerian Air Force fighter jets on internal security operations bombarded a terrorists' stronghold, killing scores of them. The incident happened when the terrorists gathered for an important meeting hosted by Aminu Duniya, a Boko Haram terrorists commander.

title: Fulani Group vs OPC, Kwara
description: 2 persons were killed and many others were injured in a clash between the Fulani Groups and the members of the Oodua Peoples Congress (OPC). It was reported that the crisis happened at a market between a group of Fulani known as Regular Fulani and Bororo Fulani over a trade disagreement.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Daily Trust (9 )

title: Bandits vs Immigration Officials, Jigawa
description: Some bandits attacked a patrol team of the Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) and killed one of them. 2 other operatives were injured in the incident.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 11 people were killed and several others were abducted by bandits during an attack. It was reported that the bandits invaded two villages and launched their attack on the residents.

title: ISWAP vs Policemen, Borno
description: A Policeman was killed during a clash with members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). the victim was lost in the process of foiling an attack on a checkpoint along the Maiduguri- Damaturu highway. 6 other officers sustained injuries during the operation

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 vigilante members were killed and several residents, including a newly wedded couple, were abducted by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the incident happened when the vigilante members engaged the bandits in a gun battle but lost two of their members in the process. Some of the kidnapped victims were rescued in the process.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Some terrorists, including their leader identified as Abdulkarimm Lawal Faca-Faca, were killed when Nigerian Airforce fighter jets raided some terrorists' hideouts. A version of the story stated that the raid was conducted by the police and the operatives of the Nigerian Airforce.
sources_of_information: The Punch (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , Vanguard (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (28 )

title: Bandits vs Farmer, Taraba
description: Rampaging bandits killed three farmers are different spots. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped several people during the attacks which happened in the evening.

title: Bandits Kill Expatriates, Kogi
description: 6 people including 2 expatriates working for West Africa Ceramics Company Ajaokuta, 2 company drivers and 2 police inspectors were killed by gunmen who launched an attack on their convoy.
sources_of_information: The Nation (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits in their numbers, armed with sophisticated weapons, attacked a village. One of the victims, Abdulrashid Abba Manna went to the farm and was killed by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 4 persons were killed and 6 others were kidnapped by some bandits in a community. It was reported that the incident happened when some bandits stormed a community and launched their attack.
place: Dan Tsuani Community, near Civil Defence Trining School

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 3 farmers were killed on their farmlands by some terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists rode on motorcycles, demanding food items before they carried out their operation. It was also reported that the terrorist shot some farmers who could not meet up with the food demanded by them.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Several bandits were killed by the Troops of 21 Armoured Brigade in collaboration with Civilian JTF operatives. It was reported that the incident happened when the operatives stormed the terrorist's camp and engaged them in an exchange of gunfire.
place: Sambisa forest and Lake Chad region

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Some bandits from a neighbouring state attacked and killed 5 Fulani herdsmen while they were tending to their cows. It was reported that 19 of the herders escaped during the attack.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Nigeriens, Imo
description: ESN/IPOB: Members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) killed 8 Nigeriens and carted away their heads. It was reported the victims were living with some northerners in the state before they were killed without provocation.

title: Police vs Terrorists, Delta
description: ESN/IPOB: A suspected member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) was killed by police operatives. It was reported that some weapons were recovered from the suspects by the police.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Taraba
description: Boko Haram members attacked a community, killed 3 people on the spot and abducted 6 others. The terrorists came in 9 motorcycles and started shooting anyone at sight. Other reports have it that 4 traders were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A pregnant woman, together with her baby, died while she was having emergency delivery of the baby by the roadside. The incident happened when the woman was running away from some bandits who invaded her community. It was reported that the bandits also abducted 50 people while several others fled the community during the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Bandits Attack, Plateau
description: 7 people were killed, several others injured while many escaped into the nearby bush when bandits stormed a community and shot sporadically.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A farmer was killed while others were injured and crops destroyed when suspected Fulani herdsmen raided their farms and community. The attack was perpetrated when it was raining g heavily.

title: Gunmen vs Police/Vigilante, Kogi
description: No fewer than 3 police officers and 5 local vigilantes were killed in an ambush by suspected gunmen. They were mobilized to fight off bandits who had taken control of the area from indigenes.
sources_of_information: This Day (8 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Plateau
description: 16 bandits and 2 vigilantes were killed during a clash between two groups. It was reported that the incident happened when the vigilantes launched an attack on a particular village that has been under the bandit's control with the intention of reclaiming it.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , The Punch (18 ) , The Nation (18 )

title: Bandits vs Man, Bauchi
description: Katu Mai Dukkuna, a 70-year-old man, was brutally killed by bandits on his farm while 3 of his grandchildren, 2 female and a male were abducted.

title: Solider vs Terrorists, FCT, (Abuja)
description: 2 soldiers attached to the 102 Battalion were killed by ISWAP during an attack on a military checkpoint. It was reported that the terrorists also injured 2 others. There have been attempts by terrorists to run over FCT. Lives were lost in the incidents. The Islamic State West Africa province (ISWAP) claimed some of the attacks.
place: Zuma Rock Resort, near Madalla, a few meters from Zuba

title: Police vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A police officer was killed when some Boko haram ambushed the convoy of a council chairman, Hon. Asheikh Mamman Gadai.

title: Banditry vs Army, Plateau
description: Several bandits were killed by the Nigerian Army of Troops of Operation Safe Heaven (OPHS). It was reported that weapons were recovered from the terrorists during the operation.

title: Army vs Bandits, FCT (Abuja)
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 30 terrorists that attacked troops of the Guard Brigade as captured in IBD024661. It was reported that the troops also recovered six motorcycles, two AK47 rifles and one fully loaded LMG magazine.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 20 people were killed following a terrorist attack. Over 20 people lost their lives attempting to escape the attack by diving into the river, where most of them died in the process due to their inability to swim.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Daily Trust (28 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 6 people were killed by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening and some foodstuffs were also taken away by the bandits.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed while others were wounded by armed bandits who invaded a town in large numbers. It was reported that the terrorists shot sporadically during the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 notorious bandits were gunned down during a shootout with the team of policemen. Items recovered from the bandits included one AK47 rifle loaded with two rounds of live ammunition, one motorcycle, and a machete while some victims (farmers) were rescued unhurt.

title: Bandits vs Army, FCT (Abuja)
description: A captain and two soldiers were killed by terrorists. The incident happened when the soldiers visited a law school and were ambushed by the bandits while returning to their base.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Driver vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A government driver identified as Nasir Yusha'u was shot dead by some bandits who attacked a commercial bus. It was reported that the deceased was attacked when he ran into the bandits passing through a route and decided to dodge them but was shot dead in the process. It was also reported that phones and other valuables were being taken by the bandits from the passengers.
place: Jibai to Katsina, Farun Bala Community
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , This Day (2 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 hoodlum was killed in an exchange of gunfire between the police and the robbers over robbing in an area. It was reported that the hoodlums blocked some roads and were robbing and extorting motorists.
place: Onitsha/Owerri Expressway, leading to Okija Nkwo Market

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: 3 persons, including a civilian and a policeman, were killed and 5 girls and a vigilante leader were abducted by terrorists in an attack. It was reported that the incident happened close to a forest where the bandits were located in the area.
place: Lasandi and Sabon Gari and Saminaka in Kwando Forest

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 persons were shot dead and 3 others were abducted by bandits after the withdrawal of soldiers from the community. it was reported that the attack was based on the Fulani militia, many others were also injured during the attack.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Several bandits were killed by combined security operatives in a gun duel that occurred in the affected area where the terrorists were trapped after a heavy downpour. It was reported that some villagers including women and children were rescued by the security forces who were abducted by the terrorists.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 9 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. This community have come under coordinated and sustained attacks by suspected Fulani herdsmen (bandits) who dislodged thousands of people from their ancestral communities and forced them into Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camps

title: Assailants vs APC Women, Imo
description: 5 people, including an All Progressive Congress (APC) women leader identified as Mrs. Okonkwo Rachael were killed by some unknown gunmen.

title: Political Crisis, Taraba
description: Doe Ilimia, a PDP youth leader and one other person were killed when gunmen invaded the residence

title: ISWAP vs Vigilante, Borno
description: 7 persons including the chairman of the Civilian Joint Tasks Force (CJTF), Alhaji Bukar Mandama, were killed in an ambush by Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) members. It was reported that the Troops were attacked at a Ruga site by the terrorists. It was also reported that some of the attackers were neutralized by the military.

title: Troops vs Terrorists, Katsina
description: 2 terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji during an operation. It was reported that the troops engaged the terrorists in a gun battle and recovered AK 47 Rifles and other weapons from the bandits.

title: Gunmen vs Wedding Guest, Imo
description: 7 youths, including Ifechi (20) and Emeka (22), were killed and 2 others sustained injuries by armed men suspected to be operatives of Ebubeagu, a government-owned vigilance outfit. The victims labeled bandits were reportedly attacked while returning from a wedding ceremony. It was also reported that 5 people were missing after the incident. Communities around the area protested the killings and shut down the Onitsha-Owerri expressway.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (14 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Vanguard (14 ) , The Nation (7 ) , The Guardian (14 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: A person was killed while 3 others were injured when bandits invaded a community and rustled some cows. The attackers reportedly numbered about 40 on 14 motorcycles. An unspecified number of residents were kidnapped by the attackers but were rescued by a team of policemen and vigilantes.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Some bandits ambushed some soldiers and killed one of them. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a mining community in the morning. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising the villagers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Bandits Kill Farmers, Sokoto
description: 4 farmers were killed and 70 others were abducted by bandits. They were attacked while working on their farms. 19 were abducted from Tsamaye village and 11 each in Mazau and Marina villages.

title: Bandits vs Terrorists, Kaduna
description: A clash between bandits and members of the dreaded Ansaru terrorist group led to the death of 2 people. The clash started when Ansaru members were preaching to local residents and this do not go well with the bandits.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: Mua’zu Danladi, a 25-year-old relative of former Bauchi governor, Adamu Mu’azu, was killed and 3 others were abducted by bandits. The attackers shot sporadically to ward off any counter-attack before fleeing with the victims.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 3, Taraba
description: 2 brothers, Rimamshong Kitan and Rikrum Kitan as well as their cousins, Adi and Ezekiel were killed on their farms by bandits. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported by the source.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 11 people were killed by some bandits who attacked some residents on their farm. It was reported that the incidents happened when terrorists loyal to a notorious kingpin identified as Damina attacked the farmers over ownership of the farmland.

title: Communal Clash, Cross River
description: 2 persons were killed and several houses destroyed during a clash between youths of 2 communities. It was reported that the crisis started as a result of disagreement over ownership of the same portion of rice farmland between the two communities.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 people were killed by some terrorists on their farms. It was reported that the victims were attacked by the terrorists while they were working on their farmlands.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji and elements of the Nigeria Police eliminated scores of terrorists. This is a reactionary clearance of the terrorists after they overran a police outpost in one of the villages.

title: Fighter Jet Kill 2, Katsina
description: 2 civilians were killed and 14 others were injured when a military fighter jet in search of bandits mistakenly dropped bombs on civilian areas. One of the victims was a woman.

title: ISWAP Prison Break, FCT (Abuja)
description: 5 people, including an official of the Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) and 3 members of the Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP), lost their lives. The incident happened when the terrorists broke into a custodial centre to free their colleagues. Several people were injured in the attack.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: 8 bandits were killed by the Military Information Officer, Operation Safe Haven, and the vigilante groups. It was reported that the attack was launched by the two security operatives as a repelled attack on the bandits in two communities.

title: Gunmen Attack, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were shot dead by unidentified gunmen. The victims, who were killed without provocation included Isonwa Kalu Egwu a.k.a German and a middle-aged man.
place: Ebem and Asaga in Ohafia Community

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Plateau
description: Mr. Yarima Jabil, a village head in a community, and his sons were killed by some gunmen who opened fire on the affected residents of the victims at midnight and carried out their operation. It was also reported that 2 women were being taken away by the gunmen after the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in a counter operation by soldiers. Arms, ammunition, and bags of assorted foodstuff were recovered from the victims.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 5 people in a village. They also carted away domestic animals and food items belonging to villagers.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: 15 people lost their lives in a communal crisis that happened between the people of Ngbo and Ezza in the Nkwuada community. It was reported that majority of the people killed in the clash were indigenes of Nkwuada. The cause of the clash was the killing of a native of Nkwuada by the Ezza settlers.
place: Ngbo and Ezza in the Nkwuada community

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Sokoto
description: 4 farmers were killed by some bandits while working at their farms. It was reported that the bandits arrived in the community at noon and launched an attack on the farmers. It was reported that an 18-year-old girl was also abducted during the attack.

title: Bandits vs Police, Katsina
description: An Assistant Commissioner of Police, ACP Aminu Umar Dayi, in charge of Dutsinma Area Command was ambushed and killed by bandits. It was reported that the victim was killed in a fierce gun duel. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal for the killing of the bandits' leader by the police operative.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A suspected member of the Indigenous People of Biafra/ Eastern Security Network (IPOB/ESN) was killed by the tactical police team. It was also reported that the police also arrested a lady attached to a vigilante group of the Ebubeagu over stolen motorbikes.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were killed by gunmen who attacked them at a checkpoint. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning. Several other people were also killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 7 soldiers were killed by some terrorists during an ambush attack. It was reported that the deceased were killed by the bandits in an ambush in a forest while on patrol.

title: Police vs IPOB, Ebonyi
description: A member of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Eastern Security Network (ESN) was killed while another member identified as Elijah, was fatally wounded, and 6 others escaped with gunshot injuries when the Police Command raided their camp.

title: Workers vs Boss, Kwara
description: A 45-year-old man, Jamiu Ibrahim was killed by his workers, Isiaka Sabi, Hassan Bature, and Aredo Umaru during an armed robbery operation. It was reported that the deceased, a farm owner was taken by 5 unknown gunmen at a farm settlement out of his room into a guinea corn farm behind his house and was shot dead.Another version of the story reported that the suspects conspired to kill the deceased for refusing to give them money.
place: Asalpa farm settlement, Idofin Odo-Ashe community
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Fulani Militias vs Church Members, Taraba
description: 30 members of the Reformed Church of Christ in Nigeria (RCGN) were slaughtered in a night attack by Fulani militias. Several others were wounded in the attacks.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed, 3 others were abducted and animals were taken away after bandits attacked some residents. It was also reported that the incident made many residents leave the affected areas for fear of more attacks.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Sokoto
description: 11 farmers working on their farms were attacked and killed by bandits. The bandits attempted to abduct other farmers but the vigilantes foiled it.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: Bandits killed 7 military personnel and one vigilante in some communities located in a chiefdom. The attackers issued quit notice to some other communities and threatened to wipe them out if they disobeyed.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: The commander of a vigilante group, Mr. Danladi Dobbo, 4 of his men and a hunter were ambushed and killed by bandits when they attempted to rescue some 22 farmers that were abducted on a farm at Rafin-Daji community in Abaji Area Council of Abuja.

title: Herdsmen vs Policemen, Benue
description: 2 policemen were shot dead by Fulani herders in the night. It was reported that the policemen were killed and their guns carted away by the herders. The policemen were on an operation to arrest some bandits before the attack. A version of the story stated that the policemen identified as Insp. Christopher Eigege and Sgt. Sunday Idoko were killed by one Orfega Msughter and others.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: A 20-year-old herder identified as Isah Muhammadu was shot to death by some bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits wielding sophisticated weapons attacked a Fulani settlement in the area.

title: Gunmen vs 3 Friends, Benue
description: 3 friends, including a lecturer in the Department of Mass Communication at the Benue State University, Markurdi identified as Mr. Fred Akaakar, Aondoayange Apever and Kachina Shiaondo were killed by bandits. They were accosted to a drinking joint where they were shot dead.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Ex-lawmaker, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 'Unknown' gunmen killed and beheaded a physically challenged politician, Nelson Achukwu, a former lawmaker in Anambra State. He was accused of sabotaging the activities of the gunmen.
place: The boundary of Uke and Ukpor Communities
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A joint security team made up of the police and vigilantes killed 2 terrorists in a village. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists invaded the village in their numbers, armed with AK-47 rifles.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed and 2 persons injured when bandits attacked Maranatha Baptist Church and St. Moses Catholic Church. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the community on motorcycles and launched their attacks on 3 villages. The gunmen also looted some shops and abducted over 40 people.
place: Mara-natha Baptist Church and St. Moses Catholic Church,Ungwan Fada, Ungwan Turawa and Ungwan Makama in Rubu Area
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Vanguard (3 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A terrorist was killed in a gun duel battle by police operatives in collaboration with other personnel. It was reported that the bandits invaded 2 villages on motorcycles and attacked the residents. Ak-47 with 18 rounds of live ammunition were also recovered by the police after the operation
place: Sara Gamawa and Unguwar Meta Villages, Gummi/ Bukkuyum Axis

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 6 mobile policemen were killed by bandits during an attack on the convoy of intending pilgrims to Saudi Arabia. It was reported that the bandits engaged the police in a gun battle that made the pilgrims escape unhurt to a safe place.

title: Fulani Herdsmen and Youths, Abia
description: 2 people including a wheelbarrow petty trader and a commercial motorcyclist were killed during a protest staged by youths for the killing of 36-year-old Israel Nwaobilor, a tipper driver by suspected Fulani Herdsmen. Nwaobilor went to load sharp sand in his tipper when he was reportedly abducted and later found dead in the bush some days.

title: ISWAP vs Scavengers, Borno
description: 13 metal scavengers were shot dead by ISWAP fighters in a village. The victims included 11 male and 2 female scavengers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , This Day (13 ) , The Nation (13 )

title: IPOB/ESN vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: 5 people, including a gang leader known as Double Lion, were killed during a confrontation between members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and some unknown gunmen. The clash happened when members of IPOB swooped on the gunmen in their camp.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Kidnappers, Bauchi
description: 3 people were killed and 3 others injured when gunmen suspected to be kidnappers raided a community. The bandits went to the village to abduct the head, Jauro Banu, but when people raised the alarm, they abandoned their mission and fled.

title: ISWAP vs CJTF, Borno
description: 3 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CTJF) were killed when some ISWAP fighters attacked them. The fighters also abducted some humanitarian workers.

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Unknown gun attacked a meeting venue and killed 3 people. 2 others were inflicted with bullet wounds. The incident is connected with the numerous attacks on civilians and government security forces by gunmen believed to be members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), an arm of IPOB.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Two farmers, Alhaji Mustapha Lawal and Bello Lawal, were killed on their farmland by suspected bandits. The victims had gone to their farm to plant some crops when they were killed and 3 others were kidnapped.

title: Gunmen Attack, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 businessmen identified as Sammy and Alaba were killed by unknown gunmen who came on two commercial motorcycles. It was reported that the victims were at their shop discussing with other people when the gunmen shot them.
place: Umuoba, Ogbor Hill Waterside, Bridge Motor park

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A suspected bandit was killed and 1 AK47 and 9 motorcycles were recovered by a team of police Operation Puff Adder and the army's Operation Thunder Strike. It was reported that the joint security operatives engaged the bandits in an exchange of gunfire that led to the death of the bandits.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person identified as Abdullahi was killed and another sustained injury during an attack by bandits. It was reported that the bandits attack the community with the intention of rustling cattle belonging to the residents but the mission failed when they could not meet their target.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person identified as Ikechukwu Udeozor was killed by some gunmen after spending days in captivity. It was reported that the deceased was kidnaped at his residence for some days before he was killed.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilantes, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 hoodlums, identified as Baby Nayoka, popularly known as Baby, and 1 other were killed by some vigilantes. It was reported that the hoodlums arrived in a Sienna car and lodged in a hotel in readiness for the next day's operation when they were traced to the location and gunned down.

title: Herdsmen Attack, (FCT), Abuja
description: The body of a young man identified as Hussaini Aliyu Takuma was discovered inside a well by the security operatives some days after he was declared missing by his brother. he was believed to have been killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: One Killed, Benue
description: An SS3 female student of Saint Monica's Girls Secondary School, undergoing the West African Senior School Certificate Examination, (WASSCE), identified as Charity Eze was shot dead by unknown gunmen in her residence. It was reported that the deceased was attacked by gunmen who shot her in the head when she went to remove her clothes from the rope.

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralized several fighters of the Islamic State of West African Province and Boko Haram group. The terrorists were killed during clearance operations embarked upon by troops of 115 Battalion. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Youth Leader, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Hon. Emeka Alaehobi, a youth leader, was kidnapped from his home by some gunmen who later killed the victim. His remains was left on a road.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Boko Haram vs Youths, Borno
description: 22 youths were killed by fighters of the Boko Haram terror group. The incident happened when the youths were scavenging for disused metal and twisted irons. The terrorists also scavenge for the metal which they use to produce tools and other weapons.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (22 ) , This Day (23 ) , Nigerian Tribune (23 ) , Daily Trust (23 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), together with members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF), killed about 47 terrorists, including top commanders of a splinter group of Boko Haram.
place: Lake Chad and fringes of Sambisa forest

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) troops killed over a dozen Boko Haram terrorists, seized 3 gun trucks and torched a petrol tanker.

title: Communal Clash, Cross River
description: 3 people were killed in a communal crisis between two communities over land ownership. It was reported that many houses were destroyed both in the two communities. This incident is connected to the event in IBD024255.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Men of Anambra State Police Command killed Chinedu Ajogu a.k.a Sampolo, the gang leader of a kidnapping group terrorizing some communities. It was reported that five other members of the gang were arrested while their victims were rescued.

title: Gunmen vs Worshippers, Ondo
description: Over 50 people were killed and several others wounded when bombs exploded and bullets were rained on worshippers at St. Francis Catholic Church, by gunmen suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (50 ) , The Nation (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (50 ) , Daily Trust (22 )

title: Communal Crisis, Gombe
description: 1 person was killed while several others were injured during a clash over farmlands between Waja and Lunguda communities. The incident happened when some Lunguda people who went to the farm were attacked in the morning.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 1 person identified as Stephen Gyang, 24-year-old, was killed and 2 others were injured by gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened at night when the gunmen invaded the affected village.

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Fighters of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) killed a Boko Haram commander, Ummate Ma, and other fighters. It is assumed that 24 fighters were killed in the clash.
place: Chinene/Barawa axis in the Mandara Mountains

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Woman, Abia
description: A woman was kidnapped and killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Her murder occurred a few weeks before another man was killed in the same LGA (see event in IBD024385).

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji, rescued 152 kidnapped civilians, killed 18, and apprehend 25 bandits. The troops also recovered 292 cattle and 1 camel in the operation.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl-Stroke (OPWS) neutralized five bandits in a community. It was reported that the bandits were killed in two different encounters.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )
