title: Communal Clash, Kogi
description: A renewed crisis between Bassa and Igburra over land led to the death of 18 people while over 20 houses were razed down.
place: Farm at Uga-Cheure near Oguma and Korumu near Udogbo

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 30 members of the local vigilante otherwise known as Yan Saka. They also ambushed the vigilante members as they were trying to mobilize against them.
place: Gidan Dan Inna community in Auki district

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 25 people were killed by gunmen during an attack on a community. The attack was carried out in the afternoon by the gunmen who attacked the communities without any provocation.
place: Ungwan Gamu, Dogon Noma of Maro, Ungwan Sarki and Maikori villages near Maro ward
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (32 ) , The Guardian (32 ) , The Punch (32 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman was shot dead by some gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen also dispossessed the victim of his rifle during the attack. The incident happened when policemen were on patrol.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko Haram fighters and one soldier were killed when troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) combed the enclaves of the terrorists. It was reported that the troops rescued a 5-year-old child during the operation.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 2 notorious bandits, Dullu and Dan Maigari, were killed alongside 15 others during an attack on their base by another group led by a notorious bandit, Bello Turji. The clash followed the killing of a member of Turji's gang.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 6 others were arrested by the police for terrorizing the area. Other things like weapons and animals were recovered by the police during the operation.

title: Gunmen vs Catechist, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person identified as Chief Clement Umeh, a Catechist, was killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the gunmen attacked the deceased in his house and beheaded him, then went away with his head and set his house ablaze.

title: Cultist vs Soldier, Ogun
description: A clash between cultists and soldiers led to the death of one of the soldiers. It happened when a crisis broke out between Yahoo boys (Internet fraudsters). one of them went to bring cultists and the other invited soldiers to defend him. The victim died from a stray bullet fired by fellow soldiers.

title: Boko Haram vs Hunters, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram fighters were killed and 20 injured by hunters led by their chairman, Mai Kyari. It was reported that the incident happened at the hideout of the terrorists in which the hunters and the Boko Haram terrorists engaged in a fierce battle.

title: Boko Haram vs Policemen, Borno
description: 2 policemen were killed in an ambush and others were injured by Boko Haram fighters. It was reported that the terrorists also attacked the policemen in a village and burnt two of their patrol vehicles.
place: Goni Matari Village, between Mainok and Jakana, along Maiduguri-Damaturu Road,

title: Gunmen vs Family, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 people, a mother, Harira Jibril, and her 4 children (Fatima, Khadija, Hadiza and Zaituna) were allegedly killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the gunmen invaded the areas and opened fire on the victims and left.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 100 family members of terrorists in the North East, comprising 33 women and 67 children, were rescued by the troops. The troops and the Civilian Joint Task Force also neutralized some terrorists. It is assumed that 10 of the terrorists were killed in the encountrer.
place: Amdaga, Balazola, Ndakaine, Jango, Sabah and Gobara

title: Boko Haram vs Youths, Borno
description: 35 youths were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The incident happened when the youths went to scavenge for metal. The terrorists also scavenge for the metal which they use to produce tools and other weapons.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (35 ) , This Day (32 ) , Nigerian Tribune (32 ) , Daily Trust (32 )

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 65 people who were mostly farmers were killed when the Boko Haram fighters raided a border community. The locals who are mostly farmers, fishermen and businessmen lost their lives and fortunes to terrorists due to the limited presence of security operatives.
place: Rann, situated on the international border between Nigeria and Cameroon, 365 km from Maiduguri
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (65 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , The Guardian (35 )

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP Fighters, Borno
description: 6 terrorists were killed during a clash between Boko Haram fighters and members of the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was reported that Boko Haram invaded the hideout of ISWAP fighters at night and attacked their convoy.

title: IPOB Member, Delta
description: Police operatives attached to an anti-kidnapping unit shot dead Chinedu Omenogor, a suspected IPOB member and arrested 4 others, including retired military personnel.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army in collaboration with the operatives of the Department of State Services (DSS). The incident happened when the operatives invaded the IPOB training camp.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Some terrorists killed 7 people in some communities. The incident happened when the bandits attacked the communities and also carted away animals and food items.
place: Kwan-doka, Gidan kada and Kaura-dawa communities

title: Cult Clash, Ogun
description: 2 persons were killed in a reprisal cult attack by an opposition cult group. It was reported that the crisis started during a fight that broke out between two cult groups which created fear among residents in the area.

title: Truck Driver and Conductor, Delta
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen believed to be members of the Independent People of Biafra, IPOB, attacked and killed a truck driver and his conductor at a roadblock. The truck belonging to a popular manufacturing company was burnt down alongside a car and a Keke Maruwa.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 6 suspected terrorists who attempted to raid some communities were killed by the police. It was reported that weapons and some animals were recovered from the bandits while others were rustled by the attackers.
place: Dabaibayawa Village in Batagarawa and Dankiri Village

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Delta
description: A superintendent of police was shot dead by members of the Eastern Security Network, the armed wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A man was shot dead by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB. It was reported that the deceased was on his way coming from a trip when he was killed at a junction.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Abia
description: A motorist was killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack on a shuttle bus. It was reported that the Fulani herdsmen kidnapped all the passengers on the bus inside a bush and killed the private car owner.
place: Uturu-Okigwe Road, Close to the Abia State University
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Ondo
description: Gunmen doubling as bandits attacked and killed a 49-year-old man identified as Abayomi Olukoju. The incident happened when the bandits wanted to abduct the victim during a journey and shot him dead when he tried to escape.

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Anambra
description: Some hoodlums who were enforcing a sit-at-home order were killed by the Anambra State Police Command. Since it was not specified how many people were killed, it is assumed that no less than 5 of the hoodlums died in the incident. Another version of the story stated that the hoodlums killed one person during the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman was killed by some gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The unidentified policeman was riding a motorcycle when the gunmen stopped him and shot him dead.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A couple was shot dead by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that they also injured other people during the attack.

title: Fulani Kidnappers, Abia
description: The decomposing bodies of kidnap victims were found in a place where they were dumped. The victims were kidnapped by Fulani herdsmen who later killed them and dumped their bodies. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that about 5 bodies were dumped in the place.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a terrorists' commander known as Abubakar Sarki and his fighters. The incident happened when the troops engaged in clearance operation

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 farmers were killed on their farmlands by bandits. It was reported that the deceased's were on their farmlands to harvest their crops when they were attacked. It was also reported that the bandits were terrorizing the community and vowed that no farming activist will take place.

title: Gunmen Kill 7, Kano
description: 7 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted the head of the community and injured three other people.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A member of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) died from a stray bullet during a crossfire between security agents and bandits along an expressway. The bandits were engaged by the security agents while they were trying to cross the highway in the evening.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Niger
description: Bandits killed three policemen and a commercial motorcyclist. It was reported that they injured the passenger on the motorcycle. The incident happened in the night when the police were doing their routine duties.

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Air strikes of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) eliminated the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) Militant Chief of Defence (Ameeru-l-Fiha), Bako Gorgore and Aba Ibrahim, a prominent leader in the Nigerian North East of the Lake Chad.

title: Boko Haram Kill Commander, Borno
description: A top commander of Boko Haram/ ISWAP, Abu-Sadiq, popularly known as Burbur was killed by his group for allegedly plotting to surrender to the Nigerian troops.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: Gunmen suspected to be terrorists killed 7 soldiers, a mobile policeman and some villagers during an attack on the 6 Brigade of the Nigerian Army Base. The incident happened when soldiers were responding to an attack on a nearby village. Another source had it that soldiers neutralized many bandits during a raid on their hideout.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 7 residents were killed during an attack on a community in the early hours of the day by bandits. Some residents were injured in the incident.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 persons were killed by bandits in two villages. It was reported that the bandits stormed the villages in the afternoon and started shooting sporadically at the residents.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: 56 people were killed while several others were injured when bandits on motorcycles, carrying sophisticated weapons attacked some villages.
sources_of_information: The Punch (56 ) , The Guardian (56 ) , Vanguard (48 ) , This Day (56 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed Malam Shehu, the Amir and spiritual head of some terrorists. It was reported that the troops killed the man and some of his foot soldiers during a clearance operation in their enclaves.
place: Jaje, Mango Ali, Dissa and Balangaje
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 )

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Imo
description: Gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) killed an Assistant Superintendent of Police, Ukam Efut. The incident happened when the officer and two other policemen were collecting money from illegal oil dealers at a checkpoint. It was reported that the police mobilized to the spot of the attack and killed 2 of the gunmen.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 people were killed and a military base was set ablaze by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) during an attack on a remote village. It was reported that the insurgents stormed the village in larger numbers and opened fire on the residents and their properties.

title: IPOB Sit-At-Home, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 men were killed by hoodlums for violating a sit-at-home order introduced in the South-East by the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). One of the victims is identified as a policeman, while the second is yet to be identified.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: A farmer, Musa Monsuro, was hacked to death on his cashew farm by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The area has been notorious for herdsmen attacks.

title: IPOB, Anambra
description: 2 brothers, Nnajiofor Modobi and Godwin Modobi, a former youth leader of the community, were killed by the hoodlums for violating a sit-at-home order introduced in the South-East by the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) killed about 22 Boko Haram/Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened during clearance operations.
place: Fringes of Lake Chad, Tumbun Rabo

title: Gunmen Kill Soldiers, Imo
description: A would-be couple who were personnel of the Nigerian Army, Master Warrant Officer Audu Linus and Private Gloria Mathew, on transit to formalize their traditional marriage rites, were beheaded by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The gunmen raped the woman before killing her and her man. They made a video of the dastardly act and circulated it online. IPOB denied the allegations.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Ebubeagu Operative, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: An operative of Ebubeagu security network identified as Sunday Izhikpa was shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The victim was killed at his duty post.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Benue
description: 2 personnel of the NSCDC, Alexander Odeh (Assistant Superintendent of Corps II), and Ajoko Terwase (ASCII) as well as their driver were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen while on duty enforcing anti-grazing law in the state. They were members of the Livestock Guard Command in the state.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 5, Plateau
description: 5 passengers including a vigilante were killed by bandits. While 2 of the victims were killed in an ambush, the other 3 were killed in a stop-and-search operation by the attackers. About 20 others were abducted. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: The troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) neutralized 1 bandit during a joint patrol. The incident happened when the troops engaged the troops in a gun duel.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: The troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) neutralized 3 bandits during a joint patrol. The incident happened when the troops engaged the troops in a gun duel.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 farmers, Terkende Injarwua and Mfaiga Ukor, were killed on their farms by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Their corpses were recovered and buried.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 19 people belonging to the Irigwe Development Association (IDA) were killed and some injured by suspected militias in different villages. It was reported that many people were missing, houses were razed and harvested food crops were burned during the attack.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: Soldiers on internal security operations in the South-Eastern part of the country killed 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra and the Eastern Security Network (ESN) during a fierce gun battle.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 25 people including a 102-year-old native of the area were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits operated for hours in which properties were destroyed, houses were razed, and foodstuffs and animals were taken away.
place: Kamaru Ward, in the Chawai Chiefdom.

title: ISWAP Bomb Blast, Yobe
description: 1 person was killed while 7 others were injured when a bomb explosion rocked a beer parlour. It was reported that the blast left many people scampering for safety. It is assumed that the attack was carried out by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), a faction of Boko Haram.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Hoodlums Attack Police Station, Kogi
description: 3 police officers lost their lives in an attempt to repel an attack by hoodlums who attacked Adavi Police Station. The Islamic State-backed faction of Boko Haram, the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed responsibility for the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Farmer, Plateau
description: Mr. Pam Dogo, a farmer, was killed in an ambush by gunmen suspected to be Fulani militias. He was attacked while returning from the farm.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 10 persons were killed during an attack by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists came on bikes with weapons and launch the attack on the residents.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 8 people were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. Several people were injured in the attack. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the community. Another version of the story stated that the victims were a family of five and six others.
sources_of_information: The Punch (8 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kastina
description: 2 people were killed by bandits. Scores of residents were also abducted by the attackers.

title: Bandits vs Councilor, Katsina
description: A newly elected councilor, Alhaji Nasiru Magaji, was killed in the early hours of the day by rampaging bandits. It was reported that the hoodlums invaded the residence of the victim before shooting him dead.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Terrorists suspected to be either members of ISWAP or Boko Haram sneaked into the town and killed more than 12 people in a bar. Many were injured while some government buildings were burnt in the attack.

title: OPWS Troops vs Notorious Bandits, Nasarawa
description: Troops of Operation Whirl-Stroke (OPWS) killed a bandit and arrested a notorious bandit leader identified as Leggi Jibrin during a raid on their hideout in a forest. Some of their kidnapped victims were rescued and weapons were recovered.

title: Leadership Crisis, Edo
description: 3 people were killed when gunmen opened fire on them while collecting parking fees from vehicles. One of the victims was the Chief Security Officer of the community. Mr. Osasu. The attack was attributed to the lingering leadership tussle in the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 terrorists were killed and many people were rescued by Troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force( MNJTF) and Operation Lake Sanity. It was reported that the troops overcame the terrorists in the vicinity of Tumbun Fulani and Tumbun Rago.
place: Tunbun Fulani and Tunbun Rago in Lake Chad axis
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Punch (27 )

title: Assailants vs Fulani Herdsmen, Kogi
description: A notorious criminal identified as Kabir Bala (Okwu) and members of his gang killed five Fulani herders. Some of the victims were identified as Ibrahim, Harun and Shuaibu Wang.

title: Communal Clash, Akwa Ibom
description: 40 people were killed, and houses and properties worth millions were destroyed during a communal conflict between the Ilaje (Yoruba) and Ibeno communities. It was reported that the crisis started as a cult clash before assuming an ethnic dimension. Many residents especially fishermen fled the community for safety.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (40 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 )

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 2 commanders and 32 fighters of the Boko Haram were killed by Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters during a supremacy clash between the two groups. It was also reported that some members of the ISWAP group were also killed in the clash.
place: Yale in Damboa and Gargash Village

title: ISWAP Kill 2, Borno
description: 2 security personnel were killed and an unspecified number of people were wounded when Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters attacked a military formation. Another version of the story stated that 2 soldiers and one mobile policeman were killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The bodies of 5 kidnap victims were found by some members of a community. It was reported that the victims were kidnapped by suspected bandits and might have been killed after they failed to pay the demanded ransom.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralized 23 terrorists. The incident happened when the troops responded to a distress call of a terrorist attack on a village and they mobilized to the scene.
sources_of_information: The Punch (23 ) , Other newpapers 1 (22 ) , Daily Trust (22 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of 34 Artillery Brigade of the Nigerian Army neutralized a kingpin of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and its armed affiliate, Eastern Security Network (ESN). The incident happened when the group was trying to enforce sit-at-home order. It was reported that a musician known as Roco Nnadiwekwe, aka Ja Rule, a teenager, and a woman died from a stray bullet during the shootout.
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (17 )

title: Gunmen vs Community, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: About seven members of the Hausa community in Anambra State were killed by gunmen. The incidents happened during spates of attacks unleashed on members of the community by the gunmen.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 7 volunteers acting as vigilantes when they attacked a community. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack on the community for the killing of 2 members of the bandit group.

title: ISWAP vs Vigilante, Borno
description: A 17-year-old vigilante identified as Godwin was killed by the fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was reported that the terrorists also kidnapped 6 girls from the community.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 2 persons were killed and many fled their homes during an attack by bandits. It was reported that the attack was launched when the villagers were observing their iftar.

title: Terrorists Attack, Niger
description: 4 people were killed and many kidnapped during a terrorist attack on a village. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village on motorcycles with weapons and fired a truck conveying villagers from Erena to a town, injuring many of them.
place: Tafila Village, near Gwada, Internally Displaced Persons,(IDPs) camp, Town.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen attacked a community and killed one policeman. The attack was carried out at a junction leading to the house of the state governor where security operatives erected a security post.

title: INEC Official Death, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: An Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) staff identified as Nwokorie Anthony, involved in the ongoing Continous Voter Registration Excercise (CVR) was killed by unknown gunmen. 2 other officials were missing after the attack. The registration process was suspended following the attack.
place: Nkwo Ihitte, PU 004, in Amakohia Ward (RA 02)
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) eliminated about 100 Boko Haram/Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists, including 10 key commanders. The offensives were conducted under the ''Operation Lake Sanity'' involving the MNJTF troops from Nigeria, Niger and Cameroon and troops from Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK - Nigeria). One of the key ISWAP leader killed in the attack was identified as Ammar Bin-Umar.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (100 ) , Nigerian Tribune (100 ) , Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , Vanguard (100 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and an unspecified number of other animals were taken by some bandits during an attack on a farm belonging to the Nigerian Correctional Service. It was reported that the bandits came very early in the morning and went straight to the farm.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Operatives of Kaduna Police Command in collaboration with the Nigerian Army and Navy foiled an attack on a village by some bandits. It was reported that one person was killed during the incident.

title: Residents vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A repentant bandit known as Smally led some courageous locals to the enclaves of bandits where the criminals were engaged, leaving scores dead and freeing about 38 kidnapped victims.

title: Bandits vs Traditional Ruler, Benue
description: A traditional ruler in Gaambetiev was killed while many other people were critically injured. It was reported that the bandits also burnt several houses and properties. The killers were identified as Fulani herders.
place: Gaambetiev, Avalumun Ioraav in Turan Council Ward
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 9, Benue
description: Suspected marauding Fulani herdsmen killed 9 people in a village. It was reported that they also injured one person and also destroyed several properties in their rampage.
place: Tse-Sumaka village in Mbadwem Council Ward
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , Vanguard (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 persons were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked a community. The gunmen also burnt 5 houses and destroyed properties worth millions of naira.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: About 80 people were killed by rampaging bandits who attacked 4 villages. It was reported that the gunmen infiltrated the villages in the morning and unleashed mayhem on residents, injuring many and displacing others.
place: Kukawa, Gyanbahu, Dungur and Keram villages
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (101 ) , Other newspaper 3 (101 ) , The Guardian (78 ) , Nigerian Tribune (81 ) , The Nation (80 ) , Vanguard (80 )

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: About 62 people were killed by rampaging bandits who attacked 4 villages. It was reported that the gunmen infiltrated the villages in the morning and unleashed mayhem on residents, injuring many and displacing others.

title: Bandits Attack, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits attacked 2 communities, killed a person, and abduct 7 others. They also engaged some vigilantes in a gun duel while escaping and killed 2 of the vigilantes.

title: Banditry, FCT Abuja
description: Mr. Adamu Aliyu, the Chairman of Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association, and 3 of his members were killed by bandits while returning from a business trip.
place: Daku Village in Dobi Ward, a border between FCT and Niger State.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed and 3 others were abducted by bandits during an attack on a Fulani settlement. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits tried to abduct a resident.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons were killed when gunmen stormed a council headquarters and set the building on fire. It was reported that the gunmen came in two vehicles.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 3 people were killed, others injured and kidnapped in a terrorist attack in some communities. the attackers arrived in large numbers and raided the community.
place: Rumache Medalla Community in the Bassa/Kukoki Ward
sources_of_information: This Day (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 3 people were killed by bandits who attacked a Mosque while worshippers were breaking their Ramadan fast. It was learnt the attackers, numbering about 50, also abducted many worshippers from the mosque and took them to unknown locations.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 church security men were killed by unknown gunmen for attending a prayer session that was declared by the Anambra State governor, Charles Soludo.
place: St. Joseph's Cathedral Church in Ekwulobia
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Gunmen vs FRSC Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 Operatives of the FRSC were killed by gunmen during patrol operations. The commander of the unit was also injured by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Commander of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) identified as Abubakar Dan-Buduma and 19 other terrorists were killed by troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF). It was reported that the terrorists were killed in an attempt to launch an attack on the nearest military base.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 Nigerian Soldiers were killed by an IED by suspected bandits. It was reported that the soldiers were on their way to an operation when their vehicle stepped on the IED planted by the terrorist.

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 4 hunters were killed and 7 others sustained various degrees of injuries when an IED buried by some Boko Haram insurgent exploded. The IED exploded on a highway.
place: between Damboa and Sabon-Gari along Damboa/Biu highway

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 security operatives were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The incident happened when the group attacked some police stations.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 traders were killed while 7 others were injured by terrorists who invaded a market. It was reported that the hoodlums invaded the market in the afternoon with sophisticated weapons.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed and properties were stolen by bandits during an attack on some communities. It was reported that they arrived on bikes and started shooting.

title: Cult Clash, Benue
description: 5 houses were burnt during a cult clash. It was reported that the crisis started when a young man suspected to be a cult member was killed. His death resulted in reprisal attacks by his members.
place: Adeke around the mobile police barracks

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 17 people were killed by bandits during attacks on four villages. It was reported that they arrived on motorbikes and started shooting at the people. They also went away with some cattle in the markets.
place: Kadaddaba, Rafin Doka, Babban Baye, and Wano Communities

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people were shot dead and several others were kidnapped by bandits who invaded a community in the night. It was reported that some residents were hit by stray bullets and got injured while escaping from the rampaging bandits.
place: Ungwan Bulus area of Sabo Tasha Kaduna city

title: Gunmen vs Ebubeagu Operative, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen killed an operative of the South-East Security Network codenamed Ebubeagu. It was reported that the victim, Iboko Christian, was attacked in his house.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons were killed and a building was set ablaze by gunmen identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The gunmen have been troubling the communities within the South East.
place: Ukpor, Headquarters of Nnewi South LGA
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 2 people and razed 20 houses. It was reported that the herders also destroyed many farmlands and crops.
place: Laake village in Kwali District of the council area
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: The air component of Operation Thunder Strike eliminated some bandits during a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops also recovered some guns and motorcycles.
place: Akilibu-Sarkin Pawa Road at Mangoro village

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The air component of Operation Thunder Strike eliminated some bandits during a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops also recovered some guns and motorcycles.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 people were killed and several others displaced when herdsmen attacked several communities. Most residents, especially women and children, left the village for safety.
place: Boagundu, Turan, Maav-Ya, Kendev-Ya, Ityuruv, Ugbe, Iyon, Iwanev, Injôôv as well as Jato-aka

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 23 people were killed and many were injured during an attack by bandits in two villages. Some of the bandits were neutralized and valuable items were recovered by the security operatives.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 people including a pastor identified as Rev. John Torbee Ajav of Deeper Life Church, Umenger were killed by some suspected Fulani herdsmen. It was gathered that the pastor was on his way to a program when the suspected Fulani opened fire and killed him. The other victims were farmers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: IPOB, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen believed to be enforcing the Monday sit-at-home order of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) shot 2 passengers dead.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 7 soldiers were killed by terrorists during an ambush on the troops. It was reported that the incident occurred the same day terrorists bombed the Abuja-Kaduna train and led to the killings and abductions of others.

title: Gunmen Attack Train, Kaduna
description: 8 people were killed, some injured while others were missing when gunmen attacked the Abuja-Kaduna train and blew up the rail track. Some of the deceased were Secretary-General of the Trade Union Congress of Nigeria, Musa-Lawal Ozigi, Kwara State Chairman, Akin Akinsola, and Dr. Chinelo Magafu Nwando, a young medical doctor. The attack was never formally claimed and was allegedly masterminded by Ali Kawaje, a gang leader also known as "Kachalla", and one Sadiku, a former member of the Darul Islam sect who joined Boko Haram. It forced the railway corporation to suspend further operations.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Bandits Kill Villagers, Kaduna
description: 15 villagers were killed when bandits invaded a village. They came into the village shooting sporadically which led to the death of the victims.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 4 notorious criminal gang members believed to be foot soldiers of the late gang leader, Terwase Akwaza, popularly known as Gana, were killed by police.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Bandits Attack Airport, Kaduna
description: A security operative, Mallam Shehu Na’Allah, attached to the Nigeria Airspace Management Agency (NAMA) was killed when over 200 bandits attacked the Kaduna International Airport. It was reported that the military killed 12 people who attacked the airport.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , The Punch (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (13 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: 8 people, including a pregnant woman, were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen in two communities. It was reported that the youths of the communities had chased some herders out of their farms for allowing cows to destroy hectares of cassava plantation and in the process killing some cows. This made the Fulani herdsmen launch a reprisal attack. Several houses and motorcycles were burnt and farmlands were destroyed.
place: Mgbuji and Ebo communities in Eha-Amufu

title: Bandits vs Farmer, Sokoto
description: 4 farmers were killed by bandits. The bandits killed the farmers on their farmland after the farmers, refused the bandits' cattle to feed on their crops.

title: Ebubeagu Commander, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen invaded the house of the commander of Ebubeagu security outfit in Ezza North Local Government Area, Mr. Magnus Iganda, and shot him dead.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Herders, Katsina
description: Terrorists believed to be herders killed an unspecified number of people in five communities. The killing is a result of rivalry between two herder groups that accused each of cattle rustling. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.
place: Gidan Dankunda, Kungiya, Gidan Kurty Centan Dangera and Gidan Malumfashi

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Bandits killed three people and abducted 16 others in 4 villages. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the residents of the villages.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 people, including a village head, were killed by rampaging bandits who have been terrorizing residents, destroyed several properties in the village. Many people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , The Nation (16 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Imo State Police Command decimated 4 members of the Eastern Security Network when members of the group came in large numbers to attack a police station.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The leader of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP), Sani Shuwaram, and other members of the sect were killed in an airstrike by air components of the Nigerian Air Force. The super Tucano jets and other aircraft of the Nigerian Air Force killed the terrorists during series of bombardments of the ISWAP camps. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Military vs ISWAP, Borno
description: An unspecified Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by troops of operation Hadin Kai. The insurgents, armed with grenades and five-gun trucks, were overpowered by the troops. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40 deaths) were recorded.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: The Joint Security Task Force killed 100 suspected bandits and also recovered 61 motorcycles in a gun duel.

title: Bandits vs Army, Benue
description: 4 bandits were killed and their camp destroyed by troops of Operation Whirl Stroke. The new leader of the bandit gang, Terna Ahile, threatened to avenge the killing of his members and the destruction of their camp.
place: Mbayongo council ward, the general area is Vinvir

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army decimated several fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa Province and Boko Haram terrorists. They also rescued about 30 people abducted by the terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, The Punch

title: Cult Clash, Lagos
description: A leader of a cult group identified as Adebayo Pka Ororo was killed by members of a rival cult group known as the Aiye using a machete. It was reported that the crisis started in March when one of the members was killed and snowballed into reprisal attacks.

title: Gunmen vs Army Officer, Delta
description: Operations Officer of 3 Battalion of the Nigeria Army identified as Lieutenant Musa was killed by unknown gunmen. He was said to be killed along a link road in the community when he was driving home.

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Niger
description: 4 people were killed when some farmers clashed with Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that two of the victims were Fulani herdsmen while the other two were farmers. The clash started when the migrating herders stopped inside a farm owned by two siblings, Bello and Bala, and started cutting tree branches to feed their cows.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits were killed by joint security operatives led by 31 Artillery Brigade Commander. The incident occurred during a serious gun battle with the security operatives.
place: Chikammub, Mahoro in Gulbin Boka District

title: Bandits vs Travelers, Katsina
description: 5 passengers were killed while three were critically injured when bandits armed with sophisticated weapons opened fire on a vehicle.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army and members of a vigilante group killed scores of bandits who have been terrorizing residents. It was reported that the joint security task force also recovered cows from the bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 1 person was shot dead by some terrorists. It was reported that the incident occurred when the terrorists attacked a market in the area and unleashed terror on the people. Some of the victims were abducted, houses and food barns were burnt.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits were killed by men of the Nigerian Police during a failed attack by the terrorists. Another camp used by the terrorists to launch attacks was raided by security operatives.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 7 Children were killed in a stampede during an attack led by some bandits. It was reported that the incident occurred when residents fled their homes as soldiers protecting the community from bandits were withdrawn.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Borno
description: Aga City, the Vice Chairman of Timber Sellers Association, was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that he was killed while trying to drive off after receiving the noodles he bought for his family on his way home.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some bandits attacked a community in the early hours of the day, killed 3 people and kidnapped 2 women.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Security Officer, Ogun
description: Unknown gunmen killed an officer of Ogun State Security Outfit, Social Orientation and Safety Corps (So-Safe Corps). The victim, Assistant Superintendent of Corps (ASC), Jimi Ogunjimi, was shot in the early hours of the day while on surveillance of the area in the company of 5 colleagues.

title: Soldier vs Youths, Cross River
description: 2 lives were lost during a communal clash between Alesi (Ikom LGA) and Ochon (Obubra LGA). The victims were shot dead by soldiers drafted to quell the crisis. It was reported that the clash started at midnight when the soldiers engaged the youths in a gun battle, several others sustained injuries.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Kebbi
description: 19 Security Operatives including 13 soldiers, 5 policemen, and 1 vigilante were killed during an attack by some bandits on the convoy of the Deputy Governor, Samaila Yombe. It was reported that the incident involved a 3-hour gun duel between a combined military and police detachment against the bandit. ASP Idris Umar Libata was killed by the bandits during the attack. Some civilians were also killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (19 ) , Other newpapers 1 (14 ) , Daily Trust (19 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (25 ) , The Punch (25 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed while a Catholic priest identified as Reverend Father Joseph Akeke was abducted by some bandits. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a community.

sources_of_information: Vanguard (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Herdsmen vs Woman, Bayelsa
description: A 39-year-old woman identified as Waadu Alfred was tied to a stake, raped and killed in her farm by some Fulani herdsmen.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPKHK) killed 17 fighters of Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terror group. It was reported that the troops arrested 3 terrorists.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Rampaging bandits killed 35 people who were mainly members of the local vigilante. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a border community. Several people were abducted by the bandits.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (37 ) , The Punch (34 ) , Daily Trust (30 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed some fighters of Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) when they attempted to attack a town. The troops killed some fighters and recovered 2 vehicles from the attackers.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: A clash between the fighters of the Boko Haram terror group and those of Islamic State West Africa Province led to the death of scores of terrorists. It was reported that ISWAP seized 9 motorcycles from the Boko Haram group after the clash.

title: Bandits Attack, Sokoto
description: 2 farmers, Hamza Na’allah and Zubairu Haruna, were killed by bandits when they were working on their farmland. It was reported that a farmer escaped into the nearby village unhurt.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Rampaging bandits killed 35 people who were mainly members of the local vigilante. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a border community. Several people were abducted by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 5 people lost their lives while several others were injured when some bandits attacked some motorists and travelers. It was reported that the bandits opened fire on the travelers. One of the victims was identified as Saifudeen Lawal Isa.

sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 people and set ablaze a tanker on the road. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits blocked the road and opened fire on travellers.

title: Bandit vs Kidnap Victims, Zamfara
description: Bandits identified with notorious kingpin, Dankarami, killed 8 of the 10 men they kidnapped from a community for failure of their relatives to pay a N6 million ransom. The victims were abducted since September 1, 2021.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits lost their lives when a clash ensued between 2 rival groups of armed bandits. The crisis was a result of a misunderstanding over sharing of rustled cows. The bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Gunmen Attack, Niger
description: Gunmen invaded some communities and killed 2 people. It was reported that in a swift response, the local vigilance group mobilized and killed 7 of the bandits who invaded the communities.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 50 gunmen were shot dead by security operatives. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the bandits who have been terrorising residents.

title: IPOB vs Community, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 people, including a former PDP woman leader, Madam Ucha Kalu Ndukwe, her first daughter, Chibuzor Ndukwe and 2 others, Ndubuisi Ndukwe and Kalu Umah were killed by some hoodlums identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the assailants set houses ablaze, including that of the traditional ruler of the community, and destroyed several properties. The killing was said to have been as a result of a crisis that erupted in the community between 2 factional groups of unknown gunmen.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Niger
description: Over 8 bandits were killed while some security personnel and civilians were injured in a gun battle between security troops and the bandits.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 50 gunmen were shot dead by security operatives. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the bandits who have been terrorising residents. It was reported that 2 security operatives were killed in the attack.

description: About 50 gunmen were shot dead by security operatives. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Gunmen Attack, Niger
description: 9 villagers were killed by rampaging bandits who invaded several villages. It was reported that the gunmen numbering over 100 attacked the villages, killed the victims and injured others.

title: Gunmen vs Mourners, Benue
description: 9 people, including a traditional ruler, were killed by some bandits who rode into the community on motorcycles while people gathered for the burial of a couple Mr. and Mrs. Atenoe Agbev. It was believed that the area had been under the grip of gang members loyal to a kidnap kingpin, Terwase Akwaza, aka Gana, who was killed by the military in 2020.

title: Bandits vs Special Adviser, Taraba
description: Levi Gbashi, a Special Adviser to the Governor of Taraba State, was killed by bandits. This incident happened when the victim was coming back from a funeral at a nearby village.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Insurgents, who were on gun trucks and motorcycles, attacked and killed 7 people, burnt down shops, looted foodstuffs and livestock belonging to the residents. Other reports have it that 11 farmers were killed.

title: Boko Haram attack, Borno
description: 11 people were killed by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters. The attack took place in a remote village in the area. It was reported that the victims were shot several times.

title: Gunmen vs Octogenarian, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Professor Isaiah Onymelukwe was shot dead by some gunmen who blocked vehicles on a road. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted 2 people during the incident.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: The troops of the joint military spike operation codenamed Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) neutralized 2 notorious armed militia loyal to the slain militia warlord, Terwase Akwaza alias Gana. The 2 notorious militia were identified as Terdoo Kiorga, aka Apaapa, and Orkulam Mom, aka Orbutee.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed some fighters of Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) when they attempted to attack a town. The troops killed the insurgents who have been terrorising residents.
