title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai killed some fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) when they attempted to attack a town. The troops killed the insurgents who had been terrorizing residents.

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: Olamide Aremu was killed while 2 other persons were injured by political thugs, during the congress of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: A member of the Eastern Security Network, a wing of the IPOB was shot dead while 3 others were arrested by troops of the Nigerian Army. The group has been terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police escorts were shot dead by some gunmen suspected to be pro-Biafra agitators. The victims were killed when escorting a couple to the airport. The gunmen also abducted the couple but later released them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF) in Cameroon neutralized several Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that several other insurgents fled with gunshot injuries. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Guardian (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: 2 policemen were killed by some gunmen who attacked their station with guns and improvised explosive devices which set the station ablaze. This incident took place at night.

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: 8 people were killed, while 14 others, including 5 women, were abducted by bandits. The killing occurred in 2 communities, on different days.

title: Military vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Airforce eliminated 22 terrorist kingpins including top ISWAP Commander, Mallam Buba Danfulani, during a raid on Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorist’s strongholds.
place: Lake Tchad Tumbun area, including Tumbun Kaiyowa and Tumbun Allura

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 18 people were killed while several others were injured when some bandits invaded a village. It was reported that the incident happened in the night and caused panic among villagers.

title: Found Dead, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some decomposing bodies of kidnap victims were found in a well located in the camp of members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), a wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 bodies were found.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Punch (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 )

title: Police vs Kidnapper, Katsina
description: 1 bandit was shot dead during a gun duel with the police. The incident happened when the police tried to intercept some bandits who have been terrorising residents. 8 abducted victims were rescued.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen suspected to be pro-Biafra agitators invaded a cattle market and killed 8 people. They also slaughtered over 20 cows in the midnight attack.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen suspected to be pro-Biafra agitators killed 3 policemen at a checkpoint. It was reported that the incident happened in front of a police station where the policemen mounted a roadblock.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Anambra State police neutralized 3 gunmen who attacked Neni Police Divisional Headquarters. The police also recovered weapons from the gunmen. It was reported that some policemen were killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 3 policemen were killed.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 3 people were killed while about 24 others were abducted by bandits. It was reported that the attack was launched by bandits who were fleeing from joint security "Operation Sahara Storm".

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Operatives of the Anambra State police neutralized 4 gunmen who attacked Aguata Police Divisional Headquarters. The police also recovered weapons from the gunmen.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , The Nation (6 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed while several others were injured by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits attacked the village in the early hours of the day, forcing residents to flee from their homes.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 policemen were killed at a checkpoint by gunmen. It was reported that the rampaging gunmen took the police by unawares.
place: Obeagu Uno Amechi road along Awkunanaw-Agbani road
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Bandits Kill 8, Zamfara
description: 8 people were burnt to death by terrorists who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits also abducted about 29 people during the attack which happened in the evening.

title: Gunmen Attack, Niger
description: Over 200 gunmen invaded some communities and killed several people. They also injured men and abducted dozens of women and children. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 40 people were killed. Another version of the reported that the police and other security agents attacked the invading bandits and killed about 20 of them.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Bandits vs Community, Zamfara
description: 6 people were killed when some bandits attacked a community. It was reported that 5 of the victims were members of a vigilance group.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Scores of bandits were neutralised during an offensive by the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji. It was reported that a notorious bandit leader, Dogo Umaru and scores of his foot soldiers were killed in the operation.
place: Magama, Tsaunin, Babare and Tsamben villages

title: Bandits Kill 4, Niger
description: 4 people were killed when some bandits invaded a community. They also abducted an unspecified number of people including women.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Operatives of the Katsina State Police Command killed 5 bandits during a gun battle. The operatives repelled the bandits and rescued a kidnap victim.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Niger
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and ground troops killed 13 bandit leaders and gangs terrorizing some communities. It was reported that the operation was conducted by a military fighter jet and helicopter gunship.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed a muazzin who was calling for Subhi prayer in a community. The victim was inside the mosque close to his residence when the armed men struck and shot him dead.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Niger
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and ground troops killed 12 bandit leaders and gangs terrorizing some communities. It was reported that the operation was conducted by a military fighter jet and helicopter gunship.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Niger
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and ground troops killed 12 bandit leaders and gangs terrorizing some communities. It was reported that the operation was conducted by a military fighter jet and helicopter gunship.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 4 people were killed as gunmen identified as Fulani herders razed a village. It was reported that the gunmen invaded the village and shot sporadically. They also destroyed several properties.
place: Sabon Kaura village in Atyap chiefdom
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , The Punch (7 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: IPOB vs Army, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 members of the Eastern Security Network, a paramilitary wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when members of the ESN, including one Ejike, were enforcing sit-at-home in an area. It was reported that 3 military personnel lost their lives in an auto crash that happened in the same area while they were trying to stave off the gunmen's' attacks.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen killed two people in a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day. One of the victims was identified as Bobo, a member of the disbanded local vigilance group known as OSPAC. Another version of the story stated that the incident happened when OSPAC and a newly formed local security outfit in the area known as EMOVIS clashed.

title: Kidnappers Kill Cook, Kaduna
description: Rev. Fr. Joseph Shekari, the Catholic Priest of St. Monica Ikulu Pari Parish, was kidnapped by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen and his cook, Sati Musa, shot dead. The priest was later released by his abductors.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Police vs ESN/IPOB, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) was decimated by the operatives of the Imo State Police Command. The police recovered several weapons from the gunmen.

title: IPOB vs Commuters, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 commuters were killed and set ablaze inside their vehicle along a road by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra who were enforcing sit-at-home orders. The victims were on the road before they were ambushed and killed the IPOB members.

title: Police vs ESN/IPOB, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were decimated by the operatives of the Imo State Police Command. The police recovered several weapons from the gunmen.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 people were killed while several others were abducted by rampaging bandits who invaded several communities. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A commercial driver known as Mansur Sani was killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits also abducted 4 residents during the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 10, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed in some communities by rampaging bandits. It was reported that the bandits rode into the communities on several motorcycles and shot sporadically at residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , The Nation (10 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed in some communities by rampaging bandits. It was reported that the bandits rode into the communities on several motorcycles and shot sporadically at residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (17 ) , The Nation (23 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 17 people were killed by bandits when they invaded some communities. The bandits shot sporadically at residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (17 ) , The Nation (17 ) , The Punch (17 )

title: Bandits Kill 11, Kaduna
description: 11 people were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that several people suffered gunshot injuries during the attack.
sources_of_information: This Day (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , The Nation (11 ) , The Punch (11 )

title: Auto Crash, Ondo
description: An alumnus of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba was crushed to death by a hit-and-run truck driver. The incident happened when the victim visited the university for clearance.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Niger
description: Suspected Boko Haram terrorists killed some people when they attacked some communities. The incident created panic among residents. It is assumed about 20 people were killed in the incident.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: About 25 terrorists of the Islamic State of West African Province, ISWAP, got drowned while fleeing aerial bombardment by troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A leader of the Civilian Joint Task Force in Borno State identified as Ibrahim Maliya Saidu was killed while 5 others were severely injured when they stepped on landmines planted by Boko Haram.

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Katsina
description: The village head of Daddara Liman village was killed by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that the bandits also killed four people in a nearby village.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Independent (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Niger
description: Gunmen killed 3 soldiers, 4 vigilantes and 4 villagers were killed by bandits when they were on patrol. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits ambushed the victims.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Operatives of the Sokoto State Police Command killed 7 bandits during a clearance operation. They also recovered several weapons from the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Ogun
description: 5 people lost their lives while several properties worth millions of Naira were destroyed during a clash between some farmers and Fulani herdsmen. Many residents deserted the community.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: The internecine strife between the people of Ishinkwo and Abaomege led to the killing of one person identified as Ogbonnaya Chijioke. He was ambushed while on his way to the market and hacked to death by Abaomege bandits.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 10 people were killed by bandits in an attack on a village. The bandits also burnt several houses during the raid which happened in the early hours of the day. The bandits were identified as Fulani militia.
place: Atak Mawai village, Zaman Dabo ward
sources_of_information: This Day (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Vanguard (11 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Operatives of the Sokoto State Police Command killed 8 bandits during a clearance operation. They also recovered several weapons from the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Bandits vs Administrator, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed the former Sole Administrator of Dogon Dawa Development Area identified as Alhaji Idris Adam Damari. A large number of bandits invaded the town, shooting sporadically.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: ISWAP vs Security Operatives, Niger
description: About 12 members of the special task force deployed to repel insurgents in a town were killed by fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa (ISWAP). More than a dozen of the special task forces personnel suffered varying degrees of injury while several villagers were also killed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 13 people, including men, women and children, were killed in different bandits' attacks. The bandits were from different camps who joined forces against one Mani. The fatalities rose to 156 after some days.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Katsina
description: Bandits killed one person and injured 2 others when they attacked a town. It was reported that bandits have been terrorising residents of the town.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 people were killed while over 100 others were kidnapped when bandits struck 2 communities. It was reported that the gunmen riding on about 30 motorcycles and with AK-47 rifles stormed the communities and shot sporadically at people.

title: Gunmen vs Farmer, Kwara
description: A farmer identified as Alaga Olayemi was shot and killed on his farm by some bandits. It was reported that the farmer's son sustained a gunshot injury from the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Super Tucano fighter jets deployed by the Nigeria Air Force under Operation Hadin Kai decimated scores of insurgents belonging to the Islamic State for West African Province (ISWAP). The attack led to the killing of a notorious ISWAP commander known as Mallam Ari and others.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 female bandits and 4 others were killed when troops of the Nigerian Army repelled a kidnap gang that attempted to kidnap the Managing Director of the Zamfara State Transport Authority (Mass Transit), Mr. Aminu Adamu Papa and his family members.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Many bandits were decimated by security operatives during a clearance operation. It was reported that the Joint Task Security Task Force, comprising special hunters, intercepted some cattle.
place: Forests in Kutchi, Zagzaga, Gun and Katarma

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Many bandits were decimated by security operatives during a clearance operation. It was reported that the Joint Task Security Task Force, comprising special hunters, intercepted some cattle.
place: forests in Galadiman-Kogo, Kusasu, Alawa and Erena communities

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits killed one person and abducted 15 others. The incident happened in the night when residents were at sleep.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Assailants vs Ebubeagu Member, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Ebubeagu Security Network identified as Sunday Nwafor was killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the gunmen stormed the house of the victim in the night while he was asleep and committed the crime.
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists attacked some communities and killed four people. They also destroyed several buildings and kidnapped 24 people.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Bandits stormed a village and killed three people. It was reported that the bandits who dressed in military uniform also burnt houses and destroyed several properties.

title: IPOB vs Herder, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A herdsman identified as Mohammadu Alarabe alias Ogbodo was killed by member of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The victim was killed while he was taking care of the cattle of a prominent Igbo man known as Chief Peter Chukwuani Onyeabor. They also killed some of the cows.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 soldier and 1 officer of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) were killed when bandits stormed a military base.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The tactical team of the Imo State Police Command raided a criminal hideout inside a forest belonging to the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and neutralized one person.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen attacked a meeting being held by members of Enugu South Local Government's chapter of the All Progressive Congress (APC) and killed its State Youth Leader, Mr. Kelvin Ezeoha and another member of the party.
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , Independent (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs IPOB, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra were gunned down by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation aimed at ridding the hoodlums. Troops also recovered several weapons and insignia. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 3 police officers and two members of a vigilante group lost their lives in a gun battle with bandits. It was reported that scores of bandits died in the clash between bandits and security operatives.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (45 ) , Other newspaper 3 (45 ) , Other newpapers 1 (45 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits attacked a village.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a bandit while the bandits killed a soldier. The incident happened the troops came to intervene when the bandits were operating in a community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits, who came on several motorcycles, shot dead one person. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits invaded a village on a revenge mission. They were looking for members of the group of Malam Abba, a dangerous bandit leader.

title: Army vs Boko Haram/ISWAP, Borno
description: The troops of the Nigerian Army of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) killed five members of the Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen attacked a police headquarters, killing an inspector and leaving another policeman who died from the injuries he sustained. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the station, shooting sporadically.
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 3 bandits and recovered weapons from them. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops were on patrol in the area.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Ogun
description: 5 people lost their lives and many others got injured in a crisis between farmers and herdsmen. It was reported that the clash led to the burning of many houses, maize bans, motorcycles, and other valuables. The clash started when the herdsmen led their cows to graze on the farmers' farmlands. A version of the story stated that 2 hunters, Bara Kolawole and Sole Ojugbele, who came to help the farmers were shot dead by the police because a policeman, Inspector Omolayo Olajide was killed.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Bandits vs Traders, Kaduna
description: Bandits abducted an unspecified number of traders and killed one of them on their way to Kano and Kaduna.

title: Bandits Kill 19, Niger
description: 19 people were killed while 15 others were abducted by armed bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits attacked some communities.
place: Makuka, Kulho, Adogon Mallam and other communities

title: Bandits Kill 13, Niger
description: 13 people were killed by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the attack happened during the day.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Other newspaper 3 (13 ) , This Day (40 )

title: Fulani Gunmen vs Community, Plateau
description: 2 people lost their lives when some Fulani militia invaded a community. It was reported that the victims were killed on their way to the farm by the gunmen in the early hours of the day. In a reprisal attack, more than 18 people were killed and many injured in the attack. The Fulani group were accused of being responsible for the attack, in which 6 people were injured and over 20 houses razed down, vehicles, motorcycles and harvested food crops destroyed.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (2 ) , Daily Trust (18 ) , Other newspaper 2 (23 ) , The Guardian (21 ) , The Punch (18 )

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 people were shot dead by gunmen who were enforcing a sit-at-home order by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. It was reported that several vehicles were burnt.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and several others were abducted by bandits who invaded a suburb. It was reported that the terrorists came on motorcycles, killed the victim and kidnapped his wife and daughter. A version of the story stated that a man making call was shot dead by the bandits who invaded a community in the night.
place: Gbagyi villa, a suburb of the metropolis along the Kachia/NNPC highway
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Attack
description: 2 civilians were killed when members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) attacked a military institute. It was reported that the attackers also set 4 cars ablaze.
place: Tukur Yusuf Buratai Institute of the Nigerian Army University, Buratai Village

title: Bandits vs Miners, Katsina
description: 2 artisanal miners were shot dead by bandits who invaded their mining sites. It was reported that the bandits also left 5 of the miners with varying degrees of injuries.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were shot dead by gunmen who were enforcing a sit-at-home order by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. It was reported that several vehicles were burnt.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 youths were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits killed the victims on the spot.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 5 bandits were killed by security operatives who foiled the attempt of the bandits to attack a community. The operatives got wind of the attack and stepped in to stop it.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigeria Army killed three members of the Boko Haram terrorist group and destroyed an illegal market that is being operated by them. The incident happened during a clearance operation.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Vigilante Kills 8, Zamfara
description: A vigilante group killed 8 people who were said to be giving information to bandits. Among those killed were a man, his wife, and 2 sons.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Police operatives neutralized 2 bandits when they raided their enclaves in a forest. It was reported that the police recovered 22 rounds of live ammunition during the onslaught.

title: Bandits vs Power Workers, Niger
description: 2 workers at the Zungeru Hydro Power Dam, Wushishi, were shot dead by some bandits who attacked their sites. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped 4 Chinese expatriates.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Taraba
description: 2 passengers were killed by bandits who also abducted 40 people along a road. It was reported that the bandits abducted the people and moved them into the forest surrounded by mountains. Some of the victims were family members of the former Secretary to the Taraba State Government, Gibson Timothy Kataps.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 7, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 7 residents when they attacked a settlement. The victims were identified as Dahiru Bilya, Jibrin Bilya, Dayyabu Adamu, Bashir Habibu, Jabir Shuaibu, Buhari Habibu and Abubakar Habibu.
place: Kudu da Gari settlement in Sabon Birni
sources_of_information: This Day (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Independent (7 ) , The Nation (7 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits razed some communities and killed several villagers in 2 LGAs of the state. Different fatalities were reported by different sources. The numbers are split into 2 to cover both affected LGAs (See incident in IBD022935). Many of the victims were civilians and local vigilantes called Yan Sakai. A good number of residents were displaced to other villages.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits razed some communities and killed several villagers in 2 LGAs of the state. Different fatalities were reported by different sources. The numbers are split into 2 to cover both affected LGAs (See incident in IBD022936). Many of the victims were civilians and local vigilantes called Yan Sakai. A good number of residents were displaced to other villages.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: One person was killed and many others wounded as gunmen attacked the palace of Eze Imo, Dr. E. C. Okeke. The police tactical team and some vigilante group repelled the attack and stopped the attackers from setting the palace ablaze.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by the operatives of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing villagers. They were retreating to a forest when they were intercepted by the troops.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one person identified as Moses Jaja when they invaded a village. It was reported that they kidnapped several people in the attack.

title: Bandits vs Police, Taraba
description: A police sergeant was shot dead by bandits who kidnapped a serving officer of the Nigeria Customs Service. It was reported that the bandits also left a police inspector with gunshot injuries. The bandits later killed some of their members during the sharing of the ransom they collected from the abduction.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Taraba
description: A farmer identified as Irimiya Musa and 5 other people were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the gunmen, 5 in number, stormed the house of the large-scale farmer and shot him and others.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits invaded a herders' settlement and killed a man identified as Auwal Koshe. They also rustled about 250 goats and sheep from the settlement.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Some bandits invaded a community and killed one person. It was reported that a man identified as Joshua Kawu sustained gunshot wounds in the chest and was rushed to the hospital.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one person when they invaded a village. It was reported that the bandit broke into some homes while shooting into the air. The victim was a housewife known as Hadiza Mohammed.

title: Assailants vs APC Chieftain, Akwa Ibom
description: An All Progressive Congress (APC) chieftain, Mr. Otu Inyang was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victim was trailed and shot dead a few minutes into the new year while on his way home after attending the crossover service at Qua Iboe Church, Ikot Udoma village, Eket.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Over 16 bandits loyal to bandit leader known as Gwoka Dankarami were killed during military airstrikes on his camp. The location of the bandits was struck multiple times.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 4 people were killed while 12 other, including 10 women and 2 men, were abducted by bandits who have been terrorizing some villagers. It was reported that one person was injured and was rushed to the hospital. The victims were identified as Lado Shuaibu, Usman Haruna, Ayuba Muntaru and Jafar Abdullahi.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Police vs Kidnapper, Kaduna
description: A kidnapper was killed by security operatives and 9 people were rescued from the bandits. The operatives invaded the camp of the bandits and opened for them.

title: Gunmen vs Ex-Customs Officer, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen killed a retired Customs Officer identified as Mr. Nkemakonam Ume-Agudosi in his hometown. It was reported that the victim was settling some family issues when the gunmen stormed the meeting venue and unleashed mayhem on those who gathered for the meeting. Some other people were injured in the attack.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that they also abducted some people in the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen killed a policeman and injured another in attack at on a health centre. It was reported that the attack took place during a free medical outreach organised by Uli Global Ambassadors for Development Initiative (ULIGADI). A version of the story stated that the gunmen kidnapped a policeman.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Independent (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 22 fighters of Boko Haram and ISWAP terrorist group were eliminated by troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF. It was reported that the incident happened during clearance operations.
place: Mallam Fatori towards the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits kidnapped a family of three, killed the father of the family and released the wife and daughter after the family paid an undisclosed amount of ransom.

title: Gunmen vs Woman, Delta
description: A woman identified as Mrs. Oghale Lucky Napoleon (40 years old) was beheaded by unknown gunmen while her husband, Mr. Napoleon, escaped with bullet wounds during the attack.

title: IPOB vs Policemen, Anambra
description: IPOB: Three policemen who were en route to the airport to pick Chief Vincent Obianodo, the founder of The Young Shall Grow Motors were attacked and killed by suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The victims include ASP Francis Idoko, Inspector Rufa'i Adamu, and Inspector Emmanuel Akubo. I believe they were en route to the Anambra International Airport when the incident occurred.

title: Bandits vs Worshippers, Niger
description: 8 worshippers who were kidnapped from a mosque by bandits were killed by their abductors. It was reported that the victim were killed due to the delay in the payment of their ransom.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed by bandits who attacked travellers on a highway. It was reported that the bandits also abducted scores of travellers during the incident which caused panic.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 3 people were lost when some insurgents belonging to the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fired projectiles that hit some communities. Troops of the troops of the Nigerian Army engaged the terrorists in a gun battle.
place: Bulunkutu Kasuwa, Ajiri cross and Ngomari Ayafe close the airport

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated about 6 bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities. The killings happened in several operations.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated about 6 bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities. The killings happened in several operations.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated about 7 bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities. The killings happened in several operations.

title: Bandits Kill Ex-Army Officer, Kaduna
description: Bandits invaded a community, killed a retired army officer and kidnapped an unspecified number of residents.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated about 6 bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities. The killings happened in several operations.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Zamfara State Police Command neutralized several bandits in their hideouts and recovered 8 AK-47, 1 GPMG, Rocket Launcher. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated about 6 bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities. The killings happened in several operations.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: About 38 people were killed by rampaging bandits who attacked three villages. It was reported that the bandits also razed houses, destroyed properties and farm produce.

description: 7 people were killed by bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the attack happened in the night. The bandits also abducted some people during the attack.

description: The killing of one Umaru Idrisu as captured in IBD022789 led to a reprisal attack by some Fulani herdsmen who unleashed mayhem on several communities. Several people were killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who attacked a village. The terrorists have been terrorising residents of the village.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen attacked a police checkpoint, killed two policemen, and burnt their patrol vehicle. It was reported that about 10 policemen were at the checkpoint when the incident happened.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Tiv Community, Nasarawa
description: The killing of one Umaru Idrisu as captured in IBD022789 led to a reprisal attack by some Fulani herdsmen who unleashed mayhem on several communities. Several people were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 8 people when they attacked some villages. It was reported that the bandits attacked a man in his car, killed him and set him ablaze. They killed 7 others in various villages. 7 other people were also injured in the attack which spanned four days.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some unknown gunmen shot dead a young man in the early hours of the day. The incident happened when some masked armed men were going from house to house picking up any young man in sight.

title: Bandits Kill, Kaduna
description: Alhaji Habibu was shot to death by bandits in Saye village. More details of the incident were not reported.

title: Military vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Several bandits were killed during a gun duel with the military. The village was under the control of bandits before the confrontation.

title: Bandits Kill, Kaduna
description: Umma Ibro Kontagora, Abdullahi Noma Kontagora and a male adult were killed when bandits barricaded the Buruku-Udawa. Also, Danjuma Maiungwa was killed in Yola-Kadi general area.

title: Land Dispute, Ondo
description: Chief Ilori Tunde, one of the high chiefs in Owo kingdom, was brutally murdered by masked gunmen. It was reported that the victim was murdered over a land dispute. He was killed while he was returning from a fact-finding mission on the disputed parcel of land.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one Alhaji Habibu when they invaded a community in the night. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped three of the man's children in the attack.

title: Military vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Many bandits from the camp of the warlord, Halilu Sububu, were killed in an airstrike by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF).

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Samson Maza and David Garba were killed by bandits in Sako village. Also, the corpses of Nehemiah Abba and Samuel Gwazah were discovered by a patrol team in the Kurfi-Magamiya general area
place: Sako village and Kurfi-Magamiya general area

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Operatives of the Kaduna Police Command killed 2 bandits and recovered motorcycles used by the bandits to terrorise people. The incident happened when the operatives engaged the bandits in a gun battle where two of them were killed while others ran away with bullet wounds.

title: Bandits Kill Lawmaker, Kaduna
description: A member of the Kaduna State Assembly, Honourable Rilwanu Gadagau, was killed by suspected bandits. Many commuters were also abducted by the attackers.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Alhaji Sani Dogara was killed on a highway by some bandits who waylaid travellers. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted scores of travellers. The attack happened in the night.

description: Hajia Shafaatu, one of the survivors of the bandits' attack as captured in IBD022704, died in the hospital. It was reported that the woman lost 4 children during the attack.

description: IPOB/ESN: A truck driver was killed by some gunmen including Chinwedu Nwangwu, known as Onyearmyg, and his gang.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Adamawa
description: Some Fulani herdsmen hacked 2 farmers to death when they were resisted by the farmers who asked them not to enter into the farm of indigenes. The village mobilised, chased and killed one of the fleeing herdsmen.

title: Bandits vs Worshippers, Niger
description: 9 worshippers observing their morning prayers at a mosque were shot dead by rampaging bandits who invaded a community on motorcycles, shooting sporadically.

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: A housewife was shot dead by bandits who stormed a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped 8 people during the raid on the community.

place: along Deeper Life road, Bojiboji Owa Town

title: Bandits vs Travelers, Sokoto
description: Some seasonal migrants were burnt to death by bandits who waylaid them on the road. The victims were killed by a terror kingpin identified as Turji who has been making life difficult for residents and travelers.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A set of twins, popularly known as Tawaye, and some bandits were decimated in NAF airstrikes. It was reported that the airstrike was targeted at the camp of the bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 bandits were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Zamfara
description: 6 people were killed by bandits who also kidnapped several other people. The armed men burnt some of the intercepted vehicles with people onboard.

title: Gunmen vs Motorcyclist, Delta
description: A commercial motorcyclist popularly called Okada was killed by unknown gunmen who also snatched his motorcycle. It was reported that the dead body of the victim was found in a pool of blood.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 12 bandits were decimated by the Nigerian Air Force airstrikes. It was reported that the gunmen were on a convoy of motorcycles when the NAF airstrike hit them.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Katsina
description: 4 people were killed while some people sustained injuries in an attack on 3 villages by bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded the villages at night and destroyed several houses.

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Captain in the Nigerian Army and 5 other soldiers lost their lives when fighters of the Islamic State's West African Province tried to overrun a military base. It was reported that troops also killed 16 ISWAP fighters.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed about 63 others were abducted some terrorists attacked some communities. The bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities.

description: 1 person was killed about 63 others were abducted some terrorists attacked some communities. The bandits have been terrorising residents of several communities.

title: Bandits vs Fulani Herders, Kaduna

title: Police vs Bandits in Hotel, Kaduna

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army who were on patrol made contact with bandits and killed 2 of them. The bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army who were on patrol made contact with bandits and killed 3 of them during a gun battle that last for some time. The bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Joint Task Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF), a vigilante group supporting the military operations in the northeast, arrested one terrorist and killed three others who were looting farm produce along a major road.

title: Rape and Kill by Fulani Herdsmen, Abia

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed two policemen and burnt their bodies. It was reported that the dead policemen were travelling with their colleagues when they were attacked by the gunmen. The Head of Eastern Security Network in Imo and Anambra States identified as Chinonso Okafor aka Gentle spare headed the killing of the victims. One of the killed police officers was identified as Inspector Rufai Adamu.

title: Vigilante vs ISWAP, Niger
description: A vigilance group raided the camp of terrorists belonging to the Islamic State's West African Province (ISWAP) and killed 13 of them. The incident happened the vigilance group acted on a tip-off.

title: Security Agents vs Bandit Leader, Kaduna
description: A bandit ring leader identified as Yellow Baba Arusa was killed in an encounter with police operatives. His killing was a reaction to the attack by bandits on the popular Kaduna-Abuja road as captured in IBD022605.

title: Military vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Gun battle between soldiers and bandits led to the death of many bandits (assuming at least 20) while several weapons and motorcycles were recovered from them.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman was killed by some gunmen when they attacked and burnt a divisional police headquarters. It was reported that the Divisional Police Officer suffered head injuries in the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna

description: Rev Dauda Bature, a pastor of the Evangelical Church of Winning All (ECWA), was killed by bandits who kidnapped him on his farm. It was reported that the bandits killed the victim after collecting ransom from his wife.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: 2 people were killed while 66 others were abducted by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits raided some communities. Those killed were youths providing voluntary security services in a community.

description: Bandits killed 3 people during a rampage in the early hours of the day. The bandits attacked several communities, killing the victims, abducting several people and setting houses ablaze.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Zamfara
description: An unspecified number of gunmen killed 6 people and injured many others when they unleashed terror on a village. Some women and children were kidnapped in the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Couple, Delta
description: A couple were murdered by some unknown gunmen. The couple, parents of a set of twins, were identified as Chidi and Rita Edebor, a hairdresser. They were shot dead in the night.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some residents were killed when some gunmen attacked 2 communities. It was reported that the bandits also destroyed several houses and set properties ablaze. Some people were also injured in the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The Nigerian Air Force’s fighter jets killed an unspecified number of bandits during an aerial assault on identified bandit enclaves. The locations were identified as bandit hideouts after thorough checks and analysis of various intelligence reports. It is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 riot policemen and a soldier were killed in the gunfight with ISWAP terrorists. The terrorists attacked the town with trucks mounted with anti-aircraft guns and motorcycles while the troops were conducting clearance operations in the town.

title: Boko Haram/ISWAP Attack, Borno
description: Fighters of the Islamic State of the West African Province (ISWAP) killed two policemen and a soldier. The deceased were members of a joint security team conducting clearance operations in preparation for the return and resettlement of IDPs.

description: 1 person was killed by marauding bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents. The victims were identified as Hakilu Umar and Muntari Umar.

description: 1 person was killed by marauding bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents. The victim was identified as Bello Alhaji

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 policemen attached to the mobile unit were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town. It was reported that the insurgents drove into the town in 8 gun trucks and operated for over one hour.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 policemen were shot dead by unknown gunmen who stormed the political rally of the All Progressive Grand Alliance (APGA). The party was holding a governorship rally when the incident happened.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna

title: Troops vs Boko Haram, Borno

description: IPOB/ESN: A female police officer was shot dead by some unidentified gunmen. The incident happened when the gunmen attacked a police station.

title: ISWAP Leader, Borno

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force alongside Cameroonian Defence Force killed 7 Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate a military base.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force in the North-East, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK), killed 20 Boko Haram/Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened when the troops ambushed the terrorists.
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, Nigerian Tribune

title: Bandits Clash, Zamfara
description: A notorious bandit, Damina, was shot dead and his body dismembered by a rival group led by Dogo Gide. It was reported that the deceased was living in a forest and had burnt a woman alive during a raid on a community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 50 bandits were killed by security forces during an onslaught against the bandits by the troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the Nigerian Air Force helicopter gunship provided close air support to ground troops.
sources_of_information: The Nation (50 ) , This Day (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (50 )

title: Bandits vs Traders, Sokoto
description: About 40 traders were killed by bandits who attacked a market. It was reported that the gunmen attacked the market where foodstuffs are sold, killing the victims and injuring many others.
sources_of_information: The Punch (120 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (43 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army eliminated over 20 Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters. It was reported that there was also an air raid during the operation.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Security operatives killed 10 bandits terrorizing a community. The incident happened when scores of bandits engaged the operatives in a gun duel. Many of the bandits were injured and they abandoned their motorcycles as they escaped into the forest. A kidnapped victim identified as Alhaji Abubakar Usman was rescued during the operative.
place: Kwanan Bataru on the outskirts of Fatika
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: Bandits Kill 12, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 12 people and burnt down several houses and shops when they invaded a village. It was reported that the attack caused panic among residents who fled for their lives.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of armed bandits were neutralised by a combined team of local vigilantes and hunters ambushed them. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a community.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Zamfara
description: 5 soldiers were killed by bandits during an ambush on them. It was reported that the bandits made away with the rifles of the soldiers after the attack.

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: 4 soldiers were killed while foiling a terrorist attack launched by the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP). The army repelled the attack on the military base by the terrorists.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A security guard of the University of Nigeria Teaching Hospital, Enugu, identified as Stephen Ajah was shot dead by gunmen who were trying to enforce the sit-at-home order of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The victim was returning from night duty when the incident happened.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: 32 armed bandits fleeing Zamfara State were killed by security forces. It was reported that the bandits attacked a security post and shot dead 5 policemen who attempted to confront them.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: In a reprisal attack for the incident captured on IBD022325, some bandits raided a market and killed 20 people. It was reported that several other people were left with life-threatening injuries.
sources_of_information: The Punch (20 ) , The Nation (19 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 )

title: Bandits vs Pharmacist, Kaduna
description: A pregnant pharmacist was shot dead by some bandits. The gang of bandits were led by one Umar Adamu alias Meagwu. It was reported that the lady was killed because she was walking sluggishly when she was abducted.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ebonyi
description: 2 policemen were shot dead by unknown gunmen. The incident happened when some gunmen invaded a community and shot sporadically at people.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Independent (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Vanguard (2 )

title: Army vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralized 3 gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen were part of the group terrorizing residents and security operatives. A soldier was killed during the operation.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Bandits vs Speaker's Father, Zamfara
description: The father of the Zamfara State House of Assembly, Muazu Magarya, lost his life in the hands of bandits who abducted him. It was reported that the bandits kidnapped Alhaji Muazu Abubakar and killed him in their den.

title: Extra Judicial Killing, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 young men identified as Chigozie Nwaiwu and Christian Chukwu were killed in extrajudicial ways by the operatives of the Imo State Police. The police killed the victims and tagged them members of the Indigenous People of Biafra.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 10 worshippers were killed while 11 others were injured when bandits attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits also set some houses ablaze. They also rustled animals and also stole cash, phones, clothes and foodstuff.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (16 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Niger
description: 5 riot policemen were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the policemen were gunned down when they tried to stop the invaders who burnt healthcare centre and 2 patrol vehicles.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A man who tried to do a video recording of gunmen was shot dead by a gunman. Also, another man was killed at a junction by the gunmen who also set ablaze the house of Joe Igbokwe, an APC chieftain, and the offices of the DSS and that of FRSC. Another version of the story stated that a 300-level Medical Rehabilitation student of Nnamdi Azikiwe University identified as Miss Chioma was also shot dead while she was recording the activities of the gunmen with her phone.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Plateau
description: 3 people were killed while 3 others were injured by gunmen who attacked a village. The deceased were identified as Barry Ive (42 years), Isaiah Gado (45 years) and Weyi Chohu (40 years). A version of the story stated that the killers were Fulani militias.
place: Hukke village, Miango District, Irigwe Chiefdom
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Gunmen attacked a community and killed 2 people. It was reported that the gunmen have been terrorizing the community for some time.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Operatives of the Kaduna State Police Command and Operation Puff Adder II killed a bandit and arrested three kidnappers. It was reported that the incident happened when the police stormed the hideout of the criminal and engaged them in a gun battle.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Zamfara State Police Command neutralised 5 bandits during their raid in some communities. The bandits have been terrorising residents in the communities.
place: Gidan Bita, Malakatar and Kagara forest

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 10 people were killed by marauding bandits who have been terrorizing some villages. They moved from house to house attacking residents and setting houses and barns ablaze.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen suspected to be members of Indigenous People of Biafra invaded a police station, killed 2 policemen and razed the station. A version of the report stated that two of the victims were identified as Okechukwu Nwafor and Obumneme Chigozie Mbonu (38 years).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Bandits vs Ansaru Group, Kaduna
description: A clash between terrorists belonging to the Ansaru group and bandits led to the loss of 30 bandits. It was reported that the clash was a battle for supremacy between the two groups.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: One of the drivers on the convoy of Honorable Chris Azubuogu, the member representing Nnewi North/South and Ekwusigo Federal Constituency, was shot dead by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra.
place: Nnew-Nnobi Road, in front of St. Paul Anglican Church, Nnobi
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 30, Niger
description: 30 people were killed by bandits who attacked some villages. Three policemen were among the victims.
place: villages around Kachiwe and Sarkin Pawa
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Independent (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (43 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , Daily Trust (50 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 people were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The victims were killed at a political gathering in a community.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were killed by suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The group has been threatening that the governorship election will not hold in the state.

title: JTF vs Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: The Joint Security Task Force ambushed and killed no fewer than 20 cattle rustlers and also recovered two machine guns and a number of AK47 rifles from the rustlers including over 300 cattle rustled from the community.

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 person was killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. Another version of the report stated that 3 people were killed in a market close to a church. One of the victims was a car owner who was shot in his Lexus 350.
place: Nwagu Market , close to Madonna Catholic Church, Agulu
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen Kill 5, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen who were suspected to be members of Indigenous People of Biafra killed Dr. Chike Akunyili and 4 others. They shot the medical doctor in the head and eyes, and brutally butchered his police orderlies without provocation.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 9 people, including one Mr. Yakubu Dajuma, were killed by bandits. They were killed as a reprisal attack for the incident captured as IBD022236.
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 )

title: Air Force Strikes, Borno
description: About 20 civilians were killed during an airstrike by the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the strike was targeted at Boko Haram terrorists but the Air Force mistakenly killed the civilians.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an attack at the headquarters of a local government. It was reported that the troops of the Nigerian Army and other security agents killed the insurgents.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed one Nasiru Abdullahi during an attack on a community. The incident happened when the bandits who have been terrorizing some communities invaded the victim's community.
place: Gobirawan Kamacha in the Bina general area
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 34, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 34 people when they attacked 2 communities. It was reported that 8 people sustained injuries while 20 houses were burnt by the bandits in the attack.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (34 ) , The Punch (40 ) , The Nation (34 ) , Other newspaper 3 (34 ) , Other newpapers 1 (38 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community in large numbers at night, killed the victims, and abducted an Islamic teacher.

title: ISWAP/Boko Haram vs Army, Sokoto
description: ISWAP/Boko Haram terrorists attacked a joint military base, killing 15 persons. It was reported that the insurgents came in their large number, surrounded the camp and fired from different directions. The victims were members of a joint patrol team. Another version of the story stated that many of the terrorists were killed in the attack. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 40 terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (55 ) , The Nation (20 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: The Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists killed 7 soldiers in an ambush and injured 15 others. The incident happened when the victims were on patrol along a road. A version of the story stated that 4 vigilantes were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A member of a vigilance group identified as one Japenti was killed in the forest by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits buried the victim in a shallow grave.

title: IPOB Crisis, Imo
description: Obinwanne Iwu, a 34-year-old man, was lynched to death by mob for forcing people to obey the sit-at-home order issued by IPOB. People were angry that he and his gang were forcing to obey the order despite that it was called off by the leadership of IPOB.

title: Ebubeagu Kills Pastor, Ebonyi
description: The founder and Pastor of Glorious Gospel Fire Assembly, John Onu, lost his life after he was hit by a stray bullet fired by personnel of Ebubeagu Security Outfit. The operatives came to arrest some youths who attempted to raze the house of one Okechukwu Onyibe whom they accused of killing one Oluchi Nwibo. It was reported that the two other people where killed in the crisis that ensued.

title: Bandits Kill Student, Imo
description: A Senior Secondary School student of Marist Comprehensive Academy, Uturu, was killed during a robbery incident by some bandits. The students were returning when the bandits, in a bid to stop their car, shot and killed one Ede Donald.

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Kogi
description: Operatives of the Kogi State Vigilante Group killed 11 bandits and arrested others including a Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) personnel identified as Inspector Abdullahi Saidu. The NSCDC official, alongside a friend, supplied the criminals with weapons and information. 3 kidnapped victims were rescued.
sources_of_information: The Nation (11 ) , Other newpapers 1 (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. It was reported that the rampaging herders also abducted Mr. Iorver Igbo, father-in-law to one Mr James Igbudu.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 3 people lost their lives while scores were injured during an annual Iyeri feast dance. It was reported violence erupted at the festival resulting in the loss of lives and destruction of property worth millions of Naira. The crisis was an aftermath of the conflict before Ekiugbo and Oto-Iwhreko.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 8 people including 6 bandits were killed by local vigilante in the attack. It was reported that the bandits killed 2 people and injured 3 other people. A version of the report stated that 13 bandits who were apprehended by vigilante and put in police custody were killed by angry mob after the station was overrun.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (21 ) , Daily Trust (19 ) , This Day (24 )

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kebbi
description: 5 people were butchered by bandits who attacked a village in the early hours of the day, and rustled cattle.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 12 soldiers of the Nigerian Army attached to Operation Hadin Kai Theatre Command in Maiduguri were killed in an ambush by Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists when they drove into mines as they travelled to Maiduguri from Monguno. The insurgents also made away with 3-gun trucks and rifles seized from the soldiers, as well as cash.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 2 people when they attacked a community. The bandits have been terrorising residents of the community.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits attacked a community, killed Yohana Irrimiya, a Boys Brigade officer and took away 5 other people.
place: Rigo Gbagyi in Mararaban Rico Community

title: Police vs IPOB, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN- Men of the Ebonyi State Police Command killed 2 members of the Eastern Security Network, a militia wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The incident happened when the police trailed the victims to their hideouts.

title: Army vs Bandits, Adamawa
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed some bandits in a community and recovered 11 rocket launchers from them. It was reported that the security operatives also recovered 3 grenades.

title: Air Force Strikes, Yobe
description: 10 villagers were killed in an airstrike carried out by Nigerien Air Force who were in pursuit of Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the several other villagers were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Punch (9 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A soldier was killed while 4 other people were abducted by bandits who attacked a community. Those kidnapped in the attack included a woman, her daughter and two sons.
place: Milgoma community near Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital in Zaria
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Kogi
description: After the killing of Alhassan Alhassan, a vigilante commander, other vigilantes reinforced back to the forest where they killed 11 bandits and rescued two abductees.
place: Ottoyi, a border community between Niger and Kogi states.

title: Bandits vs Zamfara Emir, Kaduna
description: A policeman was shot dead when some bandits attacked the convoy of Emir of Bungudu, Alhaji Hassan Attahiru. The victim was attached to the traditional ruler, who was kidnapped by the bandits.
place: Dutse village near Olams farms along the Kaduna-Abuja highway
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: IPOB vs Priest, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A priest of the Anglican Church identified as Rev. Emeka Merenu was shot dead by men of the Eastern Security Network. It was reported that the victim was killed in the church parsonage for inviting soldiers to guide over a school he was managing. The killing was a reprisal for the killing 3 IPOB members in the community earlier by the soldiers who maintained security at the priest's school.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Prison Break, Kogi
description: 2 soldiers were killed while some prison officials were injured when about 240 inmates escaped from a prison. It was reported remanded terrorists, bandits, armed robbers and other criminals were among those that escaped during the jailbreak. Another version of the report stated that 2 soldiers and a policeman were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (3 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 12, Zamfara
description: 12 security personnel comprising of 9 naval ratings, 2 policemen, and soldiers were killed during a raid on a military base by suspected bandits. It was reported that the bandits also stole weapons and set houses ablaze.

title: IPOB Sector Commander, Imo
description: ESN/IPOB: Chidera Nnabuhe, a.k.a Dragon, a suspected Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB)/Eastern Security Network (ESN) sector Commander was shot dead during a gun duel with police command. Chidera was killed with 2 other members of the group identified as JJ and Dadawa, both natives of Ohazora in Ebonyi State when the Command’s Tactical team stormed their hideout in an uncompleted building in a valley at Essential Home popularly known as” NGBUKA”

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of fleeing bandits were killed by troops of the Nigeria Army. The incident happened when the bandits fled from their hideout in Zamfara State as a result of attacks by the army but ran into a patrol team in Niger State where they were killed.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 6 people were killed by bandits during an attack on a community. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Many people were killed when some Boko Haram terrorists, in 5 gun trucks, attacked a military base. It was reported that the clash led to the loss of lives on the part of both the soldiers and terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.

title: Residents vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A bandit identified as Baleri, who disguised to purchase some drugs in a town, was killed by residents of the town. It was reported that the victim was intercepted and manhandled by the residents.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 2 vigilantes were shot dead during a gun battle with bandits. The victims were ambushed while on parade in the village.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilantes
description: A shootout between the gunmen and vigilante personnel led to the death of 2 bandits, while several others sustaining injuries. The bandits stormed the community with aim of abducting the father to the Deputy Speaker, State House of Assembly, Shehu Dalhatu Tafoki but eventually abducted 2 of the sisters.

title: Kidnappers vs Pharmacy Student, Edo
description: Fulani herdsmen, who doubled as kidnappers, abducted and murdered a Pharmacy student of Igbinedion University identified as Mr. Olajide Sowore. The victim was the younger brother of Omoyele Sowore, the publisher of Sahara Reporters.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Independent (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 19 people were killed while several others were missing in an attack by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a village in a reprisal attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (19 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , This Day (15 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: Men of the Niger State police command killed 3 bandits and their informant. It was reported that the head of the bandits identified as Buba Baromi was among the victims.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 195 Battalion, Sector 1 OPHK with Civilian Joint Task Force eliminated 2 ISWAP terrorists in an ambush operation along the terrorists’ crossing point.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kogi
description: 9 persons were killed and scores injured by unknown gunmen who went on a shooting spree. Many people who were running to escape were hit by stray bullets.
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , Vanguard (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Nigerian Army neutralized 6 suspected Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) members while on patrol along Damboa-Bulabulin-Maiduguri Road.

title: Bandits vs Director, Zamfara
description: Some bandits killed Mr. Umar Bawa, the Director of Works of the Kaura Namoda Local Government Area. The victim was killed when the gunmen opened fire on his vehicle on a highway.
place: along Kaura Namoda and Moriki roads

title: Police vs Bandit's Leader, Niger
description: Operatives of the anti-kidnapping team of the Police force, with the support of local vigilantes, eliminated a notorious bandit's leader, Jauro Daji. The police also killed several other bandits loyal to the victim. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 other bandits were killed.

title: Assailants vs Pilot, Kaduna
description: Some unidentified assailants gruesomely murdered Captain Abdulkarim Na'Allah, the eldest son of Senator Bala Na'Allah. A version of the report stated that the pilot was killed by bandits in his residence. The killers were identified as Bashir Muhammad (23 years), Nasiru Salisu (27 years) and Usman DanKano.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen attacked a community and killed three people while 2 others were declared missing. It was reported that the gunmen shot 2 women and a man, while the third victim was rushed to the hospital for treatment.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Bandits vs Man, Bauchi
description: A man identified as Jibrin Aliyu was shot dead in his house by some bandits. The killers were identified as Idi Abdullahi, Rabiu Sulaiman, Aliyu Malam alia Majo and Hassan Bako.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Some bandits were shot dead by security operatives in a maize farm. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 bandits were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by bandits when they attacked a village. The duo were identified as Gideon Mumini and Barnabas Ezra.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: About 11 villagers were killed and 6 others were injured by bandits in an onslaught on a community. It was reported that the attack happened in the night.
sources_of_information: This Day (11 ) , Other newpapers 1 (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 35, Plateau
description: Fulani bandits attacked a community behind a university and killed over 35 people. It was reported that the invaders also burnt several houses in the attack which they carried out in the night.
place: Yelwa Zangam community behind the University of Jos
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (36 ) , The Nation (35 ) , Nigerian Tribune (36 ) , The Guardian (36 ) , Independent (63 )

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 27 people were killed in a deadly clash between Islamic State's West African Province (ISWAP) and Boko Haram over attempt to surrender. The attack was coordinated by Abba-Kaka, a self-acclaimed ISWAP government of Tumbumma commanding Marte, Abadam, Kukawa and Magumeri.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (27 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (0 )

title: Police vs ESN/IPOB, Imo
description: ESN/IPOB: Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed in a bloody clash with the police. The incident happened during a raid on their camp. It is assumed that 5 people were killed.

title: Herdsmen Kill 8, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen clad in Nigerian Army uniforms attacked and hacked 8 people, including 4 children and their mum, to death. It was reported that the killers invaded the community in the night. They also kidnapped a man whom they took to an unknown destination.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: Bandits vs NDA, Kaduna
description: 2 officers of the Nigeria Defence Academy (NDA), Lieutenant -Commodore Wulah and Flight-Lieutenant C.M. Okoronkwo, were shot dead by bandits who attacked the academy. Another officer, Major Christopher Datong, was kidnapped by the bandits but found dead the next day.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , PM News (3 )

title: Bandits Kill 4, Zamfara
description: Gunmen killed 4 people and abducted 50 others when they attacked a town. It was reported that the bandits came in large numbers and invaded the town at the midnight.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Many people were killed while one person was injured during an attack by unidentified gunmen. Three of the victims were identified as herders.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , The Nation (12 ) , Daily Trust (14 ) , Independent (14 ) , Other newspaper 3 (16 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: Gunmen killed 12 people during a night attack on a community. It was reported that over 250 bandits invaded the settlement with assorted weapons, attacked residents and raped some women.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , This Day (18 )

title: Bandits Clash, Kaduna
description: 9 bandits lost their lives when two groups of armed bandits clashed over ransom sharing formula.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 )

title: Bandits vs Military, Katsina
description: Bandits killed two Niger Republic military personnel in an ambush. It occurred when the bandits were crossing over from Jibia to Niger Republic to rustle cattle.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (7 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 6 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked some communities. It was reported that the herdsmen stormed the communities in the night and carried out the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
