description: 3 people were killed when bandits attacked 2 communities, and abducted 17 people including 8 ismiyya student pupils and teachers.

title: Bandits attack, Katsina
description: Bandits attacked a community and killed 4 people while 5 others were injured.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed when gunmen attacked some communities. It was reported that the attack which happened in the evening led to the death of the boy, while 1 person was injured and a house and four vehicles were burnt.
place: Atuka village near Jankasa in Unguwan Gaya district in Atyap chiefdom

title: Oil Workers, Imo
description: 4 workers of Lee Engineering Company, a contractor with Shell Petroleum Development Company of Nigeria in the community and a police officer attached to the oil company were killed in an ambush by gunmen. Few others sustained gunshot injuries. No group claimed responsibility for the attack despite that the police accused the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) of the attack. IPOB denied any involvement.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: IPOB vs Soldiers, Abia
description: A young man died when he was shot in the chest by persons whom some eyewitnesses alleged were men of the Nigerian Army.
place: Popular Gas-Line off Aba-Port Harcourt Highway

title: Bandits Kill 11, Zamfara
description: Bandits attacked a village and killed 11 people. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted over 40 people in the attack which happened in the night. They shot sporadically, forcing residents to scamper for safety.

title: School Kidnap, Zamfara
description: 4 people including a police inspector and 2 other security personnel were killed when armed bandits abducted many students and teachers in Zamfara College of Agriculture and Animal Science Bakura. 2 members of staff and a student escaped from their abductors’ den and returned to the college. Another version of the story stated that a student and lecturer were later killed.
place: College of Agriculture and Animal Science, Bakura
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Nine people were killed while 6 others were abducted. 8 of those killed were men while one woman was shot dead.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen and 3 gunmen died in a shootout during an attempt to attack a police station. The attacks are believed to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and the Eastern Security Network (ESN).

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 8 farmers were killed while scores were injured during an attack by bandits. The community has been under constant attacks by bandits.

title: Bandits vs NDA, Kaduna
description: 10 terrorists including the second-in-command, Musti and Yellow Mai-Madrid, and Dan-Katsisnawa were killed and others injured by the Army Troops in an attack. It was reported that the terrorists were among the ones who attacked and abducted some officers from Nigerian Defence Academy (NDA).

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 3 people, Amos Bulus, Bulus Swam and Simon Akut were killed by bandits while Kezia was injured and taken to a hospital for treatment.
place: Goran Gida, Gora district of Zangon-Kafat
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: ISWAP Leader, Borno
description: Abu Musab Al-Barnawi, the leader of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) was killed together with other commanders of the group. It was reported that the victims were killed during a battle of supremacy between some members of ISWAP. Another version of the story stated that the commanders were killed during a battle with troops of the Nigerian Army. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 commanders were decimated.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 5 people and burnt nine houses in an attack on a village. It was reported that the bandits also burnt three vehicles while one vehicle was vandalized.

title: Grenade Explosion, Borno
description: 5 children were killed when a disused grenade they were playing with exploded. They had picked up the grenade while herding in a field outside a town. The grenade may have been dropped by Boko Haram terrorists or used by the army in the fight against the terrorists.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , This Day (5 )

title: Task Force vs Bandits, Niger
description: 15 bandits were killed by the Joint Security Task Force. The incident occurred 2 weeks after 10 bandits were killed in the same LGA.

title: Youths vs Travellers, Plateau
description: 22 Fulani travelers on their way from Bauchi to Ondo State were killed by suspected Miango youths who had gone to retrieve about 40 indigenes who were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Not less than 40 others were declared missing while their buses were burnt.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (22 ) , Vanguard (15 ) , The Punch (22 ) , Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , The Nation (22 ) , Daily Trust (25 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: The village head of Dugul, Mallam Rabiu, and 4 others were killed while many houses were burnt and hundreds of animals belonging to the villagers were stolen by bandits.

title: Militia Kill 4, Benue
description: 4 people, including a one-year-old baby, two children and their mother, were killed by armed militia from Ngbo community in Ebonyi State. The attackers stormed the community in a commando fashion and razed the home of the victims. Another version of the story stated that the victims were killed by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Herdsmen vs Women, Plateau
description: 3 Plateau women were shot dead in their farms by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders have been terrorizing villagers.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN:4 policemen lost their lives when gunmen attacked a police command. It was reported that the attack was a reprisal for the killing of 2 members of ESN as captured in IBD021847.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 45 bandits were eliminated in a coordinated strike by air platforms and assault by ground forces under the Operation Hadarin Dajo (OPHD) of the Defence Headquarters. The bandits were killed while having a meeting.

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Two members of the Indigenous People of Biafra were gunned down by security operatives when they tried to enforce a sit-at-home order by the group. Another version of the story stated that the victims were gunned down by members of the Eastern Security Network in the early hours of the day.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Army vs IPOB, Anambra
description: 2 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by operatives of the Nigerian Army. The victims were killed during a sit-at-home order by the military patrol team which approached a roadblock mounted by IPOB members.

title: IPOB Kill 4, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 passengers were burnt inside two commercial buses that were plying the road during the IPOB's sit-at-home order. The victims were burnt together with the buses.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Gunmen vs Naval Officer, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen attacked a team of navy personnel on duty at a junction along a highway and killed one of them. The gunmen engaged the personnel in a shootout, causing the death of the victim. It was reported that 6 members of IPOB were killed in the attack.
place: Awkuzu junction along the Awka-Onitsha Expressway
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (8 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: IPOB/ESN Killing, Ebonyi
description: 3 people lost their lives during the sit-at-home order by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The victims were killed as a result of the order by the group.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 notorious bandits were decimated through air interdictions when the military engaged in a combined ground and air assaults on identified enclaves of the bandits. The victims were identified as Alili Bandiro, Dyyabu Bala, Bala Nagwarjo, and Sulele Bala.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Vanguard (4 )

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Ebonyi
description: About 2 people were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked a village. Many people were affected by the invasion as some people were missing while farmlands were destroyed.
place: Okpochiri village in Ukwagba Ngbo community

title: IPOB Kill 1, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A man was shot dead close to a market by members of the Eastern Security Network. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day during the sit-at-home ordered by the Indigenous People of Biafra.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Ekiti
description: Fulani herdsmen killed a man and abducted his wife and daughter while they were traveling in a Lexus 330 SUV. It was reported that the kidnappers demanded N50 million ransom to free the victims. The victims were going for the burial of a family friend's mother when the incident happened.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: About 78 bandits were decimated by the jets of the Nigerian Air Force during aerial bombardments of the bandit's camp. The incident happened during a 3-day aggressive bombardment.
place: South of Dansadau town and North of Kuyaanbana Forest Reserves

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 19 Boko Haram fighters were decimated by Nigerian Air Force during an aerial bombardment of the terrorist hideout. It was reported that the Nigerian Air Force Alpha jets conducted airstrikes that killed the terrorists.

title: Hunters vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 20 bandits were killed by local hunters. It was reported that the hunters also recovered several livestock rustled by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 18 people, including a police officer, were killed by bandits during attacks on five communities. It was reported that the bandits attacked the communities in the early hours of the day. Some of the victims were identified as Joseph Maza, Timvan Cibi Ciwo, Monday Titus, Asabe Magani, Laraba Danladi, and Yosi Danladi.
place: Kigom, Kikoba, Kishisho and Ungwan Magaji communities
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 ) , The Nation (25 ) , Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , Vanguard (25 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: Gunmen identified as Fulani herdsmen killed a pregnant woman and 7 other people when they attacked a community. It was reported that the herders also injured several other people and destroyed farms.

title: Motorcyclists Clash, Ogun
description: 7 people lost their lives in a clash between Hausa and Yoruba commercial motorcyclists (Okada riders). The incident happened some commercial motorcyclists refused to pay when the ticket fee was hiked from N600 to N800, causing a clash that snowballed into an ethnic crisis.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , The Nation (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Security operatives ambushed and killed 6 members of the Indigenous People Of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Network (ESN). 3 others were arrested. They were allegedly responsible for the murder of a Divisional Police Officer (DPO).

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram and Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists were eliminated during a gun battle between them and operatives of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and ground troops.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Gunmen attacked a community and killed Timothy Yakubu, Audu Dara, and Irimia David. Not less than 10 houses were burnt down by the attackers. A version of the story stated that the incident happened when Irigwe youths in Miango community clashed with Fulani militias.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Punch (13 ) , The Nation (17 ) , This Day (13 ) , Other newspaper 3 (70 ) , Vanguard (70 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen were killed during an attack on a police station by unknown gunmen. The Police Command denied the deaths but affirmed the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Gunmen Behead Man, Imo
description: A man was killed and beheaded by unknown gunmen, bringing the number of beheaded persons in the community to 3 (see the incident in IBD021756). The recent beheadings are linked to criminal gangs that had killed several people including security operatives in the state.

title: Rival Bandits Clash, Katsina
description: A leader of a bandit group, Dogo Nabajallah, and 3 others were killed during a clash between 2 rival gangs of bandits over the marriage of a woman. The fight broke out in the gang's hideout in the forest.

title: Natives vs Fulani Herders, Taraba
description: 6 Fulani herdsmen comprising of 4 boys and 2 women were butchered by some natives. It was reported that the killers launched attack on a Fulani settlement and killed the victims when they found the body of a man from the village that went missing.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Several people were killed while dozens were injured by bandits who attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits invaded the communities on motorbikes. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed by the gunmen.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who blocked two major roads. It was reported that the bandits abducted several other people during the attack. A report stated that 60 road users were abducted.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Some bandits invaded a community, killing one person and injuring three others. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the community in the night and raided houses.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 4 people and abducted about 14 people. Some of the kidnapped were identified as a pregnant woman, children and other members of the family of a lecturer at the Zamfara State College of Arts and Science. A version of the report stated that the victims were vigilantes who confronted the bandits.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Zamfara State police command neutralized a notorious bandit and rescued 11 kidnap victims. The incident happened when the bandits attached some commuters.
place: Gusau-Sokoto road at Dogon Karfe axis

title: Gunmen vs Tiv Family, Nasarawa
description: A family of 5 members was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen shot sporadically at the compound of the victims when they attacked the village.
place: compound at Gidan Sule village, along Lafia-Makurdi road
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: 8 people, including 3 policemen, 2 civilians, and 3 unknown gunmen, were killed during a clash between the police and the gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen attacked police operatives at 2 checkpoints. One of the policemen was identified as Mr. Okuma. One other victim was identified as Pastor Benjamin Ani.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Independent (9 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , This Day (8 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some travelers on the road and killed an infant, a couple and another person. It was reported that the infant was shot in the chest. The passengers were returning from a burial when the incident happened.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 members of the Boko Haram/ISWAP sect were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during an ambush. Some of the insurgents were also arrested.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 13 special mobile police officers and 2 residents. The police personnel were ambushed while they were on patrol. Six of them were seriously injured.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed about 8 people including 2 aid workers. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders invaded some communities in a local government area. One of the victims was a 200 level student of the Department of Public Administration, Benue State University, Makurdi, Mr. Japhet Toryila.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: The protracted communal crisis between Bonta militias and Igede people of Ukpute areas escalated with several people feared killed and houses burnt. Due to the nature of the story, It is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Policemen attached to Operation Puff Adder killed 10 bandits, among them a woman. The gunmen killed an Inspector and a Sergeant during the attack on a police camp.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , The Punch (12 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits killed one person and abducted 7 other people. It was reported that the bandits also rustled over 50 cattle from the village. 3 women and four men were kidnapped.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 14 bandits were killed in different operations by soldiers. About 16 information to the bandits were arrested while 223 livestock were rescued in other operations within the past 2 weeks.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: Fulani herdsmen, dressed in military camouflage, attacked a community and killed 5 people. It was reported that the rampaging herders who came in a bus killed the victims, including a Commander of Amotekun identified as Muri.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 Boko Haram and the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by soldiers during clearance operations. 29 insurgents were arrested and 40 civilians were rescued during the operations which were conducted within the last 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers and many Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an early morning attack by Boko Haram terrorists. The soldiers died while repelling the attackers who later went away with Armoured Personnel Carrier, APC, and two operational vehicles belonging to the military and CJTF. It is assumed that 20 of the terrorists were killed.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Sokoto
description: 2 soldiers were killed and 7 others injured in a raid by bandits. The attackers also burnt down two patrol vehicles belonging to the police and army.

title: Task Force vs Drivers, Anambra
description: 1 person was killed in a clash between a Revenue Task Force and trailer drivers at a building materials market. The crisis ensued when the agents demanded money from a trailer driver.
place: Ogidi town on the Onitsha-Enugu Expressway

title: Police vs Bandits, Jigawa
description: A bandit leader, Abdullahi Bummi, was killed and a 65-year-old kidnap victim, Hajiya Hassana Zubairu was rescued by the police.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Armed bandits numbering about 18 invaded a community, killed one person and abducted 5 others. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day. They also rustled 32 cows.

title: Bandits vs Businessman, Bauchi
description: Bandits shot dead a 40-year-old businessman, Mr. Tasiu Tilde, after he resisted the attempt to kidnap him. The victim, popularly called Mai Kemis, was in his pharmacy when gunmen attacked him.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 soldiers of the Nigerian Army were killed and beheaded by gunmen at a checkpoint. It was reported that the victims were gunned down when they attempted to repel gun attack by the Eastern Security Network (ESN).
place: Checkpoint along Iggah-Asaba Road, Adani community
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: NAF airstrikes targeted at bandits claimed the lives of a woman and her four children in a village. It was reported that the village has a forest where the bandits were hiding. About 120 bandits were also killed in the attack.
place: Sububu Forest between Shinkafi and Maradun

title: Herders vs Farmers, Benue
description: Fulani bandits attacked a community when the people were still sleeping, killed 3 farmers, and injured many others.

title: Bandits Kill 9, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 9 people when they invaded a community. It was reported that several people were injured while many fled their homes to other neighbouring communities.
sources_of_information: The Nation (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: About 24 people lost their lives when bandits attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising the communities.

title: Herders Kill Youth Leader, Oyo
description: In an attempt by Fulani herdsmen to kidnap two people, a youth leader, who is popularly known as Olori Odo, was shot dead. The killers were identified as 16-year-old Umaru Mohammed and one 27-year-old Usman Mohammed.
place: Akinkunmi village close to Kara market

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 9 people were killed and many others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. The incident happened in the early hours of the day.

title: Bandits vs Immigration Officers, Katsina
description: 2 personnel of the Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) identified as Umar Bagadaza Kankara and Lauwali Dutse were killed at a checkpoint by bandits.
place: Kabode checkpoint along Jibia road in Katsina

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped several other people in the attack.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 49 people were killed by bandits who invaded five communities in a district. The attackers rode g on about 100 motorcycles.
place: Tsauni, Gudan-Baushi, Gidan-Adamu, Wari and Gudan-Maidawa in Faru district
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (49 ) , The Punch (42 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Niger
description: 2 mobile policemen and their wives were killed by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened in the night when the bandits rode on 17 motorcycles into the village. Another version of the story stated that the member of a vigilance group was killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Many people were killed as gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members attacked the hometown of the Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF). The community’s civilian guards who attempted to repel the insurgents were among those killed during the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , This Day (24 ) , The Nation (19 ) , Daily Trust (18 ) , Vanguard (23 )

title: Bandits vs Army, Kebbi
description: Bandits ambushed federal troops and killed 7 soldiers. It was reported that the victims were identified as 4 naval special forces and 3 operatives from the army.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Kaduna
description: 2 Military personnel, Private Salisu Rabiu and Ordinary Seaman Bilal Mohammed , lost their lives while attempting to prevent the abduction of pupils of Bethel Baptist High School in Kaduna.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: Fulani herdsmen killed the Mai-Angwan Tiv known as Zaki Terzungwe Anjua and 2 other people in an overnight attack. The victims just returned from an internally displaced persons' camp before they were attacked.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 19 people were killed when some bandits invaded a village. The attackers stormed the village in the night and operated till early hours of the day.
sources_of_information: The Punch (19 ) , Vanguard (19 ) , Independent (19 ) , The Guardian (19 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Katsina
description: 2 people were killed while 3 others were injured when some bandits invaded some villages. It was reported that the bandits attacked 2 villages.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Independent (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) attached to the Joint Task Force in the North East killed 11 Boko Haram fighters. It was reported that the troops also recovered a large cache of ammunition and a truck laden with petroleum product.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Danjuma Alhaji was killed by bandits on the outskirts of a community. The incident happened when the bandits attacked the community.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Gunmen/Cultists vs Vigilante, Edo
description: A member of Edo Vigilance Group identified as Endurance a.k.a DMX was shot dead by unknown gunmen suspected to be members of a rival cult group. It was reported that the assailants trailed their victim from his house to a lotto betting shop where he was shot thrice at close range.
place: Ologbosere Street Off Benin Technical College Road in Ugbowo Quarters

title: Bandits Kill 4, Kaduna
description: 4 people were shot dead by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the victims were killed at the outskirts of the community. 2 of the victims were identified as Solomon Bamaiyi and Francis Moses.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by rampaging bandits. It was reported that the victims identified as Tanko and Sani Jibrin were shot dead by an armed bandits.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 28 ISWAP-Boko Haram fighters were decimated along a highway. It was reported that the insurgents also killed one policeman and seized another in the incident.

title: Gunmen vs Herders, Plateau
description: 7 Fulani herdsmen were killed by unidentified gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen also shot dead some cattle in the attack which happened when the herders were rearing them.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: Mr. Bitrus Manzere, a primary school headmaster, and one other person were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the headmaster was hacked to death while the second victim was shot dead by the marauder.

title: Bandits vs Lawmaker, Katsina
description: Alhaji Mohammed G. Ahmed, a member representing Shinkafi constituency in Zamfara House of Assembly, was killed by bandits. The incident happened when the lawmaker was travelling back after the defection ceremony of his state governor. His son and driver were kidnapped by the bandits.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 3, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 3 young men when they attacked a community. Two of the victims, Sulaiman and Nura Dogon Gida, were shot dead when the bandits shot at a Golf 3 car that they were traveling in while the third victim was killed when the bandits were engaged by some vigilante.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in conjunction with the Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai killed 12 Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province members during a gun duel. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to attack a military operational base.
sources_of_information: The Punch (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , The Guardian (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (14 ) , This Day (14 )

title: Burnt IPOB Member, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The burnt body of a herbalist for the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB)/Eastern Security Network (ESN), Pascal Okeke, was found in one of their camps. His killers were not identified.

title: Police vs IPOB, Imo
description: Several members of the Eastern Security Network, ESN, the militia wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, group were killed during raids on their camps by police operatives. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 15 people were killed in the raids.
sources_of_information: The Nation (15 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , The Punch (15 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian army troops neutralized scores of bandits in a fierce encounter. At least 2 scores were believed to have been killed by the soldiers who also recovered one PKT riffle, a large cache of ammunition, and a motorcycle.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , The Guardian (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Bandits vs Troops, Zamfara
description: An encounter between a patrol team of Operation Hadarin Daji, the NAF, and the Police Special Forces, and bandits left a police inspector and a NAF operative identified as James Okpu, dead. 7 bandits were also killed.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: A man and his two sons were killed by gunmen. It was reported that a woman sustained injuries from the attack. A version of the report stated that the killers were Fulani herdsmen.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one person and injured several other people. They also abducted 14 people in the attack which happened in the night. It was reported that they attacked the community with sophisticated weapons.

title: Village Head, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits killed the village Head of Dogon Daji Anja Mallam. He was shot at close range by the bandits who also raided 2 residents.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Herdsmen vs Man, Rivers
description: A 26-year-old man identified as Nonye Nwa-Omoku was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen in his community. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening without any provocation.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was shot dead by the police during an attempt to kidnap an Indian. 4 loaded AK-47 magazines were recovered from the bandits.
place: Plan Farm Phase at Dankande area

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 14 bandits were shot dead by operatives of the Nigerian Police. It was reported that the incident happened when hoodlums attached a police station in an attempt to free their mates.
sources_of_information: The Nation (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (14 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 ) , Nigerian Tribune (14 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of 152 Battalion Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) of the Nigeria Army repelled an attack on a community and in the process, killed 6 terrorists.

title: Banditry Kaduna
description: A 13-year-old girl and one other person were killed by armed bandits stormed the residence of the village head and abducted some people.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs ISWAP/Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP)/Boko Haram fighters, including their commanders, were eliminated by during airstrikes by the Nigerian Air Force. One of the commanders was identified as Modu Sullum.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , This Day (40 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 9 people were killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and shot sporadically.

title: Medical Doctor, Niger
description: Gunmen suspected to be armed bandits abduct and killed Precious Chinnedu Emeka, a medical Doctor in his Private Medical Health facility.

title: Bandits vs Police, Kebbi
description: A policeman, Sergeant Friday Aleji, was shot dead by some bandits who abducted some students of Federal Government College, Birnin Yauri. The attackers, who rode on motorcycles stormed the school from a neighbouring forest. Another version of the story stated that 3 students were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Rescue of Kidnapped Students, Kebbi
description: Nigerian troops operating under the aegis of ‘Operation Hadarin Daji’ supported by the Nigerian Air Force component rescued more abductees of the FGC Birnin Yawuri (See event in IBD021437). In the process, many of the bandits were killed and a female student also died of exhaustion.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (81 ) , The Nation (81 ) , Other newspaper 3 (83 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: 15 bandits were gunned down in a shootout with soldiers. The incident happened when the military men, who were on patrol, saw the bandits on their motorcycles and attacked them.
sources_of_information: The Nation (15 ) , Other newpapers 1 (16 ) , Other newspaper 3 (16 )

title: Bandits Kill Driver, Edo
description: A driver with Hartland Construction Company identified as Buhari was shot dead by gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen also kidnapped an expatriate being driven by the victim. The incident happened after the driver picked the expatriate from the airport and was taking him to a location. Another version of the story stated that the victim was killed by Fulani herdsmen.
place: along Benin-Auchi Expressway by Ogebmudia Farm
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Banditry, Ondo
description: 2 sons of a farmer identified as Dele were killed by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits attacked the home of the farmer. Another version of the story stated that the bandits killed Mr. Dele and abducted 2 of his children.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed and the formation razed down when terrorists loyal to the Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP, invaded a military camp. It was reported that the fighters rode on 10 utility vehicles to storm and attack the military formation.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 5 people were killed while 10 others were abducted by suspected Fulani herdsmen. 3 of the victims were killed after facing trials by the bandits.

title: Herdsmen vs Graduate, Edo
description: Miss Williams Ella Sunday, a Master of Science (MSc) graduate of Architecture, Ambrose Alli University (AAU), Ekpoma, was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders opened fire on a bus the victim was traveling with. She died on the spot.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed while 2 others were injured in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 9 people lost their lives in a communal clash between Aila and Adagbo communities. The cause of the crisis was not stated but it is assumed that the communities were enmeshed in a boundary dispute.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , This Day (9 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Zamfara
description: About 4 policemen and an officer of the Nation Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) were killed during a gun duel with bandits. It was reported that many bandits were killed during the incident. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: This Day (25 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 ) , The Punch (25 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 10 persons were shot dead while sleeping at night by gunmen suspected to Fulani herdsmen. 5 people were severely injured. The victims included Darap Rap, Stephen Rap, Ibrahim Dong, Feng Gyang, Davou Matthew, Naomi Samuel, Kaneng Dung, Davou Pam, James Fom, Gyang Jum, Mr David Dalyop, Emmanuel Paul.
place: Sabon Layi village of Kuru community
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Vanguard (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (12 ) , The Guardian (12 )

title: Bandits vs Policeman, Akwa Ibom
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman was killed when some members of the Eastern Security Network, ESN, attacked a police station in the early hours of the day. The armed men stormed the area on motorcycles.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 people were killed by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the attacker stormed the community in a guerilla manner and shot in all directions before setting houses on fire.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Police vs Man, Akwa Ibom
description: IPOB/ESN: An apologist of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, identified as Imo John Udo was shot dead by the police. The circumstance surrounding the killing was not stated.

title: NAF Air Strikes, Niger
description: Extra-Judicial Killing: Some wedding guests were killed while others were injured by airstrikes conducted by a NAF Alpha jet. It was reported that the jet carried out aerial bombardment to dislodge some bandits but ended up killing the victims. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Army, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 6 soldiers were gunned down by members of the Eastern Security Network linked to the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB. It was reported that the army also killed about 3 members of ESN.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , The Nation (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 6 people were killed while 3 others sustained serious injuries when bandits attacked a community. The attack was a reprisal by one Mani Doro whose boy was killed by the Kanawa residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Boy vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A 13-year-old boy, Abdulkarim Mati, killed 2 bandits. It was reported that the boy shot dead the men with an AK-47 rifle when he had an issue with them and he fled from the forest where they were hiding.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits were shot dead by operatives of the Nigerian Police. It was reported that the incident happened when bandits who doubled as highway robbers were engaged in a gun duel by the police. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: An attack by Fulani herdsmen behind the Army barracks led to the death of 5 people. Many others were wounded.
place: Zongo-Akiki community of Mbalagh Council Ward

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Ahmad Muhammad, a student of Nuhu Bamalli Polytechnic Zaria, was shot dead by bandits during their operation. It was reported that 8 other students, as well as lecturers, were also abducted by the bandits. A pregnant woman was also abducted.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits killed about 51 people during attacks on 5 communities. It was reported that several residents were displaced by the attacks. Many of the residents, women, and children, were taken to shelter in other towns.
place: Kadawa, Kwata, Maduba, Ganda Samu, Saulawa and Askawa communities
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (51 ) , Other newpapers 1 (90 ) , The Nation (57 ) , The Punch (93 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 6 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen stormed their farmlands and abducted some of the women.
place: Anyom community of Mbatyula Council Ward

title: Herdsmen Kill 3 Hunters, Kwara
description: 3 hunters were killed by Fulani herdsmen. They were ambushed while they were working with vigilante to secure their community their community.

title: Assailants vs Herders, Plateau
description: 3 Fulani herdsmen were killed by some assailants. The identity of the killers could not be ascertained. The incident happened when the herders were grazing their animals.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Zamfara
description: 4 people were killed while about 60 women were abducted when bandits invaded three villages. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the villages. Another version of the story stated that the bandits killed 5 soldiers and 9 villagers

title: Herdsmen Kill 4 Hunters, Kwara
description: 4 hunters were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen ambushed the hunters while they were helping to guard their community. The incident happened in the night.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , This Day (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Kanu's Lawyer, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were killed when security operatives from the joint team of the army, police, and Civil Defence Corps invaded the country home of Ifeanyi Ejiofor, personal lawyer of the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu. One of the deceased, Samuel Uzor Okoro, was a personal assistant to the lawyer.

title: OPC vs Herdsmen, Oyo
description: 4 Fulani herdsmen were killed by members of the Oodua Peoples Congress (OPC). The victims were identified as Alhaji Dako Usman (60 years), Bello Sulaiman (36 years), Alhaji Adamu (45 years), and the 75-year-old community leader known as Seriki.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 30 people were killed by bandits who also stole some animals. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village and shot sporadically.
sources_of_information: The Nation (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , This Day (30 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: An army deserter and a trainer/commander of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), Joseph Uka Nnachi alias King of Dragon, and 4 of his members were killed by security operatives. The incident happened during a gun duel with the police during a failed attack on the Imo Police Command Headquarters. It was reported that 5 policemen were also killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 locals were killed by bandits who also razed Assemblies of God hall. It was reported that other people sustained injuries in the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 3 people when they invaded a community. The victims were identified as Femi Bara, John Taiwo, and Tunde Taiwo.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Bandits vs NSCDC Commander, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits killed a commander of the NSCDC. The victim was identified as Commandant Dangana. He died from bullet wounds he sustained during an attack.

title: Bandits Attack, Kebbi
description: 88 villagers were killed by bandits. The incident happened when the attackers invaded some villages and killed the victims who were mainly members of a vigilance group.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 30 people were killed while many others were injured by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the attackers invaded the community in the evening and shot sporadically. One of the victims is a graduate of the Federal University of Agriculture, Makurdi, identified as Echechofu Ali.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (30 ) , Daily Trust (27 ) , Other newpapers 1 (30 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed by bandits who invaded some villages. The victims were killed along a road. Two of the victims were identified as Abubakar Sani and Abubakar Saleh.
place: Lambar Zango area along the Kaduna-Zaria Road
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 41 farmers and a policeman. The incident happened when the bandit attacked two villages. It was reported that they also engaged the police in a gun battle.

title: Parents Die, Niger
description: 2 parents died as a result of the shock they experienced from the news of the abduction of their children as captured in IBD021248. About 200 students of Salihu Tanko Islamiyya School were kidnapped by bandits.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) sect, including their commanders called Umar Tela, were neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed over 50 fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP. The incident happened when the terrorists engaged the army in a battle but were repelled.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 5 bandits were killed by the police who also recovered their operational motorcycles. The incident happened during a gunfire exchange between the bandits and security agents.

title: Assailants vs Herder, Kaduna
description: A Fulani herdsman was killed by some assailants. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack following the killing of 4 natives by Fulani herdsmen as captured in IBD021269.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Fanyo Bello was killed when bandits raided a community. Details of the attack were not reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Oyo
description: 2 people including a butcher, Lamidi Eleran were butchered by Fulani herdsmen/kidnappers. It was reported that the killing led to a protest by members of the community. The second victim was shot dead by a popular contender to the traditional stool of the community during the protest.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits raided a community and killed 3 people. Many were injured while others were displaced to neighbouring communities. The attack came a day after 15 people were killed in the town (See event in IBD021259).

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandit raided a community and killed a man, Yusuffa Karami. Details of the attack were not reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Wakali Kon, Yusuf Joshua, Martha Ayba and Lami Peter were killed during raids by bandits. 2 of the victims were killed while working on their farms.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ebonyi
description: A police was shot dead while 4 gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB were killed. The incident happened during the sit-at-home day ordered by IPOB to commemorate the dead during the Biafran war.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Independent (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: 4 policemen were shot dead by unknown gunmen during a sit-at-home day declared by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB. It is assumed that the gunmen were members of the Eastern Security Network, ESN.
place: Chinatown bus stop, Okpara Avenue, Mgbemene
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 15 people, including a policeman, were killed by marauding bandits who raided some communities. It was reported that the bandits stormed the communities on motorcycles and shot sporadically. Some women and children were also abducted by the gunmen.
place: Beri town in Bobi District, Garin-Gabas, Tegina community
sources_of_information: Vanguard (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A policeman and 6 others were killed by bandits during an attack on a community. 6 others were left injured in the attack. 3 of the attackers were also shot dead by security operatives.

title: Gunmen Kill Ex-Presidential Aide, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: The All Progressives Congress (APC) chieftain and former President Goodluck Jonathan’s aide at the time, Alhaji Ahmed Gulak was intercepted and killed by gunmen while on his way to the Sam Mbakwe Airport, Owerri to catch a flight supposedly back to Abuja. His killing was believed to be politically motivated. 2 of the killers were tracked and killed by policemen but reports had it that the 2 people, Noel Chigbu, Nzeribe Tochi Ekwe, were innocent. One of the killers identified as Anosike Chimobi (28 years) was later arrested.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , Independent (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 military person fighting ISWAP/Boko Haram insurgents lost their life when they ran into improvised explosive devices planted by the terrorists. It was reported that Colonel Husseni Sankara later died from the injuries he sustained in the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , The Punch (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: Bandits kidnapped about 200 students of Salihu Tanko Islamiyya School. One person was killed and another critically injured when the bandits shot sporadically into the air. It was reported that 6 of the pupils died in captivity.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (7 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 12 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked border communities. It was reported that the herders invaded the communities at night and wrecked havoc on the residents.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , The Punch (12 )

title: Gunmen vs Judge, Enugu
description: A former judge of Enugu State High Court, Justice Stanley Nnaji, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen double-crossed the victim's car with theirs and dragged him out of his Mercedes Benz SUV before killing him.
place: Enugu Diagnostics Centre by Ebeano Tunnel

title: Police vs Gunmen, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 8 gunmen suspected to be IPOB/ESN members were shot dead by the police. It was reported that the incident happened when some hoodlums attacked a state criminal investigation department. 2 policemen were killed during the attack. 2 relatives, Onyebuch Anthony Amadi (27 years) and Obinna Onyebuchi Egekwu (30 years), died in the hands of security agents as a result of the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Vanguard (12 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Delta
description: 2 Constables and an Assistant Superintendent of Police were killed when gunmen raided their station. 2 of gunmen were killed by the officers. Police stations in the state have been targeted in series of attacks by unknown gunmen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Political Violence, Lagos
description: 2 people were killed during the LGA primaries of the All Progressives Congress (APC). The crisis started following allegations of irregularities and imposition of candidates by the party’s big wigs. many people reportedly injured in the clash.
place: Haastrup Street off Ayilara Street Ojuelegba
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 gunmen suspected to be IPOB/ESN were shot dead by the police during a gun duel. It was reported that the incident happened when some gunmen attempted to torch a police division but were met by some resistance.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 Air Force personnel were shot dead by unidentified gunmen. The attackers have been targeting security operatvies.

title: Gunmen vs Immigration Provost, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Unidentified gunmen killed Okiemute Mrere, the chief provost of the Nigerian Immigration Service, NIS, in Imo State. It was reported that the assailants riddled his Toyota Hilux truck with bullets.

title: Gunmen vs NAF, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 NAF personnel were shot dead by unknown gunmen when they went to buy food from a nearby canteen. IPOB/ESN were implicated in the attack as they had carried our similar attacks in the state.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram fighters were killed during a foiled attack on troops' location. Multiple weapons including one anti-aircraft gun, two machine guns, and eight AK-47 rifles were recovered. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Vanguard (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Scores of people were reported dead when bandits attacked many communities in an LGA. Some of the victims allegedly drowned in River Kaduna when they were escaping the onslaught. The bandits abducted several people, the majority of them were girls, rustled several cows and snatched motorcycles. The fatalities may increase as some people were still missing.

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A military checkpoint was attacked by unknown gunmen and 5 soldiers were killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Alhaji Shafiu, Alhaji Balailu Sani, and Abdulsamad Hussaini were killed when bandits attacked a community. In revenge, youths attacked a Fulani settlement and killed Abdulmuminu Agwai and Samaila Agwai.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 2 people were killed and 11 others were wounded in an attack by suspected herdsmen. Residents were displaced to nearby communities.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 12 corpses were recovered from a nearby bush after suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. Many residents were displaced to Jalingo, the state capital.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , The Guardian (12 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Dauda Adamu, a community leader was killed during a raid by bandits.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Army vs IPOB, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 people were extra judicially shot dead by the troops of the Nigerian security personnel when some gunmen openly shot dead a personnel of the Nigeria Air Force. Several other people were injured. One of the victims was identified as Matthew Okpara and 2 other ladies.
place: Nekede/Naze junction along the Owerri-Aba road

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided a community, killed 4 residents (Musbahu Yusuf Basiru Jaafaru, Ja’afaru Yahaya and Umaru Sulaiman) and rustled 25 cows.
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen raided some communities in the early hours and killed 36 people. Many were injured while some were declared missing.
place: Shikaan, Mbagena and Kpav in Shitile
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (36 ) , Other newpapers 1 (36 ) , Daily Trust (36 ) , The Nation (36 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Rivers
description: IPOB/ESN: 7 members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN) were killed by a joint security team during a raid on their hideout. They were alleged to be planning attacks on security formations before they were raided. 5 other members were arrested.
place: Agbomchia forest between Oyigbo and Eleme LGAs
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 gunmen who engaged special forces in a shoot-out were gunned down. It was reported that the gunmen attempted to raze a police station that is under construction. 2 businesswomen and a young man were killed by stray bullets.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits killed the village head of Magira village. It was reported that the incident happened in the midnight when the bandits invaded the village. They also abducted a 16 year old girl.

title: Bandits vs Police, Zamfara
description: 10 residents were killed by bandits who attacked 5 villages in a Local Government Area. It was reported that 10 of the bandits were also killed by the police who came to engage the bandits.
place: Dadamji, Gidan Runji, Doka, Yanmadanga and Yarkatsina

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 10 bandits were killed by the police in collaboration with vigilantes. The incident happened when the police responded to a distress call by a village.

title: Police vs Bandits, Imo
description: 2 bandits, Uchenna Elendu and Elu Osinachi, were gunned down during a gun duel that lasted several hours between the police and the gunmen. The police recovered a service rifle and ammunition from the slain bandits.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits were killed in a foiled attack on a community. They were repelled by policemen who later lost 2 of their members in the attack. It is believed that not less than 40 of the attackers were killed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (42 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (42 ) , The Nation (42 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Sokoto
description: The leader of a vigilance group, Adamu Kaure, popularly known as Yan sa kai was killed by some bandits while he was working on his farm. Members of his group attacked the bandits, leading to the death of 12 people. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Police vs Hoodlums, Anamabra
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 hoodlums who where part of those that attacked the office of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) were shot dead by the police. It was reported that the hoodlums razed the office and burnt electoral materials.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 policemen were gunned down by unidentified gunmen during an attack on a police division. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the station in the early hours of the day.

title: Herdsmen Kill 7, Plateau
description: 7 people, including women and children, where killed by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked a community. It was reported that the armed herders attacked the community at night, shooting sporadically.
sources_of_information: This Day (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were neutralized by the Air Task Force of Operation Hadin Kai. The incident happened when the task force conducted air interdiction mission on the hideout and logistics of the terrorists.
place: Guazamala and Toumbuns of Lake Chad

title: Gunmen vs NSCDC, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 officers of the NSCDC were killed during an attack on their outpost by gunmen. Their rifles were taken away and their vehicle set ablaze.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed when bandits attacked 3 communities. Many were also injured in the attack.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 8 farmers were shot dead by bandits who attacked them while they were working on their farms. It was reported that the victims were killed in their farms as they were clearing them in preparing for a new farming season.

title: Security Agents Kill 1, Ebonyi
description: The South-east security outfit codenamed 'Ebubeagu' in collaboration with the police arrested 38 bandits and killed one of them. The victim was killed during the raid.

title: Bandits Kill 12, Niger
description: 12 people including 2 Mobile Policemen were killed by armed bandits. Many residents were injured and 2 were kidnapped by the attackers who reportedly suffered casualties when they were repelled by security operatives. It is assumed not less than 5 bandits were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 19, Sokoto
description: 19 vigilantes were killed by armed bandits. It was reported that the bandits were killed while trying to repel an attack by the bandits on their community. The incident happened in the afternoon. Another version of the story stated that 22 people, including a village head, were killed by bandits.

title: Herdsmen Kill 5, Taraba
description: 5 people were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen barely 8 hours Tiv and Fulani leaders signed a peace pact in the community. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
place: Ukoo Abaa village, near Kufai Amadu
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 13 residents were killed by marauding bandits who have been terrorising residents. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village, killed the victims and injured others.

title: Police vs Bandits, Ebonyi
description: A leader of bandits popularly called 'Blood', who attacked police station and killed a policeman as captured in IBD020972, was shot dead by the police. It was reported that the victim was killed when the police engaged the victim and his gang in a gun duel. Other members of the gang were injured in the duel.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: About 100 residents were butchered by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders stormed many communities in a Local Government Area and killed the victims. They also destroyed several properties.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (100 ) , Other newspaper 3 (100 ) , This Day (100 ) , Other newpapers 1 (101 )

title: Gunmen Kill Herders, Plateau
description: 2 herders were killed by unknown gunmen while rearing their cows in the area. Some cows were shot dead by the attackers.

title: Extra Judicial Killings, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 35 bodies of victims of extra judicial killings by the security agents fighting member so the Indigenous People of Biafra were found in the hospital. They were dumped in a mortuary.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 15 residents were killed during a raid on their communities by suspected bandits. Many others were believed to have sustained different forms of injuries.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Nasiru Sarkin Zango, the driver of the Emir of Birnin Gwari, Alhaji Zubair Jibril Mai Gwari ll, was killed by bandits while returning to the community to service his vehicle. The attackers emerged from the forest and opened fire on the driver.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Ayuba Madugu was killed by gunmen who attacked a police outpost. However, the attack was repelled by the operatives.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 8 people, including a traditional ruler, were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. It was reported that several other people were wounded in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , Vanguard (8 ) , This Day (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 )

title: Political Violence, Oyo
description: A man identified as Tayo Opakunbi was shot dead during local government election. It was reported that the victim was killed by some thugs hired to cause crisis. The victim, an employee of the Adeseun Ogundoyin Polytechnic, was hit by a bullet while sitting in front of his residence.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Falalu Dari and Sabiu Idris were killed when bandits attacked their community.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 3, Sokoto
description: 3 residents died during an attack on their community by bandits. One person was injured, many were robbed of their belongings, and cows were rustled by the attackers.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: One Inusa Ibrahim dead was killed when bandits raided his community. 3 residents were also injured.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: One Nicholas was killed while 11 others were kidnapped during a raid on a community by bandits. His wife and sister-in-law, who were staying in the same residence with him were among the kidnapped victims.

title: OPC Factions, Osun
description: 2 people were killed when members of the OPC and the Oodua Peoples Congress Initiative (OPCI), clashed. The crisis started when members of the OPCI shot dead a member of the OPC. The deceased member of the OPC was identified as Olayode while that of OPCI was known as Wasiu.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police special constabularies were shot dead by unidentified gunmen. The victims, killed on duty, were identified as Emeka Nwaoza (43 years) and Chijioke Nwaoza (35 years). They were cousins.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed some Boko Haram terrorists during an encounter with the insurgents. It was reported that the troops responded to a distress call by farmers who were attacked by the terrorists.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: Bandits killed one person and abducted about 12 residents of a settlement. It was reported that the bandits invaded the area in their large number and perpetrated the act.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: 1 person was killed and 12 others were abducted by bandits who raided a community. The attackers broke into homes and whisked away residents who couldn’t escape the onslaught.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Abubakar Shekau, the leader of Boko Haram, allegedly died after his camp was raided by fighters from the Islamic State West Africa Province. Dozens of terrorists from both factions died in the supremacy fight. Many of Shekau's commanders who refused to surrender were either killed or captured alive. It is assumed not less than 2 dozens of fighters from both factions lost their lives.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (24 ) , The Guardian (24 ) , Vanguard (24 ) , Independent (24 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Katsina
description: One person was killed when some bandits attacked a town. It was reported that the victim was identified as a farmer, Alhaji Iliya Bakon-Zabo, who migrated to the town about 6 years ago.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Vanguard (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN:A police sergeant, Loveday Obilonu, was killed by gunmen. He was attached to the Department of Operations of the state police command headquarters before his death.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed scores of Boko Haram fighters while conducting a clearance operation on the hideouts of the terrorists. They also recovered large caches of arms and ammunition.
place: Ngaiwa, Tongunle, Washelle, Mo'o, Mudollo, Mugdalla and Amtul villages

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits killed the son of the emir of Masuga. The bandits shot the son of the emir, Alhaji Bashar Namasaka, dead on his father's farm. Some of the farmers working with him were also shot dead by the bandits who rustled an unspecified number of cattle. Due to the nature of the story, it assumed that 5 other people were shot dead.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people lost their lives when some bandits attacked q herders' settlement. The victims were identified as herders. An unspecified number of cows were also rustled by the herders.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 8 people were killed by bandits who invaded a community. They burnt a building housing the Assemblies of God Church. The victims included Samaila Gajere, Bawa Gajere, Bitrus Baba, Umaru Baba, Solomon Samaila, Sambo Kasuwa, Samuila Kasua and Gideon Bitrus. A version of the report stated that troops of the Nigerian Navy killed the bandits when they repelled an attack on another community.
sources_of_information: This Day (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Independent (11 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 4 youths of a village lost their lives when armed bandits attempted to launch an offensive against the village. The youths were murdered when the villagers tried to resist the bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: Three soldiers were shot dead while 2 bandits were gunned down when some bandits attacked a community. It was reported that a Chinese expatriate working with a construction company was kidnapped.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Punch (42 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 17 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen in an attack on a village. It was reported that the herders have been terrorizing villagers.

title: Gunmen Attack Police Station, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen suspected to be militants of the Independent People of Biafra (IPOB) attacked a police station, killed 2 officers, and burnt down the station.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 40 Boko Haram terrorists who had gathered to plan attacks on communities were bombarded and killed by soldiers. They were targeted after their communication and plan were intercepted. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen killed a Catholic Catechist identified as Sydney Shirsha and two other people. They were killed in a church.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 2 people were killed in a communal clash between the people of Mbakume and Mbasombo communities. It was reported that the communities have been enmeshed in an age-long crisis.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 9, Taraba
description: 9 people were killed while many others were injured when suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The incident displaced many residents to neighbouring communities.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Rivers
description: 4 gunmen identified as members of Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, and a nurse were gunned down by operatives of the Nigerian Police. It was reported that the gunmen who killed some policemen as captured in IBD021021 and IBD021022 and retired to a makeshift clinic where they were receiving treatment from a nurse identified as Uchechi.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IIPOB/ESN:2 gunmen were killed in a joint operation by the Army, Air Force, and the Police. It was reported that 2 rifles, five motorcycles, a Toyota Lexus SUV, and an 18-seater bus were recovered from the hoodlums.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (0 )

title: IPOB vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A police sergeant identified as Joseph Nwaka was killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB. It was reported that the group also snatched the service rifle of the policeman.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Sokoto
description: A policeman was shot dead when some bandits ambushed a police patrol team. It was reported that the bandits took the team by surprise and opened fire on the team, killing the policeman.

title: Bandits kill 4 Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: Aliyu Ibrahim, the secretary of the vigilante group in Dogon Dawa, and 3 other vigilantes, Bara’u Khalid, Alhaji Bukar and Malam Dauda, were ambushed and killed after they received a fake distress call.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents were killed when combined security forces repelled their attack on residents. It was reported that three soldiers lost their lives in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (27 ) , The Punch (43 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Kebbi
description: A Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), Abdulqadir Garba Hardo, was shot by some bandits. It was reported that the gunshot fractured the victim's bone and later led to his death.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Oyo
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen shot dead one of the commanders of Man O'War while he was on his way to another community. The victim was identified as Oluwole Olabode.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Akwa Ibom
description: 5 police officers and a wife of an officer were shot dead by unknown gunmen who attacked a police facility. It was reported that the gunmen have been attacking security personnel.
sources_of_information: This Day (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A combined team of police operatives and troops of the Nigerian Army engaged some armed bandit in a gun battle, killed one of them while several others escaped with bullet wounds.
place: Rigachikun axis of the Kaduna-Zaria dual carriage way

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Army killed 48 bandits including 4 of their top commanders. The 4 top commanders of the bandits were identified as Yellow Mai-Bille, Sani Meli, Da-Katsina, and Sama'ila Bakajin Bari. Another of their leader sustained gunshot injuries.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (48 ) , Nigerian Tribune (48 ) , The Punch (48 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were killed by the air component of Operation Thunder Strike. The incident happened during series of aerial missions across several locations in the state.
place: Forests in Birnin Gwari and Chikun

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: A retired army sergeant, Christopher Madaki, his wife, Mary, and daughter-in-law, Alice, were killed by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a village. They injured the man's son known as Clement Madaki.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Rivers
description: 4 policemen were gunned down by unknown gunmen. It was reported that one of the gunmen was shot dead in one of the attacks.
place: Choba bridge checkpoint; Rumuji police station; Ogbakiri junction

title: Gunmen vs Police, Rivers
description: 3 policemen were gunned down by unknown gunmen who attacked several police stations and checkpoints. It was reported that one of the gunmen was shot dead in one of the attacks.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 11 members of the Eastern Security Network, an arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), were gunned down by a team of security forces. The incident happened when victims attempted to overrun a police station. It was also reported that a female officer of the NSCDC, Mrs. Glory Nkwocha, was killed by a stray bullet during the clashes.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , The Nation (12 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 11 residents were killed by bandits in a reprisal attack for the killing of their informant by residents of the town. It was reported that three other people sustained injuries in the attack.

title: Monarch, Cross Rivers
description: The monarch of Ajasor community was killed by a 39-year-old man, Victor Isong. However, he denied the allegation and insisted he was framed up. This event is backdated by a week since no date was reported.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: One Mariya Sale was killed and 3 others (Ladidi Abdullahi, Zubaida Balarabe, and Hauwa’u Ayuba) were injured when bandits raided a community.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Mr. Bitrus Luka was shot dead and Kings Andy, Danladi Audu, and Titus Friday were injured during an attack on a community by bandits.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: Bandits killed 7 people when they invaded a community on motorcycles and shot indiscriminately to scare away people. Foodstuffs and properties were also destroyed before they left the community. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists allegedly killed 5 soldiers, 15 Civilian JTF, and 10 civilians during a raid on a community. The attackers engaged soldiers in a gun battle before dislodging the Special Forces. 5 vehicles, 3 from vigilantes, 1 gun truck from the Nigerian military, and 1 from CJTF were carted away. The terrorist had also killed 5 civilians and a security operative a day earlier.

title: Chieftaincy Crisis, Ondo
description: 2 people were killed as two factions of youths loyal to two traditional chiefs, Chief Idowu Ogunye and Chief Sunday Bada, engaged in a clash over the Olokoja chieftaincy title.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were neutralised by troops of the Operation Thunder Strike (OPS) component of the Nigerian Air Force. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 19 people were killed in a renewed attack on some communities by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Many people were injured and several houses were burnt.
place: Tse Amgbem, Udam near Aondoana, and Agbanu Seghev/Ukuse
sources_of_information: Vanguard (19 ) , The Punch (19 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Independent (17 ) , The Nation (11 )

title: Community vs Fulani Herdsmen, Cross Rivers
description: There was a claim that some Fulani herdsmen were killed by youths in the area. It is assumed the incident happened on the 1st of May 2021. Also, it is assumed that 5 herdsmen were killed.

title: Bandits vs Pension Boss, Kwara
