description: The Kogi State Pension Board Chairman, Solomon Akejewe, was killed by gunmen while he was returning from a travel. The victim, who was in the company of his driver, was shot dead by the bandits while his driver was injured in the attack.
place: Eruku, close to Egbe in Kwara
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Herdsmen Killing, Benue
description: 4 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. It was reported that the herders attacked the village at night and shot sporadically, killing and destroying properties.
place: Imande Akpu village, along Gbajimba - Federal University of Agriculture road
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , This Day (4 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A kidnap kingpin and a bandit identified as Auwal Daudawa, known for his role in the abduction of the 300 schoolboys in Katsina State, was killed in a rival fight. It was reported that the victim was shot dead during a gun duel with a rival gang.

title: Gunmen vs Policemenm, Akwa Ibom
description: 2 policemen were killed and a female officer on night duty wounded by gunmen suspected to be members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), a military arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). 5 vehicles were burnt alongside the Police station.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Armed Fulani herdsmen attacked a village and killed one Mr. Avindir Agir Nyam. It was reported that the herders have been terrorising villages.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Businessman vs Soldiers, Imo
description: Noel Chigbu, a businessman was killed by soldiers in front of the state Government House. He was shot the day he took delivery of his new Camry car and was driving home at the close of work. The killing is connected to the clampdown on IPOB and their military arm, the Eastern Security Network (ESN) by security operatives.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Niger
description: Two people were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped several other people in the community.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Rampaging bandits invaded a community, killed one person while several other people were injured in the attack. The bandits have been terrorizing residents of the village.

title: Herdsmen vs Couple, Benue
description: Armed Fulani herdsmen killed and dismembered a man and his wife during an ambush. It was reported that the victims, Igba Faga and his wife, were riding home from the farm on a motorcycle when they were accosted and killed.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: Police neutralized three bandits during a raid on their camp in a forest. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents of the environment.
place: Tomatar Imande Ukusuu Mbacher Council Ward

title: Army vs Woman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A woman, Mrs. Chikaodi Ofoegbu, was hit by a stray bullet from one of the guns of soldiers who were jubilating at a military checkpoint on a road. The mother of 4 died before she could be rushed to the hospital.

title: Herdsmen vs IDPs, Benue
description: 7 people in the Internally Displaced Peoples' camp were shot dead by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked the camp at midnight. Several other people were injured.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Residents, Anambra
description: 19 people said to be Fulani herders were butchered by unknown assailants. It was reported that the assailants clash with the victims who were residents in a village. The victims included women and children between 1 and 2 years old.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (19 ) , The Nation (9 ) , The Guardian (19 )

title: Market Crisis, Lagos
description: Clashes linked to supremacy tussle among cult groups, ticketing issues in the market as well as religious violence prompted by blasphemy, led to Aliyu Shuaibu a boy from the Niger Republic, stabbing Sadiq Oloyo, a Yoruba boy to death. So far, over 5 people have died in the crisis.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Security Operatives vs Farmer, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN::A farmer, whose identity could not be ascertained was extra judicially shot dead by security agents in front of government house.

title: Assailants vs Army, Rivers
description: 4 soldiers were shot dead by unknown gunmen who attacked a motorcade conveying oil workers to a location. It was reported two soldiers sustained bullet injuries in the attack.

title: Ritual Killing, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 10 girls were killed by members of the Eastern Security Network. It was reported that the victims were killed for the burial of a top commander of the group identified as Ikonso.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Vanguard (10 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Army vs Undergraduate, Imo
description: IPOB vs Army: Divine Nwaneri, a first-year student of the Imo State University, Owerri, was shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army deployed around the Imo State government house. It was reported that the victim was being conveyed to the hospital due to sickness but was shot dead when some soldiers tried to stop the driver of the vehicle. The driver was also shot.
place: Government House front gate in Owerri

title: Bandits vs Woman, Kaduna
description: A woman identified as Mrs. Rahila Dauda was shot dead by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a village and attacked residents.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits Attack Worshipers, Kaduna
description: Two worshippers, including a medical doctor, Zakariah Dogo Yaro, were killed by bandits who attacked worshippers. An unspecified number of worshippers also sustained injuries during the attack. The doctor was a staff of the Kaduna State Ministry of Health. Some worshippers were also abducted.
place: Haske Baptist church at Manini Tasha village of Kuriga Ward

title: Bandits vs Police, Kebbi
description: 9 police personnel including a divisional police officer (DPO) were shot dead by bandits. The officers were killed during a gun duel with the bandits. 2 Yan Sa Ka (local vigilantes) and some residents were killed by the bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 16 people were killed in the attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The partially burnt corpse of a seven-year-old boy, Abubakar Sarki Musa was found in an uncompleted building. The victim was killed by rampaging bandits who invaded the village.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 indigenes were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the village. The victims were identified as Bala Gwamma, Kasage Ali, Mai Jakki, Makeri Kugu, Haruna Kawu, and Ali Agaji.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were killed when the terrorists tried to overrun a military super camp. It was reported that the insurgent killed about 20 soldiers. In addition, about 33 soldiers were shot dead when the Nigerian Airforce jet mistakenly fired at them while trying to clear the rampaging terrorists.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (93 ) , This Day (93 ) , Daily Trust (93 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Some bandits killed about 6 people when they invaded some communities. The incident happened when the heavily armed bandits were passing through the communities and clashed with residents.

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Imo
description: ESN/IPOB vs JTF: 7 members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN), a security wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), were killed by a joint security team. One of the victims was a top commander of the group identified as Ikonso.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 17people were killed by Fulani herdsmen in separate attacks. It was reported that the attack which spanned two days saw the herders killing destroying several communities.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (17 ) , The Guardian (17 ) , The Punch (17 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a community, killed 2 people, and injured 3 others who were moved to the Benue State University Teaching Hospital (BSUTH) for treatment.

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Imo
description: ESN/IPOB vs JTF: Members of the IPOB invaded the country home of Governor Hope Uzodimma and killed three people, including a policeman, an official of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, and a firefighter attached to the house. This was a reprisal for the killing of IPOB men in IBD020893.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the Nigerian army killed 21 Boko Haram terrorists. The terrorists had earlier attacked Geidam, forcing residents to flee for safety, as they broke their Ramadan fast. Another version of the report stated that 11 family members were killed when an explosive device targeted at the insurgents landed on the victims' homes
sources_of_information: The Guardian (21 ) , This Day (21 ) , Daily Trust (32 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A traditional ruler, Chief Hyacinth Ajon, and one Benjamin Anakula were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Some people were injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 45, Zamfara
description: No fewer than 45 residents were killed during attacks on 6 communities by bandits. Dozens of women and children were declared missing while houses, shops, private and public buildings were burnt.
place: Yar Doka, Kango, Ruwan Dawa, Madaba, Arzikin Da and Mairairai

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: Some unknown gunmen attacked a police divisional station and killed 2 policemen. It was reported that the attackers also destroyed some parts of the police facility.

title: Bandits vs Army, Niger
description: A Regimental Sergeant Major (RSM) was killed by armed bandits who invaded a village. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a military camp.

title: Bandits vs Amotekun, Oyo
description: Bandits, who attacked the personnel of the Oyo State Security Network code-named Amotekun Corps, killed a member of the security outfit identified as Sulaiman Quadri. The victim was hacked to death when he and another colleague were escorting farmers to their farms.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: An official of Greenfield University, Kaduna, was shot dead by bandits who invaded the school. It was reported that the gunmen also abducted some students of the university during the attack. The killed official was a porter in the school. In addition, 5 students of the university were also killed by the bandits. Their bodies were dumped in a forest by the bandits. Two of the bandits were identified as Aminu Lawal, aka Aminu Kano, and Murtala Dawu, aka Mugala.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Vanguard (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , This Day (6 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Police killed 15 bandits when the armed men attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits also killed about 5 villagers in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 5 bandits lost their lives when they attempted to attack security operatives in a military checkpoint. The bandits came in a seven-seater minibus and attempted a surprise attack on soldiers but 5 of them were gunned down.

title: Communal Crisis, Ebonyi
description: 2 people were killed in a renewed boundary dispute between two communities. It started when a councilor took some foreign investors to a disputed land that the government committee was working on.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 15 bandits were gunned down by the police when the armed men attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits also killed about 5 villagers in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits were killed in a gun duel with policemen. The victims were sighted along a cattle route in the area with some rustled domestic animals before they were attacked. 3 of the bandits were also arrested.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: 2 policemen were shot dead when unknown gunmen attacked a police headquarters. It was reported that the police also killed three of the attackers during the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Independent (3 ) , Vanguard (5 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Rampaging bandits killed Suleiman Yunusa and Musa Bala when they attacked some villages. They also rustled an unspecified number of cows.
place: Settlement near Maraban Jos and outskirts of Garu village
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Barnabas Isa was shot dead by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village and terrorized the villagers.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: A civilian identified as Jacob Auta was killed during an attack by bandits. A military camp razed, while some military vehicles burnt and others stolen.

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: 6 bandits were shot dead by the police during a clearance operation. It was reported that the police killed the victims in an ambush.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Nation (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) neutralized 5 armed bandits and injured some during the air raids of their hideouts. The bandits have been terrorizing residents.

title: Banditry, Benue
description: Some bandits attacked a villager and killed some people. It was reported that they attacked the village in the morning but were engaged by security operatives.
place: Anune along Naka road on the outskirts of Makurdi

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of bandits were executed in a market by vigilantes in revenge for the murder of 3 farmers. The killers blocked every exit from the market and slaughtered their victims.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters and soldiers lost their lives in an attempt to overrun a military base. Fatalities were put at 10 insurgents and 10 soldiers since no specific fatalities were reported.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Bandits Kill 9, Sokoto
description: Bandits raided a community, killed 9 people, injured many others, and rustled about 500 cows.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: 2 school children were killed during an invasion by gunmen numbering about 10. The attackers disrupted bank activities and hoisted the Biafran flag at the gate of a bank, thereby confirming that they were members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Gunmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 12 farmers in a Tiv settlement. The incident happened in the early hours of the day when the gunmen attacked the community and shot sporadically while chanting war songs.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (11 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , The Nation (12 ) , This Day (14 )

title: Herdsmen vs Man, Edo
description: The husband of a woman identified as Mrs Okafor Jane Iyamuka was murdered by Fulani herdsmen. The circumstance surrounding the death was not stated.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 children died when some bandits kidnapped 28 children from a community. It was reported that the children died out of starvation and other untold hardships in captivity.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Oyo
description: A 56-year-old farmer, Muftau Babarinde, was hacked to death by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the farmer had gone to give food to his labourers and was returning home when he was killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Scores of people lost their lives when residents of a village dared some bandits who attacked them. Not less than 2 scores were believed to have died in the incident.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 6 miners were killed by rampaging bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the gunmen attacked the village at night.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Guardian (6 )

title: Residents vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Angry residents with the support of vigilante groups killed about 30 bandits in a village. The incident happened when the bandits stormed the village to attack the villagers. 3 residents were killed in the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Kaduna
description: Buhari Alhaji Halle, Nasiru Mai Ungwa Dari, Ali Nasiry, and Iliya Idris were killed by bandits who attacked two villages. One person was also injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 people lost their lives when fighters of the Boko Haram sect invaded a town. It was reported that the terrorists also destroyed the town during the attack.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Punch (18 ) , The Nation (18 ) , This Day (18 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Joshua Dauda, his 7-year-old son, Philipm, and 2 others lost their lives when bandits attacked a village. Seven houses, one car and a motorcycle were burnt down.

title: Assailants vs Community, Ebonyi
description: Many people were killed by rampaging assailants believed to have come from a neighbouring community in Benue State. Several houses and properties were razed. Another version of the story stated that the community was attacked by Fulani herdsmen. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed in the attack.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Armed Bandits stormed a sugarcane farm and killed Isah Haruna a resident of the area.

title: Communal Clash, Gombe
description: About 15 people lost their lives as a result of the invasion of Nyuwar and Hemen (Jessu) communities by gunmen. The crisis was triggered by the tussle for farmland between Lunguda and Waja ethnic groups.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , Vanguard (15 ) , The Guardian (24 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Rivers
description: 6 people were killed and scores of others were wounded as unknown gunmen opened fire on a group of youths going about their lawful duties in the community.

title: Mob vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 gunmen suspected to be bandits were killed when several residents of the area came to the aid of a victim whose house was broken into by the gunmen.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Vigilante, Niger
description: 5 vigilantes were killed while scores were injured during an attack on a local market and some communities by bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Soldiers of Sector 1, Operation Lafiya Dole, and 112 Task Force Battalion killed 7 Boko Haram fighters. The troops engaged the terrorists with superior aerial and ground firepower.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 9 people including three soldiers were killed when Boko Haram fighters attacked a community. It was reported that the terrorists set the United Nations' facilities on fire, forcing humanitarian workers to flee for their lives.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (9 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Miners, Plateau
description: About 8 miners were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked them at a mining site. It was reported that the incident which happened at night left three women and 5 men dead.
place: behind Cabitex company in Kuru community
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Kebbi
description: 4 officers of the Police Mobile Force (MOPOL) and Nigeria Army were killed by bandits who attacked three villages. It was reported that 6 bandits were killed during the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: No fewer than 24 bandits were killed during a raid on their hideouts by officers of Operation Thunder Strike. They were killed in an aerial mission.

title: Soldiers Raid Community, Benue
description: Soldiers killed 12 bandits over the missing of 2 soldiers. The soldiers were believed to have been killed. Scores of residents were alleged to have died in the operation which involved military helicopters and missile launchers. Properties worth millions of naira were destroyed. Another version of the stated that 11 soldiers were killed while about 70 deaths were recorded. It was confirmed by the government that local militias actually killed the soldiers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (54 ) , The Guardian (14 ) , The Punch (23 ) , The Nation (35 ) , Daily Trust (81 )

title: IPOB vs Soldiers, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) attacked a military checkpoint and killed 2 soldiers. The place was set ablaze and the remaining soldiers ran away.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were shot dead by bandits. The incident happened bandits invaded some communities. It was reported that several other people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: About 7 people were killed by bandits who also abducted some people. The incident happened when the bandits struck on a highway in the night. Several other people were injured.
sources_of_information: This Day (7 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , The Nation (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 11 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a gunfight with the army. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to attack the troops of the 192 Battalion.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit who had been on the radar of the police for some time was killed during a raid by policemen. Arms and ammunition were recovered from the gang.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 5 .males, Samson Danladi, Luka Gajere, Amos Ali, Titus Baba, and Damali Musa, were killed by bandits during a raid on their community. Another person was injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 of the right-hand men of Abubakar Shekau, leader of the Boko Haram sect, were killed by the group over allegations of insubordination and betrayal. Those killed include, Abu Fatima, who held the position of a war commander and Baana Alaji Modu Kakakauma who held the position of chief assistant to the leader.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 soldiers were wounded while many Boko Haram insurgents were killed by a joint task force comprising soldiers, police, and some civilian volunteers. It is assumed that 10 of the insurgents were killed.

title: Communal Crisis, Benue
description: 6 people were killed over a fish pond. The fish pond had been a source of dispute between some communities in the area, in which several people have been killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP)were killed during a gun duel with troops of the Nigerian Army. The insurgents ambushed the convoy of the Borno State Resettlement and Relief Committee but were repelled. 3 soldiers were injured in the attack.
place: Along Maiduguri-Gajiram-Monguno Road at Jigalta village

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB) killed 4 suya sellers of Hausa origin. Also, see the event in IBD020705.

title: Gunmen vs Miyetti Allah Leaders, Nasarawa
description: Some bandits attacked and killed two Chairmen of Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association in the night. The victims were identified as Mohammed Hussaini, State Chairman of the association, and Muhammed Umar the Chairman of association in Toto LGA.

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB) killed 3 suya sellers of Hausa origin. The attackers came dressed in military attire.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Niger
description: Bandits numbering about 100 attacked a Joint Security Task Force camp and killed 7 people, including 5 soldiers, a member of the NSCDC, and another person.

title: Army vs Wedding Guests, Tarab
description: Extra Judicial Killing: 5 youths, where were guests at a wedding, were shot dead by soldiers who thought they were bandits as they were riding on motorcycles. The victims were identified as Abdulkadir Bello, Tukur Bellow, Philip Yakubu, Habu Yarima and Yaú Misa. Two of the victims were students of the Taraba State University and Taraba State College of Agriculture.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits were killed during a raid on their hideouts by the police. 5 suspected informants were also arrested during the raid.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: A former councillor, Dayyabu Jafar, was killed by bandits while on his farm. Other communities were also attacked by the bandits. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Yusuf Dallatu was killed by bandits during an attack on a community. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Air Force Jet Crashes, Borno
description: NAF's Alpha Jet involved in the anti-terror war against Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province lost radar contact in Borno State and crashed in Bama. The 2 pilots onboard are believed to have died in the crash. Boko haram claimed responsibility for downing the plane and released a video of the dead pilot.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Independent (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: 2 people were killed by suspected herdsmen. The victims, young farmers, had gone to water their crops when they were attacked.

title: Police vs Bandit, Niger
description: Police killed a bandit and recovered one AK47 rifle from him. He was shot when the police engaged some bandits in a shoot-out.

title: Bandits vs Police, Kaduna
description: Some bandits identified as Aminu Lawal (aka Kano) and Murtala Dawu (aka Mugala), who were working in synergy with a kidnap kingpin known as Yellow Ashana, kidnapped and murdered 2 police officers and one vigilante.

title: Bandits Kill 6, Kaduna
description: 6 people lost their lives when some bandits who tried to waylay their vehicles shot at them, causing the vehicle to somersault. The victims were identified as Aisha Bello, Uwaliya Alhaji Shehu, Ramatu Sani, Muhammad Shehu, Aminu Ibrahim, and Ibrahim Abdul. Some other people were injured in the attack.
place: Kan Hawa Zankoro near Ungwan Yako
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Herdsmen vs Community, Enugu
description: About 8 people lost their lives during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and members of Igga Community. The problem started when some Fulani herdsmen shot a young man working at a rice factory over a misunderstanding and blocked sympathizers from taking him to the hospital. Among the victims was Muhammed Danyunku, a prominent Muslim leader who had lived in the community for over 30 years.
place: Adarice Factory in Adani, Igga community
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Independent (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a man identified as Amos Yari. The incident happened when the bandits attacked some locals in a village.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Police vs IPOB, Awka Ibom
description: IPOB/ESN: Three police officers including a Chief Superintendent of Police, Ben Ajide, and Assistant Superintendent of Police identified as Ogueri Vitalis lost their lives when they clashed with members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, in a community. It was reported that about 4 policemen were missing in the attack. Another version of the report stated that the attackers were cultists. In response to the killings, the military conduct airstrikes that led to the death of scores of the hoodlums.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , Independent (43 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A vigilante was killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits abducted four people, including three children.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Alhaji Sule, a businessman, was shot dead by some bandits who attacked a village. He was killed when he resisted the bandits' attempt to kidnap him.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Katsina
description: Gunmen who doubled as bandits shot and killed three people and injured two others. The incident happened when dozens of the gunmen, who rode on a motorcycle, stormed a community and ransacked it.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 48 terrorists and rescued 11 kidnapped victims. It was reported that the 28 Task Force Brigade of Sector 1 Operation Lafiya Dole neutralized the terrorists in an ambush.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (48 ) , The Guardian (48 ) , Nigerian Tribune (48 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: One bandit was killed while an arms dealer was arrested by the police. It was reported that the police also recovered 8 SMG rifles, one pistol and 85 rounds of 7.62 X 39 mm live ammunition.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: 6 people lost their lives during an encounter between troops of Operation Whirl Stroke and bandits. It was reported that the troops engaged the armed men belonging to the camp of Late Gana in a fierce gun battle.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a village. The bandits killed the victim, Nasiru Rufai, when he resisted their attempts to kidnap him.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 5, Sokoto
description: Some bandits killed 2 policemen and 3 other people. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits stormed a village in the night. Three of the victims were farmers.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Sokoto
description: The village head of Tunga and two other people were killed by bandits who invaded their village during the sunset prayers. It was reported that the attackers operated for a full hour uninterrupted.

title: Corpse, Kaduna
description: The decomposing corpse of Paul Simon was discovered by soldiers on patrol. He was declared missing on March 24, 2020. It is assumed he died the same day. He might have been killed by bandits considering the spate of kidnap and attacks in the state.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Delta
description: A police inspector was stabbed to death and others were injured by unknown gunmen who attacked a police patrol team. It was reported that the gunmen set the patrol van ablaze and also dispossessed the police officers of some rifles.

title: Security Operatives vs IPOB, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 16 members of the Eastern Security Network, an arm of the Indigenous People of Biafra, were killed during a shoot-out between the group and security operatives comprising of personnel from the army and police.
place: Ariaria junction along the Enugu-Port-Harcourt express

title: Bandits Kill 4, Taraba
description: Unidentified gunmen killed three Fulani men and one other person during an attack on travelers. It was reported that the victims were traveling in a Peugeot 505 Station Wagon when they ran into a roadblock mounted by the gunmen. The gunmen also set the vehicle ablaze after carting away items inside it and ran into the forest.

title: Bandits vs Police, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were killed by some bandits and two of their rifles were carted away in the process. The victims are as follows: Inspector Austin Ugwu, Inspector Longinus Ugochukwu, and Constable Ama Ifeanyi. The incident happened at a police checkpoint.

title: Bandits Kill 8, Kaduna
description: 8 people were shot dead by bandits who attacked some villages. It was reported that the bandits killed Nura Rufai, Sanusi Gajere, Yakubu Labbo, Usman Dangiwa, Alhaji Abdulhamid, Janaidu Tsalhatu, Haruna Dotu and Hamisu Mohammad.
place: Dogon Dawa-Kuyello road and Ungwan Maje in Birnin Gwari
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army on the anti-banditry operation busted an attempt by a kidnap gang to abduct some villages. The clash led to the killing of 3 bandits.

title: Bandits vs Soldier, Niger
description: A soldier was killed by bandits who attacked a military base. It was reported that the bandits also injured another soldier in the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed by rampaging bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits killed the following: Dayyabu Yarima, Dalhatu Ashiru, and Suleiman Samatu.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by troops under the auspices of Operation Thunder Strike, OPTS, and One Division, Nigerian Army. The incident happened during a clearance operation of the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: A staff of a clinic was killed when some bandits attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village and attacked the hospital, killing one person and injuring three others.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 20 vigilantes were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the vigilantes engaged a group of bandits during the incident which resulted in the death of the vigilantes.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , The Nation (26 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were shot dead by gunmen who attacked a police checkpoint. The victims were identified as Inspector Austin Ugwu, Inspector Longinus Ugochukwu, and Police Constable Ama Ifeanyi.

title: Assailants vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A policewoman lost her life during an attack at a divisional police headquarters by some unidentified gunmen. It was reported that the attackers razed the police facility. The victim was shot dead.

title: Bandits vs Fulani Leader, Kaduna
description: A Fulani community leader in Doka general area identified as Alhaji Lawal Musa, popularly called Alhaji Maijama'a, was killed by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits attacked the victim while driving on a motorcycle with his elder brother, Alhaji Gide Musa.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one person identified as Irmiya Godwin while he was on his way from his farm. They also attacked his brother who escaped from them. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a village.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: 2 policemen and two prison officials were killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen killed the victims when they attacked a police station and a prison car taking some prisoners to court.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Vanguard (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Soldiers on anti-banditry operations burst an attempt by a kidnap gang to abduct some villagers. It was reported that the soldiers killed 3 of the bandits during the operation. Another version of the story stated that the soldiers killed scores of bandits.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , This Day (40 ) , Independent (40 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed 2 people identified as Duza Bamaiyi and one Zakka Pada when they attacked 2 villages. It was reported that the bandits also injured three people including one Pada Dalle.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 10, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed 10 people during an attack on a village. It was reported that the bandits razed 56 houses and 16 motorcycles. They also raided and burnt several barns. 4 people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 3 bandits were killed by policemen and their AK-47 rifles were recovered. Details of the operation were not reported.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed when bandits attacked a local market. Dozens of people were injured while stalls were burnt down.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 suspected bandits were killed by the police and 5 AK-47 rifles were recovered from them. The victims were traced to their hideout and were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandit have been wrecking havoc in the village.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits stormed a village and killed 3 military officers and five villagers in an attack. It was reported that the gunmen also set a military operational vehicle ablaze. Another version of the report stated that 11 bandits were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (19 ) , This Day (18 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed a traveller when they shot at some vehicles plying a road. The victim was identified as one Abdullahi Baballe.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by troops of Operation Thunder Strike. It was reported that the troops also rescued 4 victims who were kidnapped by the bandits.

title: Bandits vs Hunters, Katsina
description: 17 hunters were killed by bandits when they went on a hunting expedition. 25 other hunters who were in the company of those killed were abducted by the bandits. A N500 million ransom was demanded by the abductors.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of the Nigerian Army killed 41 members of the Boko Haram terror group and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) during an offensive against the terrorists.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Thunder Strike laid ambush, killed two bandits and recovered wraps of Indian hemps from them. They also recovered one motorcycle, a locally-made rifle as well as one mobile phone from the bandits.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole killed over 41 Boko Haram and ISWAP terrorists in a clearance operation. The incident happened during a gunfight which lasted about 45 minutes.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened some terrorists waylaid the troops and some members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). Another version of the story stated that 15 soldiers and 4 Civilian Joint Task Force members were killed in the attack by the military denied the fatalities. Whichever side lost its men, the fatalities are assumed not to be less than 20.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Some rampaging bandits, who attacked some communities, killed four kidnap victims. It was reported that 5 of the bandits were afterward shot dead by vigilantes. 2 more bandits were killed a few days later while 2 others were arrested.
place: Fapo near Gulu in Azza community, Lapai
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Vanguard (11 ) , Independent (11 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters were killed while four soldiers lost their lives during an encounter between the terrorists and the army. The incident happened when troops of Sector 3 Operation Lafiya Dole were on a clearance patrol. It is assumed that 40 terrorists were killed in the incident.
place: Fringes of the Lake Chad and the Tumbus
sources_of_information: The Nation (44 ) , Other newpapers 1 (44 ) , Nigerian Tribune (44 )

title: Herdsmen Kill Farmer, Oyo
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a village and hacked a farmer to death with a machete. It was reported that the herders tied the farmer identified as Kola to a tree before killing him.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Some bandits attacked a community and killed one person. It was reported that the rampaging bandits killed one Rabiu Haruna.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 13, Zamfara
description: 13 people were killed by bandits who attacked their community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community in the afternoon and shot at residents.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Kaduna
description: 4 residents were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandit stormed the community, shooting sporadically. The victims were identified as Wada Sudlaiman, Amiru Saidu, Yusha'u Mohammadu and Osama Abdulwahab.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Two people were killed by bandits who attacked a village. The victims were identified as Ibrahim Yahu Birnin Gwari and Haruna Usman.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army troops of Operation Tura Takaibango eliminated 25 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists and captured a cache of arms and ammunition in a clearance operation.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: 1 person was killed while 18 others were abducted and several others were injured as gunmen attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits fired several shots at people to announce their presence in the community.

title: Bandits vs Miners, Zamfara
description: About 100 miners operating in a mining site were kidnapped by bandits while 10 of them were killed. The miners were attacked while they were working.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits stormed a village and killed 3 people. At least 5 others sustained gunshot wounds.

title: Banditry, Nasarawa
description: The village chief of Osewu community and 16 other residents were hacked to death by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: A security guard was killed by some rampaging bandits who also injured several other people. The guard was identified as Tanko Mohammed. The bandits also kidnapped some people.

title: Herdsmen vs Vigilante, Oyo
description: 2 members of a local security outfit were murdered by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. The victims were identified as Ojetunji Oladokun Akabi and Owolabi Rasak. The security men were on the duty before they were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Drivers, Edo
description: 3 drivers of articulate vehicles were shot dead by some marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders attacked the drivers in the early hours of the day to steal from them. The incident led to a protest by tanker and other articulate vehicle drivers. Another version of the story stated that the victims were luxurious bus drivers.

title: OPC members vs Herdsmen, Oyo
description: Some members of the OPC stormed the house on Isilu Wakili, a 75-year-old old blind Fulani herdsman, and killed his sister Fatima Umar by setting her ablaze. It was reported that members of OPC also arrested 2 other people.

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Plateau
description: Some armed men ambushed three men, killed one of them while two others escaped with injuries. The deceased was identified as 36-year-old Bitrus Chollom while those who escaped were identified as Isaac David and Emmanuel Davou. A version of story stated that the armed men were Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Herders Kil 4, Oyo
description: Four men were killed by Fulani herdsmen loyal to one Abdullahi Iskilu Wakili who has been terrorizing some villagers. The victims were hacked to death in the early hours of the day. 2 of the victims were members of the community police.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram sect members (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed by military troops during a clash between the terrorists and the army. The incident happened when the terrorists attacked a military base.

title: Assailants vs Herders, Anambra
description: 4 Fulani herdsmen were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked them and killed some of their cows. Some of the cows also got missing in the aftermath of the attack. The victims were identified as Hadari Umaru, Hamidu Umaru, Aliu Idris and Hassan Idris.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Oyo
description: 4 people were killed by unknown gunmen who invaded a village. The victims were killed without provocation.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were neutralized by the troops of the Nigerian Air Force during a clearance operation. The bandits have been terrorizing several communities. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 13 people were killed by bandits who attacked a village. Three people were critically injured during the attack. The bandits have been terrorising several communities.
sources_of_information: The Punch (13 ) , Daily Trust (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (17 )

title: Herdsmen Kill Farmers, Ekiti
description: 2 farmers Toyin Akeju, popularly known as Jisoro, and Daodu, a labourer invited to work on the farm, were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Their bodies were later recovered from the bush.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: ISWAP vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 54 terrorists and herdsmen were killed during a clash between terrorists loyal to the Islamic State West African Province and Boko Harm fighters. The clash happened when members of Boko Haram terrorist group attempted to loot from the ISWAP units. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdate to the middle of the month.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 bandits were killed while many others were injured by troops of Operation Thunder Strike, OPTS. They were killed during an ambush operation conducted to rid the region of bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 40 villagers were killed by bandits who stormed the village. It was reported that the bandits attacked the village and killed the victim. Another version of the story stated that the police denied any of such killing in the village.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Sokoto
description: One man was killed while two women, including the wife of the late village head of Saketa, were kidnapped by rampaging bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit leader identified as Rufai Maikaji and some other bandits were neutralised. The bandits were killed during aerial bombardment by troops of the Nigerian Air Force. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 24 bandits were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kano
description: Bandits killed three people and abducted one person. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a village. They abducted the mother of a businessman identified as Alhaji Yusuf Jibrin.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Cross River
description: Some unknown gunmen killed 6 policemen and a soldier at two checkpoints located in two communities. It was reported that the gunmen killed the victims and carted away their rifles.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kaduna
description: Bandits attacked some villages and killed 5 people. Some of the victims were identified as Hussaini Suleiman Dari, Yahuzu Sale, Mohammed Sani Suleiman, Yahuza Sale and Garba Sule.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen killed one person and abducted Hajiya Asabe Jibrin, mother of a businessman. It was reported that the gunmen also injured two others.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Rampaging bandits killed 5 people when they invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandits killed Ashahabu Abubakar, Ado Rilwanu, Sabo Iliya, Mannaseh Matthias Danjuma and Ayuba Waziri.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Vanguard (5 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 civilians were killed while several others were injured when the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) (ISWAP) attacked the town.

title: Bandit Attack, Niger
description: 1 person was killed while several others were kidnapped when bandits raided a community.

title: Herdsmen vs Travellers, Osun
description: 1 traveller was shot dead while others were abducted by Fulani herdsmen who waylaid the travellers on a highway. Other travellers were injured in the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kaduna
description: 5 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits burnt 10 houses, two motorcycles and 50 bags of ginger in the attack. The victims were identified as Ishaya Aboi, Regina Ishaya, Goodluck Dauda, Joseph Adamu and Hassan Joseph.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits, who attacked a village, killed Likita. Details of the attack were not reported.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Communal Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: 2 people were killed during a communal clash between Ammamong and Okopedi communities over a boundary dispute. Houses and properties were also destroyed in the attack.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 5 people were killed by rampaging bandits who invade some communities. It was reported that the bandits, who came in their large number, caused panic among the villagers.

title: Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: Sani Na Indo, a cattle dealer, and his 2 sons were slaughtered by gunmen suspected to be bandits in a raid at their family residence.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Niger
description: Some gunmen attacked some villages and shot dead 5 people. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped some people during the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Kaduna
description: 4 people were killed by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandits who came in large numbers shot sporadically at everyone on sight.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 8 bandits were killed when a joint police-military patrol team raided their camps. Items recovered include one AK-47 rifle and burnt nine motorcycles belonging to the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandits who came in large numbers shot sporadically at everyone on sight.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 4 people were killed and 11 others, including 7 women, were kidnapped in an attack on different villages by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the villages.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Sokoto
description: Some rampaging bandits killed 1 person when they invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits also rustled some livestock during the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Sokoto
description: Some rampaging bandits killed 3 people when they invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits also rustled some livestock during the attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed and a dozen travelers, including a newly wedded bride and her friends, were abducted in separate attacks by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents killed the soldiers when they attacked a troop position.

title: School Abduction, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed while others injured when bandits invaded the Government Secondary School and kidnapped 279 students. Another version of the story said that 2 people were killed. The victims were released on March 03.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Ondo
description: A kidnapper was killed by some hunters and vigilantes who rescued some kidnap victims. It was reported that bandits kidnapped 7 of the victims as they were traveling before the rescue team came.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 22 people were shot dead when some bandits raided a goldmine. However, it was reported that the leader of the bandits was shot dead by villagers when the bandits attacked a village.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Niger
description: 5 people, including a graduate of the Federal College of Education, Kontagora, were killed by bandits that raided some communities. It was reported that 8 people were kidnapped by the bandits.

title: Hoodlums vs Police, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: An Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) and a Corporal attached to a police station were killed by hoodlums who attacked a police station. It was reported that the hoodlums, numbering about 50, attacked the station and set it ablaze. It was reported that the police killed four of the hoodlums and arrested 8 of them.
sources_of_information: Independent (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (6 ) , This Day (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Niger
description: A policeman was shot dead while three other policemen were injured by bandits who shot the victims from a treetop. It was reported that bandits have been terrorizing residents of the community.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 8 people were killed by rampaging bandits who attacked some communities. Several houses were destroyed in the attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 10 people were killed by bandits who have been terrorizing some communities. One of the victims was identified as Yakubu Abdullahi, a farmer. The bandits also rustled some cows.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists when they attacked some communities. It was reported that the terrorists launched an attack near a university.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , The Punch (13 ) , Other newpapers 1 (16 ) , Vanguard (16 ) , Daily Trust (16 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several persons lost their lives when troops of the Nigerian Army clash with Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops tried to reclaim a village taken over by the terrorists.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 15 people got drowned while trying to escape from armed bandits who launched an attack on a community. It was reported that the bandit stormed the community shooting sporadically.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was shot dead while several others were injured by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community in their numbers and carted away valuables, including money and food items.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Sale Musa and his son, Amiru Sale Musa were killed by armed bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits attacked the village in the night, killed the victims, and kidnapped 9 people.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 Internally Displaced Persons were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. They were killed when they went to fetch firewood in the bush.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Rampaging bandits killed three people when they attacked some communities. It was reported that the incident led to the lynching of one of the accomplices nicknamed 'Doctor'. Some of the victims were identified as Ubanginda Dogo and Bulus Gwamma.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , This Day (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Delta
description: unknown gunmen shot dead 2 persons in the Sedeco area. Details of the incident were not reported.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed two people whom they kidnapped for ransom. It was reported that the bandits who have to terrorize some communities also set some of their captives free.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed seven people when they attacked a community. It was reported that the victim were farmers that were returning from their farms.
place: Ugboke, Oshodi, Okokodo, Ariyan and Yoruba Camp
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Police Kill Bandit, Katsina
description: A bandit was killed in a shootout with security agents. 2 AK47 rifles were recovered from the bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Many were killed by bandits who attacked some communities. It was reported that the bandits attacked the communities unchallenged for hours. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: In an ensuing firefight, between Military troops, several bandits were neutralized, and others escaped with bullet wounds when the troops laid ambush and intercepted the bandits, who abducted 4 people. It is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: School Abduction, Niger
description: Benjamin Doma, a student of Government Science College Kagara was killed while 27 students and 15 workers of the school were kidnapped by gunmen suspected to be bandits.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandits Kill 10, Niger
description: 10 people were killed and 24 others were kidnapped in a broad daylight attack by bandits. It was reported that 5 of the victims were men of the local vigilante group while others were young boys who were supporting the vigilante during the raid by the bandits. It was reported that a village head was also killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 4 policemen and 7 villagers were killed by members of the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) when they were fleeing from the Sambisa forest following recent onslaughts by the armed forces in the area.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some armed bandits barricaded a road and killed one Ibrahim Abdulmumin, a resident in a village. It was reported that son of the village head, Sahabi Shafiu, was injured in the attack.

description: Some bandits attacked a village and killed a resident. The victim was identified as Elder Dikko Bagudu. Bandits have been terrorising the vilalge.

title: Assailants Kill Herders, Anambra
description: 14 Fulani herdsmen were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked them and killed some of their cows. The attack also led to the missing of some of the cows. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the it happened in the state capital.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of 21 and 26 Brigades of the Nigerian Army, supported by the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF), killed 81 Boko Haram fighters in the Sambisa axis and lost 1 soldier to a landmine attack.
place: Garin Bello, Kwoche, Lawanti, Alfa Bula Hassan and Alfa Cross among others.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were decimated when troops of the NAF engaged them in a fierce gun battle. It was reported that the incident happened when bandits tried to ambush the operatives but were overpowered.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: 3 farmers were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the herders have been terrorising the community.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed three passengers. The incident happened when the passengers were waylaid by the bandits why they were travelling on a highway.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Ogun
description: Some Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities in the early hours of the day, killed three people, and injured 8 others. They attacked the communities with guns and machete.
place: Orile-Igbooro community. Korole village and part of Oja-Odan town
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Ondo
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed three farmers working on their farms. Recently, the Ondo State Governor evicted armed Fulani herdsmen from forest reserves in the state. That has done little in stopping the attacks on farmers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Some bandits, who attacked a village in the early hours of the day, killed a farmer and his son. They invaded the village with the intention of kidnapping the victims but ended up killing them.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: A small boy identified as Marvis Idodo was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders attacked the boy and his parents while they were working on their farm.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Ogun
description: Some Fulani herdsmen ambushed some villagers and killed Isiaka Apesin and Oguntosin Adebayo. It was not the first time the village has come under herdsmen attack.

title: Bandits vs Army, Kaduna
description: 2 soldiers were killed when some bandits attacked a military outpost in a village. It was reported that one soldier and a civilian sustained injuries in the attack.

title: Bandits vs Police, Taraba
description: Gunmen killed a policeman when they attacked a mobile police checkpoint. It was reported that the gunmen who rode on motorcycles opened fire on the policemen manning the checkpoint, killing one of the cop, while four passersby sustained injuries.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some armed bandits invaded a village and killed one person. It was reported that the bandits shot the victim to death.

title: Bandits vs NAF, Kaduna
description: Nigerian Air Force (NAF) jets neutralized several bandits in their hideouts in the forests. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.
place: Rahama, Tami, Sabon Birni, Galadimawa and Ungwan Farinbatu

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 121 and 151 Battalions of the Nigerian Army, Operation Tura Takaibano (OTT) killed two Boko Haram commanders during a clearance operation. The commanders were identified as Abul-Bas and Ibn Habib. They were killed while crossing a settlement.

title: Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 3 soldiers were killed while 2 others sustained injuries when Boko Haram terrorists attacked troops providing security for road construction. The military debunked the rumour that 20 soldiers were killed in the encounter.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Katsina
description: Bandits killed the leader of a vigilante group when they attacked a community. They also kidnapped one Mr. Alex, a staff of First Bank, and two daughters of one Hassan Fari.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Some gunmen killed someone at the border between two villages.
place: between Sarking Baka and Dankyawai villages near Gidan Kurmi

title: Bandits Kill 10, Kaduna
description: 10 people were killed by bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the hoodlums also injured three people in the attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 7 people lost their lives when some bandits attacked some communities. It was reported that one of the victims was a bandit who was killed by a community as a reprisal.

description: 5 people were killed by gunmen. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community from a neighbouring community.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kaduna
description: 5 people were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the hoodlum injured many people with gunshot and also destroyed several houses.

description: 1 person was killed by bandits while 2 others including a mobile policeman were injured. The bandits stormed the community in an attempt to kidnap residents.

description: 5 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened some bandits attacked a village but were repelled by the troops who ambushed them.

description: 13 people were killed and many others were injured when bandits a community. The attack came after the bandits forcefully collected a number of bulls from children who were using them to convey sand in carts in the outskirts of the town.

description: Alhaji Maikudu Husaini and his brother, Nafiu Husaini, were killed during an attack by bandits. His village was attacked by bandits but residents beat back the attack and in the process, the siblings were killed.

description: 30 bandits were neutralised and several others injured by the troops of the Operation Hadarin Daji of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at decimating the bandtis.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents, assuming at least 24, were killed in aerial bombardments on their hideouts. The hideouts were also destroyed. This event is backdated by 2 days since no day was reported.

description: 3 bandits were shot dead by the police during a shootout. 2 AK47 rifles were recovered from the bandits.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ondo
description: Mr. Adejuyigbe Daniel, an OPC member, was killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen while trying to rescue an abducted farmer, Mr. Solomon Akinmeji. Daniel fell out of his search group by moving afar to locate the missing farm owner before he was reportedly abducted and shot dead by the herders

title: Herdsmen Attack, Osun
description: Fulani herdsmen shot dead a policeman and kidnapped 3 Chinese expatriates. It was reported that the herdsmen have been terrorising the area.

description: 2 people were killed by bandits who terrorized a community. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped many people during the attack.

description: The Air Component of Operation Thunder Strike killed 2 bandits as they tried to escape the notice of the fighter jet crew.

description: 2 men, Mr. Raphael Bawa and Mabo Aga, were killed in an ambush by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herders. They were returning from a neighbouring community when they were shot.

description: Gunmen identified as bandits killed 7 people when they attacked some communities. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the communities in the early hours of the day.

description: A leadership crisis between ISWAP factions led to the murder of dozens of insurgents. The factions were in contention over who will replace the former Governor of Lake Chad who was killed in a military strike. It is assumed that not less than 2 dozens (24) insurgents died in the power tussle.

description: Nigerian troops with the support of MNJTF eliminated Alai Bor, and 6 other terrorists in his entourage. They were trying to cross a highway when they were ambushed.

description: Omolayo Olajide, a police inspector attached to the Ogun State Police Command, lost his life during a gun duel between bandits and policemen during banditsâ€™ attack on some Fulani herdsmen.

description: About 100 bandits killed 7 people and rustled over 1,000 cows. Security operatives did nothing to prevent the deadly attacks despite the fact that the residents had passed on necessary information to the attack

title: Gunmen Kill 5, Niger
description: 5 people were killed while 10 others sustained injuries when bandits invaded some villages. It was reported that the bandits stormed the villages on about 50 motorcycles.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (5 ) , The Nation (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Unidentified gunmen killed a commercial driver identified as Abubakar popularly called Baba Aku. The incident happened in the evening when the victim was conveying passengers on the road.

title: Bandits vs Pregnant Woman, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits killed an eight-month pregnant health worker along a highway. It was reported that the victim was killed while she was traveling on the highway.

title: Gunmen Attack, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen killed an army officer and a policeman in a military checkpoint. It was reported that the attackers came with a speed boat through a river and shot the uniformed men at the checkpoint.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Military fighter jets neutralized scores of bandits on motorcycles in a forest around a community. Not less than 2 scores died in the encounter.

title: Bandits Kills 4, Kaduna
description: 4 people were killed by bandits. The incident happened when the bandits, wielding sophisticated weapons, attacked a community.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by armed bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits also injured 8 others. The victims were identified as Kabiru Lado and Alhaji Yahuza Jinaidu.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 24 people were butchered by bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded some villages, killed the victims and burnt about 20 houses. They also kidnapped about 19 people.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Imo
description: A clash between the Nigerian Army and the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) security outfit led to the death of 1 person. Many ]people were injured.

title: Communal Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: 5 people were killed, 4 others abducted and motorcycles were carted away in a renewed boundary dispute between Usaka Uko in Ikwuano Local Government Area of Abia and Nkari in Ini Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State.

title: Auto Crash, Ondo
description: 10 people, including students of the Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba, Akoko (AAUA), were crushed to death by a cement-laden truck. It was reported that the truck, belonging to Dangote Cement Company, rammed into shops at the university community, killing the victims. Some of the students were identified as Samuel Adesomoju, Oluwaseun Ojinni and Pope Kelvin,
sources_of_information: This Day (10 ) , Independent (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , The Nation (12 )

title: Youths vs Fulani Herdsmen, Oyo
description: A woman and two children were killed when youths, led by Sunday Igboho, attacked a Fulani community. The attack came after the 7-day ultimatum given to the herders elapsed. The herders were asked to leave the community due to the various crimes they were perpetrating.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 )

title: Communal Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: The death toll in the communal crisis between Uko-Nteghe Uda and Uko Akpan Enwang communities keep increasing as 1 person was beheaded and 2 others killed.
place: Uko-nteghe Uda and Uko Akpan Enwang communities

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram and Islamic Province (ISWAP) terrorists were killed by a team of operation Lafiya Dole in an ambush. 5 of their gun tuck destroyed and some women and children rescued

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: A man identified as Ibrahim Salisu was killed by bandits. It was reported that the man was killed after an attempt by the bandits to kidnap him failed.

title: Bandits vs Herder, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed a herder identified as Abdullahi Saleh. It was reported that the herder was killed by the bandits along the road.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one Dogara Yahaya, the ward head of Baranje village, and one Reuben Adamu. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a village.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 402 Special Operation Task Brigade of Operation Tura Takaibango (OTTB) killed 5 Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the troops also recovered arms and ammunition, including Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) manufacturing materials.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: Abdulaziz Aliyu, the son a lecturer with Abubakar Tafawa Balewa University (ATBU), Professor Aliyu Muhammad, was shot dead by some gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the gunmen invaded the home of the professor and abducted him.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits shot dead a man when they attacked a village. It was reported that the man, a resident of the village, was known as Lawali Abdulhameed.

title: Bandits Kill 8, Zamfara
description: 8 people were killed when bandits raided 2 communities. Houses and properties were also burnt by the attackers who numbered about 100. The attackers had planned to abduct community members but met resistance from the people. In annoyance, they opened fire on people and killed the victims.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Kaduna
description: 2 people were shot dead by bandits. It was reported that the victims identified as local vigilantes were killed during an encounter with bandits. Their names were given as Malam Auwalu and Alassan Shehu.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops overpowered bandits who attacked a community in reprisal for an attack on a Fulani settlement and killed 5 of them.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Zamfara
description: 10 residents were killed during a raid by bandits. 5 of the bandits were killed by vigilantes. Several residents were injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , The Nation (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed in an ambush by soldiers. They were tracked to a route following credible information that they were planning to launch an attack on people. Few of the bandits were alleged to have escaped with gunshot injuries.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops on anti-banditry operations Killed 30 armed bandits and recovered 24 cows and an unspecified number of sheep.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Kaduna
description: Samaila Yohana, Alhaji Sani, and Malam Rabiu were killed during attacks on 2 communities. Other residents were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: A woman was killed when bandits ambushed and fired gunshots on travelers. 3 people were injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: An 80-year-old woman, Hauwwa Umaru, was killed during a raid by bandits. She was hit by a stray bullet when the bandits were shooting sporadically and setting houses ablaze.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Herdmens vs Registrar, Ondo
description: Dr. Amos Arijesuyo, the deputy registrar of the Federal University of Technology, Akure, was shot dead by gunmen identified as Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the gunmen attacked the victim alongside his driver and one other person while they were plying a highway.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army and the Air Force. The incident happened when some Boko Haram fighters attempted to attack troops' location.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: a member of the Benue State Livestock Guards was killed in an ambush by bandits susp[ected to be Fulani herdsmen. The victim and his colleagues were on routine patrol when they came under attack. A member of Agro Rangers was injured.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Kaduna
description: 4 riot policemen were shot dead by bandits numbering about 100 who attacked policemen on a highway. It was reported that the policemen were returning to their base when the bandits ambushed them.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Bandits Kill Catholic Priest, Niger
description: A Catholic priest, Rev. Father John Gbakaan Yaji, was kidnapped and murdered by gunmen suspected to be armed bandits in the state. His corpse was found a day after his abduction on his way from a religious meeting.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Nasarawa
description: 9 soldiers were shot dead by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened when the soldiers went to rescue those the terrorists held hostage in a forest. The soldiers were identified as Felix Kura, Iliya Kefas, Bati Yakubu and other young officers.

title: Military vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Bandits were sighted with herds of cows and bombarded by military jets. Some of them (assuming not less than 10) were killed in the strike.
