title: Military vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were killed during airstrikes on their base inside a forest. It is assumed that not less than 2 scores were killed in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 soldiers, including an officer, were killed while 15 others were injured when they ran into landmines planted by Boko Haram insurgents during an operation in a village.

title: Communal Crisis, Delta
description: A protracted land dispute between warring communities of Igide and Emede led to the death of several people. 4 houses set ablaze and many people were wounded. It is assumed that 10 people died in the clash.

title: Bandits vs Hunters, Kaduna
description: 1 hunter was shot dead in a forest by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the hunters clashed with some bandits who were in a forest. Another hunter was injured in the clash.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A man, Malum Umara, lost his son when some Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village. The terrorists shot at the man's house, killing his son, Asheik while he, his wife and daughter, Fatima, sustained injuries.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: Two villagers were shot by bandits who attacked their village. The victims were identified as Aliyu Daiyahu and Safiyanu Muhammad. Bandits have been terrorizing the village.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that two other people sustained gunshot wounds in the attack. The gunmen ambushed the victims while they were returning from market.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit was killed and 2 others were arrested by policemen. 8 kidnapped suspects were also rescued during the raid. Also, see the event in IBD019943.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were decimated by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole. It is believed no less than 40 terrorists died in the encounter.

title: Bandits Kill, Plateau
description: More than 18 people were killed and many injured in a fresh attack between Irigwe ethnic group and Fulani group. The Fulani group were accused of been responsible for the attack, in which 6 people were injured and over 20 houses razed down, vehicles, motorcycles and harvested food crops destroyed.
place: Ancha village of Miango District in Irigwe Chiefdom/ Ncha
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , The Nation (17 ) , The Punch (18 ) , The Guardian (21 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 10 bandits and a soldier were killed during a gun battle between troops of Operation Sahel Sanity and the bandits. 2 other soldiers suffered minor injuries during the operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army engaged in a gun fight with some Boko Haram terrorists, killing 6 of the insurgents. The troops also destroyed a gun truck and several weapons belonging to the terrorists.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army under the Operation Tura Takai Bango killed 30 Boko Haram fighters. The incident happened when the troops encountered the terrorists in a village.
place: Gonan Kaji village along the Damaturu-Buni Yadi Road

title: Villagers vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: Some villagers killed a bandit after apprehending 2 of them. The bandits have been terrorizing the villagers.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 5 bandits were neutralized by fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the incident happened when the fighter jets were on clearance operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 28 Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when troops of Operation Tura Takaibango engaged in a clearance operation.
sources_of_information: The Punch (28 ) , The Nation (28 ) , This Day (28 ) , Independent (28 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 50 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops of Operation Hadarin Daji engaged in a clearance operation. 4 soldiers were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (50 ) , The Guardian (50 ) , Daily Trust (50 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people who were attempting to escape from bandits were shot dead by the bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits attempted to kidnap Alhaji Yunusa Gambo and one Mallam Surajo but ended up killing the duo as they tried to escape.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Amotekun vs Herdsmen, Oyo
description: Men of the Oyo State Security Network Agency popularly known as Amotekun killed seven suspected Fulani herdsmen who doubled as kidnappers. It was reported that the victims resided in the forest before the security outfit stormed the area in the bid to dislodge them.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Guardian (7 )

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Many people were killed when bandits, who rode on motorbikes, shot sporadically and warned residents to remain inside. Some of the victims were killed when they tried to escape the onsluaght.

title: Bandits vs Police, Niger
description: A policeman was killed and one resident got wounded when armed bandits attacked a community. It was reported that the incident left many villagers in tension.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: The troops of the Nigerian Army killed one armed bandit and rescued three abducted people during an operation conducted by Operation Whirl Stroke.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 residents were killed and another one injured when Boko Haram raided a community. They also stole livestock (chicken, goats, and rams) as well as clothes, bicycles and food items.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed some people when they attacked a community. It was reported that the incident happened when military operatives engaged the terrorists, who attacked a community, in a gun duel. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed some commuters along a major highway. It was reported that the terrorists also snatched 11 vehicles from drivers and took them to the bush. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 people died from the attack.
place: Aligambori nbear Gajiram along Maiduguri-Monguno Road

title: Bandits/Kidnappers Kill 4, Kaduna
description: Bulus Barde, Hassan Zarmai, Lawal Pada and Kefas Auta were killed by bandits. One of them was a vigilante. Scores of residents were also abducted by the attackers but were lucky to have been rescued by soldiers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 6 soldiers and a master warrant officer during an attack on a military. They burnt down about 40 houses, looted the community, and carted away 3 vehicles.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole destroyed 2 Boko Haram Terrorists’ (BHTs’) gun trucks and eliminated some of their fighters. It is assumed that 20 Boko Haram fighters were killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 9 people including three infants. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped eleven people and injured six others in the attack.

title: Cult Killing, Delta
description: A 42-year-old hairstylist, Adams Eguvwese was murdered by unknown gunmen suspected to be cultists. He was killed inside his barbing salon by masked men.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Military airstrikes on Boko Haram settlements eliminated scores of insurgents. The settlement was believed to harbour logistics and other logistic items. It is believed that not less than 40 insurgents died in the raid.

title: Gunmen Kill Chief Imam, Kaduna
description: Danleeman Isah, a Chief Imam, was killed during a raid on a community by gunmen. The Cleric's murder was connected to his vocal stand against banditry and other killings in the state.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were killed in military airstrikes on Boko haram bases in 2 communities. Their structures and logistic stores were destroyed in the strikes. It is believed that at least 2 scores (40) of insurgents died in the encounters.
sources_of_information: Independent (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , This Day (40 ) , The Nation (40 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 18 people lost their lives during an attack and counter attacks by some bandits. It was reported that 3 relatives of a warlord called Filani were killed and he rallied his fellow bandits to invade a village, killing 15 people.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , Vanguard (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (19 ) , This Day (18 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A bandit was killed in an ambush by soldiers while on routine patrol. 2 women and a child were rescued during the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Several bandits 9assuming not less than 20) were killed by soldiers during a raid on some locations by the NAF. Some rustled cattle were killed in the offensive.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 6 people lost their lives when some bandits attacked a village. The victims were killed while they were returning from their farms It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped some ladies in the attack.
sources_of_information: This Day (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 9 bandits were killed by troops in a gun battle while attempting to cross over to another location with a large herd of rustled cattle. They were killed in an ambush by the soldiers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Vanguard (9 ) , The Guardian (9 )

title: Boko Haram Executes 5, Adamawa
description: 5 people believed to be Christian captives were executed by Boko Haram fighters loyal to the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). A 49-second video showed the execution of the victims who were abducted from Garkida in Adamawa State. It is assumed they were also killed in Adamawa.

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 7 hunters were killed in a Boko Haram landline attack while 19 others were injured. The victims were in pursuit of escaping insurgents when their vehicles ran through the landmine.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , Vanguard (7 ) , The Guardian (7 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 6 bandits were killed by security operatives. The incident happened when the operatives engaged the bandits in a gun duel. The bandits have been terrorizing residents of the area.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Daily Trust (8 )

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 4 soldiers were killed when their vehicle ran through a landmine allegedly planted by Boko Haram.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army engaged bandits on a highway in a gunfight and killed 9 of the bandits in the process. Bandits have been terrorizing motorists on the highway.

title: Traders vs Bandit, Katsina
description: A Fulani herdsman who was suspected to be a bandit was lynched by traders when he brought his cow to sell in a market. His colleague was rescued by the police. AK 47 riffles were found on them, raising suspicion that they were bandits.

title: Bandits vs Village Head, Niger
description: Some bandits killed the village head of Madaka identified as Zakari Ya'u Idris. It was reported that the victim was abducted by the gunmen who killed him a week later before the family could pay a ransom.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during air offensives targeted at the den of the terrorists. The airstrikes also destroyed the terrorists' den.

title: Gunmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 people were shot dead by unknown gunmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the police arrested 2 of the gunmen at the scene of the crime.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A notorious bandit, Nasiru Kachalla, and many of his lieutenants were killed as bandits battled one another over rustled cattle in a forest. The incident happened when rival bandits battled each other. Kachalla was responsible for the murder of a seminarian identified as Michael Nnadi as captured in IBD018442.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Bandits Kill Vigilante, Katsina
description: The leader of a vigilante group,Ummaru Balli, was killed by gunmen believed to be bandits. 8 people were also abducted.

title: Bandits Kill 7, Niger
description: 7 people were killed during an attack on a community by bandits. They thought they had escaped from the attackers only to be trailed to their hiding place and shot dead. Houses were burnt down.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 hunters and a civilian were killed in a coordinated attack on some communities by Boko Haram insurgents. The attackers looted the communities.
place: Tashan Alade, Shafa, Azare Sabon Kasuwa and Sebro

title: Bandits vs Police, Jigawa
description: 2 senior police offers were killed by gunmen identified as bandits. The incident happened during a failed raid of kidnappers' den by some policemen. 1 other policeman was injured in the attack.

title: Mob Lynches Bandits, Kaduna
description: A businessman was attacked and robbed of his money and other valuables by 2 bandits. The attackers were later apprehended and lynched by an angry mob.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 person was murdered while 6 others were injured by Boko Haram terrorists. The incident happened when the terrorists attacked a community.

title: Bandit Attack, Kaduna
description: Bandits blocked a busy road and shot at commuters. The bullets hit one Richard Sabo who in the course of driving knocked down one of the bandits to death. Richard later died from the gunshot injuries.

title: PDP Leader, Niger
description: The Ward leader of the PDP, Ahmodu Mohammed was killed in his residence by bandits. The incident was the 2 attempt to take his life. His 3 daughters were abducted by the attackers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Mob Lynches Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits who specialized in stealing livestock were killed through mob action. They were chased to a community where they were mobbed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The incident happened when the terrorists invaded a village on Christmas eve. It was reported that the insurgents also burnt down houses in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 people were killed and their houses razed by Boko Haram fighters. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists attacked a community on the eve of Christmas.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 )

title: Bandits Kill Motorcyclist, Kaduna
description: Hudu Yahaya, a commercial motorcyclist was attacked and beheaded by bandits who also escaped with his motorcycle.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: A vigilante leader and 3 others were killed in a village market attack by bandits. The attackers shot sporadically at motorcyclists.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 5 traders and 2 vigilantes were killed when bandits opened fire on traders at a market. The attackers also set ablaze cars and bags of maize during the attack. Several bandits (assuming at least 20) were killed by security operatives

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Kwara
description: 7 personnel of the Nigerian Army and an officer of the State Security Service (SSS) lost their lives during a military operation aimed at clearing out bandits who have been terrorizing some parts of the country.

title: Bandits Kill 7, Kaduna
description: Bandits raided a community and killed Samson Hassan, Nuhu Hassan, Ali Hassan, Tsoho Wasa, Gabriel Ahmadu, Dogara Sarki, and Shekwolo Yohanna. 4 people were injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , The Nation (7 ) , Vanguard (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Bandits, Benue
description: An armed bandit, who was linked to the killing of a Makurdi based lawyer and his wife, was killed by troops of Operation Whirl Stroke. This event is linked to IBD019635.

title: Banditry, Kano
description: Some bandits killed a member of a vigilance group and abducted a nursing mother. The bandits have been terrorizing the community and killed the victim close to their hideout.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate a town.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: A woman was shot dead and about 30 commuters were abducted by Boko Haram. The attackers laid ambush on commercial vehicles and attacked their victims.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide operation killed 3 people and injured 7 others. The attacker who was reported to be a male died in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists were neutralized by troops of Army Super Camp 11 and 401 Special Forces Brigade of Operation Fire Ball. Gun trucks and Anti-Aircraft guns were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Fulani Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Some gunmen identified as Fulani herdsmen attacked a community, killing 7 people. The victims were identified as Peter Akaho (70 years), Ayuba Steven Sheyin (67 years), Jummai Ayuba (55 years), Ishaya Joel (35 years), Yakubu Saviour (14 years), Ayuba Goodluck (11 years), and Patience Ayuba (6 years). 5 people were missing after the attack. The victims were believed to be locals (the Atyap).
sources_of_information: Vanguard (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: Boko Haram Ambush, Borno
description: 5 soldiers were killed by Islamic State West Africa Province, ISWAP, in an ambush on a military convoy. The insurgents seized 2 vehicles in the attack.

title: Miners, Osun
description: A Chinese Kuang Zhang, and Abdulhadi Musa, died in the crisis that broke out at a mining site. The foreigners arrived at the site and ordered local mines to vacate, claiming that the site had been licensed to them by the Federal and state governments, but the workers refused to leave, claiming they owned it. Other people sustained injuries during the clash.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The remains of several people killed by bandits were found in the den of the bandits. In addition, 2 men who could not afford to link the bandits with their relations so that they can pay ransom were shot dead.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits (assuming 40) were killed by soldiers during an anti-bandits operation. 7 others were arrested while arms and ammunition were recovered.
place: Magizawa, Kani, Zango Tabanni and Nasamu

title: Bandits Attack, Delta
description: A 59-year-old woman, Mrs Loretta Gwam, and her son, Pastor Alfred Gwam were killed by hoodlums while having morning devotion inside their home. Also, a 10-year-old boy, Chimeremezie Izu was abducted.
place: No. 5 Kelvin Street, Core Area 4, GRA, Asaba
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke killed three bandits and apprehended 4 others during raids on the hideouts of the bandits.The army engaged the bandits in gun duel before overcoming them.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 soldier and 20 terrorists were killed during a gunfight between troops of the Nigerian Army and Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorist tried to invade a community. Another version of the story stated that 4 other people were killed in the attack by the terrorists.
sources_of_information: This Day (21 ) , The Nation (21 ) , The Punch (25 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 5 Boko Haram terrorists during clearance operation aimed at destroying terrorists. It was reported that the troops carried out the attack when they ambushed the terrorists.

title: Gunmen vs Ex-Rep Candidate, Oyo
description: Dr. Fatai Aborode, a former House of Representative candidate on the platform of Accord party in the 2015 general elections, was shot dead by some gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen identified as Fulani herdsmen killed the victim near his farm.

title: Bandits Kill 7, Niger
description: Bandits attacked a community and killed 7 children and a pastor. Not less than 20 people were kidnapped and many others were injured. This
place: Manta, Gurmana, Alawa, Erena, Garkogo, Chukuba/Kwaki and Kurebe/Kusaka

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Gunmen identified as Fulani herders killed four people in a community while 7 others were severely injured. It was reported that the attack happened in the night. The victims were identified as Timothy Emberga Akwa, his two sons, Innocent, Terhemba and an in-law identified as Orban.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 4 Boko Haram terrorists during clearance operation aimed at destroying terrorists. It was reported that the troops recovered two bicycles, wheel barrows, bags of fish and grains from the terrorists.

title: Bandits vs Pastor, Niger
description: Jeremiah Ibrahim, the pastor with Evangelical Church Winning All, ECWA, was killed by gunmen. The victim was killed when he went to check his farm and decided to visit another pastor but was killed.

title: Communal Crisis, Delta
description: 2 people were killed and several houses set ablaze over a protracted land dispute between neighbouring communities. A version of the story stated that 7 people were killed.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: 2 notorious bandits were killed, and 20 locally made rifles, 40 empty cases of 7.62 mm special ammunition, and 5 rounds of 7.62 mm special ammunition were recovered. Their logistics destroyed by troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 soldiers were killed and a soldier was abducted by insurgents suspected to be members of the Islamic State in West African Province (ISWAP).

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) killed three bandits during a gun duel. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits besieged a community and were robbing residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were killed during air strikes conducted by the Air Component of Operation Thunder Strike. It was reported that the troops also destroyed the bandits' camp in a forest.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An insurgent was killed by troops of 222 and 144 battalions of Operation Fire Ball of the Nigerian Army during the combing of Sambisa forest.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 insurgents were killed by troops of 222 and 144 battalions of Operation Fire Ball of the Nigerian Army during the combing of Sambisa forest.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by the police while several others were arrested. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits were preparing to carry out an attack.

title: Lecturer, Bayelsa
description: Domestic Violence: Enebraye Zuokemefa, a lecturer at the Isaac Jasper Boro College of Education, was killed by gunmen at a point-of-sale (POS) centre. His death is linked to domestic violence as his wife, Eniye Zuokemefa, earlier threatened to kill him over suspicion that he had a child out of wedlock.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Bandits looking for Ubankasan Gurau but he was not around, they met his father and killed him.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people were killed by bandits who also abducted scores of residents. The victims were government volunteers who work in the community and were identified as Sunday Bawa and Samuel Luja.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Operatives of the Nigeria Police Force killed 2 bandits during a crossfire with some armed bandits. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits were preparing to carry out operation.

title: 3 Killed by Kidnappers, Katsina
description: Gunmen believed to be cattle rustlers killed 3 people, shot another, and kidnapped about 15 persons. The injured person was rushed to the hospital for medical attention. Cattle were also rustled.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Katsina
description: 7 farmers, including a nursing mother, were killed by bandits who attacked three communities. It was reported that the bandits also abducted about 30 villagers.
place: Tashar Bama, Dogun Muazu and Unguwar Maigayya villages
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Goni Maina, the former Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) governor of Lake Chad was killed during air raids by the Nigerian Army and the Air Force. He was having meeting when he was killed.
place: Sabon Tumbu around the Lake Chad region

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a bandit when some of the bandits kidnapped some people and rustle about 69 cattle. It was reported that the army rescued the kidnapped victims as well as the rustled cattle.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Bandits Behead Farmer, Kogi
description: Suleiman Abdulkareem, a security guard with Upper Area Court, was beheaded on his farm.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 13 loggers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists when they went to fetch firewood for an internally displaced persons camp. The terrorists ambushed the loggers before killing them.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 5 bandits and recovered 4 AK-47 rifles and three dane guns from them. It was reported that the troops captured 8 bandits during the operation.

title: Robbers vs Bus Driver, Delta
description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits killed an unidentified commercial bus driver and kidnapped all passengers on board.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: About 50 farmers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who waylaid the farmers while they were working on their rice farm. Several of the farmers sustained serious injuries. A foreign media reported that 10 women were still missing after the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (110 ) , The Guardian (53 ) , Daily Trust (110 ) , This Day (43 ) , The Nation (78 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in different clearance operations in the state. Various weapons and foodstuffs were recovered from the terrorists.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several fighters from the Islamic State West Africa Province were killed in an airstrike by the NAF. Their structures and hideouts were also destroyed. It is assumed that not less than 10 terrorists were killed in the encounter.
place: Ngwuri Gana, along the Gulumba Gana-Kumshe axis and Tumbuma Baba on the fringes of Lake Chad
sources_of_information: PM News (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 villagers were killed by bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the bandits shot indiscriminately at villagers during the attack. Many villagers fled their homes.
place: Magami, Tungar Haya and Sabon Sara villages

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed 15 bandits during a clearance operation aimed at eliminating criminal elements. The bandits were killed in their hideout by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed 67 bandits during a clearance operation aimed at eliminating criminal elements. The bandits were killed in their hideout by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits attacked 2 communities, killed 5 people and rustled some animals. It was reported that the attack was the first of such invasion by the bandits in the communities.
place: Gidan Nayawa and Ungwar Malam Bala in Maidabino

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit was shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the bandits invaded a village and the army was called in to restore order.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many fighters of Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) were killed in airstrikes conducted by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole. The terrorists' logistics base was also destroyed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Assassins vs APC Chairman, Nasarawa
description: Unknown gunmen shot their way into the house of the All Progressive Congress, Philip Shekwo, abducted him and later killed him. Due to the nature of the killing, it is assumed that it has political undertone. Mohammed Usman, a notorious bandit and kidnapper was arrested in connection to the killing.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 soldiers, 2 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF) and some others were killed in an ambush coordinated by Boko Haram insurgents. It is assumed that 10 people, including terrorists, died in the incident.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 9 bandits. It was reported that two AK-47 rifles were recovered from the bandits. The incident happened during a clearance operation in several villages.
place: Galadi, Sabon Tunga, Tamuske and Gobirawa villages.

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: A convoy of truckloads of food heading to Baga to distribute relief materials to IDPs ran through a landmine laid by Boko Haram. The explosion was followed by gunshots. 7 soldiers on escort duty died in the encounter.

title: Soldiers kill, Benue
description: Operation Whirl Stroke of the Nigeria Army eliminated 3 bandits in an operation conducted following credible intelligence on the hideout of some notorious elements who were alleged to be terrorising the area.

title: Bandits vs Council Chair, Katsina
description: Alhaji Lawal Dako, the Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Sabuwa LGA died from the injuries he sustained when bandits swooped on him and shot him 5 times.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 members of the Kaduna State Vigilance Service (KADVIS) were shot dead by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits ambushed the personnel on their way to another community.

title: Bandits vs Policeman, Niger
description: A policeman was killed when bandits invaded a community. 13 people were kidnapped in the process. The officers were ambushed by the bandits while on routine patrol.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 17 armed bandits were killed in an air offensive conducted by the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji. The troops destroyed the camp of the bandits.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The Land and Air Components of Operation Thunder Strike killed scores of bandits in a joint offensive operation along an expressway. The operation was aimed at clearing off bandits in the area.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 23 terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Fire Ball and also captured 1 Improvised Explosive Device (IED) specialist. It is assumed the incident happened on the 15th of November since no date was reported.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of Operation Accord of the Nigerian Army killed three bandits while others escaped during a night patrol in a village. .

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 people were shot dead by bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the bandits, who have been terrorizing the villages, also abducted some villagers.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 people were shot dead by gunmen who invaded some villages. The gunmen also abducted some villagers during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were neutralized by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole during air raids. It was reported that the Air Task Force engaged in multiple airstrikes on the locations of the terrorists.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army, while conducting routine night patrol, killed three armed bandits. It was reported that the bandits opened fire on the troops on sighting them but the troops overpowered them, killing three of them.

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: 4 bandits were killed in a joint operation between police and local vigilante. Also, 2 unregistered boxer motorcycles with bloodstains, AK 47 rifle, and live ammunition were recovered from the bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: A palace guard was killed by bandits who attacked and kidnapped a district head. It was reported that the bandits who came with several motorcycles also kidnapped the children of the district head.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army during a gun battle. A motorcycle, four magazines, and two cell phones were recovered from the bandits.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole. The incident happened when the Air Task Force destroyed the fuel storage facility belonging to the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP).

title: Bandits vs Commissioner, Zamfara
description: A driver in the convoy of the Zamfara State Commissioner of Security and Home Affairs, Abubakar Dauran, was shot dead by some bandits who attacked the commissioner.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were decimated by the Air Component of Operation Thunder Strike led by the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the airstrikes were launched to mitigate the menace of the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade located killed 5 marauding terrorists who attempted to infiltrate the town.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: Some armed bandits killed 4 people and injured several others when they stormed a village and started shooting at residents. It was reported that the incident happened in the night.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Armed bandits killed four people when they attacked two local markets in two villages. It was reported that the bandits rode on their motorcycles and wielded AK-47 rifles to the market when most of the traders were about rounding off the day's business.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force and local hunters were killed when they engaged Boko Haram insurgents in a shootout during a siege on their village. Some of the insurgents were allegedly killed. It is assumed that not less than 5 insurgents died.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of under Operation Sahel Sanity killed 5 bandits while one soldier lost his life during a shootout. The incident happened when the bandits, in their large number, invaded a village on several motorcycles and shot sporadically.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (6 ) , The Nation (4 ) , This Day (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: Troops sighted and neutralized the lone female suicide bomber before she could detonate her vest.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 residents were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during a raid on their community. The attack was carried out when people were observing their Juma'at service. Farmlands, houses, and markets were also burnt down.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Many people were killed during an attack on a community by bandits. Soldiers were drafted into the community and repelled the attack. it is believed that not less than 10 people died in the attack.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Zamfara
description: A man, Alhaji Haruna Koli, was killed by bandits and 10 others including the wife of the district head of the community were kidnapped.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Three Boko Haram terrorists were neutralized by troops of the Nigerian Army while they were attempting to launch an attack on a convoy of vehicles conveying Internally Displaced Persons.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Katsina
description: 4 people were killed during an attack on a community. Others were injured while houses were burnt down. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Over 50 armed bandits attacked a village, killing 1 person and kidnapping 3 others. It was reported that the bandits injured several people in the attack and also rustled over 45 cattle.

title: Army/Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A 30-year-old man, Rabe Bala, and 5 bandits were killed during a shootout with soldiers and policemen. The bandits were on a revenge mission in the community for the death of some of their members.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , This Day (5 )

title: Leadership Crisis, Osun
description: The tussle over a kingship stool claimed 6 lives. Properties were burnt down while many people were wounded. Different camps fought over the continued stay on the throne of Oba Olatunde Falabi who was removed by a court.

title: Bandits vs Customs Officer, Jigawa
description: Some bandits killed a Customs officer and critically injured another officer. The incident happened when the officers were conducting a routine patrol in a village.

title: IPOB/Hoodlums Kill 10, Rivers
description: EndSARS Protest: 10 Muslims were allegedly killed by IPOB members during the EndSARS protest which was later hijacked by hoodlums. One of the victims, the Seriki's son was burnt beyond recognition. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Police vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 6 Boko Haram fighters who had earlier attacked a community were killed by the police. The insurgents attempted to overrun a Police Command in the community before they were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 IDPs and 16 Boko Haram insurgents died in a foiled attack on a military base. Over 10 people were injured in the incident. A pregnant woman was among the civilians killed by the insurgents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Punch (28 ) , The Nation (22 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed by some gunmen who invaded a village. It was reported that the gunmen also kidnapped two other people. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village in a large number.

title: Soldiers Kill Man, Rivers
description: A commercial motorcyclist died after he was hit by a stray bullet fired by soldiers. Since the killing of 8 security operatives (see the event in IBD019182) during the EndSARS protest by suspected IPOB members, the LGA has been occupied by soldiers and the group's activities have been proscribed.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were killed during raids on their hideouts. Their camps were also destroyed in an operation that was conducted following information that they use the location to lunch attacks. It is assumed that not less than 2 scores were killed in the incident.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 8 farmers were killed when suspected Boko Haram attacked them while working on their farms. About 30 others were declared missing after series of attacks within a week. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed as they attacked an army location. Arms and ammunition were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 travellers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who waylaid them. Several others were abducted by the members of Boko Haram. The attack took place in the evening.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: Many people were killed during an attack by bandits. The attack was a reprisal for the killing of 3 bandits by the community vigilante. The victims were mostly children and elderly ones who could not run from the bandits. It is assumed not less than 64 people died in the clashes comprising of 17 residents and 44 bandits.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the air component of NAF. Their camps were destroyed in the raid. It is assumed that not less than 24 insurgents were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers after they were noticed to trail a convoy of vehicles conveying IDPs. A gun truck belonging to the terrorists was destroyed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: 2 armed bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army under the Operation Whirl Stroke. The incident happened when the troops engaged the bandits in hot pursuit during which the two victims were killed.

title: Protesters vs Policemen, Rivers
description: EndSARS: 3 policemen were killed by hoodlums who infiltrated the protesters over police brutality. Some officers were also declared missing while the Area Command was burnt down. Another version of the story stated that 5 soldiers and three policemen were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). Some members of the IPOB were also killed.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , The Nation (8 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 people were slaughtered by members of the Boko Haram sect in a village. It was reported that the villagers were jostled from sleep by the terrorists who entered the victim's houses, bungled the men one after the other before beheading them in the presence of their wives and children.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an air raid on their strongholds by NAF. It is assumed that not less than 10 insurgents were killed in the encounter.

title: Herdsmen vs Contractor, Niger
description: Some Fulani herdsmen who doubled as gunmen killed three people, including a businessman and CEO of Spool and Waterbodies Limited, Adeniyi Odunlami. It was reported that the herders kidnapped and killed the man, claiming that he blocked them from grazing their cattle in a reserve area.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 terrorists were killed by soldiers and AK47 rifles were recovered from them. The operation was conducted during a clearance operation.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed during airstrikes by the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the strikes were targeted at clearing the hideouts of the terrorists.

title: Son and Father Kidnap, Ekiti
description: 52-year-old, Idowu Daramola who was kidnapped alongside his, son Olorunsola Daramola was killed by his abductors believed to be Fulani herdsmen.

title: Gunmen vs Lecturer, FCT (Abuja)
description: Unknown gunmen killed a lecture with the Federal University of Birnin Kebbi after the assailant went on a shooting spree. The incident happened when the lecturer, Abdullahi Abubakara Dakingar, went to see his ailing father who was on admission in a hospital.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Scores of bandits were killed by the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji during a clearance operation by the Nigerian Army. The airstrikes destroyed the camp of the bandits.

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 14 Fulani bandits were killed by Yan Sakai, a banned vigilante group. It was reported that the bandits were terrorizing some communities before they were killed.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 6 members of a local vigilante were killed during an attack by bandits. They called for reinforcement during the attack but got none from the police. The neglect forced the vigilantes to carry their dead colleagues to Kagara Police Station.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: An Iman, his deputy, and 6 others were killed during a raid on 3 communities by bandits. 3 people were also injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , This Day (8 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits were killed during a shootout with soldiers on a clearance operation. Many victims were rescued during the operation.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 15 people were killed in fresh attacks on 2 communities by bandits. While 9 was killed in Kadia village, 6 people including a 7-year-old boy were killed in Kidandan community. The communities were alleged to have been burnt by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (12 ) , This Day (12 ) , The Nation (12 )

title: Herdsmen vs Couple, Ebonyi
description: The decomposing bodies of a couple identified as Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Onya Oko were found in farmland. It was reported that the victims were murdered by the marauding Fulani herdsmen.

title: Bandits vs Troops, Plateau
description: The leader of an armed bandit group was killed by Operation Safe Haven (OPSH) in a raid in which many members of the group were equally neutralized. It is assumed not less than 11bandits died in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed during a clearance operation by troops of Operation Thunder Strike. The victims were ambushed along their major route.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed during air raids on their camps by the Air Component of Operation Thunder Strike. The attack aircraft took turns in strafing the target areas as well as damage to their dwellings.
place: Kuyambana, Fadaman kanauta and Jan-Birni forests

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: A traditional ruler, Da Chung Gyang Mwadkwon, and 5 other persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the attack took place at night.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , The Guardian (6 ) , This Day (6 )

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Katsina
description: 9 villagers were killed by some bandits who invaded their village on motorcycles and retreated to a forest after the attack. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening.

title: Bandits vs Customs Officer, Katsina
description: An official of the Nigeria Customs Service identified as Garba Nasiru was murdered by some bandits. The bandits attacked some Customs officials at a checkpoint, killed their victim and went away with his AK-47 riffle.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents (assuming not less than 20) were killed in a military airstrike. Their operation bases were also destroyed.
place: Maima and Tusuy near Warshale and Tongule along the Dikwa-Rann axis

title: Hoodlums Kill Policeman, Rivers
description: A policeman attached to the SARS headquarters in Port Harcourt was killed by hoodlums suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) who came through from a community in Abia State. Another source reported the killer as cultists.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed while 3 others were arrested during a search and rescue operation carried out in conjunction with local vigilantes supported by the air component.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 11 soldiers died after their convoy ran though a landmine planted by Bojo Haram. The explosion was followed up with gunshots by the insurgents. Among them were a captain and a lieutenant.

title: Gunmen Kill Herdsmen, Ebonyi
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen Adamu Ibrahim, 7, and Jubril Ibrahim, 15, were killed at their camp while 2 others were critically injured when gunmen invaded their camp at night.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were decimated by the Air Task Force of the Operation Lafiya Dole. The incident happened when the logistics based of the terrorists were destroyed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 15 security operatives who were in advance team of Governor Babagana Zulum were shot dead in an ambush by Boko Haram terrorists. The victims were 8 policemen, three soldiers and 4 members of the Civilian JTF.
sources_of_information: This Day (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (30 ) , The Guardian (30 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 21 bandits were shot dead while 3 soldiers lost their lives during a military operation targeted at wiping bandits under Operation Sahel Sanity. The army and the bandits engaged in a shootout
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (24 ) , The Guardian (24 ) , Daily Trust (23 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: 3 bandits were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army under the Operation Whirl Stroke. The bandits were killed when the army rescued some people who were abducted by the hoodlums.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Scores of people were killed and several properties were destroyed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising residents.
place: Akawo village, Yar Kasuwa, Ushe, Senchi

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen shot five people to death and inflicted machete cuts injuries on another during an attack in a community. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the community in the night and shot at locals who were relaxing in their homes.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 7 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. The incident happened when the troops stormed the hideout of the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some top Boko Haram terrorists were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. The camps of the terrorists were also destroyed in the operation. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Colonel D. C. Bako, commander of the 25 Task Force Brigade, was killed by Boko Haram insurgents. He died from injuries he sustained when his patrol team was ambushed by the insurgents. A version of the reported stated that many terrorists were killed when a reinforcement was called in.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (41 ) , This Day (41 ) , Other newspaper 3 (41 ) , Daily Trust (16 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 5 people were killed and many others were wounded during an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Food stuff were also stolen and houses were burnt down. The attackers were believed to have come from neighbouring Nasarawa State.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , This Day (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Ogun
description: Personnel of Operation Burst killed 4 bandits who were terrorising some residents. It was reported that the bandits were hiding in a forest where the security personnel invaded.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Katsina
description: 5 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a village. It was reported that the incident happened when the herdsmen invaded the village in the early hours of the day and started shooting sporadically, leading to the death of the farmers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Sokoto
description: A group of about 100 armed men dressed in army camouflage attacked police headquarter and killed a Divisional Police Officer and a police inspector. A version of the report stated that 5 other people were killed in the attack. The bandits also kidnapped some women.

title: Gunmen Kill Student, Osun
description: The mutilated body of a missing student of Osun State Polytechnic, Festus Adedoyin Ewejobi, was found in his room. He was declared missing for 4 days before his discovery. He was allegedly assassinated by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked vehicles parked on the roadside following the restriction of late vehicular movements in the state. 10 people mostly commuters were killed while many others were declared missing. 5 buses were alleged to have been attacked by the insurgents.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits were killed during a massive air strike conducted by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandit attacked the village in the night and operated for about 2 hours.

title: Bandits vs FRSC officials, Nasarawa
description: Bandits killed two officers of the Federal Road Safety Corps and kidnapped 10 other offers. It was reported that the incident happened when the personnel were traveling for a training programme.
place: Udege junction along the Mararaban-Udege Road, Adoka
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A 50-year-old man, Ashiru Aliyu, was killed by bandits who also kidnapped 7 women during. It was reported that the bandits numbering about 30 stormed the village, shot sporadically, abducted their victims and rustled unspecified number of cows.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Katsina
description: Alhaji Muntari Mai Yadi was killed by bandits and his son was kidnapped. The victim buried afterwards. The whereabouts of the kidnapped victim remain unknown.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: The Sarkin Tauri of Dandume town was killed and 4 others were kidnapped. Details of the attack was not reported.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits were decimated by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji during a clearance operation. The killed bandits belonged to the gang led by a bandit called Dangote. Due to the nature of the report, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Gunmen killed 2 people and injured many others when they attacked some communities. It was reported that the gunmen were identified as Fulani herdsmen. Some of the victims were identified as Cecilia Ishaya (62-year-old widow), Iliya Sunday (56 years)
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed 2 Tiv farmers. It was reported that the lifeless body of the victims were discovered with bullets wounds and machete cuts by a search party after they did not return home from the farm.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Fulani militia launched an attack on a village and shot dead one Emmanuel David Yohanna (13 years). It was reported that they injured two people identified as Sunday Zango Stephen (48 years) and Zakka John (23 years).
place: Kitsarapang village in Kizachi Chiwo of Kizachi community, Tsam Chiefdom

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 3 Atyap youths, who went to clear their sugarcane, were attacked by some Fulani militia. The militia attacked the victims with daggers and machetes. One of the victims was identified as 25 year old Anthony Magaji, a final year HND student with Nuhu Bamali Polytechnic, Zaria.

title: Prince Ojukwu, Anambra
description: 35-year-old Prince Chukwuma Ojukwu, popularly known as Agujiugo, was gruesomely murdered in his residence by unknown gunmen.

title: Army vs Bandit, Benue
description: A bandit was shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army in the Operation Whirl Stroke unit. The troops also arrested four other bandits in the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed a cleric identified as Reverend Alubara Audu and two other people. It was reported that the gunmen abducted 5 people in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army belonging to the Operation Lafiya Dole during a clearance operation aimed at clearing remnants of the terrorists.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: IPOB vs Hausa Residents, Rivers
description: 2 Hausa indigenes lost their lives when they were attacked by some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the irate IPOB members launched a coordinated attack on Hausa residents.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 bandits were killed while others escaped with gunshots wounds when troops of Operation Accord engaged them in a gun duel.
place: Jeka Da Rabi area along Kaduna-Abuja expressway

title: Police vs Bandits, Niger
description: 6 bandits were shot dead by the police when they engaged the bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits also killed a policeman and 4 people in the attack.

title: Bandits vs Vigilates, Niger
description: 17 vigilante members were killed by bandits, who abducted 20 persons from a community. It was reported that the bandits ambushed the vigilante members. They also killed a policeman and a security man in a bank.
sources_of_information: The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (17 ) , This Day (17 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Scores of bandits were killed by the Air Component of Operation Thunder Strike. It was reported that the operation was aimed at clearing bandits from some forests.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some soldiers were killed by ISWAP/Boko Haram fighters who attacked military positions. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 soldiers were killed in the attacked.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by members of a vigilance group when some bandits attacked a village. The victims were killed when vigilante confronted the bandits,

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole bombarded hideout belonging to members of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists and killed scores of their fighters. It is assumed that 40 people were killed in the bombardment.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unspecified number of Boko fighters lost their lives when they encountered troops of the Nigerian Army. 4 soldiers reportedly died in the encounter. It is assumed not less than 20 Boko Haram fighters where killed in the incident.

title: Political Violence, Bayelsa
description: Unknown gunmen killed Karma Agagowei, the councilor representing Ward 6 of Sagbama Local Council of Bayelsa State. It was reported that the victim was returning from Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) ward congress when he was shot and butchered by the assailants.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were shot dead during encounter with troops of Nigerian Army who stormed the hideout of the bandits. It was reported that the soldiers arrested about 157 illegal miners too.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Bandits vs Man, Katsina
description: Bello Musawa, the son of the former chairman of Musawa LGA was killed by bandits. This wife was also abducted.

title: Soldiers vs Kidnappers, Kogi
description: A kidnapper was killed during a raid by soldiers and vigilantes on their hideout. Over 100 people, mostly women and children were rescued from the bandits. This event is backdated by a week as reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole killed some top commanders of the Boko Haram/Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP). Some of the killed terrorists were identified as ISWAP Naval Commander, Abu Imrana, Mallam Ibrahim and Mallam Abba. Due to the nature of the story, it is reported that 10 terrorists were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: IPOB vs Security Operatives, Enugu
description: 21 member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and 2 operatives of the Department State Security (DSS) lost their lives when both parties clashed. It was reported that members of the IPOB were conducting a parade when security operatives stormed their gathering and attempted to disperse them. Several others were injured in the clash.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (23 ) , The Punch (12 ) , The Guardian (24 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were killed in an ambush by soldiers. Other bandits were believed to have escaped with gun injuries.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 15 bandits were killed by the police during an onslaught against banditry. The bandits have been terrorising various communities.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were killed during an encounter with the military air component of Operation Lafiya Dole. The terrorists were killed during air raids.

title: Kidnappers Kill Expatriate, Niger
description: An expatriate with a construction company was abducted and killed his abductors. 3 soldiers and a vigilante who had gone to rescue him were killed in an ambush. Some of the bandits (assuming at least 5) died in the shootout with the soldiers. The nationality of the expatriate was not certain as some sources reported that he was a Lebanese (Abdulsalem Algusani) while others reported him as a Chinese.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Independent (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 2 soldiers, a Boko Haram commander, a nursing mother, and many insurgents (assuming at least 10) were killed during a clash between security operatives and insurgents. A hospital and other structures were burnt down in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers lost during an encounter Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters the terrorists invaded a town and military base. It was reported that 3 terrorists were neutralised in airstrikes.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , This Day (11 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: 3 soldiers were killed while 2 others were wounded during a confrontation between troops of Nigerian Army and some bandits. Also, scores of bandits were killed in the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of Operation Sahel Sanity of the Nigerian Army destroyed several bandits’ camps, killed 3 bandits, arrested 7 bandits and their collaborators and recovered a cache of arms and unspecified numbers of cows.
place: Karaduwa and in Dumburum Forest both

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army under the operation codenamed "Operation Hail Storm". Troops also destroyed the hideouts of the terrorists.
place: Tumbuma Baba in Lake and Sambisa Forest areas
sources_of_information: This Day (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Independent (40 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters belonging to the Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Customs vs Residents, Oyo
description: 2 people were killed during a clash between some residents of a community and Customs officers attached to the base located in the community. The crisis started when some Customs officials, on a routine check for smuggled goods, argued with a driver who was transporting drinks to his farm and shot him in the ensuing melee.

title: Army vs Ansaru, Kaduna
description: Some terrorists belonging to the Ansaru terrorist group were neutralised by the Nigerian Air Force jets during a clearance operation. The operation was aimed at clearing out terrorists and bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of Operation Sahel Sanity destroyed 12 bandits' camps and killed three of the bandits. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at ridding the location of bandits.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 bandits who had killed Mohamed Auwal were shot dead by the operatives of Operation Puff Adder during a gun duel. 2 kidnapped victims were also rescued.

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: Heavily armed gunmen, numbering about 12, killed a man identified as Nasiru Halilu (37 years) as he engaged them in an argument when they stormed his house in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the bandits abducted 2 sister and a health worker.

title: Festival Crisis, Ekiti
description: 2 people were shot dead during a crisis that enveloped the stoppage of Ogun Onire festival by the state government due to COVID-19. Worshipers turned violent when they were told that the festival would not hold for the year. The monarch's car was set ablaze. One of the victims was a pregnant woman identified as 34-year-old Mrs Kehinde Olusegun, while the other was Tope Olatunji.
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: The fiance of a businesswoman, Modupeoluwa Oyetoso was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the gunmen also kidnapped the lady and demanded for ransom before they released her.2 people were arrested for the crime.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 13 farmers and herders were killed by Boko Haram terrorists in two communities in a local council. It was reported that the terrorists rustled some sheep and goats, and also injured 16 villagers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole killed scores of Boko Haram fighters when the army destroyed a base belonging to the terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists use the logistics base to store their weapons and assemble to launch attacks.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 8 bandits and 2 villagers were killed when the bandits attacked a village in early hours of the day. The deceased villagers were identified as Shafi'i Suleiman (65 years) and Yakubu Idris (70 years).
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Nation (10 )

title: Troops Kill Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army under Operation Sahel Sanity killed 1 bandit, arrested 9 informants and collaborators, and recovered over 40 rustled cows.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Katsina
description: A bandit was shot dead during a gun duel between some bandits and vigilantes. The bandits stormed the village and killed the All Progressive Congress youth leader for Yau-Yau/Mallamawa ward identified as Mallam Sadi.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 people including a woman at Gwange and 5 others were killed by the explosives, planted by Boko Haram terrorist in separate locations within the city while 27 people were injured.
place: Gwange, Custom, and Gidan Ayaba areas of the metropolis
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Vanguard (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Bandits, Kogi
description: 13 persons were hacked to death by gunmen. In the attack, a man and 12 other members of his immediate family were killed.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (13 ) , The Nation (13 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Police Kill Bandits, Katsina
description: Police killed 3 bandits and recovered an AK-47 rifle, 6 motorcycles, and 17 cattle from the bandits.

title: Mob vs Arm Supplier, Sokoto
description: A man suspected to be supplying ammunition to bandits was lynched by an angry mob. The body of the man, who hails from Niger Republic, was thrown into a river by the villagers.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Sahel Sanity killed two bandits and captured a Nigerien gun supplier. It was reported that the troops also rescued 5 kidnapped victims.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Assailants vs Illegal Miners, Niger
description: A 14-year-old boy, who was mining illegally at a mining site, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported several other illegal miners suffered gunshot injuries.

title: 6 Drown, Niger
description: A boat mishap claimed 5 lives, 3 women and 3 children. They were escaping from banditry attacks when their canoe capsized.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: An 85-year-old man and 6 others were killed during an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Houses were also burnt.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: the wife of the Agwam Musa Didam of Fanstwam Chiefdom and 8 others were killed during an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Several houses and properties were burnt down.
place: Zikpak, Ungwan Masara, in Fantsuam area

title: Drown, Niger
description: 5 persons including 2 children were drowned when the canoe they boarded following the news of bandits coming to invade their village, capsized.

title: Boko Haram vs Humanitarian Aids, Borno
description: 5 abducted humanitarian workers were executed by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). The insurgents made contacts with families of the victims who were abducted last month and demanded $500,000 as ransom. It is assumed they were killed around Sambisa forest, a stronghold for the insurgents. It is assumed they were killed the day the video was released.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Katsina
description: 2 people were killed by bandits and their animals were rustled. On sighting security operatives, the attackers left the rustled animals and fled.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: The village head of Gora Gan, a 6-year-old boy and 8 others were killed during a raid on their community by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Many residents were wounded while houses were set ablaze.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (10 ) , Vanguard (11 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , This Day (10 )

title: Security Guard, Plateau
description: A security guard was killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a hospital. A policeman on duty in the hospital was also attacked with a machete and his rifle was taken from him.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 5, Kaduna
description: 5 people were killed during a raid on a community by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Women protested naked over the recent killing. Many residents have died in similar attacks in the LGA over the past 2 weeks.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Zamfara
description: Several bandits (assuming at least 10) were killed in airstrikes by the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji. Bandits' camps were also destroyed in the raid.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits were killed in an airstrike conducted by troops of the Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji. It is assumed that not less than 40 bandits were killed in the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 21 wedding guests were killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. The attackers opened fire on the victim while the party was ongoing. 28 others sustained various degrees of injury.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Katsina
description: 16 soldiers and 17 bandits were killed during a shootout. The soldiers were ambushed while on a clearance operation. However, the Nigerian Military reported that only 4 soldiers died in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (33 ) , Other newpapers 1 (33 ) , Vanguard (35 ) , Other newspaper 3 (33 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers while trying to cross over from Cameroon to their stronghold in Sambisa forest. A source reported that scores (assuming at least 40) were killed in the incident.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Katsina
description: 7 suspected Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a shootout by soldiers during a clearance operation. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole destroyed a Boko Haram camp and, killing several terrorists in massive airstrikes.
place: Ngwuri Gana along the Gulumba Gana-Kumshe axis

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: 2 men were shot dead and a married woman was abducted during a raid by bandits on a Fulani settlement. They demanded N2 million as a ransom for the release of the woman and N2 million as tax to avert further attacks. This incident is backdated by a week from its report as it was stated that it occurred a week ago.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 24 residents were killed during raids on 3 communities by bandits. The attacks were well coordinated.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed a military convoy and motorists, and killed at 4 soldiers, while many are unaccounted. A Tata lorry was burnt, one Hilux vehicle damage, and caches of arms and ammunition were carted away.
place: Kongiri village near Mainok along Maiduguri highway

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 7 people were killed while many others were seriously injured by Fulani herdsmen. Over 20 houses were burnt along with many motorcycles and a car.

title: Communal Clash, Adamawa
description: 10 people were killed during a renewed communal clash between the Lungada ethnic group in Adamawa state and their Wajas counterpart in Gombe state. Many people were also injured.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 7 persons including a woman were killed in an attack by Fulani herdsmen. 12 others were injured.
place: Chembe village in Ukemberegya/Tswarev ward of Gaambe-Tiev

title: Military vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The troops of the Operation Hadarin Daji killed scores of bandits during aggressive clearance operations. It is assumed that at least 40 bandits were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , The Punch (40 ) , This Day (40 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 20 people were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen following an attack on 2 communities during the preparation for a mass burial of some Catholic members.
sources_of_information: The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and killed 20 troops of 25 Task Force Brigade, a military operation team. Also, 19 Boko Haram members were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (37 ) , Other newspaper 2 (26 ) , The Punch (40 ) , Vanguard (30 )

title: Military vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 46 armed bandits were killed during a clash between soldiers and bandits. The fierce encounter followed a distress call that armed bandits had invaded the area.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 15 residents were killed during an attack by bandits numbering over 200.Many others were injured in the attack.

title: Bandits Attack, Sokoto
description: In an effort to get rid of armed bandits, cattle rustlers, kidnappers, and other criminal elements, several bandits were neutralized and their camps, destroyed by Operation Hadarin Daji. It is assumed that 10 bandits were killed in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram hideouts in 2 locations were bombarded by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole. Several terrorists were killed in the process. It is assumed not less than 10 Boko Haram fighters were killed.
place: Parisu and Bula Bello in Sambisa forest

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 prominent Boko Haram leaders of the terrorists were killed by soldiers in an attempt to infiltrate Army Super Camp Damasak. The victims included Tumbun Dabino – Ba Issoufou, Tumbun Bororo – Amir Batam, Tumbun Jaki – Almustapha, Tumbun Bagaruwa – Modou Kollo, Dogon Tchoukou – Issah, Tumbun Rakke – Mustapha Woulama, Tumbun Dila – Boukar Kowa, Tumbun Mita – Abou Aisha.

title: Hunters/Vigilante vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An attack on a community by Boko Haram was foiled by hunters and vigilante members. 2 insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
