description: A farmer was killed during a raid on a community by Boko Haram. They infiltrated the community without the knowledge of residents and carried out the attack. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: Three people traveling on a road were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked them. It was reported that the herders have been waylaying travelers on the road.

title: Bandits/Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 2 vigilantes were killed by bandits numbering about 50. The bandits raided a community and abducted 30 residents. In the bid to rescue them, the vigilantes were laid ambush on and attacked. The attackers were reported as Fulani herdsmen by a source.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: Some bandits (assuming not less than 5) were killed during airstrikes on their hideouts by the military. Some of then bandits were arrested. Among them were 2 foreigners.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 9 people were killed during a raid on a community by bandits. Many animals were also rustled by the attackers. Attempts by some vigilante groups to foil the attack proved abortive.
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 soldiers and 20 insurgents, were killed in a gunfight, following the ambush of troops by Boko Haram sect.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were allegedly killed by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole. Their structures were also destroyed in the raid. It is believed that no less than 2 scores (40) Boko Haram fighters died in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A soldier lost his life, while 10 others were seriously injured, and some still missing in a fight with Boko Haram Insurgents.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 3 persons, Aminu Yusuf, Lawal Akushi and Mansir Danliti were killed, while 3 others injured when bandits launched an attack on a community.

title: Bandits vs Herders, Kogi
description: Armed bandits attacked a Fulani settlement, killed 2 herdsmen and stole 103 cows.

title: Policeman kill in Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 6 people, including a policeman, were killed while 5 others among who were 2 pregnant women were injured when bandits over 100 attacked 2 communities and also carted away their properties.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , Independent (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: Bandits, riding on motorcycles shot repeatedly in 3 different communities, killing 4 people and injuring so many people.
place: Sunko, Gavya, Marafa in Manta District

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Hassan Dan Tagwaye, the notorious bandit leader and his twin brother, Husaini were killed in an attack by the Nigerian Army. Several other bandits were killed also, while a few escaped with injuries. It is assumed that 20 others were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Katsina
description: 3 people were killed when bandits raided a community. They also rustled bulls and stole food items.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Boko Haram vs Herdsmen, Borno
description: 5 persons suspected to be herdsmen were, killed when members of the Boko Haram sect, armed with AK-47 rifles, invaded some communities. They were killed while attempting to plead with the terrorists not to go with their cows, which is their only means of livelihood.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: 15 people were killed when armed bandits arrived at the community on dozens of motorcycles, encircled the village and started firing at the residents, and also made away with herds of animals.
place: Ruwan Tofa community, west of Dansadau town
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , This Day (10 ) , Vanguard (15 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: Fleeing women running after bandit killed a businessman man, Alhaji Yunusa Rugabza, fell into a dam with their children, and 6 of the children between ages 5 and 7 years died in the dam.

title: Army vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Troops of Operation Safe Haven killed 3 bandits while others escaped with gunshot wounds. 1 Barreta pistol, 1 single barrel gun, 2 fabricated pistols, 4 rounds of 9mm ammunition, 3 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition, 4 cartridges, a motorcycle and a techno phone were recovered from them.

title: Bandits Kill, Niger
description: Audu Makeri, was shot dead by bandits, 2 elderly people were kidnapped while 6 other members of the villages sustained gun injuries. The villages affected were Zhazhayidna, Kpayituko, Iboru, Ndayinkwo, Mbokwo, Kudodo and Affarpi.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: A young man, Mmaduabuchi, was killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen who were ordered to vacate the community. The herdsmen attacked the victim on their way out of the community and stole his motorcycle.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF bombarded Boko Haram's residential and training ground and killed scores of insurgents. It is assumed not less than 2 scores (40 terrorists) were killed in the raid.
place: Garin Maloma in the fringes of the Sambisa Forest

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed while their gun trucks were immobilized by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole. It is assumed that 20 of them were killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A security guard to a banker was shot dead by rampaging bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the banker, who was with the victim at the time of the incident, escaped by whiskers.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: The Air Component of Operation Hadarin Daji, destroyed some armed bandits camps. The Air Component dispatched a force package of Nigerian Air Force (NAF) attack aircraft and helicopter gunships to engage the area, leading to the destruction of three of the targeted camps, some of which was seen engulfed in flames, and several of the criminals were also neutralized in the process. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.
place: Forest in Katsina State – south of Birnin Kogo along the Katsina-Zamfara boundary area

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani militias ambushed and killed Mr. Musa Ataka, the village head, and Mr. Danjuma Taake, while they were returning from a neighbouring village, where they had visited a friend.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers on patrol encountered Boko Haram criminals mounted on 3 Gun Trucks and killed 5 of them. Malam Hassan Bukar who was abducted by the insurgents was rescued while one Toyota Land Cruiser jeep was recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers laid ambush on Boko Haram insurgents and killed 1 logistics courier. Other insurgents were believed to have escaped with gunshot injuries. Arms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed and another one was captured alive during a clearance operation by soldiers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed and another one was captured alive during a clearance operation by soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram raided a community and killed 29 people. The community shares boundary with Gubio where 81 people were killed a day earlier.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a raid on their logistic base by soldiers. Arms and ammunition were recovered from them while 16 women and 16 children were rescued.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram overran military checkpoints and killed about 20 soldiers and 42 civilians. Soldiers claimed they killed 20 terrorists. 100s lof civilians were injured while the United Nations' humanitarian hub in the area and a local police station were set ablaze. Rocket Propelled Grenade, RPG, fired on the main entrance gate of the hub but did not explode, while the main and exit gates were riddled with bullet. Monguno, a hub for international non-governmental organizations. The casualties may likely increase considering the number of wounded persons.
sources_of_information: Web Newspaper (60 ) , Vanguard (82 ) , Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Punch (41 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram stormed a local market and opened fire on traders and buyers, killing 4 people and injuring many others.

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, katsina
description: 5 people including Abdullahi Lawal AKA Kirgi and Isiya Kanawa who were vigilante members were killed in a clash between vigilante and bandits.
place: Dajin Gwamma in Dan Ali village

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: The Village Head of Mazoji and Sarkin Fulanin Fafu, Alh. Dikko Usman was killed by bandits during an attack in his residence.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in an ambush by soldiers. The victims were among a band of insurgents' logistics couriers that attempted to cross into a community. 4 bicycles and 4 bags of grains were recovered from the victims.

title: Herdsmen Kill Farmer, Imo
description: A man, Elder Iriaka, was killed in his farm by suspected Fulani herdsmen when he saw them grazing on his farm and challenged them. The attackers were apprehended by the youths and were handed over to the police. No date was reported for this incident. Therefore, it is backdated by 2 days.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Bandit Attack, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 8 people and injured 10 others in a recent attack on a community. many people were allegedly abducted while others were missing in the attack that came 3 days after 60 people were killed in another attack on the LGA.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: Bandits invaded a community, killed 1 person, and kidnapped 2 others. Details of the attack were not reported. Also, see event in PAR012294.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents dressed in foreign military camouflage uniforms were killed in an ambush by soldiers. Arms and ammunition were also recovered from them.
place: along Pulka – Firgi – Banki Junction – Sabsawa.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 60 people were killed in fresh attacks by bandits on five communities. The bandits stormed the communities on over 100 motorcycles, after which they began shooting, molesting women, burning houses and grain stores and also rustled some cattle.
place: Kadisau,Kabalawa, Kwakware, Unguwar Wahabi and Raudama
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (60 ) , Other newspaper 2 (57 ) , The Punch (18 ) , Vanguard (40 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 people were killed when Boko Haram members laid ambush and opened fire on motorists with military escort conveying passengers from Maiduguri to Damboa.
place: Maiduguri to Damboa, near Pole Wire

title: Bandits Kill 40, Katsina
description: 40 people were killed during a raid on a village by bandits. The attackers who allegedly numbered over 200 were going from house to house killing their victims. It was believed the bandits raided the community for food and other materials.
place: Kadisau, Kabalawa, Unguwar Wahabi and Raudama
sources_of_information: Independent (40 ) , Web Newspaper (40 ) , The Guardian (60 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Community Spies, Kaduna
description: 4 Adara youths identified as Ayuba Zagi, Danladi Shekarau, David Kampani, and Jumare Anthony were lynched by their kinsmen when they discovered that they were informants to bandits terrorizing, kidnapping and killing of people.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 81 people were killed during a Boko Haram attack on a community. 7 people including the village head were abducted while 400 cows were rustled. The attackers disguised as religious preachers disarmed some residents of their and guns, bow and arrows before shooting them. They were killed for allegedly revealing their locations to the military.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: A village head, an Islamic cleric, and more than 15 people were killed by militias in different parts of the state in a crisis between Jukun and Tiv.
place: Maigoge, Maihula, Bagoni, Akate and Wurbo
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (17 ) , The Nation (17 ) , The Punch (17 )

title: Military vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Nigerian military through Operations Hadarin Daji, Accord and Katsina, conducted air strikes on two bandits’ camps, killed scores of the bandits and also recovered 496 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition, seven dane guns, three mobile phones and other items from the bandits.

title: Military vs Herdsmen, Benue
description: Soldiers of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) killed 5 Fulani herdsmen who invaded three different villages and killed 12 people. The Fulani invaders stormed the villages, shot sporadically, killed people and injuring many people in the process.
place: Torkula, Kponko and Kaseyo all in Mbadwem council ward
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (17 ) , The Guardian (17 ) , The Punch (8 ) , This Day (17 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: In a combined effort with ground and air offensive by troops of Operation Thunderstrike and local vigilantes, during clearance patrol, 70 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: Independent (70 ) , Nigerian Tribune (70 ) , Other newspaper 2 (70 ) , The Guardian (70 ) , Daily Trust (70 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An acting Commanding Officer of the Nigerian Army, Major K. Yabkubu was shot dead by Boko Haram fighters during a gun battle between the terrorists and the army. It was reported that troops also neutralized 10 terrorists in the attack.
causes_of_violence: religious issue, political issue, The Punch

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 people lost their lives when some Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities. The cause of the hostility was not stated.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 9 people, including women and children, were killed in the early hours of the day by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened when most of the villagers were still asleep.
place: Agwala in Tudun Wadan Doka District
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 3 persons were killed while Yusha’u Dissi, the chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC) of Matazu Local Government Area, and several others, were abducted when armed bandits attacked some villages. People killed include Nuru Lawal, Aminu Mai-Unguwa and also a 12-year-old boy.
place: Dan Alhaji village, Kandawa village, Shirgi village

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 8 people, including 3 herdsmen, lost their lives when some Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities. The cause of the hostility was not stated.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 farmers were killed by unknown gunmen in their farms. Farmers now abandon their farms because they are being killed daily. Bandits just storm the farms; kill people on sight and leave.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: Militias, killed a pastor of the Christian Reformed Church -Nigeria, CRCN, Rev. Emmanuel Bileya, his pregnant wife, Juliana, and their teenage boy while working on their farm. This killing is linked to Jukun and Tiv crisis.
sources_of_information: Independent (3 ) , This Day (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: Fulani herdsmen also known as Bororo, shot dead 3 people, Ope Babalola, Waheed Ganiyu and Yemi Sunday Osuolale on their farm.
place: Ikereku, Pade, Olanla and Babalola villages
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 people were killed by bandits in a village. It was reported that the attackers also injured 6 other people and rustled the undisclosed number of animals from the village.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 13 people were killed by bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that the hoodlums also stole hundreds of animals and other valuables belonging to the villagers.
place: Unguwar Gizo, Sabon Layin Galadima and Mairuwa villages

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed 13 people. Among the victims was a ward chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party identified as Augustine Abbey.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 bandits guarding a logistics warehouse were killed by troops of the air component of Operation Hadarin Daji. It was reported that the troops also destroyed the warehouse. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated two days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female suicide bomber infiltrated a community, detonated her Improvised Explosive Devices, IEDs, killed herself and injured 3civilians.

title: Bomb Explosion, Borno
description: A 13-year-old child was killed while playing with an Unexploded Ordnance (UXO) brought in from Bama LGA. 3 civilians were injured in the explosion. The UXO must have been abandoned by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 civilians were killed and 3 others injured, when Boko Haram insurgents, on motorcycles, bicycles and a 4-wheel drive vehicle attacked a community.

title: Gunmen attack, Plateau
description: Gunmen attacked a fast-food joint, and killed 5 people including 43-year-old Asabe Samuel, the shop owner, 48-year-old Audu Anadu, 25-year-old Shedrack Joe and Gideon Tuhku, a 67-year-old secondary school teacher. The bandits proceeded to another shop where they killed 35-year-old Iba Adi.

title: Bandits, Sokoto
description: Over 70 people were killed and many others were injured when bandits invaded some communities. Properties worth millions of naira were destroyed in the attack.
place: Garki, Dan Aduwa, Kuzari, Katuma and Masawa
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (70 ) , Nigerian Tribune (74 ) , Other newspaper 3 (80 )

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: 30 bandits were killed in an airstrike conducted by the Air Component of the Operation Hadarin Daji. Logistics store belonging to the bandits was also destroyed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (30 ) , This Day (30 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Nigerian Army killed 3 key Boko Haram/ISWAP leaders and 72 other terrorists. The killed commanders were identified as Manzar Halid, Amir Abu Fatima and Nicap. Some other commanders who were wounded in the attack were identified as Abu Jamratu Al-Naweer, Kaka Bana, Tareta Babakari and others.
place: Banki junction and Response Area, Firgi within the 7 Division strike
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (75 ) , The Punch (75 ) , The Nation (75 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: About 70 inhabitants were killed by bandits. It was reported that the bandits have been killing people in various communities. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Communal Crisis, Ebonyi
description: Azubuike Inya, a 46-year-old man, was murdered by his kinsmen at Amankwo village, Nkpoghoro community. It was revealed that the killing was occasioned by an intra-communal crisis, involving the people of Amankwo village, and one Chief Donatus Ezeogo Ajah (aka Zentus).

title: Police vs Bandits
description: The Divisional Patrol Team while on routine patrol, along with vigilantes, foiled a bandits attack, killed 2 of the bandits, while others fled into the bush with gunshot wounds. Items recovered include one RPG with breech no. M80 and 0ne G3 rifle with breech no. 63660.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: In Operation Hadarin Daji, the air component killed 27 armed bandits and destroyed some of their dwellings.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 18 Boko Haram members were killed, and many escaped with gunshot wounds while a large cache of arms and ammunition, logistics supplies, and other equipment were recovered. 72 hostages including 34 women and 38 children, held by the terrorist were rescued.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: Air Components of Operation Hadarin Daji defeated armed bandits in air raids in Katsina and Zamfara states between May 20 and 22, killing 135 of the bandits. A set of huts housing one of the notorious bandit leaders was taken out with scores of the bandits killed and a few seen fleeing towards Forest. It is assumed that 45 bandits were killed in this attack. This incident is also linked with PAR012164 and PAR012165.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (45 ) , Nigerian Tribune (45 ) , The Punch (45 )

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Air Components of Operation Hadarin Daji defeated armed bandits in air raids in Katsina and Zamfara states between May 20 and 22, killing 135 of the bandits. A set of huts housing one of the notorious bandit leaders was taken out with scores of the bandits killed and a few seen fleeing towards Forest. It is assumed that 45 bandits were killed in this attack. This incident is also linked with PAR012163 and PAR012165.
place: Hassan Tagwaye’s Camp; Alhaji Auta’s Camp and Maikomi
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (45 ) , Nigerian Tribune (45 ) , The Punch (45 )

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: Air Components of Operation Hadarin Daji defeated armed bandits in air raids in Katsina and Zamfara states between May 20 and 22, killing 135 of the bandits. A set of huts housing one of the notorious bandit leaders was taken out with scores of the bandits killed and a few seen fleeing towards Forest. It is assumed that 45 bandits were killed in this attack. This incident is also linked with PAR012164 and PAR012163.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (45 ) , Nigerian Tribune (45 ) , The Punch (45 )

title: Bandits vs Travellers, Taraba
description: Bandits ambushed and killed 8 persons traveling from Wukari to Donga Council while 3 people, narrowly escaped with various degrees of gunshot injuries. This incident further fuelled tension in the area between the Tiv and Jukun ethnic groups which also claimed 2 lives and property.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Bandits, who came with over 60 motorcycles and each motorcycle conveying 3 of them, attacked 3 communities, killing 12 people and carting away animals. Other reports have it that Kajera and Magazawa villages were attacked.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , The Punch (12 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: 20 people were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen in remote settlements of Kajuru local government area. There have been daily attacks and destruction from Monday to Thursday in the remote settlements.
place: Satellite settlements of Kallah, Libere, and Gefe towns
sources_of_information: The Punch (20 ) , This Day (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (30 )

title: Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole killed an unconfirmed number of Boko Haram terrorists and destroyed two of their gun trucks on the outskirts of the town. It is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Independent (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , The Punch (20 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 members of the Boko Haram and Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP), terrorist groups were killed by Nigerian Army troops. The terrorists, who were armed with mortars, rocket-propelled grenades, and small arms were heading to attack villages surrounding Baga when the troops attacked their convoy with overwhelming firepower.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Vanguard (20 )

title: Bandits, Niger
description: Five people were shot dead by bandits when they attacked 4 communities. The victims included a pastor whose church was also burnt down, a blind man, and 3 villagers. The attackers rustled more than 1000 cows.
place: Nankuna, Nansa, Eburo and Lagodo in Erena Distric

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram and Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists were killed when the ground troops, backed by fighter jets and helicopter gunship of the Nigerian Air Force successfully bombarded their hideouts. It is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed in the attack.

title: Bandits, Niger
description: Through the combined efforts of police and local vigilantes, 9 bandits were killed while 150 cows and 200 sheep were recovered during an attack in some villages.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newspaper 2 (9 ) , The Nation (9 ) , The News (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram Terrorists (BHTs) were killed by Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole through Air Task Force. Their logistics facilities and other structures were also destroyed. It is assumed that 20 BHTs were killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Sector 1 Operation Lafiya Dole, in an ambush operation, killed 9 Boko Haram terrorists while 2 soldiers were injured. Another report has it that 5 soldiers were killed while unconfirmed number of the terrorists were killed.It is assumed that 20 terrorist and soldiers, were killed in the attack.

title: Boko HaraM Attack, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigeria army killed 35 members of Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists within a week in different locations. In some operations, civilian joint task force and hunters assisted the troops.

title: Fulani Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen attack 3 communities. 8 people were killed, a lot of people were injured and fled their homes into the bush and other neighbouring communities for safety.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , The Punch (27 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS), a Special Military Task Force, killed 4 armed bandits who attacked and killed 2 villagers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Vanguard (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 17 people were killed while several houses were set ablaze by bandits suspected to be herdsmen. Villagers, also ran into the bushes for safety.
place: Gonan Togo village at Kufana community
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (17 ) , The Nation (17 ) , The Guardian (15 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: 4 people were killed while 9 houses were destroyed during a clash between Tiv farmers and herdsmen, when a Tiv farmer, prevented cattle from grazing on his farm.
place: Baki Kwarte and Kadarko, in Keana

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 75 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in twin security operations between Nigerian and allied forces from neighbouring states, including Nigeria.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Niger
description: 1 person was killed while many were abducted during an attack by bandits. Among those kidnapped were the wife of the Education Secretary of the Chanchaga LGA, Lawal Balarabe, along with her one-week-old baby and 3 grandchildren of a former Commissioner for Finance in the state, late Tanko Inga. the attackers also rustled 481 cattle.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 17 bandits were killed, while several others escaped with gunshot wounds, during a joint clearance operation involving troops of Operations Thunder Strike and Whirl Punch with air support from the Air Component of Operation Gama Aiki, at suspected bandits’ hideouts.
place: Mashigi Galbi, Damba and Kabarasha villages
sources_of_information: The Nation (17 ) , The Guardian (17 ) , The Punch (17 ) , This Day (17 )

title: Communal Clash, Anambra
description: A land dispute between Umumbo and Omor communities claimed a life and properties. 300 farmers from both communities were injured and 50 others were declared missing. A 6.p.m to 6.a.m curfew was imposed on both communities to contain the crisis. A source reported many were killed in the clash (assuming about 20 people)
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Vanguard (20 ) , Independent (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 )

title: Bandits Kill 5, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed and their animals were rustled by bandits. Many residents were injured in the incident. The attackers also kidnapped the Administrative Head of Danmusa LGA and his son.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: An octohgenarian, Elder Atser Anbya, was killed in his home by suspected Fulani herdsmen. His wife was inflicted with machete injuries and battling to survive.

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Ogun
description: A commercial vehicle driver was shot dead and his passenger was robbed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The same group of attackers also kidnapped a policeman attached to the Area Command Office, Ayetoro Police Division.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Delta
description: 2 Vigilantes including the leader of the group, Emeka Chosen, were shot dead in an ambush by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The victims were on a mission to rescue a kidnapped woman and her daughter when they came under the ambush.

title: Gunmen, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed Emmanuel Yerima a security guard and kidnapped 15 others including the Sarki of Doka, a banker and his daughter in 3 different attacks.
place: Kuriga, Komo and the Millennium City,
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: The corpse of 3 farmers killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen were recovered . The victims were planting groundnut when the came under attack. One of the victims was identified as Msughter Tarnongo.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Kaduna
description: 4 vigilantes, Habibu Yusuf, Adam Abubakar, Bahari Kabiru, and Sani Abdullahi, were killed by bandits during a raid on their community. They were ambushed when they went to recover the corpse of a victim killed by bandits. 2 other vigilantes were injured in the incident.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 78 Boko Haram/Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists were killed by the Nigerian Army Artillery Regiments of Operation Lafiya Dole. The operation was carried out based on intelligence reports that showed that the area harboured a large number of terrorists.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Artillery Regiments of Operation Lafiya Dole killed 56 Boko Haram insurgents during a raid on their stronghold. Intelligence report allegedly showed that a large number of terrorists converged in the area before the attack.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 people were killed, many inflicted with injuries and a large number of livestock and foodstuff were taken away by the bandits. Among those people killed was Sada Musa, a farmer.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of insurgents were killed when fighter jets of the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole bombed terrorist hideouts and logistic facilities. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.

title: Bandits vs Police, Kaduna
description: A Police Inspector and a villager were killed were abducted by bandits. The officer died during an ambush on a Polie patrol van. 6 others including the village head were abducted by the attackers.
place: Near Polwaya, along the Brinin Gwari highway

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: A raid on a community by bandits claimed 2 lives. About 2,000 cattle were rustled and many residents were wounded in the attack. The incident also caused massive displacement of people who fear the attackers may come back for more attacks.
place: Erena, Kogo, Yinakpa, kapna, Aleyin, Rafin Senyin, and Amuko and Farindoki.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , This Day (4 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 7, Niger
description: 7 people were killed when bandits raided some communities. 5 of the victims were vigilant members who were ambushed and killed by the bandits. The attackers made away with valuables and over 100 cattle after the raid.

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: A communal clash between Kparev and Ihyaren claimed the live of 1 person. The incident was caused by moulding of block in a forbidden land. The crisis had been on between the indigenes and settlers all of Tiv extraction over ownership of land in this area.

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 residents were killed during a raid on a community by bandits. The attackers opened fire on people from motorcycles and fled afterwards.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Islamic West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by soldiers during a raid on their hideouts. It was believed that the victims converged in a settlement for a meeting. It is assumed that about 20 of the terrorists were killed. A source reported that scores (assuming at least 40) were killed.
place: Koloram on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 89 bandits were killed in a joint operation by the Nigerian Army, NAF and Nigerian Police Force. 322 rustled cows, 77 motorcycles and 9 cell phones were recovered while 3 females and 2 males were rescued from the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 7, Kaduna
description: 7 people were killed during attacks on 3 communities by gunmen suspected to either be bandits or kidnappers. Few of the sources reported that the attackers were Fulani herdsmen. 1 person was abducted and 5 others where wounded in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , This Day (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram fighters including their leaders were killed during an aerial bombardment on their houses by NAF. The operation was executed following an alleged intelligence on their presence in the area. It is assumed not less than 20 terrorists were killed in the operation.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were killed when they blocked a busy road and were robbing people of their belongings. An AK-49 rifle was recovered from the bandits.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Delta
description: A farm manager and a watchman were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The manager was shot from the window while the watchman was shot from a close range. The 3rd person who were with the victim was lucky to survive the raid by climbing into the ceiline.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 21 bandits and 4 soldiers died in an anti-banditry operation. Communities in the state have often come under bandit attacks. In the bid to curtail the attacks, anti-banditry operations were initiated.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Both the Boko Haram and the Islamic States of West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists were engaged by the army in fierce battle leading to the death of 11 people including a soldier.
place: Pulka crossing, Mandara mountains, Yenegu village, Kumshe, and Miyanti

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: Bandits attacked a community, killed 3 persons and injuring 2 others. Those killed include a medical health worker, Sanusi Bello, Safiyanu Abdullahi and Hassan Sani.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: Some gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen on 19/04 invaded the Unguwan Magaji village, Kamaru Chawai Ward of the Kauru LGA of Kaduna State, killing four persons and razing 36 houses. It was reported that one of the attackers was found dead and his phone retrieved. Those killed during the attack included Mrs. Hanatu Joseph(58), Mrs. Sarah Sunday (40), Mrs. Dije Sajay (55), and Mr. Sunday David (47).
place: Unguwan Magaji in Kamaru Chawai Ward
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 13 terrorists were killed while two gun trucks with Dushkha Guns, six AK 47 rifles were captured by The Nigerian Army troops of Operation Lafiya Dole when Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists made an attempt to attack a community.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: In an ambush, armed bandits killed 4 soldiers who were conveying food supplies to their colleagues carrying out operation codenamed ‘Hadarin Daji’ in the forest. In retaliation, the troops responded and killed dozens of the gunmen and recovered about 8 AK47 rifles.
place: Forest near Garin-Kada and Birane villages

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Niger
description: Several bandits (assuming at least 20) were killed by the Air Component of Operation Gama Aiki with the support of Operation Thunder Strike. The victims were sighted along with a large herd of rustled cattle in the area.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Independent (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 )

title: Stampede, Borno
description: COVID-19: 12 women and children lost their lives in a stampede during the distribution of N5,000 cash and clothes to thousands of displaced persons by the state governor. Gamboru is a border trading hub that has repeatedly been attacked by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Communal Issue, Ebonyi
description: More than 20 people were killed while many sustained various degrees of injuries when military invaded a community. The crisis that led to the invasion by the military was as a result of the boundary dispute that led to the killing of a Naval officer, Naval Sub Lt. David Igbadhal.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed Kaukau Gada a member of a vigilante group and abducting a pregnant mother and her child. The corpse of Kauka was found at the outskirt of the town covered in blood a day after the attack. This attack came before the attack in PAR011943 by the military.
causes_of_violence: religious issue, political issue, Daily Trust

title: Bandit Attack, Katsina
description: 25 people were killed during attacks on 3 communities by bandits. While the attackers killed 17 people in Makarwaci, 6 were killed in Kuraichi and 2 others in Dogonruwa village. many residents also sustained different degrees of injuries. This event is linked to PAR011876 and PAR011877.
sources_of_information: This Day (25 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Nasarawa
description: Soldiers killed 4 suspected Boko Haram terrorists operating a cell code-named 'Darul-Islam'. There activities were closely monitored until the raid.

title: Bandit Attack, Katsina
description: 5 residents were killed by bandits during an attack on a community. Many people were reportedly injured in the attack. This event is linked to PAR011875 and PAR011877.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , The Guardian (23 ) , Other newspaper 3 (23 ) , Daily Trust (23 )

title: Bandit Attack, Katsina
description: A lot of people lost their lives when bandits attacked their community. Many others were believed to have sustained different degrees of injuries. 17 were killed at Gurzar Kaka, and 13 in Gurzar Gamji. This event is linked to PAR011876 and PAR011875.
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , The Guardian (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 ) , Daily Trust (14 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed a 25-year-old farmer, John Chinter. He was killed when the attackers opened fire on him and other members of his family while asleep.

title: Fire Incident, Borno
description: 14 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) died during a fire outbreak at their camp. 15 others sustained various degrees of injuries. The cause of the fire was not reported. Majority of the IDPs were people that were displaced by Boko Haram attacks. 6 of the victims were from the same family.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (17 ) , Other newspaper 2 (14 ) , This Day (14 )

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: A 60-year-old commander of a local vigilance group was killed by bandits while a 14-year-old girl and 15-year-old boy were abducted.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Nigerian Army attached to Operation Lafiya Dole killed 105 Boko Haram and Islamic State West African Province terrorists in an attempted to attack a community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (105 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Punch (105 ) , This Day (105 )

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF bombarded Boko Haram hideouts and killed several terrorists (assuming at least 20). Fighter jets also destroyed some of the structures and logistic facilities belonging to the terrorists.Key Boko Haram leaders were killed in the attack. Another source reported scores of the terrorists were killed (assuming at least 40)
sources_of_information: Vanguard (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 )

title: Communal Crisis, Ondo
description: A 7-year-old boy, Marvelous Akintubuwa, died after he was thrown into the river by hoodlums who attacked the deposed Olugbo of Ugbo, Prince Adebanjo Mafimisebi. The boys corpse was found floating on the river a day after the incident.

title: Traders vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 10 cattle traders on their way to Zamfara from Katsina state were attacked on their was by bandits. When the driver of their vehicles was shot dead, the vehicle conveying them hit an oncoming vehicle and went up in flames. Only 1 trader survived the incident.

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: 50 heavily armed gun-wielding bandits invaded a town on motorcycles and killed 5 people while 5 others were also injured in another community. Over 600 people, mostly women and children, have been displaced in the attack and are currently taking refuge at Bosso Primary Schools in Minna. This event is linked with PAR011899
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Bandit Attack, Niger
description: Heavily armed gun-wielding bandits killed 1 person and injured several others. This event is linked with PAR011900.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Gunmen Kill 9, Plateau
description: 9 people including a pregnant woman were killed during an attack on a community by gunmen. 33 houses were set ablaze during the attack which followed a rise in tensions between the local Irigwe community and Fulani herders over alleged cattle rustling and land disputes.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , Vanguard (9 )

title: Bandits vs Hunters, Katsina
description: 11 local hunters including Abdulaziz Bawa, Muntari Kaura, Nura, and Yahaya both of Tashar Tsamiya and Umar Bawa from 4 villages of Kaurawa, Gidan Goge, Tashar Tsamiya and Zan Bago were killed by armed bandits while hunting in the forest.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , This Day (11 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 3 soldiers, 2 policemen and also looted foodstuff and livestock.

title: Boko Haram vs Travellers, Borno
description: A Toyota Hilux and a truck filled with bags of beans were set ablaze while 7 travelers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents along the Maiduguri-Damaturu highway. The victims were traveling during the late hours when they came under attack.
place: Outskirts of Auno village,along Maiduguri-Damaturu highway

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin in a subsidiary operation called 'Operation Chingaba', killed 9 bandits and rescued 0 men, 4 women, and 4 minors from their hideouts.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Independent (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , The Punch (9 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some motorists in a convoy of security escort ran over IEDs allegedly planted on the highway by Boko Haram insurgents. An unspecified number of people were killed. It is assumed that 20 people died in the incident. However, it was unclear if soldiers were among the dead.

title: Herdsmen Kill Pastor, Delta
description: Fulani herdsmen stormed a branch of the Celestial Church of Christ, Breakthrough Cathedral, Ibusa, Parish I, and killed Stephen Akpor, the resident pastor who was praying and counseling his members

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Airstrikes conducted by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya led to the deaths of some civilians. Contrary to the report, reliable, information confirmed that the target location was occupied solely by Boko Haram Terrorists.

title: Robbers Kill Man, Delta
description: A man identified as David died after he was hit by a stray bullet during an armed robbery attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The attackers shot sporadically on noticing that they were being followed by local vigilante and police.

title: Herdsmen Kill 4, Plateau
description: A 34-four-year-old pastor of ECWA church, Mathew Tagwai, and 3 other persons were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen during a raid on a community at night. Two of the victims were identified as Joseph and Ishaku Clement.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Boko Haram vs Troops, Borno
description: 2 members of Boko Haram/Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed while unconfirmed numbers were injured by Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole. The soldiers had an encounter with the terrorist who rode in a convoy of seven-gun trucks and many motorcycles.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a driver conveying the corpse of Malam Yahuza Mai Hula, a resident of Birnin Gwari who died after a brief illness in Zaria. 15 people including 3 members of the same family and sympathizers of the dead man were kidnapped by the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Several people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an attack on the home town of the State governor. Houses were burnt down and shops were looted. An octogenarian was also shot before the insurgents were repelled by soldiers. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian and Nigerien troops, supported by Air Task Force (Nigeria) and Niger Republic Air Force, bombarded Boko Haram and the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) strongholds and killed several insurgents. 1 gun truck, 1 anti-aircraft gun and 1 motorcycle were recovered from them.
place: Kure village along Tumbun Rago and Tumbun Fulani general areas in Borno
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , The Guardian (19 ) , The Punch (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 people were killed when Boko Haram members invaded 2 communities that share border with Sambisa forest. They looted foodstuff and livestock before setting some shops ablaze.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Mr. Joseph Ochogwu, an Inspector of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), was killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. He was killed in his line of duty.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram insurgents where killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. 10 captives were also rescued from the insurgents. The operation was conducted in conjunction with local hunters.

title: Police vs Kidnappers, Katsina
description: Ibrahim Maye and Bishir Mai Laya, alleged high-profile informants for kidnappers and bandits in Katsina State were killed by police in the process of passing information to kidnappers in the forest.

title: Task Force Kills Boy, Ebonyi
description: COVID-19: A 19-year-old boy was allegedly shot dead by a Council Chairman, Honourable Eni Uduma Chima who was enforcing the Coronavirus lockdown in the state with other Task Force members. Crisis broke when loyalists of a House of Representative member who organized a party contrary to the ban of social activities clashed with the Task Force. 2 other people were injured in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram (assuming 40) were killed in artillery fire and aerial bombardments by the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF). Few sources reported that some (assuming 20) of insurgents died in the attack. The operation was executed on the heels of reports that the insurgents concealed under the dense vegetation of the area to plan attacks.
sources_of_information: This Day (40 ) , Independent (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ondo
description: A rice farmer, Mr. Jacob Odushe, his son, Adura, and Victor Ejeh, were killed in their farms by suspected herdsmen. Victor was found dead after he was declared missing. Residents had earlier reported to the police that they saw a helicopter dropping arms to the attackers but nothing was done about it until the attack. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Herdsmen Kill, Plateau
description: 3 people were killed and 2 others inflicted with gunshots injuries when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked and set a community ablaze.
place: Ancha community, Miango District in Irigwe Chiefdom
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Bandits Attack, Sokoto
description: 22 people were killed when armed bandits attacked a community. The bandits arrived at the village and started shooting sporadically, killing people at sight and razed down several properties.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (22 ) , Nigerian Tribune (22 ) , Other newspaper 2 (22 ) , Vanguard (22 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 10 people were killed in 2 villages by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Houses were set ablaze in the 2-day-night attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , This Day (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Air Task Force of the Operation Lafiya Dole destroyed one of the strongholds of the Boko Haram insurgents. They attack which, resulted in the destruction of some of their structures as well as the killing of several terrorists. It is assumed that 20 Boko Haram insurgents were killed.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Mr. Danaladi Barde, a former District Head of Jagindi Tasha, and his brother Musa Barde, were killed by Fulani herdsmen, while the wife of Musa survived the attack with gunshot wound.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Military vs Bandits, Niger
description: Scores of bandits were killed by Military. The bandits were bombarded in an air raid conducted by the Air Force Jets following intelligence that the bandits assembled under a tree in the area. It is assumed 40 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: Independent (40 ) , The Punch (40 ) , This Day (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji neutralized 9 bandits and released some kidnapped victims from their holds. This event is linked with incident in event PAR011770.
place: Gidan Usman, Gidan Babagoji, Gadauna, Gidan Janari, Kekuwaje, Gidan Sarki, Gardi and Bingi
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Independent (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , The Nation (9 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: Troops under Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD) killed 31 bandits. This event is linked with incident in event PAR011762.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of the Islamic State for West African Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed when the military bombarded their hideout with fighter jets. It is assumed that at least 40 insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Not less than 70 soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram ambush on their convoy. Insurgents fired rocket-propelled grenades at a lorry carrying the troops. Fatalities may likely rise as several soldiers were injured and many others allegedly abducted. The convoy was attacked on its way to launch an offensive on a camp belonging to Insurgents affiliated to the Islamic State group in the area.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (70 ) , Web Newspaper (70 ) , Other newspaper 2 (47 ) , The Guardian (70 ) , Other newspaper 3 (51 ) , Vanguard (50 ) , The Punch (70 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram fighters were killed by soldiers during a foiled attack on a community. 3 AK47 rifles, 2 hand grenades and 1 Tecno phone were recovered. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Bandits vs Policeman/Soldiers, Niger
description: 20 people including a Mobile Police Officer were killed when bandits numbering over 50 on motorcycles raided 2 communities. Scores of residents including 3 military men were wounded. Many others were allegedly abducted. A subsequent report stated that 17 policemen, 12 soldiers and 3 civilians were ambushed and killed while on a rescue mission.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (20 ) , PM News (29 ) , The Nation (27 ) , Nigerian Tribune (32 )

title: Hunters vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Hunters repelled an attack on a community by Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters and killed 2 of the attackers. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Plateau
description: 2 soldiers and 2 civilians were killed in an ambush by gunmen. Their AK47 riffles were taken from them too. The soldiers were part of the team drafted to the community to maintain peace between community youths and Fulani herdsmen

title: Assailants vs Man, Delta
description: A man identified as Omoghene Akakor was murdered by some assailants and his corpse was taken away by the hoodlum. The victim was killed as a result of the on-going crisis in a community.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole killed many Boko Haram insurgents during clearance operations. Top Boko Haram commander Abu Usamah, was among those Boko Haram insurgents killed during the encounter.
place: Gorigi in the Allagarno Forest axis
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (100 ) , Independent (100 ) , The Guardian (100 ) , This Day (100 ) , Other newspaper 3 (100 ) , The Nation (100 )

title: Police vs Bandit, Katsina
description: A bandit was shot dead by operatives of the Nigerian police during a gun duel. It was reported that the victim was part of the bandits who attacked some villages. 60 cows and 80 sheep were recovered from the bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 16 people were killed by bandits when they attacked a community. It was reported that the gunmen entered the community and were shooting at the people indiscriminately.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Islamic State of West Africa Province/Boko Haram leaders and fighters were killed during a meeting in a cluster of buildings by Operation Lafiya Dole. It is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed during a shootout with policemen. 2 kidnapped victims were rescued from the bandits.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Soldiers killed 24 bandits after a distress call that the bandits were attacking people and rustling cows.
place: Gurbin Magarya, Kwari and Garin Gado villages
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (24 ) , The Punch (24 ) , Nigerian Tribune (24 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed by soldiers during an operation. 7 males and 2 females kidnapped by bandits were rescued and several arms and ammunition were recovered.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen killed 7 persons in separate attacks in some communities. It was reported that the attacks were carried out simultaneously. It was reported that the gunmen razed houses and property in the communities.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 5 commanders of a terrorist group, Ansaru, and 12 bandits were killed in a joint air and ground operation carried out by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and the Nigeria Police.

title: Bandits vs Twin, Zamfara
description: A group of bandits suspected to be Fulani went to Birnin Magaji market and shot the popular twin brothers, Hassan and Husaini, dead. In retaliation, the people of the town killed 3 Fulani people.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The driver of a vehicle conveying some candidates for the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) was killed by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped some of the candidates and a one-and-half-year-old boy.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigerian Air Force fighter-jets bombed the logistics base of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP). It was reported that a number of terrorists were killed in the attack. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 insurgents were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 )

title: Communal Crisis, Ebonyi
description: A 70-year-old woman from Amana community, in the Ezza South LGA was killed by assailants working for Ohankwu people in Ikwo LGA due to the conflict over a mining site in a boundary between Ngbo community and Ohankwu communities. Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 4 weeks

title: Herdsmen vs Mourners, Benue
description: 7 mourners were killed while scores of others were injured by Fulani herdsmen who attacked those on wake keep. It was reported that the herders unleashed mayhem on several communities.
place: Chongu, Tse Ayev and Tyohembe communities

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 4 people were kill by bandits during a fresh attack on a village. It was reported that the armed men on motorcycles invaded the village and rustled cows belonging to the villagers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Daily Trust (8 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that 2 of the insurgent surrender to the troops during the encournter.

title: Bandits vs Family, Edo
description: A man identified as Mr. Moses Lawrence Iyoha and his brother were killed by some bandits who attacked the duo. It was reported that the gunmen kidnapped the duo and later killed them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Multi-National Joint Task Force killed Boko Haram and Islamic State West African Province top commanders during a clearance operation. Those killed were identified as Mallam Bakura and his aides. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Youths vs Herders, Kogi
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen were killed by youths n a community. They were grazing their cows in a bush when the youths attacked them, killing two of them and injuring three others.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 6 bandits lost their lives during a gun duel with the police. The bandits also kidnapped some members of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC). They were later rescued by the polce

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Police killed a bandit and arrested 2 others for writing a threatening letter to villagers to raise N3m within 3 days or the whole community would be wiped out.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko Haram terrorists were neutralised during an aerial bombardment by the fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force. The incident happened during a clearance operation that targeted the terrorists' settlement.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 )

title: Bandits Kill 1, Sokoto
description: 1 person was killed and 6 others were kidnapped by bandits during an attack on a community. The bandits attacked in their large number.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed during aerial bombardment by the NAF. It is assumed 10 of the insurgents were killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdate by 2 days.

title: Bandits Kill 8, Zamfara
description: 8 people were killed when dozens of bandits raided a community. Cows and domestic animals were also carted away by the attackers.

title: Communal Clash, Edo
description: A man was killed during a clash between Itsekiri and Benin youths over development levy. The crisis which started with request for N100,000 levy later escalated to a cult war and communal clash. Some people sustained gunshot and machete injuries.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens (assuming at least 24) of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the NAF. Their structures were also destroyed in the operation. Another source reported that scores of the insurgents were killed, meaning that at least 40 insurgents died.
place: Bula Korege on the fringes of the Sambisa Forest

title: Cult Clash, Ondo
description: 4 people were shot dead during a rival cult clash in Adekunle Ajasin University. Among the victims was Mr. Olakunle Maththew Olayinka, a 300-level student of the Department of Biochemistry.
sources_of_information: Independent (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 7 Mobile Policemen (MOPOL) and a civilian were killed in a Boko Haram attack. The victims were recently drafted into the area before their deaths. Military and MOPOL bases were burnt down and arms were carted away by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Nation (6 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead by the troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the insurgent attempted to overrun a town with 30 gun trucks. It was reported that 2 Civilian Joint Task Force members and 4 policemen were killed in the operation.
sources_of_information: The Punch (29 ) , The Nation (26 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Bandits Kill 2, Zamfara
description: The Village head of Kujemi, Malam Gambo and Mustapha Halilu were killed by bandits. The ruler was on a visit to Karauchi when he was attacked.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 Boko Haram fighter was shot dead by troops of 192 Battalion durring a clearance operation. Several insurgents escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Bandits Kill 51, Kaduna
description: 4 villages were attacked by bandits and 51 residents were killed. The attackers stormed the affected villages shortly after Islamic early morning prayers. Many houses were set ablaze and foodstuff were carted away. Many of the bandits were also killed in the attack. It is assumed 10 of the bandits were killed.
place: Kerawa, Rago, Marina, Zariyawa, Hashimawa, and Unguwar Barau
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (61 ) , PM News (50 ) , Other newpapers 1 (51 ) , The Nation (51 )

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Niger
description: Not less than 40 bandits were killed by vigilantes led by a 70-year-old woman. Some of the bandits were arrested while others fled. Weapons were also recovered from the bandits. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of 19 Brigade under Operation Ayiso Tamonuma. It ware reported that the terrorists attack the troops but lost many of their fighters.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the combined troops of 19 Brigade, 127 Battalion, 130 Battalion, 707 Special Forces Battalion, 101 Battalion, Army Strike Group, 375 Artillery Regiment and elements of Headquarters Sector 3 Explosive Ordnance Team. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 insurgents were killed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters (assuming at least 10) were killed during a raid by NAF. Their motorcycles were destroyed in the process. The fighters were believed to have converged in the location to plan attacks on civilians and soldiers. The second source reported that scores (at least 40) were killed in the incident.

title: Soldier Kills Colleagues, Borno
description: A soldier fighting Boko Haram counter-insurgency in Borno State killed 4 of his colleagues and shot himself dead. 2 other soldiers were injured.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters (assuming 10) were killed by combined troops of 152 Battalion and 21 Special Armoured Brigade in conjunction with elements of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Boko Haram Kill Christians, Borno
description: Islamic State West Africa Province (SWAP) fighters claimed to have executed 8 Christians. Images were released to back up the claim.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 5 bandits were shot dead during a gun battle with the police. It was reported that bandits have been terrorising some communities before the shoout out.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 9 Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. 28 women and children were rescued during the operation.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Boko Haram insurgents mounted a checkpoint along Damaturu-Gashua road. Many people were feared killed. It is assumed about 10 people were killed in the operation. Among them were vigilantes.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: There were fears some residents were killed during an invasion on a community by Boko Haram insurgents. It is assumed about 5 people died in the incident of which 2 were soldiers. Houses and churches in the community were burnt as well.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Katsina
description: A suspected bandit, Abubakar Nayabale and vigilante member were killed in a shootout. The bandits had attempted to kidnap one Yahaya Tella but met resistance from youths and vigilantes.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A top ranking commander if the Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) was killed alongside some of his men during an aerial bombardment of their meeting venues. It is assumed about 5 ISWAP fighters were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Independent (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: The village head of Bang community known as Chief Alfa Yayu was killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the community has been constantly attacked by the herders in the past.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many people were killed when Boko Haram terrorists stormed a community in a convoy of gun trucks and motorcycles. Most of the victims were returning from their farms when they were attacked. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Edo
description: A 45-year-old farmer identified as Onne Owoh and a palm wine tapper known as Samuel Imonkhai were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the duo were killed while they were plying their trade.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Electrocution, Kaduna
description: Mr. Tony Iwelu, the Chief Security Officer (CSO) to the Minister of Transportation, Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi, was electrocuted by a shower rose in a hotel while on an official assignment. However, few sources reported that he was killed in a train attack bandits.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: A man identified as Hamza Esu was shot dead by bandits who also injured another person known as Yakubu. It was reported that the incident happened in the night when the victims were riding on a motorcycle and ran into the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 30, Katsina
description: 30 people were killed during raids on 2 communities by bandits. The attack was believed to be reprisal attacks for the murder of 2 people of Fulani extractions. Nigerian president, Muhammadu Buhari, asked his kinsmen not to revenge the attack to avert further bloodshed.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed by the Air Force. It is assumed about 10 insurgents were killed as the sources reported several fighters were killed. Their camp was also destroyed in the bombardment. This incident is backdated y 2 days since no date was reported.
place: Kirta Wulgo on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Niger
description: An Inspector of Police, Ibrahim Mitra, and an agent of a vigilance group were killed in an encounter with bandits who had earlier rustled about 300 cows. The victims succeeded in recovering the cows but were killed a day later. 6 of the bandits were also killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Soldiers, Plateau
description: 2 soldiers attached to the Operation Safe Haven (OPSH) were killed by Fulani herdsmen in the night. The killing led to the destruction of about 150 houses belonging to Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: About 14 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they invaded a community. It was reported that the marauders arrived the community with a large number of cattle and destroyed farms before the incident happened. A version of the story stated that they were accompanied by soldiers during the killing.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (14 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Nation (12 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 30 people were killed by bandits who stormed 2 communities on motorcycles. It was reported that the bandits invaded the communities when Muslim residents were about observing Magrib prayer.
sources_of_information: The Punch (30 ) , Daily Trust (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (33 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 21 people, including a family of 11, were killed by bandits in an attack on a village. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack on hunters and local guards who attack the bandits.

title: Herdsmen Kill 14, Delta
description: 14 people mostly farmers were killed at different locations by suspected Fulani herdsmen. They were killed when they resisted herdsmen from grazing on their farmlands. 1 of the victims was Edjvwegha Eninwegha, the younger brother of an ex-President General.
place: Avwon, Agadama and Ohoror communities of Uwheru kingdom
sources_of_information: The Guardian (14 ) , Vanguard (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara 1
description: 13 bandits were killed in different operations in Zamfara, Katsina and Kebbi states. 7 of the victims were assumed to have been killed in 3 LGAs in Zamfara State.
place: Tungar Mata, Tuduki, Kawaye, Mararaban Kawaye, Moriki, Belhi, Ruwar Kura, Kyaram, Gallai and Shirkai villages.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Katisna 2
description: 13 bandits were reported to have been killed across Zamfara, Katsina and Kebbi states.3 of the victims were assumed to have died in Katsina State.
place: Tsauwa, Dankar and Yan Gayya villages

title: Bandits Kill 4, Plateau
description: 4 people were killed during an attack on a village by bandits. The victims were teenagers.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram fighters and a soldier died in a gun battle. 7 members of the Islamic States West African Province (ISWAP) were also arrested while 9 women and children were rescued. A soldier was killed in the operation. 11 ISWAP members were also arrested.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 30 people were killed by Boko Haram fighters when they attacked stranded travelers at the outskirts of a city. Most of the victims were burnt to death. Some people were kidnapped and over 18 vehicles burnt. One of the victims was identified as Nana Fatima Babagana, a graduating female student of Mass Communication Department, University of Maiduguri.
place: Auno checkpoint on the outskirts of Maiduguri
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (30 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Daily Trust (30 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kebbi 3
description: 13 bandits were reported to have been killed across Zamfara, Katsina and Kebbi states.3 of the victims were assumed to have died in Kebbi State.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram commanders were killed during an aerial bombardment of their meeting venue by the Nigerian Air Force fighter jets. The terrorists were holding meeting when the incident happened. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Niger
description: 3 people were killed and over 15 people were injured during an attack on a community by bandits. The attack was carried out in the morning.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons were killed and another person critically injured in a fresh attack by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders stormed the community in the night, shooting sporadically.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: A middle-aged man was killed while a 17-year-old girl was kidnapped by some Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community in the evening. It was reported that the herders have been causing mayhem in the community.

title: Police vs Terrorists, Kaduna
description: The special operatives of Operation Puff Adder of the Nigeria Police, backed by the Special Forces of the Police Airwing decimated 250 members of the Ansaru terror group in forest. The forest was the operational camp of the Ansaru terror group. A pilot and co-pilot were injured in the operation. Also, Inspector Muhammed Abubakar of the Nigeria Police Force, Mallam Abba, a commander of Boko Haram and one Mofa, a notorious kidnapper, were killed during the operation.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (251 ) , Vanguard (251 ) , Daily Trust (250 ) , The Guardian (251 )

title: Police vs Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: 3 cattle rustlers were killed during a gun battle with the police. They were part of a gang that rustled 13 cattle from a village.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters loyal to the Islamic State West Province (ISWAP) were killed by the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole during air raids. It was reported that the base of the terrorists was also destroyed in the raid. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 5 persons were shot dead by bandits who invaded several communities. It was reported that the bandits rode into the communities on motorcycles, shooting randomly.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: 6 vigilantes were killed by bandits who invade a community. It was reported that the vigilantes were killed when they intercepted the bandits with a large herd of cattle.

title: Political Violence, Oyo
description: A PDP member, Alajase, and another person known as Isah Azeez were killed during a clash over local council administration. the 2 main political groups in the state, PDP and the All progressives Congress (APC) have been in contention over the control of council areas in the state.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Independent (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Bandits Kill Man, Katsina
description: A middle aged man was shot dead inside a market by bandits. The attackers had pursued 3 men into the market and killed 1 of them. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Some bandits killed 1 person while 3 others were seriously injured. They also abducted an imam and 19 other persons. The bandits invaded several communities on motorcycles with sophisticated guns, cutlasses and knives.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Chieftaincy Tussle, Kogi
description: 3 people were killed during a crisis that erupted between two clans over a chieftaincy tussle. The incident happened when some youths from both opposing clans engaged themselves in a fight. Many houses were also razed. Tahiru Abdul, a 47-year-old man, behind the killing, was responsible for the killing of the 2 brothers, an ex-Naval officer and the other a traditional title holder.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 female suicide bombers, who attempted to infiltrate a crowd, hurriedly detonated their improvised explosive devices killing themselves and 2 other people.
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed they killed about 2 soldiers and 4 civilians during an attack on a military base. The civilians were hit by stray bullets. Foodstuffs and cash were looted by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 passengers were killed and another one critically injured when suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked commuters along Maiduguri-Damaturu road. A report stated that 2 of the victims were truck drivers.
place: Near Auno along the Maiduguri-Damaturu road
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , The Punch (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (2 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: A Nollywood actor called Juwon was killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. he was attacked while on transit with some other Nollywood actors.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: A pregnant woman and 16 others were killed in an overnight attack by Fulani herdsmen. The herdsmen also burnt many houses in the community.
