title: Farmer vs Fulani Crisis, Taraba
description: 3 people were killed and houses burnt following a bloody clash between Fulani and Tiv farmers. The crisis started when Fulani herders invaded a beans farm and killed the owner, Mr Dooior James. 2 others were killed in reprisal attacks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 people including a female suicide bomber and 3 other worshipers were killed in a mosque. The bomber attacked the mosque while prayer was going on.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed during aerial bombardment. by NAF. Their defensive parapets and underground tunnels were also destroyed. It is assumed that 20 insurgents were killed.
place: Tumbun Rego on the fringes of Lake Chad and at Bula Bello near the Sambisa Forest

title: Bandits.Kidnapeprs, Kaduna
description: About 50 armed bandits suspected to be kidnappers killed a vigilante and abducted the wife of a popular medical doctor (Mrs Ataga) and her children. She was killed after 7 days in captivity after the N150 million ransom could not be paid.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Trado-Medical Practitioner, Oyo
description: Alhaji Fatai Yusuf, the founder of Oko Oloyun worldwide and a renowned alternative therapist was shot dead by unknown gunmen.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 loggers were killed by Boko Haram fighters when they attack a community. It was reported that the attack happened in the morning while the logger were trying to collect firewood.

title: Bandits, Niger
description: Armed bandits numbering about 50 invaded 5 communities and killed 11 people. The bandits also kidnapped 4 women and rustled over 300 livestock.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 ) , Other newspaper 2 (11 )

title: Bandits vs Student, Niger
description: Mathias Livinus, a postgraduate student of the Othman Da Fodio University, Sokoto, was killed by bandits when he visited his parents in their village. He was riding on a motorcycle when he ran into the bandits who sprayed bullets on him.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Intense gunfire between Boko Haram, and Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), led to the death of several members. It is assumed that about 10 terrorists died in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A Nigerian Army officer and 7 soldiers were killed in a fierce battle against Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the troops repelled the attack by the insurgents which also left 5 soldiers wounded. Many insurgents were also killed. Due to the nature of the report, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (17 ) , The Punch (16 ) , Daily Trust (18 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits who specialized in kidnapping were gunned down by the police. So kidnap victims were rescued.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Boko Haram vs CAN Chairman, Adamawa
description: Reverend Lawal Andimi, the Chairman of the local chapter of Christian Association of Nigeria, CAN, in Michika was abducted and killed by Boko Haram fighters. He was beheaded.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of 159 Battalion belonging to the Nigerian Army. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: Armed bandits ambushed local vigilantes and killed about 7 of them. They also injured several others in the attack. It was reported that the bandits also burnt 50 motorcycles belonging to the vigilante. The incident happened when the vigilantes mobilized to launch an attack on the bandits hideout.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The troops of 3 Battalion repelled a Boko Haram attack on a community and killed a Boko Haram fighter. in the process, 1 Boko Haram criminal suicide truck driver strapped with a suicide vest was killed. Other report said scores of the terrorists (20) were neutralised.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 bandits were gunned by the police during a gun duel between the hoodlums and the police. It was reported the bandits kidnapped some people before police stormed their hideout.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a military checkpoint and killed 2 soldiers but lost some of their members too. It is assumed about 5 insurgents were killed in the encounter.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Niger
description: Mallam Ahmad Yakubu, the village head of Rumache, was murdered by some Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that 17 villagers were kidnapped in the attack.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Nigeria Air Force conducted air strikes against the Boko Haram camp, killed so many Boko Haram fighters, and destroyed several structures.It is assumed that about 10 terrorists were killed.
place: Kollaram at lake Chad near Gudumball

title: Communal Clash, Enugu
description: A man identified as Basil Onwukwe was killed during a communal clash betwee Amaeke and Amagu autonomous communities. Both communities have been enmeshed in age-long crisis as a result of land dispute.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 17 soldiers were killed while many others were abducted in confrontations between the army and Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that scores of people were abducted in the incidents. It was reported that several insurgents were also killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Punch (27 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , This Day (27 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: 14 people were killed by gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community in the evening and started shooting sporadically.

title: Herdsmen kill 2, Edo
description: 2 men identified as members of the Lord's Chosen Church were abducted and murdered by Fulani herdsmen. The victims were identified as Basil Odoji and Innocent Udoh. The incident happened while the victims were traveling on the highway in the night. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated to the middle of the month of January. They were abducted and murdered by Abdullahi Usman, Abdulkadiri Mohammed, Mohammed Lawan, Bello Umar and Musa Lawan

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a military post and killed four soldiers. Details of the atatck were not provided.

title: Ansaru Terrorists Attack Emir's Convoy, Kaduna
description: The convoy of the Emir of Potiskum, Alhaji Umaru Bubaram, was attacked by Ansaru terrorists. 6 people were killed and many were allegedly kidnapped. 4 of the dead victims were aides to the monarch while 2 were commuters. Ansaru claimed it killed 22 people in the attack.
place: Fandatio village near Maraban Jos on the Kaduna-Zaria Highway
sources_of_information: Vanguard (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (22 )

title: Health Workers, Zamfara
description: 2 health workers supervising a polio vaccination exercise, Aliyu Suleiman and Aliyu Muhammad, were shot dead by bandits during an altercation. Another workers sustained injuries. Women who on queue for the vaccination were robbed by the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Kill Christian, Borno
description: A 22-year-old Christian student of the University of Maiduguri, Ropvil Daciya Dalep, was executed by an 8-year-old Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighter. The victim who was from Plateau State was kidnapped on his way back from school. It is assumed he was killed in Gwoza, Boko Haram's stronghold.
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (1 ) , Web Newspaper (1 ) , Independent (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 2 health workers were killed by bandits. The incident happened the bandits attacked a village.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: About 29 people were killed by bandits during attacks on a village. It was reported that the bandits came in large number to attack the village. Several people were injured.
sources_of_information: The Punch (29 ) , Daily Trust (14 ) , The Nation (28 )

title: Bandits vs Soldier, Kaduna
description: A personnel of the the Nigerian Air Force, Aircraftman Mukhtar Ibrahim, and three others were killed by some bandits. The incident happened when the bandits ambushed some personnel of the Nigerian Air Force.
place: in Unguwan Yako, near Buruku, along the Kaduna- Birnin Gwari road,.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 passengers in a vehicle traveling on a highway were killed while 7 others were abducted by Boko Haram fighters. It was reported that the terrorists laid siege road before killing the victim.

title: Troops kill 3 bandits, Sokoto
description: Troops reportedly killed 3 bandits in Miyanchi

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A high ranking commander of the Islamic State, West African Province (ISWAP), Khalifa Umar, was among those killed in an air strike attack on one of the insurgents’ hideout by NAF. It is assumed that 10 people were killed in the incident.
place: Tunbums Sabo area of Lake Chad Basin
sources_of_information: This Day (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Benue
description: 2 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community in the early hours of the day with sophisticated weapons. The victims were identified as Mr. Emmanuel Torkule and his friend.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 3 bandits were shot dead by troops of 8 Division, Nigerian Army. It reported that the army engaged the bandits who doubled as catted rustlers and killed the victims.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: 2 people were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the attack also led to massive destruction of property as over 100 houses and valuables worth millions of Naira were set ablaze.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: 1 person was killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani militias who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: A Tiv man was killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani militias who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 4 people were killed and 21 others, including a Chief Imam, Mallam Umar Mohammed were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community in the morning. It was reported that some people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: 2 teenagers were killed, while several others were injured by bandits who waylaid motorists at a checkpoint. It was reported that they also abducted 4 Customs officers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters were decimated by troops of 112 Task Force Battalion. It was reported that the troops captured one AK47 rifle, other arms and ammunition. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Several bandits lost their lives when the 17 Brigade of the Nigerian Army launched attack on their hideouts and camps in a forest. 2 soldiers were wounded in the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 13 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they invaded a village in the midnight. It was reported that the herders have been terrorising members of the village.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of the Boko Haram terrorists were shot by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened during clearance operation aimed at flushing out the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a military post abandoned by Chadian soldiers. Not less than 3 soldiers were killed. A 3rd party observer, CBC news claimed 25 soldiers lost their lives while Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) claimed 8 soldiers were killed. The terrorists also burnt over 300 tents, killed 8 civilians and injured others at a mega Internally Displaced Persons’ (IDP) camp.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (25 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A police base was attacked by Boko Haram fighters and 3 officers were killed. Another officer was injured. The attackers were dressed on military camouflage.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Many bandits were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the troops of the 17 Brigade engaged the bandits and killed many of them. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 of the bandits were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 32 people including soldiers were killed while more than 35 others were injured when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted by Boko Haram members exploded on a bridge in a market place.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (32 ) , The Nation (30 ) , This Day (30 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed when some bandits invaded a village in the night. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village on motorcycles, shot sporadically and kidnapped some persons.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: 35 people were killed while 58 others were abducted following the invasion of 10 communities by bandits in Chikun and Birnin Gwari Local Government Areas
place: Badna, Zankoro, Hayin Damisa, Unguwan Badole, Badimi, Kuderi and Unguwan Doma in Chukun LGA while others include: Rumana Gbagyi, Rumana Hausa and Malomo in Birnin Gwari LGA.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed in airstrikes by NAF. Their camps were also destroyed. It is assumed that not less than 10 of the terrorists lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead when they ambushed the convoy of the Theatre Commander of Operation Lafiya Dole, Major-General Olusegun Adeniyi. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 insurgents were killed in the attack. Another version of the report stated that the driver of Major-General Olusegun was killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Guardian (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (21 )

title: Boko Haram Kill Christians, Borno
description: 2 Christian captives were beheaded in a video by the Islamic State West Africa Province. It is assumed the incident occurred in Gwoza LGA where they have a strong base.

title: Gunmen Kill 4 Soldiers, Niger
description: An army Captain and 3 soldiers were killed in an ambush by bandits. It was alleged that some civilians (assuming 5) lost their lives in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Nation (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , The Punch (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A military post was attacked by Boko Haram insurgents who disguised as soldiers. 6 soldiers and 5 civilians were killed. 2 boys sustained machete cuts and properties were destroyed.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Umar Isah, a lecturer at the School of Basic and Remedial Studies (SBRS) Ahmadu Bello University (ABU) based in Funtua Council, was killed by bandits who attacked several communities. It was reported that the bandits attacked the communities at night.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram terrorists (assuming at least 10) were killed during a clearance operation by troops. 461 Boko Haram captives were rescued.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , This Day (6 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 siblings, Joel Fali (16 years), and Kwakwi Fali (14 years), and a 35-year-old farmer, Yusuf Yakubu were killed during an attack by Boko Haram. Several houses were burnt.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 4 Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the insurgents invaded a community and looted some shops.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , The Nation (15 )

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army and other security forces killed 16 bandits and arrested several others during a clearance operation. It was reported that 12 kidnapped victims were also rescued in the operation.

title: Herdsmen vs Community, Kogi
description: About 19 persons were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. It was reported that the motorbike-riding gunmen numbering about 100 razed the king's palace and also attacked places of worship.
sources_of_information: The Punch (19 ) , Daily Trust (23 ) , Other newspaper 3 (19 ) , Other newpapers 1 (29 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 4 Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out the insurgents. It was reported that a gun truck, two motorcycles, one anti-aircraft gun and two AK47 rifles were captured by the troops of 144 Battalion.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of Boko Haram fighters were killed during aerial bombardments by NAF. The insurgents were targeted when they converged on a location in preparation for attacks on soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 men were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a village and looted dozens of bicycles. It was reported that the insurgents attacked the village while the residents were sleeping.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several (assuming at least 10) Boko Haram fighters were kileld when NAF bombarded their structures and camps.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed a vigilante, abducted 2 others and set ablaze a church, primary school and primary health care centre.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army Super Camp 7 killed 1 terrorist, captured 1 alive and rescued 8 women and 6 children.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: Bandits invaded the house of Alhaji Tasiu Wali and abducted his wife Hajiya Asmau Tasiu, her one-year baby daughter, Husaina Tasiu and Abu Abu.Ibrahim Usman, a passerby, died after he was hit by a stray bullet.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: Fulani herdsmen numbering about 20 invaded a Tiv village, killed 2 people and injured over 6 people. The attack came as a result of loggerhead with the villagers over land grazing.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Fighters of the Islamic West Africa Province (ISWAP) raided a community and killed 7 people. They also abducted 4 others.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Delta
description: A yet-to-be-identified man was gunned down by unknown gunmen in a market. It was reported that the gunmen killed the man without collecting anything from him. A version of the report stated that the victim was mistakenly shot dead by his gang members.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber who attempted to detonate an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) strapped to his body died after detonating the bomb strapped on him. He was trying to gain entry into the base when the IED exploded.
place: Nigerian Army base in Sambisa Forest.

title: Boko Haram Kill Christians, Borno
description: The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), a faction of Boko Haram, executed 11 Christians in revenge for the killings of their leaders, including Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi and Abul-Hasan Al-Muhajir in Iraq and Syria. The killings were contained in a video.
sources_of_information: This Day (11 ) , The Punch (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (11 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 persons lost their lives while three others were injured when some Boko Haram fighters attacked some residents. It was reported that the attackers stormed the community when most residents were preparing for Christmas eve church services.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Kebbi
description: 2 farmers were killed by cattle rustlers and their animals were stolen. The attackers who were believed to have come from Zamfara State shot sporadically before making away with the stolen animals.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber and 3 fighters were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Niger
description: Gunmen, who came on a motorcycle, attacked a village and killed 2 people. The victims would have being more if not for an old man, Gajere, who first sighted the bandits and raised the alarm.

title: Boko Haram vs Aid Workers, Borno
description: 4 humanitarian aid workers including an enumerator with Action Against Hunger ACF, a staff with Solidarity International, a yet to be identified person, and a Deeper Life pastor who repaired fans and stabilizers were ambushed and killed by Boko Haram insurgents on their way to Monguno.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 persons were killed by Boko Haram fighters during raids on some villages. About 48 of the insurgents were gunned down by troops of the Nigerian Army during a counter attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (50 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters attacked a military checkpoint, killed 3 soldiers and a CJTF member. Residents of the community were spared.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Yobe
description: An Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) commander, Abu Muqhtar, and 30 of his fighters were killed by soldiers during an attempt to infiltrate a community. 2 soldiers lost their lives in the encounter according to another report.
sources_of_information: Independent (31 ) , Vanguard (31 ) , The Nation (31 ) , This Day (31 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (32 )

title: Bandits, Niger
description: Bandit stormed a community on motorcycles shooting sporadically in the air with firearms, and in the process, killed 8 people.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation LAFIYA DOLE under the auspices of Operation RATTLESNAKE struck a part of the cluster buildings where Boko Haram terrorist reside and killed several of them. It is assumed abut 20 insurgents lost their lives.
place: Ngoske in the Sambisa Forest area

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unspecified number of Boko Haram insurgents were bombed while having a meeting. It is assumed no fewer than 10 insurgents were killed in the bombing by NAF.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram killed 19 cattle herders. The herders repelled an attack by the insurgents who invaded their village to steal livestock. 1 of the insurgents was killed.
place: Fuhe village, near Ngala close to the border with Cameroon

title: Boko Haram vs Aid Workers, Borno
description: 4 aid workers working for Action Against Hunger in the North-Eastern part of the country were butchered by Boko Haram terrorists. The victims were captured in July 25, 2019 while working in the region.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , This Day (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 14 civilian militia group members and a Mobile Policeman were killed when Boko Haramd and ISWAP attacked a security check point.

title: Bandits vs Customs Officers, Kogi
description: 2 Customs Officers, Assistant Superintendents of Customs, Sunday Ohiremen and Sunday Omale were shot dead and 1 other was injured by bandits.

title: Bandits vs Customs Officers, Kogi
description: 2 Customs officers identified as Assistant Superintendent of Customs I. S. Ohiremen and Assistant Superintendent of Customs 2 S. M. Omale were shot dead by unidentified bandits. Another Customs officer, Deputy Superintendent of Customs H. I Oladapo, sustained gunshot injury.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Some soldiers were killed by Boko Haram fighters. This was captured in a video released by the Boko Haram terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the incident happened in Borno and it is backdated by 2 days.

title: 2 Villages Attacked, 4 killed
description: Two villages attacked by unknown gunmen resulting in 4 people being killed

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 40) were killed in an air interdiction by NAF. Their structures were also destroyed.
place: Kokiwa and Bula Korege on the fringes of Sambisa Forest

title: Gunmen vs Student, Kogi
description: A 400 level student of the Kogi State University, Anyigba, was killed by gunmen while he was writing his final exam. It was reported that the unknown gunmen shot the victim dead.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unspecified number of Boko Haram were killed during a foiled attack on some communities in Damboa. It is assumed that no fewer of 10 insurgents lost their lives in the encounter. Armoured vehicles and some motorcycles were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 3 soldiers on patrol were killed by an IED explosion allegedly planted by Boko Haram.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram fighter was killed in an ambush by soldiers. Many others were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an encounter with soldiers. They were believed to have been killed by a Rocket Propelled Grenade bomb.explosion

title: Boko Haram vs Security Operatives, Borno
description: 2 soldiers and a policeman were executed by the Boko Haram fighters belonging to the Islamic State of West African Province, ISWAP. The execution was shown on a video released by the group.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 soldiers were killed by Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) buried by Boko Haram fighters on the road. The victims were a commander of the 153 Task Force Battalion and 2 other soldiers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram fighters were killed by troops of 21 Special Armoured Brigade during a raid on the terrorists. It was reported that several insurgents were injured in the attack.Several women and children were rescued from the terrorists.
place: Mantari, Malam Masari and Gabchari villages

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram fighter was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a military operation aimed at wiping out insurgents. It was reported that several Boko Haram fighters were wounded. 2 AK47 rifles, 2 magazines loaded with 30 rounds of 7.6mm special ammunition and unexploded mortar bombs were found.

title: Bandits Attack District Head, Niger
description: Bandits attacked district head, killed 13 and abducted 6 people

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram fighter was neutralized during an encounter with the troops of 21 Special Armoured Brigade.
place: Mantari, Malam Masari and Gabchari Villages

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of 144 Battalion engaged and neutralised 3 insurgents. The incident happened Boko Haram terrorists attempted to infiltrate the troops' location.

title: Bandits, Niger
description: 11 people were killed in an attack by bandits. The victims were preparing to go to church when they were raided. Over 20 people sustained serious injuries.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (11 ) , The Nation (11 ) , The Punch (11 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram fighters were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to infiltrate a military base. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 persons were killed.

title: Police vs IPOB Members, Imo
description: Two IPOB family members who were peacefully gathered were killed by the police. The attack was believed to be a reprisal attack for the murder of 2 policemen in Anambra State (see event in IBD017955)

title: IPOB vs Police, Anambra
description: 2 policemen, Assistant Commissioner of Police, Oliver Inoma-Abbey and Assistant Superintendent of Police, Joseph Akubo and 3 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) lost their lives during a clash between policemen and the group as security operatives invaded the home of Nnamdi Kanu's lawyer. A police van was burnt during the clash.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram fighter was shot dead during an encounter between the insurgents and troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the gun duel last for one hour.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Akwa Ibom
description: 3 Fulani herdsmen killed a farmer identified as Peter Asuquo in his farm. It was reported that the herdsmen stabbed the victim to death. The killers were identified as Shehu Ule, Aliyu Umar and Neusa Adamu.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) destroyed several Boko Haram terrorist strongholds and killed 13 of them while many others sustained injuries.

title: Attack on Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko Haram Terrorists were killed in their hideout during an air operation by NAF component of Operation Lafiya Dole.
place: Ngoske on the fringes of Sambisa Forest

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was shot dead by soldiers during an attempt to attack a military location. 2 AK47 riffles were recovered from the attackers. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attempted to infiltrate a military location. They were repelled by soldiers and 3 insurgents were killed in the process. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Kaduna
description: Kasang Ambakadi and Clement Mosesnwere killed on the farm by gunmen. They were ambushed. For about a week, tension in the LGA remain high following attacks on cattle rustlers and reprisal attacks on farmers.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The meeting venue of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) was bombarded by NAF and many ISWAP fighters with their leaders. It is assumed about 10 casualties were reported. It is also assumed the incident took place in Abadam where similar bombardments had been carried out.

title: Gunmen Kill 14, Zamfara
description: 14 people were killed when bandits suspected to be of Fulani descent. 10 others were injured. The attack was believed to be reprisal attack on the murder of 9 of their colleagues by vigilantes in IBD017836.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (14 ) , The Punch (14 ) , The Nation (14 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming at lest 2 scores) of Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a foiled ambush on soldiers. Several items were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Gunmen Attack, Benue
description: 9 persons, including women and teenagers, were killed by unknown gunmen. The gunmen invaded a community on motorbikes, shooting sporadically and gunning down their victims.

title: Gunmen vs Hunters, Adamawa
description: 6 hunters were killed by gunmen believed to be members of Boko Haram. The attacks invaded the community on camels and shot indiscriminately on residents. The victims were shot while driving the attackers out from the community.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , This Day (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , Vanguard (11 )

title: Gunmen Kill 2 Farmers, Kaduna
description: 2 farmers were killed by gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen. There was no alleged provocation to the murder of the victims. while one was killed with a machete, the other was shot dead with a gun.

title: Rustlers Kill 4, Kaduna
description: 4 persons were killed by cattle rustlers in the early hours of the day. The victims were identified as: Hosea Ayuba, Ado Adamu, Abagu Danladi and Kusa Danladi. Their killing was believed to be a reprisal for the murder of a palm wine tapper.

title: Political Crisis, Bayelsa
description: Heavy shootings that rocked the venue of the PDP rally due to rival clash between supporters of the PDP and APC led to the death of Radio Bayelsa Outside Broadcast Van driver, Simon Onu, a supporter of PDP and others.
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 )

title: Gunmen vs Police, Bayelsa
description: Unknown gunmen shot dead 2 policemen and carted away their riffles. It was reported that the attack which happened at a police checkpoint took place in the early hours of the day.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were neutralized by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during an aerial bombardment aimed at wiping out the insurgents. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.
place: Malam Fatori on the fringes of the Lake Chad

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists and a soldier lost their lives during an encounter between the terrorists and the troops of the Nigerian Army. The clash happened when the Boko Haram fighters attempted to infiltrate a town.

title: Gunmen vs Security Guard, Osun
description: A security guard at a mining site was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The victim was shot in the chest by the gunmen in the night.
place: Aba-Aagun village via Itagun in Osu

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army while others escaped with gunshot wounds. An insurgent gun truck was destroyed, 4 AK 47 rifles and a cache of ammunition were recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents and a soldier lost their lives during a clearance operation by the troops of the Nigerian Army. The operation was aimed at clearing out the terrorists.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suspected Boko Haram was tortured and killed by some soldiers. It was reported that the incident was captured on a video which was circulated on social media. It is assumed that the incident happened 2 days before it was reported.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 9 Fulani were killed by members of a local vigilante, Yan Sakai, on suspicion that they were bandits. 2 weeks later, the carried out reprisal attack on the LGA and killed 14 residents (See event in IBD017834).
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (9 ) , The Nation (9 )

title: Communal Crisis, Edo
description: A man, Mr. Aghahowa Pulley, was killed by soldiers hired by a crown prince to quell a communal crisis. The Eonogie of Ogan and his sons were accused of diverting N171 proceeds from a burrow pit in the community. The palace was burnt down after the victim was victim killed.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Islamic State in West African Province (ISWAP) fighters (assuming at least 40) were killed in an ariel bombardment by NAF. There operational vehicles were also destroyed.
place: Arrinna Ciki on the fringe of the Lake Chad
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , This Day (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: Uchechukwu Onyibor, a six-year-old girl, died from the gunshot injuries she sustained after Fulani herdsmen attacked her and her parents in their house.

title: Police vs Bandits, Benue
description: 2 bandits were killed by the police during a gun duel. Weapons, phones and charms were recovered from the bandits. This incident is backdated by 2 days of its report sine no date was reported.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Bandits Kill 3, Niger
description: 3 people were killed when bandits raided some communities. 6 others were kidnapped and 1,200 cattle were rustled.
place: Beri Kargo, Kini, Anguwan Makaranta and Shema
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Army vs Bandit, Kaduna
description: A bandit was shot dead by troops of the Nigerian army. The incident happened when the army tried to rescue a 12-year-old boy identified as Rabe Abubakar, who was kidnapped by the bandits. Several other bandits were injured.
place: Sanyi village close to Liberia Forest

title: Cult Clash, Cross River
description: 5 persons lost their lives in a clash between some cultists and community residents. The cultists killed a man identified as Bukie Bankong while the villagers retaliated by killing 4 of them. There is an episodic but recurring crisis related to the struggle for control of revenue from the Boki oil palm estates. This is in addition to the kidnapping of three non-indigenes who reside in Boje community, Boki Local Government Area, on November 23, 2019.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army Headquarters killed a bandit and destroyed 2 camps belonging to the criminals. The army recovered one AK47 rifle, three motorcycles, two mobile phones and the sum of N5,000 from the bandits.
place: Kankomi close to Tantu and Daban Goje Mountains

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers and a local hunter named mallam Monyewere killed in an ambush by Boko Haram insurgents who also lost many fighters (assuming 10 fighters). Another source reported that 4 soldiers and a hunter were killed but failed to state if the insurgents recorded fatalities.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram fighters (assuming about 10 of them) were killed in an aerial bombardment by NAF. The victims were believed to be meeting when the venue was bombarded. Another source reported that scores (assuming at least 40) of the insurgents were killed.
place: Ngoske on the fringes of Sambisa forest

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram fighters lost their lives when their vehicle stepped on Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) they planted for troops.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 persons was killed while 5 others were abducted by some bandits who launched attacks on some communities.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Imo
description: A hunter identified as Eze Anorue was killed by Fulani herdsmen. The reason for killing the hunter was not stated. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Army vs Kidnapper, Kaduna
description: Troops of Nigerian Army attached to 'Operation Thunder Strike' killed a kidnapper and rescued three villagers abducted from their farms. One AK 47 rifle with two 7.62 special ammunition were recovered from the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 youths from Plateau State were kidnapped at a construction site and were later killed by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents abducted some other persons.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 1 person was shot dead by unidentified assailants. It was reported that the killing is linked to the perennial Aladja and Ogbe-Ijoh crisis which is hinged on land tussle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram fighters were killed when Nigeria Air Force jets bombed their locations. The insurgents and their commanders were killed while they were holding a meeting. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that at least 2 scores were killed. A score refers to 20 people in this context.
place: Boboshe on the fringes of the Sambisa forest
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Punch (10 ) , This Day (40 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 30-year-old Wakili Ayuba was ambushed and killed on his way home by Fulani militias. The pregnant wife was killed in a similar way three months ago. The killing of the wife is linked with IBD016958.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed an infant and a driver of a commercial bus while they abducted PMA ll Hamza, a Kaduna State Traffic and Enviornment Law Enforcement Agency (KASTELEA) marshal. The incident happened when the victims were on transit.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram fighter was killed by soldiers during a foiled attack. It was reported that the troops also recovered one AK 47 riffle, on magazine, one Very High Frequency (VHF) Radio, one mobile phone and syringes/ injections. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army troops of 242 battalion in conjuction with their Sector 2 Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) and Chadian Defence Forces (CDF) killed 15 Boko Haram terrorists during a fierce gun battle in which a soldier was killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed while 4 others were abducted in the early hours of the day by gunmen who invaded a community. The gunmen stormed the community in a commando style, shooting at anyone in sight.

title: Banditry, Plateau
description: 3 women were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen while they were harvesting tomatoes in their farms. The victims were identified as Tabitha Joro Dung, Ngo Yop Gwom Pam and Zong Peter.
sources_of_information: This Day (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: NAF vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 10 bandits were killed by NAF during a raid on their hideouts. The raid was carried out as part of operations to attack bandit's camps in the forest.

title: Flooding, Ondo
description: Doyin Boluwaji, a final year student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko (AAUA), lost her life when she was swept away by flood. The incident happened when the victim tried to move out of her house but got stck in the flood which was caused by heavy downpour. Another version of the story stated that 3 students were swept away in the incident.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Akwa Ibom
description: 1 person was killed by Fulani herdsmen. The victim was killed in his farm by the herders who usually destroy farmlands with their cows. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during air raids aimed at wiping out the terrorists. It is difficult to justify the number of casualties as the event was only reported by a source. It is assumed at least 2 scores (at least 40 fighters) died in the incident.
place: Kirta Wulgo on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead when some of them attacked a Special Response Area of the Nigerian Army's location. The insurgents were neutralized when they attempted to take over the military base.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An ambush on a military convoy by Boko Haram terrorists killed 11 soldiers while 14 others were wounded.

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Zamfara
description: 9 soldiers on a peacekeeping mission were killed by gunmen identified as Fulani bandits. It was reported that the bandits arrived on motorcycles and opened fire on the soldiers stationed at a village. 1 soldier was injured. The killing was a reprisal attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 young men were killed by Boko Haram because they were Christians. The men were trained carpenters from Plateau State but hired to other states due to their expertise.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops during a foiled attack. Weapons were recovered from the terrorists and 51 people were recused from their grip. A source subsequently reported that 18 soldiers were killed in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: A driver and seven passengers were killed when an improvised explosive device, IED planted along their way bu suspected Boko Haram fighters exploded. The victims were travelling from Biu to Maiduguri in a Golf car.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Seven soldiers and 5 vigilante members were ambush and killed on a military convoy by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). In contrary to the number of death, the group claimed to have killed 14 troops and captured two others in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Kills Aid Worker, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants beheaded an aid worker with an international aid group, Action Against Hunger (AAH). He was one of the six staff of the group that were abducted while travelling to deliver humanitarian assistance to IDP-returnees at Damasak town in July. The killing was discovered through a video released by a faction of Boko Haram, the Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) on social media.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Sokoto
description: Gunmen laid ambush and killed some soldiers. The affected soldiers were said to be part of Operation Habin Kunama III deployed to tackle banditry in the north West. It is assumed that 5 soldiers were killed in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened in the morning when the victims were in the farm to fetch firewood. The victims were 2 women and a community leader, who had gone to show the women the firewood to fetch.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 commanders of Boko Haram and Islamic State West African Province, ISWAP, were killed by troops of Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF. The victims (Abba Mainok, Bukar Dunokaube, Abu kololo, Abor Kime (said to be of Arab origin – likely their ISIS trainer), Mann Chari, Dawoud Abdoulaye (from Mali) and Abu Hamza) were controlling fighters when they were raided.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (7 )

title: Bandits Kill Imam, Sokoto
description: The deputy Imam of a Central Mosque, Malam Isa Labaran, was killed by gunmen. The victim who was the commandant of the vigilantes in the community was shot on the head.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Nine farmers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents on their farm. The farmers were surrounded by the insurgents before they were slaughtered one after the other.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Sokoto
description: Three young men were killed while three women sustained gunshot injuries when bandits who rode on five motorcycles shot sporadically at people.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 6 persons were killed by bandits who invaded 2 communities. It was reported that the bandits attacked the communities in the evening, causing the residents to flee. The bandits carted away valuables and cows worth millions of naira. They also abducted two persons.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of terrorists from Islamic State West African Province (ISWAP) and its local franchise, Boko Haram, were decimated during air raids by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF).
sources_of_information: This Day (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Hoodlums vs Woman, Edo
description: A woman, Mrs. Alice Omorogbe, her daughters, Mrs. Blessing Efe and her six-month-old baby were kileld by a tipper driver, Mr. Edoghogho Omorogbe. The victims were children and grand children of the head of the village, Pa Omoregbe Avanrenren. Their death is related to the lingering crisis between the community elders and the youth leader of the community, Perrick Egbon.

title: Bandits vs Man, Niger
description: Some bandits killed a man during raids on some communities. They also raped and brutalised a woman. The bandits were 10 in number.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: The security guard of Mr Kabir Faruk Matazu, the Transition Management Committee chairman of Matazu LGA, was killed and his 2 children abducted by gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Three Boko Haram terrorists were shot dead during an encounter with troops of the Nigerian army. Bicycles and food items were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole, under the special response, Halaka Dodo Operations, killed three Boko Haram terrorists.The incident happened during a clearance operation targeted at wiping out insurgents.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 9 soldiers were killed while 12 others were injured in an attack on a new military camp. The insurgents carted away the military petroleum tanker, an armoured vehicle and eight other operational vehicles.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Vanguard (9 ) , Other newspaper 3 (9 ) , This Day (9 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists belonging to the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). The terrorists were killed during air raids targeted at the training camp of the group.
place: Mallam Fatori on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Bandits Kill 3, Sokoto
description: Three elderly men were killed while cattle were rustled when bandits attacked a community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen butchered 2 persons, Stephen Samuel and Dajugu Randong while 5 others sustained gunshot injuries. They were attacked while on a journey.
place: Nding Loh village of Fan District
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of 22 Brigade/Super Camp, Dikwa, working with members of the Civilian Joint Task Force, vigilance groups and hunters, killed scores of Boko Haram terrorist and recovered six AK47 rifles and 66 7.62mm ammunition from them. At least 2 sores (40) were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Six bandits, Muhammed Abubakar, Abduallahi Abubakar, Habib Abubakar, Marina Dandash, Saidu Abdullah and Mrs Salamatu Saiyit, were arrested for killing two soldiers. This event is linked with IBD IBD017572.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram fighter was killed when members of his group attacked a military convoy. It was reported that the attackers wounded a soldier and made away with cash, arm cache and food belonging to the army.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Plateau
description: Six bandits, Muhammed Abubakar, Abduallahi Abubakar, Habib Abubakar, Marina Dandash, Saidu Abdullah and Mrs Salamatu Saiyit, were arrested for killing three soldiers. This event is linked with IBD IBD017573.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Political Crisis, Kogi
description: Sporadic shootout by gunmen at the venue of PDP primary election led to the death of one person.

title: Protest, Katsina
description: One person was killed during a protest by irate youths who were protesting against incessant attacks by bandits on their community that recently killed a motorcyclist. The protesters burnt the residence of the Secretary to the State Government, SSG and the All Progressives Congress secretariat to register their dissatisfaction with the growing insecurity in the area.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: Bandits ambushed and attacked traders who were returning from the market. In the process, a motorcyclist was killed. The killing led to protest by irate youths.This event is linked to IBD017305

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 5 farmers were killed in their farms by Boko Haram terrorists. While 3 were shot dead, 2 others were killed with machetes.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were neutralized in air strikes launched by Air Force. The air raid was conducted to clear the terrorists. At least, 2 scores were believed to have died in the incident.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several fighters from the Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP, were killed by Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF. The victims were killed during air interceptions. Sources reported that scores of the insurgents were killed. It is assumed about 40 of the terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 3 soldiers and dozens of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 2 dozens) were killed during a clash. 8 soldiers and many insurgents were injured in the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 8 people working on their farms were attacked and killed by Fulani herdsmen. They were mostly women. 5 were missing after the incident.
sources_of_information: This Day (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , The Guardian (13 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 soldiers lost their lives during an ambush by members of the Boko Haram terrorist group. The terrorists took away arms and ammunition on the ambushed soldiers.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Two terrorists were killed by Nigerian Army troops of 26 Task Force Brigade while others scampered for their dear lives with gunshot wounds when ambushed by the troop during a heavy downpour, where they were attempting to plant IED

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Three persons were killed and dozens of others were kidnapped by armed bandits who blocked the expressway and opened fire on commuters in vehicles.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Newsworld (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: A student of ECWA Seminary School was killed in the early hours of the day in his farm by bandits. The incident happened when the victim and his friend went to his farm.

title: Bandits, Sokoto
description: Two youths were shot dead while ten others were injured by gunmen when the villagers were preparing for wedding ceremony.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many terrorists were killed when they failed in their attack on the headquarters of 26 Task Force Brigade. The attackers were overpowered by force and weapons were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Farmer, Taraba
description: One person died while four are undergoing treatment in the hospital after bandits stormed their farm and open fire on them.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 persons were killed and 12 others were missing after Boko Haram insurgents attacked a local government area. It was reported that the terrorists abducted some women.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram strongholds were bombarded by NAF and scores of the insurgents were killed. It is assumed that at least 2 scores of the extremists lost their lives.

title: Herdmen vs Woman, Enugu
description: A 67-year-old woman, Mrs. Pat Ngwu, was brutally raped and murdered by Fulani herdsmen when she went to her farm. The incident led to a protest by the members of the community.

title: Bandits Kill 14, Katsina
description: 14 people lost their lives when bandits attacked 2 communities. While 11 were killed in a community, 2 were killed in another community. A Chief Iman was among the victims.

title: Bandits Kill 3, Katsina
description: Bandits raided a community and killed 4 people. The bandits escaped into the thick hilly mountainous forest. The victims were killed when they went after the attackers to recover rustled cows.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: An attack by Boko Haram on a community was foiled by soldiers. 3 soldiers were killed in the incident. It was not reported if the terrorists suffered any fatality.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of persons lost their lives when three fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) pounded a terrorist command and control centre. It was reported that the terrorists camps were destroyed during the operations.
sources_of_information: This Day (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Eight people including three soldiers and three civilians were killed while two soldiers and six civilians injured, in crossfire between Islamic State West Africa Province group and soldiers.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Akwa Ibom
description: Friday Etor was killed while, Nsikak Udo, was critically injured during an attack by Fulani herdsmen who invaded their farmland with their cattle.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Bandits vs Palace Guard, Sokoto
description: 7 bandits led by one Maude Salisu killed a palace guard when they attacked the residence of Alhaji Muhammadu Gidado, the District Head of Gidan Bubu village. The bandits abducted the brother of the district head.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 persons were killed and four others injured following a suicide attack by two female Boko Haram suicide bombers who infiltrated a town. It was reported that the incident happened in the night.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 5 civilians were killed in a shootout between soldiers and Boko Haram terrorists. Several attempts have been made by the terrorists to penetrate a military base in the community.

title: Herdsmen vs Catholic Priest, Enugu
description: A Catholic priest identified as Rev Fr. Paul Offu was shot dead by some Fulani herdsmen who doubled as kidnappers. The corpse of a second victim who was abducted during the attack on the priest, Mr. Kenneth Igwe, was found days after. The killers were identified as Ibrahim Adamu (25 years) and Idris Tobe (28 years).
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Vanguard (2 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram terrorists were neutralized when Air Task Froce (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole destroyed their hideout. The incident happened as a result of Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) missions which revealed the presence of the terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 persons died.
place: Alafa, fringes of the Sambisa forest
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 10 bandits were killed by soldiers during a clearance operations. Nigerian troops were deployed to Birnin Gwari following numerous incidents of kidnapping and banditry.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 3 residents were killed and 2 others were abducted by bandits during a raid on 5 communities. One of the victims, a boy, was shot dead while trying to escape the attack.
place: Garin Labo, Bakon Zabo, Nahuta, Ajasu and Zamfarawar Madogara.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents broke into a community and kill many of the villagers. They also looted and carted away foodstuffs. It is assumed that 20 people were killed in the attack.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Kaduna
description: 2 soldiers and some members of Civilian Joint Task Force (assuming 5) were killed by bandits. The incident occurred when the bandits tailed a farmer to his farm but engaged with security operatives who had intervened in a shootout.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 persons, including 1 soldier, 5 suicide bombers and some Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists, lost their lives when the insurgents attempted to invade troops location. It was reported that several terrorists escaped with severe injuries. ISWAP claimed that the 15 people killed were all soldiers.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Armed bandits killed 6 persons and kidnapped 6 other persons when they attacked four villages. It was reported that one of the victims was the village chief imam at Shingi identified as Malam Abu Garba.
place: Shingi, Sabon Garin Wagini, Hayin Nuhu and Dantudum

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 18 persons were killed while many women were abducted by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits wrote letters to the villages prior to their attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 traders were killed by bandits on the highway while they were travelling. It was reported that the bandits opened fire on the vehicle conveying the traders, killing three of the victims instantly.

title: Banditry, Katisna
description: 4 lives were lost and several women abducted when bandits raided a community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Troops of Harbin Kunama III killed a notorious bandit identified as Monday Chikwunka (36 years) during a clearance operation aimed at ridding the state of bandits. The army also intercepted other bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Boko Haram Fighters, Borno
description: Infighting among members of 3 factions of Boko Haram claimed scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of their members. The fight which spilled over from Niger Republic was over sharing formula for income generated by taxing cattle herders.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 persons were shot dead when members of the Boko Haram terrorist group invaded an Internally Displaced Persons camp. The terrorists stole food and livestock from the camp.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 3 bandits were shot dead by troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when troops of Operation Thunder Strike dislodged a bandits camp. Some kidnap victims were rescued.
place: Kubuso, Kuso and Kakumi general areas
sources_of_information: Independent (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when troops of Operation Harbin Kunama III dislodged a bandits camp.
sources_of_information: Independent (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Boko Hram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a community, killed a woman and abducted 5 others. The victims were working on their farmlands when they were swooped on.

title: Bandits vs Army, Kaduna
description: 2 Air Officers identified as Flying Officer Abdulrahman Bayero and Aircraftman Saidu Bawa were killed in an ambush by armed bandits. The incident happened when the victims and other Air Force officials were on their way to another location. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 60 mourners were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during a raid on some villagers. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack for the killing of 11 Boko Haram members by the villagers.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 15 persons were killed by bandits during an attack on a village. The armed men stormed the village in the evening, killed the victims, kidnapped some women, and set some houses and cars ablaze.
sources_of_information: This Day (15 ) , Daily Trust (20 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits killed a man when they attacked a village. It was reported that the villagers took the body of the victim, Shafiu Inusa, to the state government house. The victim went to apply fertilizer on his plants before he was killed.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Two farmers, Ali Yanga and Wahum Dura, were shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents while working on their farm. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Colonel K. E. Elemele, Captain A. Mohammed and four soldiers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the military men were ambushed by the insurgents while they were heading to another community. A version of the report stated that a civilian was also killed in the attack. A source reported that 11 insurgents were killed after they ambushed the soldiers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Independent (21 ) , Vanguard (17 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants killed a member of the Action Against Hunger, Grace Taku, as well as a driver while three health workers were abducted.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 20 persons were killed by armed bandits during raids on some villages. It was reported that the bandits attacked the villages at night, killing the victims and razing down house.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Daily Trust (37 ) , Vanguard (37 ) , The Nation (37 )

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Kabiru Ismail, the state’s deputy director of budget, was killed by bandits while Alhaji Hamza Salihu was kidnapped and a lady shot in the leg.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 46-year-old Thomas Wollo and his 7-year-old son, Nggwe Thomas, were beheaded while an aged woman was also killed by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 10 persons were killed while 5 others were severely injured when bandits waylaid some communities. It was reported that the hoodlums also set five motor vehicles and four motorcycles ablaze. They rustled unspecified number of cows.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , The Nation (10 )

title: Bandits vs Police, Katsina
description: Over 300 Bandits on motorcycle ambushed men of the “Operation Puff Adder” and killed a policeman. 4 other policemen were injured by the bandits before they fled into the forest.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several (assuming at least 20) terrorists from the Islamic State of West Africa Province, ISWAP, were killed in aerial bombardments by NAF. The terrorist's structures and logistics were destroyed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 )

title: Bandits Kill 8, Katsina
description: 8 people were killed while a policeman was also died during raids on some communities by bandits. Residents were injured and animals were rustled. The attack was carried out at night. Just last week, 18 people were also killed in the council area.
place: Dan Sabau, Pawwa and Makera villages

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Katsina
description: 11 persons were killed by bandits who attacked some villagers. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the villagers. They struck at a market while trading was going on.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , The News (11 ) , The Guardian (15 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 17 persons were killed by bandits during series of attacks on some villages. It was reported that the bandits killed the victims, wounded several others and destroyed many properties.
place: Ungwan Rabo, Ungwan Maganda, Ungwan Dadi
sources_of_information: Vanguard (17 ) , This Day (17 ) , The Guardian (13 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Over 10 bandits were killed during a clearance operation by ground troops. Over 127 rustled cows were recovered and 1 kidnapped victim was rescued. Also, 7 bandits were arrested.

title: Gunmen Attack, Benue
description: Jasper Iornem Dzughgba, a former leader of the legislature in Kwande Local Government Council and a loyalist of the All Progressive Congress, was shot dead by yet-to-be identified gunmen. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the death of the victim is politically motivated.

title: Vigilantes Kill Driver, Borno
description: A rickshaw driver was shot dead at a checkpoint by members of the Civilian Joint Task Force, CJTF, The victim was ordered to stop but refused and was assumed to be a Boko Haram members.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 10 bandits were killed by troops of Operation Hadari Daji. The victims were killed when they were escaping the forest. Some of the bandits were arrested.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 11 people were killed during an attack on 9 communities by bandits. Many children and women were declared missing after the attack, raising the possibility that the number of fatalities may increase over time. 6 people were abducted in the incident.
place: Pauwa, Katge, Danhayi, Gidan Guge, Kaurawa, Jan Bago, Kadanya, Gidan Kwaki and Lamper Kantoma.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Hunter, Ekiti
description: A hunter identified as Emmanuel Ilori was killed in the early hours of the day by Fulani herdsmen while he was on a hunting expedition in the forest. The herdsmen were about 30 in an abandoned piggery farm.

title: Army vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: 8 bandits were killed by troops of Operation Harbin Kunama III under the 8 Division, Nigerian Army. It was reported that 5 bandits' camps and 25 motorcycles were destroyed in the operation.
place: Isa, Rbah and Burkusuma general area around Sububu Forest

title: Gunmen vs Varsity Worker, Cross River
description: Mr. Bassey Ekpeyong Inyang, the Chief Architect in the Works and Physical Planning unit of Cross River University of Technology, CRUTECH, was killed by unknown gunmen after he came back from church with his wife. It was reported that the assailants waited for the victim to come home before killing him.

title: Gunmen vs Undergraduate, Ekiti
description: Maria, a 22-year-old undergraduate, was killed while working in her father's farm. It was reported that the victim was killed by unknown gunmen as she worked alone in the farm.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of 26 Task Force Brigade ambush and neutralise two terrorists and also recover some weapons from them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed a number of Boko Haram terrorists in an ambush after the insurgents attempted to attack a military location.Due tp the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , The Punch (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 )

title: Soldier vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji, killed 29 bandits in the recent clearance operation, while 3 soldiers were killed during the exercise.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (32 ) , Other newspaper 2 (32 ) , This Day (32 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji killed 15 bandits terrorising innocent citizens in a community. It reported that the army also destroyed all the bandits' camps and logistics.
place: Madada forest in Dansadau District, Magami
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , Independent (15 ) , The Nation (15 ) , The Punch (15 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 9 persons were killed by Boko Haram terrorists when they attacked a village. It was reported that the insurgents also carted away food and livestock during the attack.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 18 persons were killed by bandits during attacks on three villages. Bandits have been terrorising the state.
place: Malafaru, Dan Tudu and Tudun Wada in Shinaka District

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 farmers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists when they attacked a village. It was reported that the insurgents stormed the farm settlement in about 5 pickup vans and motorcycles. They accused the villagers of divulging information about their operations to the military.
sources_of_information: This Day (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Edo
description: A woman was killed in her farm by Fulani herdsmen. One of her arms and legs were cut off by the attackers. Youths went on rampage, went into bushes and sacked the camps of cattle rearers.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army on operation Hadari Daji (OPHD). The bandits have been terrorising the state.

title: Kidnappers Kill Vigilante, Kebbi
description: A vigilante, Ahmed Haliru, died in a hospital after he was attacked by kidnappers. Two of his colleagues survived the attack. The attacks were also believed to be bandits.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Failed attempt by terrorist to attack Mafa village led to killing of scores of the fighters. It is believed that at least about 20 insurgents were killed. Over 100 victims, including women and children, were rescued by soldiers.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Scores of bandits (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed by troops of the operation Lafiya Dole in collaboration with members of the civilian joint task force. It was reported that the victims were killed while the troops were on a routine aggressive patrol.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 persons were killed while about 20 others were kidnapped by bandits who attacked some villages. It was reported that the bandits also rustled some cattle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 members of Boko Haram terrorist group were killed by soldiers in counter-insurgency operations. It was reported that the army recovered two AK-47 rifles.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of the Nigerian Army killed 3 terrorists and rescued 95 persons held hostage by the terrorists. 42 women, 51 children and 2 men were rescued.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 19 bandits were killed during a joint military operation to curb bandits' activities. The food and arm supplier of the bandits was also caught by the army.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 1 person was killed when some bandits struck in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the bandits also abducted the village head and 7 others. The deceased was identified as Sidi Abubakar.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 42 Boko Haram fighters from the Islamic State in West Africa Province, ISWAP, were killed by soldiers on clearance mission. A soldier was killed and 10 others injured in the encounter. Both soldiers and ISWAP have been fighting for the control of Lake Chad.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several (assuming 10) Islamic State in West Africa Province, ISWAP, fighters were killed when soldiers attacked their headquarters and logistic base.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 7 persons were killed by bandits who invaded a community at night. It was reported that the invaders also injured several people in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Nigerian Army killed some terrorists belonging to Boko Haram and Islamic State of West African Province during a raid on their camps. Some women and children were rescued during the operation. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists died.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorist invaded a military base with many utility vehicles, killed five soldiers, made away with ammunition and set a section of the base on fire.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 children and a teenager were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders invaded a village. They shot dead eight-year-old Monday Yahaya, Samson David, 17 year, and Ashimile Danladi, 9 year.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: Six people were killed when armed Fulani herdsmen invaded a village. The victims, said to be farmers, were killed on their way to their farms.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Many armed bandits were killed by the Nigerian Air Force during an aerial bombardment of the position of the hoodlums. NAF degraded the bandits by razing their camp in dual air raids. Due to the nature of the incident, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a raid on a village. It was reported that the herders invaded the village, killing and maiming the villagers. They also burnt down about 40 houses and farmlands.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Communal Clash Taraba
