description: Many people were killed and several houses burnt in a crisis that erupted between Kona ethnic group and Fulani herdsmen. One of the sources reported that some of the victims were burnt inside their houses. It is assumed that ten people died in the incident.
place: Kasuwan Bera, University, Jauro Sabai, Jerbanbur and Kona communities

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists were eliminated when the Nigerian Air Force bombarded the location of the terrorists. The Air Force aerial bombardment led to the death of the insurgents. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 31 persons were killed while 41 others were injured when 2 female and 1 male suicide bombers detonated IEDs strapped to their bodies. The bombers infiltrated a tea joint and a commercial area.

title: Gunmen Kill Driver, Ondo
description: An Ambulance driver in the convoy of the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) conveying Lassa fever drugs died after he was shot by gunmen. The bandits had attempted to abduct all the occupants of the ambulance but were not successful and shot at the speeding vehicle which has a police escort.
place: Ifon, a border town between Ondo and Edo states

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Troops and Boko Haram insurgents recorded several fatalities in a shootout during an attack on a military base. The insurgents attacked the base on 9 fully loaded pickup vans. 25 soldiers were reportedly killed by the insurgents and few others were abducted. It is also assumed that about 10 insurgents died in the incident.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 persons were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits came on motorbikes and that tthey also rustled hundreds of cows and sheep.

title: Bandits Kill 34, Zamfara
description: 34 people were killed when bandits raided 3 communities. The attacks shot sporadically on people,killed their victims and wounded many.
place: Kwallido, Tungar Kafau and Gidan Wawa
sources_of_information: The Punch (34 ) , Daily Trust (35 ) , Other newpapers 1 (34 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A joint patrol team comprising operatives of Operation Puff Adder and Sharan Daji killed a bandit and arrested three other bandits after a gun duel. The bandits also stole some cows.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Osun
description: A civil servant identified as Mr. Adenipekun Ademiju was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who doubled as armed robbers on a highway. It was reported that the victim was killed when the robbers waylaid the vehicle he boarded.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many soldiers including the commanding officer of the 158 Battalion identified as Lt. Col. Azubuike were killed by Boko Haram fighters from the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) faction. Ammunition and weapons were looted during the raid.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Nigerian Army killed one Boko Haram terrorist and injured another when they rescued two women and 6 children from the terrorists. The army laid ambush on the insurgent before the incident happened. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdate by 2 days.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 social media personalities of the Islamic State for West African Province (ISWAP) were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The insurgents were identified as Abu Hurayra al-Barnawi, Ali al-Ghalam al-Kajiri, Abu Musab Muhammed Mustafa al-Maiduguri, Abu Abdullah Ali al-Barnawi Abu Musa al-Camerooni, Ahmed al-Muhajir. Abu Ali al-Bamawi, Abu Khubayb bin Ahmed al-Barnawi and Abu al-Qa’qa’ al-Maiduguri. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Bandits, Sokoto
description: 50 bandits on motorcycle attacked a community and killed 25 people. Many others were injured.
place: Sapiru village, under the Tozai Ward

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 3 men from the same mother were killed by bandits in an early morning attack on a village. The victims were attacked on their farm close to one of the camps of the bandits.
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , The Nation (3 )

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 25 persons were killed by bandits during an attack on three communities in a local government area. It was reported that the bandits attacked the villages from evening to morning.
place: Kalhu, Tsage and Geeri villages near Gandi

title: Bandits Kill 16, Zamfara
description: 16 persons were killed by bandits during an attack on a community. It was reported that 14 persons were injured during the attack. Some of those killed were identified a 102-year-old man, Mallam Muhammadu, and his children.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (16 ) , The Punch (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , Other newspaper 3 (16 )

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: Anas of Unguwar Sarkin Muslmi area, a suspected ally of bandits and a woman also suspected to be a wife to a bandit and her baby, were intercepted and killed by the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). In retaliation, bandits killed 23 people in two communities and injured many others.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed by Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during some air raids targeted at routing the insurgents. Several other terrorists were injured in the operation.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Boko Haram vs Security Forces, Borno
description: A Boko Haram attack on a mosque was repelled by a combat unit of the Federal Special Anti-Robbery Squad (FSARS) and Counter Terrorism Unit (CTU). Another source reported that the insurgents killed a worshiper before they were repelled by the special forces.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 insurgents were killed by troops of the Mulitnational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out the insurgents in the North-East of Nigeria.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , This Day (20 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 persons were killed by bandits who attacked a community. The incident happened a day after the wife of the President, Mrs Aisha Buhari, visited the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camps in the area.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a military formation, burnt it down and carted away ammunition. While the army said scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of the insurgents were killed in counter attacks, the Islamic State in West Africa Province, ISWAP, claimed it killed 4 soldiers in New Marte and 10 in Kirenawa.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the men of the Nigerian Army when they terrorists attempted to take over a military location. It was reported that several others escaped with bullet wounds.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 8 persons were killed by bandits when they attacked a community. It was reported that 18 persons were injured in the attack on the community which is on the outskirts of the state capital.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at lest 2 scores) were killed in aerial bombardment by NAF. The victims were from the Islamic in the West African Province, ISWAP, faction.

title: IPOB Attack, Anambra
description: 5 persons were killed while a Catholic priest identified as Rev Fr. Eziamaka was severely injured by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The incident happened when members of IPOB attacked people who breached their sit-at-home order which was meant for Biafran war commemoration.

title: Boko haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 persons were butchered by Boko Haram terrorists when the insurgents attacked some communities. It was reported that the insurgents slit the throats of the victims and also made away with some food stuffs.
place: Bulama Isa, Dala Wulari and Abbajri

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Unidentified gunmen killed 6 members of a family in the night. It was reported that the victims belonged to the family of Gyang Dachung. Another version of the story stated that the victims were killed by armed Fulani herdsmen.

title: Bandits vs Mob, Zamfara
description: 27 persons lost their lives when some bandits and mob clashed. It was reported that the attack by the bandits which led to the killing of 23 persons was a reprisal for the killing of some persons by the mob.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , Daily Trust (23 ) , Other newspaper 3 (23 )

title: Muslims vs Christian Youths, Plateau
description: Many persons were killed while many others sustained injuries when Christian and Muslim youths clashed over a dead body. The crisis started when the body of a young man was found at the boundary between Rikkos and an Hausa settlement. Several houses were torched in the violence.
place: Cele River between Angwan Miango and Rikkos community
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , This Day (13 )

title: Bandits Kill Man, Katsina
description: A man identified as Bilya Lawal was killed by bandits. The armed men attacked the two villages, killed the deceased and injured many.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Dozens of bandits were killed when the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets destroyed the operational base of the bandits. The bandits hideouts were found in a forest.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (24 ) , This Day (40 ) , Daily Trust (24 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Four soldiers and a cameraman died from an attack by Boko Haram on the Lake Chad region.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Oyo
description: Rabiu Tiamiyu, a cow butcher was killed by two Fulani herdsmen who baited him and his apprentice, Oluokun Olusola to Iseyin, killed him and dispossessed them of N1.2m.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 5 villagers were killed by marauding bandits who stormed a village in their large numbers. It was reported that the bandits also rustled some animals from the village.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Operatives vs Kidnappers, Niger
description: 9 kidnappers and other bandits (assuming about 5 bandits) were killed in different locations across 6 LGAs. Many others including the kidnappers of 3 Chinese foreigners were arrested. The killings occurred within the last 2 months. One of the incidents was captured in event IBD016497. This event accounts for the remaining 13 fatalities.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Katsina
description: 11 villagers were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits besieged the village in large numbers, killing and maiming those they encountered. They also rustled cattle.
causes_of_violence: crime, Daily Trust, This Day, The Guardian

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 11 persons were killed by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits who came in large numbers also rustled some cattle from the village.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , This Day (11 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Some bandits invaded a village and killed 18 persons who were mostly farmers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (18 ) , This Day (18 ) , The Guardian (18 ) , Other newspaper 3 (18 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack Church, Kaduna
description: Gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen invaded a church, killed one Obadiah Samson and abducted 17 others including Pastor and choristers. Some report started that the bandits attacked a Baptist church while others reported it was on Evangelical Church Winning All (ECWA).
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 people were killed while 2 others sustained injuries during Boko Haram insurgent attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A soldier was killed while three others were injured when Boko Haram fighters attacked a Nigerian Army base.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 12 people including 10 fishermen and 2 civilians were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. All the victims were male. The insurgents, after killing the 2 civilians, also rustled their cattle.

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Kogi
description: A farmer identified as Ariyo Aina was killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the death of the deceased resulted into a reprisal attack on Fulani communities in which 10 people died.

title: Gunmen vs Fulani Herdsmen, Kogi
description: Corpses of 3 Fulani herdsmen were found. It was reported that they were killed in a reprisal attack by unknown gunmen.

title: Herdsmen Kill Farmer, Delta
description: The corpse of a farmer, Chief Chikwe Ojinji, was discovered in his farm. He was cut with knife and shot with a gun by Fulani herdsmen

title: Bandits Kill 17, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits killed 17 people at different villages. It was reported that the attackers invaded the community on bikes. They killed 7 people in the first community, killed 4 in the second community and 7 others who were trying to help the community.
place: Gidan Kaso, Dan Dabo, Kokeya village

title: Bandits Kill 1, Nasarawa
description: A man identified as Mohammad Shuaibu was killed by his wife abductors. The names of those abducted were Basaru Rukaya, Aishat Zakari, Chinedu Ide, Reuben Ibrahim and Vivian Ibrahim.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: An attack by Boko haram insurgents on a community led to the death of a policeman.
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, Daily Trust

title: Bandit, Kaduna
description: 12 armed bandits were killed and 15 kidnapped victims were rescued by Nigerian Air Force troops of 271 detachment.

title: Gunmen Attack, Katsina
description: Gunmen killed 20 persons in three villages in a local government area. It was reported that the bandits came and opened fire on the locals before rustling some of their animals.
place: Dan Marke, Dan Sabau and Karya villages

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A military convoy was hit by a roadside bomb which ripped through the convoy and killed 3 soldiers including a lieutenant-colonel, his driver and orderly, while four others suffered critical injuries

title: Bandits Kill 2, Zamfara
description: 2 people were killed. It was reported that armed bandits launched a violent assault on the inhabitants killing two persons and kidnapping seven persons including a 3-month-old baby..

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber from the Islamic State of Syria and Iraq faction detonated explosives strapped to his body at a military base. An army commander of the rank of lieutenant colonel was killed. It is assumed the suicide bomber also died in the process.

title: Bandits vs JTF, Zamfara
description: 6 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force were killed by some bandits who ambushed the officials while they were returning from the city after receiving their payment.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The victims were among 5 people abducted during an attack in a nearby community.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 14 persons were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village in the night on a reprisal attack, as some villagers betrayed them.

title: Troops kill 4 Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in a clearance operation tagged ''Operation Hard Strike''. It was reported that a makeshift shelter, erected by the terrorists was also destroyed.
place: Surdewalla, Ranwa, Baladayo, Sabon Gari and shetimeri villages

title: Troops vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Troops of operation Sharan Daji killed 5 bandits during a clearance operation on bandit's enclaves.

title: Diobu market, Rivers
description: at least one person was shot dead in a rival cult clash and the accompanying mayhem unleashed on innocent residents of Mile 3 axis of Ikwerre Road in Diobu area of Port Harcourt on Friday, 8th May 2019. As a consequence of the attack, cultists went on a rampage, robbing residents and vandalizing vehicles of motorists plying the road in the area. The conflict was between Deybam and Icelanders over the collection of daily market tolls. A respondent recounting the incidence reported thus: The crisis in Mile 3 was sparked off by shooting to death of a suspected Deybam cult member by rival Icelanders cult member early Friday at Bishop Okoye Street, Mile 3 Diobu, Port Harcourt over the right to collect daily dues (popularly known as “marching”) from traders at Bishop Okoye Street. A member of Diobu Vigilance Group recalled that contest over the right to collect marching ground two weeks earlier claimed two lives. The deceased was identified as a suspected Iceland member and another suspected Deybam cult member. Source: Ebiede, Tarila Marclint, Celestine Oyom Bassey and Judith Burdin Asuni (ed.) [2021], Insecurity in the Niger Delta. A Report on Emerging Threats in Akwa Ibom, Bayelsa, Cross River, Delta, Edo and Rivers States, London, Adonis & Abbey Publishers, p.364.
place: ile 3 axis of Ikwerre Road in Diobu area of Port Harcourt

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 9 persons, including a humanitarian worker, were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. One other person was injured during the attack.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A woman with a baby together with six other persons were killed by armed bandits who invaded their village. It was reported that the woman and her baby were burnt to death.

title: District Head, Sokoto
description: An 82-year old district head of Balle, Ibrahim Aliyu, was killed by bandits. A policeman was killed in the process.The attackers who came on 6 motorcycles also set the police headquarters in the area ablaze.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 6 persons were killed when some villages were attacked by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident started when some herders tried to graze on farms belonging to villagers..

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 11 people comprising of 4 soldiers and 7 civilians were killed during a raid by Boko Haram. Several houses and shops were razed by the attackers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Other newpapers 1 (7 ) , The Punch (6 ) , This Day (9 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 5 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders, who rode on motorcycles and shot sporadically, raided some villages. They also burnt some houses.

title: Bandits Kill 31, Zamfara
description: Bandits raided a village and killed 31 residents. Majority of the victims were killed in their farms while escaping the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 persons were butchered by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that a mobile policeman was shot dead while Di Zere, a 63-year old man, was burnt beyond recognition in his room. 75 houses with food stuffs and two churches were burnt.

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Sokoto
description: Suspected bandits attacked the residence of the former governor of Sokoto State and killed his security guard identified as Abdullahi Jijji.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 persons were killed when armed bandits stormed a village. The hoodlums also injured several other persons and burnt down the village in the attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 15 Nigerian soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram attack on a military base. The victims included a captain, a lieutenant and 13 soldiers. The attack was believed to have been carried out by the ISIS affiliated faction of Boko Haram. Another source reported that 5 soldiers were killed, and 30 declared missing while another reported scores (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed.
sources_of_information: Web Newspaper (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (35 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 4 members of a Peace Committees on the boundary crisis between Ngbo in Ebonyi State and Agila in Benue State were killed by warlords. 2 others were injured. The victims, who were from Ngbo, were believed to have been killed by Agila warlords.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Many persons were killed when about 100 armed bandits raided a village. Several other persons were abducted along with their animals by the marauding bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 persons died.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 6 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who stormed some villages. It was reported that the assailants invaded the village in a reprisal attack. The victims were identified as a man known as Baba Zibion, Baba El-Nathan (a blind man) and three others who were youths.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: A missionary hospitals was targeted for bombing by Boko Haram. Though scores of people were wounded, only the 3 attackers were reported dead. This event is backdated by a week since the incident took place last week.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: About 30 persons were killed by bandits who invaded 4 villages. It was reported that the hoodlums burnt several houses, carting away household items and animals.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: Seven cattle rustlers were killed by mob at Emir’s palace. The cattle rustlers came with DSS personnel to the Emir’s palace to negotiate the release of their cows seized by the army during an operation in a forest.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Farmers, Ogun
description: 4 persons were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers. The clash broke out when the herdsmen made their cattle drink from the community stream and polluted it.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants killed 14 men who were collecting firewood. The bodies were found with bullet wounds. The victims were among thousands of people sheltering in camps in the town.
place: Duwabayi village near the garrison town

title: Militia vs Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: Shehu Saedu, a herder, was killed and another person was declared missing during an attack by a militia. The attackers also rustled and killed over 300 cows.

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 15 residents were killed by bandits during a raid on 2 villages. Unspecified number of houses were razed.
place: Gobirawa and Sha Ka Wuce villages

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 26 persons were killed and many others were critically injured by members of the Boko Haram group. The incident happened when the terrorists invaded a village in the night.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (26 ) , The Punch (26 ) , Daily Trust (26 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 )

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 80-year-old man, Mai Unguwa Duwa, was killed, while 48-year-old Bishir was shot when bandits, numbering about 50 on motorcycles, sporadically shot at villagers.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Unknown gunmen hacked down a lawmaker, Sinimbalia Maigida and his 65-year-old father, Titus Maigida. It was reported that the killing could be a reprisal attack for the killing of 2 Fulani persons as captured in IBD016392.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: About 50 soldiers were reportedly killed in a surprise Boko Haram attack on a village. Weapons were also carted away. However, a military source confirmed the attack but denied of any fatality.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed by bandits who have been attacking some villages. It was reported that the bandits also wounded some people and carted away cows and grains.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) Operation Diran Mikiya killed 20 bandits during a clearance operation where the camp of major kingpin, Alhaji Lawal, was raided.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , This Day (20 ) , Daily Trust (20 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force killed scores of Boko Haram terrorists during an aerial bombardment. It was also reported that they destroyed the terrorists' vehicles and workshops.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF) killed 3 members of Boko Haram who tried to attack a military location.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: 5 bandits were killed by troops of the 72 Special Forces Battalion.The suspected armed militia were killed in a gun duel.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 10 armed bandits were killed by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during an aerial bombardment. The bandits, who shot at the Air Force jets, were killed when the Air Force unleashed fire power through its 2 Alpha jets and an attack helicopter on them.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , This Day (10 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Assailants vs Fulani Herdsmen, Bauchi
description: Unidentified assailants killed 10 member of the Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association of Nigeria (MACBAN). It was reported that the corpse of the Fulani men were found with either machete cut, bullet wounds or both.

title: Army vs Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: A cattle rustler was killed by troops of the Nigerian Army belonging to the Operation Safe Haven.290 cattle were recovered from rustlers after the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 13 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders invaded a community.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Taraba
description: 2 bandits were killed by soldiers on anti-banditry operations. The soldiers were on a fighting patrol when they came in contact with the victims.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed seven bandits during a gunfight with hoodlums. The troops encountered the bandits while on a clearance operation.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 39 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Multi-national Joint Task Force (MNJTF) during a gun duel. 20 soldiers were reportedly injured in the operation.
place: Tunbum Rege, an island in Lake Chad
sources_of_information: The Nation (39 ) , Vanguard (39 ) , This Day (39 ) , The Guardian (39 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 4 people including an elderly couple and their 2 granddaughters were killed during a raid by Fulani herdsmen. The attackers also burnt over 100 houses.

title: Policemen vs IPOB, Delta
description: A member of the indigenous people of Biafra (IPOB) was killed during a clash with policemen.The police opened fire on the protesters and the bullet hit one of them.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) special forces on anti-banditry operations killed two bandits while several others fled with gunshots wounds. The bandits were killed when they attempted to gather around some villages.
place: Rafi and Doka villages of Mada District
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Punch (3 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Troops kill 27 Boko Haram, Borno
description: 27 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops from Nigeria and Cameroon. It was reported that the terrorists were attacked during joint clearance operations.
place: Wulgo, Tumbuma, Chikun Gudu and Bukar Maryam villages

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ekiti
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed two people. It was reported that the herders also injured three other persons with machetes. The incident happened in the midnight. One of the victims was identified as Mr Danjuma Ali, a Muslim farmer and a severn-year-old boy.

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: NAF bombarded bandit's logistics base and killed 4 bandits in the process. The strike followed credible information that the bandits had relocated to the village with their logistic items.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: A pregnant woman and 15 other persons were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victims were in a naming ceremony when the attackers stormed the community. Among the victims were Mr and Mrs Adebayo John.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (16 ) , Daily Trust (17 ) , This Day (16 ) , Other newpapers 1 (18 )

title: Factory Workers, Lagos
description: 3 factory workers, Amaechi Joseph, Adedayo Dauda and David Jasper died after they were accidentally splashed with liquid metal from a factory furnace while taking their bath.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 9 bandits were shot dead by the police during a gunfight between the two. It was reported that the incident happened when the police stormed the hideout of the bandits. One policeman sustained gunshot wound.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , This Day (9 ) , The Punch (9 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Katsina
description: 18 people were killed during a clash between bandits and local vigilantes. Casualties were recorded no both sides. 6 of the corpses were identified as vigilantes.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed 4 persons including the father, mother and daughter. One of the victims was identified as Kennedy Ukuanovwe and he was shot dead by the herders while he was on his way home while riding on a motorbike.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Scores of Bomo Haram from the Islamic State's West Africa Province, ISWAP, were killed in an ambush. The terrorists had planned attacking some communities in the area. It is assumed about 2 scores of the terrorists lost their lives.

title: Army Kills 6 Bandits, Zamfara
description: 6 people were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the troops ambushed the bandits and engaged them in a shoot-out.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Scores of bandits were killed during air strikes by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). The Air Force destroyed about eight camps belonging to the criminal elements.
place: Doumborou, Sububu, West Malamawa, Baturia Pond and Rugu Forests

title: Air Force, Zamfara
description: 25 bandits were killed by Air Task Force (ATF) during attacks on bandit's logistic bases. The bandits were raided on 2 locations.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and murdered 20 residents. The victims were attacked with guns and machetes. Several residents were injured while fleeing the attackers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (21 ) , The Nation (21 ) , Vanguard (21 ) , Daily Trust (21 )

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 14 people died during a clash between vigilantes and bandits. Both groups suffered 7 victims respectively. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 persons, including 2 female suicide bombers, lost their lives in Boko Haram attack. The incident happened when the bombers detonated the bombs that were strapped to their bodies. 45 persons were injured in the attack.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 policemen and 3 bandits lost their lives during a shootout between the gunmen and the police. It was reported that the incident happened when the gunmen invaded a wedding ceremony. They also set some houses ablaze.

title: Aircraftman, Borno
description: A member of an Air Force team that was actively involved in the fight against Boko Haram insurgency, Umaru Abdul Ganimu, was killed by a blade of the NAF helicopter. He was passing through the side of the functioning rotor when his head was chopped off.
causes_of_violence: other accident, political issue, religious issue

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Anambra
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 6 persons in a farm settlement. The herders also burnt houses and raped women. 30 other persons were severely injured in the attack.
place: Agweopia Camp, Iyiogbu Camp and Iyinkolo

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming at lest 2 scores) of terrorists from the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) were killed by NAF. The victims had assembled under a tree for a meeting before they were hit.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 18 soldiers were killed when a faction of Boko Haram terrorists affiliated to Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) attacked a military formation. Due to the nature of the incident, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 1 person was killed while three others were injured by unknown gunmen who attacked them in the night. The dead victim was identified as Mr. Mahan Ishaku (42 years) while the injured were given as Ahmadu Sale, Faiza Sale, and Ishaya Maju.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: 50 people have been killed by rampaging bandits. It was reported that members of Civilian joint task force mobilised people to confront the bandits in the forest which led to the killing of over 50 persons including CJTF members.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 5 farmers. It was reported that the herders invaded the village in the night and killed Torkaa Gbim, Celina Tavershima, Ayilaga Tavershima, Sonter Tavershima and Terkaa Tavershima.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Special Forces of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) killed 5 bandits and rescued 2 women and a child abducted by the gunmen.

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: 40 people mostly farmers were killed in 3 communities by bandits. The bandits on motorcycles invaded onion fields and shot the victims dead.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists died during a clash with soldiers. While 3 of them were killed by soldiers, 2 others died after the vehicle conveying them went over a roadside bomb planted by the terrorists.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 Boko Haram insurgents, including a commander known as Malloum Moussa, were killed by troops of the Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF) during Operation Yanci Tafki. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out terrorists.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (16 ) , The Punch (16 ) , The Nation (16 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 peasant farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who laid siege on a village. They shot their victims and ran away. Another farmer was severely wounded.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 3 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked them on their way from farm. The farmers were conveying their farm produce from the farm to their houses when they were gunned down. The victims are Samson Ajene, Adah Audu and Monday Ocho.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: A Mada lady was raped to death by Fulani herdsmen. The ladies where returning from a wedding ceremony when they were accosted by herdsmen. The incident caused Mada youths to kill a Fulani man and the Fulani people retaliated by killing another person. They also razed 20 houses.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Electoral Violence, Benue
description: 1 person was killed during the re-run election. It was reported that the crisis started when political hoodlums came to came to disrupt the election.

title: Bandits Kill Policeman, Zamfara
description: A policeman was killed by gunmen. It was reported that the bandits attacked their victims at the goldmine thereby killing the victim.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 10 residents were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a raid on a community. The victims were killed while sleeping outside their homes.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents were killed during their attempt to infiltrate a town. It was also reported that 5 people were also killed during the insurgent's failed attack on a bank.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram members, running away from their base for safety, attack a community, destroyed some properties and killed 3 persons.

title: Communal Crisis, Cross River
description: A communal conflict between Ikwo community of Ebonyi State and Egbor, Ipene and Abanwan communities in Cross River state claimed 4 lives.The 2 villages where the victims were killed were razed by the attackers believed to have come from Ebonyi state.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Multi-National Joint Task Force killed several Boko Haram insurgents during a clearance operation targeted at wiping out the terrorists. The terrorists were killed by the firepower of the Air Force. Due to the nature of the story it is assumed that 20 persons were killed.
place: Tumbun Rego Area on the Lake Chad fringes
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Vanguard (33 ) , Daily Trust (33 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits who entered into a village to rustle cows were chased back into the forest by vigilantes and in the process, 17 vigilante members were killed.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 22 persons were killed by armed bandits numbering about 80 who stormed a village. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village and shot sporadically.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , This Day (10 ) , Daily Trust (22 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 55 bandits and 3 soldiers were killed when the troops attacked the bandits in their stronghold in order to rescue those who were abducted by them. Several other persons were injured.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (58 ) , The Punch (55 ) , The Nation (55 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 81 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked some communities. It was reported that the attackers also razed 43 houses and wounded several other persons.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed by armed bandits who invaded a village. The bandit ambushed and opened fire on some people who were travelling along a road.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 2 suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in a botched attack. It was reported that the Improvised Explosive Device(IED) on them exploded midway into the operation.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Over 100 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attack some communities in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the attackers also burnt down 30 houses.
place: Inkimi, Iri, Dogonnoma in Ungwar Gambo

title: Political Crisis, Imo
description: Uchenna Agugua, who came back to Nigeria from Mozambique to vote, was killed on the Election Day following a mayhem caused by thugs.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 10 persons were killed and about 30 houses burnt when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community.

title: Election Crisis, Taraba
description: 8 people were killed while 56 persons were injured as a result of the Governorship elections results that was announced, which resulted to a clash between rival party supporters.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 27 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a clearance operation by the Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF). It was reported that the MNJTF also destroyed six gun trucks belonging to the terrorists.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , This Day (27 ) , The Nation (27 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 23 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a clearance operation by the Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF). It was reported that the MNJTF troops recovered 20 AK-47 rifles and five anti-aircraft guns.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (23 ) , This Day (23 ) , The Nation (13 )

title: Bandits Kill 16, Kaduna
description: 16 people were killed. It was reported that the attack followed the killing of a man identified as Danbuzu Nemi whose search led to the attackers trailing the search team to the village and killing people.

title: Political Violence, Katsina
description: Some bandits killed a policeman, CPL Mannir Usman attached to Danmusa Division, and abducted 3 ad hoc staff of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) during the governorship and House of Assembly elections.

title: Political Violence, Katsina
description: An officer of the NSCDC, UmarAliyu, was killed by by some armed bandits who also kidnapped some INEC staff during the governorship election.

title: Political Violence, Sokoto
description: 2 policemen were killed by bandits. The victims were identified as Abdullahi Maisaje, an Assistant Superintendent of Police, and Sergeant Usman Ibrahim. The policemen were on their way to election assignment when they were ambushed.

title: Bandits Kill 16, Zamfara
description: Suspected bandits killed 16 people on the eve of gubernitorial and house of assembly elections.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: Nigerian Army troops in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force killed 20 armed bandits and recovered cache of arms and dozens of motorbikes.

title: Boko Haram Landmine, Borno
description: 5 farmers lost their lives when the truck conveying them and their produce was blasted by a landmine planted in the middle of the road. It was reported that 20 persons were also injured in the attack. It is assumed that the landmine was blasted by Boko Haram terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by Troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole when members of the insurgents attacked a military formation.

title: Boko Haram attack, Borno
description: A Boko Haram terrorist was killed and one AK-47 rifle recovered when the terrorists engaged the troops in shooting.

title: Armed Bandits, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits and cattle rustlers killed 30 people when siege was laid on a community. Residential houses, shops and motorbikes were burnt.

title: Gunmen vs Cab Driver, Edo
description: A taxi driver, identified as Madueke Obiagu, was shot dead by unknown gunmen in front of his house. It was reported that the assailants shot the victim while he was fixing the battery of his Audi 80 saloon car with number plate BEN 236 XY. A version of the story stated that the victim was killed by cultists during a cult war.
place: Akugbe Street, off Santana Road, Ikpoba Hill, Benin City

title: Mad Man vs Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen were killed by a mad man. The cause of the death was not stated. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 months.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 32 persons were killed by armed bandits who invaded a community. It was reported the bandits stormed a checkpoint mounted by local vigilantes and shot them dead.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (32 ) , This Day (29 ) , The Nation (30 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 29 persons were murdered by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the attackers came in large number and razed the village.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (28 ) , Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (29 ) , The Guardian (29 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 13 persons were killed when some armed bandits attacked a village. The bandits stormed the village on motorbikes, firing at residents. They also torched about ten vehicles, motorbikes, bicycles, shops and residential houses before they left.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , The Nation (21 ) , This Day (14 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Bombs from the first Alpha Jet of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) hit the building where insurgents assembled for a meeting. It is assumed that 20 of the insurgents were killed.
place: Kolloram on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed during an air raid. The incident happened when the Air Force conducted air strikes on terrorists enclaves.

title: Political Violence, Taraba
description: 4 persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen shortly after the presidential and national assembly elections.

title: Political Violence, Delta
description: 2 young men lost their lives during the presidential and national assembly elections.The victims were killed by unknown gunmen who opened fire on voters.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: A chieftain of the All Progressive Congress (APC), Mowan Etete, his elder brother and one of his cousins were shot dead by unknown gunmen during the presidential election.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 16 persons including hunters and farmers, were shot dead by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community in the early hours of the day when residents were fast asleep.
sources_of_information: The Nation (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , Other newspaper 3 (20 ) , This Day (17 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: NAF bombarded a Boko Haram camp and killed some terrorists. It is assumed about 10 terrorists were killed. Another source reported that scores, assuming at least 2 scores, were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (40 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 1 person was killed when bandits invaded about ten villages. It was reported that over 2,000 women and children were displaced by the attackers.

title: Bandits vs Community, Zamfara
description: A clash between residents and bandits claimed 66 lives. While 7 residents lost their lives, 59 bandits were killed in the attack.

title: Auto Crash, Ogun
description: 3 people including a motorcyclclist, Ogunide Olorunto, and his passengers,Tobi Elegbede and Yemisis Agolo, were crushed to death by a truck. The driver of the truck lost control and jumped into the other lane where he rammed at the victims.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 18 people. It was reported that the attackers ambushed their victims, who had gone to the bush to fetch firewood. Some of the victims were beheaded and others gunned down.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 people and 3 Boko Haram suicide bombers died in a Boko Haram attack on a community. Among the dead was a member of the Civilian JTF who tried to repel the attack. 15 people were injured in the attack.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Bandits killed 3 civilians and one military officer in the morning. The incident also left scores of persons injured and over 200 cows rustled. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village shooting sporadically just as the residents engaged them.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists and 4 civilians were killed when the terrorists attempted to scuttle the postponed general elections. The army repelled the insurgents

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: An army officer, 3 soldiers and some insurgents were killed while 5 others were injured when some Boko Haram fighters attacked a military base.
place: Special Forces School, Buni Yadi town
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Gunmen Attack/Political Violence, Benue
description: Unknown gunmen killed Mr. Boniface Okloho, the Chairman of the All Progressive Congress in Ohimini Local Government Area. The incident happened after the victim attended a party meeting following the shift in the presidential and National Assembly polls.

title: Political Violence, Akwa Ibom
description: 2 persons were killed while 13 vehicles were burnt during a pre-election crisis that erupted in a local government area. It was reported that the affected persons died in a gun duel between some hoodlums and security personnel on election duties.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Niger
description: Armed bandits kill 5 persons during an attack on 17 communities. 35 people were declared missing and 3,500 others displaced by the incident.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 130 persons were killed by unidentified bandits who raided 8 Fulani settlements. The victims included 22 children and 12 women. The attackers also destroyed the settlements. Some of the victims were listed as Maro, Unguwan Adamu, Unguwan Ayama, Unguwan Dorawa and Unguwan Na Kuntu.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (131 ) , This Day (130 ) , The Guardian (130 )

title: Herdmen Attack, Delta
description: 2 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the armed herdsmen ambushed members of the community, killed the farmers and injured many others.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several persons, including a soldier, an aide to the governor and a civilian, were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who attacked the convoy of the Borno State governor, Kashim Shettima.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Vanguard (42 ) , Nigerian Tribune (42 )

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Soldiers killed 37 bandits during a simultaneous operation to decimate banditry in the state.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Soldiers repelled Boko Haram terrorists when during an attack on a community. The soldiers killed many of the insurgents while a soldier and a civilian were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 )

title: Police vs IPOB, Imo
description: Extra Judicial Killing: 3 members of the Indegenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead during a clash with the police. It was reported that 4 policemen were hospitalised.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 11 people were killed when gunmen believed to be Fulani, attacked a community.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigeria Air Force killed scores of Boko Haram terrorists from the lslamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP). Their training camp and several equipments including vehicles were destroyed.

title: Bandits kill 9, Niger
description: 9 people mostly women and girls were killed by armed men. Some of them were raped during the attack.
place: Badna, Malfa, Tunga and surrounding communities.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 soldiers lost their lives when Boko Haram jihadists raided a military base. It was reported that the terrorists infiltrated the base in the evening and unleashed mayhem on the soldiers. They stole two army vehicles.
place: Forward Operation Base in Ngwom village

title: NAF vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigeria Air Force(NAF) killed scores of bandits. NAF destroyed their hideouts and trucks by launching an attack on them based on credible human intelligence reports .

title: Army vs IPOB, Abia
description: 3 member of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by the army during a routine patrol. Another version of the story stated that the three members of the group were shot dead when the army were removing posters of Nnamdi Kanu in a market.
place: Asa Nnentu Auto Spare Parts Market

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: An army officer and 21 villagers were massacred during a 2-day siege by some bandits. The incident led to relocation of more than 200 villagers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 3 persons lost their lives and many others were injured when Boko Haram terrorists attacked a community.It was reported that the insurgents were repelled by the operatives of the military, police and vigilance group.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 11 persons were killed by gunmen who attacked a village. It was reported that the gunmen also set some houses ablaze.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons lost their lives when some Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities. It was also reported that the attackers burnt down three houses while many persons were injured.

title: Cultists vs Student, Kogi
description: Abdullahi Muhammed, a final year student of Kogi State University, was murdered by unknown gunmen. Another version of the story stated that the student popularly called Comrade Lincoln was shot by cultists. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Scores of people, assuming at least 2 scores (40) were killed when Boko Haram raided a community. Several houses were also burnt. The attackers were later repelled by soldiers. Also, see event in IBD015752.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: An Assistant Superintendent of Police, ASP, was shot dead by herdsmen when he led a team of police officers in search of the herdsmen who had been involved in kidnap activities.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers while trying to infiltrate a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many civilians were killed when Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village. It was reported that several persons were also missing after the attack. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 persons were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 60 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a community. The terrorists burnt houses and destroyed several properties. So many persons were displaced.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 12 soldiers were killed during a Boko Haram attack on a community. It was reported that 12 soldiers were killed as the terrorists raided the community

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 soldiers were killed when some Boko Haram terrorists attacked a military base in a village.

title: Cult Clash, Edo
description: Sergeant Monday Ehijie, an orderly to Ipoba-Okha LGA chairman, was killed alongside 2 of his cult members during a fight with their rivals.
place: Namayo junction, Upper Sakpoba Namoyo junction, Upper Sakponba

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: A gang of Fulani herdsmen attacked a community, gunning down some members of the community. It was reported that the attackers also set some houses ablaze. It is assumed that 10 persons were killed.

title: Vigilante vs Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: A Fulani man and his brother were killed by members of a vigilance group who mistook them for cattle rustlers. The killers carted away the victims' cattle, sheep and goats. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation on their hideouts. Weapons were recovered from the terror group.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders attacked some communities, kidnapped people and unleashed mayhem.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders attacked some communities, kidnapped people and unleashed mayhem.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders attacked some communities, kidnapped people and unleashed mayhem.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the herders attacked some communities, kidnapped people and unleashed mayhem.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 Nigeria soldiers lost their lives and 58 bandits were killed when troops of the Nigerian Army and other security agencies confronted bandits who were terrorising residents in some states. Another source reported that 11 civilians and 1 vigilante were killed by the bandits.
sources_of_information: This Day (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (62 ) , Daily Trust (33 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation. The incident happened when some of the terrorists attempted to break into a military formation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers of the Operation Lafiya Dole lost their lives while fighting to repel Boko Haram terrorists who attacked a community. It was reported that 2 suicide bombers were killed in the attack.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents who made frantic attempts to infiltrate Gajiram Community were killed by Operation Lafiya Dole. It is asummed about 20 insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A Volkswagen driver was killed by Boko Haram in an ambush. The passengers of the car escaped into the bush. Few of them were believed to have been kidnapped by the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Kills 15, Borno
description: 15 people were killed by Boko Haram. It was reported that the insurgents burnt several houses and a military base killing 15 persons including 3 soldiers.

title: Bandits Kill 26, Sokoto
description: 26 people were killed by suspected bandits. It was reported that they attacked the communities while riding on motorcycles.
place: Warwana, Tabkin Kwasa and Dutsi villages

title: Fulani Attack, Adamawa
description: Suspected Fulani militias attacked Holma, killed two residents and twenty houses were destroyed in the attack.

title: Communal Crisis, Kogi
description: 10 people were killed and many injured in a crisis that erupted between Ebirra and Bassa-Komu ethnic tribes.

title: Herdsmen vs Fisherman, Delta
description: A fisherman was shot dead while 2 others were injured while returning from a fishing expenditure. The attack was done by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 80 Islamic State in West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters were killed during a clearance operation by the newly-established Special Forces Command of Operation Lafiya Dole. In the process, an officer, and a soldier were lost.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 4 people were killed while many others were injured when armed bandits attacked a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Soldiers, local hunters and CJTF fought back Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a community and killed about 20 night travellers.

title: Boko Haram kill 3, Borno
description: 3 people were killed by Boko Haram. It was reported that the insurgents raided the communities, burnt houses and killed a cleric and 2 other persons.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Yobe
description: Many Boko Haram fighters were killed by Nigerian soldiers. They were ambushed by soldiers who got prior information of the planned attack.According to a report, about 50 terrorists were killed in the fight.

title: Bandits,Nasarawa
description: 48 weapons and 801 ammunition recovered, 9 people arrested and 1 bandit killed by The Operation Wild Stroke of the Nigerian Army operating in Nasarawa. Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 1 week.

title: Farmers Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Ogun
description: A Benue-born farmer killed a Fulani herdsman for destroying his farm. Residents deserted their homes over fear of reprisal attacks by other Fulani herdsmen.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A gang leader and scores of the bandits gathered on Doumbourou Hill and believed to be planning another attack were killed by two attack helicopters of the Nigerian Air Force.

title: IDPs Die in Camp, Benue
description: 41 IDPs reportedly died in Abagena camp due to precarious condition of the camp and starvation. Most of the IDPs were people displaced by herdsmen crisis in the state. The State Government has been overwhelmed with the responsibility of taking care of the IDPs. No dates were reported for the deaths. It is therefore assumed it occurred throughout 2019. Such deahths were also reported in other camps in the state

title: Armed Bandits, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits in a convoy of motorcycles, attacked 2 communities, killed 18 people and destroyed large storage of farm produce.

title: Boko Haram Camp, Borno
description: The Nigeria Air Force (NAF) Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole destroyed a building being used as meeting venue by Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) and neutralized all the occupants. 10 insurgents were asumed dead.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed Miss Janet Markus and Mr Dung Pam.

title: Boko Haram Female Bombers, Borno
description: Troops of 22 Brigade Garrison in Operation Lafiya Dole killed 3 Boko Haram female suicide bombers while on patrol. They also recovered one Rocket Propelled Grenade (RPG) and a suicide vest at the scene of the encounter.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Travellers, Plateau
description: 5 travellers, Miss Favour Nintel, Miss Felicia Nuhu, Mr. Bulus Dung Sunday, Miss Jenet Yakubu Pam and Mr. Jok Danladi were attacked and killed while returning from an event organised by a Christian youths in Jos by gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen. 2 others sustained injuries.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Nigeria Air Force (NAF), Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole neutralised several Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters at their hideout near a fish dam.

title: Bandits Kill Soldiers, Zamfara
description: Bandits ambushed and killed unspecified number of soldiers at a forest. It is assumed 10 soldiers lost their lives.

title: Troop vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Diran Mikiya neutralised armed bandits in their hideout with an Alpha jet aircraft. It is assumed 10 bandits were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 soldiers and 2 civilians were shot dead when Boko Haram terrorists launched a coordinated attack on the headquarters of Multi-national Joint Task Force (MJTF). Among the civilain victims was atrailer driver who was conveying soldiers out of the attacked areas. No information was [provided on the soldiers being conveyed. Civilians were given the options of staying or leaving the attacked communities. Thousands of civlilians moved out from the affected communities but many were reported missing during the transit.
place: Headquarters of the 7-Brigade, Multi-national Joint Task Force (MJTF), Lake Chad at Baga, Doron-Baga, Kross Kawwa, Bunduran, Kekeno and Kukawa towns

title: Bandits, Niger
description: Gunmen ambushed and kidnapped 15 persons while 2 others were killed in a neighbouring community between Niger and Kaduna States.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers belonged to sector 4. Monguno is Sector 3, were killed by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 25 houses were set ablaze while 4 people were killed when Boko Haram militants stormed a village close to Chibok.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 13 soldiers and 1 policeman lost their lives when they were ambushed by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the victims were on the way when the incident happened.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists were killed during an encounter between the terrorists and some soldiers. The incident happened when the terrorists attacked a military base. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Mob vs Informants, Zamfara
description: 5 informants of bandit who have been menacing some communities were rounded up and killed by an angry mob. The bandits have been kidnapping residents and rustling cattle.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Zamfara
description: 5 farmers lost their lives after an attack by unidentified armed bandits. The incident happened when the bandits attacked some communities, killing people and destroying properties.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Some soldiers were killed in an ambush on military vehicles by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents laid ambush on the soldiers in the evening. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 soldiers died.

title: Cult Killing, Lagos
description: 2 brothers, Akeem, 40-year-old and Jamiu. 33-year-old were killed by bandits in the same day. The killing is believed to be a clash between two cult groups in the same community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were gunned by troops of the Lafiya Dole during a clearance operation. It was reported that a soldier lost his life during a hot pursuit of the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Four farmers were killed and their corpses were burnt by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents invaded rice plantations, razing down hectares of farms and destroying properties.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 12 Soldiers were killed while dozens are missing and 28 Islamist militants killed when the militants disguised as civilians internally displaced persons to infiltrate the community.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 8 bandits were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army of the Operation Sharan Daji during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the bandits who have been terrorising the state. 4 AK-47 rifles, two magazines containing 48 rounds of ammunition and two motorcycles were recovered from the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A teenage female bomber, who attempted to infiltrate a security checkpoint, was shot by security men. The improvised explosive device on her body exploded.

title: Bandits Kill 22, Zamfara
description: 22 persons were killed by armed bandits who attacked the village. It was reported that they were shooting people dead as they chased them on motorcycles.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: 9 persons were killed when armed bandits stormed s village. The sporadic shooting resulted in the death of the victims.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed while 2 others sustained injuries when Boko Haram insurgents stormed a military base in nine gun trucks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many persons were killed while several others were injured when some Boko Haram terrorists attacked some communities. The attackers invaded the communities and shot sporadically. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 persons were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 117 Battalion, 28 Task Force Brigade, Operation Lafiya Dole with members of Civilian Joint Task Force, killed one Boko Haram terrorist and arrested two others. One AK-47 rifle, a magazine, 21 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition, a 36 hand grenade, magazine pouch and a motorcycle were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A military base was attacked by Boko Haram and a soldier was killed. 7 other soldiers were injured.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 8 soldiers and 10 Boko Haram terrorists lost their lives when the insurgents launched an attack on a military base.Another source reported that 8 soldiers and 10 Boko Haram were killed. The attackers were from the Islamic State in the West African Province (ISWAP) faction of Boko Haram.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (18 ) , Other newspaper 2 (18 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 104 bandits and 16 policemen died during a clash. Police also destroyed 50 hideouts belonging to the bandits. 500 cattles and 79 sheep were recovered from from the bandits. 20 policemen were rescued from the bandits according to the police.

title: IPOB vs Police, Anambra
description: 2 policemen were killed by IPOB members during a clash with policemen. Crisis started when security operatives tried to stop members of the proscribed pro-Biafra group from the illegal activity.

title: Farmers vs Herdsmens, Katsina
description: 11 people were killed during a clash between farmers and herdsmen. The crisis started when a farmer who resisted the invasion of his farm was killed. Villagers retaliated and killed a herder.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (11 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 15 farmers were shot dead by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened when the terrorists attacked the farmers who were working in their field.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 9 farmers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who opened fire on them and injured three others. It was reported that the insurgents took away 12 people who were mainly women.

title: Bandits vs Vigilates, Zamfara
description: 12 vigilantes popularly called Vivilianb JTF were ambushed and killed by bandits. The victims were on their was back from a meeting in a neighbouring village. Few others sustained different degrees of injuries.

title: Birthday Party, Bauchi
description: 8 persons were killed while two houses and a car were burnt in the early hours of the day as party-goers clashed at a birthday party. It was reported that the clash was as a result of minor disagreement at the party which snowballed into violence that took a religious dimension. A version of the report stated that the crisis started when two men were fighting over the affection of a woman at the party. One of the principal cause of the crisis was identified as Patrick Zumunta.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Over 70 soldiers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists when the insurgents raided three military bases. It was reported that the soldiers were completely routed as the terrorists captured the bases. According to a report, more soldiers were killed when they went to retrieve the corpses of their colleagues. Majority of the sources reported the community that came under attack (Metele) but stated different LGAs. The incident is believed to have occurred in Adadam as stated by majority of the reports.
sources_of_information: Web Newspaper (70 ) , Vanguard (70 ) , Daily Trust (70 ) , The Punch (100 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Sale Ahmed, a.k.a, Baban Hassan, one of the leaders of a Boko Haram faction, the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), was killed in a joint raid by the Army and the Air Force. He was a key member in the kidnap of Leah Sharibu from Dapchi.

title: Communal Clash, Akwa Ibom
description: 1 person was killed and several others were injured when some hoodlum unleashed violence in Nnung Oku Ekanem community. The crisis was as a result of the arrest of two cassava thieves who were said to have migrated from another village identified as Afaha Unium.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: A civilian JTF member was killed and more than 120 cows and goats were carted away before burning 100 homes and abducting 10 Internally Displaced Persons on their farms.
place: Mammanti village, a suburb of Maiduguri

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 4 farmers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who invaded the community in large numbers. The incident happened while the farmer were picking cowpea in the field.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole and members of the Civilian JTF killed two insurgents and rescued 16 captives during a clearance operation targeted at wiping out Boko Haram terrorists.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Abu Rajal and Tuja Sa’inna, commanders of Boko Haram terrorist group, were killed following a joint operation by 25 Task Force Brigade and 28 Task Force Brigade..
place: Clearance operations from Gumsuri to Gambori

title: Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Boko Haram terrorists and soldiers engaged each other in a gun duel during a foiled attack on a military base belonging to the 120 Battalion. Some of the terrorists were killed and others escaped with injuries. It is assumed that 10 people were killed in the attack.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists (assuming 10) were killed in an arial attack by NAF following intelligence report that the terrorists had gathered in the village. Another source reported that scores of terrorists (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , The Nation (40 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: A civlian was killed and 16 soldiers declared missing after Boko Haram terrorists in several gun trucks attacked a military base and a market in the city. The victim was killed in a crossfire.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 persons identifed as Henry zozo and Emeka Egwu were killed by fulanI herdsmen. It was reported that the two men were ambushed and killed by their assailants.

title: Boko Haram Attack., Borno
description: 14 people including an Islamic cleric, his wife and 3 children were killed by Boko Haram during an attack on 4 communities and an IDP camp. 40 makeshift camps in Dalori IDP were burnt and several persons were declared missing, raising the possibility that the fataliies may increase over time.
place: Dalori, Kofa, Mallumti, Ngomari, and Gozari

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of persons (assuming at least 40) including a soldier and Boko Haram terrorists lost their lives when the Islamic State affiliated faction attacked a military base and were repelled by the army. The insurgents came in 13 gun trucks. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed by unknown Fulani herdsmen who attacked them on their farms. It was reported that the herdsmen came from Nasarawa state to the area to graze their cows and in the process attacked the people in their Farms.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some surviving Boko Haram terrorists that were seen fleeing an area were killed in an attack by Nigeria Air Force (NAF) Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Lafiya Dole. It is assumed that 10 of the terrorists were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists stormed a community and killed two villagers. It was reported that the terrorists also destroyed several houses, looted food items and other valuables. A version of the story stated that the terrorists killed the village head and two women.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 person was killed during Boko Haram attack in some communities. It was reported that they set houses on fire and carted away food items.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 12 farmers were killed with matchets by Boko Haram. They were attacked while working on their farms. 3 of them were wounded.
sources_of_information: The Nation (12 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Punch (12 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 28, Borno
description: 28 people were killed during a raid on harmlets close to food silos. They were tied to stakes and slaughtered by the attackers. Many people got injured while escaping the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army, Civilian Joint Task Force and some vigilantes. The incident happened when the troops were on clearance operation to rid the state of terrorist elements. 12 persons were rescued from the the terrorists by the troops of 121 Battalion together with members of the Civilian Joint Task Force and some vigilantes.

title: Boko Haram vs Aid Worker, Borno
description: Hauwa Mohammed Liman, an aid worker with the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), was brutally shot dead by Boko Haram terrorists who captured her and other aid workers since March 1, 2018.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents were killed in an aerial bombardment by the Nigerian Air Force. It was reported that the Air Task Force used two Mi-35 Helicopter Gunships to engage and destroy the identified Boko Haram positions. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were neutralized when they were ambushed by troops of Nigerian Army. The incident was part of the clearance operation aimed at wiping out the terrorists. 6 soldiers were injured in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Mine Blasts, Borno
description: 2 Nigerian soldiers were killed and 9 other persons were wounded in two separate mine blasts set by Boko Haram terrorists.
place: Kumshe village; Between Dikwa and Marte

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 soldiers died while 76 Boko Haram terrorists were killed during a deadly battle between the terrorists and troops prosecuting war against insurgency. It was reported that 16 soldiers were wounded as the terrorists attempted to take over a community.

title: Political Crisis, Ogun
description: Jimoh Salami, a supporter of one of the House of Assembly aspirants in Abeokuta North Local Government Area, died after being hit by a charm during senatorial, House of Representatives and state House Assembly primaries.

title: Political Crisis, FCT (Abuja)
description: I person was killed during the All Progressives Congress (APC) National Assembly (NASS) primaries in Abuja.

title: Herdsmen kill 4, Plateau
description: 4 people identified as Laraba Joshua, 38; Ago Gabo,43; Markus Di, 40; and a baby were killed in a fresh attack by Fulani Herdsmen.

title: Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits killed 6 persons when they stormed a village. It was reported that they also kidnapped a businessman Alhaji Lawalli Mai Tireda. The bandits drove on motorbikes in dozens into the village.

title: Political Crisis, Zamfara
description: Violence erupted at the polling centres during the botched election of APC governorship primary election leading to the death of 5 people including a student of the Federal University, Gusau, Samaila Sani Afro, 3 other victims came from the neigbouring LGAs.

title: Political Crisis, Ebonyi
description: Two factions of the All Progressives Congress (APC) clashed during senatorial primary election leading to the death of 2 people.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
