description: A local Fulani herder was killed by armed men during a reconciliation meeting convened by the district head on the directive of the traditional ruler of Bata Chiefdom, Hama Bata, Alhamdu Teneke. It was reported that two policemen were injured in the incident.

title: Political Crisis, Imo
description: 28-year-old Chinonso Solomon, an aide to the chairman of Isiala Mbano LGA was killed by political thugs after the governorship primary of the All Progressives Congress in the state.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 14 persons lost their lives when some Fulani herdsmen attacked a Berom community. It was reported that the gunmen attacked the village in the middle of the night.

title: Political Crisis, Imo
description: 3 buses were burnt down and 1 person killed in Orodo ward as violence marred the primary election of the All Progressive Congress (APC).

title: Communal Clash, Plateau
description: Many persons lost their lives as a result of the violence that erupted after the killing of a motorcyclist by some thugs from Hausa community. Among the victims was a student of University of Jos who died while some Fulani herdsmen attacked some hostels.
place: Celebridge near Tina junction, Viilage Hostel near Faringada

title: Political Crisis, Niger
description: A clash between All Progressives Congress (APC) supporters of two rival House of Representative’s aspirants led to the death of 2 people while over 15 others in critical condition in the hospital.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Commander, Borno
description: Ali Garga, a commander in Mamman Nur, a Boko Haram faction, was assassinated by his colleagues for intending to free 300 captives. The victim was killed by other commanders when his plan was exposed. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed when Air Force jets launched attack on the location of the terrorists. The terrorists were neutralised during an aerial bombardment. Due to the the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.
place: Bakassi near Daban Masara on the fringes of Lake Chad

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 26-Task Force Brigade under the Sector 1 of the Operation Lafiya Dole killed 7 Boko Haram insurgents and rescued 73 person in two separate operations.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided and burnt three villages. It was reported that the terrorists looted food items before setting the villages on fire.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Abdulkarim Bagoma was killed by bandits. 3 others were injured and the whereabouts of one Ibrahim Mai is still unknown.
place: Birnin-Gwari-Funtua road connecting Kaduna and Katsina States

title: Boko Haram vs Midwife, Borno
description: The killing of Saifura Hussaini Ahmed Khorsa (25 years) by Boko Haram was captured in a video. She was one of the aid workers that were kidnapped by the terrorists when they attacked an Internally Displace Persons camp on March 1, 2018. See event in IBD013281.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several insurgents (assuming 20) were killed in an ambush by soldiers. Several arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Air Force killed Boko Haram occupants of 4 trucks intended to be used for an attack. It is assumed not less than 10 terrorists died in the attack.

title: Rustlers Kill 2, Plateau
description: 2 teenagers were killed by cattle rustlers. The victims were identified as Meshack Dalyop (14 years) and Pam Danjuma (10 years). It was reported that the body of the victims were dumped in the bush.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorist in 2 communities where the Albarnawi faction of the terror group recently operated.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Many persons died when soldiers and Boko Haram terrorists were engaged in a gun battle during an attack on an army base. 50 terrorists were killed. It is believed few other uncoategorized persons(assuming about 10) died in the incident.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: Gunmen attacked and killed several persons in the early hours of the day. The attacks were believed to be bandits
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (21 ) , This Day (11 ) , Daily Trust (12 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigeria Air Force (NAF) killed many Boko Haram terrorists and destroyed their hideouts. The incident happened during air interdictions by Operation Thunder Strike II. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 terrorists were killed.

title: Army vs Bandits/Kidnappers, Kaduna
description: Troops of Division 1, Nigerian Army shot dead 6 kidnappers and 4 bandits during a clearance operation along an expressway. The 4 bandits were identified as Kidan Isa, Gidan Haruna, Mobale and Kuduru. An AK-47 rifle magazine, 16 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition, one dane gun, a locally-made pistol and two mobile phones were recovered by the army.
place: Kidandan, Unguwan Bilya, Sofa and Unguwan Nakuli areas along Abuja-Kaduna Expressway

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists attacked a military base. It was reported that both the army and the terrorists suffered casualties. It is assumed that 20 persons died in the attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Many persons were killed by Boko Haram terrorist when they attacked a military base. It was stated that scores of soldiers and residents were killed in the attack. majority of the residents were IDPs who recently returned home.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 )

title: Assailants vs Man, Gombe
description: A man identified as Hayatu Aliyu died from the injuries he sustained when some bandits attacked him as he went to buy a mobile phone. The killers were identified as Jibrin Adamu (20 years), Garkuwa Soul (20 years), Babangida Danladi (26 years) and some other persons at large.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 youths were killed by Fulani herdsmen in an early morning attack. The victims were killed by the herders who attacked a village, shooting sporadically at villagers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets killed scores of Boko Haram terrorists and destroyed their strongholds in a renewed onslaught against the terror group.
place: Kollaram on the Fringes of Lake Chad and Sambisa Forest

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole ambushed Boko Haram militants and killed many of them. It was reported that the troops recovered some weapons and 147 assorted livestock. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 terrorists were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Miners, Plateau
description: Five persons were gunned down by unknown gunmen at a mining site. The incident happened when the miners were working at the site. Several other persons were wounded in the attack.

title: Bandits vs General, Plateau
description: Major General Idris Alkali was murdered by bandits while he was travelling on a road and was buried in a shallow grave.

title: Kidnappers vs Police, Rivers
description: Bandits killed three persons, including two policemen and a driver who were escorting a Nigerian staff from Total oil company. According to unconfirmed local reports, a fourth policeman died at hospital. Bandits were actually attacking a supermarket when they met the police escort and tried to put a hand on their weapons. There was no planned kidnapping.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 8 persons, including a pastor with Church of Christ in Nation LCC, his wife, 3 children and three other persons, were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The attackers raided the community, burnt the pastor and his family. A version of the story stated that a woman was shot dead by the soldiers when she demanded that they go after killer herdsmen.
place: Abonong and Zayit villages of Foron DIstrict

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 1 person was shot dead by gunmen suspected Fulani herdsmen when they attacked a mining site.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 30 soldiers were reportedly killed by Boko Haram. The troops deployed for 'Operation Last Hold' came under attacks right in their base by several terrorists. However, Army Headquarters denied the attacks and maintained that several of the terrorists (assuming at least 20) were killed. 18 more bodies were recovered few days after the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (50 ) , Daily Trust (60 ) , This Day (68 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers during an ambush. Several weapons were recoverd from the terrorists.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 30 bandits were killed in an Air Force bombardment. Several bandits have been killed in similar attacks.

title: 2 Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 armed robberes were killed in a fierce gun duel with the Police. Arms recovered from the suspects included AN AK 47 Riffle, and five live ammunition. They were believed to have killed members of the IGP Intelligence Response Team (IRT) also in Kaduna.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Plateau
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a fresh attack on a community.Two communities in the council were also attacked last week.

title: Boko Haram Leader, Borno
description: The factional leader of the Boko Haram loyal to Islamic State in West Africa (ISWA), Mamman Nur, was killed by his fighters who rebelled against him. The victim was killed by his closest lieutenants. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that the incident happened in Borno.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked Ndin and Haipang villages.This event is linked to IBD014649.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 19 persons lost their lives during an attack by Boko Haram insurgents in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the terrorists came to the community in trucks, firing guns and rocket propelled grenades.

title: Gunmen vs Cleric, Kaduna
description: Hosea Akuchi, Pastor of Baptist Church, Guguwa, was killed by some bandits who attempted to kidnap him. The bandits later kidnapped the victim's wife known as Talatu.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of terrorists were neutralized by the Nigeria Air Force during series of air strikes aimed at routing the insurgents. Another source reported that dozens (assuming at least 2 dozens) were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (24 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 )

title: Police vs IPOB Women, Imo
description: Extra Judicial Killing: One person was killed during a referendum march by more than 1000 women of the Indigenous People Of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the victim died when police attacked the peaceful protesters. 25 others were injured

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 5 bandits were killed by soldiers. The bandits had ambushed the soldiers but were overpowered. Among the victims was a notious bandits, Sani Danbuzuwa. A soldier also died in the operation.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 1 soldier was killed and two others were badly wounded when armed Fulani herdsmen ambushed military personnel. The military men were on routine surveillance when the event happened.

title: Air Force Vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) destroyed the hide-outs of bandits and in the process killed scores of bandits. It is assumed that the number of people killed is 40.

title: Boat Mishap, Zamfara
description: 5 people mostly kids died after a boat ferrying them capsized. They were fleeing their community after a levy was imposed on them by suspected armed bandits and cattle rustlers.

title: Army vs Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in the Operation Whirl Stroke killed 21 Fulani herdsmen during a military clearance operation aimed at flushing out bandits and terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Political Violence, Jigawa
description: Crisis broke out during an All Progressives Congress stakeholders meeting. 2 people lost their lives. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: A twin suicide bomb attack on a crowded place led to the death of 10 people while many others sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Gunmen vs Ex-Prison Boss, Nasarawa
description: A retired Assistant Controller-General of Prisons, Nanvyat Gwali, was killed by unknown gunmen in his farm. The body of the victim was discovered in his farm.Accusing finger was pointed at Alhaji Tumbo Banki for the killing of Gwali.

title: Political Violence, Ekiti
description: A high ranking member of the All Progressive Congress (APC) identified as Mr. Bunmi Ojo was assassinated by unknown gunmen at a football viewing centre in the night. It is assumed that his death was politically motivated.

title: Herdsmen Kill Police, Edo
description: A policeman, an escort to officials of the Edo state chapter of the Practising Butchers Association, was killed by herdsmen. The convoy of the butchers ran into armed Fulani herdsmen numbering over 20 robbing travelers on the highway.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Air Force killed a large number of bandits operating in a forest and terrorising some communities. The incident happened during armed reconnaissance missions conducted by the Air Force. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed.
place: Sububu, Birnin Magaji and Rugu Forests

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Soldiers diggigng trenches around a military base were ambushed by Boko Haram terrorists. Reportedly, a staff of NEMA, Mr. John Iliya and 18 soldiers were killed in the attack. Weapons were also looted by the attackers.

title: Herdsmen vs Cattle Rustlers, Adamawa
description: A man was killed during a fight in a market. Some men came to the market to sell a rustled cattle. A fight ensued between the rustlers and the cattle owners. The victim was killed in the process.

title: Police and Vigilante, Taraba
description: 3 policemen ASP Kilobas Iliya, Sgt. John Dogo and PC Joel Saleh and 2 vigilantes were ambushed and killed by the gang of armed bandits who carted away their AK47 rifle and a Bareta pistol.

title: Boko Haram Kill 7, Borno
description: 7 people were killed when Boko Haram raided a village. The beheaded the victims including the were the village chief and his wife before setting the village on fire. They also fired guns and rocket-propelled grenades on the community.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram suicide bombers inlcluding 3 female bombers, who set out to attack several locations in the state capital, lost their lives when the Improvised Explosive Devices on them detonated.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an ambush by soldiers. The terrorists were reportedly on their way to attack a village.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked some communities.The attackers struck at night.The 3 persons killed were believed to be Irigwe people.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 5 persons were shot dead during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and Yandang communities. The herdsmen attacked the communities at night.

title: Army vs IPOB, Abia
description: The bodies of 38 pro-Biafra agitators were found in a village. It was reported that the victims were arrested during the Operation Python Dance carried out by the Nigerian Army in the South East Zone. Residents claimed the bodies were dumped in the last 2 weeks. It is believed they were killed in the last 2 weeks and therefore backdated to then.

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits, assuming about 40 of them, were killed by Nigeria Air Force. Recently, the Federal government drafted special forces to the state to combat the bandits.
place: Mashema, Yankari and Hayin Alhaji villages

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 villagers were killed by Boko Haram during a raid. Details of the attack were not reported. This incident is backdated by a week since it reportedly happened a week before its report.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 persons lost their lives when some bandits attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits abducted 7 other persons including 2 nursing mothers and an 8-day old baby.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists, assuming 2 scores, were killed when the Nigerian Air Force fighter jet struck the terrorists' settlement at a village. The raid repelled the planned occupation of the village and attack on troop location by the terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 16 Boko Haram insurgents while a soldier and two civilians were injured in a clearance operation. The troops recovered two gun trucks and other assorted weapons from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A policeman was killed and 4 soldiers were injured in an attack on a police station and an army base in a town. It was reported that the insurgents came in about 30 vehicles and launched attack on the town.

title: Political Violence, Imo
description: Mr. Sunny Ejiagwu, a newly-elected All Progressive Congress (APC) chairman of Ideato North Local Government Area, was murdered by unknown gunmen. It is assumed that the victim was killed because of his political position.

title: Police vs Bandits, Ogun
description: 1 person was killed when police busted a gang of bandits who specialize in high profile kidnapping and robbery. The victim was killed during a gun duel with policemen who foiled attempt to rob and kidnap two businessmen for ransom. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Police Vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Some armed bandits ambushed a police vehicle on routine patrol, killed 3 of the police personnel and burnt down their vehicle.

title: Police vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed when they engaged security operatives that included the police, hunters and members of the Civilian Joint Force in a shoot out. 2 of the terrorists were arrested.

title: Gunmen vs Worshipers, Zamfara
description: 42 people were killed inside a mosque when bandits invaded a village, moving from house to house. The gunmen stormed the village on motorcycles and headed straight to the mosque. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Male suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) strapped on his body during an early morning congregational prayer in a mosque, killing himself and 7 other persons.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Former Commissioner for Education in Katsina State, Professor Halima Idris, a military officer and 2 others were killed by gunmen on Kaduna-Abuja highway.
place: Between Jere and Kateri, about eighty five kilometres between Abuja and Kaduna.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists and some soldiers were killed during an ambush staged by the insurgents. It was also reported that the terrorists were on their way to attack a market before ambushing soldiers. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 soldiers and 2 scores of insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram vs Air Force, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 2 scores) lost their lives in an aerial bombardment by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF).

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 3 persons were killed in an attack by bandits in a village.It was reported that the attackers in their dozens stormed a village market by evening, killed 3 persons and injured 8 others.

title: Gunmen vs Police, RIvers
description: 2 policemen were killed by unknown gunmen at a junction. It was reported that there was rising incidents of gunmen attacking policemen in the state. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 30 persons were killed and dozens missing when Boko Haram insurgents ambushed a convoy of vehicles. It was reported that 27 vehicles of various sizes and capacity conveying commuters and goods were completely torched by the insurgents.

title: Bandits Kill 30, Zamfara
description: 30 people (7 people in Sakkada; 4 in Gyadadde; 8 in Barin Zare; 4 in Sabon Gari, and 8 in Otawa.) were killed during raids on their villages. The attackers were believed to be bandits and cattle rustlers. Several cows were also rustled.
place: Sakkada, Barin Zare, Otawa, Gyadadde and Sabon Gari villages

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 policemen and 2 bandits lost their lives during a clash between the police and some bandits. It was reported that the gunmen ambushed the police and both engaged in a fierce gun battle. While mourning the dead policemen, a woman, Mrs. Martha Amos, a widow, lost her life when she was hit by stray bullet from the police.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 6, Taraba
description: 6 suspected cattle rustlers were killed by herdsmen when they tried to sell the rustled cows in a market. The cows were believed to have been rustled during the reclent invasion of Lau LGA.

title: Bandits Kill Man, Jigawa
description: A 32-year-old man, Yahaya Chu, was lhacked to death when he tried to stop robbers from stealing his motorcycle.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Boko haram ambushed and killed soldiers (5 officers and 18 soldiers missing). 22 of the insurgents lost their lives in the same incident. However, soldiers denied any of their soldiers were killed. The attackers reportedly have links with Islamic State in West African Province (ISWAP).

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Yobe
description: 20 soldiers were killed and 20 others injured in a Boko Haram ambush. According to a report, over 600 soldiers were still missing after the terrorists, dressed in military apparel and armed with sophisticated weapons overran the military base.

title: Asthmatic Patience, Lagos
description: 63-year-old Mr. Theophilus Olurotimi Shofu, an asthmatic patience, begged the police to allow him to go, because he was heading to the hospital but the police refuse, in the process, he had asthma crisis, collapsed at the feet of the policemen and died.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 residents were killed during a Boko Haram raid on a community. Among the victims is John Tika, a former secretary of the defunct All Nigeria Peoples Party (ANPP). The insurgents also hoisted their flag in the community.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: Fulani herdsmen raided some villages, shot sporadically and burnt houses while residents were asleep. 48 people were killed.
place: Mayo Lope, Yojjin, Bujun, Ugbakka, and Wakka

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 15 Boko Haram members were killed during a gun battle with soldiers. Some fled into the bush with gunshot wounds.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: About 50 persons were killed during an attack by Fulani herdsmen on some communities. It was reported that the invaders also destroyed houses and properties.
place: Gojefa, Bujum Yashi, Bujum Waya, Sabonlayi and Bujum Kasuwa

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: About 42 persons were killed during an attack by Fulani herdsmen on some communities. It was reported that the invaders also destroyed houses and properties.
place: Todung, Budon, Bunzum and Bamga Dutse
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Punch (42 ) , Independent (73 ) , The Nation (73 )

title: Gunmen vs District Head, Zamfara
description: The District Head of Kucheri, Alhaji Ibrahim Madawaki, was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the traditional ruler was shot while sitting in front of his house by assailants who came on motorbikes.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Three farmers identified as Ormoba Tsebo, Mkarsha Kyaave and Aondofa Iorliam were killed by Fulani herdsmen who ambushed some Internally Displaced Persons that were going to their farms in the early hours of the day. Several others were injured in the attack.

title: Police vs Bandits, Delta
description: A notorious bandit, Fidelis Enege, was shot dead by policemen from the Delta State Police Command. It was reported that the victim was the leader of a gang behind the murder of Francis Ogodo as captured in IBD014297. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: Scores of people (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Among the victims was a policeman. However, 3 of the attackers were killed by soldiers. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 6 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a village. It was reported that the herders also burnt 22 houses and a church.
place: Raghwol Ewi at Maraban Kantoma in Fan District

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers following a tip off. Further details of the incident were not reported.

title: Boko Haram Kill 2, Borno
description: 2 residents were killed by Boko Haram during an attack on a community. 3 others sustained injuries. An insurgent, Ibrahim Lawal, however, surrendered to soldiers. This incident is backdated by 2 days of its report since no date was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. 5 motorcycles and food stuff were recovered.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers while on patrol. Several arms and ammunition recovered from the insurgents. A soldier was wounded in the operation.
place: Mallam Kafari, Goni, Alkari, Burburna and Kantanna

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers on counter-insurgency operations in the North East. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out terrorists. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 2 persons were killed while 29 others were injured by Fulani herdsmen when the herders attacked some farmers in their farms. It was reported that the herders also set some villages ablaze.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 terrorists were killed and 33 hostages rescued during a patrol of Damboa and Bama council areas. It is believed that 2 of the terrorists were killed in Damboa LGA. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 soldiers attached to the Operation Whirl Stroke, a military spike operation to stem herdsmen killing, were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen in an ambush. The attackers injured other soldiers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: About 110 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked 11 villages. It was reported that the herders carried out the attack, killing natives and destroying properties. Some of the killers were arrested and their names are Yahuza, Friday and Ahmed, Mr. Ishaya Adamu, Peace Yohanna, Rita James and Deborah.
place: Xland, Gindin Akwati, Ruku, Nghar, Kura Falls and Kakuruk all in Gashish District as well as Rakok, Kok and Razat villages all in Ropp District
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (110 ) , Vanguard (135 ) , The Punch (86 ) , Other newpapers 1 (150 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village and killed 4 people.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 21 persons lost their lives while several others were injured during an attack by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen struck around 8pm, killed the victims, burnt several houses and properties.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by men of of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the troops encountered the insurgents at midday, killing 7 and recovering 2 AK 47 rifles, AK 56 rifle and 7 rounds of 7.62 mm ammunition.

title: Army vs Armed Bandits, Zamfara
description: The troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army killed 20 armed bandits and arrested three others in a village. It was reported that the army raided the hideout of the bandits.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Borno
description: 3 were beheaded during an attack by Boko haram. The victims were working in their farms when they were raided. 13 others sustained gunshot injuries.

title: Army vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Extra Judicial Killing: Soldiers from the Nigerian Army killed 6 Fulani herdsmen and over 150 cows. There was no report on what led to the killing by the military. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Bandits vs Man, Delta
description: A man identified as Francis Ogodo was murdered by some bandits led by one Fidelis Enege. It was reported that Fidelis and his gang have been terrorising residents.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many people were killed when 2 female suicide bombers sneaked into the barracks in a tricycle, and detonated their explosives at a relaxation spot.It is assumed that 10 people were killed. A version of the report stated that 2 female suicide bombers, a soldier and 2 civilian joint task force personnel were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Hoodlums, Plateau
description: 5 Fulani travellers were burnt to death while they were returning from market. It was report that the vehicle conveying them was waylaid by hoodlums who set them ablaze.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 4 persons from the same family were killed by Fulani herdsmen who launched an attack on a community in the night. It was reported that many persons were injured.
place: Kai village, Kurra Falls, Gashes district

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force neutralized scores (assuming at least 40) Boko Haram terrorists during an aerial bombardment. It was reported that the mission was carried out with 2 NAF Alpha Jet aircraft.

title: 23 Found Dead, Zamfara
description: 23 unidentified persons were found dead inside a forest. It was reported that the victims had gunshot wounds or slit throats. It was reported that the victims were killed by bandits who operated inside the forest. Due to the nature of the incident, it is backdated by 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide attacks and a rocket propelled grenades on a community killed over 20 persons. Majority of the victims were people coming back from Eid-el-Fitri celebration. The insurgents fired grenades into a crowd that gathered after the suicide attacks, increasing the fatalities and injured victims.

title: Gunmen Kill 3, Enugu
description: 3 persons were gunned down within 24 hours while another was severely injured by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victims were working in their farmlands when they were waylaid and killed by gunmen.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: Scores of residents (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed when bandits numbering over 200 raided several communities. Many of the inhabitants who fled the recent attacks are scared to return home.
place: Fura Girke, Majira, Kanawa, Yargeba, Takoka, Bargaja, Bundungel, Bantsa, Unguwar Matanda and Makera

title: Troops vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of 72 Special Force Battalion in the Nigerian Army killed some armed bandits while some escaped with gunshot wounds during a gun duel between the army and the bandits. The army recovered some weapons and other items used in communication by the bandits. It assumed that 10 of the bandits were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: A Boko Haram commander was killed when some terrorists attacked 13 villages. The victim was killed by security operatives.

title: Political Violence, Ekiti
description: A member of the All Progressive Congress (APC) was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that Mr Willy Ayegoro was shot dead by two gunmen who rode on a motorbike. Due to on-coming elections in the state, several persons on the opposition have been facing attacks.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: A family of 4 Tiv farmers was killed by Fulani herdsmen while going to their farm. It was reported that the killed happened in the morning and the victims are Utindi Kyor (Father of the family), Shie Aondo (his son), Dedzugwen (son's wife) and Boyi (grandson).

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 persons, including a Boko Haram suicide bomber, lost their lives when the bomber attacked a shop near an extended congregation of Muslims performing midnight prayers. One of the dead victims was a civilian Joint Task Force personnel.
place: Along Baga Road by Maikore Junction

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed about 23 Boko Haram terrorists during a clearance operation aimed at clearing out the terrorists. It was reported that the troops of 153 Task Force Battalion in conjunction with Cameroonian Defence Forces carried out the operation.

title: Gunmen Attack,, Plateau
description: 3 persons were killed by unknown gunmen who ambushed them at a junction and went away with their motor bikes. It was reported that many other persons were injured in the attack.

title: Explosion, Adamawa
description: A boy identified as Saidu Ahmed lost his life while two of his friends sustained severe injuries when an improvised explosive device (IED) exploded. It was reported that the trio were picking metal scraps when the incident happened.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber heading to the market mistakenly detonated an improvised explosive device (IED), killing himself alone. It was reported that the male suicide bomber detonated the bomb when he sighted massive presence of police and other security agents.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Sokoto
description: 13 persons lost their lives in a clash between bandits and vigilante group. The clash occurred after a failed attempt by the bandits to kidnap an elderly man in a village. While the bandits killed 7 of the vigilante members, they lost 5 of their men during the gun duel.
place: Dan Tasango village in Gebe district

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons lost their lives in the hands of bandits who doubled as kidnappers along a major highway. It was reported that the kidnappers abducted travelers plying the highway.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 5 bandits were killed during a gun duel with the army. It was reported that the army engaged the bandits in their camps and killed the victims.
place: Danguru, Babandoka, Dansadau districts and Madaka forests

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 Boko Haram terrorist was killed by troops of 145 Battalion during a clearance operation targeted at routing the terrorist. The troops recovered AK 47 rifle and one magazine loaded with 25 rounds 7.62mm.

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: 12 bandits were killed by troop of Nigeria Amy attached to 1 Division Garrison when the bandits went to the village market to restock their supplies and other necessities.
place: Kidandan, Maidaro and Sabon Fili villages

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 192-Battalion under Operation Lafiya Dole killed 4 Boko Haram insurgents and recovered many weapons from them. The incident happened when the troops staged an ambush on the insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Some Irigwe people were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the security agents were accused of complicity in the killing. Due to the nature of the report, it is presumed that 5 persons were killed in the incident.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 13 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when the herders invaded a community. Some of the victims were killed when the herders attacked a wake keep in the community while 2 of them were students who came to write the National Examination Council (NECO) in the affected community.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 bandits were gunned down during a gun duel with the police. It was reported that the incident happened when the police intervened while the bandits were attacking some communities.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a community in the wee hour, killing 5 people in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Police, Nasarawa
description: 3 policemen were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The victims were ambushed on their way to quell a crisis between Agatu farmers and the herdsmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 19 farmers were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a village. It was reported that the herders burnt many houses, foodstuffs and personal belonging. Several farms were destroyed,

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 11 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of 153 Task Force Battalion, Operation Lafiya Dole and Camerounian Defence forces during military clearance operations.

title: Bandits Kill 30, Zamfara
description: 23 people were killed by bandits during an attack on a community. The bandits had previously attacked the community but lost some of their members (assuming 5) to the by local vigilantes called Yansakai. They however struck back later and killed 30 residents.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (23 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists were shot dead by soldiers during a clearance operation. 9 hostages including 2 aged men , 2 females and 5 children were also rescued.
place: Jaje, Angwa Audu, Major Ali, Dabu Abdullahi, Dabu Wulkaro and Gori Jaji

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Police, Oyo
description: A policeman identified as Timothy was stabbed to death at a community by a Fulani herder. The victim was killed while on surveillance duty.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 5 soldiers died after their vehicle ran into IEDs laid by Boko Haram. The insurgents had ambushed the soldiers but lost many of their members in a shootout. It is assumed about 10 of the insurgents were killed.

title: Security Operatives vs IPOB/MASSOB, Abia
description: A young man identified as Nnamdi was hit by stray bullet and he died on the spot during a clash between members of the Pro-Biafra groups and security operatives. The incident happened as the pro-Biafra groups marked Biafra Heroes Remembrance Day. The victim was said to have come from his house to buy something when he was shot dead.
place: Chigbu Street, off Uratta junction by Port Harcourt road

title: Gunmen vs Police, Rivers
description: 2 police officers were shot dead by gunmen while another police officer sustained gun shot injuries in the incident. It was reported that the victims were on patrol when the unknown gunmen opened fire on them.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 persons travelling on a motorcycle to visit a relatives were ambushed whIle a woman was also killed.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: 8 persons lost their lives when some bandits struck at a village and stole some cattle. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village, shooting at anybody at sight. One of the victims was the head of the vigilante. Due to the nature of the event, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A man was killed when Boko Haram members attacked Fulani settlement. They rustled a good number of cattle.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 persons lost their lives when Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated Improvised Explosive Device at a village. It was reported that 2 of the dead were civilians.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 2 residents were kidnapped and later killed by armed bandits. The killing triggered mass exodus from the community for fear of further killings. This incident is backdated by a week since no date was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A couple, Mr. Kwaghaondo Ugber and his wife, Mne, were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the couple were ambushed on their way to another village.

title: Youths vs Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 8 Fulani herdsmen were killed by youths over a damaged phone. 5 persons were arrested for the killings. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: One Azegeor Shitenger was killed by Fulani herdsmen when the herders attacked a village. They also took one Mrs Yonov Shitenger hostage.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ekiti
description: 3 travellers, including 2 women, were killed by Fulani herders. 2 of the victims were travelling in a commercial bus while the 3rd victim was travelling in a private car.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who have been terrorising some communities in Benue State. It was reported that the victims were returning from the burial of 19 persons who were previously butchered by Fulani herders as captured in IBD013714.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 soldiers were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders attacked a community.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 5 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they invaded a village in the night. It was reported that the herders attacked the village, killing 5 persons and injuring many others.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed one person, abducted three housewives and six others when they invaded a village. It was reported that a 12-year-old child sustained injuries from gunshots during the incident which happened in the midnight.

title: Army vs Fulani herdsmen, Benue
description: 35 Fulani herdsmen were killed by troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) while a soldier lost his life during the clearance operation targeted at neutralizing the herders who have been terrorizing some communities. It was reported that the herders were engaged by the army through air and land operations.

title: 3 in Cult Violence, Abuja (FCT)
description: A clash by teenager cultists has led to the death of 3 victims. There were worries that the community have been infiltrated by cultists with illegal firearms. The crisis has been ongoing in the past few months.

title: Bandits vs Passenger, Kaduna
description: A passenger was killed when bandits opened fire on a commercial vehicle. It was reported that the victim died while other passengers sustained injuries as the driver lost control of the vehicle which veered into a bush.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) killed scores of Boko Haram terrorists during an aerial bombardment aimed at clearing out the insurgents. The operation was carried out with Mi-35 helicopter gunships which was used to fire rockets and cannons at the insurgents.

title: Amy vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the 1 Brigade of the Nigerian Army have killed 3 bandits during the 'Operation Idon Raini' in the state. Other members of the criminal gang escaped with gunshot wounds.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army nutralized 2 female suicide bombers, who targeted the troops. One of the bombers detonated the device and killed 2 victims while the other one failed to explode.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole killed 2 Boko Haram terrorists in a joint counter-insurgency operation with Camerounian Defence Forces and Civilian JTF. The troops also arrested some terrorists in their hideouts.

title: Armed Bandits vs Communities, Kaduna
description: 10 persons were killed by armed bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that several persons were injured in the attack. The bandits stormed several villages, shooting and burning down houses and farmlands.
place: Mashigi, Dakwaro and Sabon Gida villages
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 people were killed while 15 others injured when a Boko Haram bomber disguised as a worshipper, detonated his explosives in an open-air mosque for people displaced by insurgency.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 5 farmers were killed by Fulani herders who invaded a community. It was reported that the killing happened few hours after Vice President Yemi Osinbajo left the place.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 members of a cooperative society who went to inspect some hectares of land were not lucky to escape as Fulani herdsmen killed them.

title: 6 Vigilantes, Adamawa
description: 6 local vigilantes fighting alongside the military were ambushed and killed by Boko Haram insurgents when on patrol.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole and Camerounian Defense Forces killed 15 Boko Haram terrorists during a clearance operation aimed at neutralizing the insurgents in their hideouts.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit was shot dead during an exchange of gunfire between Troops of 1 Brigade, Nigerian Army and some bandits. It was reported that severally bandits escaped with gunshot.

title: Kinappers vs Engineer, Sokoto
description: A Syrian engineer, working with a construction company, was abducted by kidnappers. It was reported that the bandits also killed three policemen attached to the expatriate.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 5 persons were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked 2 communities. It was reported that the assailants invaded two settlements in the early hours of the day.
place: Tiv settlements of Ilai Mopamuro and Ido-Gbede

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents at their hideouts were killed by Troops under the Operation Lafiya Dole. The troops also rescued an aged man who was held hostage by Boko Haram terrorists.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Bandits, Adamawa
description: 10 bandits were killed in a shootout with soldiers. The victims were killed during a clearance operation.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 22 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen in the early hours of the day when they attacked a village. It was reported that the village was attacked by about 42 herders.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists attacked a community and killed 2 people.

title: Security Agent vs Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 10 Fulani herdsmen were killed by a joint police/military operation. It was reported that herders camped in a village from where they launched series of attacks on several communities before the security operatives swooped on them.

title: Armed Banditry, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits killed 8 persons in a village and stole cows. It was reported that the bandits stormed the village and started firing gunshots which caused the villagers to scamper for safety.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 8 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack on a village. It was reported that the herders stormed the community on motorbikes, killing residents and burning houses.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers blew up themselves after they were chased from the premises of a mosque. It was reported that the bombers had earlier attempted to sneak into a mosque while worshipers were observing their morning prayers but were chased out of the area.
place: Bunu's mosque in the Jiddari area

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed during a raid by Troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army and some weapons were recovered from them in a farmhouse they forcefully took from the owner. The abandoned farmhouse was forcefully occupied by criminals and had been used as a shelter and a place where victims of kidnapping were kept.
place: Gonan Bature East of Rijana and Kasarami Farm House

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Nigerian Air Force. There were exchange of gunfire with ground troops before the Air Force was invited.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , The Guardian (40 ) , Other newspaper 3 (40 )

title: Land Dispute, Plateau
description: 3 persons lost their lives as a result of land dispute between the people of Shanful and Mudah. It was reported that 5 houses were burnt in the crisis which lasted for 4 hours.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 45 persons, mainly women and children, were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. It was reported that the attacked village borders Zamfara State. The attacker encircled the village before opening fire on villagers.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (64 ) , Vanguard (58 ) , The Nation (71 ) , The Punch (73 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram victims (including 4 Boko Haram members) died while 7 persons were injured when the bombers detonated the Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) strapped on their bodies. Other sources stated that 7 victims including the terrorists died in the suicide.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 30 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked 4 villages in 2 council areas. It was reported that several persons were injured in the incident while many others were missing.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , Other newspaper 3 (12 ) , Vanguard (15 ) , Other newspaper 2 (12 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A community was attacked by Boko Haram and many are feared dead. It is assumed about 10 people were killed by the insurgents since no figure was reported.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Zamafara
description: 13 persons lost their lives in a clash between armed bandits and vigilantes. It was reported that the incident happened when the armed bandits stormed a venue where the vigilantes were holding a meeting.

title: Auto Crash, Ogun
description: A Police Inspector, Azeez Ajasa, died in a lone accident when he lost control of his Golf 4 car with number plate EKY 631 BB and veered into a bush. The car somersaulted in the process.
place: Adedero village on the Kobape-Abeokuta Expressway

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 60 persons lost their lives when twin bomb blasts by Boko Haram insurgents hit a mosque and a nearby market. It was reported that many people were critically injured in the attacks.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (68 ) , Nigerian Tribune (27 ) , Independent (42 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded some villages. It was reported that the attackers also injured several persons and razed many houses.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: A 30-year-old farmer identified as Alani Olalere was killed by Fulani herdsmen when he went to his farm. It was reported that the victim was dealt machete cuts on his neck which led to his death.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A logistic base of Boko Haram was bombarded by Nigerian Air Force and all the insurgents in the location were reportedly killed. Another source reported scores of the insurgents (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 7 persons in the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded the camp situated in a church. It was reported that the event happened in the midnight. Some the victims were identified as Festus Terdue Agude, Mama Doom Uhule Oragbai, Shiaondo Tamen, Tordue Tamen, Iorbume Shima and Mr. Suur.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko insurgents in a group of cars and motorcycle attacked Maiduguri and exchanged gunfire with security operatives. 9 people including 5 suicide bombers died in the incident.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 8 persons were killed by Fulani Herdsmen when the herders invaded several villages in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the herders also set the villages ablaze.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 19 persons, including two Catholic priests, were brutally butchered by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community in the early hours of the day. It was reported that the priests were killed alongside some of their church members during mass. The names of the priests are Rev Fathers Josephe Gor and Felix Tyolaha. Among other victims are Mr. John Ivor, a catechist and Mr. Hyacinth Chia.
place: St. Ignatius Catholic Parish, Mbalom village

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 7 persons in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camp were brutally murdered by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when the victims tried to collect some foodstuffs from their village.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 28 persons lost their lives when Fulani herdsmen attacked some villages. It was reported that the herders numbering about 50 attacked the villages for about 2 days.
sources_of_information: The Punch (28 ) , Vanguard (39 ) , Other newpapers 1 (37 ) , Daily Trust (34 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists lost their lives when they detonated the bombs strapped to their bodies while they attempted to infiltrate a town. It was reported that they killed themselves only.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 people including 4 Boko Haram insurgents, 3 soldiers and 2 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) were killed during a shootout between soldiers and Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed during a shootout with soldiers. Other insurgents fled during the exchange.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kogi
description: Troops of Nigerian Army killed 6 bandits who have been terrorizing some communities. It was reported that several others were severely injured in the operation.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops acting on intelligence discovered the camp Boko Haram Insurgents, used for providing instructional training materials. During the encounter; the troops killed 1 of the insurgent and rescued a hostage from the training camp.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. 5 captives were also rescued.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 22 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they invaded some communities. It was reported that the victims of incident, which happened in the midnight, were mostly women, children and old people.
place: Anzughul, Tse-Abi, Tse Ginde, Tse-Peviv, Tse-Ikyo, Agenke and Gbenke communities
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (22 ) , Vanguard (31 ) , The Guardian (20 ) , Daily Trust (12 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army on Operation Lafiya Dole killed a Boko Haram insurgent. It was reported that the troops also wounded several other terrorists in the encounter. It was reported that a soldier was also killed in the operation.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 27 people were killed by gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers. The attack was a reprisal attack for killing a cattle rustler by villagers. The victims were killed in 3 communities.
place: Kabaro, Danmani Hausawa and Danmani Dakarkari villages
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (34 ) , The Punch (27 ) , Other newpapers 1 (30 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 6 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack on a farming community. Several others were injured and many houses burnt.

title: Herdsman Kill 1, Benue
description: A resident was killed during an attack on a community by Fulani herdsmen. About 40 houses were set ablaze. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 2 persons were killed by bandits who attacked a village. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing some villages.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Army, Benue
description: 4 Fulani herdsmen were shot dead by men of the 707 Special Forces Brigade during a shootout between both parties. The incident happened when the herdsmen attacked a community.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 9 Mobile Policemen deployed to maintain peace were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the security operatives were ambushed by the herders after one of them was initially killed.

title: Fulani/Bororo Girl, Oyo
description: A 12-year-old Fulani/Bororo girl was tied to a tree by some farmers who were aggrieved over the destruction of their farms by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the girl later died.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed when Nigerian Air Force bombarded their convoy.

title: Communal Clash, Kogi
description: 5 people were killed, while over 50 houses were burnt in a crisis that erupted following a dispute between the Bassa Kwomu and the Igala over harvest at a disputed cashew plantation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the troops ambushed the terrorists during a clearance operation.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded some communities. It was reported that the attackers have been terrorizing residents.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 43 villagers were killed by bandits who attacked several villages. Some of the victims were killed in the course of burying their lost ones.
sources_of_information: The Nation (43 ) , Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 3 (26 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists were gunned down by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation aimed at dislodging the insurgents. Several abducted women and children were rescued.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons werre killed in a village when Fulani herdsmen attacked the village. It was reported that the attackers invaded the village in the early hours of the day.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked several border communities and kill 67 people. Initially, 41 persons were reportedly killed. Later on, 26 more bodies were recovered push up the fatality figure to 67.
place: Akaanya, Tse Gbum, Kpete and Ulam

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed so many people in different parts of Benue and Nasarawa state. 3 of the victims killed were from Tswarev, Logo LGA.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 1 person was killed by Fulani herdsmen when the herders opened fire on some villagers. It was reported that many people were injured in the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 5 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. Several others were injured in the attack. It was reported that the herders attacked a village with dangerous weapons including AK-47.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 20 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the Air Force during air strikes on the insurgent's hide out. The event was aimed at clearing the territory of terrorists.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in 2 separate encounters in the mountainous region by soldiers during clearance operation.
place: Bokko Hilde, along Ngoshe - Pulka road and Mujigine general area

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A farmer identified as Aondoaver Muemumu was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a village. It was reported that the the victim was ambushed on the way.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A soldier was killed by Fulani herdsmen. The incident happened when some Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and engaged security men, who were repelling them, in a gun battle

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 people were killed while 8t others sustained injuries when 2 female suicide bombers entered into a mosque and attack worshipers observing morning (Asuba) prayers.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 suicide bombing were killed by troops of the Nigerian Air Force and the Nigerian Army in an attempt to attack the students hostel at the University of Maiduguri.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 4 persons identified as relatives were killed by Fulani herdsmen who emerged from a bush and opened fire on some villagers. It was reported that the incident happened in the evening. The victims were identified as Hembaor Ahoor, Terlumun John Adair, Engr. Hange and Mr. Mfer.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: A father and his son were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a village. It was reported that the killers stormed the village in the evening.

title: Police vs Armed Robbers, Bayelsa
description: An armed robber was shot dead while another was fatally wounded during a gun duel between the robbers and the police. It was reported that the victims were among a gang of three bandits who carry out robbery attack behind a health centre. The deceased was identified as Selepamodei Ogili (23 years).

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed by soldiers. The bombers attempted to infiltrate a community but were intercepted by operatives.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Benue
description: A man and his son, Mr Andrew Ataboh and Benjamin were attacked and killed in their farm by Fulani herdsmen. Their vital organs were also removed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. 5 of them were also captured alive. 149 people including 54 women and 95 children were rescued from the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole engaged Boko Haram terrorists, killing 5 and arresting two of them. It was reported that the troops recovered assorted weapons and other items.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 5 persons were killed during an attack by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders attacked several communities in the early hours of the day and wounded many people.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen identified as Mohammed Osama and Umoru Sanda killed one Nurudeen Dahiru. It was reported that the victim was killed by the assailants without any provocation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 4 members of a family were killed by Fulani herdsmen despite the presence of the military in the community. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack for the killing of a Fulani man who was shot.

title: Soldiers, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits engaged the military men in a fierce gun duel resulting in the death of 2 soldiers and 21 bandits were gunned down. Several arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: Bandits vs Police, Kogi
description: Gunmen raided a police station, killed 2 policemen on duty and a suspect in police custody. The bandits also carted away AK-47 rifles belonging to the police.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 29 people including a soldier, 14 persons, 6 Boko Haram gunmen and 7 suicide bombers died in 2 separate incidents involving soldiers and the extremist group. The insurgents had attempted to infiltrate the state capital but were repelled. 83 people were wounded in both incidents

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 9 persons lost their lives during an attack by Boko Haram terrorists. While 4 terrorists were gunned down by security operatives, 4 suicide bombers were killed as they tried to detonate the bombs strapped to their bodies.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (11 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Daily Trust (9 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Edo
description: A pastor of the Church of God mission, Mr. Pius Eromosele, was abducted and killed by Fulani herdsmen while working on his farm. He was killed after being accused of killing a cow. Another person was also killed by the attackers.

title: Gunmen vs Herdsmen, Zamfara
description: Suspected cattle rustlers attacked some herders and killed about 15 of them. The gunmen rode on motorcycles, stormed the village and shot their victims dead. The gunmen initially killed 12 and later returned during the burial of the deceased to kill additional 3 victims.

title: Gunmen kill 2, Akwa Ibom
description: Unknown gunmen stormed a popular market and killed 2 victims. The hoodlums also set a portin of the market on fire after killing their victims. It was reported that the gunmen perpetrated the crime in protest for a crack down on their members by the Joint Task Force.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: 3 persons were shot dead gunmen who invaded a village, taking the villagers unawares. It was reported that the bandits were later engaged in a gun duel by the police.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: Fulani bandits wielding Ak47 rifles invaded a village, killed Alhaji Ibrahim Tanimu (Garkuwan Sabuwa) and injured Alhaji Mu'awiyya, after which a huge sum of money was taken from him.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers died during a failed suicide operation. They detonated the explosives on themselves and injured 3 others.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Benue
description: 2 boys were ambushed and killed Fulani herdsmen. The victims were among some youths who had gone to a stream to have their birth.

title: Bandits, Enugu
description: 2 robbery kingpins, Okeme alias Pikin and Philip a.k.a Akwara, that belong to Ndi Isewo Group of Abbi, that have been terrorising members of the public where beaten to death by irate mob.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked the victims while they were in their farms. The herders also burnt down some houses in the village..

title: Police vs Motorcyclist, Kwara
description: Extra Judicial Killing: A police sergeant attached to the Kwara State counter terrorism unit of state police command shot dead a commercial motorcyclist in the early hours of the day. The victim, killed without any justification, was identified as Sule Abu.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Plateau
description: 3 people were killed in a night attack by gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen. The attackers opened fire on their victims.

title: Bandits vs 11 Soldiers, Kaduna
description: 12 soldiers were shot dead by bandits loyal to Buharin Daji who was killed in Zamfara in IBD013332. The attack is suspected to be a reprisal attack for the murder of the kingpin. The victims were soldiers drafted into the state to fight banditry and others crimes.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: A traditional ruler, Musa Edibo, the Onu Okenwiu of Agbenma community, his wife and 8 other persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who have been terrorising the community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 persons were slaughtered by Boko Haram terrorists. The victims were killed near an internally displaced persons camp.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Edo
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 2 people. The community and the herdsmen have been having running battle in the area over a period of time.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Man, Plateau
description: A 23-year-old man, Mr. Joseph Alli, was killed and beheaded by Fulani herdsmen. They ate his food and went away with his head.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Taraba
description: A man, Andeyantso Bulus was killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack. Several people have lost their lives in the state in similar attacks.

title: Herdsmen Kill 5, Taraba
description: 5 people were killed during an attack on a community by Fulani herdsmen. The victim included a wife and her husband. Three women were also abducted.
place: Muji I, Muji II, Kando and Kpashimbe villages

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 25 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen in coordinated attacks targeted at some communities. It was reported that the herders injured many and razed houses.
place: Oganenigu village, Iyale and Aloko villages
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (25 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Vanguard (50 )

title: Mad Teacher Kills Pupils, Ogun
description: A suspected mentally derailed teacher, Lekan Adebisi have been arrested in connection with the killing of 2 pupils, Mubarak Kalesowo and Sunday Obituyi. The embattled teacher was an extra-moral tutor to the pupils when he developed a mental crisis and hacked to victims to death.

title: Businessman, Taraba
description: Mr. Kumachivir Iorkohol, a 33-year-old businessman was killed by unknown gunmen in his house after taking the money and the phones from him and his wife.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Herdsmen believed to be of Fulani extraction attacked a community and killed over 5. The victims were all farmers.Several people have lost their lives in similar attacks this year.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 people were killed and 18 others injured when a Boko Haram male teenage bomber detonated his Improvised Explosive Device (IED) in a crowded area where people gathered to buy bean cake.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists and 2 military officers including a commander lost their lives during a gun battle. The officers, Lt-Col. A.E. Mamudu and a young naval officer, were both killed by a vehicle-borne IED by suicide bombers.

title: Bandits Kill 20, Kebbi
description: 20 people were killed in several communities in different council areas by bandits. The 3 attacks were carried out in March.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 13 people including 3 UN aid workers, 4 policemen and 6 soldiers were killed during an attack on an IDP camp.Another female aid worker was abducted in the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , The Nation (13 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A female suicide bomber detonated explosives on herself when she could not have access to a targeted mosque. She had disguised as a worshiper to failed to gain entrance. 2 people were wounded in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents kidnapped 3 victims and the residents fled to different directions. 2 of the insurgents were killed by hunters and vigilante. Another one was wounded.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 28 men were allegedly killed by the military while undergoing an unreported screening. Their corpses were brought into the mortuary with with bullet wounds.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed and four injured in an ambush by Boko Haram terroritsts. It was reported that the incident happened when the soldiers were travelling from one town to another.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 10 Fulani herdsmen were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders attacked a community, razed houses and left many of the residents injured and displaced.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 35 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers in border areas with Cameroun. About 797 captives were rescued from them. It is assumed the incident took place in Bama since it shares border with Cameroun.
place: Kusha-Kucha, Surdewala, Alkanerik, Magdewerne and Mayen villages

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Police engaged bandits in a gun duel and killed one of them. The bandits had attacked 2 villages when policemen were drafted to the area. The victim was also reported as a kidnapper.

title: Religious Crisis, Kaduna
description: Muslim and Christian youths clashed over the conversion of a Christian girl. 12 people were reported dead and many others wounded. Many houses were also set ablaze.
sources_of_information: The Nation (9 ) , The Punch (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (15 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. One of their commanders was captured. Some solders and several other insurgents were wounded.

title: Communal Clash, Kwara
description: 1 person died during a clash between 2 communities, Offa and Ijagbo, over a piece of land. The crisis broke out during a peace meeting between the opposing communities. A naval rating and policemen were injured in the clash.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons were butchered by Fulani herdsmen who constantly attacked citizens in different parts of Benue state. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself during a failed suicide attack on the University of Maiduguri. He was sighted and they shot at him before he detonated the explosives.

title: Boko Haram Kidnapped 111 School Girls, Yobe
description: The kidnap of 111 school girls from the Government Girls Science Technical College has led to the death of 5 of the girls. Many of the girls are still missing although some of them were already rescued. The 5 victims including Aisha and Maimuna died of exhaustion following the manner they were crammed into the vehicles that took them away. However, one of the sources reported they were trampled to death during the kidnap incident.

title: Police vs Armed Robbers, Delta
description: An armed robber was shot dead during an exchange of gunfire between the police and some armed bandits. Three AK47, 192 live cartridges and two dynamites and an Audi car were recovered.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 22 people died in multiple Boko Haram suicide bombings in a fish market. 28 others were injured. Some sources reported the attack was carried out by female bombers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (22 ) , Vanguard (21 ) , Daily Trust (23 ) , Other newpapers 1 (21 )

title: Gunmen Kill 41, Zamfara
description: 41 persons were shot dead by gunmen who ambushed a Cantar truck conveying over 20 people, slaughtering them and burnt their bodies inside the truck. The bandits also attacked traders in a market as they shot indiscriminately at them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a clearance operation by troops under the Operation Lafiya Dole in the North East. It was reported 46 women and children were rescued from captivity. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.
place: S-Shape part of the Sambisa forest close to Sabil Huda

title: Herdsmen Kill 4, Kaduna
description: 4 palm wine tappers were killed by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. The victims were killed on the way from checking their palm trees.

title: Man Stab Nephew, Lagos
description: Emmanuel Ajasa, 73-year-old man used a knife to stab, Adeniyi Oyebajo, his 50-year-old nephew, when trying to settle a dispute over ownership of a portion of land between his mother and him.

title: Herdsmen vs Police, Benue
description: 2 policemen were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders ambushed the policemen and killed 2 of them. However, the mutilated body of one of the missing policemen was discovered with with his eyes, ears and nose removed, probably for rituals.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Scores were killed in an attack on a village by Fulani herdsmen. It is assumed at least 2 scores (40) died in the attack since no fatality figure was reported. Among the victims is Mrs Fidelia Faga.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers while attempting to infiltrate a community. It is assumed about 10 of them lost their lives as no figure was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons, John Esije (32 years), Monday Nzwe (38 years) and Mr. Saku Giyeri (41 years), were ambushed and killed. It was reported that the three victims were returning home on a motorcycle when they were attacked by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Benue
description: 3 people including Orduuga Kumaga, Mnenge Orson were killed during an attack on a community by herdsmen. The victims were on motorcycles when they were shot dead. 4 others were injured in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen raided a village dominated by people of Tiv extraction and killed 8 persons. The attack was carried out early in the morning when people had just woken up from sleep.
place: Baaki, Kadarko, Kwaghshir, Ibuan, Apurough and Buaii

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. The attack came hours after the State Governors raised alarm over planned attack by herdsmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A prominent Igbo trader was killed by Fulani herdsmen who were on rampage. It was reported that the herders have been terrorizing several communities.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 7 persons were killed and several homes razed in a village during a midnight raid by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that so many people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (7 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , Other newspaper 3 (10 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Adamawa
description: 2 persons lost their lives during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers. It was reported that the clash was a result of a misunderstanding between the farmers and herders.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: 30-year-old Mrs Mariam Badmos and her three-month-old baby were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who attacked the woman, child and husband. The herders attacked the bus trio were travelling in while they were on their way home after the day's business.

title: Hoodlums Kill 7, Benue
