description: 7 persons identified as Fulani herdsmen were killed by irate youths. It was reported that the victims were travelling when the criminals attacked, killed and burnt them to ashes.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 5 persons lost their lives during a suicide bombing by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the event happened in an internally displaced persons (IDPs) camp.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 6 villagers were killed and 13 were injured when a suicide bomber struck at a Local Governement Area.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 people were burnt alive, 3 others were killed and an entire village was also burnt down by Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists stormed the village in the evening and wrecked havoc on the villagers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 12 people were killed in coordinated attacks by Fulani herdsmen on several communities. The herders sacked 25 communities in a local government area.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked a community. It was reported that houses were also razed.

title: Bandit vs NNPC Official, Benue
description: An official of the Nigerian National Petroleum Corportation (NNPC) was killed by some bandits. It was reported that the victim was on official assignment when the event happened. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.
place: Torkula, a border community of Guma LGA in Benue and Nasarawa state

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 persons were killed in an ambush by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident which happened in the night left one person severely injured.
place: Ariri and Tafi Gene villages of Jebu-Miango

title: Farmers vs Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen were murdered while 73 cows were killed by farmers. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (it is assumed that it is at least 2 scores) were killed during an air raid by Nigerian Air Force remotely piloted aircraft. It was reported that the aircraft was sent on the mission when the army noticed the presence of the insurgentS in an area.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons between 70 and 100 years were killed and over 12 houses burnt during attack by Fulani herdsmen in a village. The names of the victims are Ahmadu Hwie (male, 100 years), Odoh Hwie (male, 90 years) and Gado Kondo (70 years).

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A police officer and a farmer were killed in the early hours of the day by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders attack left several persons severely injured.

title: 2 Policemen killed by Bandits, Benue
description: Terwase Akwasa, commonly called Ghana, led his gang to kill 2 mobile policemen. The gang leader led his team in armed confrontation with the police. It was reported that internal problem within the hierarchy of the gang led to the unfortunate incident. Houses and police patrol vehicles were razed during the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. One of the victims was identified as Alex Mtsor. It was also reported that the herders took over 2 communities.

title: Community vs Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 3 persons lost their lives during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and youths in a community. It was reported that a youth in the community killed a Fulani boy with block. In retaliation, the Fulanis killed a 25-year-old woman, Victoria Sunday, and a boy, Moses.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 3 persons were killed and several houses razed during an attack by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that two of the victims were shot dead while the head of the third was severed with a machete.
place: Rikwe Chongu village in Miango District

title: Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: 2 persons, including a hunter, were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the hunter, Mr. Omalieku, and his colleague were shot dead by the rampaging herdsmen.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 4 persons, including 2 men and 2 women, were killed during a midnight attack by Bachama Fulani herdsmen on a community. It was reported that the herders attacked the community at night. The attackers also carted away foodstuffs and livestock belonging to the community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kebbi
description: 1 person was killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was also reported that the Fulani herdsmen and some farmers clashed over a piece of land.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Kebbi
description: 6 persons were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and some farmers. It was reported that while 3 farmers were killed, 3 Fulani herdsmen lost their lives.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: A hunter identified as Daniel Wallam was killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victim was gunned down by the herders who destroyed some farmlands with their cattle.

title: Herdsmen Kill Farmer, Ogun
description: A farmer, Adetona Owolabi was attacked and killed in his farm by Fulani herdsmen. The murder occurred few hours after the State Governor summoned a security meeting of stakeholders in the state including leaders of farmers and herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 persons lost their lives during an attack by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the event happened when Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village. Several other persons were injured and properties were also destroyed.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 2 persons were butchered by rampaging Fulani herdsmen during a mass burial of 68 persons. It was reported that the herdsmen attack has been on-going in the Local Government Area.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 12 people including 10 civilians and 2 female bombers died in a suicide mission inside a market. The bombers infiltrated into traders and detonated their explosives. About 48 persons were also injured. Another source reported the suicide was carried out by 4 females who were also assumed dead. Scores of deaths (assuming at least 2 scores) were reported by Vanguard.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 11 persons, including women and children, were butchered by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen attack lasted for two days.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Benue
description: 2 persons lost their lives in a Fulani herdsmen attack on their community. Recently, many have been killed in similar attacks. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 10 persons, including a monarch, Zaki Gabriel Ukovour, were butchered by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen attack lasted for two days.
place: Gishiri, Dooshima, Danwaza and Karmen villages

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Benue
description: 1 person died in a fresh Fulani herdsmen attack. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 3 residents and 2 insurgents died in a community raid by Boko Haram. The attackers, who came in large numbers, also burnt more than 18 shops and abducted some persons. 2 of the insurgents were killed by vigilance group on patrol.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 6 persons, including women and children, were butchered by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen attack lasted for days.

title: NAF Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 5) were killed in a NAF aerial bombardment. The insurgents were sighted with the aid of Remotely-Piloted Aircraft (RPA).

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 4 persons were killed in a renewed attack by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen destroyed many houses and foodstuffs during the attack. Due to the nature of the event, it is backdated by 2 days.
place: Uhime and Angyo communities at Dooka

title: Herdsmen Kill Youth, Plateau
description: A youth was killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack. Details of the attack was not reported. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Explosion, Edo
description: Sanusi died when an already manufactured bombs exploded and killed him in a building in which a room was converted into an Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) factory for reasons not reported. Suspects who are engaged in the assemblage of the (IED), includes Idris Ibrahim, 22; Zainab Ibrahim and Oyeza Abdul all indigenes of Kogi State and Idris Ibrahim who is on the run.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: A 35-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP), Mr. Modu Malari, was shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents. He was killed while collecting firewood. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 suicide bombers, strapped with suicide vests were killed by Operation Lafiya Dole while the 3rd suicide bomber was arrested when trying to infiltrate the town.

title: Communal Clash, Nasarawa
description: 11 people lost their lives in a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen in some settlements. 2 persons were killed in a settlement while 9 persons were killed in other locations.
place: Anfana settlement, Gidan Wambai in Azara and Gidan Emon

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 61 people including 57 Boko Haram insurgents, 3 soldiers and 1 civilian lost their lives in a foiled Boko Haram attack. The soldiers died after the insurgents rammed a military vehicle. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Nasarawa
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a raid on a community. Several people have lost their lives in similar attacks in different parts of the state. Arrested culprit include Audu, Dabir, Dachi, David, Biabu and Fidelis.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 10 persons were killed in a recent herdsmen attack on an agrarian community. Recently, several people were lost in similar attacks across the area council.

title: Militia vs Fulani Villages, Taraba
description: Many people were killed in an early morning attack carried out by a militia group. Other resources identified the attackers as Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the militia attacked three villages, killed villagers and set houses ablaze. Three of the deceased were identified as Nuhu Isiyaka (5 years), Nasuru Mohammmed (6 years), Clement (53 years) and Mallam Muhammed Bello (66 years).
place: Fulani villages (Donada, Katibu Kasua, Mako, Lavaro, Jambutu and Yusa)
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , Other newspaper 2 (55 ) , The Punch (60 ) , The Nation (55 )

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ondo
description: A woman, Patience Salami was attacked and killed in her farm by Fulani herdsmen. Crops and farm produce were also destroyed by the attackers.

title: Gunmen Kill Family of 5, Taraba
description: Gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen attacked and killed a family of 5 ion their farm. The community had received threats following the banning of open grazing in the state.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents, who were footsoldiers to a Boko Haram factional leaders identified as Mamman Nur, were killed during an encounter between the insurgents and the army. It was reported that the factional leader was severely injured. Among the dead is the wife of the leader. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 3 people were killed by gunmen suspected to be herdsmen. The victims include Mr Tatyough Uombor, Mr Gbenger Orakundu and Mr Angar Ude Jugu. This recent attack came a day about 50 persons were also killed in the council area.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A teenage Boko Haram suicide bomber killed 11 people, including his biological father, at a mosque. It was reported that the incident happened in the early hours of the day.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (12 ) , The Nation (11 ) , Independent (14 ) , The Guardian (16 )

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Adamawa
description: A roadside Boko Haram bomb killed 3 residents. Further details on the attacks were not provided.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 50, Benue
description: 50 people were slaughtered by Fulani herdsmen during a coordinated attacks on 6 communities in 2 LGAs. Many of the victims were people people coming back from church services. While some were shot, many were killed with matchetes. There was a massive protest after the incident across the state for the insensitivity of the government in stopping the killings. Alhaji Laggi, 40-year-old along side with 3 others, Mallam Muminini Abdullahi, Muhammed Adamu and Ibrahim Sule were mastermind in the killing of over 73 residents of Benue State.
place: Gaambe-Tiev, Ayilamo and Turan in Logo LGA and Umenger, Tse-Akor and Tomatar near Tse-Abi in Nongov District in Guma LGA
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , The Guardian (50 ) , Daily Trust (73 ) , The Punch (73 )

title: Herdmen Kill Man, Nasarawa
description: A man was killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. He was gunned down while he was moving his farm produce to his town.

title: Communal Clash, Bayelsa
description: 2 youths were kileld during a communal clash. Both groups have been engulfed in crisis over who controls oil pipeline surveillance jobs at the Nigerian Agip Oil Company oil field.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Large number of Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village but were repelled by the Air Force. Many of them (assuming about 20) were killed in the foiled attack. 5 soldiers were later reported dead and 30 others missing.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many people including Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) were killed by Boko Haram during an attack on a village. Most of the victims were firewood mongers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 4 people were killed by herdsmen during a clash with farmers. A farmer whose farm was grazed on approached a herdsman and was attacked and killed. A peacemaker was also killed. The father of the herdsman was also killed when he went to make peace with the victims.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Adamawa
description: Some farmers (assuming at least 5) were killed by Fulani herdsmen during the Christmas festive period. It is believed the incident occurred on 26th since no date was reported in the source.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: 3 persons were killed during attacks by Fulani herdsmen. The attack was a reprisal attack.

title: Herdsmen Kill 4, Adamawa
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a raid. Over 100 houses were razed during the incident. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen vs Taxi Driver, FCT (Abuja)
description: A taxi driver identified as Maigamu was killed by unknown gunmen while he was fixing his car along a road. It was reported that the gunmen shot the driver and later stabbed him with knives. They also stole his money.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents who had rustled about 200 cows were trailed and killed by soldiers. The 200 cows were also recovered.

title: NAF Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operatives of the Niigerian Air Force (NAF) neutralized a large gathering of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming 20 insurgents) after a convoy of the insurgents on motorcycles were trailed to a location.

title: Soldiers Kill Boko Haram Insurgent, Borno
description: A Boko Haram specialist in manufacturing Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) was killed by soldiers. Other members were wounded in the incident.

title: NAF Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of Boko Haram insurgents were killed during aerial bombardments by the Nigerian Air Force (NAF). The insurgents were sighted through a surveillance mission

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: Mr. Olatunji TAngu Afolabi was attacked and killed by Fulani herdsmen. His body was also burnt.

title: Gunmen Kill Policeman, Rivers
description: A policeman was shot dead by unknown gunmen. A vigilance group was also shot in the process.

title: Boko Haram Ambush, Borno
description: 4 persons were killed in a Boko Haram ambush on a humanitarian convoy consisting of aid workers and soldiers escorting trucks conveying relief materials to an IDP camp. The four drivers were drivers of the trucks. 3 other and a truck loaded with food items were taken away by the insurgents. 6 Boko Haram attackers were however killed by soldiers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 )

title: MASSOB, Imo
description: 4 MASSOB members including one factional group leader, Arinze Ojoko, were killed during an intra-group crisis. A faction loyal to the deposed leader of the group, Ralph Uwazuruike attacked another in the bid to take full control of the operational office, the Freedom House. The group has been engulfed in leadership tussle over some time.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during an attempt to infiltrate a military unit from a nearby bush. Many insurgents were also reported wounded in the foiled attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists were killed during an air strike by Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets. The incident happened during an air offence aimed at wiping out the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber killed herself and three other persons in an internally displaced peoples' (IDPs) camp. It was reported that the bomber bust into the camp number 4 through the western flank before detonating the explosives on her.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole killed several insurgents and captured 167 of the Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the offensive was carried out with coordinated air and artillery bombardments. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Kogi
description: 2 persons were killed while 10 others were severely injured when some Fulani herdsmen ambushed some farmers. It was reported that the incident happened when some farmers went to pick fruits.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: Three Fulani herdsmen identified as Mohammed Bello (40 years), Muhammed Momoh (30 years) and Yisau Umoru (18 years) killed 4 women who were mourners at a funeral. It was reported that the herders killed the women as they resisted attempt to be raped while they were returning from the funeral. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Soldiers Kill 20 Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a raid. 17 others were captured alive and 100 persons under their captivity were rescued. 6 soldiers sustained gunshot injuries.The clearance operation has been ongoing for the past 2 weeks. Therefore, this incident is backdated within the past 2 weeks as reported.
place: Arena Chiki, Chikun Gudu, Arena Waje, Sa’ada and Juwe.

title: Gunmen vs Children, Akwa Ibom
description: A man identified as Aniekan Billie lost two of his children, Godwin Sunday (9 years) and Idara Sunday (5 years), to unknown gunmen. It was reported that the man locked up his children in his room and left to buy food items but came back to discover their bodies.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Cross River
description: Four Fulani herdsmen were killed during a clash between the herders and a community. It was reported that the victims were killed when they attempted to invade a community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in the Sector 1, Operation Lafiya Dole, killed 5 Boko Haram terrorists during a patrol. The troops also recovered weapons, machetes, knives and a sum of N5,500 from the terrorists.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 10 persons, including 2 district heads, were killed by gunmen who raided 2 communities. It was reported that the gunmen who were identified as herdsmen burnt down houses in the villages during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of 202 Battalion, Sector 1 of the Operation Lafiya Dole ambushed Boko Haram terrorists, killing three of them. The troops recovered AK-47 rifles as well as equipment used for making Improvised Explosive Devices from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 25 persons were killed by Boko Haram suicide bombers who attacked a market. It was reported that the attack was carried out by 2 female suicide bombers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 2 civilians were killed when members of Boko Haram terrorists group invaded a village in the night, burnt down houses and carted away food supplies.

title: Gunmen Kill 4 Policemen, Adamawa
description: 4 policemen on patrol were killed by gunmen. The policemen had attempted to arrest some Fulani herdsmen in the area before they were killed.

title: Boko Haram Members, Borno
description: 4 members of the Boko Haram sect were killed by troops of 3 Battalion, 22 Brigade of Nigerian Army, Sector 1, operation Lafiya Dole. Also, a Boko Haram leader was captured.
place: Northern Fring of Sambisa and Kala Balga

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets killed some terrorists during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out terrorists. It was reported that the jets carried out several interdictions and destroyed many Boko Haram structures.

title: Soldiers Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: 14 Boko Haram members were killed while 30 people were rescued in a clearance operation embarked by Nigeria Army troop in various area of Bama Local government area.
place: Abusuriwa, Newchina, Bonzon, Usmanari, Goyayeri, Shitimari, Gashimari and Awaram village.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 3 soldiers were killed during a raid on a military establishment by Boko Haram. 6 other persons were injured. Another source reported that a teenager was also killed. However, it was not reported if there were casualties on the part of the terror lists.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 50 worshipers died in a Boko Haram attack on a Mosque during an early morning prayer. There is a possibility of increased fatalities as many sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers blew themselves up and a local vigilance chairman in a foiled suicide mission. Several people were killed but the terror group and farmers in the state same day.

title: Political Violence, Osun
description: An alleged manipulation of a ward congress election led a protest that eventually claimed 2 lives. The crisis was triggered by alleged imposition of candidates, which led to the use of dangerous weapons like clubs, machetes, broken bottles and daggers to engaged fractional groups. The date of the incident was not stated, it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Bandits Attack Community, Zamfara
description: Some bandits laid siege on some communities in a renewed violence. The hoodlums rode on motorbikes and unleashed mayhem on the villages, killing 3 people and leaving others injured. The cause of the attack could not be readily established.
place: Gidan, Maidawa, Wari, Didan Ann, Tungar amd Mallamawa villages.

title: Bandits Kill 23, Zamfara
description: 23 people were killed by armed bandits during a raid on 5 communities. The victims were killed during their congregational Friday prayer. Stored farm produce were burnt down by the attackers.
place: Barka da Yabo, Mallamawa, Tungar Kahau, Maikamarrimi and Gidan Anna

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 6 persons including 4 female suicide bombers and a boy died in a coordinated suicide bombings. One bomber could not detonate her explosive vest as she stripped it.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 residents were killed when Boko Haram attacked 2 communities. 2 of the attackers were killed by soldiers. This recent attack came 5 days after another attack on Gulak in IBD012458.

title: Farmers vs Herders , Nasarawa
description: 2 Fulani herders identified as Ali Abubakar and Shehu Hassan were shot dead during a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. The cause of the clash was not identified. But this incident comes in a context of ethnic tensions. In 1987, for instance, 72 people were killed over the appointment of an Egbura man to control the market of Umaisha. The Bassa, who are a majority in Toto LGA, claim to be indigenous to the area and dispute to the Egbura (who are next to them in terms of population) the title of paramount chief to chair the local traditional council. Other incidents followed in 1994 and spilled over to Kogi State on the other side of Benue River. In 1997 and 1998, again, 3,000 people were allegedly killed, especially in the villages of Umaisha, Ugya, Kenyehu, Shaga, Shekarnku, Kuwa, Kokulo, Shishigheneshi, Rakpani, Bakate, Dumbeku, Risagu and Shafa-Abakpa. A resetllement programme which started in 2000 to bring the Bassa back home had also to stop because of ethnic confrontations between Tiv and Alago communities in Nassarawa in June 2001. Source: Imobighe, Thomas (ed.) [2003], Civil Society And Ethnic Conflict Management In Nigeria, Ibadan, Spectrum, 329p.
place: Ajigora village, Loko Develepment Area and Kwatakwa village

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 18 persons, including 4 suicide bombers, lost their lives when the terrorists detonated bombs strapped to their bodies in multiple attacks. It was reported that 2 male and 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers carried out the attack.

title: Farmers vs Rustler, Katsina
description: A farmer, Salisu Sada, was killed by 39-year-old Ibrahim Ilu, a headsman, who posed as cattle rustlers. The victim was killed by the herdsmen when he attempted to stop them from destroying his plantation.

title: Boko Haram Insurgent, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram insurgent killed his father, Adamu Kwaramtcheri (56 years), for refusing to join the sect. He carried out the act with 4 of his colleagues.

title: Herdmen Kill 2, Plateau
description: 2 men riding on a motorcycle, Bulus Dantoro and Dung Christopher, were ambushed and murdered by Fulani herdsmen. Several attacks have been carried out in the area in the past one month.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Scores (at least 2 scores) including soldiers were killed when members of the Boko Haram attacked a community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers lost their lives while 13 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a military operation aimed at dislodging the terrorists. It was reported that 6 other soldiers were injured in the operation.

title: Boko Haram Kill 2 Women, Adamawa
description: 2 women were killed by Boko Haram stray bullets. Several attacks have been carried out in the council area since this month.

title: Farmers vs Herders , Nasarawa
description: One Hassan Sabo Paplolo was killed while 3 other people were injured in a clash between farmers and Fulani herders. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal for the wounding of a farmer identified as Yunusa Makeri who had a misunderstanding with two Fulani herders over his rice farm. Another source reported that scores (at least 2 scores (40) persons were killed by the Fulani herdsmen who were leaving Benue state due to the implementation of an anti-grazing laws.

title: Herdsmen Kill 11, Plateau
description: 11 villagers returning from a market were waylaid and killed by herdsmen. 4 of the passengers survived the attack though with severe injuries. The council area recently come under Fulani herdsmen attack. However, some other reports reported the attack was perpetrated by gunmen. Among the victims are Felix Ngwong, Gyang Emmanuel,Chuwang Bitrus, Daniel Nini, Dagam Danbwarang, Rueben Danbwarang, Sunday Danbwarang, Dachollom Shom and Daniel Shom.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: An elderly woman and his son were killed by 2 male suicide bombers. The attackers also died in the incident. 3 soldiers were also reported to have died in a shootout with other members of the terror group.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Man, Plateau
description: A man was attacked and killed in his residence by Fulani herdsmen. Before he was killed, he was threatened by a herdsman who had grazed on his farm.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many members of Boko Haram terrorist group were killed by the troops of the 151 Battalion of 21 Brigade of Nigerian Army. It was reported that insurgents were ambushed by the army.

title: Gunmen vs Politician, Plateau
description: The Chairman of Action Democratic Party, Waziri Fursum, was assassinated by some unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victim was murdered in the night.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Kogi
description: A man identified as Abdulganiyu Aduki was murdered while his daughter and wife were seriously injured by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen shot his wife and five-year-old daughter.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female suicide bombers were responsible for an attack that killed 14 people. While some of the victims died in the blast, others were shot as they tried to escape the scene.
place: Muna Garage General Area of Maiduguri

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram members were killed by soldiers. The victims died during a clearance operation on some hideouts in 6 villages. Some were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were intercepted and neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that some of the terrorists were shot dead while they were attempting to cross a highway.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A number of bandits (assuming at least 5) were killed in a foiled ambush on soldiers. Some were reported to have escaped with gunshot injuries.

title: Armed Robbers vs Traders, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits shot dead 7 people including a baby. The victims were on their way to market when the bandits intercepted them and started collecting money, mobile phones, motorbikes and other valuables from them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 3 Battalion 22 Brigade on Operation Lafiya Dole killed 11 Boko Haram insurgents and destroyed a bomb-making factory. The troops also destroyed the logistics base of the terrorists.
place: Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule and Warsele villages

title: Boko Haram Kills 8 Soldiers, Yobe
description: 8 soldiers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The victims, an officer and 7 soldiers, were taken unawares at a football field. 7 were declared missing.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (11 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (13 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: A community was attacked by Fulani herdsmen after the state government passed an anti-grazing law that banned open grazing in the state and many (assuming at least 10) killed. According to the report, the incident recently happened and therefore backdated by a week.

title: NAF Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram members including the wife of Abubakar Shekau, Mallama Fitdasi were killed in Nigerian Air Force (NAF) bombardment. At least 2 scores of the insurgents were assumed to have been killed during the bombing of their hideouts. Telegraph reported that dozens of the insurgents (assuming at least 2 dozens) were killed.

title: Religion Crisis, Taraba
description: Mr. Anum Sone was killed, goods, worth millions of naira were looted and so many shops were burnt following a clash between Muslims and Christian youth when 4 Muslim boys who accused a boy of blasphemy.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Attack, Borno
description: Many people were killed while scores were injured when Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their bodies. The first attacker detonated bomb at a park while the second bomber detonated bomb in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: A soldier was killed when Boko Haram terrorists overran a military base. 9 others were injured

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers killed themselves and injured another woman. The incident happened when the bombers detonated the Improvised Explosive Device strapped to their bodies.
causes_of_violence: religious issue, political issue, Daily Trust

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko HAram members were killed by soldiers. The insurgents laid ambush on the soldiers but lost 3 of their members.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers were killed while 5 were injured in an ambush by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents ambushed a military convoy, killed the soldiers, stole 2 military gun trucks and burnt an operational Hilux van.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Plateau
description: 6 Fulani children between the the ages of 6 and 12 were killed and beheaded by some assailants from a community resulting in a retaliatory attack by the herders who killed 29 women and children from the same community.
place: Internally Displaced Persons camp, Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe Chiefdom

title: Corps Member, Imo
description: A serving member of the National Youths Service Corps, NYSC, Ekene Uwaoma Martins, a 23-year-old man was killed by some unknown gunmen.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: 2 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the herders have been conducting series of attacks on several communities. Due to the nature of the event it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Clash, Plateau
description: 6 people were killed, several others injured and over 6 houses razed when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen came in a large number, swooped on the villagers at midnight and struck, despite the dusk-to-dawn curfew.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram suicide bombers, including 3 female and a male, detonated bombs strapped to their bodies as they attempted to infiltrate a general hospital and a community respectively.
place: Molai General Hospital and Umulari village

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were shot dead by troops of Nigerian Army on Operation Dole during a clearance operation of insurgents. The troops cleared the enclaves of the terrorists in some villages.

title: Herdsmen, Plateau
description: Herdsmen ambushed and killed a boy in a community. It was also reported that two cows belonging to the herders were killed in the ensuing crisis which led to a protest by women and youths of the affected community

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army on Operation Lafiya Dole killed 15 Boko Haram terrorists who attempted to infiltrate military outpost. It was reported that a soldier was killed in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in an ambush by soldiers. The victims were killed while crossing into Sambisa forest with their colleagues. Some food items were recovered from them.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers in an ambush. The victims who also are rustlers were crossing into the state capital to sell off some rustled cows.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers in ambushes. While one one them was killed in an ambush, 3 others were killed when the disguised as Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs).

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 4 soldiers lost their lives in Boko Haram ambush. The victims were attacked while conveying food to their military base.

title: Boko Haram Member, Ondo
description: Basir Mohammed a 20-year-old member of the Boko Haram sect who was arrested in Ondo State killed a man and his child in the farm.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A policeman and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) were killed when some Boko Haram insurgents attempted to attack a military outpost. It was reported that the IDP victim was a female.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of Nigerian Army ambushed and killed 2 Boko Haram food and logistics suppliers. It was reported that the soldiers recovered ammunition, food items and animals from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operation Lafiya Dole operating in Bama LGA, ambushed and killed 2 Boko Haram terrorists and recovered 2 bicycles and 3 wheel barrows

title: Boko Haram Kills 9, Borno
description: 9 people were killed when Boko haram attacked farmers in an IDP camp. The IDPs were attacked while returning from their farms.

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 people including an Imam, Ustaz Goni Bukar Tabare were slaughtered by Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 12 people were killed after 3 Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated their explosives on the group of farmers. It is assumed 3 of the bombers died in the incident. The bombers comprised of a male and 2 females.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 )

title: Political/Ethnic Violence, Delta
description: 4 Hausa indigenes were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). The attack on a market dominated by non-indigenes was led by Osita Musa. 2 members of the gang, Abraham Ndudu and Okereke Ifeanyi were arrested for the crime.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Abia
description: Political Violence: 2 members of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by soldiers who launched a crackdown on the group. The victims were putting on black clothes.
place: Diamond Bank on Akanu Ibiam Road

title: IPOB vs Soldiers, Rivers
description: 3 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by Nigerian Soldiers. It was reported that several other persons were injured during an invasion by the army. IPOB members also killed a police sergeant identified as Daniel in a reprisal attack.Guardian reported that Muslims were among the victims in the clash.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Abia
description: Political Violence: 10 trucks were burnt with over 15 dead bodies lying on the Aba-Port Harcourt highway. Those who died were either felled by bullets allegedly fired by soldiers or hit by other objects while trying to escape.

title: IPOB Clash, Abia
description: 5 persons were feared dead and scores wounded, when supporters of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and soldiers clashed. The number of deaths were not specified but is assumed 5 people died.

title: IPOB Clash, Abia
description: Soldiers shot sporadically as IPOB members moved towards Ariaria International Market, which caused pandemonium as people scampered for safety which led to the destruction of some vehicles and deaths of unconfirmed number of people. 5 people are assumed to have died in the incident. A policeman was later confirmed dead in the incident (IBD012092)
place: Osisioma axis stretched beyond Ariaria market, to the Flyover junction

title: IPOB vs Soldiers, Abia
description: Political Violence: 3 people were feared dead and about 30 others injured when gunmen suspected to be soldiers allegedly attacked the country home of the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, Nnamdi Kanu. 4 days later, another 22 people were killed during a second invasion.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A large number of Boko Haram insurgents (Assuming 20) were neutralized during a meeting. They were sighted gathering for a meeting and were bombarded.

title: IPOB vs Police, Abia
description: The attack carried out by IPOB members led to the killings of unspecified number of victims (IBD012076). A police statation was touched in the event and a wounded policeman in the attack was later confirmed dead in the hospital.
place: Osisioma axis stretched beyond Ariaria market,

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: The troops of 27 Brigade of Operation Lafiya Dole shot dead two Boko Haram terrorists in a village. It was reported the troops rescued victims abducted by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 persons in the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camp were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that they killed the victims when they attacked the camp. 6 of the victims were members of the Civilian JTF.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed herself during a foiled operation. Shew sneaked into a garage, detonated the IEDs strapped on her and died alongside a civilian.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 persons were killed, 13 others were injured during an attack by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that eight farmers were declared missing after the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram members (assuming 10) were killed by soldiers while crossing a point. Many others were reportedly wounded.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 3 persons were killed during a communal clash between 2 factions struggling for the control of the community's Administrative Committee. The fight for the soul of the oil rich community has been ongoing for some time. 7 people were declared missing after the crisis.

title: Boko Haram Kill 8, Borno
description: 8 farmers were killed during raids on a farming community. The attackers numbering about 17 razed down 3 villages and targeted youths in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of Mobile Strike Teams, MSTs, 21, killed a large number of Boko Haram terrorists while other terrorists sustained gun shot wounds. It was reported that the army recovered several items from the insurgents.

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Hundreds of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming at least 200 hundred) were killed in air strikes. The Nigerian Air Force suspected the insurgents were gathering inside Sambisa forest and bombarded the area.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Zamfara
description: 2 civilians were killed when gunmen who doubled as cattle rustlers abducted a Divisional Police Officer (DPO) and three other policemen. The bandits also carted away weapons belonging to the police.

title: Boko Haram Kill 4 Farmers, Borno
description: 4 farmers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists in their farmlands. Their corpses were found in nearby bushes during a search party.

title: Boko Haram Kill 11, Borno
description: Between 11 and 18 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) were killed during a Boko Haram raid on their camp. The victims were killed with knives.
sources_of_information: The Punch (11 ) , This Day (11 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (18 )

title: Political Violence, Delta
description: Mr. Felix Okugbeni, the ward chairman of PDP in Okpe, was brutally murdered by unknown gunmen. He was shot severally by the assassins while he was inside a tricycle in front of his residence in the evening. The killers were identified as Junior Dele, Emma Francis and Ejoke Onome.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Edo
description: A 52-year-old farmer identified as Mr Efosa Omoregie was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herdsmen swooped on the farmer with their animals, destroying his crops and also killed him.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Ba'Abba Ibrahim and two other members of the Boko Haram sect died from injuries they sustained when the insurgents were ambushed by troops of the Nigerian Army.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram commanders were killed in a military operation by the troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that the army killed Audu Kabuiri , Modu Bako and Abubakar Banishek, who were deputies to a factional leader of Boko Haram known as Abubakar Shekau.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram deputy leader and other top shots of the terrorist group werre killed during an airstrike by combined forces of the Nigerian Army and the Nigerian Air Force warplanes.

title: Boko Haram Kill 17 Farmers, Borno
description: 17 farmers were killed by Boko Haram during a raid. The farmers were attacked while farming.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 6 persons including the male suicide bomber died in an attack targeted at security operatives. Some sources reported that only the bomber was killed. 5 policemen and few others were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (6 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 )

title: Communal Crisis, Delta
description: 2 persons including a member of the Interim Management Committee in an oil rich community, Benson Okuturo and Samuel Mayomi, died during a communal crisis. While Benson died from shock after a bullet was fired at him, Mayomi was drown after their boat was hit at by a group of opposing youths.

title: Leadership Crisis, Anambra
description: A guard, Emma Nwankwo, was killed during a community leadership crisis. 2 vehicles and several properties were also destroyed.

title: Political Violence, Benue
description: Dr. Tavershima, a Principal Senior Special Assistant to Governor Samuel Ortom of Benue State on Knowledge Economy and Investments, was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Gunmen vs Community Leader, Edo
description: Unknown gunmen shot and killed Mr Lambart Igbinomwanhia, the former chairman of the outlawed Community Development Association (CDA) of a village. The killing triggered protest among the youths who razed the palace of the monarch, Kingsley Omorose who was accused of the crime.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Yobe
description: A suspected Boko Haram explosion killed 2 persons. 3 other victims were injured in the attack. The victims were cattle traders who ran into the terrorists and stepped on the explosive devices while attempting to escape.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operations. It was stated that the army recovered bicycles and cows from the insurgents. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Hunters vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 2 Boko Haram commanders were killed by hunters. The victims were killed after they attacked a community to steal food and medical supplies.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 16 people were killed during a suicide attack on a market. 80 injured in the attack.

title: Armed Robbery Attack, Plateau
description: 4 persons were murdered during a robbery incident. 3 other victims were seriously wounded in the attack. A similar incident was reported in the same LGA where a tradittional ruler was killed by unknown gunmen ( IBD011872)

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 27 people died in Boko Haram multiple bomb blasts at a market. Among the bombers was a woman. 83 people were wounded in the attacks.

title: Boko Haram Kill 7, Adamawa
description: 7 residents were killed by Boko Haram in a raid on 2 communities. The terrorists also looted their victims and set several houses ablaze. 3 attacks have been carried out in the LGA in 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 farmers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists abducted one of the farmers. It was reported that the terrorists attacked the farmers at a farm some kilometres away from the village.

title: Herdsmen Kill Woman, Kaduna
description: Mrs. Rebecca Shakarau was shot dead by armed robbers suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. She was hit after shots were fired on her car.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 tractor drivers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The tractor drivers were working on a farm when the terrorists attacked and killed them. Their names were given as Kashim Bukar and Shettima Mustapha.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 persons were killed by Boko Haram militants who attacked a village. It was reported that several other people were injured in the attack. The terrorist set the village ablaze.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: An attack carried out by the Boko Haram insurgents led to the death of several people (Assuming 10). About 60 houses were burnt and many foodstuffs carted away. the incident occurred less than 1 week after a similar event occurred in Mildu, a neigbouring village. (IBD011766)

title: Air Force vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram enclave was bombarded by Nigeria Air Force. Several terrorists (assuming at least 10) were killed in the operation.
place: Parisu in the Sambisa general area

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by Troops of Operation Lafiya Dole and also recover explosives and motorcycles in an ambush.
place: Forward Operation Base in Mainok, along a track leading to Alagarno forest in Borno

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram members were killed by soldiers in an ambush. Several others sustained various degrees of injuries.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants attacked and killed 31 fishermen in 2 different communities. 14 persons were killed in Duguri and 17 in Dabar Wanzam. The victims had just returned from from various states and went to fish but got attacked by the insurgents. A fisherman was spared and ordered to take the victims back home as a warning to others who may want to engage in fishing activities.
place: Duburi village, and Dabar-Wanzam village in Baga

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed by soldiers in an ambush. His riffle was also recovered.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmer, Ondo
description: A farmer identified as Omowole Orimisan was killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded his farm. It was reported that the the herders attacked the farmer, who challenged them for destroying his crops, while he was working in his farm.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants attacked travelers, killed 3 drivers, snatched their vehicles and burnt 9 other vehicles.

title: Gunmen vs Villagers, Benue
description: A man in his mid-forties was killed by unknown gunmen that invaded a village. The gunmen also inflicted bullet wounds on many other including the deceased teenage son. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the village on two motorbikes and a pick-up van.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko haram fighters were killed in an ambush by soldiers. 2 soldiers died in the attack. Several items including 18 bicycles, 30 bags of flour, 1 bag of groundnut, 2 bags of salt, 2 baskets of kola nut and 5 torch lights were recovered from the insurgents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , This Day (14 ) , Other newspaper 3 (14 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A good number (assuming a dozen) of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers. The insurgents had ambushed the soldiers on routine duty. However, 2 soldiers died when their vehicles ran into an IED. 4 others were injured.
place: Dukje-Mada Road near Gulumba Gana village

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male and female Boko Haram suicide bombers who attempted to sneak into a metropolis were killed by security operatives. A female suicide bomber detonated a bomb strapped to her body, killing only herself.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Ondo
description: 4 farmers were killed while several hectares of farmland were destroyed by Fulani herdsmen. Due to the nature of the story it was backdated by 1 week.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 8 people including 1 of the gunmen were killed and about 10 others injured while some houses and shops were burnt down by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram.
place: Mildo, east of Gulak close to the Cameroon border
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (8 )

title: Boko Haram vs Loggers, Borno
description: 3 loggers were attacked and killed by Boko Haram. Their corpses were found near a road side with their firewood beside them.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Attack, Borno
description: A member of the Boko Haram terrorist group lost his life when one their Improvised Explosive Devices detonated. The incident happened when some soldiers raided an IED factory.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 persons were killed by 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers who struck at a Internally Displaced Persons camp. It was reported that the attacker disguised themselves before striking in the camp.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Daily Trust (14 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 Boko Haram member who used to extort money from some villages was shot dead by men of Nigerian army. It was reported that several other insurgents escaped with bullet wounds.

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 persons were killed during an attack by Boko Haram insurgents on a village. Among the victims are 3 members of the local vigilante and 2 others.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 female Boko Haram suicide bombers, who tried to attack a village, were intercepted and killed by members of Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). The incident happened when the bombers tried to infiltrate the village.

title: Boko Haram Attack Oil Worker, Borno
description: A group of oil prospectors and their security team were ambushed by Boko Haram. Scores of Boko Haram insurgents (assuming 2 scores at least) were killed while 18 soldiers including and an officer, 30 Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) staff, 5 University of Maiduguri lecturers (1 professor and 4 senior lecturers, J.V Militus, N.Y Solomon, Manaja Uba and Daniel Birma), 15 Civilian JTF and 1 civilian also lost their lives in the ambush. The senior geologists and NNPC team were contracted to the Federal government to search for oil in the Lake Chad region of the North-East. Abducted NNPC members were later rescued from the insurgents while some are still missing.
place: Jilli and Bornoyesu villages between Magumeri and Gubio LGA

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Kano
description: 5 members of Boko Haram engaged policemen in a shootout. 4 persons, a police Inspector, Idris Musa and 3 members of the insurgent group, Abba Mohammed, Usman Buhari and Iliyasu Abdullahi died from gun shot injuries few days after the shootout.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male Boko Haram suicide bomber died when he attempted to carry out a suicide mission inside the University of Maiduguri. On sighting security operatives, he horridly detonated the explosives and died before reaching his target. Another source reported that the attackers involved a female and a male bombers who were eventually killed by security operatives.

title: Boko Haram Kill Farmers, Borno
description: 15 persons mostly farmers were attacked and killed in a farm by Boko Haram insurgents. The insurgents opened fire on the victims while working on a farm.
place: Kaleri and Alau Dam general area

title: Gunmen vs Man, Edo
description: Mr. John Agbonlabor was killed by masked gunmen who stormed his house in the night. It was reported that the killers also raped his daughter and left his wife, Elizabeth, partially blind.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram suicide bombers attacked an Internally Displaced Person's (IDPs) camps and killed some persons. 8 persons including the bombers died in the attack. The bombers included 2 females and a man.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Nation (6 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 persons including the commander of Adamawa Hunters' commander, Bukar Jimeta were shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents. 3 other victims were members of the Hunters association. Another source reported that the victims were 3 members of the same family and 2 herders. About 120 cows were stolen.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram terrorists were killed during a gun duel with soldiers. The insurgents had attacked a military location but were repelled and one of their commanders, Mustapha Abba, captured alive. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: A farmer identified as Mr Sunday Ezeugo was killed by Fulani herdsmen who shot at him. It was reported that another person was severely wounded.
place: Okueke farm settlement in Amoji community

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber was shot dead by soldiers of the Nigeria Army. The incident happened when the soldiers caught the terrorist as she tried to infiltrated a community.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 9 persons, including the bomber, lost their lives when a female Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated bomb in a mosque. It was reported that the bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device in the mosque

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber was killed after refusing to stop at a military check point. According to another source, the insurgent died in a multiple explosion.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were shot dead by troops of the Nigeria Army. The suicide bombers were killed when they attempted to infiltrate a village.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Youths vs Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 4 Fulani herdsmen were killed by some youths. The incident happened when some kidnappers raided some communities and took away some villagers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A 10-year-old cattle breeder, Gambo Bukar, was killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED). It was reported that the bombs were strapped on the boy's body when the terrorist caught him while he was returning from rearing his cattle.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 23 persons, including the Boko Haram suicide bombers, lost their lives in bomb blasts when suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their bodies. It was reported that 7 villagers and 12 civilian Joint Task Force members were killed by 4 suicide bombers during a funeral.

title: Boko Haram Kill, Borno
description: 8 villagers were blindfolded and lied facing the ground, were shot at close range by 4 masked gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram for defiling Boko Haram "Sharia police".

title: Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 male suicide bombers were shot dead by security operatives when they attempted to enter the University of Maiduguri. They are suspected to be Boko Haram members.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: 7 suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), were arrested at a shrine by the Security Operatives for killing a female police officer identified as Felicia Nwagbara. It was reported that the deceased was declared missing before her body was found. Other items such as weapons and a live python were found at the shrine.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An army officer and 3 soldiers lost their lives when their patrol vehicle encountered Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried on the road they were plying. Also three Boko Haram terrorists who planted the IED were killed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers. The victims had gone to loot and burn a broken down truck loaded with goods.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram suicide bombers, who attempted to attack a village, detonated the bombs strapped to their bodies and lost their lives. Only the attackers died in the failed attack.
place: Mammanti village around Jiddari Polo area

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 16 persons were killed in multiple bomb attacks by Boko Haram suicide bombers. It was reported that suicide bombers infiltrated strategic locations in the city, including a university, and detonated their bombs. Several other persons were injured in that attack

title: Herdmen vs Man, Ondo
description: A 64-year-old farmer, Linus Ogbee, was killed by Fulani herdsmen when he went to his farm which is close to the farm of the former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, Chief Olu Falae. It was reported that the lifeless body of victim, who is a father of 7 children, was found in the bush riddled with gunshots.

title: bandits Kill 2, Plateau
description: 2 people, Tanko and Dio, were poisoned to death after divulging information to natives on the operations of the bandits. This incident is backdated by 2 weeks as reported in the paper.

title: Herdsmen, Edo
description: A woman was beheaded by the Fulani herdsmen on her farm. The incident led to a violent protest by women and youths of the area.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A convoy of about 140 vehicles conveying corpse of a policeman and commuters were ambushed by Boko Haram insurgents. 8 people including a policeman and a government driver were killed. Another source reported that scores (assuming at least 2 scores) died in the ambush. Several others were injured.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Attack, Borno
description: 3 loggers were killed by a landmine explosion when their truck ran over it. It is suspected that it was planted by members of the Boko Haram sect.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female teenage Boko Haram suicide bombers bombed themselves when they were intercepted by hunters

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 17 persons, including the suicide bombers, died when 5 female Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their bodies. Several other persons were injured in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 soldiers, Lance Corporal Auwal Halliru and Private Halilu Aliyu were killed in a battle with Boko Haram.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 2 persons were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened a week ago.

title: Protest, Kogi
description: 5 people including a student of the Kogi State Polytechnic, Saka Seidu, was killed and many others injured when unknown gunmen stormed the place where Senator Dino Melaye was holding anti-government protest.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked Chibok community. 10 people were injured and some women also abducted.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A large number of Boko haram insurgents (assuming 20) were killed during a clearance operation. Among the victims is a Abu Nazir, the insurgents' Amir in the community. 9 children training with the insurgents were also rescued.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 2 children were killed while three other persons were seriously injured following a bomb explosion. It was reported that the explosion happened in the evening while the residents were about to break their Ramadam fast.

title: Raped To Death, Plateau
description: 2 women from the same community were raped to death and their bodies were dumped in the open. It was reported that another woman, a nursing woman, was raped by Fulani herdsmen. Due to the nature of the story, it was backdate by 1 week.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram leader, Abu Fatima, who was on the wanted list of 230 Boko Haram insurgents declared wanted by the military, was killed during a gun duel with the army. It was reported that another Boko Haram leader known as Abu Nasir was also killed by the army. The date of the story was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Cult Clash, Lagos
description: A Togolese and one other person were killed when rampaging cultist clashed. It was reported that about 20 persons sustained varying degrees of injuries in the crisis. While the Togolese was beheaded, the other victim was hit by a stray bullet.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 2 persons were killed and properties worth millions of Naira were destroyed during a communal crisis between Agbassa and Ijaw youths. The crisis was caused by clash between the youths of both communities over the ownership of a market.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Rivers
description: A herder, Abdullahi Adamu was killed by irate youth over the killing of their kinsmen by the herders. This event is linked to IBD011229.

title: Herdsmen attack, Oyo
description: Jelili a farmer was killed by herdsmen for killed 1 of their cattle. The killing, led to a bloody clash between the Yoruba and Fulani herdsmen in the area.

title: Bandits vs Tanker Drivers, Niger
description: 5 tanker drivers have been killed by armed bandits. There products were also diverted after the incidents. The incidents occurred within the last 5 months.

title: Assailants vs Fulani Herdsmen, Adamawa
description: Five men killed a Fulani herdsman, Adamu Buba, and threw his body into a river and also maimed several cows. The killers were identified as Alex Amos, Alheri Phanuel, Holy Boniface, Jerry Gideon and Jari Sabagi.

title: Gunmen, Edo
description: 2 persons, 1 of who has been identified as a Diploma student at the Delta State University (DELSU) were killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 5 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists raided the residence of the victims and butchered them.

title: Ambush, Delta
description: Bandit laid ambush on a team of police conveying 3 kidnappers to court and opened fire on the police but 3 of the bandits were killed while a police corporal was injured.
place: Azagba and otulu junction on Benin-Asaba Expressway

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 21 persons were killed when some Boko Haram insurgents stormed a community. It was reported terrorists came in the evening with their motorcycles, bicycles and opened fire at everyone in sight.

title: Vigilance Group, Kogi
description: 3 members of the Vigilante group were killed by yet to be identified bandits. The deceased were conveying 3 suspected criminals they arrested to the police office when they were ambushed and killed on their way.

title: Fulani herdsmen vs Women, Edo
description: 2 women, Mrs Martina Emoyon and Mrs Ariu, were raped and strangled to death by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders also destroyed crops and sacked a lot of persons from their farmlands.

title: Boko Haram Kill 7, Borno
description: 7 people including 4 members of the 'Civiian JTF' were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The victims were mainly local hunters who had gone on hunting expedition. They were overpowered and beheaded by the insurgents. many are still missing after the attack.

title: Herdsmen vs Man, Edo
description: A man who tried to protect his wife from being raped by Fulani herdsmen was beaten to death by the herders. It was reported that the wife of the man was about to be raped when he intervened.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. Several arms and ammunition were recovered during the operation.
place: Chikun Gudu around the Lake Chad region.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers fighting Boko Haram insurgents killed 9 terrorists during a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops rescued 998 people from the captivity of the terrorists.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Rivers
description: A cement truck owned by Dangote group was hijacked and diverted into the bush by armed bandits. The truck 2 conductors were shot dead by the bandits. It is believed the killings were perpetrated on the 19th of last month.

title: Female Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed when a female suicide bomber detonated improvised explosive devices strapped to her bodies at a military checkpoint.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen shot dead 4 persons including a seventy-four year old man known as Mr. Macaulay Pepple, Emelia Godspower and Adolphus Hitler Pepple. It was reported that victim were 4 innocent persons. Also one person who was shot by the gunmen was hospitalized.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their body within the premises of a university. The bombs killed the terrorists who attempted to enter female hostels.

title: Airforce vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Air Force jets bombarded Boko Haram insurgents attempted to build a logistic base in Sambisa forest and killed many. It is assumed about 10 of the insurgents were killed in the bombardment.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female suicide bombers detonated explosives strapped on their bodies killing themselves and 2 others.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Niger
description: 5 people were killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and villagers. The victims included a villager and 4 herdsmen.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko haram insurgents and a soldier died in a shootout with soldiers on clearance mission. The insurgents were smuggling fish to their colleagues when they were killed.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 persons, including the bombers and a security guard, were killed when Boko Haram suicide bombers who attempted to infiltrate a university detonated the bombs they strapped to their bodies.
place: Department of Works, University of Maiduguri

title: Herdsmen attack Mosque, Niger
description: 21 faithful Muslim observing their early morning prayers were killed by Fulani herdsmen as a result of misunderstanding between some of the Fulani youths and some members of the community, which resulted in the death of 1 Fulani herdsman earlier. The death toll later rose to 27.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The incident happened when the nine insurgents stormed a community in the afternoon and killed the victims.

title: Roommate, Ogun
description: 27-year-old roommate, Michael was shot dead by his roommate Gbadamosi, a 20-year-old boy, for fear of exposing him because he longs to member of a notorious gang of bandits terrorising the area.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Delta
description: 7 persons were killed and a commercial motorcycle rider beheaded by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who stormed a community. It was reported that the killing was a reprisal attack for the killing of a Fulani herdsman.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: High Boko Haram targets including a deputy to Shekau, the leader of the terrorist group, were killed during an air strike. About 5 are assumed to have been killed in the strike. Abubakar Shekau was also reported injured.

title: Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 teenage female bombers believed to be Boko Haram members died in a foil suicide attack on a military outpost. All three were killed in the explosions after they were shot at by security operatives.

title: Herdsmen Kill Man, Delta
description: A middle-age man was murdered by Fulani herdsmen on his farm land. The herdsmen alleged that the insecticide the deceased sprayed on his crops caused the death of some of their cows that grazed on the farm.

title: Crisis, Imo
description: The murder of a young man sparked a reprisal attack leading to arson the Imo state government home town.
place: Ogboko axis of the busy Orlu-Mgbe-Urualla-Osina Road

title: Kidnap Victim, Oyo
description: A kidnap victim, Alhaji Saliu Saleh, was killed by his kidnappers who were identified as Umoru Abubakar (32 years), Ogun Aremu (35 years), Mutairu Mohammed (29 years) and Tambaya Tukura (28 years). The victim was kidnapped and killed as a reprisal for the arrest and death of one of the kidnapper's brothers in soldiers' custody. The brother was arrested for cattle rustling and he later died. Due to the nature of this incident, it was backdated by 1 month.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Officially, 15 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the troops of 21 Brigade of the 7 Division Army during a clearance operation. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to enter a dreaded forest. Actually, the 27 Task Force Brigade Battle Group commenced advance on 26 April 2017 at about 0900 hrs and entered habour at about 1930hrs when some elements of Boko Haram attacked them and were repelled. The next day, on the 27 April 2017 while the Brigade continued its advance, the Boko Haram insurgents attacked again: they used 2 trucks loaded with explosives (VBIED) to hit the leading tank thereby killing 1 x 4 soldiers, 3 CJTF and injuring 30 x soldiers and 2 x CJTF. Despite the casualties, the troops repelled the attack and killed many Boko Haram insurgents and captured their equipments and weapons. No equipment was captured from the military.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (22 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A lone female Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) strapped to her body as she attempted to enter a farm.
place: Alkomi area near the fence of Dynamics Farms

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male suicide bomber detonated a bomb when he was prevented from entering an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) community. He killed himself and a civilian.
place: IDP host community in USmanti area

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 persons, including the bombers, lost their lives while 11 others were seriously injured when three Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs in a garage and two other close locations.
place: Usmanti, Muna garage and Muna Ethopia

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of Nigerian Army. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to attack a town during the day.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 5 soldiers died in a Boko Haram suicide attack. The attack was targeted at a military convoy.

title: Herdsmen, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded Governor Samuel Ortom’s village when the residents of the community had gone to bed and started shooting sporadically during which they killed 4 people.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: 43-year-old welder Solomon Ejor, was beheaded by herdsmen while trying to rescue his mother, Mrs Maria Ejor, who had gone to farm and was held hostage by the Fulani herdsmen in her farm

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A Boko Haram terrorist, who disguised as a cart pusher, was intercepted by residents of the community as he detonated the IED on his cart, killing himself and 3 nearby civilians, while 2 other civilians sustained injuries.
place: Mainari Kanuri Village along Damboa/Biu Road

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their bodies when they attempted to infiltrate a village. The terrorists were intercepted by by Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF).

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: 6 people were killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and resients of a farming community. The herdsmen killed Sunday Kachuwa over an allegedly attack on their cattle. Protest broke out as a result and more people including a passenger were killed.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram terrorists were killed during a clearance operation of terrorist hideouts by troops of Operation Lafiya Dole. It was reported that several guns and rounds of ammunition were recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army troops of Operation Lafiya Dole killed 21 Boko Haram fighters during a clearance operation. It was reported that troops of 3 Battalion, 22 Brigade were attacked by the insurgents and they responded, killing 21 of the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 soldiers died when their patrol van ran into an Improvised Explosive Device laid by Boko Haram terrorists. Several (assuming 10) of the insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: An explosive device planted by Boko Haram terrorists killed a member of a vigilante group and got seven other members of the group injured. It was reported that the victim was also the driver of the vigilante members. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Funeral, Edo
description: Bobby Usiobaifo A 35-year old man was shot dead by unknown gunmen during the burial rites of his father, Pa Abel Usiobaifo.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 57 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops during a gun battle. The insurgents were regrouping in an area when they were caught up. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Farmers vs Herders, Benue
description: 5 persons were killed in a clash between Benue farmers and fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders besieged the farmers' village and shot sporadically and also set houses ablaze.
place: Inundugh village in Yaav council ward

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko haram female suicide bombers died after the explosives strapped on them exploded before hitting their targets.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 women including Mbanengen mother of 7 children were killed by Fulani Herdsmen when they were working on their farm.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 suicide bombers on Boko haram mission were shot dead by security operatives in the Works Department of the University of Maiduguri.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers blew themselves up during a foiled attack on a mosque during the sun rise (Subh) prayer.
