title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of travellers lost their lives when Boko Haram militants opened fire at private and commercial vehicles on a road. It was reported that many others were injured in the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 soldiers were killed by Boko Haram terrorists while 4 others were missing when the insurgents opened fire on the soldiers as they were approaching another town. It was reported that 5 soldiers were injured.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) strapped to his body. It was reported that the bomb killed the suicide bomber and injured 1 person.

title: Herdmen Kill 15, Benue
description: 15 people were killed in different communities by Fulani herdsmen. One of the communities attacked have been under occupation by the herdsmen for over 2 years.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , The Punch (10 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 male Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) strapped to their bodies at a filling station. It was reported that the bombers killed themselves only and also partly damaged a truck.
place: Bukar Gujari filling station in Muna Garage

title: Herdsman, Delta
description: A herdsman was killed when Youths of a community and Fulani herdsmen were engaged in a gun duel.

title: Boko Haram Kill 3, Borno
description: 3 rsidents were killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided a community. 14 girls aged 17 and below were abducted during the raid.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber killed herself when she detonated a bomb strapped to her body as she was about to enter a wedding venue. It was reported that the bomber's original plan of detonating the bomb inside the wedding venue was foiled by a domestic dog which sniffed her out.

title: Boko haram Kill 12, Borno
description: 12 people were killed in a multiple Boko Haram attacks on a farming community. About 23 others were wounded when a female suicide bomber detonated explosives at the village cemetery. The bomber is assumed dead after the detonation.

title: Mob vs Cattle Rustler, Katsina
description: A member of cattle rustling group called Mairakumi was killed by an angry mob. It was reported that Mairakumi had been terrorizing the residents which led to mob action. Due to the nature of the event, this incident was backdated by 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Kill Herdsman, Borno
description: A herdsman was killed by Boko Haram for not a protection fee. Hos 50 cows were also killed.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Cross River
description: 10 persons were killed in a community by Fulani herdsmen.The victims included one Etim Okon and 9 other persons who were butchered by the herdsmen. This provked the displacement of more than 3,500 people

title: Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: A gang of Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 3 victims and injured 6 others. The assailants were also said to have taken over farmlands. The attacks were carried out with daggers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 8 people including 5 suicide bombers were killed while over 20 people were injured in multiple explosions that occurred in 3 different places.
place: Muna Garage, Muna Kumbori and Muna Dagalti

title: Herdsmen vs Village Head, Nasarawa
description: Suspected herdsmen were said to gave killed a village head and a youth. Before the incident the village head had gone ona fishing expediction with some people at a pond and some fulani herdsmen threatened to kill them and police recovered 2 AK47 from the Fulani. The attackers were said to have claimed ownership of the land where the pond was located. The date of the event was not reported, it is assumed it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Kwara
description: 4 people including 3 Fulani herdsmen and a farmer died during a clash. The farmer was killed in his farm after he severally reported that the herdsmen graze on his farm. In a reprisal attack, 3 herdsmen were killed. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Artisan, Oyo
description: A 25-year-old welder, Joshua Adeniyi, was killed by Fulani herdsmen in his shop. He was stabbed on the chest.

title: Herdsmen Kill Ex-LGA Boss, Edo
description: The former Chairman of Etsako East LGA was shot dead by Fulani herdsmen during a robbery incident. The victim attempted to run from the robbery scene when he was shot at.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 family members (a mother and her 2 children) and a civilian JTF member died after 3 Boko Haram suicide bombers (a man and 2 women) detonated explosives after they failed to gain entry into the state capital. The 3 bombers are assumed dead also.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: An ex-chairman of Etsako East Local Government Area, Mr Suleiman Afegbua, was shot dead by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who waylaid travelers on a busy road.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A lieutenant , Chris Oguntoye and a mobile policeman, Sergeant Haliru Aliyu were killed in a Boko haram ambush. The victims were in a military convoy to Gubio area when they where attacked. Another source reported 5 soldiers were killed.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 female teenage suicide bombers and 2 male pedestrians died in a foiled suicide attempt. The teenagers were intercepted by security operatives and blew themselves up. 16 people were injured in the attack.

title: Rustlers vs Herdsman, Benue
description: Four cattle rustlers killed a herdsman in a village. It was reported that the rustlers have been terrorizing the village and stealing large number of cows.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were shot dead close to a military check point by soldiers. The victims were brought down after they were ordered to stop but refused. One of the victims was pregnant. 4 soldiers were killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Communal Clash, Anambra
description: 3 Fulani herdsmen were killed in a communal clash between two communities over the sale of land by some individual. 2 more people were reportedly killed after some days.
place: Amansi and Iruatu village in Nteje

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 10 people including a monarch, a taxman and an All Progressive Party (APC) Scribe, Mr. Ter Shirga were killed during a raid on some communities by Fulani herdsmen. Several people were injured in the attack and many also displaced. The fatalities rose to 20 after 2 days.
place: Mbalagh District, Wuav, Dogo, Bav Awuna, Tse-Igyura and Ortese Mbashiam

title: Soldier vs Man, Borno
description: Extra Judicial Killing: A personnel of the Nigerian Army identified as Lance Corporal Hillary Joel killed a man during a fight against Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that Joel set the man ablaze. It was later found that the man had no links to Boko Haram terrorists. The date of the incident was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 3 months ago.

title: Yoruba vs Hausa, Osun
description: An ethnic/communal crisis erupted between Yoruba and Hausa communities, leading to loss of many lives. The cause of the violence was not clear but a version said that an illicit affair between a married Yoruba woman and a Hausa man led to the communal war while the second version stated that a Yoruba woman was slapped by an Huasa man after littering her shop with some dirts. The husband of the woman mobilsed his colleagues for a revenge. Various deaths figures were reported while many were injured. Many houses were burnt. The state government imposed a 2-day curfew on the town.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (50 ) , Daily Trust (46 )

title: Boko Haram Executes 3, Borno
description: 3 men believed to have spied for government were executed by Boko haram in a video released to the public yesterday. One of the victims was beheaded while 2 others were shot dead with AK47 riffle.There was no mention of the date and place of execution. Therefore, the incident is assumed to have been carried out in Sambisa forest, the insurgents stronghold and backdated by a week.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 soldier and 2 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a shootout.About 505 persons (177 women, 20 men, 127 male children and 150 female students were rescued from the terrorists.

title: Kidnap, Delta
description: Valentine Mbalu, DPO, in charge of 'C' Division, Asaba, (bridge head), was abducted by unknown gunmen on his way from Agbor to Asaba and his decomposing body was later found. Suleiman Ibrahim and Yusuf Hamisu were paraded for the kidnap and murder.

title: Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 suicide bombers (an elderly woman, a boy and a girl) believed to be Boko haram bombers died during a failed suicide attack on NNPC depot. While the woman blew her self up beside a stationary tanker loaded with fuel, the boy and girl were shot dead by soldiers when they headed to the depot.

title: Herdsmen Kill 10,Benue
description: 10 people lost their lives when Fulani herdsmen raided a community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 18 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army when the insurgents invaded a village. It was reported that the terrorists attacked the village to cart away food but the troops overpowered them.

title: Cameroonian Army vs Boko Haram
description: With the MNJTF, Cameroonian Army claims to have killed 60 insurgents and liberated 5,000 civilians placed in an IDP camp in Banki on the Nigerian side of the border. Operation Thunder 2 penetrated 25 km deep into Nigeria.
place: all villages 25 km into Nigeria and 40km wide from Cameroonian border

title: Bomb Explosion,Niger
description: 4 persons were killed while 4 others were injured in a bomb explosion which rocked a market. It was reported that the bomb explosion was as a result of wrong handling of explosive by a newly recruited soldier, 22-year-old Private Tanko Damina. The soldier was showing off the explosives to prove that he was part of those that fought Boko Haram members. The other victims, who were all female, were identified as 14-year-old Wasila Adamu, 20-year-old Ruma Bello and 12-year-old Kulu Garba.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 24 members of Boko Haram terror group were decimated by Nigerian Air Force fighter jet which rained down fire on them. It was reported that the insurgents were killed when the security officials sighted them.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 8 persons were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community of farmers. It was reported that the herdsmen attacked the community when the farmers confronted them over the grazing of their farmlands.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (6 ) , This Day (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 7 soldiers and 20 Boko haram insurgents were killed during an invasion of a military base. It was reported that the attack lasted for several hours.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed no fewer than 4 persons in an attack which lasted for hours.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) neutralised a gathering of Boko Haram members. It was reported that the Air Force bombed the terrorists' gathering and hideouts, killing about 411 insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 18 persons were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The attackers burnt several houses and destroyed several properties. So many people were injured in the attack.
place: Ashim, Nissi and Zilan in Ataka District

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 9 persons were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The attackers burnt several houses and destroyed several properties. So many people were injured in the attack.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 29 people were killed by suspected cattle rustlers. Around 30 masked cattle rustlers invaded a community and shot indiscriminately at residents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of terrorists and civilians lost their lives in an attack by heavily armed Boko Haram fighters as they attempted to storm Maiduguri through its border with Mafa.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers stormed a motor park in the state capital, blew themselves and 2 others up. The 2 civilian victims were among the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) waiting to return to their homes. Another source reported scores (assuming at least 2) died in the foiled invasion. Most of the victims were the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (At least 2 scores) of Boko Haram terrorists were killed when they attempted to attack a Nigerian Airforce Force helicopter conveying personnel on a medical outreach programme. One personnel was injured.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Delta
description: 5 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by soldiers. It was reported that the soldiers invaded the venue of the meeting of their members. About 20 persons were injured in the invasion.

title: Auto Crash, Delta
description: 3 Fulani herdsmen were killed by a motorist that rammed into them when the herder blocked an expressway in an attempt to rob commuters. It was reported that herders died on the spot.

title: Boko Haram vs Policemen, Borno
description: 2 policemen were killed and another was injured by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists were intercepted by police officers while trying to invade the police station.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB Members, Anambra
description: IPOB: An unknown number of villagers were reportedly killed and set ablaze by soldiers. The number of deaths and the date of the incident were not given. It is assumed that 5 people died. The date was backdated by 2 days.

title: Bandits vs Army, Kaduna
description: Bandits shot 5 soldiers dead and set their truck ablaze in an ambush. It was reported that the incident happened close to a camp where the soldiers stay.

title: Gunmen Kill 6, Benue
description: 6 people were killed by bandits suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen. It was reported that the deceased were members of the All Nations Evangelism Ministries (ANEM).

title: Bandits vs Army Officer, Katsina
description: A Nigerian Army of the 17 Brigade identified as Major A.G Mohammed was shot dead in an ambush by some bandits. He was killed when he responded to a call for reinforcement.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Bandit vs PDP Secretary, Zamfara
description: A man identified as Musa Ille was killed by gunmen suspected to be bandits. It was reported that the deceased, the secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Zamfara State was attacked in the night at his house.It was not clear of the incident is politically motivated or criminally inclined.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several terrorists were killed in military airstrikes carried out by the Air Components of Operation Hadarin Daji and Hadin Kai. The incident was a clearance operation aimed at clearing out the terrorists.

title: Army vs Bandit Leader, Sokoto
description: Bandits' leader identified as Dogo Gide was neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army. The terrorist leader and gang have carried out series of attacks on civilians and security operatives.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed a 53-year-old baker, Mr Tijani Amedu, and abducted his 13 relatives, who were mainly children travelling with him. His corpse was found a day after his abduction.

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of Exercise Golden Dawn III neutralised a member of the Eastern Security Network, the armed affiliate of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The incident happened when troops, together with navy, police and local vigilante operatives, raided the camps of the proscribed group.

title: Bandits Kill Woman, Katsina
description: Malama Ladi was killed by bandits who abducted her and forcibly married her off to one of her abductors. She was killed when she refused to be defied by her captor.

title: Security Operatives Kill 5, Katsina
description: 5 suspected bandits were killed by security operatives. This incident is backdated by one week since no timeframe was reported. It is also believed it occurred in the state capital since no locations were reported.

title: IPOB/ESN vs Victims, Imo
description: Several dead bodies were found in the camp of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Eastern Security Networks (ESN) by military troops during a clearance operation. Due to the nature of the story, it was assumed that 10 bodies were recovered.

title: ISWAP Kill 2, Borno
description: Fighters of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) killed 2 people and abducted two traditional rulers. The incident was a reprisal attack for the killing of an unspecified number of terrorists by troops of the Nigerian Army as captured in IBD028088. They blamed the villagers for leaking information to the troops who ambushed them.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 15 persons were killed and several others were injured by some bandits who invaded some villages. It was reported that several houses and shops were set ablaze during the attacks.
place: Zawaini Zawaini, Jangargari and Jaja Villages

title: ISWAP vs Herders, Borno
description: 27 herders were killed by the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists for trespassing on their territory. It was reported that the incident happened when the herders took their cattle to graze on land close to the ISWAP terroriory.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 7 bandits who had allegedly attempted to raid a military base were killed by soldiers. A machine gun, motorcycles and ammunition were recovered from them.

title: Gunmen vs PDP Chieftain, Osun
description: A chieftain of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) identified as Dele Agboola was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The 42-year-old politician was killed while he was eating in front of his wife's shop. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that it was a politically motivated killing.

title: Gunmen Kill Vigilante, Kogi
description: A vigilante member identified as Mustapha was killed by gunmen. Community residents threatened to cause a crisis if the culprits are not uncovered and punished.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 people, including women, were killed and 21 others sustained injuries when terrorists, suspected to be members of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fired a mortar bomb into the town.

title: Communal Clash, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed during a crisis that ensued between a Fulani herder and a Muwaghagvul man. The have been reports of ethnic intolerance between Fulani and Muwaghagvul communities.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 18 persons were killed by some gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the gunmen burnt the corps and animals of the victims after killing them.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits raided some communities and killed 31 people. Many others were injured. The community was believed to have come under attacks for refusing to pay levies imposed on them by the bandits.
sources_of_information: The Punch (31 ) , The Guardian (42 ) , Daily Trust (25 ) , Vanguard (40 )

title: Bandit Informants, Kaduna
description: Extra Judicial Killing: 7 corpses were found in a forest. The decomposing corpses were identified as bandits' informants who were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army while they were trying to escape.
place: Gidan Makeri Forest near Janjala community in Kagarko Chiefdom

title: Bandits Attack, Zamfara
description: Armed bandits released 12 children they kidnapped but killed one of them. The armed men had earlier released 70 out of 83 abducted children and killed three.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Several people were killed and others were injured by some gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the gunmen attacked the residents in large numbers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (200 ) , The Guardian (100 ) , The Nation (130 ) , Other newspaper 3 (130 ) , Vanguard (29 ) , Nigerian Tribune (150 ) , Other newpapers 1 (117 )

title: Gunmen vs APC Chieftain, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A chieftain member of the All Progressive Congress (APC), Captain Anthony Enoch, was killed by some unknown gunmen. He was killed while coming from the party's stakeholders meeting. It was also reported that his corpse was dumped inside the boot of his car.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army neutralised 2 bandits during a clearance operation aimed at weeding out terrorists. The incident happened when the troops made a contact with the terrorists.

title: Fulani Militia, Kaduna
description: Bandits identified as Fulani militia stormed a community and killed an indigene. It was reported that the assailants came in their large numbers with herds of cattle.

title: Communal Crisis, Delta
description: A disagreement between some members of the vigilante and the anti-cult group claimed the life of a youth. The crisis crippled economic activities in the town as most stores around the area could not open for business, while parents did not allow their children to go to school.

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Niger
description: 1 soldier was shot dead by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that 23 bandits were also shot dead and several others were injured in the incident.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (24 ) , Other newspaper 3 (21 ) , Other newpapers 1 (21 ) , The Nation (30 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 2 people including one Zaharaddeen Mohammed of Amaru and Sunusi Sani of Dorayi were killed by armed bandits who came in large numbers to invade the residence of a customs officer, Malam Abubakar Modibbo. His wife Asiya Abubakar, his 2 daughters, Khadijatul Kubra and Hafsat and another person, Falalu Ibrahim, were kidnapped during the raid.
place: Kofar Kona area of Zaria City

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji neutralized three suspected bandits in an ambush. They also recovered one PKT gun with 48 rounds of 7.62mm x 54 ammunition, three AK47 rifles, three magazines with 63 rounds of 7.62mm special ammunition, and three motorcycles.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Guardian (3 )

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: 36 people, including 6 mobile policemen, were butchered by rampaging bandits who attacked villagers. It was reported that the bandits also kidnapped many people during the attack.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: An unspecified number of people lost their lives while others were abducted by bandits who attacked several communities. It was reported the bandits went from one community to another during the onslaught. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 people were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilantes, Abia
description: 3 members of a vigilante were killed by unknown gunmen. They were attacked when coming back from a function.

title: Gunmen vs Army, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be bandits killed a soldier and abducted another along a road. The soldiers were on their way to a military camp when they were ambushed.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Some bandits killed two teenagers who were trying to escape from abduction. It was reported that the bandits also released about 70 abducted farmers in their captivity.

title: Assailants vs Miners, Plateau
description: About 5 people were killed by assailants who invaded a mining site at night. A version of the report stated that suspected armed Fulani herdsmen killed the victims at the site.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Punch (6 ) , The Guardian (6 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Benue
description: Some residents and a soldier were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen who invaded some communities. It was reported that the militiamen stormed the communities and opened fire on residents without provocation. Several other people were injured. It was stated that the Commander of the Nigerian Army Peacekeeping force, codenamed Operation Whirl Stroke was killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (13 ) , Vanguard (16 ) , Other newspaper 2 (15 ) , The Guardian (15 ) , Other newspaper 3 (17 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Joint Task Force (JTF), Operation Hadarin Daji (OPHD), killed 5 bandits during a clearance operation. They also recovered an AK-47 rifle, an automatic grenade launcher, two magazines, and a large number of cattle.

title: Bandits Kill 2, Plateau
description: 2 people died when fleeing terrorists attacked some communities. The victims were killed in separate attacks.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldier, Taraba
description: A soldier was killed in an ambush by gunmen while many people were injured as he ran into an ambush. He becomes the 4th victim that was killed in an ambush in the area within a week. in addition, other reports have it that a soldier and 24 other residents of Ussa and Takum in Takum Local Government Area (LGA) were killed in the lingering Kuteb farmers and herder crisis. 20 Kuteb indigenes were killed while three Fulani herdsmen also paid the supreme price as a result of the crisis.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 3 persons were killed and several houses were destroyed when some gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members invaded a community. It was reported that the terrorists stormed the community on two motorcycles and attacked the residents. It was also reported that some shops in the community were set ablaze and food items carted away during the attack.

title: ISWAP vs Army, Borno
description: An officer of the Nigerian Army was killed by members of the Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) fighters at a border community. The incident happened when soldiers clashed with the terrorists when they attacked an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp. About 35 of the terrorists were decimated during the clash which lasts for 3 days.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Scores of people, assuming at least 40, were killed in a raid on some communities by bandits. The attack was carried out when residents were indoors. Several houses and other properties were destroyed by the attackers.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (22 ) , Other newpapers 1 (22 ) , This Day (27 ) , Vanguard (33 )

title: Political Violence, Kano
description: Supplementary Election: 3 people were killed when thugs wanted to disrupt the supplementary election but were resisted by residents. Some houses were destroyed during the crisis.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were killed by Troops of the Joint Task Force Operation Whirl Punch. It was reported that the troops laid an ambush on the terrorists and engaged them in gunfire at their hideouts. It was also reported that 2 AK-47 rifles and others weapons were recovered.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed 2 members of the Boko Haram terrorist group. The incident happened during a raid of the suspected terrorists' enclaves.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed and 1 other was arrested by Troops of Operation Hadarin. It was reported that the incident happened when the troops laid ambush on the hideouts of the terrorists in the area.

title: Army vs Bandits, Katsina
description: A terrorist was killed and others were injured during an ambush by the troops of Operation Hadarin. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits were conveying large quantities of rustled animals to a village. AK-47 rifles and livestock were recovered by the troops.

title: Bandits vs Court Registrar, Niger
description: The Registrar of Sharia Court, Ibbi, identified as Mallam Namaru was among the 9 kidnapped victims killed by bandits two weeks after their abduction. They were killed after their abductors lost 50 of their men during a clash with villagers and vigilantes.

title: Communal Clash, Sokoto
description: Several people, including a soldier, were killed and others injured during a clash between some Hausa and Fulani people in the community. It was reported that the crisis started when an old man was killed by a Fulani indigene. It was also reported that one soldier was killed when the Fulani attacked the military base in the area.

title: Herdsmen Clash, Taraba
description: Several people were killed during a clash between the Kuteps and Fulani Herdsmen. Another version of the story reported that the herdsmen are behind the killing and kidnapping of some people in the community. It was also reported that the palace of the traditional ruler, Ando Madugu, was burnt during the clash.

title: Cultism, Ondo
description: A final-year student of the Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko, identified as Temitayo Ayodeji was stabbed to death by some cultists during an argument over N1000.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Assailants vs Men, Lagos
description: 3 persons were killed and 1 other was injured by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victims were attacked at night by the gunmen who invaded the community.
place: 41 Road, Union Bank Block Estate, Gowon in the Ipeja Area
sources_of_information: The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 )

title: Boko Haram vs Pastor, Borno
description: An unidentified pastor in charge of the Church of Brethern in Nigeria, known as EYN Church, was shot dead, and his wife was injured by some bandits who invaded the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 18 Boko Haram members were killed by Troops of Operation Hadin Kai during an ambush at the terrorist's hideout.

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Niger
description: 6 persons, including 2 vigilante members, were killed and 14 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded the community.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 7 persons were killed and 26 others were abducted by bandits who invaded the community. It was reported that the bandits stormed seven communities and attacked the residents.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: Post-Election Crisis: 1 person was killed while scores were injured when supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party and the All Progressives Congress clashed over the outcome of the March 18 governorship election.
place: Office of the Independent Electoral Commission along Aba Road

title: Police vs IPOB, Abia
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed during a clash between the group and police operatives. The incident happened members of IPOB attacked policemen who were on confidence-building patrol/show of force.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division Nigerian Army killed 5 bandits in a clearance operation that lasted for several hours. It was reported that the troops also recovered four AK-47 rifles, 6 AK47 magazines, 24 rounds of 7.62mm, three motorcycles, one machete, 2 handsets, and some charms.
place: along Kanti-Tantatu road in Kubusu forest and the Kaso hiss general area
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kwara
description: 1 person identified as Danjuma Maidanji was killed and 1 other, Mariam was injured by some Fulani. It was reported that the suspects, 2 Fulani herdsmen, Ali Suleiman (24), and Sidi Abubakar (12) attacked the deceased, a herder, and his daughter on their farm over grazing rights.

title: Troops vs Bandits
description: Soldiers of the Nigerian Army killed 11 bandits in a fierce battle, cleared several enclaves of the bandits and recovered arms and ammunition from them.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Katsina
description: Gunmen numbering over 60 invaded a village and killed 5 people. It was reported that 4 others were injured during the attack.

title: Communal Crisis, Cross River
description: A communal dispute between 2 communities over a parcel of land at their farm areas, left many people dead, and thousands of people homeless, following the destruction of residential houses and farmlands.

title: Security Operatives vs IPOB, Abia
description: Several members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by a joint team of the Nigerian Army and the Police. It was reported that the incident happened when the IPOB members were protesting the continuous incarceration of their leader, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu.
place: Osusu Road by John's Anglican Church
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Guardian (50 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 3 people were killed and several houses razed following a bloody clash between youths of Ojantele, Otobi of Otukpo and Ijegwu of Obi LGAs of Benue State. The crisis started as a result of a misunderstanding over the electricity supply from a transformer that services the two areas.

title: Police vs Bandit, Katsina
description: A bandit was shot dead by the police. The incident happened when the police repelled some bandits who tried to block a road.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 persons, including Mallam Ya'u, were shot dead and 16 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits, who rode on motorcycles with AK-47s stormed two communities in the area and attacked the herder's camp.

title: Boko Haram IED, Borno
description: The chief bomb maker and a high ranking member of the Boko Haram, Awana Gaidam, was killed by his Improvised Explosive Device (IED). The 39-year-old bomb maker died when the bomb struck his vehicle along a road.
place: along Njumia and Arra in the Sambisa forest general area

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Bandits killed 5 people who were in their kidnap den, including a retired police officer, Moses Tanko. The victims were killed for failing to raise the demanded ransom.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) attack on a military base was foiled by soldiers. At least 10 ISWAP fighters died in the encounter.

title: Bandits vs Baby, Kaduna
description: Some bandits killed a newborn baby whose mother was abducted by the hoodlums for a long period. It was reported that the bandits freed the woman after she lost her baby but refused to release her 16-year-old daughter.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani Herdsmen who invaded the community. It was reported that the victims were killed beside a fishing pod when they went fishing.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Cultism, Rivers
description: 6 people were killed during a clash between 2 rival cult groups. The crisis started when members of one of the groups were having fun at a relaxation center when their rival stormed the area and opened fire on them.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: A soldier was killed by Boko Haram terrorists who attacked a military base. The terrorists have been tormenting residents of the local government area.

title: Political Violence, Nasarawa
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 1 person identified as Yunisa Lolo was killed by security operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly election. It was reported that the incident happened at the collation center when the deceased started disrupting the place which made the military personnel intervene.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: Governorship Election Crisis: An INEC ad-hoc staff identified as Akoi Arumodu was killed and 2 others were injured by a stray bullet from some political thugs. It was reported that the incident happened at the polling units when some hoodlums arrived in the area and shot sporadically to scare the voters away in order to snatch ballot boxes.

title: Political Violence, Delta
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 1 person was shot dead by security operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly election. It was reported that the incident happened during a clash at his polling unit between some hoodlums and the security operatives.

title: Political Violence, Akwa Ibom
description: Pre-Election Crisis: 3 persons were killed by some unknown gunmen who invaded the area. It was reported that the incident happened on the eve of the Governorship and House of Assembly election.
place: Ibiono Ibom, in Oko Ita, headquarters

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: Governorship Election Crisis: 2 persons were killed by police operatives during the Governorship and House of Assembly elections in the state. It was reported that the bodies of the deceased were recovered by other security operatives.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: Some Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed a driver, Ome Osesa. They also injured other people and kidnapped others.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Gunmen vs Security Operatives, Niger
description: 4 persons, including a Nigerian Army Major and 3 soldiers, were killed in an ambush by some gunmen. 4 members of the local vigilantes were also killed in the encounter. The soldiers were ambushed when they went to recover the dead bodies of the vigilante members that were killed by the bandits.
place: Igu village, along Sarkin Pawa-Kaduna Road
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Punch (8 ) , The Nation (8 )

title: Bandits vs Security Operatives, Niger
description: 9 security operatives were killed in an ambush by some bandits. The situation led to a shootout between security operatives and the bandits.

title: Bandits Kill 18, Katsina
description: 18 villagers were killed by some bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandits clashed with local vigilantes during the attack. Several people were injured.
place: Majifa, Gurbi, Danmarke, Gidan-Anchor, Gida-Saika, Dan-Mangoro and Gidan-Sale
sources_of_information: The Nation (18 ) , Other newspaper 3 (18 ) , Other newspaper 2 (23 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 1 hoodlum was killed while another was wounded in a gun battle between policemen and gunmen. The incident happened when the unknown gunmen shot sporadically and set two vehicles and a filling station ablaze.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Kaduna
description: 6 members of a vigilante group were killed by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community and opened fire on the local security at a checkpoint on sighting them.
place: Awaro checking point in Western Part

title: Assailants vs Police Officers, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A police officer was shot dead by some gunmen who invaded a police station. It was reported that the gunmen had attacked a police checkpoint in the area before invading their station.

title: Bandits vs Travellers, FCT (Abuja)
description: 2 passengers were killed by bandits who blocked a road. It was reported that the bandits regularly blocked roads to terrorize road users in the same spot where the killing happened.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Edo
description: 3 persons, including a pastor and two of his workers, were killed and many others, were injured by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victims were killed while they were working on their farmland.
place: Eti Oseh road, which links Saboginda Ora, Sobe Community

title: Election Crisis, Rivers
description: Election Day Crisis: A pregnant woman identified as Ruth Osah and a member of Emohua Local Vigilante Service (EMOLVIS), known as Mark Orduize were killed while a vigilante personnel was injured and 2 houses were burnt. Then incidents halted the elections process in the community.

title: Political Violence, Gombe
description: Presidential Election Crisis: 10 persons, including law enforcement agents and security personnel, were killed during the Presidential general election. It was reported that properties were also destroyed during the violent attack.

title: Suspected Herdsmen vs Farmer, Niger
description: A 52-year-old man identified as Samanja was shot dead by suspected Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the deceased, a farmer was attacked and shot in the neck by the bandits while working on his irrigation farm in the morning.

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: 2 persons were killed while several others were abducted by bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the victims were returning back from a Friday market in an open Canter lorry which was set ablaze by the bandits.

title: Political Violence, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A senatorial candidate of the PDP Oforchukwu Egbo, was killed by some gunmen who attacked his convoy at night. It was reported that the gunmen also burnt one of his drivers in the convoy to death.

title: Security Agents vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A combined team of security agents killed 6 gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra when they attempted to infiltrate a police facility. 2 AK47 rifles, one Toyota Sienna vehicle marked Abuja ABC848EQ, charms and other incriminating items were recovered from the hoodlums. A version of the story stated that a policeman was killed in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (6 ) , This Day (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 )

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Niger
description: 5 police officers, including the DPO of Paiko Division, SP Mukhtar Sabiu, were killed by some gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the police upon receiving a distress call about some bandits in a village, intercepted and repelled them with the combined teams of local vigilantes members. It was also reported that some of the bandits were killed in the exchange of gunfire.
sources_of_information: The Punch (10 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 )

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 152 Battalion Banki of Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) killed 8 Boko Haram terrorists. They were killed in an ambush in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF).

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 1 person was killed and 16 women were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits stormed the community at midnight. It was also reported that 4 persons were injured during the attack.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Katsina
description: 41 members of an outlawed vigilante group, Yankasai, were shot dead by a group of bandits who ambushed the victims. The incident happened when the vigilante mobilized to retrieve some cattle rustled by the bandits (See IBD026317).
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (41 ) , The Nation (41 ) , The Guardian (41 ) , Other newpapers 1 (41 ) , Nigerian Tribune (100 )

title: Bandits vs Miners, Kaduna
description: 5 persons were killed and others were injured by some gunmen who invaded a mining site. It was reported that the victims, local miners, were working at the site located in the bush when the gunmen attacked them.

title: Gunmen vs Police Officer, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed a female police officer during an attack on a checkpoint along a road. The victim was with her colleague as they mounted a guard before the incident happened.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of 25 Task Force Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) neutralised 23 Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists. The incident happened during a failed ambush by the terrorists near a military outpost.

title: Gunmen vs Party Members, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 members of the All Progressive Congress (APC) were killed by gunmen while they were having a meeting. The attackers stormed the venue of the meeting on motorbikes and opened fire on the gathering, killing 2 of the victims.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 5 terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that the troops recovered some weapons from the bandits.

title: Bandits vs Councillor, Niger
description: Saleh Allawa, a newly elected councilor was killed by bandits who laid an ambush on his vehicle. Allawa was on his way to his village when they ran into his killers. His personal assistant escaped.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kebbi
description: 2 bandits were killed by Troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that the incident happened during a routine patrol in a community. It was also reported that the Troops also recover some weapons after the operation.

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: 2 bandits were killed while 28 kidnap victims were rescued by members of the vigilante group. The vigilante members engaged the bandits in a fierce gun battle.
place: bush bothering Toto and Kotonkarfe LGAs

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP), terrorists were killed by Troops of the 25 Task Force Brigade, Operation Hadin Kai (OPHK) in an ambush. It was reported that terrorists stormed the base of the Troops with Mine Resistant Ambush Protection (MRAP), and four Hilux trucks and started shooting sporadically which made the Troops repelled the attack by engaging the terrorists in a gun battle.
place: Azir on Damboa-Biu Road, Sambisa Forest

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Several bandits who have been terrorising residents were decimated by security operatives. The terrorists were killed in a village.

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed about seven members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. The incident happened when troops encountered the hoodlums at a checkpoint.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 terrorists were killed and others were injured in their hideout by Troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that 3 motorcycles were recovered by the Troops after the operation.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Policemen vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: 2 bandits were killed by a combined team of police operatives in conjunction with local hunters. The incident happened when the security operatives stormed the hideout of the bandits.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 people were shot dead when some gunmen opened fire at a military checkpoint. It was reported that the gun duel lasted over 45 mins during which the victims lost their lives.

title: Police vs Kidnappers, Bauchi
description: 3 kidnappers and bandits were killed by the police operatives and other security forces. It was reported that AK47 rifles were recovered from the kidnappers while some of them were arrested.

title: Communal Clash, Ondo
description: 1 perosn died during a clash between Hausa and Fulani settlers. The crisis escalated a day later, leading to many people sustaining various degrees of injuries. Both groups clashed over a pack of Cannabis sativa kept in the bush by the Hausa man.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed several people when they attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorising the community.

title: Police vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Operatives of the Zamfara State police command killed 11 bandits who shot dead a Chinese national identified as Fan Yu. It was reported that 2 Chinese expatriates and their police escorts were attacked while assessing a project in a location.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , The Nation (12 ) , Other newspaper 3 (12 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Forest Sanity killed 4 bandits and seized motorcycles during patrols in some areas. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 )

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai neutralized 8 Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) terrorists in an ambush. The troops carried out the operation when they came in contact with the insurgents.

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Sokoto
description: 6 persons, including 3 policemen were killed and several others were injured by bandits. It was reported that the incident happened at the marketplace when the bandits came on motorcycles and started shooting sporadically.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Punch (6 )

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 56 people, including 33 wives and 23 fighters of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) were killed by Boko Haram. It was reported that the incident was a reprisal attack over the killing of a Boko commander, Malam Abubakar (Munzir), and 15 others by the ISWAP fighters.
place: Sambisa, Ukuba, Arra, Sabil Huda and Farisu

title: Army vs Bandits, Niger
description: 20 terrorists were killed and 5 kidnap victims were rescued by the operatives of the Joint Security Task Force. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation in the community.
place: Gaskiya Bana, a border community between Niger and Kaduna State

title: Troops vs Terrorist, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji neutralized 3 bandits while 20 others fled with gunshot wounds.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 bandits, including Dogo Mallam and Bello Mallam, were killed by troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that the troops engaged the bandits in a shoot-out where four terrorists were killed and AK47 was recovered.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 19 people were killed by bandits who attacked a village in the night. It was reported that the bandits, who came on motorcycles, shot sporadically at residents.
place: Royoji village in Birnin Tsaba District

title: IPOB/ESN vs Vigilante, Enugu
description: A member of a vigilance group was killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra. It was reported that IPOB members led by one Mr. Martins Abogwu kidnapped the victim, killed him and buried him in a shallow grave.

title: Air Force vs Bandits
description: 7 notorious bandits, who were members of Mallam Ila group, were killed by the Nigerian Air Force attached to ''Operation Hadarin Daji''. The terrorists were killed in the push to rid the area of bandits.

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 policemen were shot dead by gunmen who swooped on them at a checkpoint where they were extorting money from motorists. A version of the report stated that the policemen were killed at a police station.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Nation (3 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Air Force vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Many bandits were neutralized by the Air Component of Operation Whirl Punch. The bandits have been terrorizing residents before the strikes which were targeted at their enclaves.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 )

title: Gunmen vs Woman, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen, who were trying to escape after killing some victims as captured in IBD025670, killed a pregnant woman and a local security officer. The gunmen were identified as members of the Indigenous People of Biafra.

title: NAF Air Strikes, Kaduna
description: Several bandits were neutralized by air strikes by the Nigerian Air Force during a series of air interdictions. The strikes were aimed at decimating the bandits who were terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Kidnap Victim, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits who stormed a village and kidnapped some villagers later killed one of the victims. It was reported that collected ransom, freed some of the victims and killed the deceased.

title: Gunmen vs Businessman, Niger
description: A 42-year-old businessman identified as Ebele Ojogbo was killed and 13 others in his apartment were abducted. It was reported that the incident happened when the gunmen suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen invaded his house at night.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: 3 persons, including Sunday Ogbuabour and Chidi Lazarus (40) were killed and others injured when suspected Fulani herdsmen invaded their community. It was reported that the victims were attacked when they were monitoring the exit routes in the community.
place: Agu-Amede, Mgbuji and Umujiovu-Eboh Communities in Eha-Amufu

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Some people were killed when gunmen attacked a police checkpoint. It was reported that the gunmen shot sporadically, injuring some people and killing an unspecified number of victims. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 people were killed in the attack.

title: Army vs Bandit Kingpin, Zamfara
description: Troops of Operation Hadarin Daji neutralised a bandit kingpin known as Mr. Bada and rescued abducted victims. It was reported that other bandits fled with gunshot injuries. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 5 bandits were killed.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 )

title: Air Force vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The Nigerian Air Force killed 2 high profile ISWAP commanders identified as Mallam Ali Kwaya and Mallam Bukar Mainoka and several of their fighters during air interdictions. The incident happened when the terrorists were planning to attack some military bases. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that about 20 other terrorists were killed.
place: Belowa in the Tumbuns, Lake Chad Region

title: Air Force vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several members of the Islamic State West Africa Province were decimated by airstrikes of the Nigerian Air Force. The terrorists were spotted converging in a location before the strike.

title: Bandits vs vigilantes, Niger State
description: A gun duel occurred in Wushishi LGA between bandits and vigilantes. 8 bandits and 6 vigilantes died.

title: Militias, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed while 5 others sustained injuries in an attack by suspected Fulani militias. This led to a massive protest along Bokkos -Barkin Ladi road, causing serious gridlock.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 24 fighters of the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) were killed by the Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the incident was a result of a reprisal attack.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Plateau
description: 4 persons were killed by some gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that the bandits laid an ambush on the community a day before attacking the victims during the Muslim Salat prayers.

title: Fulani Attack, Plateau
description: A 32-year-old man, Davou Nwatep, was killed and 1 other injured by some suspected Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the incident a reprisal attack for the arrest nof their kinsman.

title: Bandits vs Farmers, Zamfara
description: Some bandits led by one Mr. Bada invaded a village and killed some farmers while they were harvesting their produce.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police officers were shot dead and others were injured by suspected gunmen. It was reported that the incident happened when the police on a stop-and-search operation were attacked by the gunmen, including Chinwedu Nwangwu, known as Onyearmyg who were in military uniforms in Siena and Hilux vehicles with security sirens.

title: Drown, Zamfara
description: 30 people including women and children drowned in a river. It was reported that the incident happened when the victims were running away from bandits in two overloaded canoes conveying them across a river capsized.
sources_of_information: The Nation (30 ) , The Punch (26 ) , Other newpapers 1 (30 ) , Daily Trust (13 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram (assuming at least 2 scores) were killed during a raid on their enclave by soldiers in conjunction with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF). One of the Chibok girls who was abducted from a government-owned secondary school in Chibok, Borno State in April 2014 was rescued with 4 children.

title: ISWAP Attack, Borno
description: 3 people were killed in a raid by the Islamic State of West African Province (ISWAP) fighters. It was reported that the insurgents stormed the community in the early hours of the day and targeted the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) members. 2 of the victims were civilians and 1 a CJTF member.

title: ISWAP vs Traders, Kano
description: 2 Igbo traders were shot dead by gunmen. The victims were identified as Ifeanyi Elechukwu (41 years) and his friend, Chibuile Emmanuel. The Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) later claimed the attack.
place: Sabon-Gari area of metropolitan part of Kano
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Independent (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 6 others were kidnapped by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened at a farm center.

title: Boat Mishap, FCT (Abuja)
description: 5 people, including a housewife, drowned and 4 others were injured when a canoe capsized in a river. It was reported that the incident happened when the victims were escaping from the bandits' attack.

title: Bandits Kill 4, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 4 people and rustled a number of cattle in a community. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing residents of the community. The attack was carried out by Bello Turji's men.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 5 persons were killed, 4 others sustained injuries and 8 people were kidnapped by some bandits who invaded a village. The bandits on motorcycles and in large numbers stormed the village and shot sporadically into the air. They also burgled some shops and took away foodstuffs and other valuables.

title: Boko Haram vs ISWAP, Borno
description: 25 Boko Haram fighters, including their commander, Kundu, were killed by the Islamic State West Africa Province ( ISWAP) during a fierce rival battle. It was reported that the incident happened when the deceased and his team were on a robbery mission and were intercepted by the ISWAP members on motorcycles.
place: Between Dikwa and Bama Local Government Areas

title: Land Tussle, Delta
description: 1 person identified as Frank Amakiri was killed during a land tussle. It was reported that the crisis started with an exchange of gunshots between two communities. It was also reported that one suspect, Micheal Amakiri was arrested by the police.
place: Aladja and Ogbe-Ijoh, Between in Udu and Warri south west local government
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 )

title: Assailant vs Man, Enugu
description: 1 person identified as Mr. Chikodili Ngwu was killed by some gunmen. It was reported that the deceased was shot dead within a market area. His murder was connected to the leadership crisis that had claimed several lives in the community.
place: Ameke Village in Oruku Community, Oruku market square

title: Gunmen vs Police, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen who rode in a Lexus SUV opened fire on a police patrol van and killed 3 policemen in the process. 2 of the victims were shot dead in a gutter where they ran to hide. It was reported that 2 other people were killed by the gunmen.

title: Gunmen vs Cleric, Ebonyi
description: ESN/IPOB: A renowned Islamic cleric in the South East identified as Sheikh Ibrahim Iyiorji was shot dead at his residence by gunmen belonging to the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).

title: Terrorists Attack, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed by some bandits in a community. It was reported that the bandits invaded the area and attacked the residents and also looted several shops.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army and the Air Force killed 5 Boko Haram commanders and 195 other terrorists during a clearance operation. It was reported that the terrorists were neutralized during airstrikes.
place: Gabachari, Sheruri, Mantari and Mallum Masari villages
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (200 ) , The Guardian (200 ) , Daily Trust (200 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: 3 persons including a hotel owner, Chief Ogbonnaya Nwadibia were killed by some gunmen who invaded the hotel. It was reported that the incident happened at night when the gunmen came on motorcycles with weapons and stormed the hotel where they killed the owner known as Galaxy and 2 others identified as Henry Chukwu (43 years) and Alexander Okorie (52 years).
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Independent (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 terrorists were killed by Troops of Operation Forest Sanity. It was reported that the incident happened when the Troops engaged the bandits in gunfire and killed two on the spot.

title: NAF vs ISWAP, Borno
description: Several Islamic States of West African Province (ISWAP) members, including their leader, Fiya Ba Yuram, were killed and others injured by the Nigerian Airforce (NAF). It was reported that the attacks were carried out under the Air Component of Operation Hadin Kai.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Some gunmen suspected to be pro-Biafra agitators attacked a police checkpoint and killed a policeman. It was reported that a civilian was shot dead in the gun duel that ensued during the encounter. A version of the report stated that the dead victim was one of the hoodlums.
place: G-Hostel Junction, close to the Enugu-Abakaliki

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Some bandits stormed some communities in their large numbers, shot sporadically, and killed 16 people. Many others were alleged to have sustained various degrees of injuries.
place: Gidado and Garinkuka villages in Guma District of Mutum-Biyu Chiefdom

title: Police vs IPOB/ESN, Enugu
description: A member of the Eastern Security Network, the military wing of the Independent People of Biafra (IPOB) was shot dead by the police. The incident happened when the police raided the camps of IPOB.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, FCT (Abuja)
description: 2 vigilante members were shot dead during a gun battle with bandits who attacked a community. It was reported that the incident happened at a forest bordering the FCT and Niger State.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: The air component of Operation Whirl Punch in the North West killed a notorious bandit leader, Alhaji Shanono, and 17 of his men. The incident happened when the Air Force cleared out the bandits from their stronghold.

title: Kidnappers Kill 1, Niger
description: The Coordinator, Federal Inland Revenue Service (FIRS) in charge of Zamfara, Sokoto and Kebbi states, Alhaji Muhammad Kudu Adamu, was killed by bandits while returning from his hometown in Kwara State where he had gone to greet his relations who just returned from the pilgrimage to Mecca, Saudi Arabia. 3 other people were kidnapped while 2 petrol tankers were set ablaze.

title: NAF vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram/Islamic State of West African (ISWAP) terrorists were killed in an air raid by the Air Task Force (ATF) of Operation Hadin Kai. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40 terrorists) were killed in the operation. This incident is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported by the source.

title: Banditry, FCT (Abuja)
description: Bandits shot dead herder, Shehu Kwarjini, and abducted another person at a settlement located in a village. It was reported that the bandits killed the herder when he attempted to escape.
place: Fulani settlement at Gwombe village in Gwargwada chiefdom

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 2 persons were killed and 8 others were abducted by some bandits who invaded a community. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits numbering about 30 and armed with AK-47 riffles attacked 3 villages in the area. They also rustled some animals after the attack.
place: Babbar Ruga, Kwarin Maikotso and Kore Villages

title: IPOB/ESN vs Police, Enugu
description: A police officer identified as John Okapnachi was killed by members of the Eastern Security Network, a military wing of the Indigenous People of Biafra. They buried the victim in a shallow grave.

title: Transport Union Crisis, Lagos
description: 4 people were killed in a clash between rival transport union groups over the right to the sale of tickets and collection of tolls from truck drivers along the port corridor. The clash was between members of the Lagos State Park and Garage Management unions.

title: Gunmen Kill Monarch, Taraba
description: The traditional ruler of Yukuben chiefdom, Udeng Ibrahim Yamusa, and his son were killed by bandits while returning from a peace meeting. They were riding on a motorcycle when they were shot. The monarch was killed by his close aides who were angered by their sack.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 20 dead bodies were found beside a stream when some terrorists invaded a community. It was reported that the terrorists came in large numbers to steal cows and shut them in every direction to scare people away.

title: Cult Clash, Bayelsa
description: A mechanic identified as Friday was killed by some cultists during an internal crisis. The members engaged one another in a free-for-all battle over an undisclosed reason.

title: Communal Clash, Oyo
description: One person was alleged to have died during a clash between Hausa and Yoruba youths. The crisis started with an Hausa trader and a Yoruba client. However, the police denied any death.

title: Bandits vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: 5 villagers were killed and 10 bodies of terrorists were found dead in a forest during a gun duel battle between the terrorists and the villagers. It was reported that the villagers had put up a fight when they were attacked by the bandits. It was also reported that motorcycles were recovered from the bandits after the operation.
place: Ganin Gari Community, Randagi ward, Birnin Gwari forest

title: Bandits Attack, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed in Ruwan Godiya and 1 other person at Kwai, while scores of people were injured by bandits who also rustled their animals. One of the victims was Abdulazeez Haruna.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (6 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , The Nation (6 ) , This Day (9 ) , Daily Trust (9 )

title: Bandits vs Policemen, Katsina
description: Terrorists numbering over 300 killed 5 Mobile Police Officers (PMF) and 3 other civilians at a police checkpoint.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (8 ) , Other newspaper 3 (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: ACP Aminu Umar, an area commander in a community was killed by some bandits led by one Saidu Yaro alias Sabon Jini (30 years). It was reported that the deceased known as the god of Dutsinma was attacked by the bandits during rainy hours. It was also reported that some people were abducted during the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Gunmen vs Man, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A father of four was killed at a burial ceremony by some gunmen believed to be pro-Biafra agitators. It was reported that the victim was shot in front of his wife and children.

title: Banditry, FCT ( Abuja)
description: A 7-year-old boy identified as Ayuba was killed and 2 others injured by some bandits who stormed a community at night with sophisticated weapons. It was also reported that some people were abducted and foodstuffs were taken away by the bandits.
place: Paikon Basa Community in Gurdi Ward

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: Anas Adamu, a final year student at the Federal College of Education, Katsina, was killed in an ambush by bandits during the Sallah period. Two of his friends were abducted by the attackers. The deceased attempted to escape the attack but was apprehended and set him ablaze.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 10 gunmen were killed and their camps were destroyed by the police during a raid on their hideout. The raid was a reprisal for the earlier killing of 2 policemen and another person captured by the hoodlums.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (13 ) , Other newpapers 1 (13 ) , This Day (13 )

title: Bandits Kill 30, Taraba
description: About 30 people were killed in different communities within a week by bandits. The attacks displaced about 20,000 residents into neighbouring communities.
place: Basank, Muji 1, Muji 2, Fawen, Tati, Flashin, Rikwen Tumu, Rikwen cwun, Tswen 1, Tswen 2, Kando, Kasiten, Kpashi, Shimta, Kwaben, Mbiya, Kakum, Tukok, Gaba and Mbafobani.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (60 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Plateau
description: 12 people lost their lives in a clash between bandits and vigilantes. It was reported that the clash which happened in the morning led to the death of 9 bandits and 3 vigilante members.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (12 ) , The Guardian (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 20 soldiers belonging to the 45 Battalion, Bida, 7 policemen and 40 civilians were killed in an ambush by bandits. Other security operatives and civilians were injured too. The incident happened at a mining site where they shot sporadically to announce their presence and scare the workers away. It was also reported that 4 Chinese expatriates and other Nigerians were abducted in the process.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (67 ) , Daily Trust (22 ) , The Nation (39 ) , Independent (23 ) , The Punch (48 )

title: Vigilantes vs Bandits, Niger
description: 5 suspected bandits were killed in a reprisal attack in a forest by the members of the vigilantes' group. It was reported that the vigilantes' group engaged the bandits in gunfire leading to the death of the victims and others escaping.
place: A Forest in Lafiya, Kpada, and Duma Communities

title: Gunmen vs Woman, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: A pregnant woman and a vigilante member identified as Nonso were shot dead by some gunmen who invaded a drinking joint. The lady was the wife of the owner of the drinking spot.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: A Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) Commander and 1 other person were shot dead by some bandits during an attack in a community. It was reported that the CJTF commander and other members opened fire on the bandits unaware that they were close to them. It was also reported that 16 people were abducted by the bandits during the attack.
place: Sabon Gero Community at Millennium City

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 3 people were killed and many others kidnapped by bandits who invaded a village. It was reported that the attack happened after the bandits signed a peace accord with the village.

title: Army vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke arrested 4 kidnappers, neutralized 4 bandits and rescued a kidnapped victim. The incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai kill 9 terrorists and recovered ammunition. Details of the incident were not reported.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: A woman identified as Maryam Mohammed was shot dead by some bandits who wanted to abduct her son. The lady was shot when she hit one of the bandits with a pestle in order to free her son.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: A councilor-elect, paul Ojile and his cousin were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen when they went to search for a kidnapped victim. They were beheaded by the attackers.

title: Banditry, Bauchi
description: Gunmen who doubled as bandits killed 4 people and injured 3 others when they attacked 3 communities. It was reported that the incident happened when the bandits went to abduct the hamlet head of some communities.
place: Jimari Sabuwa, New Tudun Wadan Jada and Jauro Banu

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 police officers were shot dead by some gunmen who invaded a police station in the community. It was also reported that the station was set ablaze.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Operatives of Kaduna State Police command killed 4 bandits and arrested a woman who was supplying arms to criminals. They recovered AK49 and AK 47 rifles with magazine, 134 live ammunition and one operational vehicle.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Banditry, Niger
description: 8 people were killed and many others were abducted by some bandits in a community. It was reported that the incident led to many residents fleeing their homes for safety.

title: Gunmen Attack, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons were killed and others sustained injuries by gunmen who boarded a lorry, disguised and open fire on passerby suspected to have gone to the market. It was reported that the gunmen were angered by the heavy presence of military men in the area.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: A woman, a friend to the wife of a traditional ruler known as Uban Garin Bararawa, was killed by kidnappers who abducted the monarch.

title: Hoodlums vs Policemen, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen killed 2 policemen at the mechanic workshop of a private transport company. The hoodlums stole the rifles of the policemen.

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Four members of the Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association of Nigeria (MACBAN) were killed by gunmen. It was reported that the Fulani herders were killed while 60 of their cows were rustled during the raid. The victims were identified as Mohammed Idris, Sale Idris, Abdulmumini Idris and Musa Idris.

title: Gunmen vs Policeman, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: A policeman and 3 unknown gunmen were killed during a shoot-out with the security agents. It was reported that the incident happened when the agents raided a hideout used by the gunmen.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Independent (3 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Security Operatives vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram commander and his deputy were killed during a clash with hunters and vigilante. The terrorists numbering about 20 were riding on motorcycles when the security operatives engaged them.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Man vs NPC Chief, Nasarawa
description: Mr. Zakari Umaru-Kigbum, a former Commissioner of National of the National Population Commission (NPC) was killed at his residence by unknown gunmen. It was also reported that 2 of his children were kidnapped. A source stated that the victim was a lecturer with the Isa Mustapha Agwai Polytechnic, Lafia.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , This Day (1 )

title: Groom, Kaduna
description: Bandits in large numbers on motorcycles invaded the home of a newly married couple, killed the groom and kidnapped his pregnant wife. The bandits also went away with 4 members of the family of Abdulrahman Ibrahim Jere, a former Commissioner of Poverty Alleviation in the state.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Policemen killed 2 bandits and recovered AK 47 assault rifles from them. The incident happened during a clearance operation. It was reported that several other bandits sustained bullet wounds.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: 4 unknown gunmen were killed by the police during a shootout. The operation was carried out based on the information received from concerned citizens of the community.

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: 12 people were killed by terrorists who invaded a village. It was reported that the bandits also burnt farmlands belonging to residents of the village during the early morning raid.

title: Gunmen Kills Two, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 persons were killed by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). It was reported that the gunmen invaded the area and opened fire on the deceased before leaving the area.

title: IPOB vs Lawmaker, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Anambra State House of Assembly identified as Mr. Okechukwu Okoye and the Director of his campaign organisation, Mr. Cyril Chiegboka, were murdered by gunmen. The lawmaker's head was cut off and placed at a motor park. A 70-year-old native doctor identified as Chukwujekwu Onuora aka. Egbe Eji Aza Oku from Unubi was fingered in the killing.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Ebonyi
description: IPOB/ESN: Gunmen invaded the home of the chairman of Ikwo Local Government Area of Ebonyi State, Chief Steven Orogwu and killed his elder brother, two nephews and a security guard. The gunmen also burnt down the family house of the Orogwus.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 unknown gunmen were killed by the security operatives while they were enforcing a sit-at-home order. It was reported that the security operatives recovered a white Toyota Hiace bus from the gunmen.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Security Operatives vs Gunmen, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 6 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were killed by the JTF of the Nigeria Military and police for attempting to kill a traditional ruler.
