It was reported the hoodlums invaded the community in Hilux vans and advanced toward the palace of the ruler before they were repelled.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , The Nation (6 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: A security man was killed by gunmen who invaded a community. It was reported that properties were also destroyed during the attack.

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed and 20 others were abducted by gunmen in a community. It was reported that the gunmen stormed the community and shot sporadically, leaving the residents running for safety.
place: Kurmin Sata, a few kilometers from Millennium City
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Vanguard (1 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 soldiers were killed by gunmen in a military setup. It was reported that the military men engaged the gunmen in a gun battle deal.
place: 3-3 Estate in Nkwelle Ezunaka, near Onitsha
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Army vs IPOB/ESN, Abia
description: Soldiers of 14 Brigade Army Headquarters, Ohafia, killed gunmen belonging to the Eastern Security Network (ESN) of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). Due to the nature of the story, it was reported that 4 gunmen were decimated.
sources_of_information: The Nation (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: JTF vs Bandits, Niger
description: A Joint Security Task Force (JTF) killed 10 bandits during a foiled attack on a community. 14 kidnapped victims were rescued by the operatives.

title: Herdsmen vs Woman, Benue
description: A woman identified as Miriam Terwase was murdered by some Fulani herdsmen when she went to her farm. It was reported that the herders caught the victim and her son in the farm and butchered her.
place: Tse Aban in Tombo Council Ward

title: APC Chieftain, Bayelsa
description: Mr. Sunday Frank-Oputu, a chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC) was shot dead while asleep by unknown gunmen. He was at the forefront of the struggle to extricate his community from the firm control of some persons allegedly behind illegal oil bunkering activities.
place: Baybridge residence in the Yenizue-Gene suburb of Yenagoa

title: Bandits Kill APC Chairman, Kaduna
description: Bandits invaded a community and killed the All Progressive Congress (APC) chairman in Aribi Ward, Mr. Iliua Auta, and one other person. It was reported that the victim was killed on his farm.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: Bandits vs Soldiers, Katsina
description: 3 Nigerian soldiers were killed and others injured by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) that was planted by terrorists. It was reported that the troops were on a special operation in a community when terrorists ambushed them and one of their vehicles stepped on the explosive device.

title: Bandits Attack, FCT (Abuja)
description: A 23-year-old man identified as Nura Mai Gyada was killed during an attack by bandits in an area. It was reported that the bandits, numbering about 100, came with weapons and divided themselves into groups, moving from house to house. They shot at residents sporadically and made away with valuable items and cash, and abducted some residents during the attack.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 12 people were killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked two communities. It was reported that the bandits have been terrorizing the communities. Several people were also kidnapped.

title: ISWAP Bomb Explosion, Taraba
description: 3 people were confirmed killed following a bomb explosion that rocked a local drinking joint. It was reported that 19 others were injured in the explosion. The bomb was detonated by a teenager.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , Other newspaper 3 (3 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 2 persons were killed and 40 others injured when bandits in large numbers attacked a community. It was reported that the bandits had earlier launched an attack on other communities in the area leading to deaths and abductions of some victims.

title: Police vs Gunmen, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Men of the Anambra State Police Command foiled an attack on a Police Divisional Headquarters. One of the attackers was reportedly killed during the gun battle.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 4 policemen were shot dead by gunmen who attacked a police station. It was reported that the gunmen suspected to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) carried out the attack in the early hours of the day.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: One Alhaji Abdullahi Ardo was killed and his 15-year -old daughter identified as Mariya was abducted by some bandits. It was reported that the bandits invaded the village at night and went straight to the deceased resident.
place: Dorayi Village of Dutsen Abba Ward

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN? 2 people were killed and a Toyota Sienna bus was burnt by members of the Indigenous People of Biafra who were enforcing the Monday sit-at-home order of the group in the South East. The hoodlums opened fire at a motor park in the early hours of the day and chased traders and travelers away.

title: Bandits Kill 15, Benue
description: Marauding bandits killed 15 people in a community. It was reported that the bandits also injured one person and also destroyed several properties in their rampage. The killers were identified as Fulani herders.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Vanguard (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram./ISWAP, Borno
description: Troops of the Mutinaional Joint Task Force (MNJTF) eliminated 18 ISWAP/Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the incident happened during a clearance operation.

title: Army vs ISWAP, Borno
description: The land component of Operation Hadin Kai, with support of the air components, conducted an offensive operation and killed a prominent Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) commander, Abubakar Dan-Bubuma. Scores of terrorists were also killed during the clearance operation.
sources_of_information: The Punch (41 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Banditry, Katsina
description: A popular businessman identified as Sale Auta was killed by some terrorists who stormed a community. It was reported that the hoodlums also kidnaped the deceased's teenage daughter known as Aisha along with dozens of other residents of the community.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 4 people, including the son of the Zamfara State's Commissioner for Security, DIG Mamman Tsafe, (retd), were killed by bandits while they were breaking fast. Some people were abducted while others were injured.
sources_of_information: The Punch (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Ansaru Attack, Kaduna
description: 15 soldiers of the Nigerian Army and 3 vigilante members were killed while others when suspected members of the Ansaru engaged soldiers in a fight during a raid on a military base.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (17 ) , The Guardian (17 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Vanguard (17 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , The Nation (17 ) , This Day (18 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: 11 people were killed and properties were stolen by bandits during an attack on two communities. It was reported that they arrived on bikes and started shooting. Recent attacks and threats were reported by the residents lately.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: The air component of Operation Thunder Strike eliminated 33 bandits during a clearance operation. It was reported that the troops also recovered some guns and motorcycles.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 3 persons were killed by gunmen suspected to be armed herders who were dressed in military uniform and rode on motorbikes. The victims were already killed before the attackers were repelled.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , This Day (3 )

title: Fulani Attack, Kaduna
description: 6 people were killed, many injured, and houses were razed by suspected Fulani militias. It was reported that the militias came with sophisticated weapons while the villagers were asleep.
place: Unguwan Bulus village in Zaman Dabo community, Atyap Chiefdom

title: Bandits/Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Benue
description: Bandits connected to Late Terwase Akwaza, aka Gana, teamed up with Fulani herdsmen and killed three people.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 17 people were killed by rampaging bandits who invaded 2 villages. It was reported that the bandits, who have been terrorizing residents, destroyed several properties in the villages. Many people were injured in the attack.

title: Gunmen Attack Police Division, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: 2 policemen simply identified as Ifeanyi and Iyke were killed when armed men set the Divisional Police Headquarters ablaze by throwing Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) into the buildings.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 5 people were killed by bandits in an attack. It was also reported that some of the victims were abducted by the bandits, who also attacked another community.
place: Dogon Dawa, Layin Mahuta, and Tabanni Communities.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , This Day (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 )

title: Bandits vs Traders, Sokoto
description: 1 person was killed and 6 others injured when bandits fired gunshots at a truck conveying onions trader and their commodities. It was reported that the traders were on their way to the southern part of the country when the incident happened.

title: Police vs Bandits, Katsina
description: 3 bandits were killed by men of the Nigerian Police during a failed attack by the terrorists. It was reported that the camp of the terrorists in a different location was raided by security operatives.

title: Bandits vs Vigilante, Kaduna
description: A bandit and a vigilante member died in a gun battle when some bandits invaded a village in the night. Three ladies were also kidnapped by the attackers.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: Sule Matthew a fresh graduate from Bayero University was killed by an unknown gunman while he was traveling alongside other passengers.

title: Banditry, Kebbi
description: Rampaging bandits killed 30 people who were mainly members of the local vigilante. The incident happened when the bandits attacked a border community. Several people were abducted by the bandits.

title: Banditry, Niger
description: Two bandits were shot dead when the bandits kidnapped 2 construction workers with Salini Nigeria Limited. It was reported that the bandits were engaged in a gun duel by a combined team of police, soldiers, and local vigilante members.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: A crisis between Mbasombo and Mbaivur communities led to the killing of 2 people. The clash left several houses burnt, while thousands of residents of the communities left for safe havens.

title: Security Operatives vs Bandits, Niger
description: About 50 gunmen were shot dead by security operatives. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , Daily Trust (50 ) , Other newspaper 3 (50 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Bandits killed 7 people during an attack on some villages. The bandits, on motorcycles numbering about 50, attacked the village for four hours and prevented people from holding Jumaat prayers.
place: Uguwar Bula, Unguwar Dafillo and Ijinga villages
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 8 people were killed in attacks by Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) insurgents. The insurgents invaded two villages at the night and killed the victims. They also wounded a number of people.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of Operation Thunder Strike/While Punch killed 55 bandits. The bandits were eliminated when they came under heavy airstrikes and encountered ground forces.
place: Labi general area along the Kaduna-Birnin Gwari road

title: Political Crisis, Osun
description: Toib Mutallib was hacked to death while several others were injured by political thugs, during the congress of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Gunmen vs NSCDC Officers, Niger
description: 4 officers of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) and 6 civilians were killed by gunmen who attacked some communities. It was reported that the officers were killed when their vehicle ran into an improvised explosive device.
sources_of_information: Independent (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (10 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , Vanguard (14 )

title: Gunmen vs Security Operatives, Anambra
description: IPOB/ESN: 8 people were killed when gunmen and security operatives clashed. The killing of a prominent man from Nnewi in the area led to a clash between the gunmen and the police leading to the death of 4 policemen, 1 military man, and 3 gunmen.

title: Herdsmen attacks, Benue
description: 3 mourners were killed by some Fulani herdsmen, who also kidnapped 8 people that were later rescued by some soldiers.

title: Police vs Kidnapper, Katsina
description: The Katsina State Police Command killed a bandit during a gun duel. The bandits have been terrorizing residents.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Bandits attacks, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed and 36 others were abducted when bandits attacked a community. They also abducted some people in another community.
place: Tudun Mare, Rimau and Afogo communities.

title: Vigilante vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Members of the Kaduna State Vigilance Service (KADVS) gunned down three bandits that invaded a village. It was reported that the incident happened in the middle of the night when the bandits abducted staff of the Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria, and his two children at his house in the community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Niger
description: Suspected Boko Haram terrorists attacked a military camp and ambushed the Joint Security Task Force, killing some people.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Punch (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Vanguard (22 )

title: Gunmen vs Army, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen attacked soldiers on duty on a road, killed one of them and injured 2 others. It was reported that the soldiers were on their way to their duty post before they were attacked.

title: Police vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Operatives of the Sokoto State Police Command killed 8 bandits during a clearance operation. They also recovered several weapons from the bandits who have been terrorizing residents.

title: Security Operative vs ISWAP, Niger
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed many fighters of the Islamic State of West Africa Province (ISWAP) and dislodged the terrorist group from their location.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 63 members of the Islamic State of West Africa Province and the Boko Haram terrorists were decimated by troops of the Nigerian Army. The terrorists were killed by the air component of operation Hadin Kai.

title: Bandits Attack, Niger
description: Gunmen struck and killed many people before fleeing. Bodies of 34 persons killed in the communities were found in bushes and farms.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , The Nation (34 ) , The Punch (34 ) , Other newspaper 2 (37 )

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: Some bandits attacked a herders' settlement and shot dead one person known as Abubakar Mohammad. It was reported that one Abubakar Aliyu sustained gunshot injuries on his ribs. A version of the story stated that the bandits attacked the residence of a police officer attached to the Inspector General of Police Special Intelligence Response Team (IRT), ASP Aliyu Umar, in their large numbers.
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Taraba
description: Some bandits who were fleeing from Zamfara State killed about 40 vigilantes in a neighbouring state. It was reported that some bandits were also killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits were killed in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Wanted bandit leaders, Alhaji Auta, and Kachalla Ruga, were allegedly killed in military raids on their hideouts in a forest. Other bandits (assuming at least 5) were also killed in the attack. A source report that the bandits suffered heavy casualties (assuming at least 10 fatalities)
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , The Punch (7 ) , This Day (10 ) , Vanguard (32 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Nasarawa
description: 12 bandits were eliminated by troops of the Nigerian Army. It was reported that 26 of the criminals, including 16 migrant bandits from Niger Republic were arrested by the army

title: Police vs IPOB, Imo
description: IPOB/ESN: A member of the Indigenous People of Biafra was shot dead by operatives of the Nigerian Police. The incident happened when the police stormed the hideout of members of IPOB during a gun duel. The victim was identified as Uchenna Chukwu (34 years).

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 people were killed while 30 women were abducted by Boko Haram terrorists. The terrorists looted the properties of their victims and also destroyed several houses.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Vanguard (11 )

title: Bandits vs Policeman, Kaduna
description: Some bandits kidnapped three students of the Kaduna State University (KASU) and also killed a policeman. The policeman was shot dead during the bandits' operation.
place: Karji area private hostel, near Kaduna State University

title: Banditry, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed by bandits. Two of the victims were identified as known as Nuhu Ishaya, Yakubu Ishaya and Samiru NaYau.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Babdits Kill 3, Niger
description: 3 people were killed during an attack on a community by bandits. The Village Head of the community was also abducted by the attackers.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of the Nigerian army killed 6 bandits and recovered one GPMG, one AK-47 rifle, 1 magazine, and 34 motorcycles. Some of them escaped with gunshot wounds.
place: Komani Hills within Rukudawa general area

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: A Village Head, a 97-year-old woman, and 8 people were killed in an attack by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Also, a 16-year-old girl was among 11 Christians killed by the Muslim Fulani herdsmen.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: 7 persons were killed, 13 others injures, 20 women kidnapped, many houses set ablaze, while several animals were rustled by bandits who entered the village on motorcycles and opened fire on the residents.

title: Bandits vs Man, Plateau
description: Dakup Ntiem, a livestock keeper, was shot dead while Blessing, his expectant wife, was knocked into coma by some armed bandits. It was reported that the bandits numbering about six invaded the victims home in the midnight and carried out the attack.

title: Communal Clash, Edo
description: Crisis over the boundary land that has lingered for decades between Itsukwi and Imiakabu communities claimed 7 lives. A team of policemen on peace mission were attacked by youths. The victims were killed in a counter attack by the police.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko Haram fighters wre killed by the fighter jets of the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) during an aerial bombardment. The victims were killed in the Operation Rattle Snake against terrorist elements.
place: Parisu and Garin Maloma on the fringes of Sambisa forest

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 suicide bombers were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army who tried to infiltrate a military base. The victims were neutralised before they could detonate their suicide vests.
place: 26 Task Force Birgade Garrison location, Gwoza

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 suspected Boko Haram logistic suppliers were killed by soldiers on special operation. Several weapons were recovered from the victims. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 35 Boko Haram fighters were killed by the Nigerian Air Force during air bombardment targeted at wiping out terrorists. Members of Islamic State West African Province were also killed in the bombardment.
place: Bukar Meram area by Lake Chad

title: Bandits, Kaduna
description: Two bandits specialized in kidnapping were killed while others escaped with gunshot wounds after a gun duel with Troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army.
place: Around Olam Farm and Dutse, Kaduna-Abuja expressway

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: 2 persons, including a policeman, were shot dead by unknown gunmen. One of the victims was identified as a truck driver of Dangote Cement, who was conveying cement to another location.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: About 30 armed bandits shot at NAF’s aircraft. In retaliation, the Air Component of Operation HADARIN DAJI killed about 20 of the attackers.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , The Punch (20 ) , The Nation (20 )

title: Bandits vs Communities, Zamfara
description: 18 persons were killed by bandits who invaded some communities. It was reported that the bandit struck in the early hours of the day while the residents of the communities were still sleeping.
sources_of_information: This Day (18 ) , The Nation (18 ) , Daily Trust (18 )

title: Police Vs Bandits, Katsina
description: Two bandits were killed by men of the Operation Puff Adder after a tip off. The victims were killed in a gun duel.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many persons were killed when Boko Haram terrorists fired rocket propelled grenade into a crowd in an IDP camp. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 persons lost their lives.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The victims, a man, his son and one other person, were rounded up and killed while busy with their farm work.

title: Bandits vs Vigilantes, Katsina
description: 30 local vigilantes were killed in an ambushed by bandits. The victims had mobilized to disperse bandits who blocked a major route in the area but were ambushed. The bandits also attacked and killed 8 passengers including children. Some of them had their eyes plucked out by the attackers.

title: Fulani Gunmen, Edo
description: Fulani gunmen killed a retired personnel of the Nigerian Air Force, Olufemi Tewobola, Pastor Meliorate Eboh and a truck driver. The victims were abducted while on transit and forced into a nearby bush where they killed the policeman upon his identification.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 4 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked some communities. It was reported that the attackers also razed several houses.

title: Bandits Attack, Kaduna
description: Suspected armed bandits killed 5 people. It was reported that the assailants attacked the residents indiscriminately killing and maiming their victims.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: 16 persons were killed by bandits who attacked some communities. It was reported that the incident happened in the night.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (16 ) , The Punch (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , Daily Trust (16 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 soldiers and many insurgents (assuming 10) lost their lives when some Boko Haram elements engaged troops of the Nigerian Army in a gun battle. Several other persons were injured.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram terrorists were decimated when the Air Task Force of Operation Lafiya Dole bombed their hideout which was used as a platform to attack residents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Troops of the 27 Task Force Brigade and Nigeria Army Special Forces School killed several Boko Haram insurgents who attacked the military base. Several other terrorists sustained bullet wounds.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead by troops of the 112-Task Force Battalion conducting clearance operation.
place: Zaza, Kajeri Maye and Kajeri Mai Burem villages

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: NAF destroyed some gun trucks belonging to the Islamic State of West Africa province (SWAP) faction of Boko Haram. About 50 of its members were also killed in the air raid.

title: Driver Kills 2 Bandits, Zamfara
description: A commercial vehicle driver killled 2 Bandits. It was reported that the driver ran into the two bandits while they were attempting to cross the road with their rifles on their shoulders and killing them instantly.
place: Gidan Jaja/Gurbin Bore Road of Zurmi local Government Area

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorist were engaged in a gun battle by soldiers. 5 Boko Haram terrorist were killed in the process.

title: Army vs Bandits,Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division, Nigerian Army under Operation Whirl Punch killed several bandits and kidnappers during a clearance operation in a forest. The troops destroyed the camps of the bandits and kidnappers. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 bandits and kidnappers were killed.

title: Political Crisis, Lagos
description: Over 50 injured and 2 people, Rilwan Musa (a.k.a. Apata) and AbdulQuadri Adebayo (a.k.a. Uche), were killed when hoodlums working for a party leader opened fire during collation of results of House of Assembly primary organised by All Progressives Congress (APC).

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a joint operation by Nigerian and Cameroonian troops. Assorted weapons and other items were recovered.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A soldier was killed by Boko Haram terrorists when the insurgents ambushed two commuter buses and abducted about seven female passengers.14 of the attackers were traced to their hideout and killed by soldiers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the 81-Division Task Force Battalion under the Operation Lafiya Dole. The event happened during a clearance operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed during attacks on 2 communities by Fulani herdsmenThis event is linked to IBD014650.

title: Masquerades' Attack, Taraba
description: 11 persons lost their lives during a communal crisis which happened after masquerades attacked some youths. The situation resulted in a reprisal where some persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that one of the victims was killed by soldier when the youths were protesting.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen killed one person and rustled 9 cows belonging to the Anglican Archbishop of Jos, Bishop Benjamin Kwashi. The victim was identified as one Adamu Dung (46 years).

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army killed five Boko Haram terrorists during a clearance operation targeted at the insurgents. The terrorists were killed. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 2 days.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: A farmer identified as Aondovihi Tuur was killed by Fulani herdsmen while another victim identified as Virlumun Atsaga was missing.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 travellers on a motorbike were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen while two other persons suffered serious injuries. The incident happened when the victims were returning from their farms.
place: Close to Mbazar community between Anyiin and Akwana communities.

title: Security Operatives vs IPOB/MASSOB, Anambra
description: A member of the Pro-Biafra group was shot dead during a clash between the group and a combined team of army and police. The incident happened as pro-Biafra groups marked Biafra Heroes Remembrance Day.
place: St. Mary's Anglican Church Junction, Nnewi

title: Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 31 persons were killed while over 50 people still missing in a protracted communal crisis between indigenes of Bassa and Egbura. It was believed that Egbura people were behind the ongoing killings as well as destruction of farms and houses in parts of the state.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 5 person died in a Boko Haram suicide bombing. It was reported that the incident happened when a male Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device strapped to his body, killing himsef and 4 civilian Joint Task Force operatives.

title: Bandits Kill 5, Kebbi
description: A community was attacked by bandits and 5 people were killed. The attack forced villagers to seek refuge in neighbouring villages.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked some communities. The attack caused pandemonium among residents of the state capital.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 25 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. It was reported that the attackers were over 200 in number and took the villagers by surprise..
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (25 ) , The Nation (32 ) , Other newpapers 1 (51 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits were shot dead by soldiers on patrol and 2 soldiers wounded. Various arms and ammunition were recovered from the bandits.

title: Army vs Vigilante, Edo
description: Extra Judicial Killing: A vigilante, Efe Igbinovia, was shot dead by soldiers while he was guarding some Fulani herdsmen who were captured while robbing on the road. It was reported that the soldiers stormed where Efe was with the herdsmen and shot him dead.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram insurgents were killed when they were ambushed by troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole. It was reported several of the terrorists were dislodged.

title: Army Kill Robber, Akwa Ibom
description: A robber was shot dead by soldiers during a gun duel. The bandits had robbed some victims but were intercepted by the soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 4 people died when a male Boko Haram suicide bomber attacked a community. The gender of the attackers however remain controversial as another report had it that the attack was perpetrated by 2 female suicide bombers who killed 8 persons including the attackers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 soldiers were killed during an ambush by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the terrorists killed the soldiers by planting Improvised Explosive Device (IEDs) on the road.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of Nigerian Army killed 3 Boko Haram insurgents when a group of terrorists attempted to attack a community. The troops recovered three AK 47 rifles from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed by troops of 28 Task Force Brigade in conjunction with civilian vigilante. It was reported that bombers were killed when they refused to halt their movement.

title: Boko Haram Beheads 6, Borno
description: 6 farmers were abducted and beheaded by Boko Haram insurgents. The victims were abducted while working in a plantation.

title: Undergraduate vs Mother, Osun
description: Domestic Violence: Joseph Mark, a 25-year-old undergraduate of Adekunle Ajasin University, Ondo, beheaded his mother. It was reported that the boy cut off the mother's head with cutlass.
place: 25 Zone 5, Ajetomobi Street, Eko-Ende Road, Ikirun

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 soldiers, who were providing escort to some travellers, were killed while 6 other were severely wounded when Boko Haram insurgents attacked them. It was reported that the vehicles conveying the victims were hit by Improvised Explosive Device (IED).

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Oyo
description: A 27-year-old man identified as Samson Olaosepin was murdered by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victim was killed while he was working in his farm. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Plateau
description: 2 people, Susan Daniel, a 16-year-old student and Joel Choji, were killed during a raid on a community by Fulani herdsmen. 2 other persons were wounded in the attack. This raid came few days after several persons were killed in different parts of the state by herdsmen.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 5 Brigade Garrison of Operation Lafiya Dole killed 2 Boko Haram terrorists who were riding on horses. It was reported that the insurgents were killed while fleeing from their hideout in a forest.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram insurgent was killed when they clashed with soldiers and vigilantes. Arms and ammunition were recovered from them.

title: Terror Group (ISIS) vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 30 soldiers were ambushed and killed by Islamic State (ISIS). The Nigerian Army however denied such a mass killing and labelled it a propaganda. It is assumed the incident happened in Sambisa where major terror attacks have been carried out.

title: Armed Robbery Attack, Kaduna
description: 4 persons, including an army officer and an infant, were killed by armed robbers along a highway. It was reported that the incident happened in the morning when the victims were travelling and ran into 20 armed bandits.

title: Soldiers vs IPOB, Abia
description: Political Violence: 8 persons were feared dead and scores wounded, when supporters of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) clashed with and soldiers.

title: Fulani Versus Farmers, Benue
description: Clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen, led to the death of 3 people. The crisis was triggered when cows strayed into people’s farms and destroyed their crops. Among those people killed were 2 young men from the village and a Fulani man.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A soldier and several Boko Haram fighters were killed in battles between the insurgents and the Nigerian Army in 2 separate battles.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram terrorists were killed when the insurgents attempted to capture a community. It was reported that the troops of Nigerian Army repelled the invasion, killing most of the terrorists. According to one of the sources, 18 people including 2 Boko Haram terrorists, 1 suicide bomber and 15 other persons died in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (18 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Daily Trust (18 ) , The Guardian (23 )

title: Boko Haram Attack Barrack, Borno
description: A military formation was attacked by dozens of Boko haram insurgents and 8 soldiers were killed. The barrack was burnt down and arms and ammunitions looted.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 farmers were killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided a farming community. Among the victims are 2 men.

title: Gunmen vs Vice Principal, Cross River
description: The Vice Principal of Victor Secondary Commercial School, Chief Offiong Asuquo Nyong, was shot dead in his house by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victim was shot on the head by masked gunmen.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Kogi
description: 2 policemen on duty, a detainee in police custody and a community leader were killed by unknown gunmen who invaded a police station. The community leader was identified as Mallam Sadiq Obomi.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Military vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Nigerian army and 30 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a bloody clash between the army and the terrorists. It was reported that 19 soldiers were wounded.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Delta
description: 6 members of a community were by killed by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders have been maiming, kidnapping and killing members of the community. 2 policemen were also killed in the attack. The corpse of one of them was found after 12 days.

title: Gunmen vs NULGE Chair, Bayelsa
description: Unknown gunmen attacked and killed Mr Igali Erepade, the Chairman of National Union of Local Government Employee (NULGE) in of the Southern Ijaw LGA in Bayelsa State. The victim was rushed to the Federal Medical Centre in the state capital but he did not survive the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A man, Maunta Pogu, was killed by Boko haram insurgents during an attack on Chibok community where more than 200 school girls were kidnapped. A 5-year-old boy was abducted during the raid. Another source reported that the victim was an Islamic scholar.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber was shot dead by security operatives during a failed suicide attempt. Her accomplice was captured alive and confessed they were given N200 by Boko haram leaders to detonate the explosives.

title: Gunmen vs Police, Ondo
description: Michael Olujimi, a police corporal attached to the Okitipupa Police Division in Ondo state, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The policeman was killed while he was on the way to resume duty for the day.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Edo
description: Unknown gunmen shot dead the mother-in-law of the Principal Secretary to the Delta State Governor, Mr Hilary Ibegbulem, and her orderly. It was reported that the victims were heading to the airport in a Sports Utility Vehicle (SUV) when the incident happened.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Police, Delta
description: A policeman was killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen, who dressed in police uniform, and policemen. It was reported that the clash was the second between the police and the herders in two weeks.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 2 people were killed by Boko Haram terrorists during an invasion on a community. The terrorists had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: 9 persons were killed during a communal clash between Azuofida-Edda community and Ogurude community. The crisis was caused by boundary dispute between both communities.

title: Political Violence, Jigawa
description: 1 person was killed while several others sustained injuries when crisis broke out during a meeting of the All Progressives Congress (APC). It was a meeting of the party candidates for their council polls.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 1 person was killed and many others were injured when Fulani herdsmen invaded 3 villages. The attackers torched several houses leading to loss of over 100 houses.
place: Tse Kyanyion, Tse Azakpa and Tse Orbiam Settlements

title: Man vs Police, Ekiti
description: A 36-year-old man, Abdulsalam Adinoyi, murdered a police sergeant, Gana Jiyaa. It was reported that the killer was a member of Boko Haram terrorist group.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 soldiers lost their lives while 41 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a battle between the army and the terrorists. The event happened during a clearance operation aimed at wiping out terrorists.

title: Farmers vs. Herdsmen, Adamawa
description: 3 people were killed in a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. The farmers were fishing in a pond when they were attacked by the herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide killed himself and a member of the Civilian Joint Task Force. It was reported that the suicide bomber attempted to enter a housing estate.

title: Cult Clash, Akwa Ibom
description: A youth was killed in relation to youth leadership crisis.Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 1 weeks. This event is linked to IBD IBD010454

title: Cult Clash, Akwa Ibom
description: A youth was killed in relation to youth leadership crisis.Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 1 weeks. This event is linked to IBD IBD010455

title: Boko Haram vs Motorists, Borno
description: Scores of persons were killed when Boko Haram terrorists ambushed motorists. Several persons were injured in the attack which took motorists by surprise.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 soldiers were killed during an invasion of a military camp of 'Operation Lafiya Dole' by Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that the insurgents also carted away arms and ammunition. The date of the incident was not stated but it assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Bandits Kill 1, Zamfara
description: A hunter, Idi Isa, was killed when gunmen invaded a community. The gunmen who rode on motorcycles short sporadically in the air before the victim was hit.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 persons, including the bombers, lost their lives when three Boko Suicide bombers detonated bombs strapped to their bodies. Another of the suicide bomber wanted to enter a military checkpoint but was gunned down by the army.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Some Fulani herdsmen attacked a town where they killed Mrs Veronica Ogwuche, a mother of 6 children and destroyed houses and farm produce worth several millions of naira. One Mr John Alexander was severely injured.

title: Gunmen Versus Policeman, Plateau
description: A Policeman was killed and 7 rifles carted away when gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked a divisional police station.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 villagers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a village. The terrorists also abducted several women and children. They stole foodstuffs from the villagers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Police vs Robbers, Ogun
description: A group of armed robbers attacked and robbed commuters along the busy Lagos-Ibadan expressway. One of the robbers confirmed to be one of the many Fulani bandits who perpetrated the crime was shot dead during an exchange of gunfire with the police.

title: Gunmen vs Community, Kaduna
description: 1 person was killed while 5 others were injured when unknown gunmen attacked a Fulani settlement. It was reported that the incident happened in the night.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Plateau
description: A Fulani man was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen have been moving around maiming and killing people. The victim was killed at night.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Students, Kaduna
description: 5 students of the College of Education, Gidan Waya, were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who waylaid their car. The incident happened when the victims were going to school in a commercial car.

title: Security Agents vs IPOB, Rivers
description: 11 persons were killed and scores of supporters of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were wounded during a rally termed Trump Solidarity Rally. The victims were shot dead by security agents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Kaduna
description: 3 males were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who rode on motorcycles. The area has been under attack for several months.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko haram insurgents were shot dead by soldiers during a foiled attack on an IDP camp. The insurgents had attempted to attack the camp where the Nigerian Airforce mistakenly bombed and killed scores of IDPs last week.

title: Gunmen vs Community Leader, Lagos
description: The Chairman of the Harmony Community Development Association, Malam Ibrahim Omatar and a Togolese identified as Job were killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen abducted a caterer identified as Uloma. The date of the incident was not stated but it assumed that it happened two days before it was reported.
place: Fagbile Phase 3 Estate, White Sand, Ijegun area

title: Army Bombs IDP Camp, Borno
description: While fighting Boko Haram, an Airforce fighter jet mistakenly bombed an Internally Displaced Persons Camp. The victims included 2 soldiers and 6 Red Cross officials. Many were also injured in the attack. The council chairman of Kala Balge LGA first told that the community buried 234 people. The army then forced him to backtrack because the total casualty figure recorded by the Theatre Command stood at 112 dead, while 97 were injured and received treatment in various hospitals within the state.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (55 ) , Vanguard (101 ) , Daily Trust (53 ) , The Nation (236 ) , The Punch (236 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (112 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: Prof. Aliyu Usman Mani of the Department of Veterinary Medicine, University of Maiduguri and 6 other persons were killed when a 7-year-old suicide bomber detonated a bomb in a Mosque, where he was praying. Some of those who died were killed by a second suicide bomber within the university while another suicide bomber also detonated a bomb in the university environment.

title: Armed Robbers vs Motorcyclist, Oyo
description: A motorcycle rider was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the victim was trailed by armed robbers on two motorcycles before he was shot on the head by them.

title: Police vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 4 armed bandits were killed and 1 sustained injury when they engaged men of the Kaduna state police command in a gun battle. The event was part of effort by the police to rid the state of bandits.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 11 villagers when they attacked some communities. It was reported that the herders shot dead some farmers who included Oluwatobi, Ayo Opeifa and others. Several person were severely injured.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation. The victims were killed in 2 different locations.

title: Hunters vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 7 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by a group of hunters who doubled as vigilante officials. It was reported that the hunters also seized a machine gun from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram vs Boy, Borno
description: Baa Goni Maina, a 10-year-old boy, was kidnapped and killed by 18-year-old Adam Bakura and his brother, Modu Bakura. The killers were members of Boko haram terrorist group. They killed the boy because he identified them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The bodies of some Boko Haram insurgents who escaped with gunshot wounds during a fight with the army were found in shallow graves. The terrorists died from the injuries sustained during the gun battle and were buried in the graves.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An Improvised Explosive Device, planted by Boko Haram terrorists, went off and killed an army captain, a lieutenant and injuring a few soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers killed 15 persons when they detonated bombs strapped on their bodies in a crowded market. It was reported that one of the bombers had a baby on her back.
sources_of_information: The Nation (15 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Niger
description: 9 people including Joshua Sarumi, a police Inspector and Mommoh Musa, an Assistant Superintendent of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps were killed when Fulani herdsmen who carried out a reprisal attack in the community.
place: Sabon Ndaga, Rafin Gona and BCC Gbagyi community
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Punch (9 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The insurgents were raided by the army during a clearance operation aimed at clearing out terrorists from the region.
place: Awada and Sinbaya, Anaduwa, Talwari, Agulari, Kirinari, Gubdori and Yale

title: Gunmen Kill University Student, Ondo
description: A 300-Level student of Adekunle Ajasin University Akungba (AAU), Yemi Akinbamiwa was shot dead by gunmen. He was carrying a huge sum of money when they attacked him.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 8 people including 5 Boko haram suicide bombers (3 males and 2 females), a civilian vigilante member popularly called 'Civilian JTF' died in multiple suicide explosions. The attacks were carried out in Muna Garage where similar attacks were ealier carried out by the terror group.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 army officer and 6 soldiers were killed during a fight between the army and Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that 8 other persons were injured during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 54 people including an army officer, 3 soldiers and 50 Boko haram insurgents died during a shootout with soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 5 soldiers including a Captain, a medical doctor, Victor Ulasi and several Boko haram insurgents (assuming 10) were killed during an attack on a military formation. The attack was carried out by fleeing insurgents. A source reported that scores (at least 2 scores) of the insurgents were killed by security operatives.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A senior officer and 3 others soldiers were killed when Boko haram terrorists attacked a military location. The attackers were trailed to a village where one of them was found dead, probably from gunshot injuries.

title: Assailants vs Herders, Anambra
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen were butchered by unknown persons in a community. It was reported that the incident happened while the herders were grazing their cattle in the community.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: A 19-year-old Senior Secondary school student was shot dead by cattle rustlers when he came out to ease himself. About 212 cattle were stolen by rustlers.

title: Bandits, Katsina
description: 4 people were attacked and killed by bandits while travelling late evening from Katsina to an undisclosed destination.
place: Kankara-Dutsinma road, near the new site of the Federal University (FUDMA), Dutsinma

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 1, Delta
description: A motorist died on his way to the hospital after he was shot by some cattle rustlers who blocked the road with their cattle.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: A renewed attack between Idoma farmers and Fulani herdsmen has led to the death of 5 farmers. The herdsmen brought their cows to freely grace on farmlands, triggering the crisis.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Bayelsa
description: Unknown gunmen have killed 2 people when they attacked a popular market in the state capital. The gunmen attacked one Raymond Agada and killed 2 person before carting away a sum of N120,000 from one of the victims.

title: Boko Haram Beheads 15, Borno
description: 15 grasshopper hunters were beheaded in the bush by Boko haram insurgents. The victims were combing the bush for grasshoppers before they were rounded up and slaughtered. The incident was said to have happened 1 week ago.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A 10-year-old girl, who is a Boko Haram suicide bomber, blew up herself and died before she could get to her target.

title: Lady vs Kidnappers, Kogi
description: A 20-year-old lady was kidnapped and killed by unknown gunmen. The lady had been kidnaped for weeks before her corpse was discorvered last saturday. Her case was reported with the abduction of a royal father, Alhaji Musa Isah Achuja.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A battle between the Army and the Boko Haram insurgents led to the death of 15 members of the sect. 5 soldiers were injured in the attack. This attack happened few days after the Army conquered the Sambisa forest, the stronghold of the Boko Haram terrorists. The shootout was said to have lasted 3 hours.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, FCT (Abuja)
description: One Ndubisi Uzoma was beheaded a some Fulani herdsmen, who made away with the victim's head. The incident is backdated by 1 week.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko haram suicide bomber attacked a market but was killed in the process. She was apprehended and lynched by an angry mob before she could release the explosive.

title: Herdsmen vs Motorcyclist, Delta
description: An Okada man was shot dead by a gang of Fulani herdsmen. The deceased, Mr Rufus Eroomi was butchered and his body parts scattered during the attack. This event was reported with the killing of a farmer on his farm by herdsmen in the same LGA (IBD010169).

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill Herdsman, Delta
description: A herdsman, Haruna Mohammed was killed by cattle rustlers in a bush. He was killed while fleeing from the attackers. The perpetrators also killed 2 cows belonging to the herdsman.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Delta
description: A herdsman was killed by a gang of cattle rustlers. 2 cows were stolen from the herd of the victim. The incident has heightened apprehension between the herdsmen and the residents of the area. The corpse of the deceased was thrown into the river.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers blew up themselves during a stop and search operation by the army. It was reported that one of the bombers detonated the bombs on her when they were stopped for routine checks, killing her self and her accomplice.

title: Gunmen vs Trader, Cross River
description: A trader, Mr Chinaka Michael was killed by unknown gunmen. The victim was rushed to the hospital but later died. This incident is reported with event IBD010096 where one Francis Akanihu was killed 3 weeks ago.

title: Boko Haram vs Spokesman, Borno
description: Tasiu also known as Abu Zinnira, the spokesman for Boko Haram terrorists, was executed by the leader of the sect, Abubakar Shekau. It was reported that Shekau killed Tasiu for plotting to oust him as the leader of the sect in connivance with another senior commander identified as Baba Ammar.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmer, Ogun
description: Pa Moses Atanda Omifenwa, a farmer and father of a journalist, was killed by Fulani Herdsmen. The 76-year-old victim was killed inside his farm settlement around midday.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: 4 people were killed by cattle rustlers during a raid on a village. About 700 cows and unspecified number of goats and sheep were rustled. The LGA has come under several attacks in the past one month by the same group.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A Lieutenant Colonel, Otosbrise Umusu was killed along with his security aide while returning to their base in Baga. The victim, who commanded the 118 Task Force Battalion, Operation Lafiya Dole and his aide were killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted by the insurgents .
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 ) , Other newspaper 2 (2 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers and another person were killed while 18 others were injured in twin bomb attacks by the sucide bombers. The bombers detonated the bombs one after the other.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female suicide bombers of a school age bombed a crowded market and killed 57 people. Both of them also died in the attacks, which were carried out simultaneously.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: 2 men, Mr. Felix Abrere and Mr. Ezeze Udummedjeno were killed during a clash between Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe communities over a piece of land. Both communities have been engulfed in land crisis over the years and several people have been killed in such crises.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Niger
description: 5 persons were killed when about 30 Fulani herdsmen who doubled as armed bandits stormed a community in a commando manner. It was reported that the invaders stormed the village in the midnight.

title: Assailants vs Business Man, Cross River
description: A dealer in cocoa and chemicals, Mr. Francis Akanihu, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the assassins gained entry into the man's house and shot him on the neck.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Operation Lafia Dole recorded another success with the cleance of insurgents in their camps and rescuing some 810 civilians in the Sambisa forest. Over 2 scores (at least 40) of the sect members were killed and 26 arrested during the operation. Another source reported that 54 insurgents were killed. A soldier was lost in the operation. About 108 civilians were rescued in the operations in the past 1 weeks.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , The Guardian (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (54 )

title: Gunmen Kills, Cross River
description: A man, Francis Akanihu was killed by suspected gunmen about 3 weeks ago. There have been cases of gunmen attacks in the state lately. This event is reported with incident IBD010094.

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko haram insurgents were killed by vigilantes during a shootout. The vigilantes were on a patrol when they stepped on IEDs that exploded and killed 2 of their members before attacking them. Another source reported scores (assuming at least 2 scores )of insurgents were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Aide, Anambra
description: One Mr. Chinenye Ikedimma, an aide to business mogul Prince Arthur Eze, was shot dead by unknown gunmen numbering about six. It was reported that the gunmen invaded a community in the night and also shot some other persons.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko haram insurgents were shot dead by soldiers during a failed ambush attack. The insurgents had laid ambush on the troops but were repelled.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 4 persons were killed while several houses including the house of the village head were burnt when unknown gunmen attacked a village. It was reported that the hoodlums launched an attack on the residents in the middle of the night.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 persons, including a male suicide bomber, were killed when the bomber detonated a bomb at a garage. It was reported that the 2 persons died while a Mercedes Benz marked AX 571 ABJ was damaged.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female and a male suicide bombers were killed and 3 civilians injured when the suicide bombers attempted to sneak into the village.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suicide bomber who attempted to penetrate an Internally Displaced Persons' camp was shot dead by soldiers. The insurgents have scaled up attacks on soft targets since this year.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko haram insurgents were shot dead by soldiers. The victims were killed in a camp/market operated by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 6 persons, including the bombers, were killed by Boko Haram suicide bombers who detonated bombs strapped on their bodies in 3 locations in a local government. The explosives also injured several other persons.
place: Muna garage; Near a Mobile Police Location in Jiddari; Maiduguri-Gamboru road

title: Political Violence, Kano
description: 1 person was killed and another severely injured during a clash between supporters of Governor Abdullahi Ganduje and his predecessor, Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso. It was reported that the crisis erupted at one of the secretariats of the All Progressive Congress (APC) in the state.

title: Airforce vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Fighter jets bombed different Boko haram locations and killed scores (assuming at least 2 scores: 40). In one of the locations, the insurgents were in a meeting when they were sighted and bombed.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Lt. Col. B.U.Umar, the commanding officer of 114 TF battalion in Borno state was killed in an ambush by Boko haram. Another victim in the attack, Lieutenant Muktar, died in the hospital where he was rushed for treatment. The Colonels' death came barely two weeks after Colonel Abu Ali was killed by the same group.

title: Rustlers vs Village, Niger
description: 6 persons were killed in an attack by about 50 armed cattle rustlers who stormed a community. It was reported that the criminals killed 4 Fulani natives and 2 Gbagyi indigenes. Several women and children were injured, while the rustlers stole about 700 cows.

title: Communal Crisis, Ebonyi
description: 3 people were killed during a clash between the people of Onweonweiya and Mkpumaekweoku communities. The clash was caused by a disagreement over parcel of farmland. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 person were killed while dozens were abducted when a group of Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village. The insurgents, who rode on motor bikes and camels, wrecked havoc on the village.

title: Herdsmen vs Villages, Kaduna
description: 31 villagers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded some villages. It was reported that the herders attacked and killed the villagers because they did not allow them to graze their cattle in their farms. Many other villagers were severely injured. Haruna, a Fulani herdsman, is behind the attack on 4 communities in Chawai
place: Kitakum, Ungwan Romi, Ungwan Magaji, Kigam
sources_of_information: This Day (31 ) , Vanguard (43 ) , Other newpapers 1 (45 ) , The Punch (38 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, FCT (Abuja)
description: 3 persons, including a 28-year-old man known as Zakariyya Nuhu, were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded some villages. It was reported that the gunmen also wounded several persons.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 female Boko haram suicide bombers died after they were shot by soldiers. The IEDs strapped on their backs exploded on them after they were shot. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Umarari village, along Damboa road on outskirts of Maiduguri metropolis

title: Gunmen vs Miners, Zamfara
description: 50 miners were killed by gunmen who doubled as cattle rustlers at a mining site. It was reported that about 70 gunmen rode into a mining site in the afternoon, killing some miners and injuring others.
place: Gidan Ardo village of Bindin District
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Punch (36 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A soldier was killed, 3 others were wounded. About 13 Boko Haram terrorists were also killed. The incident happened when the insurgents attacked the troops location in a village.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers of 152 TF Battalion were killed while 8 others got injured in a bomb explosion.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female suicide bombers blew themselves up in football viewing centre and cinema hall, killing themselves and 3 other persons. It was reported that 6 persons were injured in the blast.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed during an encounter between troops of the Nigerian Army and some insurgents. It was reported that the insurgents laid ambush for the soldiers. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko haram insurgents including 3 suicide bombers were killed by soldiers during an attempt in infiltrate a military location. Among the victims is a female;e suicide bomber. Another report had it that 5 of the victims are insurgents and 1 a soldier.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 21 people including an Army Colonel (Muhammed Abu Ali), 6 other soldiers (Staff Sgt. Muazu Ibrahim, Sgt Husseini Jafaru, Sgt Okon Bassey, Cpl Chukwu Simon, Pte Salisu Lawal, Able Seaman Patrick Paul) and 14 Boko haram insurgents died in an attack on a military location by the sect.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko haram members were shot dead in a shootout with soldiers. The insurgents were reported to have been on their way to rob some communities of food, animals and other items.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army at a checkpoint. It was reported that the terrorists were shot dead by the soldiers when they refused to be searched and attempted to force their explosive-laden vehicle through a checkpoint.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead during a clearance operations of terrorist elements by troops of Nigerian Army. It was reported that 19 women and 19 children were rescued during the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Adamawa
description: 2 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. It was reported that the rampaging herders unleashed mayhem on the people of the village and killed the 2 victims.

title: Rustlers vs Villagers, Niger
description: 9 persons died when a band of cattle rustlers attacked a village. It was reported that about 30 cattle rustlers invaded a village, maiming and killing villagers. They went away with several cows.
place: Gbada community, Kaure, Kurebe and Kwaki Chukuba wards

title: Boko Haram attack, Borno
description: The clash between some members of the Boko Haram insurgents and the Nigerian Army troops led to the death over 30 people including 8 soldiers and 6 vigilantes. Other papers reported that 5 soldiers and 4 vigilantes were killed. Different locations (Ugundiri village, Talala and Ajigin) were also reported as places of the event.
place: Golgiri, Ugundiri village, Talala and Ajigin

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male Boko haram suicide bomber was intercepted and shot dead by a sniper. The victim was killed when he attempted to sneak into an IDP camp.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Policeman, Plateau
description: Sergeant Cletus Suwe Gompil, a mobile policeman was brutally murdered in the presence of wife and children by some Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victim was shot dead by his killers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 10 people died in a twin suicide bomb blasts by members of the Boko haram sect . In one of the incidents, a female suicide bomber and the driver of the tricycle followed a fuel -laden tanker with the aim of causing massive destruction but was blocked by a vehicle, causing the explosives to go off on her. Another bomb also went off at the entrance of an IDP camp.

title: Gunmen Kill Group's Leader, Kogi
description: The chairman of Miyetti-Allah Association, a herders association, Alhaji Ibrahim Abubakar was killed by gunmen. The victims family claimed he was killed by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Kinsman, Ogun
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen murdered their fellow herder identified as Garuba Mohammed. Abdulahi Anaruwa and Mohammed Suleiman lured the victim into a nearby bush and cut him with a machete.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed the village head of Misisi known as John Zogo (85 years) and 6 other persons when they attacked a district. The names of other victims were given as Yakubu Abuja (80 years); Adamu Bulus (30 years); Majhe Audu (50 years); Karu Amos (42 years); Confidence Kibadu (29 years) and Kurma Amos (44 years).

title: Violence in School, Oyo
description: The violence in Oyo state secondary school led to the dead of one person. The deceased wore mufti to the school premises during the crisis. He was sent by his parents to pick his sibling, who was trapped in the crossfire.

title: Communal Crisis, Cross River
description: A clash between 2 youth groups led to the death of 7 victims. The crisis is attributed to 2 men (Raphael Okpa Ita and Chief Ntufam Bassy Ndifon Ejen, JP) who clashed over the headship of the village head of the New Netin. Another source said the crisis is connected to land.

title: Hunters vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: A midnight attack by Boko haram members was foiled by hunters; 7 members of the insurgents were killed. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Several soldiers drowned in a river while fleeing Boko Haram attack. The victims were manning a military outpost when 100s of insurgents attacked them from different directions. Though the number of the drown soldiers was not reported, it is assumed about 10 of them died in the encounter.

title: 2 in Herdsmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 2 members of the village Sunday Garba, 23years-old, Inua Gaube, 27years-old and carted away about 100 cows.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: At least 10 Nigerian soldiers were killed when Boko Haram terrorists stormed a joint position of the armies of Nigeria and Niger Republic. It was reported that about 83 soldiers were missing. 3 months after, the corpses of 16 soldiers including Lt. Col.K. Yusuf were recovered in a river bank.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: A male suicide bomber suspected to be a Boko haram insurgent was intercepted and shot dead by soldiers. He was killed when he failed to stop on order.

title: Tailor vs Gunmen, Lagos
description: A fashion designer, Segun Sowemimo was shot dead in his shop by unknown gunmen. The assailants disguised as customers when they hacked him to death. The attackers also killed a mechanic who worked on their motorcycle.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: Followers of Shakau attacked a village and seized some vehicles belonging to the Abu Musab al Barnawi faction of Boko Haram. In a reprisal, 75 folowers of Shekau including one of their leaders, Muhammad Bakr, were killed by Barnawi's fighters. No day in October, 2016 was reported for the incdent but it is assumed it occured on the 15th of that same month.
place: Karino, Tunubuma in the Lake Chad region.

title: Army vs Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were neutralised by troops of the Nigerian Army when they attempted to detonate the bomb they strapped to their bodies. It was reported that the 3rd suicide bomber escaped into a bush.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 8 people died when Boko female suicide bombers detonated explosives close to a checkpoint at a motor park. The victims included 4 female passengers and a driver.

title: Airforce vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram locations were bombed by Nigerian Air Force (NAF) and scores (at least 2 scores) were reported to have been killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a village. 3 of the insurgents that attacked the village were also killed by members of the Civilian Joint Task Force who mobilised against the insurgents.

title: Armed Robbers vs Woman, Abia
description: Mrs. Anthonia, a 65-year-old woman, was shot dead by a gang of armed robbers. The bandits raped the victim and other ladies after they waylaid their boarded commercial bus. The criminals led by Samuel Okorie also stole from the victims.

title: Army vs Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male Boko Haram suicide bomber was shot dead by the troops of the Nigerian Army when the victim attempted to penetrate troops location. It was reported that the bomber was strapped with a heavy Improvised Explosive Device (IED) and was shot dead when he refused to stop.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female Boko haram suicide bombers were shot dead when they attempted to attack a military location. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Cultist vs Policemen, Rivers
description: 2 policemen of Anti-Terrorism Unit were killed by a gang of cultists. The officers were killed when they were deployed to prevent an attack on the community. This event was reported with event IBD009630 where 1 policeman was killed in the same area.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army with the assistance of the Civilian Joint Task Force (JTT). It was reported that the encounter between the security operatives and the insurgent lasted for more than an hour. The date of the incident was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 persons were killed in a Boko Haram attacks in 2 communities. It was reported that the insurgents invaded the communities on motorcycles and bicycles in the afternoon.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 soldiers were killed when they ran into an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) and ambush by Boko Haram militants. It was also reported that 3 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in the attack by the soldiers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmer, Benue
description: A farmer identified as Ejembi Amali was killed by some Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the victim was murdered at his farm by the herders after a misunderstanding broke out between them and some farmers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 22 Boko Haram insurgents and 4 soldiers were killed during a clash between the terrorists and troops of Nigerian Army. It was reported that the troops repelled the insurgents who attacked them in their location.
place: Logomani along the Dikwa-Gamboru Ngala road

title: Herdsmen vs Villagers, Kaduna
description: 3 persons were killed Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village and torched houses. It was reported that the herders also injured 6 persons in the attack which was as a result of grazing reserves. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 worshippers were killed by rampaging Boko Haram insurgents. It was reported that the victims were worshipping in a church when the terrorists, who rode on bicycles to the village, struck.

title: Herdsmen vs Vigilante, Kaduna
description: 4 members of a vigilance group were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a joint group of army, police and local vigilantes. The security operatives lost 4 of the vigilantes in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: During an attempted attack on a community, 15 Boko haram terrorists and 2 soldiers lost their lives in a shootout. The insurgents' attack was repelled by troops from Nigerian army and the Multinational Joint Task Force.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: Herdsmen attacked some farmers in their farm, kidnapped 2 people and killed 1 person in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram sects attacked a community, killing 4 people including the village head Balawan, and his son by cutting their throats and also shot 2 other villagers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 civilians were killed while 3 soldiers injured in an ambush by Boko Haram sect who were looking for food in a commercial vehicle along Damboa/Maiduguri road.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko haram members (assuming at least 20) were killed in an encounter with soldiers. On the other hand, the insurgents claimed they attacked a military convoy and killed 40 soldiers.

title: Gunmen vs Vigilante, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen were reported to have killed a member of a vigilante group, Mr Nodi Nwachuckwu Osan. The 27-year-old victim was killed during a patrol service of the area. He was referred to as the Provost Marshal to the commander of the group before his death.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 10 Boko Haram insurgents were killed when the Nigerian Air Force (NAF) fighter jets bombed their locations. It was reported that the terrorists were holding a high-level meeting when the jets hit them.
place: Outskirts of Tumbin Gini and Tumbin Kayewa

title: Youths vs Police, Kogi
description: 3 people died in a clash between some youths and a team of policemen. Crisis broke out when a youth was killed while unloading bags of fertilizer supplied by the government. The other two victims were shot dead by the police when they were attacked. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army during a military operation tagged 'Operation Lafiya Dole. It was reported that one of the insurgents was captured alive. The date of the incident was not stated but it assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: 30 members of Shekau faction of Boko Haram were killed during a clash with the Abu Musab al Barnawi faction. 40 others were taken prisoners.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko haram female suicide bomber was shot dead by soldiers while she was approaching a check point in a cattle market. After she was shot, the bomb went off and injured 2 soldiers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Nigerian soldiers attached to the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) were killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) while 6 others were injured during a confrontation with Boko Haram terrorists. Some terrorists were also killed during the operation.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 7 bandits were killed by troops of the 223 Light Tank Battalion during a raid on the hideout of the hoodlums. Some military camouflage, arms and ammunition were recovered from the den of the bandits.

title: Troops vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 8 bandits were killed by troops of the 223 Light Tank Battalion during a raid on the hideout of the hoodlums. The troops recovered several cache of arms and ammunition in the operation.

title: Armed Robbers Kill 1, Katsina
description: Armed bandits popularly called Kauraye killed 18-year-old Abdullahi Muhammad and also injured his friend, Mansur Tsauri.
