It was reported that the victim and his friend were sitting on a well when the armed robbers attacked them, demanding for their mobile phones. They were hacked with machetes.

title: Political Violence, Ondo
description: Niyi Pirisola, a former caretaker chairman of Okitipupa Local Government area and the chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Okitipupa LGA, was assassinated in the early hours of the day. The victim was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: A fight between 2 factions of Boko haram ( Abubakar Shekau and IS-backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi factions) who are involved in leadership tussle resulted in the deaths of several fighters from Shekau's camp. It is assumed that 10 victims died in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: Several members (it is assumed 10 victims) of Shekau's faction of Boko haram were been killed in Arafa and 3 others killed in Yele by another faction of Boko haram led by the IS-backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi. It is believed that the incident happened on September 1st similar to the event in IBD009431.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: Unspecified number (it is assumed 10 victims) of Boko haram insurgents loyal to Shekau were killed by fighters from the Islamic State (IS) backed Barnawi faction. Also see events in IBD009431 and IBD009433.

title: Civilian JTF Commander, Kaduna
description: A civilian JTF commander in charge of Kakuri community, Buhari Ahmadu Tanko was murdered by unknown gunmen. The victim was killed when he attempted to stop the criminals from gaining access into Kaduna Textile Industry.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: Troops of 1 Division killed the leader of livestock bandits, Guruguru Magaji was killed. Revolver pistol and six locally fabricated 9mm rounds of ammunitions were recovered. Another cattle rustler, Isak Fulani was also arrested in Igabi LGA.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 2 bandits were killed by Troops of the 1 Division Nigerian army. 4 others were arrested in connection with cattle rustling and impersonation in Kaduna and Zamfara state. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: Soldiers killed 20 cattle rustlers during a raid on their hideout. Different rifles and ammunition were recovered from the victims.

title: Army vs Armed Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of 1 Division Nigerian Army killed the leader of a livestock and armed banditry gang called Guruguru Magaji in a fierce exchange of gun duel. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at ridding the state of armed bandits and rustlers. The troops recovered a Revolver Pistol and 6 locally made 9mm rounds of ammunition from the victim and his gang.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Enugu
description: A seminarian identified as Lazarus Nwafor was killed while Mr. Ogbodo Nwarum and his family members were seriously injured by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. The herders attacked the community in the early hours of the day. Also one of the victims of the attack, Mrs Ifeoma Agbo died later int he hospital.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (2 )

title: Army vs Armed Bandits, Bauchi
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army, 33 Artillery Brigade Headquarters killed 4 armed bandits, arrested 2 of the bandits including 7 kidnappers. The event happened during a military operation aimed at ridding the state of criminals code-named "Operation Forest Kunama". The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Angwan Dabo, Rumbu Stream and Dogon Ruwa

title: Gunmen Attack, Enugu
description: Unknown gunmen in police caps attacked a popular bus-stop in Obiagiu Council. The gunmen shot sporadically for about 20 minutes and killed a commercial bus driver called Ayaka . The attackers snatched 2 vehicles from other victims during the attack.
place: Obiagiu bus-stop, Ogui New Layout, Enugu.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army on Operation Lafiya Dole. The troops repelled attacks by some Boko Haram elements who attempted to raid nearby communities.

title: Blashemy, Zamfara
description: Religious Crisis: 8 people were burnt to dead after a boy of Christian background was accused of blaspheming Islam. A mob set the house of a man ablaze who tried to rescue the boy and in the process burnt the victims to death.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents raided a village on bicycles killed many, raped some women and abducted many others. M<any victims were also injured. The number of death is assumed to be at least 2 scores (40).

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a village. It was reported that the terrorists also raped many women, including housewives.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a village. They also abducted 13 other persons. It was reported that the attackers rode on 4 motorcycles to the village in the early hours of the day when everyone was still asleep.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 300 Boko Haram terrorists including several of their commanders including Abubakar Mubi, Malam Nuhu and Malam Hamman were killed by Nigerian Air Force during airstrikes targeted at the insurgents enclaves. It was reported that the airmen conducted the airstrikes on identified Boko Haram targets when the insurgents were performing their Friday rituals. According to a report, the groups wanted leader, Abubakar Shekau, (previously assumed dead) was fatally wounded in the bombardment.
place: Taye village, Gombale within Sambisa forest

title: BokoHaram Ambush, Borno
description: Scores (it is assumed at least 40) were killed in an ambush by Boko haram insurgents on Immigration officers who were on UN assignment. While most of the victims are the insurgents, some civilians also lost their lives.

title: Religious Killing, Nasarawa
description: A clergyman with ECWA, Reverend Zakariya, was killed by Fulani herdsmen. The killers attacked the pastor in his farm, cutting off his arms and legs. It was reported that they also chopped off the head of the pastor with a machete. The date of the event was not reported but due to the nature of the story it is backdated by 1 week.

title: Fulani Vigilance Group Kills 4, Nasarawa
description: 4 Fulani herdsmen were killed by a Fulani vigilance group. The victims were abducted and later killed by members of the group. It is assumed this incident happened on August, 15th since no day was reported for the incident.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 4, Nasarawa
description: 4 family members were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The victims were abducted and killed by the Fulani. It is assumed that this incident happened on August, 15th since no day was reported for the incident.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: Abubakar Shekau and Abu Musab al Barnawi factions of Boko Haram clashed inside a forest. 3 leaders of the Shekua faction were killed. The incident occurred in August, 2016 but because no day was reported, it is assumed to have happened on August 15th.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of Operation Lafiya Dole, who repelled the terrorists' attacks. Several arms and ammunition were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Boko Harm Members, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram members were killed while 1 of them sustained gunshot wounds. 1 AK-45 rifle and 3 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition were recovered from the insurgents at Monguno while 88 hostages were also rescued in different location of the state.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 Boko Haram member was killed by Soldiers in Bama while 88 hostages were rescued in different location in the state. Other terrorists were also killed in Mungoro LGA (IBD009265).

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: 6 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded some villages. It was reported that during the attack, the gunmen said that the villages have been turned into grazing reserves and wanted the villagers to vacate.

title: Gunmen vs Lecturer, Benue
description: Dr. Aondosoo Tondo, a lecturer with the University of Mkar, Benue State who was the All Progressives Congress (APC) chairmanship aspirant for Buruku Local Government Council was killed by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen came into the lecturer's room while he was having early morning prayers with his family and shot him dead. It was suspected that he was killed by Sole Administrator of Buruku Local Government, Mr. David Yimam Terna and 2 others
place: Staff quarter, University of Mkar, Gboko
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Protesting Youths, Kogi
description: Okaye Omodi and Zekeri Mohammed were shot dead by policemen when youths were protesting the arrest and detention of some residents, including a retired police officer identified as Peter Adama. These people were arrested after some Fulani herdsmen reported that their cows had been killed by some of the residents.

title: Militants vs Soldiers, Bayelsa
description: 3 soldiers were shot dead when bandits believed to either be pirates of militants attacked a military checkpoint. The bandits also made away with a gunboat and 2 AK47 riffles belonging to the victims.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Kaduna
description: 11 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. The herders also injured scores of people and destroyed several properties worth thousands of Naira.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The troops of Operation Lafiya Dole and members of the Civilian JTF killed 5 Boko Haram terrorists in a clearance operation aimed at wiping out the terrorists. They also recovered several cache of arms and ammunition from the terrorists.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Adamawa
description: 22 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community. The herders also injured scores of people and destroyed several properties worth thousands of Naira.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (15 ) , The Guardian (22 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , The Punch (30 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of Nigerian Army ambushed and killed two fleeing Boko Haram terrorists. It was reported that one of the terrorists escaped with gunshots wounds. Several cache of arms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Factions, Borno
description: 24 members of the Abubarka Shekau faction of Boko Haram were killed by loyalists to the Abu Musab al Barnawi faction, the Islamic State’s West Africa Province (ISWAP). 2 members of ISWAP were also killed. 1 of them was killed inside an explosive manufacturing base in the Lake Chad region.

title: Rustlers vs Pregnant Woman, Zamfara
description: A pregnant woman was killed by cattle rustlers who besieged a community and carted away more than 100 cows. The thieves also abducted 3 house wives and wounded many other members of the community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: 10 persons were killed by Fulani herders who attacked some farmers (Tivs). It was reported that the attack happened in the morning when the farmers were heading to their various farms.
place: Adayohov and Sontyo villages of Gaabe Tiev

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Man, Kogi
description: A 45-year-old farmer was killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. The victim identified as Mr Adama Muhammed was in his cassava farm when he was gunned down by the herdsmen.

title: Army vs Boko Harm, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army on Operation Lafiya Dole. The troops ambushed and killed the terrorists while they were heading back to their base. It was reported that 2 soldiers were injured in the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 40 Boko haram were killed when they ambushed soldiers who were returning from a clearance operation. Most of the victims were insurgents that came to reinforce their fleeing members. According to the report, scores (at least 2 scores) died in the shootout and 19 soldiers and vigilantes were declared missing.

title: Army vs Boko Harm, Borno
description: 45 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the troops of the Nigerian Army during a military clearance operation aimed at wiping out terrorists. The army killed the terrorists as they were regrouping in a village. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported. 80 hostages were rescued in the operation.

title: Soldiers Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 soldiers sustained injuries, 12 Boko Haram terrorists killed, while many escaped with gunshot injuries. 22 hostages including women and children were rescued in several clearance operations done by the Nigerian Army.
place: Warpaya, Zenteleye, Mubarka, Jadawa and Yerwa villages

title: Herdsmen Vs King, Plateau
description: The Saf Ron Kulere and chairman, Bokkos Traditional Council, Lazarus Agai, his driver and a police orderly were killed by Fulani herdsmen on their way back from his farm. Another version of the story stated that he was killed alongside his orderly, Sunday Wuyah, a police inspector, his wife and son.

title: Army vs Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 2 cattle rustlers were killed by a team of soldiers who raided a camp belonging to armed bandits and rustlers. It was reported that the soldiers recovered a machete from the camp. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that the it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Kidnappers, Bauchi
description: 2 kidnappers were killed by soldiers of the 33 Artillery Brigade while two of the kidnappers were arrested. It was reported that the soldiers came in contact with the armed bandits who opened fire on them, leading to the death of 2 of the kidnappers.

title: Army vs Boko Harm, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of 29 Brigade Quick Reaction Force (QRF) in conjunction with Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF) during a clearance operation. The date of the event was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Kogi
description: A 32-year-old man, Victor Sadiq, was killed in his residence by unknown gunmen. The gunmen scaled through the fence and shot the men before his wife and sister.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Adamawa
description: 3 people were killed and several others injured. Goods worth millions of naira were also destroyed by cattle rustlers with sophisticated weapons.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 25 Boko Haram insurgents and a soldier lost their lives in a gun shootout. The insurgents had attempted an attack on some locations but were repelled by soldiers. It was reported that the dead soldier was the first cousin of the Chief of Defence Staff, Gen. Abayomi Olonisakin.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (26 ) , Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , This Day (28 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 soldiers belong to the troops of Nigerian Army were killed by a Boko Haram suicide bomber who detonated a bomb. The explosion destroyed a military truck, leading to the death of the soldiers.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 18 people including 2 soldiers and 16 Boko haram insurgents died in a shootout. The insurgents had attacked a military location with sophisticated weapons before they were repelled by soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber blew up himself at a mosque, killing 6 worshippers and others. It was reported that the attack happened in the early hours of the day when worshippers were in the mosque.

title: Communal Clash, Niger
description: 6 persons, including an 84-year-old man, were killed in a clash between members of the Fulani and Gwari tribes. The clash was as a result of the grazing of the farm of Gwari community by Fulani herdsmen. Several properties were destroyed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Niger
description: A clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers left 4 people dead with many other victims injured. It was reported that 4 cars, 17 motorcycles and several houses were burnt in the attack. The attack was in retaliation for the killing of a Gwari man by Fulani men for preventing them from raping a girl during Sallah.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram militants were killed in an ambush by Troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF). Several arms and ammunition were recovered from the insurgents during the operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were shot dead by troop of the Nigeria Army as they attempted to attack Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs). 2 persons were injured from the explosion that ensued after the killing of the bombers.

title: Rustlers Kill 3, Katsina
description: 3 persons were killed by cattle rustlers who attacked a village in a midnight raid. 4 other persons were injured during the attack. It was reported that the rustlers invaded the village on motorcycles and attempted to steal some cows but were repelled. The rustlers killed the victims during a shootout that ensued during the resistance. The date of the event is not stated but it assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Rustlers, Zamfara
description: Unknown gunmen believed to be cattle rustlers killed 16 people and rustled 40 cows. 6 houses were also burnt down by the assailants.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko haram members were killed by soldiers in an ambush. According to the report, the victims were fleeing from the advancing troops.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram spy was ambushed and killed by soldiers. The victim was killed while trying to gain entry into a military location.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Rivers
description: 2 persons were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked a community. The gunmen stormed the community in the morning, blocked a section of the expressway and shot sporadically, leading to the death of the 2 persons.

title: Political Violence, Oyo
description: A member of Oyo State House of Assembly, Hon. Gideon Aremu was assassinated by unknown gunmen. The gunmen trailed the victim on a motorbike to the front of his residence and shot him while he was trying to alight from his vehicle. The assailants escaped with his mobile phone. Hon. Gideon, a member of Labour Party (LP) representing Orelope constituency, belonged to an opposition party in an All Progressive Congress (APC) dominated State House of Assembly. The incident was later reported as an armed robbery.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , Other newspaper 3 (1 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A man, identified as the son of a late village head known as Lawan, was killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a village. The terrorists struck the village and torching some houses, carting away all foodstuffs and livestocks in sight.

title: 29 Babies, 211 Boko Haram, Borno
description: An Amnesty International report (2016/2017 report) stated that 240 persons including 29 babies died in military detention in Giwa Barrack. The victims were said to be fleeing from boko haram attacks but were arrested by the Nigerian Army and died in their detention in Borno state. The Nigerian Army refuted the claims.

title: Police vs Armed Robbers, Delta
description: 2 armed robbers were gunned down during a shootout between a 4-man armed robbery gang and policemen. Arms, ammunition and a stolen vehicle were recovered from the bandits.

title: Soldiers Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Several Boko Haram fighters were killed while 16 hostages were rescued by Troops of 26 and 121 Task Force Brigades and Battalion of Nigerian Army during a military operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of 118 Task Force Battalion, 8 Task Force Division during a clearance operation. One of the terrorists was also wounded during the operation, which is assumed to have occurred 2 days before the news report.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Adamawa
description: 6 people were killed while many others were injured when Fulani herdsmen invaded a village in the wee hours of the day.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 soldier was killed and another was severely wounded and lost one of his limbs when Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded. The incident happened during terrorists clearance operation by the troops of Sector 1 of the Multi-National Joint Task (MNJTF).
place: Sagui, Kirta-Woulgo, Gore Mahamat, Gore Blangafe, Chaugry and Damboure

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers died in a failed suicide attempt on a Mosque. The Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) strapped on their bodies went off after they were intercepted by Civilian Joint Task Force (JTF).

title: Gunmen vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen invaded a village and killed 4 farmers. Many persons also sustained varying degrees of injuries during the invasion by the gunmen who rode on bikes. The victims included Mustapha, Suleiman, Usman, Umar and Idris.
place: Gurguzu village near Maguzawa, an outskirts of Rigasa

title: Bandits vs Vigilance Group, Benue
description: 6 members of a vigilance group were killed when bandits attacked their office at the local council's headquarter. According to report, the attackers believed that the vigilantes stood on their way against perpetrating their criminal activities.

title: Army vs Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 4 armed bandits who specialised in cattle rustling were killed by troops of 223 Battalion 1 Brigade under Operation Sharan Daji of 1 Division Nigerian Army. Some of the bandits were also wounded.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Kaduna
description: 2 bandits believed to be cattle rustlers were killed in different locations by soldiers. The killings were reported in Kaduna. There, the incident is assumed to have happened in Kaduna, the state capital.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: A bandit was killed during a shootout with a team of soldiers. The bandits attempted to kidnap a victim in farm before they were intercepted by the soldiers. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Vs Farmers, Adamawa
description: In a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen on farmland trespassed, 8 people were killed while 7 others were injured.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian army during clearance operations aimed at flushing out the insurgents from the North East. A civilian JTF member was killed, a soldier, a policeman and another civilian were injured during the operations. Several cache of ammunition were recovered from the insurgents.
place: Ladin Buta, Shirori, Gizina, Maska and Maska Lawanti villages

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: A bandit was shot dead by soldiers during a routine patrol. Several items were also recovered from the hoodlums.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: 5 Tiv farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The victims attempted to escape the attack of the herdsmen before they were shot dead. Several houses were also set ablaze.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , Vanguard (12 ) , Daily Trust (8 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 9 bandits were killed by soldiers in an effort to clear some communities of cattle rustlers, kidnappers and bandits. Several items were recovered during the raid.

title: Communal Clash, Rivers
description: 4 persons lost their lives during a communal clash between Deken and Deyor communities. It was reported that the communities have been enmeshed in crisis prior to the recent clash.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a failed ambush. A NAF King Air A350i Beechcraft aircraft on Intelligence, Surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) mission sighted the terrorists, who were then attacked by an Alpha Jet .

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers and Civilian JTF encountered Boko Haram insurgents and killed 3 of them during a security patrol. 11 of them were also arrested.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a clearance operations by soldiers and members of vigilant groups. Many insurgents flee with gun shot injuries.

title: Gunmen vs Police Academy Staff, Kano
description: A staff of the Nigerian Police Academy, Mohammed Inuwa Abdukadir was killed by unknown gunmen. The victim was shot by his assailants and was also dispossessed of some amount of money found on him.
place: Around Rijia Gwan in Gano Police.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers, who were on their way to carry out an operation, were intercepted and killed by youth vigilante called Civilian Joint Task Force in a community. It was reported that the bombers were dressed in an unusual way, rousing suspicion, before they were caught and killed.

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Ogun
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen, who invaded a community. 2 of the victims (Amosun Ogunronbi and Owolabi Ogunronbi) were siblings. The third victim was identified as Philip. The attackers stole a huge of sums of money from a thrift saving.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 12 people were killed during a raid by Fulani herdsmen. From the report, the fatality figure may increase as a result of the huge number of the injured persons. Herdsmen invasion in many communities in the state has been trending since last year. The death toll have increased to 59.
place: Gabo village in Nengev and Turan Councils wards

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 24 mourners, mainly women and children, were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during a wake-keep for the dead. Several other persons sustained varying degrees of injuries from the attack. It was reported that the insurgents sneaked in from the nearby Sambisa forest. The number of death in this attack has increased to 32.
sources_of_information: The Nation (18 ) , Other newpapers 1 (24 ) , Daily Trust (32 )

title: Fulani Herdsman vs Farmer, Delta
description: A 45-year-old man, Mr. Nwadei Monday Ikechukwu, was shot dead by a a gang of Fulani herdsmen while he was on his way home on his motorbike. The victim, who is a hunter and a plantain farmer, was attacked and killed by the herders.

title: Soldiers Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of 7 Division Strike Group Team B, 21 and 155 Task Force Battalion and Brigade of Nigerian Army during a clearance military operations.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 villagers were killed in a remote village by Boko Haram insurgents that forced the people to flee their homes and in the process, killed the 4 persons. 3 women were also kidnapped.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the 114 Task Force Battalion of 28 Task Force Brigade. The terrorists were killed during a clearance operation in the Northeastern Nigeria.

title: Farmers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 4 farmers were killed on their farmland by a gang of bandits. It was believed that the gang had forewarned them to stay away from their farmlands.

title: Gunmen vs Ambassador, FCT (Abuja)
description: Ambassador S.S. Yusuf, Immediate-past Nigerian High Commissioner to South Africa, was thrown through the window of his flat from a 3- storey-building by unknown gunmen, leading to his death. The perpetrator, Abubakar Yau, was later arrested.

title: Military Attack Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 Boko Haram insurgents were shot dead by troops of the Nigerian Army when a gang of the insurgents attempted an attack on them while 5 soldiers sustained varying degree of injuries. Items recovered from the insurgents included 1 Fabrique Nationale (FN), 2 belts of 148 rounds of 7.62mm (NATO) ammunition and 1 FN rifle magazine loaded with 7.62mm ammunition (Special).
place: Pulka through Banki Axis of Sambisa

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Delta
description: Obolor Tega was killed by gunmen and in a reprisal attack, his loyalists beat a 23-year-old boy, Oghenevwire Joshua to death on the same day. Crisis over who becomes the community Chief Liaison Officer has been raging for months. See events in IBD008926 and IBD008927.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clearance operation in some villages. A woman and her baby were rescued in the operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of Nigerian Army during a clearance operations to wipe out the remnants of the terrorists. The troops also recovered five dan guns, two handsets, three Boko Haram flags, a generator and several vehicles.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Boko Haram terrorists attacked a police station and a military base killing 7 persons. It was reported that the attackers stormed the town chanting Allahu Akbar, killing people, snatching pure water bags, bags of sugar, rice, milk and foodstuffs. The attack forced residents to flee into the bush for safety. It is assumed that 1 policeman, 1 soldier and 5 villagers were killed in the attack.

title: Soldiers Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 motorcycles, 1 bag containing a cash sum of four hundred and sixty-six thousand naira (N466,000.00) were recovered from a Boko Haram terrorist who was killed by 22 Brigade Garrison during a blockage from some terrorists who were fleeing on motorcycles and 8 abducted persons made up of 2 women, 2 female teenagers, 3 male children and a minor who unfortunately sustained injury were rescued.

title: Assailants vs Pastor, Lagos
description: A 56-year-old pastor, Isiaka Aikomo, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. He was killed while supervising the construction of a building owned by a woman identified as Omolara. Another source gave the victim's name as Isaac, an engineer, who was killed by kidnappers for serving as a spy to a team of policemen that engaged the gunmen in a gun duel.
place: Near Babington Macaulay Junior Seminary School

title: Boko Haram vs Hunters, Borno
description: 3 people including 2 hunters and 1 Boko haram insurgent were killed during a shootout. Also, 7 hunters were abducted in the process. This incident is backdated by 3 weeks as was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: 15 Tiv farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen in a morning raid on 3 communities. Most of the victims were killed while attempting to escape being slaughtered. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported. A subsequent report had it that over 30 (assuming 31) people were killed in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 19 Boko Haram insurgents including their top commander, Ameer Abubakar Gana were killed by soldiers with support from Air Force aerial surveillance.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram terrorists were killed in an ambush. One was also arrested. Security operatives have in recently intensified clearance operations in the Sambisa forest and its environs.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko haram terrorists and a soldier died during an ambush by the insurgents. The soldiers were ambushed by the terrorists but was able to clear the ambush and killed the extremists. Several arms and ammunition were recovered.

title: Cattle Rustlers vs Army, Katsina
description: A soldier attached to a joint security patrol team of Operation Sharan Daji was killed and some others injured when their vehicle was ambushed by cattle rustlers. The incident happened when the rustlers engaged the soldiers in a shootout.

title: Army vs MASSOB, Anambra
description: A clash between soldiers/policemen and members of MASSOB led to the death of 95 people at different locations in Onitsha, the commercial city of the state. 3 policemen were reported to be among the victims. Fracas broke out when the group matched around celebrating the 50th anniversary of the declaration of the Republic of Biafra on May 30, 1967 but were clamped down by security personnel. Military attacked more than1500 members of IPOB while they slept at a church at Nkpor killing 8 persons also, 87 people were also shot dead the next day at Uga junction.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (32 ) , The Punch (31 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , This Day (50 ) , Other newspaper 3 (95 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Troops of the 28 Task Force Brigade of the Nigerian Army killed 5 Boko Haram insurgents during a deadly encounter with the sect. A soldier and many members of the sect were wounded in the attack. 3 locally made guns were also recovered from the insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Tiv, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded 2 Tiv-speaking villages in the mid-day and killed over 10 persons. It was reported that the villages have been deserted for fear of further attacks by the herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Landmine Blast, Borno
description: A soldier and four other persons, including a woman, her baby and 2 male adults, were killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried close to a military checkpoint by the Boko Haram insurgent.

title: Gunmen Kill Couple, Benue
description: A man and his wife were killed by unknown gunmen. The assailants stormed the house of the victims, shot them dead and later set them, and their home ablaze.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Farmer, FCT (Abuja)
description: A herder killed a farmer when his cow strayed into the farm of the victim and destroyed some crops. The victim identified as Joshua was working in his farm with 2 of his children when his crops were destroyed. This resulted in a fight where the herdsmen overpowered and murdered the farmer with a cutlass.

title: 7 in Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 7 residents were killed during an invasion on 2 communities. The attack was reported to be a reprisal attack on a missing man who is assumed dead.
place: Tse Aondo and Tse Ankou communities

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram members were killed in an ambush by soldiers. Many victims were wounded and several arms, ammunition and other lethal items were recovered. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram sect invaded 5 villages and killed 13 victims. The sect carried out the attack with AK47 rifles, petrol bombs and other Improvised Devised Explosive (IDEs). Several other people were injured in the attack.
place: 5 communities of Ladin Buta near Khaddamari village.

title: IPOB Kill Boy, Delta
description: A Yoruba boy identified as Tunde was killed by members of Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB) for quarrelling with one of their members. He was taken away at night and murdered.

title: Malnutrition, Borno
description: 137 persons in the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp, due to Boko Haram attacks, died as a result of acute malnutrition. It was reported that majority of those in the camp live under very harsh conditions.

title: Herdsman vs Rustlers, Plateau
description: A herdsman was killed by some suspected cattle rustlers while about 36 cattles were taken away. Miyetti Allah Cattle Breeders Association of Nigeria, the State chapter complained through their Chairman, Mallam Nuru Abdullahi that its members are being killed by rustlers in recent times.

title: Militants vs 2 Soldiers, Delta
description: 2 soldiers were reported dead when they were attacked by unknown gunmen suspected to be militants of the area. The gunboat of the military was in search of restive Niger Delta militants when the incident occurred. Many other victims were injured in the incident.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: A 35-year-old Adamu Yusuf was killed by cattle rustlers while grazing around a village. 6 suspects were arrested for the murder.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ekiti
description: 2 persons were killed by the rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. It was reported that the herders attacked the community for refusing to allow them graze their cattle on the farms belonging to members of the community. two of the perpetrators, Usman Salihu and Abubakar Auta were later apprehended.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Policemen, Rivers
description: An Assistant Superintendent of Police, ASP Matthew Akpos, was murdered by unknown gunmen close to a school field.

title: Hoodlums Kill 2, Lagos
description: 2 persons were killed and 15 others, including one John Vincent, were severely injured when some hoodlums clashed in a marketplace. The clash which started from a disagreement over illegal ticketing snowballed into an ethnic crisis between Igbo traders and Yoruba residents around the market.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an encounter with troops of 1 Brigade Nigerian Army. The military personnel were on an operation to clear the insurgents who have been terrorising the North-eastern Nigeria.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 28 villagers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a mosque in the early hours of the day. It was reported that due to the proximity of the village to Sambisa forest, the villagers have constantly been under attacks from the terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Many people were killed when some Fulani herdsmen raided a community. The Fulani herdsmen stormed the community and shot people at sight. There has been increased invasions by the herdsmen since this year. Different reports were given by various sources.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male Boko haram suicide bomber detonated an explosive at the entrance of the state secretariat and killed 3 people. The bomber disguised as a lunatic and attempted to enter through the main gate of the secretariat when the device exploded. Another source reported 4 civilian casualty including the bomber and 2 policemen who were at the secretariat checkpoint.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A male Boko Haram suicide bomber died when he detonated a bomb near a mosque while worshippers had finished observing their morning prayers. The bomber targeted those filing out of the mosque after prayer but ended up killing himself only.

title: Boko Haram Killing, Borno
description: A horrifying video of a female Boko Haram terrorist beheading a woman was discovered by the troops of Nigerian Army. The victim was seen pleading for her life before she was beheaded by the terrorist. Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 2 weeks.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 58 Boko Haram members were killed during a raid on their camps. The raid was carried out by Multinational Joint Task Force numbering about 1000. Several people (about 60) including 15 Nigerian women, 3 Cameroonian women and 28 children were also rescued and freed. According to another version, on 7 May 2016, the Nigerian army also shot some 5 Boko Haram insurgents dead while they escaped from Walasa Village. Rules of engagement were not respected as there was no warning to villagers. 63 wives and children of insurgents were "rescued" or "liberated" and brought to a safe house in Maiduguri.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army, who were on operations to clear the terrorists out of the North-eastern part of Nigeria. Several enclaves of the terrorists were decimated in the operations which lasted for hours. Several weapons were also recovered.
place: Bala Karege, Goske, Harda and famous Markas 3
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Guardian (8 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Mob vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram tax collectors were lynched by residents when they went to collect taxes imposed on a community by the insurgent group. Another source reported that the insurgents went to attack the community when they were apprehended and lynched by the residents. Event IBD008518, where the Army killed 60 insurgents in Sambisa Forest was reported in the uploaded paper.

title: Herdsmen Kill 6, Taraba
description: 6 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen just after 2 weeks. 19 others were killed in other parts of the state. In recent times, several people have been killed in different parts of the country by the same herdsmen.
place: Korum, Orawua and Gidan Bature villages

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: 12 persons, including 7 men, 2 women and 3 children, were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked three villages. About 18 person were seriously wounded in the attack. Several houses were also burnt in the incident. The attack was as a result of a long standing land dispute over farm lands.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 20 armed bandits including 2 of their commanders, Buzu and Aliyu Rana Da kaya were killed by troops from 223 Light Tank Battalion. About 12 riffles were recovered from the bandits.
place: Babbar Doka, Ruwan Tofa and Malele all in Dansadau district

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 insurgents were killed by Troop of 27, 120 Task Force Battalion and Brigades of 7 Division with the help of some local vigilantes. The Army also arrested 9 insurgents and rescued over 472 abductees during the clearance and interception operations carried out by the army.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in an operation carried out by soldiers. The operations were launched to reclaim lost territories and clear the insurgents from their strongholds. It was further reported that 28 children and 34 women were rescued during the operation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian soldiers, who were on a counter terrorism operation killed 9 Boko Haram terrorists while they were on an assignment to clear the area of the insurgents. The soldiers also destroyed a bomb-making factory belonging to the Boko Haram sect. 6 soldiers were wounded during the incident.

title: Fulani Gunmen vs District Head, Kaduna
description: The district head of Fadan Kirshi, Bala Madaki and his 20-year-old nephew, Emmanuel Tanko were killed by Fulani gunmen. The victims were relaxing in front of the palace when the gunmen slaughtered them.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during an operation. 9 of them were captured alive and also several weapons were seized. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen vs Traditional Ruler, Kogi
description: A traditional ruler, Simon Shaibu was gunned down by unknown gunmen numbering about five while he was in a meeting with some members of his community. It was reported that, in the past, Simon had been a victim of kidnap over chieftaincy tussle in his community. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 2 notorious cattle rustlers were killed by the troops of 1 Division of Nigerian Army in the clearing operation against cattle rustlers and armed bandits in Kaduna and Zamfara state within the last 4 days. The rustlers had earlier killed 7 people.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Kano
description: Pastor Kenneth Mbah of Discipleship Ministries and his daughter, Adaugo Mbah, were burnt to death by Boko Haram terrorists. The insurgents killed the duo for failing to renounce their Christian faith when they stormed their church.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Woman, Delta
description: A 38-year-old pregnant woman identified as Elizabeth Ezeh was killed by Fulani herdsmen for refusing to have sexual intercourse with them. It was reported that the herdsmen have been terrorising the community by raping housewives, destroying farm crops and attacking residents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers in the ongoing operations to clear the insurgents from the North East. A pit where the insurgents usually dump human victims was also discovered during the operation. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: Fulani herdsmen numbering about 100 and heavily armed invaded a community and killed 48 residents mostly farmers. The attackers had previously fallen out with the community over their grazing activities. While farmers accused them of destroying their farms, they alleged that some villagers of killing some of their cattle.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A notorious Boko Haram kingpin popularly called called 'Albani of Monguno' and 6 other members were killed by soldiers during a clearance operations. Several items and weapons were recovered from the insurgents during the operation.

title: Gunmen vs High Chief, Osun
description: A 75-year-old Akannare of Ile-Ido Ife, Osun State, High Chief Moses Elutilo, was murdered at a meeting venue by unknown gunmen. The victim was the only witness in a land dispute before a court.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 fleeing Boko haram insurgents were ambushed and killed by soldiers. The victims were reported to attempt to join their families who had earlier fled from Sambisa forest due to intensified bombardment by the armed forces.

title: Auto Crash, Ogun
description: 2 persons died when a truck loaded with sand rammed into a herd of cattle led by some Fulani herdsmen in the early hours of the day.The victims were the driver of the truck and his assistant, popularly called 'motor boy'. It was reported that the truck with plate number KJA 168 XP rammed into the animals while they were crossing an expressway.
place: Obada Oko end of the old Lagos-Abeokuta Expressway

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Man, FCT (Abuja)
description: A man identified as Daniel Ikpi was killed by rampaging Fulani herdsmen who attacked some residents. It was reported that the herders who were also armed robbers attacked the residents in the early hours of the day, stealing from them and killing the victim. Many were also wounded.
place: House 18, Road 691, Judges Quarters, Gwaripa Estate

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber was intercepted by soldiers while he was attempting to sneak into a community to carry out an attack. The Improvised Explosive Device vest strapped on his body exploded and blew him up.
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Nigerian Tribune (1 )

title: Gunmen vs Lecturer, Rivers
description: A lecturer, Dr Vincent Eebe, at the Ken Saro-Wiwa Polytechnic, Bori was killed by unknown gunmen. The victim, who was also a chieftain of All Progressive Party (APC) in the state was returning home from his school when the assailants shot him dead with one of his students (Preye).

title: Communal Clash, Cross River
description: Several communities including Onyadama, Inyima, Ukpe, Okpagada and Mgbagede were involved in a communal crisis over farmlands. This incident led to the death of 11 victims. This crisis has been ongoing in the past 3 days. Several farm produce and animals were destroyed.
place: Onyadama, Inyima, Ukpe, Okpagada and Mgbagede.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A clearance operation carried out on the Boko Haram insurgents by troops of of 21 Brigade Nigerian Army led to the killing of many terrorists. Sources gave different casualty figures. 2 civilian JTF were also reported killed in the operation. 198 captives, including women, children and aged were rescued. Volkswagen golf car, 15 bicycles and foodstuffs were recovered from the terrorists.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of Nigerian Army on a clearance operation in the North-east. The troops recovered 2 dane guns and 4 assorted batteries from the terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram members were killed during an encounter with the troops of the Nigerian Army on a clearance operation. The troops recovered 1 AK 47 rifle with registration number TH5712 and 17 rounds of 7.62 mm ammunition. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: There was an attack on a community by herdsmen in retaliation of a Fulani person that was killed a week to the time of the attack.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 8 persons were killed by 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers. The incident happened when the bombers detonated bombs in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp. 12 other persons were injured in the attack which happened in the morning.
place: Banki, on the edge of Borno state, near the border with Cameroon

title: Army (GOC) vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The convoy of the Acting General Officer Commanding the 7 Division of the Nigerian Army, Brig. Gen. Victor Ezeugwu was attacked by members of the Boko Haram sect. The incident happened when the GOC was visiting soldiers who were clearing out terrorist elements in the terrorist-ravaged region of the North-East. A soldier was killed by the terrorists, 2 others were wounded while many terrorists were killed. The number of terrorists killed was not stated but it is assumed 10.
sources_of_information: The Punch (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (11 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Patrols of 113 and 157 or 158 Battalions of the Nigerian Army are ambushed and attacked by hundreds of Boko Haram insurgents who claimed to surrender. Some combatants wore uniforms so that the military would not shoot or bomb them for fear of killing their own soldiers. The battle begins at dawn and lasts for 6 to 10 hours. It opposes the insurgents to 1,552 officers and men, as each batallion groups 776 combatants. The Nigerian Army claims to have killed 30 insurgents, possibly one hundred. Witnesses in Maiduguri report that 80 bodies of soldiers were also deposited at the teaching hospital in Maiduguri, while 20 were left in barracks. Other reports mention 120 soldiers killed including those missing in action.
place: Kareto, near Damasek on the border with Niger
sources_of_information: The Nation (30 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (130 ) , Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , Other newspaper 2 (220 )

title: Armed Robbers vs Police, Imo
description: 2 police officers, attached to the Imo State Police Command, were shot dead by armed robbers. It was reported that the victims, an Inspector and a Corporal, were attacked by the bandits who escaped afterwards.
place: Around Niger Delta Development Corporation (NDDC) building, Umuagwo

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops killed 2 Boko haram members during a raid on their food storage facilities. 2 children were rescued during the raid.

title: IPOB Kill 2, Delta
description: 1 Fulani boy and another boy were killed by members of Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB). The remains of of the Fulani boy was buried in a shallow grave.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Ekiti
description: A priest who caused the arrest of a Fulani herdsman over the destruction of his farm, was attacked and killed by herdsmen. A police station was also burnt down. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 3 Battalion killed 27 members of Boko haram. They had earlier apprehended a spy who admitted he want sent by the insurgents to spy on the troops. The information led to the encounter with the insurgents where they were killed. However, 1 Civilian JTF member was killed. 455 people were also rescued and escorted to an internally Displaced Camp in the area.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A number of Boko Haram members (assuming at least 10) were killed by troops of the 103 battalion in an ambush. 15 bicycles and food stuffs were recovered from them.

title: Community Leader, Delta
description: A community leader, chief Godwin Eselema slumped and died during a leadership crisis that has lingered in the community. It took the intervention of the Nigerian Police Force to bring the riot under control.

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killing: In response to a Boko Haram attack on a checkpoint, soldiers opened fire on community residents and killed 15 people including 11 elderly men and women and 4 children under 2 years. It is assumed the incident occurred in the middle of April, 2016.

title: Soldiers vs Gunmen, Bayelsa
description: Soldiers killed a bandit during a gun duel. The soldiers were on their way to clamp down on kidnappers and sea pirates who have constituted serious threats to some communities when they met the bandits. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 22 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by Nigerian troops and the Multi-National Joint Task Force from Cameroun. The incident happened during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the insurgents. About 1,275 hostages were rescued during the operation while 3 Boko Haram commanders were arrested. Due to the nature of the story, this event is backdated by 3 days.
place: Nbaga, Bula, Danube, Ybiri, Greya, Suduwa villages along Nigeria-Cameroun border

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Guard, Ondo
description: A member of the Oodua Peoples Congress (OPC) working as a security guard in the farm of a former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, Chief Olu Falae, was killed by Fulani Herdsmen. The herders abducted the guard and later killed him for not allowing them to graze their cattle on the farm of Chief Falae.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Delta
description: An employee of Delta State University (DELSU) identified as Francis Okotie, and one Philip Obayendo were killed by Fulani herdsmen. Okotie (52 years) was shot twice on the arm and on the back of his head in his plantain and palm oil farm while the body of Obayendo was discovered 5 days after he was last seen going to his farm. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Auto Crash, Ondo
description: A 200-level student in the department of Economic Education of Adekunle Ajasin University, Ojo Afolabi Daniel, was hit by a speeding vehicle along an expressway. The incident happened when the victim was plying his trade as a commercial motorcyclist. The death of the victim led to a protest among the students of Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba (AAUA).

title: JTF vs Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 female Boko Haram suicide bombers were shot dead by members of the youth vigilante group popularly called Civilian Joint Task Force. The bombers were intercepted as they were trying to gain entry into the state capital.
place: Around Polo and Giwa Barrack areas

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Edo
description: A 64-year- old farmer identified as Alex Idemitin was attacked and killed when he was ambushed at a bush near his farm.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Taraba
description: 2 men were murdered in their sleep by Fulani herdsmen who invaded a community in the early hours of the day. The victims were identified as Nantain Kuntai (45 years) and Ponfa Nafhat (30 years).

title: Assailants vs Hoodlum, Benue
description: A notorious criminal was shot and killed by unknown assailants, suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen, on a popular road in a community. The murdered notorious criminal, Msusgh Tyavyar, was popularly known as 'Pastor'.

title: Cult Killings, Kwara
description: 4 cultists were killed during a crisis that broke out between 2 rival cult groups who were involved in a supremacy battle. One of the victims was a 20-year-old boy identified as Wasiu.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of 22 Brigade Garrison of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out insurgents. 6 terrorists were captured.
place: Madawa, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere and Maksamari

title: Herdsmen vs Community, Benue
description: The killing of 2 Fulani herdsmen by some youths in a community led to a reprisal attack by the herdsmen. The attack led to the death of 2 persons including the All Progressive Congress (APC) youth leader identified as Aondohemba Kasaar.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: During a clash between soldiers and Boko haram insurgents, 3 soldiers, 2 vigilante members and some (assuming at least 10) Boko haram insurgents were killed. The insurgents escaped with the corpses of their colleagues.

title: Gunmen vs LGA Chairman's Aide, Rivers
description: An aide to the Asari-Toru Caretaker Committee chairman known as Godknows (a.k.a. Babadiba) was killed by unknown gunmen in the early hours of the day. He was shot several times inside his residence by the gunmen.

title: Cult Killings, Rivers
description: About 16 victims have been killed in the past 1 week in the LGA. 3 casualties were recorded in IBD0008178 and IBD008200. 13 deaths is recorded in this event to make up for the remaining figure. The recent attacks are being perpetrated by cultists and unknown gunmen.
place: Erema and Obigbo Communities in Egi.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the insurgents from their hideout. Several weapons were recovered during the operation.
place: Bolungu village, Mayanti village, Gare village

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 151 Task Force Battalion, 21 Brigade of the Nigerian Army have killed 25 members of the Boko haram sect when they carried out a major raid on their camp. 18 abductees were rescued during the operation.
place: Mballeri, Shuari 1 and Shuari (Iza general area)

title: Cultists vs Student, Rivers
description: A student of the University of Port Harcourt (UNIPORT), Mr. Clinton Opribo-Amos, was shot dead by unknown gunmen suspected to be cultists in a hotel.

title: Cult War, Kogi
description: Suspected cultists killed 7 victims in the past few days when 2 rival groups clashed. The cult groups included Elebe Boys and Eiye Boys. The attacks were carried out on the street, where parents watched their wards being massacred. It is assumed that the event happened within the past one week as the date of the event was not stated.
place: Adakolo, Kabawa and Ganaja areas of Lokoja.

title: Pro-Biafran Group Kills Resident, Abia
description: Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) killed 5 Hausa-Fulani residents in a state. The perpetrators buried their victims in shallow graves. The names of the 4 victims were given as Mohammed Gainako, Ibrahim Mohammed, Idris Yakubu, Isa Mohammed Rago. Due to the nature of this story, this event is backdated by 2 weeks.Other 55 mass graves were discovered alongside the 5 victims.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (5 ) , Daily Trust (55 ) , The Punch (55 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the 114 Task Force Battalion, 28 Task Force Brigade in conjunction with member of the vigilance groups during a clearance operation aimed at flushing out the insurgents. One soldier was injured in the operation. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Communal Clash, Delta
description: An intra-communal crisis over a piece of land resulted in the death of 2 people identified as Owomake Omogomugho (43 years) and Prince Ometobor (24 years). Both parties (Ugbo family and Ibrede community) have been quarrelling over a piece of land that contains several lakes and brooks.

title: Boko Haram Female Bomber, Borno
description: 2 suspected female bombers died. One of them detonated the explosives and died while the other was shot dead by the Garrison snipers.
place: South of Umurari village, outskirt of Maiduguri.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of 7 Division Garrison and 112 Battalion of the Nigeria Army killed 5 Boko Haram terrorists and rescued 180 hostages during a 6-hour clean-up operation in five communities. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Menari, ulamari, Baale, Maafa, Zangebe and Kaltaram communities

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 Boko haram terrorists were killed during a military raid on their camps. 567 people were also rescued in the operation.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: In continuation with the clearance of the remnants of the Boko Haram terrorists, the Nigeria military troop killed 58 terrorist and lost 1 soldier.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army when the soldiers ambushed the insurgents. The troops laid in wait as the terrorists' crossed and engaged them in a deadly fight.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: The aide to Mr. Emeka Woke, Rivers State Chief of Staff, was killed by unknown gunmen suspected to be members of main opposition party a day after the national and state assemblies re-run elections.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 19 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Air Force and members of the 22 Brigade Garrison, who attacked the logistic base of the insurgents. One of the sec kingpins identified as Ameer of Dalore was among the dead. 67 hostages were rescued in the operation. A man that bears the tittle 'Ameer' was also killed in event in IBD007435.

title: Gunmen Vs Police, Benue
description: Unknown gunmen killed 2 policemen who were drafted to maintain peace in a community that was previously attacked by some armed militia. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Delta
description: Lucky Umukoro was shot dead by gunmen during a disagreement between Lawrence Ijeh and Marley Omatseye factions. The factions battled for who will become the community Chief Liaison Officer. The crisis has resulted in the deaths of many community indigenes.

title: Political/Electoral Violence, Rivers
description: 4 persons were killed in a local government during the national and state assemblies re-run elections. One of the victims, Gabriel Amachree, was shot dead by unknown gunmen suspected to be political thugs in a local government area. Also, a member of the Peace Corps was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber was ambushed and killed by soldiers of 25 Task Force Brigade. The event was reported with IBD008083, where 7 other insurgents were killed.

title: Political/Electoral Violence, Rivers
description: A member of the National Youth Service Corps was shot dead during the state and national assemblies re-run elections. The corps member was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Communal Crisis, Ebonyi
description: 2 men, Mr. Elijah Nomeh and Mr. Agashi Onuenyim, were killed in a communal conflict between 2 neighbouring communities of Ochienyim in Ebonyi state and Adadama in Cross River state. Both communities have been engaging one another in clashes for years.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 24 persons were killed when two female Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs in a mosque. While the first attacker targeted the mosque, the second attacker detonated the bomb 50 metres from the mosque. Several persons were injured in the attacks.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (24 ) , This Day (23 ) , The Punch (22 ) , The Nation (27 )

title: Gunmen, Zamfara
description: Gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers numbering about 100 on motorcycles killed 21 people, including 3 of the gunmen. Several others also sustained injuries.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: 7 members of the same family and 8 others were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The herdsmen attacked them when they confronted the herders over the grazing of their cow on their oranges.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by Cameroonian soldiers when the latter raided the terrorists' hideout in Northern Nigeria.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed 2 people, sack 25 villages and rendered close to 3,000 homeless after several houses and huts were razed.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Ukemberegya, Bwarer, Mbawar, Gov and Gambe Tiev communities

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens (that is, at least 2 dozens) of Boko haram insurgents and 2 soldiers lost their lives in an encounter with troops along a major highway.

title: Extra-judicial Killings, Borno
description: 65 people arrested in connection to Boko Haram insurgency in detention died as a result of harsh prison conditions. Most of them died from gunshot wounds, disease, suffocation and dehydration. The victims included 4 babies and 11 children. These deaths were reported to have occurred in March. Therefore, 15th of the month was assumed as the day of event since the exact date was not reported.
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (65 ) , This Day (65 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 13 people including 2 children and 4 local vigilantes popularly called 'Civilian JTF' were killed in Boko haram attacks. While 9 were killed, the 4 Civilian JTF died in IED explosions laid by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Attack, Borno
description: 3 civilian vigilantes were killed while 7 others injured by bomb planted by Boko Haram on their way to fight them.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko Haram member was killed by soldiers in an operation that was carried out in conjunction with local vigilantes. 3 insurgents were captured alive in the operation. Troops recovered one Dane gun, AK47 rifle magazine, two knives, assorted drugs and the sum of N142,000 from the terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 21 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the army during a raid on the terrorists' hideouts. 122 persons were rescued during the operations.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 4 cattle rustlers were killed by soldiers during a shootout. 3 rustlers were arrested and many of their camps were also destroyed. The operation was believed to have taken place in some forests in the capital although the exact location was not reported.

title: Political Violence, Rivers
description: A chieftain of All Progressive Party (APC), Barieene Court was shot dead by unknown gunmen. Series of politically motivated killings are being reported as the state prepares for run-off elections.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Kano
description: A cattle rustler was killed when a troop of soldiers attacked them. The troops recovered 126 cattle, 331 sheep, 10 donkeys and three camels from the rustlers.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: 5 cattle rustlers were killed by troops during a raid on their camps. 5 of those camps were destroyed and different riffles were recovered from them. This event is assumed to have happened in the state capital, Katsina, since no location was reported for the incident.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Kaduna
description: 2 rustlers were shot dead by soldiers during a raid on their camps. 7 of them were arrested and over 6 camps were destroyed.

title: Robbers' Attack, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen attacked a community and killed 2 victims-Sir David Nwadiolu and Mr Dina Utomi, a businessman. It is assumed that it happened on Saturday since it was reported to have happened last weekend..

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A suicide bomber died after he detonated an explosive. The victim was contracted by soldiers to weld a signal antena but detonated the explosion with the intention of killing the soldiers. It is assumed the victim belonged to Boko haram since they have been behind the several suicide explosions in the insurgency ravaged area.

title: 2 Sisters, Benue
description: 2 sisters were killed in their sleep by unknown gunmen. The victims had slept outside their home to take fresh air overnight when the were attacked and killed by the assailant. Their corpses were covered with sacks.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a confrontation with some youths. The victims were killed while trying to stop the herdsmen from grazing on the farming areas.

title: Farmers/ Herders Clash, Benue
description: 2 men, Terhembafan Akaajingir and Saawua Adiape , were killed when Fulani herdsmen raided some villages. Several people have died in recent weeks in similar attacks.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Army killed a leading member of the Boko Haram sect, who is on its wanted list of 100 terrorists. The victim was killed during a gun duel with the combined effort of the state security agencies. The date was not stated, it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 40 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a military operation aimed at flushing out the insurgents. The troops also captured one General Purpose Machine Gun(GPMG), one Rocket Propelled Grenade, 7 RPG, 6 AK47 rifles and other weapons.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 40 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen invaded some communities. Many houses and farm produces were also set ablaze. Several people have lost their lives in related attacks in recent times.
place: Uwev-Gov, Indyer, Meeme, Tse Hwer, Agbu, Atongo, Akoodo

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 18 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian army. The incident happened during an operation aimed at clearing out terrorists from the North-Eastern part of the country.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during 2 military operations aimed at flushing out the insurgents from their hideout.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during a military operation aimed at flushing out the insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Killing, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who move their cattle to graze on their farms.

title: Gunmen Kill 1, Delta
description: A 64-year-old man, Emmanuel Baah was shot dead by gunmen. The community involved in crisis over who becomes the Chief Liaison Officer of the oil rich community. Also, see event in IBD008926

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A raid by the military on the terrorists hideout led to the killing of 5 of them. The operation was carried out by Special Forces Team B, 7 Division Garrison. 63 people that were held captive by the terrorists were rescued from the raid. The date of the event was not stated, it is assumed that the incident happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Lawin Meteri, Mafiri Bulaka and Aljeri.

title: Gunmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: 12 victims including 2 septuagenarians were killed when unknown gunmen invaded a community. The victims included John Igbo (70), Imoni Ataya (75), Kogi John (18), Danfulani Audu (35) among others. 35 houses were burnt and dangerous weapons were recovered from the hoodlums. 2 suspects-Amos Omalex and Sunday Simon-were arrested in connection to the crime.
place: Agafu village in Loko Development Area.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram insurgents were killed when troops of the 155 Task Force Battalion dislodged them from their camp. An Explosive Device (IED) factory was also destroyed while 21 people including 8 men, 4 women and 9 children were rescued.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Community, Benue
description: 9 people were killed in an on-going raid on a community by Fulani herdsmen. This event is linked to IBD007850.

title: Assailants Vs Police, Plateau
description: A police corporal, Godfrey Michael, attached to Plateau State Government House was killed by unknown gunmen in the early hours of the day. The gunmen made away the victim's rifle.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 37 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by Nigerian military troops who raided the insurgents' medical facility. The troops also recovered IEDs meant for suicide bombings while 20 persons were rescued from the terrorists' den.

title: Bomb Blast, Adamawa
description: Several persons, including 4 police men, were killed during a bomb explosion. The blast happened when some bombs recovered from Boko Haram terrorists exploded in a police custody as a result of heat.
place: Adamawa Police Command's Anti-Bomb Squad and Motor Traffic Department, Jimeta
sources_of_information: The Guardian (24 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , Vanguard (40 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 9 people including an NSDC staff were killed by a gang of Fulani herdsmen during an invasion on some communities. Another source reported that the victims were killed during a religious crisis.
place: Sarkin Noma village in Dampar district

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 23 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a joint operation of Nigerian and Camerounian troops. About 150 hostages were freed in the operation. It was later reported that among the victims were 26 Boko Haram insurgents, a soldier and a local vigilante (Civilian JTF).

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Anambra
description: 2 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen while protecting their farms from being invaded by the herdsmen.

title: Gunmen Vs Monarch, Abia
description: Eze James Nwabeke, the traditional ruler of Ikeala Ahiaba Autonomous Community, was killed by 4 unknown gunmen. The gunmen invaded the victim's palace and shot him several times. Some other family members of the victim were injured in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmer, Oyo
description: A woman farmer was killed by Fulani herdsmen on her farm. It was reported that the farmer was beheaded on her farm by the herdsmen who have been wrecking havoc in the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some Boko Haram terrorists (it is assumed 10) were killed by troops of Nigeria Army during a clearance operation in some villages. A patent medicine store and market being used by the insurgents were destroyed by the army. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.
place: Kwaptara, Mijigete, Garin Boka, Mosole, Ngubdori, Ma'asa, Dukje and Gulumba

title: Political Violence, Benue
description: 3 persons, Okwoche Omale, Andrew Adaji and Audu Okopi, were killed in a political crisis between supporters of PDP (People's Democratic Party) and APC (All Progressive Congress). The crisis was triggered by a disagreement between a Local Government Area caretaker Chairman, Mr. Ijachi Ude of APC and his younger brother, Eje Ude of PDP.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 6 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who invaded a village at night when the villagers were preparing to go to bed. They shot at fleeing villagers, killing 5 persons. Also, an aged woman was burnt to ashes in one of the houses set ablaze by the terrorists.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents who had earlier set ablaze an elderly woman were killed by soldiers during an ambush in 2 locations. Several arms and motorcycles were retrieved from the insurgents.
place: Dole, Magar on the fringes of Algararno Forest
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (5 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 3 people lost their lives in a rivalry between the 2 villages of Ondo and Ogobia in the Ugboju district following alleged land dispute which snowballed into crisis between suspected members of PDP and All Progressives Congress (APC). The day of the incident was not given but assumed it happened in the middle of the month (15-02-2016).
place: Ondo and Ogobia in the Ugboju district

title: Boko Haram IED, Borno
description: A Camerounian Soldier was killed when a military vehicle ran into an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by Boko Haram insurgents along a road. 8 other soldiers sustained injuries. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Communal Clash, Ebonyi
description: One Eze Stephen was beheaded during a communal clash between the people of Ngbo and Agila communities. One Nwede Augustine was also kidnapped by unknown gunmen from Agila that invaded Ngbo community. 5 persons were injured during the invasion that occurred in the night. The 2 communities have been at war for long over boundary matters.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants assembled members of a community in a mosque and opened fire on them killing 22 people. The militants also ambushed and killed 8 villagers who were returning to the community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents attacked a Shuwa Arab settlement and killed 43 people including 3 women. Very few men escaped the attack. It is assumed that the incident happened on February 14, 2016.

title: Boko Haram Invasion, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents invaded a community and killed 4 victims. The criminals later made away with some food items and also set the village ablaze.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
