description: 10 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by a combined team of Nigeria and Cameroon soldiers during a clearance operation against insurgents. 45 persons comprising of 17 women and 28 children were rescued. The date of the incident could not be established but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Cameroonians soldiers carried out a cross-border operation and killed 27 Boko Haram insurgents. A soldier died in the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 6, Benue
description: 6 people were killed when gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen engaged community residents in a fight. The community has severally come under attacks by cattle herders. Several children and women were hospitalized after the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an ambush by soldiers. Since the exact figure of casualty was not reported, it is assumed that at least 10 of the insurgents were killed in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers laid ambush on Boko Haram insurgents and killed 5 of them. According to the report, the insurgents were on a retaliatory mission for the murder of one of their members in the area.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 25 Boko Haram insurgents were intercepted and killed by soldiers during a patrol. 103 civilian hostages were freed during the operation.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: Fulani herdsmen, numbering over 30 attacked a community and killed 2 members of a family. The victims were identified as Mr Fidelis Okeja and his sister, Mercy Oriefi Okeja. The attackers injured many people with cutlasses and fled into the bush after the attack.

title: Pro-Biafran Groups Vs Security Forces, Abia
description: A combined team of security agents, comprising of soldiers and policemen, killed 10 persons when they fired shots at Pro-Biafran protesters. The protesters, under the aegis of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), were protesting the long detention of their leader, Nnamdi Kanu. 30 other persons were injured. Amnesty International reported that 177 people were killed in the incident.
sources_of_information: The Nation (10 ) , Vanguard (22 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (177 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 62 persons were killed when 2 female suicide bombers detonated bombs in an Internally Displaced Persons' (IDPs) camp. Several people were injured in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 7 victims were killed in a suicide bomber attack by the boko haram insurgents. The incident was perpetrated in 2 communities.

title: Cattle Rustlers Vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: Cattle rustlers killed 50 persons when they attacked a village. The attackers fired at the residents,came on motorbikes and escaped into the forest with unspecified number of cows.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Tiv, Benue
description: 12 persons were killed in a fight between Fulani herdsmen and Tiv people. Several other persons were injured during the fight.
place: Tom Anyiin and Tom Ataan communities in Mbaya Tombu village

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 persons were killed by rampaging Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a village. The terrorists invaded the community on 10 bicycles and burnt down the whole village. 4 women and 1 boy were burnt dead in the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed some insurgents (assuming at least 5) during an operation. About 50 motorcycles and 3 vehicles were recovered from the insurgents as well. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Farmers vs Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: A bloody clash between some farmers and Fulani Herdsmen led to the death of 10 victims in a riverine settlement. The assailants were reported to have attacked the community from a neighbouring community in Nasarawa state.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: Some residents from Dalori village, who took refuge under a tree near an internally displaced persons' (IDP) camp, were killed by a suicide bomber. The bomber detonated the bomb among the villagers in the middle of the night and killed a lot of people. The second source said the attack took place right in the IDP camp. According to witnesses, the insurgents came with one Toyota Hilux at 5.30pm after sending a warning notice two days before. The fighting lasted for 3 hours and ten civilians were killed. In the camp nearby, 300 women and children tried to run away but were blocked on the road by the army, which suspected them to be create a diversion. Two rockets killed 50 women and 15 children at 7pm. The Army claimed it was a suicide bomber but it’s also possible that the Army launched the rockets to disperse the crowd.

title: Bandits Kill 10, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed when a gang of bandits invaded a village. Further casualties were prevented after anti-riot police men shot one of the attackers dead.

title: Extra-judicial Killing, Borno
description: Soldiers in search of Boko Haram insurgents raided a community and killed 32 residents. 4 women were victims of the killings, among which 1 was shot and 3 burnt to death. 28 male victims were shot while escaping the rampage. This incident reportedly occurred in February of 2016.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Over 85 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents in a renewed attacks on 3 communities. A source reported that the victims included women and children. Vanguard further reported that 3 female suicide bombers made their way into the crowd and blew up themselves, leaving many civilians dead. The insurgents appeared in military uniforms and deceived the residents. Over 100 other victims were reported to have been injured.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (85 ) , Other newspaper 2 (100 ) , The Guardian (101 ) , Vanguard (203 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 100 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by Nigerian army during a raid on the hideouts of the insurgents. About 1000 women and children were rescued during the operation.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers were intercepted by troops while trying to infiltrate a community. The bombers were blown up during the interception.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Adamawa
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a bomb in a crowded market and killed many people. The bomber was identified as a young boy.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , The Punch (15 )

title: Robbers vs Man, Ekiti
description: A man identified as a cleric was shot dead by armed robbers who attacked a police station with improvised explosive devices.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: A woman was beaten to unconsciousness by Fulani herdsmen who invaded her farm. She died few minutes in a hospital where she was taken to for treatment. It was reported the incident happened recently. Therefore, this incident is backdated by 2 days.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno 2
description: 5 persons died when they were attacked by members of the dreaded Boko Haram insurgents. The victims had gone to gather firewood when they were attacked by the terrorists. Their corpses were recovered by the youth vigilante group.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female Boko Haram suicide bombers struck a market and killed 12 people. 2 of the attacks were also blown up. The attack occurred in the same community where over 200 school girls were abducted in 2014.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Vanguard (16 ) , The Nation (15 ) , The Punch (14 )

title: Gunmen Vs Police men, Kaduna
description: 2 policemen, Sergeant Silas Isa and Sergeant Joshua Kasim, were shot dead in an ambush by unknown gunmen. The victims were men of the Police Highway Patrol unit on routine patrol. They came under attack by a gang of eight gunmen in military camouflage uniforms.

title: Boko Haram/ Fulani Herdsmen, Adamawa
description: 63 people including a serving DPO, Okozie Okereofor and his team members, were killed when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen raided 4 villages. There were conflicting reports on the true identity of the perpetrators. The sources also reported that the perpetrators are Boko Haram insurgents. However, the causality figures varied by sources.
place: Demsare, Wunamokoh, Dikajam and Taboungo communities
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (31 ) , The Nation (63 ) , The Punch (61 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Yobe
description: An old man was killed when members of the Boko Haram sect invaded a local government area. The man was killed by the insurgents outside his house before they burnt it down.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 14 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a coordinated operations by soldiers. A large cache of arms were recovered from the slain insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: A 35-year-old man was killed when some Fulani herdsmen invaded a village. The victim was shot dead when he tried to stop the herdsmen from entering the village. Farmlands were destroyed after the herdsmen got rid of their challenger.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 3 suicide bombers were intercepted at a military checkpoint and killed by soldiers. This incident was part of event IBD007665, where about 60 insurgents were killed in 1 week.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a fierce battle between the terrorists and troops from the Nigerian army stationed in the hometown of the Chief of Army staff, Lt. General Tukur Buratai.

title: Army vs Pro-Biafria Group, Abia
description: 8 persons were shot dead by soldiers during a protest by members of the Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign States of Biafra (MASSOB) and Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB). 30 other persons were injured. One of the dead was identified as 20-year-old Chidozie Okafor, an apprentice who was hit by live bullets as he stepped out from a canteen.
place: St Michael's Road, Azikiwe Road, Ariaria, Aba
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Nation (8 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (8 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Some soldiers were killed when their military vehicle exploded on the road as a result of mines planted by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Cameroonian Soldiers vs Boko Harams, Borno
description: 6 villagers including 4 members of a family were killed when Cameroonian soldiers in pursuit of Boko haram insurgents fired a rocket-propelled grenades at them. Two of the aged victims were dragged out and killed by the soldiers.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Taraba
description: 3 herdsmen were killed by cattle rustlers during a raid. 600 cattle were stolen in the process. Some women were also kidnapped to unidentified place.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 60 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a raid on the sect's camps in different locations. The incident happened within 1 week.
place: Afe, Kudiye, Mijigete, Souma and Mida

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 15 Boko Haram insurgents and 1 soldier lost their lives during a gun battle between the terrorists and the security men. The incident happened when the terrorists attempted to take over a military base.
place: 120 Task Force Battalion of the Army Base, Goniri

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Farmer, Enugu
description: A farmer, Onwura Hyacinth Ani, was shot dead on his farm by some Fulani herdsmen. The herdsmen killed Mr. Ani because they were infuriated by his complaint about the destruction of his farmland.

title: Traditional Ruler, Plateau 1
description: A traditional ruler, was killed by unknown gunmen. The victim, Dah Ali Magaji, who was the Makai Forof of his community before he was hacked to death by his assailants. The incident was reported to have occurred in January 2016. It is assumed that it happened in the middle of the month (2016-01-15). This event is related to many other 2 events where traditional rulers were killed in the LGA. The events were reported in IBD009094 and IBD009096.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Kogi
description: A herder, Haruna, was attacked and killed in his farm by 2 cattle rustlers, Muhammed Lawal Jauro and Yusuf Sanni. Both men were later sentenced to death by hanging. The incident is assumed to have happened around 15th of January since no day was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: Scores of people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a community. 23 cows were also killed by the assailants.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 6 people were killed and 8 others injured during a midnight attack by Boko Haram on a community. 2 houses of prominent indigenes of the community were razed down by the assailants.

title: Extra-judicial Killing, Adamawa
description: 2 men accused of being Boko Haram fighters (Idrisa Dele and Umaru Hammankadi) were shot dead by soldiers. Their bodies were dumped by the roadside with bullet wounds. The killings sparked off protest by the village women.

title: IED Kills Boy, Plateau
description: A 9-year-old child, Dalyop Chollom, was killed by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) while his 2 younger brothers were injured. The children were playing with the device, which was concealed inside a shopping bag, when it suddenly exploded.

title: Armed Youths, Delta
description: A 40-year-old man, Afor Emero person was killed when armed youths attacked a Shoprite complex. The crisis started when a misunderstanding broke out between a council chief and a naval officer.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked two communities. The terrorists, who rode on bicycles, shot at villagers who fled to safety. They also looted food and burnt large part of the villages.

title: Kidnap Monarch Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: The body of the kidnapped paramount ruler of Ubulu-Uku Kingdom in Aniocha North Local Government Area of Delta State, His Royal Majesty Akaeze Edward Ofolue III, was recovered. He was kidnapped by Fulani herdsmen along with his driver. A corpse of a Hausa man was also found by in the same bush.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 5 persons were killed and many others were severely injured when a Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a bomb in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) camp. The bomber, identified as a man, detonated the bomb amidst a crowd in the camp.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nassarawa
description: 30 farmers were killed during a renewed crisis between farmers and fulani herdsmen. 5 other victims (including a woman and 3 children) were said to have drowned while trying to escape from the crisis. It was said to be a reaction to a previous attack where a herdsman was killed (IBD007536). Several houses were also burnt by the hoodlums.

title: Army Vs Bandits, Bauchi
description: Some bandits were killed in a gun battle with a detachment of soldiers from the 33 Artillery Brigade. 3 AK 47 rifles, 4 magazines, 147 rounds of 7.63 mm special ammunition were recovered from the bandits by the army.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: Some Fulani herdsmen were attacked by Agatu farmers when they brought their cattle to feast on their farms. 3 of the herdsmen were declared missing and the corpse of one of them was later discovered. The event is linked to a reprisal attack in event IBD007533. The date of the event was not reported it is assumed that it happened a week before it was reported.

title: Cultists, Rivers
description: 2 terror cultists, Mr. Sunday Okogbule popularly called DD the White Lion and his close colleague were killed and their heads severed by unknown gunmen. The victims were responsible for series of attacks on the community lately. The killings were believed to be reprisal attacks by rival cult groups. Because of the tone of the report, it is assumed the 2 incidents happened in the past one week from the report. Therefore, this event is backdated by a week of its report.

title: Boko Haram Kidnap, Maiduguri
description: Boko Haram allegedly kills 8 and kidnaps 2 children right in the middle of Maiduguri. Perhaps this incident was not reported in the media because of the pressure of the government, which claimed that Boko Haram was "technically defeated"

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An attack by the Boko Haram sect led to the death of over 60 victims. The insurgents had confronted some soldiers to divert their attention in the morning but later struck their target in the evening time. Many female suicide bombers (14) struck at different times. It was reported that soldiers killed 7 of the suicide bombers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female suicide bombers detonated explosives in a marketplace and killed over 30 persons. The twin bomb attacks took place in a motor park and another market within the same LGA.

title: 2 in Cult War, Delta
description: A renewed cult war claimed the lives of 2 persons. Many properties were including 10 vehicles destroyed during the crisis. According to a subsequent report, Mr. John Mobor and 6 others were killed in the fight.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 16 males and 11 females were slaughtered while others sustained injuries during a Boko Haram attack.

title: 16 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 16 people were killed and dozens injured when Boko Haram insurgents stormed a village on bicycles. The insurgent later set the village ablaze.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (13 ) , Daily Trust (14 ) , The Punch (16 )

title: Suspected Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Taraba
description: Suspected Fulani Herdsmen murdered 2 persons and injured many others when the assailants attacked villagers who were asleep in the middle of the night.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 3 female suicide bombers between the ages of 10 to 15-years, killed 11 people including themselves, and injured over 30 others. One of the sources said 4 women and 3 men were killed in the attacks.

title: 30 in Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect members killed 30 civilians in 3 villages in the state. 20 were killed in Warwara, 6 victims in Bura-Shira and 4 victims in Mangari. The date of the event was not reported, it is assumed it occurred 2 days before it was reported.

title: Communal Clash, Kwara
description: 7 people were killed while 30 others were injured and 50 houses razed in renewed communal clash between the people of Share and Tsaragi over land. A subsequent source reported that about 40 people were killed in the land crisis.

title: Boko Haram vs Cameroon Army, Borno
description: 70 members of the dreaded Boko Haram sect were killed by a battalion of Cameroonian troops when the latter chased the insurgents across the border from northern Cameroon. Another version of the report said that the victims were civilian population. The area was one of the villages captured and declared as caliphate in August last year when about 150 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 3 suspected Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the Nigerian army troops when the sect invaded some communities in the LGA. One of the leaders of the sect, Ameer was killed in the attack. The exact date of the event was not stated. It is assumed that the incident happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: A deadly encounter between the Army and Boko Haram insurgents led to the death of 9 members of the sect. Weapons such as 4 AK-47 and a pump action gun were recovered from the sect. The date of the incident was not stated it is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 49 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. 154 captives were rescued from the insurgents' den.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 people including 4 Boko Haram bombers and 1 vigilante died in suicide bombs. The suicide bombers were intercepted at a military checkpoint before detonating the bombs that killed 4 of them and the vigilante. Another version reported that the bombers were shot dead by the vigilantes.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Police vs Protesters, Kaduna
description: 3 Shiite members protesting the arrest of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky were shot dead by the police. The crisis has been ongoing since the clash between soldiers and sect members occurred recently.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Boko Haram Ambush, Borno
description: A soldier was killed in a Boko Haram ambush. The officer was in a military convoy returning from a working visit when they were ambushed on the road.
place: Between Bama and Konduga by Sambisa forest.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many people (assuming 20) including Boko Haram terrorists and civilians lost their lives when soldiers bombarded a community from a nearby village. The victims included a woman and her 3 children. The incident was reported to have occurred late in 2015 without specific mention of the month and day. It is therefore assumed it occurred around December of 2015, when people fled the village.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Insurgents invaded a village on motorcycles and bicycles and killed 8 persons and burnt several houses.

title: Army Vs Shiite, Kaduna
description: Many people were reported killed during a heavy fighting between men of the Nigerian army and members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, also known as Shiite. Some of the killings happened when members of the sect attempted to block the convoy of the Chief of Army Staff, Lt.-Gen Yusuf Buratai. Others died when troops surrounded the house of the leader of the movement, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The wife and the son of the leader were also killed in the event. The dead included Sayyid Aliy, son of the leader of the movement, Sayyid Ibraheem Zakzaky, Wife of Sayyid Ibraheem, Malama Zeenat Ibraheem among others. Another source reported that a Colonel, yakubu Dankaduna was killed by the Shi'ites during the crisis.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , The Nation (20 ) , Daily Trust (300 ) , Vanguard (1000 ) , Nigerian Tribune (61 ) , Web Newspaper (300 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (349 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (351 )

title: Bandits Kill 3, Zamfara
description: A gang of bandits invaded a village and killed 3 persons. It was reported that similar incident had happened 2 weeks ago in a nearby village. The date of the event was not stated. It is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 2, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed when cattle rustlers invaded a community. The invaders stormed the community on motorcycles and their large numbers. They also stole many cattle.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: A Fulani ruler was killed when cattle rustlers invaded his kingdom. The Sarkin Fulani Yero of Gawu Babangida died after he was inflicted with machete cuts by his assailants.

title: Boko Haram Kills 14, Borno
description: 14 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents invaded the hometwon of the Chief of Army Staff, Lieutenant Gekneral Buratai. Some of the victims were decapitated and their heads placed on their torso.

title: Boko Haram Kills 14, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents killed 14 people when they invaded the village. The assailants later set the village on fire.

title: Bandits Kill 20, Zamfara
description: A gang of gunmen (in motorbikes) killed about 20 people when a deadly attack was carried out on a village. The attack was believed to be a reprisal one for a previous attack launched by gunmen in another LGA (IBD007309).

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists who attempted to escape from military onslaught in the Sambisa forest were intercepted and killed by soldiers. It is assumed about 10 of the insurgents were killed since there was no report of the casualty figures. This events is also backdated by 2 days from the date of its report since the date was not reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Farmers, Benue
description: 6 persons were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers. It was reported that a skirmish erupted in a community after the local people mobilised themselves and overran a Fulani settlement in the area to stop a large herd of cattle and herdsmen from gaining access into the village.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming 2 scores at least) of Boko haram insurgents were killed when soldiers, assisted by Air Force, bombarded Sambisa forest. The forest has remained the insurgent's stronghold until this recent invasion. 3 soldiers died in the operation. Several women, children and about 2,000 cows were recovered in the operation.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 persons were killed in a twin suicide attacks carried out by Boko Haram insurgents. One of the suicide bombers attempted to enter a market and the bomb on him detonated prematurely. A woman and her baby were injured in the process. The second bomb was detonated by a female suicide bomber who blew up herself and 2 others at a security checkpoint.

title: Transport Union Crisis, Lagos
description: The leader of a transport union in Lagos Island area was killed by unknown assailants. He was killed when he attempted to settle a crisis among union members in another location.

title: Gunmen Vs Police, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen shot the Divisional Crime Officer (DCO) at Igwuruta Police Division to death.

title: Political Violence, Bayelsa
description: The Vice Chairman of All Progressives Congress (APC) Ward 1 in Odi community, Diseye Dickson, was murdered by unknown gunmen. His killing is presumed to be connected with the December 5, 2015 governorship election.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Kano
description: An exchange of gun fire between cattle rustlers and security operatives led to the death of 11 rustlers. 7 of them were also arrested. The date of the event was not stated but due to the manner it was reported, it is assumed that it happened a week before it was reported.

title: Pro-Biafra Vs Security Forces, Anambra
description: 9 persons, including 2 policemen and a hawker, were killed during a protest by Pro-Biafran groups comprising of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and Movement for the Actualisation of Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB). The deceased died in a clash that ensued between security forces and the protesters during the protest. Some of the victims were identified as Chima Onoh, Kenneth Ogadinma, Angus Chikwado, Felicia Egwuatu and Nkiruka.
place: Niger Bridge Head, Obodoukwu Road and Eze Iweka Road in Onithsa
sources_of_information: Vanguard (9 ) , The Guardian (13 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Nation (11 )

title: Violent Protest, Anambra
description: A man was killed during a violent protest by Indigenous People of Biafara (IPOB) over the detention of their leader, Nnamdi Kanu.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a farming community and killed 6 men. Several others were seriously injured in the attack that witnessed the carting away of personal items and livestocks.

title: Unknown Gunmen Vs Villagers, Zamfara
description: 4 persons, including an 11-year-old girl who was selling bean cake, were killed by unknown gunmen who attacked a village. The gunmen arrived the village in the night while the residents were getting ready to go to bed. They opened fire on their victims, leading to the death of 4 people.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Gombe
description: Some Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed a farmer. The victim had confronted the herdsmen when they invaded his farmland. The assailants thereafter beat him to death. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 1 soldier lost his life while 20 Boko Haram terrorists were killed when the insurgents launched an attack in a town. The situation resulted in a fierce gun battle between soldiers and the insurgents. The attacks lasted for several hours. There were different figures from various sources.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (21 ) , Daily Trust (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (3 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Youths, Delta
description: A palm wine tapper, Mr. Japhet Inibu, was killed and another person identified as Thompson Ogege was critically injured during a clash between some youths in a community and Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the Fulani herders, who were armed with dangerous weapons including AK-47 rifles, attempted to forcefully graze their cattle on a community's farmlands.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: 4 cattle rustlers were shot dead by a team of soldiers during a raid. Several livestock including cows, sheep, goats and donkeys were recovered.

title: Student, Ondo
description: A student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Olumuyiwa Awarawon was killed by 7 members of a para-military organisation, 'Cadets' in the campus led by one Adeola Adedoyin. He was beaten into coma and died 7 days later.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a village. Several teenage girls were also abducted from the village. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported. The event is related IBD007274 where a woman and a man were killed by Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 persons including a soldiers, a man and a woman were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a village. The insurgents also carted away foodstuff. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Police vs Robbers, Kogi
description: 3 people including a policeman, Sergeant Patrick Sunday and 2 armed robbers were killed during a shootout with the police during a bank robbery. The bandits numbering about 20 had attacked Akengwu Community Bank before the police intervention.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 8 persons, including a female suicide bomber and 4 other women, died when the bomber detonated an Improvise Explosives Device strapped to her body in the midst of a crowd near a checkpoint.
sources_of_information: The Punch (8 ) , The Nation (7 ) , This Day (6 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 7 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a village. Several properties were also destroyed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 3 Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers on patrol. Some items and 3 women were rescued during the raid.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomb Blast, Kano
description: 50 persons were killed when 2 female suicide bombers detonated bombs in a market place. Several other persons were injured in the incident. There were different death figures from various sources A source stated that 8 children and 7 women were among the dead victims.
place: GSM Market, Farm Centre, Kano Metropolis
sources_of_information: Vanguard (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Daily Trust (50 ) , The Guardian (29 ) , Other newpapers 1 (17 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Hundreds of people were killed and their corpses dumped in the river and under a bridge by Boko Haram sect. This event was backdated by 7 days. The number of deaths is also assumed to be at least 200.
place: Under the bridge, and in the Yadzeram river in Bama.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Adamawa
description: 31 persons were killed in a bomb blast that was masterminded by Boko Haram terrorists. The blast happened in a park and killed mainly women, children, food sellers, petty traders as well as those who patronised their businesses. Several other person were injured in the blast.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked 157 Battalion of the Nigerian Army and 105 soldiers were killed in the process. The story which was reported by an online news media was denied by the Army Public Relations at the Defence Headquarters.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 40 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army supported by the Air Force aircraft. The incident happened when the troops embarked on an operation to clear some enclaves of terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported. Another source gave 26 deaths.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 80 villagers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village in the early hours of the day. Several other persons were injured in the raid. Properties worth millions of Naira were also destroyed.

title: Villagers Vs Rustlers, Katsina
description: 4 cattle rustlers, who invaded a village in 2 separate attacks and carted away many animals, were killed by the villagers.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of Nigeria Army on an operation to rid the north-east of terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of Nigeria Army during an operation to rid the north-east of terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 18 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of Nigeria Army on an operation to rid the north-east of terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.This event is item 2 in the uploaded source.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by the military troops on counter-insurgency operation when the insurgents, who attacked a military base, were repelled. The terrorists wanted to take over a military base but were engaged in fierce battle wherein 7 terrorists were gunned down.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army who were on operation to clear terrorist camps. Several women and children were rescued in the mission. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. 61 persons held captive by the sect were rescued by the troops.

title: Cultists, Anambra
description: 2 people died and 7 others injured when two cult groups clashed. About 10 cultists who were involved in the matter used broken bottles, clubs and guns during the crisis,

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Villagers, Kogi
description: Armed Fulani herdsmen invaded 9 different communities and killed more than 22 persons in an early morning attack. Several persons were also wounded in the attack while so many other people were missing.
place: Agoeju, Ikpoba, Ojeh, Ajomojayi, Ajadaji, Idochi, Ojiyanawo, Ulaja and Oganenigu Communities.

title: Land Crisis, Lagos
description: Land grabbers, called Omo-Onile, in a bid to forcefully collect money for a property sold in the area, killed a 30-year-old-man called Samuel, who was on his way to his workshop.
place: Aimasiko Street, Ekoro Road in Abule Egba.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram terrorists (we assume 10) were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army during an operation aimed at clearing the terrorists camps. 14 children and 6 women were rescued from the camps of the insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: A 42-year-old vigilante, Chinwuba Ekwueme, was killed by Fulani herdsmen who were grazing in a community. The victim was shot dead with an Ak-47 riffle. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Pro-Biafrian Group, Enugu
description: 2 persons were shot dead by members of Anambra State Vigilante Service. The deceased were members of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) who were protesting the detention of one of their members, Nnamdi Kanu by security agencies.

title: Rustler Vs Fulani Herdsman, Kano
description: Armed cattle rustlers stormed the cattle herd of a Fulani herdsman, Malam Habu, killed his son and whisked away 150 cows. It was reported that the rustlers fired sporadically before killing the boy and rustling the cattle. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Election Tribunal Judgment, Taraba
description: 30 persons were killed and many others were injured during a crisis sparked off by the verdict of the Taraba State Election Petition Tribunal. The Tribunal sacked Governor Darius Ishaku of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and declared Senator Aisha Alhassan of the All Progressive Congress (APC) winner of the governorship poll.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , The Guardian (30 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Bandits Vs Vigilantes, Zamfara
description: 16 local vigilante volunteers popularly known as "Yan Sa Kai" were killed by bandits who ambushed them in a village. It was reported that the vigilantes were on their way back from patrol of neighbouring villages when the armed bandits caught them unaware. The bandits opened fire on the vigilantes. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of 5 Brigade Task Group when the latter engaged in the clearing of the terrorists camps. During the operation, the troops engaged the terrorist sin a gun battle, leading to the death of 2 Boko Haram terrorists. Dane (2) / double barrel (1) guns and 12 motorcycles were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram terrorists were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army when they cleared camps belonging to the terrorists. Several persons comprising of women and children were rescued from the camps.
place: Lassa, Muthavo, Dagu, Kumabza, Izge, Unworo, Zangore, Kilekasa and Pumpum

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 members of Boko Haram who were holed up in a primary school were shot dead by soldiers on patrol. Several ammunition and solar panels were recovered from them.

title: Police vs Cattle Rustlers, Kano
description: 2 cattle rustlers were killed by the police and several cows and sheep restored. The victims were killed when they engaged the police in a shootout.

title: Gunmen Vs Motorcyclist, Lagos
description: A motorcyclist identified as Umar was shot dead by unknown gunmen when he refused to let go his motorcycle as they attempted to snatch it from him. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Attack 6, Abuja (FCT)
description: 6 family members were attacked and killed by unknown gunmen with AK-47 in a herders' camp. 5 women and a man were victims of the heinous attack.
place: Near Pyakasa village along airport road.

title: Soldiers Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 34 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a raid on the terrorists' camps. 338 captives of the insurgents, comprising of women and children, were rescued.
place: Bulajilin, Manaeashe along Bita and Damboa roads near the Sambisa Forest

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: The troops of the Nigerian Army ambushed and killed 4 Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists were on a suicide bombing mission before they were killed. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Kills 8, Borno
description: 8 villagers fleeing from Boko Haram attacks were pursued and shot dead by the insurgents. The victims were rounded up and killed just as they were about celebrating their escape.

title: Farmers-Herdsmen Clash, Oyo
description: 1 policeman was killed while mediating a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 5 persons including 4 suicide bombers believed to have come from Boko haram in an attempted suicide bombing. The bombers blew themselves up before they could get to their targets. This attack was reported differently by various sources. According to a private CJTF source in Maiduguri, a CJTF who tried to arrest the suicide bombers was injured and died later in hospital.
sources_of_information: The Nation (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 28 worshippers were killed during an early morning prayer in a mosque when a suicide bomber detonated a bomb. Several persons were injured in the attack. 1 or 2 suicide bombers also died.
sources_of_information: The Nation (28 ) , The Guardian (21 ) , The Punch (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (23 ) , Daily Trust (27 ) , Other newpapers 1 (11 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Adamawa
description: 27 worshippers were killed during a prayer in a mosque when a suicide bomber detonated a bomb after the Imam finished his sermon. Several persons were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (27 ) , The Guardian (27 ) , The Punch (18 ) , Daily Trust (33 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (61 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 20 persons were shot dead by Boko Haram terrorists on a road outside a village. The victims were passengers in 4 cars when they were attacked by members of the dreaded sect who were fleeing from a military offensive on their camp.

title: Joint Task Force Vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) killed over 150 Boko Haram terrorists and rescued 36 women and children. The incident happened when the security outfit ambushed the insurgents who were planning a massive attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Villagers, Taraba
description: 8 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked a village. The armed men numbering over 41 invaded the village in the midnight, shooting sporadically and killing the 8 victims.

title: Gunmen Vs Trader, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen shot a 48-year-old trader, Mr Sunday Okpeka dead. The man was shot through the burglary proof of his shop while he was trying to close after the day's sales.
place: Emore Road opposite St John the Baptist Catholic Church, Oleh

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Adamawa
description: 2 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during an encounter between the terrorists and the army. 16 families were also rescued during the operations by the army.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Kano
description: 3 Senegalese cattle rustlers (Umar Dogo Ndaiye, Datti Umar Rodi and Mammadu Dogo) were gunned down by the police during a shootout.

title: Soldiers killed by Boko Haram, Borno
description: 40 soldiers are killed by Boko Haram in Gwoza. Their bodies are brought to Maiduguri Teaching Hospital on 19/10/2015. The incident was never reported in the press or publicized by the army.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers vs Army, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber was shot dead by soldiers when she attempted to enter a military barrack. The bomb exploded on her body before she was shot.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers, who disguised as fleeing villages detonated explosives and killed 12 persons in a bush where many people hid from Boko Haram attackers.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: Many persons were killed while others were critically injured when a Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a bomb in a mosque. The incident happened when the evening prayer session was about to start.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , The Nation (42 ) , Nigerian Tribune (39 ) , The Guardian (14 )

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the 5 Brigade ambushed Boko Haram insurgents who had earlier attacked some military posts. The soldiers killed 10 of the terrorists.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Kogi
description: 11 persons including a soldier and 10 Islamic sect members died during a raid on the sect's hideout. The sect was fingered in a recent invasion on a DSS office in recent time. One of the sources reported that the insurgents were members of Boko Haram.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (11 ) , Daily Trust (16 ) , The Punch (7 ) , The Nation (10 ) , This Day (15 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: Scores of people ( that is, at least 40) were killed by Boko Haram suicide bombers who detonated bombs at 4 different locations.
place: Tudun Natsira and Banakwai, Ajilari area of Gommari

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 persons were killed when Boko Haram terrorists attacked a village. The attackers rode on motorbikes and destroyed many houses and properties worth millions of Naira.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An 80-year-old man and a boy were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a remote community in a local government area.

title: Rustler Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Niger
description: A rustler identified as Usman Aliyu killed the son of Magaji Ruwa, the head of Fulani camp in a community.

title: Gunmen Attack, Bayelsa
description: Unknown gunmen attacked an army post, stole some arms and ammunition and killed a civilian guard, Mr Austin Ikechukwu Igwe. He was killed because it was suspected he recognised one of them.

title: Boko Haram Beheads Soldier, Borno
description: A Boko Haram terrorist was shown beheading a soldier also, dead bodies of slain soldiers were shown in a video clip released by the sect.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before the release of the video, the location was not given but it is assumed that it happened in Sambisa Forest. Also, the total number of slain soldiers were assumed to be 6.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: A father and his son were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The attacks were carried out on Sunday Macintosh and his 5-year-old son, Ebi.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 100 fleeing Boko Haram insurgents and 7 soldiers were killed during an attempt to overrun a military base. There have been increased attacks on security and public facilities since the 2015 Independence day celebration. 8 soldiers were wounded.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (107 ) , Other newpapers 1 (107 ) , Nigerian Tribune (107 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombing, Yobe
description: 18 persons were killed when 3 teenage Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated their bombs at 3 different locations in a state. 1 mosque was attacked. The first blast killed 11 people while two other bombs killed 6 persons and 1 person respectively. Event IBD006866, where about 100 sect members were killed was also reported.
place: Buhari Estate, Fulani Settlement behind Zanna Zakariya Housing Estate, Hospital

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers blew themselves up and 15 others in 2 mosques. The explosives went off inside and outside the mosque during early morning prayers. One of the sources reported that scores died in the explosion. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) died. In one of the reports, 100 sect members were killed in Yobe by soldiers (IBD006866)

title: Army VS Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 7 persons died in a botched attack by 4 Boko Haram suicide bombers who came in military uniform. 2 of the bombers detonated their bombs and killed 3 people while 2 other suicide bombers were killed by the army.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: A military base was attacked by Boko Haram insurgents and 3 soldiers were killed. According to the source most of the insurgents (it is assumed 10 since most of them came in groups) were killed in the encounter.
place: Sector 1 of 27 Task Force Brigade located at Geidam

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers. Several weapons were also seized from them. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: 8 persons were killed by armed bandits who attacked a community. The assailants also burnt 70 local grain silos and 19 residential houses.

title: Farmers Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: A 17-year-old herdsman was killed in a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen over the destruction of farmlands by grazing animals. The victim, Jae Abubakar, was shot dead while another of his colleague was severely wounded.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Borno
description: Many persons were killed in a multiple explosions that rocked the state capital. The incident happened in the morning. A source recorded 10 deaths while another stated that scores died (at least 40) in the at the attack. Most of the victims were said to be women and children. Event IBD006839, where Boko Haram killed 8 victims is also contained in the source.
place: Kayamla and Dalori along Bama Road

title: Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: A man was killed during a reprisal attack by cattle rustlers. The village was attacked last month and several people were killed.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, FCT (Abuja)
description: 15 persons were killed, including a suicide bomber, while 20 were injured in twin bombings carried out by Boko Haram insurgents. The first attacker was a 15-year-old female suicide bomber who detonated the bomb on her body in front of a police station. The second attacker was a male terrorist who dropped off a bomb, concealed in a bag, in a market. The second bomb killed more people. There was another bomb explosion in Nyanya part of FCT, killing 3 as in IBD006848 making the total victims 18.
place: Kuje Police Station and Zamfara Market

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, FCT (Abuja)
description: 3 persons were killed by a female Boko Haram suicide bomber who attempted to scale a fence into a police station. She detonated a bomb in the process, killing 3 victims and injuring 21. This event is related to IBD006847, where a twin was released by Boko Haram and killed 15 victims at Kuje market in FCT.

title: IDP Bama Camp, Malnutrition/Starvation, Borno
description: Several people died in Bama camp between late 2015 and mid 2016 from starvation and harsh conditions. Many of the victims are people who had escaped Boko Haram insurgency. Different sources quoted different fatalities ranging 46 to 150 and 800. However, the highest quoted fatalities was 1233. The army and civilian Joint Task Force were fingered in the deaths. 163 of the fatalities was captured in event in IBD008805. This incident therefore captures the remaining 1070 is captured in this incident. It is assumed that starvation resulted directly from the diversion of food aid and restrictions on freedom of movement, as people were forbidden by Army and CJTF to leave the camp.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomb, Borno
description: 14 people were killed while many others were injured in multiple bomb blasts which ripped through a residential area. 4 bombs were detonated by suicide bombers identified as teenage girls. The bombers visited the area in a tricycle when people were preparing to pray. One of the bombers detonated a bomb near a mosque.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 11 persons were killed and several properties were destroyed by Boko Haram militants who raided 3 villages in a LGA. The event recorded 3 women casualties in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 3 officers of Nigeria Immigration Service were reported to have been killed in the North East within 2 weeks. However, it was not reported which part of the North East the officers were killed. It is therefore assumed that the victims were killed in Borno and in the state capital.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: Mr. Ibrahim Munkairi was shot dead by cattle rustlers. His 2 bulls were also carted away by the criminals.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unnamed Boko Haram kingpin was killed by the Nigerian troops involved in the ongoing counter-insurgency operations in the north-east. The victim was killed in a shootout with some soldiers. One AK 47 rifle was recovered from the victim. Another leader of the sect, Alhaji Tijani Usman Damagun was arrested in another attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect invaded a community and killed 20 persons. The community had suffered series of deadly attacks in the recent past from the terrorists. Several other persons were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (20 ) , The Guardian (20 ) , The Nation (9 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers laid ambush on Boko haram and killed 2 fleeing insurgents. Several weapons were also recovered from them. A general purpose machine gun an 1 AK47 were recovered from the assailants.

title: Boko Haram vs DSS, Kogi
description: 4 persons including an anti-riot policeman were killed when Boko haram invaded DSS office. About 30 detainees in the DSS custody were freed during the attack.
place: DSS office along Hassan Katsina Road

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Ogun
description: Agbaose Sewotan was killed by some Fulani herdsmen after he complained of their invasion on his farm. This incident seems to be an old one from the context of the report. Therefore, this event is backdated by a week.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 officers of the Nigerian Immigration Service were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. There was no report on the date of incident. Therefore, this event is backdated by 7 days from the date of report due to the nature of the killings.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adawawa
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed scores (at least 40 deaths) of farmers and herdsmen, returning from their farm and set houses ablaze.
place: Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Community, Niger
description: 50 persons, including a police man, a district head of Allawa village and his brother, were killed by some Fulani herdsmen during a midnight raid. The assailants invaded the village brandishing weapons and sophisticated guns which they shot at villagers. Several people were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Nation (36 ) , The Guardian (50 ) , The Punch (35 )

title: Custom Officer vs Gunmen, Imo
description: A team of policemen raided a community and arrested over 48 persons in connection with the killing of a Custom officer by an unknown gunmen. The assailants had carried out the attack on some Custom officers at a checkpoint. Chibuzo Ike and Henry Ndubuisi Simon were arrested as prime suspects to the murder.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Borno
description: Scores were killed when four bombs exploded within 25 minutes in an area close to an airport. One of the bombs exploded near a mosque where people were praying.
place: Ajilari Cross in Gommari, near Maiduguri Airport
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , The Guardian (54 ) , Nigerian Tribune (60 ) , Independent (64 )

title: 200 in Boko Haram Blast, Borno
description: Many victims were reported killed and 62 others injured during bomb attacks in a town. One of the explosions, hit the Onion section of a local market in the town. Different figures were recorded from various sources.
sources_of_information: The Punch (50 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Other newspaper 2 (25 ) , This Day (200 )

title: 40 in Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 passenger buses and killed scores of people (at least 40). However, police source reported that only 3 passengers were killed including 2 women and 1 man.

title: Chibok Girls' Parents, Borno
description: 4 parents of the kidnapped Chibok girls were killed by Boko Haram terrorists during raids by the insurgents. 11 other parents were reported to have died as a result of the trauma they suffered from the kidnap of their children. The date of this incident was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 1 year ago.

title: Herdsmen Kill 20, Plateau
description: 20 persons were killed during a raid on some communities by Fulani herdsmen. This recent attack came few days a 9-man reconciliatory committee was set up by the state government to resolve the recurring conflict between farmers and the herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram vs IDP, Adamawa
description: Many persons were killed in a bomb blast that rocked an internally displaced persons' camp. 13 people were also injured in the bomb blast believed to have been carried out by Boko Haram. The victims included four NEMA officials and student volunteers from the American University of Nigeria (AUN)

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Adamawa
description: 5 persons were killed in a bomb blast by Boko Haram insurgents near a market in a town. The bomb was detonated by a female suicide bomber. Several other people were injured in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A commercial cab driver and a member of the local Nigeria Vigilante Group were killed in separate attacks by Boko Haram members. The incident happened when the terrorists forced locals in the affected area to join their terror group.

title: Boko Haram Vs Security Operatives, Kaduna
description: 10 terrorists were killed by a combined team of Nigerian Army, Nigerian Airforce (NAF), the police, the Directorate of State Department (DSS) and the Nigeria Customs Service. The incident happened during a war against insurgency in the northwest of Nigeria. 64 terrorists were also arrested. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Political Violence, Kogi
description: Unknown gunmen killed one of the youth leaders of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Abu Jeremiah. The gunmen, who were 5 in number, invaded the compound of the deceased while he was playing draft game with some of his colleagues when he was killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: 3 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen when they attacked a village whose residents were protecting their crops from being grazed by cows.

title: 30 in Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 30 traders when they attacked a market with explosives. Many victims were also injured in the unfortunate attack.

title: Boko Haram Kills 5, Borno
description: Villagers were killed by Boko Haram during a raid. Other people got injured while fleeing the attack.The insurgents were repelled by soldiers with the help of civilian volunteers.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 27 people, including children and the elderly were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The terrorists came in a convoy of Toyota Hilux vehicles and motorcycles laden with explosives and petrol bombs and attacked 2 villages.

title: Boko Haram Kill 29, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents who rode on horsebacks opened fire on some civilians and killed 29 persons. Several foodstuffs were also carted away. While 27 were killed in Kolori, 2 others were killed in Ba'na Iman.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: A renewed clash between Fulani herdsmen and residents of a community over farmland led to the death of 3 persons. 2 others were injured.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Many people were killed when Boko haram insurgents raided a community. This recent killing is one of the most fatal attacks since the inauguration of the President Buhari led government.

title: Fulani Herdsmen kill 2, Plateau
description: A youth corps member identified as Segun Ogunlusi and another unidentified young man were shot dead by rampaging Fulani herdsmen. The assailant attacked the residential area where Segun Ogunlusi was staying and shot him with one other person to death. The deceased visited Jos to collect important document demanded by the National Youth Service Corps management when the incident happened.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Sokoto
description: 4 persons were killed by cattle rustlers during raids carried out on some villages. Several people were also injured during the attacks.

title: Party Chieftain, Edo
description: Captain Samson Amineshi, an All Progressive Congress chieftain was shot dead by gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen while driving home from a social function. The victim was was believed to be preparing for council election in the state.

title: 3 Set Ablaze, Zamfara
description: A man, his wife and a baby were set ablaze when their home was attacked by unknown gunmen. This event is backdated by 3 weeks to the date it was reported. The incident is connected to event IBD006658.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Yobe
description: 6 people including 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers, a pregnant woman and a baby died in 2 separate explosions. The first explosion was detonated by a female suicide bomber of about 14 years old while the second one was detonated by a boy.
place: Damaturu Central Motor Park and the Pompomari By-pass
sources_of_information: The Nation (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 male suicide bombers blew themselves up, killing a soldier and a lady. The two male bombers detonated the bombs near a military check-point.

title: 28 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 28 person were killed by Boko Haram terrorists. While 24 persons were killed in one location, 4 other persons were killed in another location.

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers and 10 members of Boko Haram terrorist group were killed in an encounter between the security operatives and the terrorists. The 2 soldiers were killed in a mine attack as soldiers killed 10 of the Boko Haram terrorists and destroyed their weapons and equipments were destroyed.

title: 5 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 5 people were killed by the Boko haram sect during a raid. The attack was carried out a day before the visit of the incumbent Chief of Army Staff, General Buratai, to insurgent affected communities.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 2 cousins Ibrahim Nyam and Jimmy Pam were ambushed and killed by unknown gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen as they were heading to Jos from Barkin Ladi Local Government Area of the state.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens (assuming 2) of fleeing Boko haram insurgents were killed by troops. The insurgents were fleeing aerial bombardment by the Nigerian Air Force but were cut up in the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 7 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they raided a farming and herding village. The attack forced many of the villagers to flee.

title: Vigilante Vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Hunters and members of the vigilance group killed 100 members of Boko Haram terrorists group and arrested 17 others when the hunters raided a village under the siege of the insurgents. The hunters and vigilante rescued about 280 women and children in the encounter.

title: 2 In Union Clash, Delta
description: 2 persons were killed during a clash between 2 factional National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) members. The crisis was over the control of the multi-million naira Uvwie Motor Park. The incidence witnessed the 2 factions shooting sporadically and attacking each other with other dangerous weapons. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Vigilante Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A suicide bomber attempting to attack a market blew himself up when he was stopped by members of a vigilante group who interrogated him. The interrogator sustained injuries and was rushed to the hospital. Another source said 5 persons died in the attack.

title: Fulani Militia, Pleateau
description: Armed Fulani militia invaded a community and killed 10 residents. There has been unending crisis between Fulani herdsmen and indigenes in the area. This event is backdated by 7 days since it was reported to have happened last week.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 150 people got drowned while others were shot dead during a raid by Boko Haram terrorists on a village. The insurgents invaded the village on motorcycles and cars, and opened fire which led to the residents scampered for safety while were killed.

title: Chibok Girls, Borno
description: Some of the girls abducted from a secondary school in Chibok since April 14, 2014 are reported to have died in airstrikes carried out by Nigerian Air Force (NAF). Though no fatality figure was reported, it is assumed that not less than 5 of the girls have died in the aerial bombardment. Some bodies of the dead girls were shown in a video recently released by Boko Haram. Since there were no reports on the deaths, this event is backdated by a year and situated in Sambisa forest since it is believed the girls are camped there.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Plateau
description: 2 persons were killed while many crops were destroyed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Vigilante Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 17 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by a youth vigilante group while one member of the vigilante (a former Councilor) was killed by the terroists in the unfortunate attack.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: A bomb that was detonated in a market by Boko haram suicide bombers, killing 50 persons. One of the sources reported that the bombers detonated the IEDs strapped on their backs. However, another source reported that the bombing was carried out by a female bomber. The insurgents have always targeted markets in recent times.
place: Sabon Gari market, along Maiduguri-Damboa-Biu highway
sources_of_information: The Punch (50 ) , Independent (47 ) , Daily Trust (48 ) , The Guardian (32 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents raided a Shuwa Arab and herdsmen community and killed 6 residents. The insurgents have increased the spate of attacks in communities around the state capital recently.

title: Fulani/Berom Clash, Plateau
description: 2 people, including a 70 year-old man, were killed by Fulani herdsmen. This incident is a follow-up to the latest clash between Berom and Fulani herdsmen as captured in IBD006426.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 4 commuters were ambushed on a highway and murdered by Boko Haram insurgents. 2 persons including a member of the youth vigilante group were adopted during the ambush.

title: Berom Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 3 Fulani herdsmen identified as Hamza Damina, Khamalu Hussein and Ahnas Hussein were killed by gunmen from Berom community.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Benue
description: Unknown gunmen killed four people and injured two others at a popular drinking joint. Two of the deceased were identified as Alfred and Donald.
place: Balcony Joint and Welfare Quarters, Kanshio

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill, Enugu
description: Mr. Samuel Okoro, 60 year-old-man was gunned down by Fulani herdsmen in the presence of his children when trying to make a peace deal.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Extra-judicial Killing, Gombe
description: Mr. Abubakar S. Aliyu was shot dead by soldiers when he refused to stop at a road block. His body was discovered inside his vehicle with bullet wounds. According to the report, the soldiers shot the victim because they thought he carried explosives and drove recklessly towards the checkpoint. He was mistaken for a Boko haram insurgent.

title: Boko Haram Members, Borno
description: About 30 Boko Haram fighters and families were killed by Shekau. Among those killed were the 5 Boko Haram fighers who married slaves, Malam Abdulmalik, Mujaheed and many others. The date of the incident was not given but assumed it happened a year ago (August 8th 2015).

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 8 Boko haram members were killed during a shootout with a team of soldiers. The insurgents' fuel and food items supplier were arrested.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 9 residents were slaughtered by Boko Haram insurgents during a raid on a village. Several houses were set ablaze during the raid.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A policeman was beheaded in a video shown by Boko Haram terrorists. It is assumed that the location of the incident was Borno.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 13 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers in an ambush when they attempted to evade a community. The insurgents proceeded and killed 9 fishermen who were their way to a fishing town.

title: Community Vs Community, Nasarawa
description: 2 persons were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked another Fulani settlement after the leader of the herdsmen was killed by armed robbers suspected to be from the settlement.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a border village. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a clash in a village. The insurgents had attempted raiding a village but were repelled by soldiers. There has been a continuous onslaught by the insurgents in recent weeks in different communities in the area. Another source reported that scores (at least 2 scores) were killed during the fight.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of civilians (at least 40) were killed during a Boko Haram raid on a community. The insurgents also looted food items from villagers and set ablaze several houses. Another source recorded 13 casualties in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 3 persons including Terzungwe Hanemaor, Terzungwe Mbaahiirga and Mr Mpuuga Akperaga were shot dead on their way back from a burial of one elder Utsua Daar by Fulani herdsmen. The District Head was accused of masterminding the attacks.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber killed 8 people in a market after detonating a bomb. The perpetrator who disguised as a passenger detonated the explosives while inside a tricycle. Another report however stated that the bombing was carried out by a male suicide bomber.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (8 ) , Daily Trust (5 ) , The Punch (6 ) , The Nation (16 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 10 persons were killed by Boko Haram terrorists who invaded a village. It was reported that the insurgents came on a revenge mission in the village.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko haram terrorists (it is assumed 10 of them) were killed during a military offensive on their camps. About 59 residents of the communities were rescued in the onslaught. Another source reported that scores (assuming at least 2 scores) of the insurgents were killed.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 ) , Daily Trust (40 )

title: Boko Haram Bomb, Borno
description: 5-year-old Nuru, 7-year-old Ayisatu and 7 of their friends lost their lives when a bomb detonated while they were playing. The bomb went off while the children fiddled with its metal ring. Due to the nature of the story, it is backdate to 2015.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community and killed 29 residents. In the same incident, another source reported that only 20 of the insurgents were killed by the security forces while rescuing people who were taken hostage by the insurgents.

title: Gunmen Kill Teacher, Enugu
description: A middle-aged secondary school teacher identified as Mrs Amaka Ugwu was shot dead by unknown gunmen. She was shot dead by three gunmen who have been trailing her while she was driving home after visiting some family friends. She was a classroom teacher at Urban Boys Secondary School, Nsukka.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A village was attacked and 31 people were killed by Boko Haram gunmen in a convoy of Toyota Hilux vehicles and motorcycles. Several other people were injured in the attack, raising the concerns that the fatality figures may increase with time.

title: Rustlers, FCT (Abuja)
description: A Fulani leader, Buba Bollowa and his eldest son Yakubu Agatu were shot dead by a gang of cattle rustlers in the presence of the family.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: 20 people died during a suicide bomb attack on a market. The suicide attack was carried out by a 10-year-old girl. Though no group claimed responsibility for the attack, it is assumed to have been masterminded by Boko haram who had previously carried out similar attacks in several markets in the area.
sources_of_information: The Nation (19 ) , Daily Trust (15 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Army Vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a fight between the terrorists and the Nigerian Army.The army later recovered cache of weapons, explosives and anti-aircraft guns from the decimated terrorists. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Kill 25, Borno
description: Boko haram attacked some villages and killed 25 residents. The insurgents laid siege on the communities and opened fire on the residents. A village head, Bulama Falkaka was among the victims

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 25 persons were killed and many others got injured when Boko Haram insurgents launched an attack on a small community on the border of two states. Jarrafu Tizza was named as the leader of the insurgents in the area.

title: Multiple Explosions, Yobe
description: A 3-bomb explosion rocked 2 motor parks in the same LGA and killed 40 persons. The bombs exploded at intervals of one minute. It is believed that the Boko haram sect masterminded the attacks. Various death figure were given by different sources.
place: Dadin-Kowa Motor Park, Tashan Dukku Motor Park
sources_of_information: The Punch (40 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (29 )

title: JTF vs Cattle Rustlers, Kaduna
description: 3 cattle rustlers were killed by JTF operatives during a shootout. The JTF was set up by the state governor to combat crime in the state.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: 3 policemen and 5 Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed when the suicide bombers, who were travelling in a Toyota Highlander jeep, detonated explosives at a checkpoint on a highway near the outskirts of a state capital. They detonated the bombs when a police patrol team stopped them for a routine search.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: 2 persons, including a Boko Haram suicide bomber, died when the bomber detonated a bomb. Several other persons were severely injured in the blast.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Farmers, Niger
description: 3 persons were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers. The incident happened in a village during a bloody encounter.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Vigilantes, Niger
description: 3 siblings (Haruna Galadima, Ardo Galadima, and Shuaibu Galadima) were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and vigilantes. The clash started when the brothers who were on their way to the market were ordered to stop by a local traffic warder but refused.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Yobe
description: Explosions at 2 Sallah praying grounds from 2 Boko Haram female suicide bombers (an elderly woman and a 10-year-old girl) killed 50 persons. There have been an increase in the use of under-aged females for suicide bombing in the insurgents ravaged areas.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Nigerian Tribune (50 )

title: Boko Haram Kill 10, Borno
description: 10 persons in a predominantly Christian community were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. Several others were left with gunshot wounds. Communities in the area have witnessed several Boko haram attacks recently.

title: 50 in Twin Boko Haram Explosion, Gombe
description: 2 explosions rocked a main market and killed 50 persons on the eve of Sallah celebrations. It was not certain if the explosions were suicide bombings or if IEDs were hidden where slippers and clothes were sold. The nature of the attacks corresponded with previous attacks carried out by Boko haram.
place: Sabon Layi footwear market, Gombe Central Market

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 2, Taraba
description: 2 unidentified persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The deceased were slaughtered in their farms by the herdsmen, who have been terrorising the community, in the early hours of the day.

title: Police vs Robbers, Ekiti
description: 2 highway robbers believed to be Fulani herdsmen were killed during a shootout with the Police. It was reported that the robbers had killed one of their victims before they were shot by the police.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a community and killed 25 persons. Some of the victims had their throats slit open while others were shot dead. There have been a resurgence in Boko haram attacks in recent days in the area.
place: Kilwa, Gwollam, Misala, Magaram and Mainok
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (43 ) , The Punch (25 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 12 person were killed by Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a small village. The terrorists also burnt down all houses, cars and other vehicles including 2 trailers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Nasarawa
description: 3 persons were killed when AK47-wielding gunmen in their hundreds invaded a community. 2 other persons were also injured in the incident. A version of the report stated that the victims were members of a vigilante group. Reports stated that the gunmen attacked the victims when a meeting on how to stop the incessant Fulani herdsmen assaults on farmers over grazing was convened.

title: Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: The driver of a bus picked a passenger unknown to him that he was a Boko Haram bomber. During a search at the military checkpoint, the suicide bomber blew himself up, injuring 3 other people.

title: Gunmen vs Man, Benue
