description: One Mr Jacob Terese Awarga Ajon was hacked to death a day before his 44th birthday. He was killed by unknown gunmen on a busy road.
place: Food basket junction, Katsina Ala Town

title: Soldiers Kill 1, Borno
description: 1 person was killed and 2 people were injured when soldiers stationed to check the activities of Boko Haram mistakenly fired at staff of Transmission Company of Nigeria (TCN) and soldiers who were escorting them. The attacking soldiers thought that the on-coming TCN staff set out for repair work and the escorting soldiers were members of Boko Haram.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Enugu
description: The traditional ruler of Isienu Amofu, Igwe Peter Onuoha and three other persons identified as Daniel Ogbu alias Choco and a couple, Ejike and Evelyn Uzor were killed by unknown gunmen. The assassinated royal father was before his death embroiled in an unresolved quarrel with some youths in his community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they laid siege on a highway near a town.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 4 persons including a Boko Haram suicide bomber were killed when a suicide bomber, who drove a commercial tricycle, detonated a bomb. 3 other persons were injured. The bomber attempted to ram into a vehicle that just came out of a garage.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 4 people died after Fulani herdsmen attacked a family. The attack followed a robbery incident that witnessed the killing of a Fulani herdsman in the bush.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents raided a village and killed 12 persons. The insurgents attacked just as the Multinational Joint Task Force was withdrawn from the village. Many houses also set ablaze.

title: Vigilantes vs Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: 11 people including 8 cattle rustlers and 3 vigilantes were killed during an invasion by the rustlers.
place: Kwati, Basa and Kaore villages in Lakpan area

title: Robbers vs Policeman, Delta
description: A police corporal identified as Okogwu Iweaya was killed by armed bandits. He was shot when he was escorting the accountant of WESCO Construction Company to withdraw some money at a first generation bank. The armed robbers made away with the AK47 rifle with 34 rounds of ammunition.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 9 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists, who came in convoy of 11 Toyota Hilux vehicles and motorcycles laden with Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and with petrol bombs, attacked the headquarters of a local council.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 residents who had just returned to inspect their damaged homes were slaughtered by Boko Haram insurgents. The incident occurred when the sect attacked a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 people including 3 soldiers and 7 old men were killed in an attack by Boko Haram insurgents. The old men died from wounds incurred from the fire set on houses by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Suicide bomber, Borno
description: A female suicide bomber of about 23-year-old alighted from a vehicle some meters away from a military check point and blew herself and 4 other people including 2 members of CJTF.
place: A military checkpoint in Sabon Gari.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Kano
description: A female suicide bomber killed herself when she detonated an explosive device near a mosque. The worshippers had already left the place before the incident occurred.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a bomb at a church, killing himself and 6 others including the pastor of the church, a woman and her baby strapped onto her back, a woman and her two children, and another worshipper.
place: Redeemed Christian Church of God, RCCG, located on the outskirts of the city.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Plateau
description: Twin blasts killed 50 and left many others injured 1 of the 2 blasts occurred at the Central Mosque while the second explosion was occurred 4 minutes later.
place: A mosque on Dilimi Street and at a restaurant close to a motor park.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 300 people mostly travellers were slaughtered when Boko haram took over Maiduguri/Damaturu road. The report was not specific on the date of incident. Therefore, this event is backdated by 7 days of this report.

title: 3 Killed in Communal Clash, Kogi
description: 3 people were killed and property running into millions of naira were destroyed when rampaging youths from Bakume and Abejukolo villages descended on residents of Ogba village. The 3 villages are in the same Local Government Area. The violence was fuelled by the Fulani herdsmen crises which some youths latched onto to attack the Ogba, Nupe community over its alleged support for the herdsmen.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 1, Benue
description: 1 person identified as Suswam Suswam was killed and several others were injured when about 50 Fulani herdsmen attacked a group of mourners who were burying their relation in a village. The gunmen emerged from the bush and shot the mourners, who were at the graveside to witness the burial of their relative.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 48 people, all males, were killed by Boko haram during a raid on a community. The victims who were resting after the days of fasting when they were assembled by the insurgents and shot dead.
sources_of_information: The Punch (48 ) , Other newpapers 1 (48 ) , The Guardian (40 )

title: Boko Haram Kills Members, Borno
description: Defected Boko Haram insurgents were trailed and killed by their colleagues. The victims had their throats slit in an attempt to discourage further defection.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a village near Maiduguri Metropolis. The terrorists shot sporadically at residents who scampered for safety.

title: 29 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 29 residents. Some of the victims were trailed to their hideouts and slaughtered. The insurgents have intensified attacks on communities in recent weeks.

title: Gunmen Kill, Zamfara
description: Several people were killed in a reprisal communal crisis. 7 people were initially killed in Kokiya village while 70 were killed and others sustained injuries in less than 24 hours in reprisal attack by gunmen in Cigama village.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (77 ) , The Nation (30 ) , The Guardian (37 ) , Daily Trust (32 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 13 people including 2 female suicide bombers died during 2 separate bomb explosions on a highway. Many others were injured in both explosions.
place: Malari village and Allau Dam road along Bama/Konduga highway

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko haram suicide bombers were blown up before they could reach their targets. The bombers had targeted a Leprosy/General Hospital in the metropolis. This recent attack came less than a week 3 people were killed in the hospital.
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Guardian (7 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About 120 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they launched a coordinated attack on a community. The attackers opened fire on the residents who had assembled at some major mosques ahead of breaking their Muslim fast. Many people were injured and several properties were destroyed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents opened fire on residents as they were preparing to break their fast, kiiling 98 persons. There has been a resurgent of attacks by the insurgents since their decimation in Sambisa forest recently.

title: Gunmen Vs Community, Enugu
description: 8 persons were killed in four different communities in a local government area at different times by unknown gunmen. 3 persons were killed in Okpo, 5 were killed in Inyi and 3 others were killed in Igogoro and Aji. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that they happened in the middle of the year.

title: Ritual Killings, Imo
description: 6 women were killed on their farms by Fulani herdsmen, with their vital organs missing. The herdsmen attacked the farmers and wreaked havoc on their farmlands. The situation prompted a reprisal attack from the youths in the area, who forced the herdsmen out of their community. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened in the middle of the given year.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A retired district judge, Mallam Mustapha, was killed by Boko Haram terrorists. The incident happened when the terrorists stormed his community. They also abducted the wife of the victim identified as Fatima Mohammed. The date of the incident was not stated but due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that it happened in the middle the year.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 people were killed while 7 others sustained gunshot injuries when Boko Haram sect invaded a community.

title: Communal Clash, Plateau
description: 4 people died in a clash between Berom people and Fulani herdsmen. 4 soldiers who were drafted to restore order in the community were also injured. The fight between the 2 conflicting parties have been ongoing for sometime.

title: Rustlers, Katsina
description: Rabo Goje, 39-year-old, and Malam Yahaya Murnai, a 47-year-old man were killed by cattle rustlers who burnt houses and shops and made away with 22 cows.

title: Communal Conflict, Kogi
description: 9 people died in a renewed fight between Fulani herdsmen and indigenes of Obakume. The discovery of the mutilated bodies of a man and his wife, a pregnant woman, 3 Fulani herdsmen and 2 other ignited the crisis. Several houses including a palace were set ablaze. Since this incident was reported to have happened few days back, this event is backdated by 2 days to the date of its report.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko Haram suicide bombers got themselves killed by the bombs they concealed in their bodies after failed attempts to get a transport into the city. The date of the incident was not stated but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Cattle Rustlers' Attack, Plateau
description: An attack by cattle rustlers led to the death of 2 persons while 7 other people were seriously injured. About 20 cows were also burnt in the attack. The victims were waylaid when they were moving their cattles to the Bukuru market for sale. Their vehicles were set ablaze. The date of the event was not stated, it is assumed the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Kill 3 Vigilante Members, Kaduna
description: Cattle rustlers attacked residents and killed 3 vigilante members. The attackers also rustled several cows. This event is backdated by 2 days of its report since it was reported to have happened recently.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A 12–years-old female suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) killing 30 people and injuring more than 30 other civilians in a crowded market.
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Daily Trust (30 ) , The Guardian (10 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: More than 50 people were killed in a bomb blast when a suicide bomber detonated a bomb in a fish market. Among the dead was one Ahmed Tijjani, a member of the civilian JTF. Several people were injured in the blast and ensuing confusion. The second suicide bomber was killed alone by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (50 ) , Vanguard (35 ) , Independent (20 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram attacked a community and killed 26 people. 17 of the victims were shot dead instantly and 9 others were also shot dead while burying the initial victims.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 4, Plateau
description: A man identified as Balongo Unogu was slaughtered in his house by some Fulani herdsmen after he challenged the murder of his brother. His brother, Edwin Unogo, was killed with 2 other persons known as Rahab Ishaku and Pam Gyang by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Farmers Vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 5 persons were killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and Migili farmers. The fight was caused by a disagreement between them when a Fulani herdsman moved his cattle into a Migili farm for grazing. An ensuing confrontation led to the death of the herdsman. A reprisal attack by Fulani herdsmen resulted in the death of 4 Migili farmers.

title: Vigilante vs Gunmen, Kaduna
description: 8 bandits and a man were killed during a shootout between local vigilante and the armed bandits. 3 days after the incident, the bandits carried out a reprisal attack and killed a local farmer. There have been several attacks in the area by the armed bandits since the beginning of this year. This incident is backdated by a week since it was reported to have happened last week.

title: Gunmen Kill 13, Kaduna
description: 13 people were killed by unknown gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers who attacked a community in the early hours of the day. Also, 15 people sustained injuries.

title: Gunmen vs Policeman, Ebonyi
description: One police corporal identified as Yusuf was shot dead near his residence at the outskirts of a state capital by 2 unknown gunmen. They trailed the police officer to his residence, snatched his gun and shot him at a close range as he was returning to his house. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Borno
description: 63 people died after a bag containing IEDs exploded. The devices exploded while members of a local vigilante outfit popularly called 'Civilian JTF' fiddled with the contents of the bag. The explosives were reported to have been abandoned by some members of the Boko haram sect. Most affected were young men and few females who had followed the vigilante group to ascertain the contents of the bag.
sources_of_information: The Nation (63 ) , The Guardian (63 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Vanguard (81 ) , Daily Trust (71 )

title: 8 Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 8 farmers (6 men, a woman and a boy) who were on their way to their farms were accosted and killed by Fulani herdsmen. Clashes between farmers and herdsmen in the state have often been driven by grazing rights.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 3 female suicide bombers died from explosive devices they strapped to their bodies. 1 of the ladies was blown to death while trying to stop a moving car.The other 2 female suicide bombers, who boarded two separate vehicles heading towards a checkpoint, were killed with the drivers who were conveying them to the checkpoint manned by soldiers.

title: Fulani Gunmen vs Pastor, Plateau
description: A pastor of Living Faith Church was shot dead by suspected Fulani gunmen. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Twin Bomb Blast, Yobe
description: A Boko Haram twin bomb blast in a local alcohol joint and the office of the vigilante group killed 13 people including the leader of the vigilante group. The vigilante office, which was blown with an IED by the suicide bomber was targeted for its collaboration with the military.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (13 ) , Vanguard (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (11 ) , The Guardian (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Scores (at least 2 scores, 40) of Boko haram insurgents, a soldier and a vigilante died in an encounter between soldiers and the insurgents. The insurgents had used women and children as shields though it was not stated that those women and children were among the casualties.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Delta
description: 2 boys including Mike and John were killed in a bush by some Fulani herdsmen. Their mutilated bodies were found a day after they went missing with cutlass wounds. As reported, the victims might have been killed while defending their farmlands. The report stated that 3 other people have previously been killed in the same bush.

title: Police vs Woman, Kwara
description: The police was reported to have killed a woman identified as Mrs. Bolatito Balogun and arrested some members of a community. They arrested some members of the community over attack on Fulani herdsmen. Te police also injured several others including one Mrs Tope Ologemo who is lying critically in the hospital. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 6 persons were killed after 3 suicide bombers attacked a checkpoint manned by local vigilante at the outskirts of the state capital. The attackers rode on a motorcycle to the checkpoint and suddenly blew themselves up together with 3 unsuspecting members of the volunteer security forces.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Plateau
description: 4 persons were killed by unknown gunmen who ambushed them on their way home after an outing. The names of the deceased are: Pam Babel, Salome Pam, Luka Gyang and Joy Toma. Cases of criminal killing have been rife in the area lately.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram members in a convoy of sport utility vehicle and motorcycles drove through 6 villages killed 43 people, looted and burnt down their houses. The major victims of this attack are mostly the men.
place: Koshifa, Matangle, Buraltuma, Darmanti, Almeri and Burmari villagesMatangale, Buraltima and Dirmanti

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 3 female Boko haram suicide bombers died when the explosives wrapped around them untimely went off. The bombers were on a mission to detonate boms in Maiduguri, the state caiptal.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 15 persons were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a remote village. The sect opened fire on unprotected civilians and burning homes to the ground. More than 500 houses were reported destroyed.

title: Security Forces Vs Boko Haram, Kaduna
description: 1 security personnel was killed when members of the armed forces and the State Security Service engaged Boko Haram insurgents in a shoot-out. Another security agent was said to have sustained injuries.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A female suicide bomber detonated an Improvised Explosive Devise (IED) strapped on her body, killing herself and 2 others. 4 persons also sustained different degrees of injuries.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A security operative was killed when Boko Haram insurgents engaged a team of joint security operative in a shootout.The two insurgents escaped from arrest during.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: Scores of people were killed in a crowded market when an Improvised Explosion Device (IED) exploded by suspected Boko Haram members. Over 50 people were reported injured in the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Plateau
description: 2 persons and a soldier were killed by Fulani herdsmen. The gunmen who attacked the village killed the victims cluding a member of the Special Task Force. 4 people were wounded and several properties destroyed. The date of the incident is unknown but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Adamawa
description: Several people died when Boko haram suicide bomber detonated explosives. The incident occurred when many traders had just closed their shops. About 40 people, mainly civilians were wounded.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Some soldiers (assuming 5) died when a female Boko haram suicide bomber attacked a military checkpoint. The bomber also blew herself up. Some soldiers and 20 others were part of the dead victims. The other source did not record civilian casualty.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: About a score (20) died when a military operation successfully repelled the Boko Haram terrorist attack in which 2 suicide bombers were involved. 12 rifles, one machine gun and rocket propelled grenades and some bombs were also recovered from the group.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: More than14 persons were killed when an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) planted by Boko Haram insurgents exploded at a market. 19 others were seriously injured. The Nigerian Red Cross (NRC) and National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) rescue team came around to evacuate bodies and the injured ones

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 50 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked Maiduguri and bombed a busy meat market. Difference sources of the report gave varying fatality figures. Several people have died in past few days from attacks by the insurgents.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (53 ) , Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , Independent (50 ) , The Guardian (25 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 person was killed in bomb blast which rocked a market. This came less than a day when similar attack was carried out in Maiduguri that killed 18 persons and injuring many. The attackers arrived in 2 Hilux vehicles and took away properties of innocent people.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko haram suicide bomber blew up himself and 26 others in a Mosque during prayers. Several people (28) also got injured during the explosion.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 27 people including some civilians and Boko Haram insurgents died during a shootout between soldiers and the insurgents. The insurgents invaded the capital of Borno State, Maiduguri in the bid to capture it.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Community, Kwara
description: 6 persons were killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and inhabitants of a local government. Both sides lost 3 people each to the crisis.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 7 person were killed by a suicide bomber who detonated a bomb at a wedding venue in a village. Many civilian persons were hospitalised from the explosion.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 4 person were killed when 3 Boko Haram insurgents detonated an improvised explosive device while attempting to gain entrance into a hospital. The explosion killed 2 security guards at the gate as well as 2 of the suicide bombers, while the third bomber was arrested. Several other people were wounded from the blast.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 30, Benue
description: 30 persons were killed by Fulani Herdsmen who stormed a village in the early hours of the day as villagers were preparing for Sunday services.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Over 40 persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a town. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: During an offensive against Boko haram insurgents, scores of the insurgents (that is, at least 2 scores) were killed. A soldier was also killed in a land mine explosion during the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 9 people were killed during the attacks of the Boko haram sect on a community. The insurgents numbered about 20 operated with knives and axes. It was reported that the assailants cut the heads of their victims.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Communal Crisis, Kogi
description: One Mr. Gabriel Ejima was killed during a communal crisis between villagers in Echule Abujaga and villagers from Alaura, Iru and Itale. The villages were involved in a land tussle.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents invaded a border community but were repelled by soldiers. Over 30 insurgents including one of their commanders who had 1000s of euros were killed in the incident. Event IBD005810 is linked to this event because it was captured in one of the sources (Thisday).

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Duke Linus Toryem, a flying officer of the Nigerian Air Force was killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an operation to rescue abducted persons kept in a forest.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Maker, Borno
description: The chief bomb-maker and a higher ranking Boko Haram terrorist was killed by one of the bodyguards of the sect leader, Abubakar Shekau. The chief bomb-maker was killed while he was trying to run away from the terrorists' camp due to the heavy bombardment by the troops of Nigerian Army. It was also reported that a senior member of the terror group who was designated to take over from Shekau became completely blind as result of shrapnel from an IED he was preparing.

title: Boko Haram Suicide bomber, Adamawa
description: A suicide bomber detonated an explosive in a busy cattle market, killing 9 people. The attack is believed to have been masterminded by Boko Haram sect. Many people lost their belongings during the attack. About 14 injured defenseless persons were taken to the hospital.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: An ex-councilor was killed in an attack carried out by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. The victim was shot at a close range when he wanted to engage the gunmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 27 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked two communities and rustled cows belonging to the natives. Another paper reported that the attack was carried out by Boko Haram insurgents
sources_of_information: The Guardian (27 ) , Other newspaper 2 (27 ) , The Nation (26 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko haram attacked a community and killed many people. About 7 women were also abducted during the raid.

title: 10 in Boko Haram, Borno
description: An unconfirmed number of terrorists were killed by the military during offensive operations in the forest. The number of the terrorist killed is assumed to be 10 and the LGA where the attack is carried out assumed to be Bama.

title: Private Security Shoots, Anambra
description: A personnel security of a former Minister of Aviation, Stella Oduah shot 3 persons to death. Police version of the event stated that a vigilante attached to the former Minister was involved in the incident and that no life was lost but 2 persons, Chuka Okechuckwu and Chukwuebuka were seriously injured in the crisis.

title: 12 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 12 people were killed in a community as Boko Haram fighters took over the border town. A convoy of the insurgent including Toyota Hilux vehicles and motorcycles, deploying Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and petrol bombs, and slitting the throats of 12 residents who had tried to protect their houses and shops from the ensuing inferno.

title: Boko Haram Kill 8, Borno
description: 8 people were killed while several others sustained gunshot injuries when Boko Haram insurgents attacked and burnt down a whole community. The terrorists carried out the attack with petrol bombs and AK47 rifles. Many other cilivians were injured and receiving treatment in the hospital.

title: Boko Haram Kills 20, Borno 2
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect were said to have slaughtered 20 victims when they carried out a raid on some communities. This event is reported with event IBD005739, where 4 civilians were killed by Boko Harm terrorists.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a community with sophisticated weapons, shot and killed a resident. They also injured 10 persons and set 20 houses ablaze.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: A Fulani man died, others injured and over 300 cattle taken away when cattle rustlers attacked some herders with sophisticated weapons.
place: Kunbur area on the outskirts of Wase.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Farmers, Kaduna
description: 3 farmers were killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked local farmers. Also, 2 Fulani herdsmen were killed by the farmers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 4 persons including a Boko haram suicide bomber and 3 students died during an attack in a school. The suicide bomber wounded many other students before detonating a suicide bomb. The total number of death increased to 4 as a result of an extra victim that died recently died in the hospital. Umar Musa was one of the victims who died later.
place: College of Administration and Business Studies, Potiskum
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers raided Boko haram camps inside Sambisa forest and killed members of the insurgents. It is believed that about 10 of the insurgents were killed. The raid also saw the release of 25 women and girls from the camps.
place: Alafia, Rogo Fulani, Laraga camps in Sambisa forest

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 29 Boko haram insurgents who had gone to a fish farm to relax while fleeing from military attacks were shot dead by 5 members of a vigilante group. The vigilantes (also hunters) opened fire on the insurgents from the their hiding places.
place: Hilang Kukuriyi axis of Sambisa forest

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 people including 12 insurgents and 8 villagers died during a Boko haram attack on a village. The insurgents were killed by local hunters who are also vigilante members.

title: Fulani Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: 30 persons were killed by suspected Fulani gunmen. there were conflicting reports about the casualty. One version of the report stated that 11 people were killed but the chairman of the council, Emmanuel Lomang said 17 were killed in Vat while 13 were murdered in Zakupang. The gunmen, who attacked two villages, killed 30 people and burnt down several houses. Later in the day, 2 people (Emmanuel Joshua and Bot Josua) were also killed. Reports indicated that the attack was a reprisal for an earlier raid and rustling of 400 cows from the Fulani settlements in the area.

title: Boko Haram vs Hunters , Borno
description: Some hunters killed 13 Boko Haram insurgents, recovered 5 Toyota Hilux vehicles and 2 Kalashnikov rifle in the cause of flushing the insurgents out of Sabisa forest.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Several members of the Boko Haram insurgents were killed by troops of the Nigerian Army. The killing happened during a gun battle to recover women and children abducted by the insurgents. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: An eyewitness account revealed that some women (assuming 10) were stoned to death by members of Boko Haram terrorist group when troops of Nigerian Army approached to rescue them and children who were held hostage by the insurgents. 10 other women were mistakenly crushed to death by a military Armoured Personnel Carrier and 3 people were blown up by a landmine. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: 80 In Communal Clash, Taraba
description: A communal clash in multiple locations between Kuteb/Fulani and Tiv ethnic groups left 84 people dead on both sides. 20 Tiv residents, mostly students, were massacred in Takum, 30 persons were massacred at a Tiv settlement, Yongogba, a Tiv laboratory technician, Samuel Ojo, 32, was killed at the Jonas Clinics, 5 were killed at Age, 7 Tiv passengers were killed on Dogon Gawa-Katsina-Ala Road, 4 Kutebs and a Jukun were shot dead between Kwali and Gbaaondo settlements, 3 people were cut into pieces in Vingir Road, Yaro Yaro, was killed with his Tiv business partner, John Chin.
place: Takum, Yongogba, along Takum-Kpashe Road, Age, Vingir Road, Dogon Gawa-Katsina-Ala Road,Kwali and Gbaaondo, Vingir Road

title: Armed Robbers Attack, Enugu
description: Chinedu Eneje, a 24-year-old trader and survivor of Boko Haram attacks in the North lost his life to a gang of armed robbers in his home town in the East.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Soldiers, Taraba
description: 9 soldiers were killed by some villagers suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. The soldiers were on a security patrol and their weapons including a rocket launcher were carted away by the hoodlums.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , The Punch (4 ) , The Nation (6 )

title: Gunmen Kill 16, Kaduna
description: 16 people were killed by unknown gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers who attacked a community. Several other people were reported to have sustained injuries.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 22 persons were killed by suspected Boko Haram insurgents. The insurgents also injured many other people after setting ablaze several houses and looting foodstuff and livestocks.

title: Women Hostages vs Soldiers, Borno
description: Women that were taken hostage by Boko haram insurgents opened fire on some soldiers that came to rescue them and killed 7. Dozens (at least 24) of the women were killed by the soldiers in the encounter. As reported, the event happened last week. This event is therefore backdated by 7 days of its report.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Nasarawa
description: 11 persons were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen who invaded the community. The attackers razed down the village and ambushed passers-by on the roads.

title: Boko Haram Kill 21, Yobe
description: 21 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) were killed by gunmen that camouflaged in military uniform. The attackers were suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect.

title: 200 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Hundreds of decomposed bodies including those of women and children were discovered by a government committee. The victims were suspected to have been killed by Boko Haram insurgents as they fled their towns. It is assumed that at least 200 deaths were recorded.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Plateau
description: 4 people including 2 security operatives were killed by gunmen suspected to be Boko haram insurgents during an attack on a village. Since this incident was reported to have happened few days back, it is thus backdated by 2 days from the date it was reported.

title: Post Election Violence, Rivers
description: 2 members of All Progressive Congress (APC), Messrs Chigba Apollos and Chiezule German, were shot dead by unknown gunmen. Their death was not unconnected with the recent spate of political killings that have characterised the area. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Benue
description: A reprisal attack by Fulani herdsmen for the killing of 2 of their kinsmen resulted in the death of 28 people in different villages. The 2 herdsmen were reported killed by gunmen believed to be robbers.
place: Tse Uosu, Gbudu and Branch Umenger
sources_of_information: Vanguard (30 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (14 ) , Nigerian Tribune (22 )

title: Assailants Vs Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 4 Fulani herders were killed by unknown gunmen. The unknown assailants attacked the herdsmen in the grazing fields.

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 3, Benue
description: 3 people including an Assistant Superintendent of Police , ASP, Baba Ibrahim, a cattle herder, Gambo Muhammed and a cattle breeder were killed in an ambush by cattle rustlers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A border community was invaded by over 2000 Boko haram insurgents and several people were killed. Since it was reported that scores died, it is assumed that at least 2 scores (40 people) died in the attack.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: In the course hunting for Boko Haram leaders and the members in Sambisa forest, one of the vehicles carrying CJTF (Civilian Joint Task Force) hit a mine. A soldier and 3 CJTF were killed while another soldier was injured.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Abu Mojahid, a notorious top terrorist commander of the Boko Haram insurgents, was among those killed by the army. The deaths occurred when the insurgents had an encounter with troops. The report was not really specific on the number of casualties but from its tone, it is assumed that not less than 10 insurgents were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: Attackers suspected to be Fulani Herdsmen assaulted some communities and killed 15 person. Many people were also declared missing. Msugh Gaza, 3 of his sons and 3 other victims died in the attack.
place: Gaza, Tse Gbaun and Ayise villages.

title: Boko Haram Vs Army, Borno
description: 2 soldiers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The insurgents attacked the vehicles of the soldiers, who were escorting internally displaced people back to their homes, with rocket. Also, 6 soldiers and 1 civilian vigilante were seriously wounded.

title: Post Election Violence, Rivers
description: 2 persons were attacked by unknown gunmen, including a man killed in his car and taken away by his assailants. Another victim also fell to the bullets of the gunmen in his house. The incident is part of the violence that trailed the just concluded elections in the state.

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: Bloody communal crisis between 2 communities claimed over 60 lives and left many others injured following a dispute between fishing communities over the ownership of a fishing pond in the area.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (45 ) , Independent (48 ) , Vanguard (60 ) , This Day (50 )

title: Cattle Rustler, FCT (Abuja)
description: A cattle rustler was shot dead by a herder during a raid on a Fulani settlement. The herder climbed a tree from where he shot dead one of the rampaging cattle rustlers.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 12 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents invaded their community and slit their throats. The attack was carried out when the army was trying to evacuate civilians to safe zones following a planned air strike.

title: Gunmen vs Fulani Herdsmen, Kwara
description: 44 herdsmen were reported to have been killed within a month by gunmen. While some were killed on their way to a meeting, others were killed on their way to grazing. The exact date in April was not stated hence the incident is backdated to the middle of April.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 7 Boko haram insurgents were killed when troops repelled an attack on 121 Task Force Battalion. The insurgents attempted the invasion with 5 gun trucks, motorcycles and 2 Golf cars laden with explosives.

title: Gunmen vs Graduate, Delta
description: A 32-year-old graduate of University of Nigeria, Nsukka, Mr Eugine Ujayikre Ighoesuvwo was killed by a group of unknown gunmen. The gunmen attacked him in his one-room apartment.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 out of the 216 school girls abducted by Boko Haram in April, 2014 were reported to have died in captivity. The news of their deaths was relayed by a Chibok school girl rescued after 2 years from Sambisa forest where they were believed to have been kept. Though details of their deaths were not released, it is believed that some of them might have been killed after refusing to denounce their religion. In the past, Boko haram had killed several people that refused converting to Islam. This incident is backdated by a year when the girls were abducted by the insurgents since no date was reported by the source.

title: Election Violence, Benue
description: 1 person was gunned down by unknown gunmen. The death may not be unconnected with the wave of political disagreement that characterised elections in that part of the state.

title: Election Day Violence, Kebbi
description: Unknown gunmen shot dead one Umaru Gomma, a renowned APC politician in the area during the gubernatorial and the house of assembly elections.

title: Election Violence, Benue
description: 2 persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen. Their death may not be unconnected with the wave of political disagreement that have characterised elections in that part of the state.

title: Cattle Rustlers, FCT (Abuja)
description: A herdsman was shot dead by cattle rustlers during a raid on a settlement. The victim was shot while trailing the rustlers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 residents were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community. According to the report, the insurgents have camps in nearby bushes where they launch the attacks.

title: Boko Haram Kills 2, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents on motorcycles attacked a village, killed 2 people and injured 3 others.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Gunmen opened fire on traders in a market and killed 14 Fulani herdsmen, including a 70 year old man and children. Many others were wounded.

title: Armed Robbers, Delta
description: 2 persons were killed by suspected armed bandits. One of the deceased was a 26-years old jobless young graduate who was stabbed to death for refusing to hand over his bag to the arm robbers. The other deceased person was a middle-aged man.

title: Robbers vs Vigilante, Lagos
description: A local vigilante identified simply as Matthew, was beaten to death with a stone by a gang of armed bandits after several shots fired at him did not penetrate his body.

title: Funlani Herdsmen Attack, Kwara
description: Raphael Shola Dada, a 52-year-old farmer was strangled to death in his farm by Fulani herdsmen. The victims had protested the invasion of his farm his assailants before he was hacked to death. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Post Election Violence, Rivers
description: Chief Okwu Osia, the ruler of Egbada, was killed by unknown gunmen. They also killed a passer-by. It was alleged that the deaths were politically motivated.

title: Hunters Vs Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: About 10 people were feared dead during a clash between hunters and suspected cattle rustlers. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Vs Community, Zamfara
description: 10 people were killed by unknown gunmen numbering over fifty (50). The gunmen, who rode into the village on motorcycles, fired indiscriminately at the people. Besides, several other people were wounded.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens (at least 2 dozens) of Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a raid on one of their strongholds and operational base.

title: Boko Haram Killing, Borno
description: About 15 suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked and killed 4 fishermen.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilantes , Borno
description: 15 suspected Boko Haram insurgents who attacked and killed 4 fishermen in Alau village (IBD005381) were routed and killed by local vigilantes from Maiduguri.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Gombe
description: 7 people died when a female suicide bomber detonated explosives in a motor park. Many women and girls (we assume 5) who were hawking at the park were victims. The attack is believed to have been masterminded by the Boko haram sect.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 9 persons were killed when Fulani Herdsmen attacked 2 villages. Several houses were razed during the incident.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 12 residents in a renewed attack on 2 communities. There have been several violent clashes between the herdsmen and Tiv farmers in the state lately.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , Daily Trust (12 ) , Independent (31 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Gombe
description: Some Boko Haram insurgents were killed by men of 301 Artillery Regiment of the Army. This happened when the insurgents attacked a military checkpoint.

title: Electoral/Political Violence, Kogi
description: 4 people including Mr. Emmanuel Ameh died during a clash between political supporters. The crisis that resulted in the deaths erupted after the 2015 Presidential election.

title: Boko Haram in Election Violence, Borno
description: 25 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an early morning raid on presidential election day.

title: Boko Haram in Election Attack, Gombe
description: Umar Aminu, a member Gombe State House of Assembly and 8 other people including 2 INEC ad-hoc staff were killed by suspected members of Boko Haram.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (9 ) , Independent (15 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 3 persons were shot dead by suspected Boko Haram insurgents while on their way to a polling unit. Another source recorded 1 fatality.

title: Military vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Over 100 (at least 101) insurgents were killed by soldiers as they liberated the last stronghold of the Boko Haram terrorists.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: 20 Fulani herdsmen were killed when gunmen attacked a community. This incident was reported to have happened towards the end of March. It is therefore assumed to have happened on the 27th. This event is linked to event in IBD005408.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 50 people were killed by Boko haram insurgents during a recent attack on a community. About 400 people including women and children were kidnapped during the raid.

title: Gunmen Kill 2, Rivers
description: 2 people including a politician and a driver were shot dead by unknown gunmen. The gunmen alighted from the vehicle and shot at the victims. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: Five (5) persons were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen numbering about 200, who attacked the village, shooting sporadically. Many other people were injured.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: 2 women disembarked from a Golf car and asked to be directed to Monday market were killed by improvised explosive devices that were on them when the explosives suddenly got detonated.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko haram insurgents and a soldier died during a confrontation. Many more insurgents were also killed when an Air Force patrol struck the fleeing insurgents. From the way the event was reported, it is assumed that 10 more victims were killed.

title: Bandits vs Traders, Katsina
description: A businessman was killed by bandits while traveling to a market. It was reported that the deceased and other victims were ambushed by the gunmen.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: 3 people were killed and 24 others were abducted by bandits who invaded some communities. Several others were injured in the incident.
place: Jangeru, Shanawa, and Birnin Yero Villages in Shinkafi Town

title: Election Crisis, Kogi
description: A hoodlum popularly known as Ojochenemi Atidoga was stabbed to death by a soldier for disrupting the election process. Before the incident, the hoodlum was said to be on a rampage, threatening to kill anybody who voted for any other party other than the All Progressives Congress, APC.
place: Open Space University Village polling unit, Anyigba

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: 2 persons were killed and 5 others were injured by some Fulani Herders who invaded a community. It was reported that the herders attacked the residents while they were working on their farm.
place: Awgu Egbeleli, an ancient town subdivided into Ogboli/Ohaja; Ugwuleshi, and Adogbator Communities

title: Gunmen vs Ex-Commissioner, Enugu
description: IPOB/ESN: Unidentified gunmen killed the former commissioner for Rural Development in the state, Ozo Gabriel Onuzulike and his elder brother, Elvis Onuzulike. They were shot at close range by the killers. The gunmen were alleged to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Bandits vs Presidential Convoy, Katsina
description: People died while 2 others sustained minor injuries when bandits attacked the advanced team of security guards, protocol and media officers ahead of President Buhari's Sallah trip to his hometown in Daura. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: `6 people were killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. Another person was killed while a mother and her son were kidnapped when the same group of attackers blocked a highway. 15 people were wounded while scores of passengers were stranded on the highway.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: Troops of Nigerian Army of Operation Sharan Daji (OPSD) killed 20 notorious bandits terrorising the state. It was reported that several caches of arms were recovered from the bandits. Due to the nature of the story, it was backdated by 1 week.

title: Army vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) killed several bandits through airstrikes in a forest where the bandits were converging. Due to the nature of the story, it is assumed that 20 persons were killed.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: 8 persons lost their lives while 10 others were injured when Fulani herdsmen attacked a village.It was reported that the attack which took place in the night left 20 houses burnt.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (5 )

title: Herdsmen, Attack, Kaduna
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 2 people in renewed attacks on some communities.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko haram members were shot dead by soldiers during a shootout during a clearance operation.

title: IEDs Boko Haram, Borno
description: IEDs kill two civilians in a food convoy of trucks escorted by the military on the road to Dikwa. According to another version, the IEDs kill one or two soldiers on 2 May 2016. It is also possible that these were 2 different incidents.

title: Raped To Death, Plateau
description: A lady, Rebecca Reuben, was raped to death by Fulani Herdsmen. her corpse was dumped in an open place by her killers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A top commander of Boko Haram and 55 other militants were killed in a battle with the Multinational Joint Task Force. 2 soldiers were also killed and 2 others sustained injuries.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Vs Community, Benue
description: 500 persons were killed by Fulani herdsmen in a village. The assailants, who were about 30, attacked the villagers with sophisticated weapons. Among the dead was a little girl identified as Mary. The clash was as a result of cattle rustling by the village youths. Subsequently, more fatalities were reported in different sources.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (100 ) , Vanguard (300 ) , Daily Trust (500 )

title: Cart Pusher, Lagos
description: A cart pusher, Abdullahi Mohammed, was assaulted and killed in a fracas caused by a traditional ruler. The cause of the crisis could not be established. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 5 Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a bloody encounter in a village. 210 persons including elderly men, women and children were rescued during the operation.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Kano
description: 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated bombs amidst a group of Shiite Muslims headed by Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The incident happened when the bombers infiltrated the religious procession to commemorate the life of Imam Hussein, Prophet Muhammed's grandson by the Shiite Islamic group. The deceased were mainly women and children while more than 50 person were injured.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: A soldier was killed by Boko haram insurgents barely 24 hours a Colonel was killed by the same group. Five of the insurgents and a member of Civilian JTF were also killed in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers recaptured a strategic town from Boko haram and killed scores (at least 2 scores) of the insurgents. Some of the insurgents were also arrested.

title: Gunmen Vs Businessman, Kogi
description: An oil dealer, Alhaji Abdullahi, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The victim was trailed from his filling station as he travelled to his village. The gunmen also made away with undisclosed amount of money belonging to the victim.

title: Gunmen vs Businessman, Kaduna
description: One Alhaji Kabiru Adamu, a businessman and education supervisor, was killed by unknown gunmen. The gunmen stormed his house in the night and beat him to death for failing to give them the money they requested for. Due to the nature of the story this event is backdated by 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Bomb, Borno
description: A man identified as Musa and 2 of his friends lost their lives during a bomb blast which happened while they were on a hunting game. The bomb which was reportedly dropped by Boko Haram fighters also crippled two other persons including Muhammadu.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Kaduna
description: 26 civil servants were killed when a teenage suicide bomber (a boy) detonated a bomb at the venue of a biometric verification centre of workers' status. 31 persons were injured in the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (26 ) , The Punch (40 ) , Independent (50 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Vanguard (25 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Boko haram insurgent was killed by soldiers while escaping a military raid. The soldiers have raided 4 camps in the forest used by the terrorists as their operational base. 31 people were also rescued from the terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A10 year- old- girl detonated an explosive under her clothes as she approached the market’s perimeter fence killing 9 people. The attack is believed to have been masterminded by Boko Haram sect.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 8, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 8 people when they attacked a community. Many were wounded and depossessed their belongingings. Properties were also destroyed during the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 80 people including soldiers, vigilante members,civilians and dozens (assuming 2 dozens) of Boko haram insurgents were killed when the insurgents attempted to overrun Giwa Military Barrack but were repelled.
place: Bale Galtimari, Kayamala, Giwa Military Barracks, University of Maiduguri Community, 202 and 203 Housing Estates, Dalori Quaters and Moli Axis

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Plateau
description: 2 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who attacked their community when most of the people were asleep.

title: Boko Haram Kills 4, Borno 1
description: The members of the Boko Haram sect were reported to have killed 4 persons in a village.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 3 women died from stray bullets by members of Boko Haram insurgents. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A man suspected to be a Boko haram suicide bomber blew himself up before he could hit his target. He later died in the hospital from excessive bleeding.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Over two dozens of Boko Haram gunmen attacked a community and killed about 25 people.Other sources gave different casualty figures.

title: Cultists/Gunmen Kill, Imo
description: Chibuike Omaka, alias Mbele, in his late 20s, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. It was believed to be a war between cult groups.
place: OppositeFCMB Bank, Along Mbaise Road, Owerri.

title: Political Crisis, Rivers
description: 2 members of the Peoples Democratic Party, Odinaka Wichendu and Nkanum Nwonkwo were killed in their residence when the gunmen raided their houses.

title: Political Crisis, Rivers
description: The leader of the All Progressives Congress Tasie Wike was shot dead by suspected political thugs during a ward-to-ward campaign for Dr. Dakuku Peterside, the party’s governorship candidate.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Octogenarian, Enugu
description: Chief Tagbuo Oguejiofor, a 85-year-old member of the traditional rulers was shot dead in his house by Fulani herdsmen over an undisclosed issue.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community. The attack was successful following the withdrawal of Chadian troops from the community.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (14 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , Nigerian Tribune (13 )

title: Boko Haram Slaughter Wives, Borno
description: Dozens of women married to Boko haram insurgents were slaughtered in the bid to stop them from marrying 'infidels' or soldiers. The victims were killed by their husbands before a battle with soldiers. It is assumed that at least 2 dozens (24) of the women were killed. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Killings, Borno
description: Scores (assuming 2 scores at least) of dead bodies believed to be hostages or those who resisted Boko haram indoctrination were discovered in water wells in a community. Some of the victims who included women and children were believed to have been executed on the River Bama Bridge before the insurgents fled the community. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suspect vs Mob, Kano
description: A man suspected to be a member of the Boko haram sect was lynched by an angry mob after a gun and a suicide vest was discovered on him. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Behead, Rivers
description: Mr. Ukeoma, 28-year-old man was beheaded by unknown gunmen. The killing is associated with the forthcoming legislative re-run elections on March 19th. Cultists were implicated in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A teenage girl blew herself up when security agents tried to arrest her for terrorism. Other 3 suicide bombers were killed before they could approach their targets.
place: IDC camp within Government Girls Secondary School in Yerwa.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Some Fulani herdsmen numbering about 70 came with arrows, locally-made guns and knives when most people were still asleep and killed over 95 people, most of who were women and children. Several houses were also burnt.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (80 ) , Vanguard (90 ) , The Punch (95 ) , Other newpapers 1 (100 )

title: Cattle Rustlers vs Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 9 Fulani herdsmen were killed by cattle rustlers while they were grazing. About 765 cattles were also rustled in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Yobe
description: 4 soldiers were killed by explosions in an attempt to clear a town of Boko haram insurgents. This latest event came shortly after troops discovered a bomb-making factory in the town where improvised explosive devices used by terrorists were manufactured.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Adamawa
description: 3 suicide bombers heading towards a military checkpoint were killed by the security agents before they could reach their final destination.

title: Boko Haram in 100 Corpses, Borno
description: 100 bodies that were suspected to have been beheaded by boko haram insugents were found dumped in what appears to be a mass grave near a bridge.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: A Boko Haram female suicide bomber blew herself up and killed 34 people in a market. The same market has come under several suicide explosions since last year. However, there are various accounts on the casualty figure in the attack. Amnesty International reported 19 deaths.
sources_of_information: The Punch (35 ) , The Guardian (25 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Vanguard (20 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (19 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 6, Plateau
description: 6 people including 2 members of the state owned security outfit were killed in 2 separate attacks by Fulani herdsmen. The victims are Habila Fom and Joseph Dung, Felicia Badung and Amos Badung, Evelyn, and her 2-year old son, Chuwang.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 travellers were ambushed and killed by Boko haram insurgents who dressed as horsemen. The insurgents also snatched the victims' cars.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , The Punch (8 )

title: Military vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Fightings between soldiers and Boko Haram sect, led to the death of 20 of the insurgents.m 5 Toyota vans, cache of arms and ammunition were recovered.
place: Gombi, which is 120 kilometres from Yola.

title: Boko Haram, Foreigners, Soldiers, Borno
description: 5 Nigerian soldiers and a South African and former Koevoet member of KwaZulu-Natal, Leon Lotz were killed, allegedly by Boko Haram sect, more likely by friendly fire. Leon Lotz was working for a private security firm, STTEP (Specialized Tasks, Training, Equipment and Protection), to help training government and allied forces to fight the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Borno
description: A bomb planted by Boko haram went off in a market and killed 5 people. This recent attack came less than a day after 2 markets and a motor park were bombed by the insurgents.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (5 )

title: Extra-judicial Killing, Adamawa
description: 33 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) who were returning home after soldiers liberated their villages were killed by mobs claiming to be fighting Boko haram. Most of the victims were women and children. A pregnant woman was reported to have been burnt alive. This event is backdated by 2 days of its report since no date was provided.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Clash, Plateau
description: 2 people, suspected to be Fulani, were killed, during a protest by some natives that were calling for the release of some armed youths arrested by men of the Special Task Force in charge of the security of the area. This incident occurred during a reprisal by Fulani herdsmen killing a 62-year-old retired police officer, Baba Jacob Wangte, his wife, Mrs. Ruth Jacob, 50, son of the retired police officer, Katop Jacob, 27, his wife Rachael, 21, 3 of his grandchildren, and 2 others
sources_of_information: The Punch (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Boko Haram Multiple Explosions, Borno
description: 58 people died in Boko Haram multiple explosions that occurred in 2 markets and a motor park. Most of the victims were traders, travelers and bystanders. This recent attacks came shortly after the group declared allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS), another foreign Islamic terror group. Amnesty International reported 45 deaths.
place: Maidugury Monday Market, Baga road fish market and Borno Express Terminus motor park
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (100 ) , The Nation (58 ) , Daily Trust (54 ) , The Punch (50 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (45 )

title: Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A suicide bomber believed to be a member of Boko haram blew up himself half way to his target (a military checkpoint on a bridge). His intention was to blow up the bridge.

title: Political/Pre-Electoral Violence, Kaduna
description: A clash between the supporters of PDP and All Progressive Congress claimed the lives of 3 teenagers. The victims were passersby during the crisis.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 300 Boko haram insurgents and 10 Chadian soldiers were killed in an attempt to reclaim a community from the insurgents. The onslaught came a day after 1000s of troops crossed into Nigeria to retake seized territories.

title: 5 in Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Shootings and setting ablaze of buildings and farm produce by Fulani herdsmen led to 5 people killed with several others abducted.
place: Jootar community in Ukemberagya/ Twarev council ward.

title: Gunmen Attack, Rivers
description: 6 people were shot dead by gunmen. The state has come under several gunmen attacks in recent days.
place: D/ Line area close to Oroworoko community

title: Communal Crisis, Taraba
description: An argument between a Jukun youth and Hausa-Fulani youth degenerated into a fight in which one of the youths took a knife and stabbed the other to death and in retaliation. Another youth was killed in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Borno
description: Members of the deadly boko haram sect attacked a community and killed 9 persons. The insurgents arrived in large numbers and slaughtered their victims in a most barbaric manner.

title: Boko Haram vs Truck Drivers, Borno
description: 10 truck drivers were reported killed by Boko haram insurgents in the past 3 weeks. The victim's heads were severed with an electric chainsaw and their trucks burnt. This event is backdated by 3 weeks as it was reported by the source. A community (Ngamdu) along the expressway linking Damaturu and Maiduguri was assumed to be the location of this incident.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 73 Boko haram insurgents and a soldier were killed during a shootout. The insurgents had camouflaged as herdsmen to gain entry into the community before they were intercepted.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: In a 2 day attack, Boko Haram insurgents slaughtered 74 men and 20 children who were said to have refused to join the sect. This occurred when the sect arrived a village to recruit more men to fight what they have termed 'a Holy War' against Nigerian government.

title: Communal Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: Mr Jonah Oku was beheaded during a communal violence over land between the people of Ekimbuk and Idoro clans. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Bauchi
description: A suspected Boko haram female suicide bomber was set ablaze by an angry mob after she was found with explosives.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 34 traders were killed when Boko haram attacked a market. Markets and public places have become main targets of the insurgents' deadly activities.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 people including 4 Boko haram insurgents and a soldier were killed during a clash with troops.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of men and people with tribal links to Chad (Shuwa-Arab community) have been killed by Boko haram insurgents. The attacks was a revenge for the participation of Chadian soldiers as members of the Multinational Joint Task Force fighting insurgency in Nigeria. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 female Boko haram suicide bombers and 2 female bystanders died when one of the bombers detonated explosives strapped in her body. Amnesty International reported 2 deaths.
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (2 )

title: Vigilante vs Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: 12 cattle rustlers were killed and burnt by members of a local vigilante. The state has been experiencing several cattle rustlers' attacks in the past one year.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A Boko haram suicide bomber detonated explosives strapped on him and killed 20 people including himself. Most of the victims were farm labourers.
place: Tarsan Gandu (Motor Park) in Biu town
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , The Punch (15 ) , Vanguard (18 ) , Other newpapers 1 (19 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (18 )

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Plateau
description: 17 people were killed when a twin blasts hit two motor parks in front of University of Jos. Most of the victims are assumed to be students who just arrived for a new semester. The attack is assumed to have been carried out by Boko haram. According to Amnesty International, 17 persons died in the attack.
place: Bauchi road in front of old University of Jos campus.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (18 ) , The Punch (12 ) , Other newspaper 2 (9 ) , Daily Trust (20 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (17 )

title: Boko Haram, Adamawa.
description: Nigerian troops have recaptured some communities and in the process killed many (assuming 10) Boko haram insurgents.This incident is linked to event IBD005090.
place: Shikah, Fikayel, Tetebah, Buza, Bara, Kamla and Bumsa in Gulak.

title: Boko Haram, Yobe
description: Some Boko haram insurgents were killed while others burnt in a fire when Nigerian troops engaged them in a gun battle in the bid to reclaim some captured territories. 10 insurgents and a soldier were assumed to have died in the encounter.This incident is linked to IBD005089.

title: Boko Haram Kills 24, Adamawa
description: 24 civilians were killed when some communities were attacked by armed militants who were believed to be Boko Haram members. They thronged the area in several vans and motorcycles to perpetrate the evil.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Kano
description: 12 people including 2 male suicide bombers died during a Boko haram attack in a motor park.Source from NURTW said 37 people died which include 21 passengers, 3 members of the union, 10 petty traders and the insurgents.
place: Kano Line at Naibawa Area, along Zaria Road
sources_of_information: The Guardian (12 ) , Vanguard (12 ) , Nigerian Tribune (12 ) , Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Daily Trust (37 )

title: Boko Haram Female Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A female Boko haram suicide bomber killed 19 people in a motor park explosion. 4 of the victims died on the way to the hospital while 15 died on the spot. Amnesty International reported 10 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (19 ) , The Guardian (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Other newspaper 2 (18 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (10 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 207 Boko haram insurgents and a soldier were killed during a shootout between the Chadian soldiers and the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A 7-year-old female suicide bomber detonated a bomb in a market and killed 6 people including herself. Amnesty International reported 6 deaths.

title: Cattle Rustler vs Traditional Ruler, Kastina
description: Hassan Wurgal, the ward head of Gimi was killed by cattle rustlers who had been terrorizing the area.

title: Boko Haram Kill 3, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram members killed 3 vigilante members when they attempted to kidnap the vice chairman of Hong local government.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Boko Haram, Niger
description: Soldiers killed 11 bandits that terrorised a community and the bandits may probably have a link with Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko haram attacked 2 villages and killed 40 persons.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , Other newspaper 2 (40 ) , This Day (50 )

title: Boko Haram Members Drown, Borno
description: A large number of Boko haram members (assuming 50) drowned in a lake while escaping from a military onslaught.
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, other accident
sources_of_information: This Day (50 ) , The Guardian (50 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 )

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Adamawa
description: Boko haram insurgent attacked a village in an early morning raid, killing over 30 people in the community. The village was said to be close to Sambisa forest.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko haram insurgents were killed during a raid on their strongholds. From the reports, it is assumed that about 100 insurgents were killed.
place: Sambisa forest and some parts of Gwoza.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect suffered heavy casualties from aerial attack. The number of casualty was not given but It is assumed that 20 members of Boko Haram was killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 30 people were killed in Boko haram attacks on 2 villages.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Other newspaper 2 (30 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 35 villagers were killed by Boko haram insurgents during an attack on a village. Soldiers intervened and killed 12 of the attackers.

title: Boko Haram, Plane, Bomb, Borno
description: An unidentified plane dispatched a bomb in a village at the Nigerian border. Over 30 people were reported killed in the air attack. It is suspected that the event is connected to boko haram raids.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 300 Boko haram insurgents and 2 soldiers died during a clash. There has been renewed efforts by soldiers to reclaim lost territories in the state.
place: Monguno, Gabchari, Abba Jabari, Gajigana, Gajiram, Damakar, Kumaliwa, Bosso Wanti, Jeram and Kabrisungul
sources_of_information: The Punch (302 ) , Independent (302 ) , Daily Trust (302 ) , Nigerian Tribune (302 )

title: STF vs Rustlers, Plateau
description: 2 cattle rustlers were killed by men of the Special Task Force.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 37 people were killed, following multiple blasts near a checkpoint, with Boko Haram sect in a gun duel.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A restaurant was bombed by a male suicide bomber. 3 other people died in the incident.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (assuming 2 scores) of Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers in their bid to reclaim territories captured from the insurgents.

title: Political Violence, Plateau
description: Rev. Samuel Doro, an All Progressive Congress party chieftain was murdered in his house by unknown gunmen.

title: Vigilantes vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 3 youth vigilantes were shot dead by soldiers transporting arms to locations in Borno during a squabble. The soldiers were mistaken for Boko haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents killed scores of residents in a recent attack on a community. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed.

title: Gunmen vs Cyclist, FCT (Abuja)
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen laid an ambush on a male motorcyclist and hacked him to death.

title: Boko Haram Female Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: A Boko haram suicide female bomber blew herself up and 13 others.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (13 ) , The Punch (10 ) , The Nation (10 ) , Other newspaper 2 (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Kano
description: A Professor of Agriculture at the Ahmadu Bello University (ABU) Zaria, Ahmad Falaki and his driver were killed by a team of policemen. This is contrary to initial report that 2 gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members were killed when policemen repelled their attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (2 ) , This Day (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 21 people were killed by Boko Haram gunmen. Another source gave 9 casualties. The attack occurred in a market place. Many other victims were injured in the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 11 people including 2 old women, who were burnt to death in their huts by Boko Haram Insurgents. Amnesty International reported 14 deaths during the attack.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (11 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (14 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Some villagers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 13 Boko haram terrorists and 1 Chadian soldier died in a recent fight. The Chadian soldiers are part of the Multi National Joint Force drafted to fight Boko haram in Nigeria. Other sources reported that scores (it is assumed 2 scores) were killed in the encounter.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (14 ) , The Nation (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 )

title: Cattle Rustlers, Kaduna
description: 3 people were attacked and killed by gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers.

title: Marauder, Benue
description: 40 persons were killed by the marauders in a crisis that led to the sacking of over 18 villages and communities, while several houses, huts and farmland were also razed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Rape, Ogun
description: Mrs. Ayesi Balogun, was raped and killed by some Fulani herdsmen.
place: Asa village in the Oja Odan area

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Benue
description: 6 people were killed in a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. There has been ongoing bloody clashes between between the two.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A DPO was killed during a Boko haram raid on a police station. The reporter made a mistake: Kanamma is the headquarters of Yunusari LGA, not Yusufari. Kanamma was the first camp where the so-called Taleban (later to become Boko Haram) settled and fought the police in November 2003. The insurgents then deserted the area but their successors came back in 2014 to steal food and burn the place. According to residents and refugees interviewed in Maine Soroa (Rep. of Niger) on 24 Feb. 2015, they arrived from Gashua (Bade LGA) to kill 1 DPO, 2 policemen and 4 civilians on 10 Feb. 2015. On 17 Feb. 2015, again, they came back to steal a Toyota Hilux pickup of the local vigilantes. 1 DCO, 1 policeman, 1 school headmaster, 1 coranic school teacher and 8 civilians were killed during their raid.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (19 )

title: Cattle Rustler, FCT (Abuja)
description: Malam Adamu Idi a 40 year-old man, was shot dead by men suspected to be cattle rustlers.
place: Fulani camp Tunga Tofa village in Dafa ward.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmer, Ogun
description: Fulani herdsmen killed a female farmer identified as Ruth Oga on her farmland. It was reported that the farmer was killed during a stand-off with the herdsmen. The date of the incident was not stated but due to the report, it is assumed that the event happened the same time with IBD004901.

title: 38 in Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities and killed 30 people.
place: Chembe, Tse-Mue, Tse-Shigbe, Mgbakpa and Oragbai
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (30 ) , Daily Trust (35 ) , Nigerian Tribune (18 ) , The Nation (38 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Borno
