title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill, Oyo
description: Mr. Adesina Ojedokun (a farmer) was killed on his farm by Fulani herdsmen after an argument over grazing.

title: Police Versus Rustlers, Kastina
description: 2 suspected cattle rustlers were killed by police since January. Due to the nature of the story, the date of this event is backdated by 2 weeks

title: Gunmen Kill, Bauchi
description: Alhaji Babangida Garba the Director of Admin and Finance at the Bauchi State Ministry of Local Government was shot and killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Commander, Borno
description: An unnamed Boko Haram commander was killed in an air raid by the Nigerian Air Force.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: 12 people have been killed in separate attacks in different locations by Fulani herdsmen. As reported, the incidents occurred in the last four months. This event is therefore backdated to the middle of the 4 months (February 4th, 2015).
lga: Isoko south, Isoko North, Ughelli South, Ughelli North

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A clash between Chadian soldiers and Boko haram insurgents resulted in the death of 200 of the insurgents and 9 Chadian soldiers.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers when they attempted to overrun the state capital through some community. It is assumed that about 100 insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 500 Boko Haram fighters and 9 civilians including an aged man, his grand daughter and 7 people in a pure water factory were killed in failed attempt to attack the state capital. One of the sources reported 3 civilian casualties. More than 37 civilians were injured in the attack.

title: 9 in Boko Haram Attack, Yobe

description: Gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers attacked a community and killed 10 people

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Several people (we assume 10) by Boko haram insurgents and many of the insurgents (also assuming 10) were killed by local hunters and soldiers during a clash in a community.

title: Herdsmen Kill 27, Taraba
description: 27 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The areas in the state has consistently been attacked by Fulani herdsmen.

title: Party Crisis, Taraba
description: A shoot-out between soldiers and protesting civilians at the venue of All Progressives Congress, APC, governorship campaign led to the death of 3 people.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers and Boko haram insurgents died when the insurgents attempted to overrun the state capital. The fatality figure as reported by one of the papers rose from 63 to 100 two days after.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores (believed to be at least 40) of civilians and soldiers and 200 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a fight between soldiers and the insurgents. This includes 2 health personnels who died when Monguno hospital was attacked.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 30 persons including a village head were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community. The recent attack came a day before the President Jonathan launched his re-election campaign in the state.

title: Boko Haram, Adamawa.
description: 6 people were killed by a joint military and vigilance groups in a fresh attempt to seize a town. A soldier and a woman died in the shootout.

title: Boko Haram, Adamawa.
description: 3 persons were killed and several houses, including churches burnt when the Joint Task Force (JTF) launched an attack on the insurgents who wanted to seize 2 towns.

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 4 Boko haram insurgents who got stranded after an attack were killed by vigilantes. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported for the incident.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 5 people were killed in a boko haram suicide mission. Amnesty International reported 6 deaths including the suicide bomber.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Gombe

title: Boko Haram Bomber Stoned, Kano

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko haram insurgents and some soldiers were killed during a clash. The insurgents wanted to overrun the troops but were repelled. It is assumed that at least 2 dozens (24) insurgents and at least 5 soldiers died in the encounter.

description: Many Boko haram insurgents and civilians were killed when the sect attempted to overrun the state capital but met a stiff resistance from soldiers. It is assumed that about 2 dozens (24) died during the attack since no casualty figure was reported.

description: A 39-year-old man, Jeje Oni, was shot dead by unknown gunmen on his to his house.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 25 people were killed by Boko haram in a community in a reprisal attack for the killing of dozens of their members by hunters. It is assumed that at least 2 dozens (24) of Boko haram members were killed. According to Amnesty International, 36 persons were killed.

title: Boko Haram Kill 26, Borno
description: 26 residents of a community were killed in an attack carried out by Boko haram.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno

title: Herdsmen Kill 10, Plateau
description: 10 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen. This is the second attack in few days.

description: 15 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen carried out a fresh attack on a community.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Gombe

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Yobe
description: 6 people were killed when a suspected boko haram suicide bomber detonated a bomb.

description: 7 people were killed in a communal clash between Fulani herdsmen and residents. The exact date was not specified, it is assumed the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

description: 3 boko haram bombers were reported to have died in a car explosion at a police check-point.

description: Boko Haram fighters attacked a village few kilometers from Chibok, where 200 girls were kidnapped in April this year. 15 people were killed.

description: A bomb planted in a football field by persons suspected to be Boko Haram terrorists exploded and killed a sugar cane vendor.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu

title: Herdsmen Attack, Taraba
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a village and killed 14 people. The gunmen carried out the attack during a wedding ceremony. It was suspected that the gunmen, who came from a neighbouring village were on a revenge mission.

title: Boko Haram Female Bomber, Gombe
description: 25 people were killed when a female Boko haram suicide bomber detonated explosives in a motor park.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Bauchi
description: 16 people were killed when a bomb went off in a market. It is believed the bomb was planted by Boko haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: Scores of people were killed when the Boko haram sect attacked a community. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed during the raid.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers ambushed and killed many Boko Haram insurgents. The soldiers ambushed the insurgents who were in the process of attacking engineers working to restore electricity in the area. 3 soldiers were also killed during the confrontation.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 5 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen raided a community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 78 people including 75 insurgents and 3 civilians were feared killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community. The 75 insurgents were killed by soldiers who repelled the attack, while 3 civilians were killed by the insurgents.

description: A man identified as Chinedu Nnaji, was murdered over a land dispute between 2 communities, Amechi-Uwani and Umunenshi Umunnajingene communities.

title: Fulani Attack, Kogi
description: Fulani herdsmen killed and burnt 18 people.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 10 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Police vs Community, Adamawa
description: About 25 Fulani herdsmen were reportedly killed by policemen. The incident happened 2 weeks (2014-12-16) before it was reported on 2014-12-30.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: One Mr Musa was killed by members of the Boko Haram terrorist group when they attacked his village. They also abducted his wife. This incident reportedly happened in December, though no exact date was stated.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A man was killed by Boko haram insurgents who also adopted his wife and child (See event in IBD005634). From the report, this incident occurred sometimes in December 2014. This event is therefore backdated to 15th of the same month since the date was not reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Dozens of people who were reluctant to join the Boko haram sect had their hands tied to their backs and shot dead by the insurgents. It is assumed about 2 dozens (24 people) were killed. Amnesty International reported that the insurgents killed 200 persons.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 13 people were killed by Boko haram insurgents during an attack. Women and children were among the casualties.

title: Suicide Bombers, Kano
description: 4 traders and 2 Boko haram suicide bombers died after the bombers detonated explosives inside a market.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in an attempt, killed 7 Boko Haram sect.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Bauchi
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army have captured the Balmo Forest killing about 20 Boko Haram members. This event is possibly linked to IBD007113 and a video posted by Insurgent group Ansaru on 09 Feb. 2015 about a massacre by Nigerian Army, which burnt Mundu village on 7 Dec. 2014. 2 dead bodies are seen o the video.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Gombe
description: 80 people including 10 soldiers and 70 insurgents were killed during a clash between soldiers and Boko Haram insurgents who attacked a dynamite manufacturing factory.

description: Soldiers in pursuit of Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village in a convoy of about 20 vehicles, killed anyone in sight and burnt down the community.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Gombe
description: Scores of people were feared killed by Boko Haram gunmen. The specific number of deaths were not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that at least 40 (2 scores) people were killed.

title: Herdsmen Attacks, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed many people. It was reported that the herdsmen ambushed some farmers and attacked them with sophisticated weapons including AK-47 riffles.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Attack, Borno

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 30 Boko haram insurgents, 35 policemen, 6 soldiers and several civilians were killed during a clash between soldiers and Boko haram. It is assumed that about 10 civilians were killed during the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Civilian JTF repelled insurgents and killed more than 200 of them.

title: Boko Haram / Prison Break, Ekiti
description: Gunmen attacked a Federal Prison and killed a prison warder in the process. Some sources alleged that the gunmen were Boko haram insurgents who attacked to rescue their colleagues.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: A 12-year-old boy, Saminu Ahmadu, was killed by cattle rustlers during a raid. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Fulani herdsmen Attack, Kogi
description: 5 persons were killed in a Fulani herdsmen’s reprisal attack.

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko haram insurgents were killed by vigilante youths popularly called 'Civilian JTF' during an invasion of a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram Kills 5 Soldiers, 30 Hunters in Roadside Bomb explosion. Amnesty International reported 35 deaths.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Vanguard (35 ) , Independent (45 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (35 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores were killed during a recent Boko haram attack on a community. Since it was reported that scores were killed, it is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed during the attack.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Punch (40 )

title: Gunmen vs Soldiers, Zamfara
description: Gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers killed 7 soldiers and other 43 persons. Houses were also burnt in the incident.

title: Bomb Explosion, Kano
description: 200 people were killed when Boko haram detonated explosives inside Kano Central Mosque and shot at fleeing worshippers.

title: Political Violence, Cross River
description: 3 people including Effiom Ayi and Otu were killed in political clash during a PDP ward congress. The 3rd victim was hit by a truck during the crisis. It was reported that the accident was planned.

title: Bandits, Zamfara
description: 8 bandits were killed by a detachment of policemen and soldiers during a raid on their hideout. The date of the event was not stated. It is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram attacked a border community and killed scores of people. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed during the attack. The attack came just few days 5 insurgents were killed in the community.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (40 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (200 )

title: Chieftaincy Tussle, Adamawa
description: 10 people were killed during a chieftaincy tussle between 2 clans of Nyakwen and Dwenti. The deposing of a patriarch of one of the communities escalated the crisis.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Many people died when Fulani herdsmen attacked several communities. The attack was in continuation of the face-off between Eggon farmers and Fulani herdsmen. It is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) were killed during the crisis.
place: Agaba at Duduguru, Kadarko, Madagba and Ugah

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 20 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked 2 villages. Several houses were also burnt down.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 48 fishermen and traders were blocked on their way to a market in Chad and slaughtered by Boko haram insurgents. Their bodies were thrown into the Lake Chad waters.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (48 ) , Vanguard (48 ) , Other newpapers 1 (45 ) , Other newspaper 2 (56 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Many people were killed during an invasion by Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that scores were killed. Therefore, it is assumed that at least 2 scores (40) died during the attack.

title: Leadership Tussle, Edo
description: Factions in a community were involved in a leadership crisis. 1 person identified as Mr. Okoro Ogbaretin, a Community Development Association chairman, was reported dead in the fracas.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 2 soldiers died during a confrontation with Boko haram insurgents. Soldiers have consistently battled the insurgents to reclaim some captured territories from the sect.

title: Policeman Drowns, Jigawa
description: A Police Inspector, Lado Nuhu, got drowned in a river after he was abandoned by his colleagues during an attack by Fulani herdsmen. The victim fell into a river when he was exchanging gunfire with the herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram vs MJTF, Borno
description: The Multi-national Joint Task Force (MJTF) killed 5 boko haram insugents.

title: Boko Haram Kill 45, Borno
description: 45 people were killed when Boko haram sect invaded a community. The insurgents made away with food stuff and livestock. Amnesty International source reported 53 deaths.
sources_of_information: The Nation (45 ) , This Day (45 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (53 )

title: 4 in Communal Clash, Nasarawa
description: A communal crisis led to the death of 4 persons at 2 different locations. There have been cases of communal attacks in various part of the state lately. Just last week about 30 people were killed in a related assault (IBD004328).
place: Arikya Soni and Sakon Gona village.

title: Gunmen Kill, Nasarawa
description: One person was killed in an evening strike by unknown gunmen. Several other people were injured in the attack. The area has become a target of incessant attacks by criminals suspected to be Fulani herdsmen. The date of the event was not stated, it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Blasts Market, Bauchi
description: A bomb explosion rocked a popular GSM Market, otherwise known as 'Kasuwan Jagol'. Over 20 persons were reported killed. According to Amnesty International report, 9 persons died in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , The Punch (30 ) , This Day (31 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (9 )

title: Communal Clash, Nasarawa
description: 23 people were feared killed in renewed clashes between Eggon people and Fulani militias.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Adamawa
description: At least, 10 soldiers were reportedly killed in a confrontation between the army and the Boko Haram sect. It was also reported that during the confrontation that lasted about 4 days, more than 400 insurgents were killed by the security forces.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 30 people were killed when Boko haram overran a community where over 200 students were abducted in April.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 5 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents invaded a community. Another source reported that dozens were killed. It is assumed that at least 2 dozens (24) were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Several people were killed during a Boko Haram invasion. The exact figure of casualty is not stated but it is assumed 5 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: About 5 people comprising of father, mother and children were burnt to death by Boko Haram insurgents when they attacked a community. Several people were wounded and properties destroyed. The date of the incident was not given but it was recorded that it happened 7 months ago (it is assumed that the event happened in the middle of the month, 2014-11-15).

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Kano
description: A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vehicle killing himself and many others including 3 policemen. The suicide bomber drove into a petrol station to commit the crime. Amnesty International reported 6 deaths.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , The Nation (15 ) , Vanguard (12 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (6 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community, burnt a police station and killed 2 people including a mobile police officer.

title: Military Fighter Jet, Adamawa
description: 3 crew on board died when an Air Force helicopter crashed. The helicopter was on the trail of Boko haram insurgents when the incident occurred.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Niger
description: A female student suicide bomber died after a failed suicide attack on a school. The bomb exploded before she could reach her target. it is suspected to be a Boko haram attack. There are conflicting reports on the casualty figure. Amnesty International reported 1 death.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (10 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (1 )

title: Boko Haram vs Hunters, Adamawa
description: 75 Boko haram members were killed by local hunters. The hunters attacked the insurgents after they were told the sect killed a soldier.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: Suspected cattle rustlers killed 4 members of the same family. The victims were identified as Lati Garba, Abdurahman Garba, Yahaya Garba and Lati Garba.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Fleeing Boko Haram insurgents killed 10 residents of a town. The majority of the victims were young people. They were either shot or had their throats slited.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Yobe
description: 52 people including students and teachers died when a Boko haram suicide bomber dressed in a school uniform detonated a bomb during a morning assembly. Amnesty International reported 49 deaths.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (52 ) , Nigerian Tribune (58 ) , Other newpapers 1 (51 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (49 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 15 civil servants. They were accused of either working in the civil service or are active in politics.

title: Boko Haram Kill 2, Borno
description: A former DSS officer and his son were killed by Boko haram insurgents. The father was killed and in the process of retrieving his corpse, the son was also killed. Due to the way the incident was reported, this event is backdated by 7 days from the date of this report.

title: Soldiers vs Fulani Mercenaries,. Nasarawa
description: 11 Fulani herdsmen in military uniform were killed by soldiers during a shootout.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 33 people including women and children were killed by Fulani herdsmen in an ambush. The victims were returning from their farms when they were attacked.
place: Ligyabo, Likygegba, in Arikya and Agwan-Mangoro communities

title: Boko Haram Female Bomber, Bauchi
description: A female suicide bomber believed to be a member of Boko Haram sect bombed a commercial bank, killing and injuring several people. Amnesty International reported 17 deaths.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (20 ) , Vanguard (14 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (14 )

title: Boko Haram Kill 7, Borno
description: 7 supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) who were travelling to the state capital to meet with some politicians were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The insurgents were returning from an operation in Nafada, Gombe state when they met the politicians (see IBD004200).
place: Sabon Kasuwa Village, Along Gombe Road.

title: Boko Haram Kill 2, Borno
description: 2 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community and burnt many houses including churches.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: Extra-judicial Killings: 15 men and boys aged between 13 and 40 (suspected Boko Haram members) were arrested by the police and handed over to soldiers. They were tied with ropes, tortured and shot dead and their corpses were dumped into the mortuary.

title: Soldiers vs Suspects, Yobe
description: Extra-judicial killings: 16 out of 17 suspected Boko Haram insurgents arrested by soldiers are found dead with bullet wounds. Their corpse are identified in the morgue by community leaders. Victims are all Kanuri and include an imam arrested in front of a mosque after the attack on a Shiite procession. This incident is connected to event IBD004197.

title: Boko Haram Kills 11, Gombe
description: An Islamic cleric of the Tijaniyya, Sheikh Adamu Misira, and 10 other people with him were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked his community. The insurgents had earlier killed an unspecified number of soldiers in a checkpoint before killing the cleric. It is therefore assumed that 5 soldiers were killed.
sources_of_information: The Nation (16 ) , Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , The Guardian (25 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: A teenager, Ossai Oluem, was shot dead by some Fulani herdsmen. Some women were also abducted during the incident.

title: Jail-break, Kogi
description: 1 inmate was killed during a jail-break. The inmate was killed when about 50 armed men suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked a maximum prison with Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and set free 144 inmates. 2 marshals of the Federal Road Safety Commission (FRSC) were also shot dead during the attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 8 people. Several houses were burnt down as well.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents stormed a village and killed 18 people. Another source subsequently reported 11 residents and 41 Boko haram insurgents killed. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: Cattle rustlers attacked a village and killed 15 people. The rustlers rode on motorcycles stole livestock and food and set houses ablaze.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Gombe
description: Many people were feared killed by multiple bomb blasts in a motor park. The blast was caused by Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) planted in vehicles inside the park.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: A Fulani group of suspected cattle rustlers launched an attack on a village and killed about 42 people, including 13 vigilantes.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: Cattle rustlers attacked a village and killed 6 people. Several houses and shops were burnt during the attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Borno
description: 41 Boko Haram insurgents were killed and beheaded by members of the youth vigilante group also known as Civilian JTF. The insurgents were killed by a combined team of Soldiers and the vigilante group. The date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that it happened 2 days (2014-10-30) before it was reported on 2014-11-01.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram sect captured the commercial centre of Adamawa State, killing over 200 people during the 2- day bloody operations.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community and killed several residents. The specific number of deaths was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents entered a town in Hilux vehicles and motorcycles and killed many people. Due to the nature of the story, 10 people are assumed to have being killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the dreaded Islamic sect, Boko Haram killed 5 people and injured several others in a village market.

title: Boko Haram vs Pastor, Borno
description: Pastor Eluid Mshelizza Gwamna of Living Faith Bible Church was killed in an ambush by Boko haram insurgents while returning from a church programme. This event is backdated by 2 weeks since it was reported that the incident occurred few weeks ago.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Dozens of Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a gun battle with troops of the Multi-National Joint Task Force (MNJTF). The specific number of deaths was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that 2 dozens (24) people were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: A community was attacked by Fulani herdsmen and 5 people were killed. Many houses were razed as well.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The dreaded Islamic sect, Boko Haram killed 17 persons in an attack and abducted 30 girls and boys.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members, killed 4 persons.

title: Boko Haram Blast, Bauchi
description: Many people were killed in a bomb blast rocked a motor park in the state. The victims were burnt beyond recognition. Amnesty International reported 5 deaths.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , The Punch (15 ) , The Nation (5 ) , The Guardian (10 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (5 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: A soldier was killed in a Boko Haram ambush. This came few days after a ceasefire was alleged to have been signed by the government and the insurgents.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 20 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen invaded some communities. Several houses were burnt down.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 1 resident. The gunmen attacked the venue of a social event and opened fire on the celebrants killing a young man.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 25 residents.
sources_of_information: The Punch (25 ) , Other newspaper 2 (15 ) , Other newpapers 1 (31 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 25 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a clash between soldiers and the Islamic militants. 5 members of the youth vigilante group (Civilian JTF) were also killed in a separate clash within the area.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (28 ) , The Nation (30 ) , Daily Trust (35 )

title: Alleged Boko Haram Attack, Taraba
description: A pastor, his son and 28 other Christians were killed by suspected Hausa-Fulani insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed some residents. The specific number of those killed was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that 5 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram Kill 30, Borno
description: 30 people including Alhaji Salatu, Alhaji Bulakaye, and a traditional ruler Ba Mallam Wasak who is also an uncle to Goni Ali Modu, the immediate past speaker of Borno State House of Assembly, were killed barely 24 hours after a ceasefire agreement was signed by the Federal Government and the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram vs Community, Borno
description: 8 people and an insurgent were killed in a Boko Haram renewed attacks on a community. Other sources reported 19 deaths including 8 travellers, 8 youth vigilantes (Civilian JTF) and 3 residents (Civilians). This event is related to event IBD004094. Several people had previously been killed in the community.
sources_of_information: The Punch (8 ) , Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Daily Trust (19 )

title: Cattle Rustler, Zamfara
description: 2 cattle rustlers were killed by members of a military special team on cattle rustling.

title: Many Drown, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents take the village of Abadam, on the border with the Republic of Niger, and kill 3 on 16 October. Many people then get drowned while crossing a river in an attempt to escape attacks in the region. The number of people who got drown was not specified in Daily Times, maybe up to 10. See also IBD004073.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (10 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (3 )

title: Market Violence, Kastina
description: 5 persons were killed in a violent clash between Fulani herdsmen and vigilante group at a marketplace.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 8 men were beheaded by the Boko Haram sect. The day of the event was not given. It is estimated that the incident to have occurred in the middle of October of 2014.

title: Soldiers vs Gunmen, Nasarawa
description: Soldiers killed 2 gunmen who were pursuing a trailer conveying cows and Fulani herdsmen. The gunmen were killed when they open fire on the soldiers who were on their trail.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Nasarawa
description: 4 people including a Police Inspector were killed by unknown gunmen during an ambush. The victims were travelling when they were attacked and set ablaze.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked 2 villages and killed many people. The victims were ambushed on their way to another village.
place: Rim and Shonong villages and Bachi.

title: 130 in Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 130 villagers were killed by Boko Haram during a raid. 2 sons and 4 nephews of a 68-year-old farmer were among the victims. Since it was reported the incident happened in early October, it is assumed it occurred the 1st week (7th) of October.

title: Boko Haram Beheads 7, Borno
description: 7 people were beheaded by Boko Haram in a revenge attack. The insurgents had earlier lost some of its members to previous attacks in the community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: In an attempt to reclaim Boko haram seized territories (Bazza, Michika, Madagali), soldiers killed over 200 Boko Haram insurgents. Some soldiers were also killed during the encounter.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers engaged Boko Haram insurgents and killed many of them. According to the report, the insurgents said to have suffered high casualty figures during the attack. Based on the report it is assumed that 25 insurgents were killed. The incident happened 1 week (2014-10-05) before it was reported on 2014-10-12.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 13, Plateau
description: A soldier and 12 others were killed in a renewed herdsmen attack on some villages.
place: Lwa, Dum, Rachit and Dyang villages in Bachit District

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: The army attacked a Boko haram stronghold in the state and killed many insurgents. The specific number of insurgents killed was not reported. However, based on the report, it is assumed that 15 insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram Kill 70, Adamawa
description: 70 people including a 99-year-old man were killed by Boko Haram during a raid on some villages.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a village and gang-raped some women in their farm. One of the gang-raped women later died. The date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that the incident happened 1 week (2014-10-01) before it was reported on 2014-10-08.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Some unspecified number of men were killed before their wives during a Boko haram invasion. It is assumed that about 5 of them were killed. Also, one Yohanna and 2 of his friends were tied to a tree and later killed by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages and killed scores of people. The specific number of people killed was not reported. However, based on the report, it is assumed that 40 (at least 2 scores) were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Enoch Yohanna's father and some of his other relatives were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. The incident happened when the terrorists invaded Enoch's village. The specific number of death was not stated. It is assumed that 5 victims were recorded in the incident.

title: Kidnap, Rivers
description: A Halliburton Oil Services, Mr. Bankole Orisanyan, was killed in his home by unknown gunmen.

title: Fulani Gunmen, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 20 persons and burnt over 70 houses.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 21 people were killed when Boko Haram launched an attack on a community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 30 Boko haram insurgents died after they opened fire on one another over issues of succession and surrender. This came few days after their leader, Abubakar Shekau was killed by soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Vs Soldiers, Borno
description: 40 Boko haram members were killed when soldiers launched major attacks against them. 11 soldiers lost their lives in the encounter.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 100 Boko Haram insurgents who has earlier attacked a community and attempted to escape were killed during a shoot-out with soldiers.

title: Communal Clash, Nasarawa
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 10 people. Many houses were destroyed during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 15 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the army during a shootout. This event is backdated by 2 weeks as it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected members of Boko Haram terrorists, attacked a market and killed 9 persons.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a market, killed scores of traders and took away money and food stuffs. The exact number of people killed was not reported. However based on the report it is assumed that 40 (at least 2 scores) people were killed.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Sokoto
description: 2 people were killed when cattle rustlers dressed in army and police uniforms attacked a community. Several livestock were stolen.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 2 people were killed when cattle rustlers numbering about 60 attacked a community.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Over 200 members of the Boko Haram sect were killed by soldiers during an attack by the insurgents. After the battle, various ammunition and military wares were recovered from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Kano
description: A bomb explosion and sporadic gun shootings left over 20 people dead when 2 suicide bombers invaded the premises of Federal College of Education (FCE).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , The Punch (20 ) , Other newspaper 2 (19 )

title: Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: 2 cattle rearers; Saidu Gidado and Musa Abdul-hamid, were killed during an attack by some cattle rustlers.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 60 Boko Haram insurgents and captured a top leader of the sect during an attempt by the insurgents to invade a major town. The attempt by the insurgents was resisted by soldiers and the gun battle that ensued resulted in the death of the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 1 soldier was killed when Boko Haram insurgents ambushed military troops.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killings: The Army captured 5 Boko Haram fighters including the Commander of the group, identified as Abubakar Shekau. 4 of them including the commander believed to be Shekau were killed by the soldiers. However, Shekau appeared on an online video debunking his killing.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram killed 5 sick elderly men who could not escape during their attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 2 Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters were killed during a shootout with soldiers to reclaim Michika and Bazza towns from the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 18 persons including a Colonel, 2 Boko Haram commanders and 15 fighters of the sect were feared killed during an attack by the insurgents.

title: Fulani Gunmen, Kaduna
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded 3 communities and killed a lot of persons including a pastor, 4 expectant women, children and some soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: 16 people were killed when Boko Haram militants riding on horses invaded a community. Several people have been killed in recent weeks by the insurgent.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a village. They burnt several houses and killed 20 people in the process.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be herdsmen attacked a community and killed 5 people including a woman and her 2 kids.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 )

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: A band of cattle rustlers invaded 10 villages and raped about 50 women. 1 of the women died in after the terrible incidence.
place: Fegin Mahe, Fegin Kanawa, Kundumai, Ingwai, Tsaunuku, Gangara, Wanaka, Kuka Gandu, Kuliwa, and Lahiya.

title: Displaced Persons, Adamawa
description: Many displaced persons by Boko Haram insurgents were killed by community guards after they were accused of practicing the same faith as Boko Haram. It is hereby assumed that about 10 displaced persons were killed. The date of the incident was not reported.Therefore, this event is backdated by 2 days of its report.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 200 Boko Haram insurgents including a top leader of the sect, Amir, were killed by soldiers. The insurgents were killed during their attempt to attack a major town as part of their territorial acquisition.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Market, Borno
description: 25 youth vigilante members popularly called 'Civilian Joint Task Force' (CJTF) people were killed when Boko haram opened fire on them in a market.

title: Boko Haram Beheads Pilot, Borno
description: The pilot of a missing Nigerian Air Force jet, Wing Commander Chimda Hedima was beheaded in a video posted online by Boko haram. The insurgents claimed to have shut down the jet and captured the slain pilot.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Oyo
description: A Fulani herdsman, Tambaya Ladan, killed one Babuga Alhaji Bande to death with a machete.

title: Hunters, Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 70 Boko haram insurgents were killed by local hunters and vigilante groups after they ran out of arms. Few days ago, the insurgents declared that the city captured.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community. There has been a fierce battle between soldiers and the insurgents in recent weeks.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Soldiers killed 40 Boko Haram insurgents during a gun battle.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko haram terrorists were killed during a confrontation with soldiers. This event is backdated by 2 weeks (fortnight ago) due to the way it was reported.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: 27 soldiers were killed by Boko haram insurgents. The son of former President Olusegun Obasanjo, Col Adeboye Obasanjo was said to have been wounded in the deadly encounter.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: An encounter between the army and Boko Haram insurgents resulted in the death of scores of insurgents. The specific number of deaths was not reported. However, based on the report, it is assumed that 40 insurgents (at least 2 scores) were killed.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a shoot-out with soldiers when the insurgents attacked the residence of former Commander of Niger-Delta Special Task Force, Major General Tukur Buratai and Buratai Central Primary School.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a shootout with soldiers during a raid on their hideout.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Benue
description: A man identified as Amem Jabi was shot dead by an armed gang. The gang shot at the victim several times but did steal anything from him.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked some villages and scores of residents. The insurgents were later repelled by soldiers.The exact number of people killed were not specified. However, based on the report, it is assumed that 40 people (2 scores) were killed.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (50 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities and killed 31 people. This is a 2nd attack within a week.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (31 ) , Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , The Nation (28 )

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 28 people were killed in a clash between the Jukuns and Fulani gunmen. Many houses including 2 mosques were destroyed during the clash.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 500 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a shootout with soldiers. This onslaught came a day after some 700 insurgents were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 60 people were killed in different locations when Fulani herdsmen believed to be cattle rustlers attacked a community. The state has been under herdsmen attacks for months.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 50 people going for morning prayer were killed when some Fulani herdsmen suspected to be rustlers opened fire on them. The killers dressed in military uniform.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Unconfirmed number of people were killed when Boko Haram members invaded a community. It is assumed that about 5 people were killed since the report was not specific on the death figure. Banki (or Amchidé on the Cameroonian side) is a hotspot because it's right on the border with Cameroon. The fighting spills over. On 15 October 2014 in Amchidé, for instance, Boko Haram members slit the throat of 30 civilians and burn churches. 8 Cameroonian soldiers and 107 Boko Haram members are then killed during a clash which is not accounted for in the database because it did not happen within Nigeria. On 16 October 2014, Boko Haram members from Banki also fire a rocket which kills 8 people in Amchidé.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Over 100 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a fierce gun battle. The insurgents attempted to seize a town but were repelled by soldiers and mobile police units. However, Amnesty International reported that Boko Haram killed 50 civilians.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (79 ) , Nigerian Tribune (120 ) , The Guardian (130 ) , Vanguard (700 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (50 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A group of Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers. It is assumed that about 10 of the insurgents were killed since no number was reported.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Some men who refused to join Boko Haram fighters were killed. The deaths include about 20 executions and 42 deaths resulting from bad treatments. Precise date of the event is unknown. But based on the report, the event is estimated between September and October of 2014.

title: Boko Haram Kills 14, Borno
description: 14 people were killed when Boko haram attacked a community. There have been several killing since the capture of some communities in the state by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram vs Cleric, Borno
description: A cleric was killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community.

title: Herdsmen vs Eggon Youths, Nasarawa
description: Over 30 people were feared killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and Eggon youths.
place: Gidan Gambo, Logobi, Assakio and Ikposogye Settlements in Alingani Community.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Scores of people were killed by Boko Haram in a town captured by the insurgents. It is assumed that about 40 people (2 scores) were killed during the attack. According to Amnesty International, 201 persons were killed.
sources_of_information: The Nation (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (201 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 24, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents killed about 20 men in civilian outfits. 2 others were hacked to death with a shovel while another 2 persons were shot dead. The date of this event was not stated, it is assumed it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Taraba
description: Gunmen attacked 2 villages and killed 20 people. During the attack many houses and churches were also destroyed.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a local government area council and dislodged soldiers who were guiding the premises. 3 people were murdered.

title: Herdsmen vs Eggon Youths, Nasarawa
description: 2 people were killed during a clash between Eggon youths and Fulani herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 1 person was killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not stated.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community and killed many people. They hoisted their flag after the attack. The actual number of people who were killed was not reported. However, based on the report that 'many people' died, it is assumed that 10 people were killed.

title: Boko Haram vs Police, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents invaded a Police Training College and killed scores of people, including police officers and trainees. Since it was reported that scores of people were killed, it is assumed that 40 people (2 scores) were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 4 villages and killed 25 people. The insurgents who invaded the villages in a convoy of over 12 Toyota Hilux vehicles and motorcycles destroyed many houses with explosives during the arrack.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 10 people who were fleeing their homes because of attacks. The victims ran into the insurgents in a nearby village.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 2 brothers and an uncle of a 35-year-old Lydia Haruna were killed by Boko Haram insurgents when the terrorists attacked a community.

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 60 people died in attacks and reprisal attacks by Eggon farmers and Fulani herdsmen. The fight started when a farmer accused a herdsman of grazing on his farmland.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 30 insurgents and some soldiers were killed during an encounter between troops of the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) and Boko Haram insurgents. The actual numbers of soldiers who died was not reported. However based on the report it is assumed that 5 soldiers were killed.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (35 ) , This Day (22 ) , The Nation (22 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 100, Borno
description: Intense fighting between the boko haram insurgents and the Nigerian Military led to the death of over 100 civilians. It was also reported that several soldiers were killed in the incidence. It is assumed that at least 10 soldiers died.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: 2 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a raid on a community. Several houses were burnt down in the incidence.

title: Herdsmen Kill 12, Plateau
description: 12 people were killed when unknown gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a village. Several cows were rustled as well.

title: Fulani Ruslers vs Farmers, Zamfara
description: Fulani cattle rustlers gunned down 23 people at the entrance of a village.
place: Hura Girke village of Wonaka district.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 10 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a community. Several other people were abducted by the insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The army killed 50 Boko Haram insurgents and lost 2 soldiers during a military operation to reclaim towns earlier seized by the insurgents.
place: Damboa, Delwa, Mustafari, Manga and Wanga Towns.

title: Gunmen Kill Pastor, Bauchi
description: A pastor, Mr. Blessing Osakpolor Ehiotobo, was shot dead by unknown gunmen in his house.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Kaduna
description: Gunmen attacked a community and killed 4 people including 1 woman and 3 men.

title: Gunman Attack, Delta
description: Jimoh Babatunde a final year Computer Science student was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Ambushed Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and killed 5 soldiers at a border town.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Scores of Boko Haram terrorists killed during a confrontation between soldiers and insurgents. The specific number of those killed was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that at least 40 (2 scores) insurgents were killed.

title: Boko Haram attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 100 people. After the attack, the Emir of the town, Alhaji Muhammed Idrissa Timta (whose father was recently killed by the insurgents-IBD002939) was declared missing. Amnesty International reported 601 deaths during the attack. The insurgents also set ablaze a police station, local government secretariat and other public buildings.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , The Punch (68 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (601 )

title: Gunmen Attacks, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen killed a District Head, Alhaji Abdulrahman Isa Baba, and 2 other persons. The gunmen carted away large sum of money and valuables after killing the victims.

title: Bandits Attack, Delta
description: Armed bandits killed a man for refusing to give them money. 2 others were killed by stray bullets during the attack.

title: Gunmen vs Guard, Yobe
description: Shalado Saleh ‘M’, a security guard, was killed when cattle rustlers attacked a settlement.

title: Communal Violence, Taraba
description: 14 people including 12 civilians and 2 soldiers died in a communal clash between the Jukuns and Hausas. The crisis was precipitated when a man was robbed.
sources_of_information: The Punch (14 ) , Daily Trust (10 ) , The Nation (40 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Yobe
description: 8 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community. The attack came after they failed to attack a military base.

title: Boko Haram Kills 30, Adamawa
description: About 30 persons were said to have been killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they carried out series of attacks on some communities. A village head, Dauda Daniel and a retired Wing Commander were also suspected to have been adopted during the incidence.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 2 displaced persons were killed by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Harram Terrorrist killed 2 soldiers and 3 civilians after setting ablaze a Police station.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and killed 11 officers of the Nigerian Army. One of the victim was identified as Captain Benjamin Toyiring Sule.

title: Boko Haram vs Village Head, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents invaded a village and killed the district head, Alhaji Ibrahim Dawi, and 11 others including the district head's body guard.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents dragged 2 members of vigilante youths (Civilian JTF) from their houses to a river bank and murdered them.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: A motorist and a passenger were ambushed and shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Funlani Invasion, Benue
description: 1 person died when some Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The attack was said to have been caused by a sack notice.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 persons were killed by Boko Haram during a raid on a village. 3 of the victims were tied up and had their throats slitted.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 60 people. During the attack many houses, shops and vehicles were set ablaze.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 60 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided a village. There are different accounts on the actual number of casualty as some sources reported scores (not less than 40) killed.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 100 people. The town was attacked when residents gathered to bury relatives who were earlier killed by the insurgents.

title: Armed Robbers, Nasarawa
description: A college principal, Alhaji Lawal Ahmed, and 2 other persons were shot dead while they were travelling by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 27 people.

title: German kidnap, Adamawa
description: A German teacher in a government-run technical training centre is kidnapped by suspected Boko Haram gunmen despite the intervention of 2 militiamen who are allegedly killed.
place: Anguwan Faransa (French quarters), outskirts Gombi city

title: Gunmen Attacks, Rivers
description: Gunmen attacked a community and killed 3 youths. One of the victims identified as Iyowuma was a contestant in the presidency of the community youth organisation before the event.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: 2 vigilante members were killed by suspected Boko Haram terrorists. A German teacher was also kidnapped during the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 9 persons were reported to have been killed when Boko Haram insurgents raided a village. The insurgents have intensified attacks on remote parts of the state in recent time.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Zamfara
description: 50 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a village. There have been several killings by herdsmen in the state. This recent attack is believed to be a reprisal attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 11 people

title: Boko haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attack a village and kill over 26 people. The insurgents also destroy many houses and shops during the attack. The army fires back and allegedly shot villagers fleeing from Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 70 people including soldiers, police and insurgents were killed during a confrontation between security forces and Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Cattle Rustlers, FCT (Abuja)
description: About 2 cattle rustlers attacked and killed 2 people. 43 cows were also stolen. The victims were identified as Muhammadu Ahmadu and Isa muhammadu.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and killed 17 soldiers including a commanding officer and 4 policemen. The soldiers were returning to their operational base when they were ambushed by the insurgents. 54 of insurgents were also killed during the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko haram sect members ambushed travelers and killed 2 passengers and a driver in different locations.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Bauchi
description: 45 Boko haram insurgents were killed during a military raid. Most of the insurgents including 2 foreigners were captured alive.

title: Security Forces vs Boko Haram, Kaduna
description: 1 Boko Haram insurgent was killed by security peratives during a shoot-out. The insurgent was killed when he engaged security forces in a gun fight in an attempt to escape arrest.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents in military uniforms attacked a village and killed 7 people including 1 member of the vigilante group (Civilian JTF). However, 5 insurgents were also killed during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 44 Boko haram insurgents were killed during an encounter with soldiers. The insurgents were killed when soldiers repelled them from attacking communities.

title: Gunmen Attack, Taraba
description: 45 persons were killed during an attack on some communities by Fulani herdsmen. Among those killed was the Tiv's representative in the Local Government Area.
place: Gashaka, Bashiri, Panwen, Barimini, Sabongida Zaga and Suntai

title: Boko Haram Ambush Soldiers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed some soldiers who were on patrol. 6 of them were killed.

title: Boko Haram Ambush, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed some passengers and motorists on a road and killed 15 of them.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko Haram insurgents, 12 soldiers including a Commanding Officer, Colonel Abubakar Chamba, a Divisional Police Officer, 3 policemen and 4 civilians died during an encounter between Boko haram insurgents and soldiers.

title: Ombatse vs Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: An Eggon cultural group, Ombatse attacked a Fulani settlement and killed 4 herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents on motorcycles attacked 2 vehicles-a Volkswagen and a Golf brands- loaded with Ramadan rice and sugar and killed 3 persons. The consignments were meant to be distributed to some indigenes of the area for the Ramadan fasting..

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 2 people, including a Fulani man and one Kolo Ardo, a graduate of Federal Technical Collage, Lassa.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents detonated a bomb concealed in a van that was conveying loads of charcoal and killed over 50 people. Most of the victims were traders and commuters at the market where the bomb exploded. According to Amnesty International, 21 persons including the suicide bomber died in the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (50 ) , Other newpapers 1 (56 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (21 )

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Kaduna
description: An Improvised Explosive Device (IED) exploded and killed many people. The actual number of deaths was not reported. The attack was suspected to have been carried out by Boko haram insurgents. The report did not give the specific number of casualty, however, based on the report, it is assumed that 5 people were killed.
place: Asikolaye/Bakin Ruwa Area, Along the Kaduna Western Bypass.

title: Communal Clash, Kogi
description: A clash between Fulani herdsmen and community members resulted in the death of 5 people. It is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported as the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Imo
description: 10 farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen who opened fire on villagers who attempted to stop their cattle from grazing on their farmlands. Also several people were wounded when youths from the community, who came to rescue the farmers, were ambushed by the rampaging herdsmen. The date of the incident was not given but assumed it happened in the middle of the year.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked the family house of the Caretaker Chairman of the Local Government Area, Alhaji Modu Walama, and killed one of his sons.

title: Boko Haram, Borno
description: The father of a Boko Haram abductee died from complications that arose from her daughter's abduction. Though she escaped from the Boko ham camp after 3 weeks, she could not meet her father alive. This incident is backdated to 2014. Since no date was reported, it is assumed he died on June 30.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Church, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 5 churches, including Deeper Life Bible Church, and killed 100 people. The churches were attacked during the Sunday service.
place: Kwada, Kautikari, Ngurojina and Karagau Villages.
sources_of_information: Independent (100 ) , Other newpapers 1 (105 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (54 )

title: Bomb Explosion, Bauchi
description: 13 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents in military uniform bombed a brothel. Places with intense social activities have become insurgents' main targets. Amnesty International reported 10 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (13 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Daily Trust (13 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (10 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 9 people including 4 Boko haram insurgents, 3 soldiers and 2 civilians were killed during a shootout between soldiers and some Boko haram insurgents.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 50 Boko haram insurgents were killed by soldiers during a raid on the insurgents' camp. 2 soldiers also died during the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (52 ) , The Nation (52 ) , Other newpapers 1 (55 )

title: Suspected Boko Haram Killed, FCT (Abuja)
description: A terrorist who was attempting to detonate an Improvised Explosive device (IED) was killed by security forces.

title: Herdsmen Attacks, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities and killed 40 people.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 soldiers and 53 Boko haram insurgents were killed when Soldiers raided their hideout. It is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported since the date of the incident was not reported.

title: Boko Haram Twin Explosion, Lagos
description: 2 explosions rocked a tank farm and killed 5 people. Both blasts occurred outside and inside the farm. Reports have been contradictory whether the blast was a bomb blast or a tanker explosion. However, the State Fire Service stated that it was as a result of a gas explosion. The attack has been claimed by Boko Haram and Shekau in a video released on 13 July 2014. It was also reported in the Punch edition of July 14, 2014. Amnesty International reported 2 deaths.
place: Folawiyo Energy and Gas, Creek Road, Apapa
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, political issue, religious issue, oil distribution
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (2 )

title: Bomb Explosion, FCT (Abuja)
description: A bomb planted by Boko Haram exploded in a shopping mall and killed 21 people including the Managing Editor (North), New Telegraph, Suleiman Bisalla. The bomber was also shot dead by soldiers while trying to detonate a second bomb. This is the 3rd bomb explosion in the FCT since April. Amnesty International reported 22 deaths.
place: EMAB Plaza, adjacent BANEX Plaza, Aminu Kano Crescent, Wuse II
sources_of_information: Vanguard (22 ) , The Nation (24 ) , Independent (25 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (22 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers of the 7 Division of the Nigerian Army in collaboration with some members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) killed 200 Boko Haram insurgents and destroyed several motorcycles used by the insurgents. The date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report, it is assumed that it happened 2 days (2014-06-25) before it was reported on 2014-06-27.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 58, Kaduna
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen simultaneously attacked some villages and killed 58 people. 21 were killed in Kabumu-Fadan Karshi, 17 in Nandu and 20 in Kobin. Karshi and Nandu are mainly inhabited by Christian peasants.
place: Kabumu-Fadan Karshi, Nandu and Kobin villages

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 16 soldiers and dozens of Boko Haram insurgents were killed when insurgents attacked a military post. Based on the report it is assumed that at least 2 dozens (24) insurgents were killed, bringing the total number of deaths to 40.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Over 70 Boko Haram insurgents who had earlier attacked some villages were killed by soldiers in an air raid.
place: Chuha I, Chuha II and Korogilim Villages.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked some villages and killed 40 people including teenagers. The insurgents attacked many shops and carted away foodstuff and livestock.
place: Chuha A, Chuha B and Korongilim Villages.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: A suicide bomber suspected to be a member of the Boko Haram sect hit a military target with his car, killing himself and 3 soldiers. Amnesty International reported 3 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (3 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 3 villages and killed many people. The specific number of deaths was not stated but based on the report, it is assumed that 5 people were killed.

title: Armed Youths, Delta
description: Armed youths broke into the compound of a traditional leader and shot one of his sons identified as Bayowa Nikaghanri dead. The incident was linked to a leadership crisis in the community.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages and killed 40 people. The insurgents who came in vehicles painted in army colour opened fire on the villagers as soon as they arrive.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Borno
description: A clash between Boko Haram insurgents and vigilantes resulted in the death of 6 vigilantes and 28 insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Kill 12, Borno
description: 12 villagers were killed in a border community by Boko Haram group members. Several attacks have been carried out in border communities by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Kills Driver, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked some passengers and killed a commercial driver who worked for the Borno Express Transport Corporation.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers dismantled a road block mounted by Boko Haram members and killed 10 insurgents.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killings: Soldiers detained 12 men from two villages in connection with Boko Haram attacks. Their corpses were found the next day with marks on their bodies suggesting that they were killed.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 2 men. Another online report stated that more than 60 girls were abducted and that over 30 people were killed by the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 15 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents attacked a market. Another source reported 25 victims. The attack might related to another one in Gumsa (Goumsa), Geidam LGA, Yobe State. See event PAR011438
sources_of_information: Vanguard (15 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (15 )

title: Police vs Cattle Rustlers, Niger
description: 2 cattle rustlers were killed by the police during a shootout. There was no specific date of incidence. Since it was reported to have happened in June, it is assumed it happened in mid June.

title: Boko Haram Kill Women, Borno
description: 59 Shuwa women were shot dead by Boko haram insurgents in a mosque. The victims had fled into a mosque were they were shot dead by the insurgents. No day was reported for the incident. The incident is therefore assumed to have happened on June, 15, 2014.

title: Rape, Enugu
description: A Woman was gang raped to death by some Fulani herdsmen. The day of the incident was not given but it is assumed it happened in the middle of the given month (15-06-2014).

title: Boko Haram attack village, Borno
description: The attack is probably related to event IBD003074. The son of the village head is abducted.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kogi
description: Three Fulani hersmen, including Mohammed Baushe, Isah Isiaku and Saleh Isah were accused of killing Abubakar Shuaib and Hari, for stealing 1 of their cows.

title: Community Leader, Plateau
description: Mr. Iliya Vomagai, a community leader, was killed by gunmen. The victim was shot dead by persons suspected to be Fulani herdsmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 7 people lost their lives during an attack by Fulani herdsmen. The attackers took advantage of a communal clash between 2 neighbouring communities to carry out the attack.

title: Boko Haram Raids, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents raided 2 villages, killed 5 people and carted away foodstuffs and livestocks.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents launched reprisal attacks against 2 villages and killed many people. The actual number of deaths was not reported. But based on the report, it is assumed that 5 people were killed.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 7 people were killed in a communal clash between Tiv and Fulani herdsmen.

title: Raped To Death, Edo
description: Cattle rustlers raped a middle-age woman to death. The victim was in the company of her 18-year-old son when she was attacked by the hoodlums.

title: Gunmen Attack Village, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 30 people. The operation was carried out at night, shooting people and burning houses. The date of the event was not reported. However, from the report, it is assumed that it happened 1 day (2014-05-20) before it was reported on 2014-05-21.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village, killed 10 people and carted away food stuffs.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Explosion, Kano
description: A bomb blast killed 10 people including a Boko Haram suicide bomber. The bomber headed towards an unknown location when the blast occurred. Amnesty International reported 4 deaths.
place: Middle Road by Gold Coast, Sabon gari
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (10 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (4 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 29 people were killed during a Boko Haram attack on a village. The insurgents launched a rocket propelled attack on a market. Most of the victims were traders.The village is a gateway to Sambisa forest, Boko Haram's stronghold.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kogi
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a border community and killed 7 persons including Murtala Isah, a couple, their daughter and 2 others. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: 40 In Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 40 persons were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village. Most of the victims were those that could not run for safety.

title: Boko Haram Attack Travelers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed some travellers and killed 9 of them. A lorry loaded with beans was hijacked as well.

title: Vigilante Kills Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: A vigilante group ambushed and killed 70 Boko Haram insurgents. The terrorists were on their way to get food items from the town when they were attacked. Another source reported that 97 people including 90 insurgents and 7 soldiers were killed during the clash. 2 of the soldiers were identified as Captain Akintola and a Commanding Officer (C.O.).
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (70 ) , The Punch (70 ) , Daily Trust (97 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 10 soldiers of the Seventh Infantry Division were ambushed and killed while returning to their base. About 20 others are also reported missing.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a village and killed residents. See also IBD00 1735

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Jigawa
description: Soldiers killed 60 Boko Haram insurgents in a reprisal attack over the death of about 10 soldiers few days back.

title: Gunmen Attack, Bauchi
description: A motorcyclist identified as Bogoro Tafiya Mwari, was stabbed to death by unknown gunmen.

title: Residents vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Residents of a community killed 200 Boko Haram insurgents. The community have witnessed several attacks from the insurgents in the past.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists attacked 3 villages and killed 60 people.

title: 3 Soldiers In Bomb Blast, Jigawa
description: A roadside bomb planted by gunmen killed 3 JTF soldiers combing a forest for the gunmen. The gunmen had earlier launched an attacked on a police station

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: 44-year-old farmer, Matthew Aniugo and Chiagha Chigbo were killed by 3 Fulani herdsmen in their farm.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Communal Clash, Kaduna
description: 4 persons were killed when youths destroyed parts of a prayer ground during a communal crisis. The clash was caused by a dispute arising from allocation of Muslim prayer ground.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community, destroyed a link bridge and killed 1 person. Several houses and a church were destroyed during the attack.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 10 passengers after barricading an express-way. The insurgents opened fire on the victims when the driver of the car to stop.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Anambra
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a farm and killed 2 farmers. The actual date of the incident was not reported. However, it was reported that officials of the state government were immediately dispatched to the affected community on 2014-04-30. It is therefore assumed that it happened the that day.

title: Boko Haram Kills 40, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a village and reportedly killed scores of people. The attack was to avenge the hunting of Boko haram kinsmen by the youth volunteers popularly called "The Civilian JTF". It is assumed that at least 2 scores were killed during this attack.

title: Fulani vs Jukun, Taraba
description: A clash that erupted between Fulani herdsmen and Jukuns led to the death of over 50 people including a soldier. The crisis started last week and escalated when the Jukuns saw the corpses of their men being conveyed to a hospital.

title: Communal Clash, Rivers
description: 3 people died when 2 groups clashed over the chieftancy title of their community. The crisis was hijacked by 2 cult groups, the Islanders and the Icelanders.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Jukun, Taraba
description: Clashes between Fulani herdsmen and some Jukuns claimed 8 lives. The victims were killed by the herdsmen during a reprisal attack.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: 27 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a clash with community youths. many communities in the state have come under attacks by Fulani herdsmen. This incident occurred on April, 2014. It is hereby assumed that it occurred at the middle of the month.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 6 persons who went to dig some sand by a river were killed by armed Fulani herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram vs School, Borno
description: 16 people including a police officer and a soldier were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an attack on Government Girls Secondary School (GGSS). About 136 school girls were abducted during the raid.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (16 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Herdsmen, Enugu
description: Theophilus Eleje was ambushed and killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Ward Congress, Edo
description: Mathew Adams was shot dead by a policeman during a Ward Congress election. The victim tried to instigate a crisis and resisted arrest before he was shot by one of the officers. The date of the incidence was not stated. It is assumed the incident happened on the 12th of April, being the day most Wards conducted their primaries.

title: Boko Haram Kill 30, Borno
description: 30 people were reportedly killed after Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village in a border area. Several people have been killed in such border communities lately.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A village head, Bulama Kaigamari and 6 others were killed by Boko haram insurgents during an attack on a village.

title: Boko Haram vs Community, Borno
