description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community and killed 60 persons. The insurgents attacked the community with Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), AK-47 riffles and petrol bombs, and went on a shooting spree. The incident took place during the weekend.

title: Boko Haram vs Students, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed many students who were travelling to write the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME). The insurgents also attacked 4 other communities where they killed several people.
place: Teachers College, Dikwa, Kala Balge, Gambulga and Gwoza.

title: Gunmen, Benue
description: 5 people lost their lives when some Fulani militias numbering about 300 attacked 3 communities.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (7 )

title: Army Kills Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers attacked Boko Haram camps and killed 100 insurgents.

title: Army VS Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Nigerian Army special forces killed 7 Boko Haram insurgents during a shoot-out in some communities around Nigeria border with Cameroon.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Yobe
description: The army ambushed Boko Haram insurgents on their way to attack a community and killed 8 members of the sect.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 3 persons were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen in a farm.

title: Boko Haram Kill 2, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 2 people. Churches and residential houses were set ablaze.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 35 persons were killed in different villages during a clash between Tivs and Fulanis. Fulani herdsmen, numbering about 70, invaded the communities and killed several people.
place: Ikyo, Catholic Church Agwaza, Kokonbo, Azer, Lijam, Akesa, Tyow Doshima, Tse Saka and Kwaghlando

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 12 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the Army. The insurgents were killed during a gun battle with the Army.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Giwa barracks, Borno
description: Hundreds of people including Boko Haram insurgents, security operatives and civilians were killed during a gun duel between the Army and Boko Haram gunmen, who attacked Giwa military barracks in an attempt to set free their detained colleagues. According to Amnesty International, at least 650 of those that escaped were rounded up and killed by the military on the same day.
place: Giwa Military Barracks, Polo and Sulimanti.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (100 ) , This Day (350 ) , Vanguard (207 ) , Daily Trust (500 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (650 )

title: Massacra, Kaduna
description: Over 100 people were reportedly killed when some gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen, numbering over 40, razed houses and gunned down residents in 3 communities.
place: Ugwar Sankwai, Ungwar Gata and Chenshyi.

title: Hoodlums vs Villages, Zamfara
description: A middle-aged man was killed by a gang of bandits wielding AK-47 rifles when they invaded some villages. The victim was killed when he tried to escape. Since no date was reported for the incident, this event was backdated by 2days.
place: Yar Katsina, Keku, Ruwan Kaiwa, Musema and Kuya

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killings: 640 men and boys who were released during a Boko Haram attack on Giwa barracks. They were re-arrested and executed by soldiers from 81 Battalion.
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (640 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (0 )

title: Herdsmen vs Community, Delta
description: 1 person was killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and their host community. The victim, identified as Mr. Agbontan, was attacked by the herdsmen with bows and arrows.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 5 persons were killed by the Fulani herdsmen.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Anambra
description: Some cattle rustlers killed one Usman and carted stealing 32 of his cows.The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Herdsmen 25, Benue
description: Some Fulani herdsmen attacked some villages and killed 25 people. Meanwhile, the state Governor, Gabriel Suswan narrowly escaped death when his convoy was ambushed by the same Fulani herdsmen, who engaged his security aides in exchange of gunfire.
place: Daudu, Gbajimba, Uikpam-Mbabai, and Umenger Villages.

title: Gunmen vs Community, Katsina
description: Gunmen suspected to be cattle rustlers attacked some villages and killed many people. In one of the villages, the gunmen killed 7 people including a Ward Head. The victims included men, women and children.
place: Maigora Town, Maiunguwa Ward in Koran Mota Village, Mararaba Gora, Sabo Layin Galadima, Unguwan Doka and Unguwar Rimi Village.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (12 ) , Vanguard (69 ) , The Nation (100 ) , Daily Trust (96 ) , Nigerian Tribune (117 ) , The Guardian (126 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: The Care Taker Chairman of a Local Government Council, Dr. Hamma Jumba, narrowly escaped being killed by Boko Haram insurgents who ambushed his convoy. However, 3 police escorts and 2 civilians were killed by the attack.

title: Boko Haram, 7, Adamawa
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 7 policemen and 1 civilian. The incidence occurred after a military campaign that was intensified to curtail the activities of the sect. There have been renewed assaults by the sect against the local people in recent times.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 20 Tiv farmers were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The herdsmen have become notorious for killing innocent people in their attempt to graze their cattle.

title: Fulani Versus Tiv, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed in a renewed hostility between Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 5 five persons were killed and several houses burnt by gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen.
place: Gishiri Hassan village in Sariki Kudu district.

title: Boko Haram, 1, Adamawa
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked a wedding ceremony in a village and killed 1 person.

title: Fulani Attack, Benue
description: 7 people were reported to have been killed by some Fulani Herdsmen during an attack on a village.

title: Army Kills 210 Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Army raided Boko Haram's hideouts and killed 210 insurgents. The insurgents were killed during a gun battle with the security operatives. The date of the incident was not reported. Based on the report, it is assumed that it happened between 2014-03-07 and 2014-03-08 before it was reported on 2014-03-09.

title: Boko Haram, 17, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 17 people. During the attack, many houses were burnt.

title: Army Kills 20 Boko Haram, Borno
description: The army foiled an attempt by Boko Haram insurgents to attack a community and killed 20 members of the sect in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram, Traders, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked traders in a village and killed 7 of them.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked four villages and killed 13 people. This incident is one of the many attacks that have occurred in the state recently.

title: Fulani Invasion, Benue
description: 18 people were killed when some Fulani herdsmen attacked 3 communities. Another source subsequently reported more casualties.

title: Gunmen Kill 16, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded 4 communities and killed 16 people. Most of the victims were women and children. The gunmen appeared in army uniforms, killing their victims and burning down over 100 houses.
place: Torok, Gwon,Gwawereng and Gwarim communities in Rim District.

title: Gunmen Kill 4, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen carried out an attack on a community and killed 4 people.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram attacked a village and killed 48 people including 2 policemen. This attack is one of the many attacks that were carried out in the state by the sect within a space of one week.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Many Boko Haram insurgents when the Army raided the terrorist's bases during air and land operations. Some soldiers were also reported to have lost their lives during the operations. 2 policemen were also killed.

title: Boko Haram Twin Attacks, Borno
description: 70 people were killed when twin bombs planted by Boko Haram insurgents exploded in a football viewing center. Fans were watching football when the explosions occurred.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (70 ) , Independent (35 ) , The Punch (35 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (52 )

title: Boko Haram Ambush, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents were suspected to have laid ambush and killed 20 people. According to the report, it was unclear if the the victims were killed by the terrorists or by a Air-force fighter jet, which was spotted around the scene of attack.

title: Boko Haram Kills 39, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village with Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and killed 39 people. Among the slain villagers were 21 women and children who were burnt to death in their huts.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: The Nigerian Army claimed that it killed 6 Boko Haram members after the carried out deadly attacks on some communities. Another source reported that a soldier and 3 civilians also died in the encounter.

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Adamawa 2
description: Some Islamic terrorists suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked 3 communities, killing 4 people.

title: Herdsmen vs Community, Delta
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked their host community and killed 2 persons. The incident happened 2 weeks (2014-02-27) before it was reported on 2014-03-13.

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Adamawa 1
description: Boko Haram insurgents attack some communities in the evening, targeting banks, shops and residents. This event happen 1 day after a similar incidence occurred in Borno where more than 40 secondary school students were slaughtered by the insurgents. The clinic and the pharmacy of the Catholic St Joseph's Minor Seminary Shuwa are also vandalized and 2 security men are killed according to Obasogie, Rev. Fr. Giedon [2014], A Documentary on the Series of Attacks by Boko Haram on Churches in Maiduguri from 2009-2014, Maiduguri, Catholic Social Communications, Directorate, o.15.

title: Fulani Gunmen, Nasarawa
description: Fulani marauders killed 54 people in some communities. The killings which took place within a period of one week as a result of a fierce communal violence.
place: Aloshi, Kadarko, Gidan Sule, and Hir Nyam Villages.

title: Herdsmen, Delta
description: Some Fulani herdsmen were reported to have killed 2 farmers- Akpojotor Ogor and Andrew Edeki-in their farm. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Students, Yobe
description: 43 students of the Federal Government College, Buni Yadi, were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. Some of the victims were burnt alive inside their hostels. The victims include Sale Mamiski, Musa Mohammad, Sani Audu, Usman Faltu, Garba Jibo, Hussani Mari, Bukar Mallam Ali, Inusa Ali, Goni Ali Babamai, Ali Ayuba, Peter John, Abba Muhammed, Aliyu Yala, Abba Adam, Hamidu Bala, Sulaiman Lawan Guji, Abbas Ibrahim, Rukaya Gaji, Auwal Adam, Usman Saleh Idriss, Usman Abba Kaku, Musa Yalti Buba, Sadisu Dauda, Aisha Audu Goni.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (43 ) , Other newpapers 1 (43 ) , Daily Trust (59 ) , Other newspaper 2 (59 ) , The Nation (60 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 3, Borno
description: 4 residents were killed when gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram invaded a community. Another source reported 3 casualties.

title: Fulani/Tiv Clash, Benue
description: 2 persons were killed in a renewed violence between Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers. One of the victims was identified as anthony Chukwu.

title: Communal Clash, Plateau
description: 29 people were killed in two villages. Their attackers barricaded the highway and attacked vehicles and travelers. The killings were believed to be reprisal attacks between locals and Fulani herdsmen. The incident was reported to have happened in Barkin Ladi and Bokkos LGA.

title: SSS vs Boko Haram, Kaduna
description: A Boko Haram member, Kabiru, was killed while attempting to snatch a weapon from a security operative in the course of his arrest. Kabiru was one of the killers of the Islamic cleric, Sheikh Muhammad Auwal Adam Albani and members of his family (see IBD001842). It was reported that the cleric was killed because some of his students murdered a local barber, who was an Al-ZakZaky student.

title: 13 in an attack, Plateau
description: About 13 people were confirmed killed in another attack carried out by unknown gunmen.

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: 30 people including a 70-year-old woman were killed in a renewed crisis involving Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers. There have been series of clashes between the conflicting parties in recent times.

title: Boko Haram Kills 132, Borno
description: At least 47 people were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram. Other sources gave 132 and 157 death figures. The incidence was believed to have also spilled over Biu LGA. Amnesty International reported that the insurgents killed 89 persons in the attack.
sources_of_information: The Punch (47 ) , Vanguard (132 ) , The Guardian (157 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (89 )

title: Fulanis Sack Villages, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded and sacked 2 Tiv villages and killed 8 people.

title: Boko Haram Kills 11, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgence killed 11 people in a 2-hour deadly operation.

title: Gunmen Kill 5, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen invaded a village and killed 5 people. The gunmen who were suspected to be Fulani herdsmen, attacked the villagers with sophisticated weapons and burnt many houses, leaving behind trails of anguish and pains.
place: Gudan Sule Village in Kadarko Town.

title: Boko Haram suspects 2014, Borno
description: According to Amnesty International, 150 Boko Haram suspects die because of ill-treatment in military custody in Damaturu and Maiduguri between January and March 2014. No precision of date. This figure is divided by 2 between Damaturu and Maiduguri: see event 11440.

title: Boko Haram suspects 2014, Damaturu, Yobe
description: According to Amnesty International, 150 Boko Haram suspects die because of ill-treatment in military custody in Damaturu and Maiduguri between January and March 2014. No precision of date. This figure is divided by 2 between Damaturu and Maiduguri: see event 11441.

title: Boko Haram Kills 106, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 106 people. During the attack the insurgents shot fleeing people and slaughtered several others. Izghe Nguru Village had reportedly a Christian majority.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (106 ) , The Punch (106 ) , Vanguard (100 ) , Other newpapers 1 (121 ) , Other newspaper 2 (146 )

title: 10 Soldiers, Adamawa
description: No fewer than 10 soldiers were reported to have been killed in an ambush by heavily armed Boko Haram insurgents against a military convoy.

title: Herdsmen vs 3 Farmers, Benue
description: Some Fulani herdsmen killed 3 Tiv farmers. The farmers were on their way from a fishing expedition in a popular fish pond in the community when they were ambushed and killed by their assailants.

title: Vigilante vs Thieves, Plateau
description: 2 suspected cattle thieves were killed by a vigilante group. The vigilante group killed the 2 cattle rustlers and dumped their corpse at a police station.

title: Boko Haram Kills 53, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a town and killed 53 persons. During the attack, many houses were burnt down.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (50 ) , The Punch (57 ) , This Day (51 ) , The Guardian (62 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 7, Borno
description: Boko haram gunmen attacked a village and killed 7 persons.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2 Farmers, Benue
description: 2 farmers were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen in military uniform. The attackers further killed a man, Tarsha Namakaa, and one other youth.

title: Gunmen Kill 6, Adamawa
description: Unknown gunmen attacked a village and killed 6 people. It was suspected that the attackers were mercenaries hired by some Fulani herdsmen.

title: Herdsmen, Plateau
description: No fewer than 22 persons was killed when unknown gunmen, suspected to be Fulani herdsmen, attacked some communities.

title: Boko Haram vs Residents, Borno
description: 4 people were killed in a Boko Haram attack on a village.

title: Fulani Gunmen, Plateau
description: 33 people including 3 members of a Special Task Force were killed in 2 villages by Fulani gunmen. 19 people were killed in Rakat and 11 killed in Atakar. However, different papers reported different number of victims.

title: Show-Biz Promoter, Imo
description: Mr Emmanuel Noel Tochuckwu Unegbu, a US-based show biz promoter was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Policeman and Son, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen attacked a Police Station and killed a policeman and his son. The gunmen injured a corporal and set free 4 suspects from detention.

title: Editor, Lagos
description: The Deputy Editor of Daily Newswatch newspaper, Mr. Toyin Obadina, was shot by unknown gunmen. He later died at the Lagos State University Teaching Hospital.
place: Ijebu-Ode road by Hypo/Lucky Fibre junction.

title: Boko Haram Kills 7, Borno
description: A roadside bomb suspected to have been planted by Boko Haram insurgents exploded and killed 7 commuters. The bus carrying the passengers ran over the IED when the incidence happened.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Church, Adamawa
description: A pastor and 10 other worshippers, who were participating in a vigil in Ekklisiya Yan'uwa a Nigeria (EYN) Church were killed when Boko Haram insurgents carried out an attack on them.
place: Ekklisiya Yan’uwa a Nigeria (EYN) Church in the village, Sabon Garin Yamdula

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen stormed a town around midnight and killed 7 members of a family.
sources_of_information: The Punch (7 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , Vanguard (8 ) , Independent (9 )

title: Policeman, Kwara
description: A policeman, Corporal Agboola Joachim was killed, with no fewer than 50 motorcycles (okadas) destroyed in a crisis between 2 communities.

title: Suspected Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: A mob killed 3 suspected cattle rustlers who were believed to be cattle thieves after spotted with ammunition. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that the event happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Kill 22, Adamawa
description: People at a church service on Sunday were killed by Boko Haram. The gunmen stormed the St Denis Catholic Church with guns and explosives. Vanguard subsequently reported 47 people dead, including 2 policemen. 41 fatalities were reported by Obasogie, Rev. Fr. Giedon [2014], A Documentary on the Series of Attacks by Boko Haram on Churches in Maiduguri from 2009-2014, Maiduguri, Catholic Social Communications, Directorate, p.12.
sources_of_information: The Punch (22 ) , The Nation (22 ) , Vanguard (47 ) , Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (41 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 63, Borno
description: 63 people including a soldier were killed when some members of the dreaded Boko Haram invaded a village market. Vanguard later subsequently reported 85 deaths.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (63 ) , The Nation (51 ) , Independent (52 ) , Vanguard (85 )

title: Vigilante Vs Fulani Youths, Zamfara
description: Some members of a vigilante group killed 3 Fulani youths, who were suspected to be armed bandits.

title: Gunmen Kill Chinese, Kaduna
description: A Chinese worker who was involved in the rehabilitation of the Jos-Kafanchan Rail line was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The bandits who killed the Chinese also killed a villager, Musa Adamu. 2 of the suspected bandits later engaged the police in a gunfire which resulted in the death of one of them.

title: Herdsmen Kill 1, Benue
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen invaded a community with their cattle, set many houses ablaze and killed a young man.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill, Benue
description: 4 persons were killed in a fresh attack that was carried out by some Fulani herdsmen. 2 of the victims were killed and dumped in a well on Tuesday while the other 2 were killed on Wednesday morning. There have been incessant attacks of Fulani herdsmen in certain locations in the state.

title: Boko Haram Kill 18, Borno
description: 18 people were reportedly killed in 2 separate attacks by Boko Haram insurgents during a raid on 2 villages.

title: Boko Haram Kills 1, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a government secondary school and killed a 45-year-old teacher, Mallam Lawan Manga.

title: Fulani Gunmen Kill 5, Benue
description: 5 people were killed in a clash between some Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers. Several locations in the state have been subject of attacks in recent times.

title: Fulani Gunmen Kill 6, Benue
description: 6 people were killed when Fulani mercenaries attacked their community. This event is connected to IBD001729 which reported 5 victims in Makurdi. The remaining 6 people were assumed to have been killed in Gwer.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 12, Benue
description: 12 people including 5 soldiers attached to the 72 Army Battalion in Makurdi were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen. The state has become a hot spot for cattle gracing related crises lately. Other sources reported that soldiers killed 30 herdsmen, whiled 7 soldiers were killed during the confrontation.

title: Boko Haram Kills 18, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 18 persons. The insurgents attacked the village using explosives and local petrol bombs to set houses on fire. See also event IBD002799

title: Boko Haram Kills 8, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 8 Christians, including 3 grandchildren. The victims were identified as Haruna Hurgwa, Ali Nigha Mbiya, Zakariya Ghirita, Tanko Zuwara, Yohanna Bulus and 3 grandchildren of Mr. Andrew Felaku. The date of the incident was not reported. Based on the report, we assumed it happened 2 days (2014-01-17) before it was reported on 2014-01-19.

title: Cattle Thieves Kill, Plateau
description: Suspected cattle rustlers killed 3 people Kahfa Timbong, Tanden Nandang and Yakubu Changtim, who along with others pursued the rustlers to recover the cows they had stolen. The killing happened at 2 different locations.

title: Boko Haram Kills 15, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents fighting against Civilian JTF attack a border fishing community, burn 60 shops and kill 15 residents, including 2 Nigeriens. As a result, many villagers run away. Authorities in Niger had warned the Nigerian Army of an imminent attack, but to no avail: soldiers left the place just before the attack. 8 residents are killed according to Nigerien authorities in Diffa (Source: fieldwork). Out of 25 insurgents, 4 were women, all between 16 and 25 years old.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (15 ) , The Punch (7 ) , This Day (15 )

title: Boko Haram Kills Many, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a border community and killed scores of people, including a police officer, after sacking the only police station in the community. It was reported that scores (at least 20) people were killed, but the actual number of casualty was not reported. Based on the report, we assumed 20 ( a score) people were killed.

title: Suicide Bomber Kills 30, Borno
description: A suicide bomber believed to be a member of the Boko Haram sect, carried out an attack that left more than 30 people dead and many injured. The suicide bomber detonated the bomb in a car. According to Amnesty International, 20 persons lost their lives.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (51 ) , Daily Trust (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Vanguard (43 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (20 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 10 persons were killed in a brutal attack by Fulani herdsmen. This incident happened when the herdsmen clashed with the residents of the area over lands for the grazing.

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 members of a vigilante group and 1 civilian were killed by Boko Haram while relaxing under a tree.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kills, Delta
description: Stephen Dieserue, was killed in an encounter with some Fulani herdsmen while Ichivwoghene Aduwa, was left with serious wounds.

title: Boko Haram Kills 5, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village on a market day and killed 5 persons. The insurgents numbering about 30 stormed the market and shot sporadically.

title: Car Dealer Dies, Ondo
description: A 47-year-old car dealer, Yusuf Wole Brown, was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The victim was found dead inside a pick-up car.

title: Herdsmen Kill Prince, Kogi
description: A 29-year-old prince, Chief Haruna Onuche was killed by Fulani herdsmen when he had gone into the bush with his cattle.

title: Army Kills 38 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Some soldiers were reported to have killed 38 Boko Haram insurgents. During the gun battle between the insurgents and soldiers, 1 soldier was killed, bringing the total number of casualties to 39.

title: Boko Haram Kill 9, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 9 people during an early morning raid.

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 3 Policemen, Zamfara
description: Cattle rustlers killed 3 Mobile Policemen (MOPOL). The victims involved an Assistant Superintendent of police, Abdul Mohammed and the other policemen, who were shot dead by the rustlers upon their arrival at a farm to ascertain the quantity of products destroyed by the rustlers following initial complaints lodged by farmers.

title: Gunmen Kill Policemen, Kaduna
description: 4 police officers were feared killed as they were attacked by unknown gunmen.

title: Fulani Gunmen Kill 30, Plateau
description: Gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen raided a community and killed 30 people, who were mostly children, women and aged people. Another newspaper reported 6 deaths in the malady.
sources_of_information: The Punch (30 ) , Nigerian Tribune (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (33 ) , The Guardian (34 )

title: Clash Claims 3, Adamawa
description: A farmer and 2 herdsmen were killed during a free for all fight that involved farmers and Fulani herdsmen. However, no date was reported for this incident. The event was therefore backdated by 2 days.

title: Gunmen Kill Businessman, Jigawa
description: A businessman, Alhaji Sa'idu Danladi, was shot dead by unknown gunmen at his residence.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extrajudicial Execution: 218 Boko Haram suspects died in detention between 2 January and 30 December 2014. About 118 documents from 23 Armoured Brigade were recovered by Amnesty International confirming the death of the Boko Haram suspects daily. This event is situated on July 2 (middle of the year) since the deaths were not disaggregated.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 3, Plateau
description: 2 persons were killed and 16 others seriously injured when some Fulani herdsmen stormed the Church of Christ In Nations (COCIN). Another person was also killed within the same area.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 )

title: Islamic Leader shot dead, Kaduna
description: A prominent Islamic scholar and leader of the Salafis movement in Nigeria, Sheikh Muhammad Auwal Adam Albani, his wife and one of his children, Abdullahi were shot dead by gunmen while returning to his house from a preaching session. The killing is claimed by Boko Haram leader Shekau in a video released on 19 Feb. 2014.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill , Plateau
description: 1 person was killed by Fulani herdsmen.This event is linked to IBD001550.

title: Police Kills 3 Bandits, Zamfara
description: A team of policemen smashed a gang of criminals and killed 3 of them. The actual date of the incident was not given. Based on the report, we assumed the incident happened 2 days (2013-12-31) before it was reported on 2014-01-02.

title: Armed Gang Kills 2, Gombe
description: A Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) youth leader, Alhaji Adamu Yusuf (aka Cooler) was killed by gunmen at his residence. A neighbour who came out to rescue the youth leader was also killed by the unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Kills 4 Villagers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 4 residents.

title: Fulani herdsmen vs Farmers, FCT (Abuja)
description: 2 persons died while many pople were injured during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and Gwari people, who are predominantly farmers. The clash which was caused by grazing problem led to the displacement of about 1500 persons.

title: Boko Haram Kills 12, Wedding, Borno
description: 12 persons were shot dead by suspected Boko Haram insurgents during a bachelor eve's party. The insurgents stormed the venue of the party and shot sporadically, killing 12 persons on the spot.

title: Army Kills 63 Boko Haram, Borno
description: About 63 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by the army in a gun battle during 2 separate military raids on the terrorists' camps. In one of the military raids, 56 insurgents were killed by the 7 Division Nigerian Army, while the Multinational Joint Task Force (MJTF) killed 7 insurgents in another military raid. Other reports gave different death figures.
place: Alfa General Area and Lake Chad Islands.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (63 ) , This Day (56 ) , Other newpapers 1 (70 )

title: Violent Christmas, Enugu
description: Johnson Uche Abonyi was butchered to death by suspected military personnel including Christopher Agada, Francis Agada and Joseph Okoro. The incidence later led to a serious crisis in the community.

title: Advertising Guru Murdered, Lagos
description: The Chief Executive Officer and Managing Director of Eminent Communications Limited, Mr. Sesan Ogunro, was shot dead by unknown gunmen.

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill Herdsman, Bauchi
description: A herdsman, Malam Abdu Abdullahi, was shot dead with an arrow by cattle rustlers.

title: Herdsmen and Youths, Benue
description: A fracas that ensued between goat sellers and Fulani herdsmen over the sales of goats at the main mosque led to the death of 1 person. The incident, which broke out during the weekend precipitated reprisal attacks the following Monday, leading to the death of over 15 people. We assumed that the event started on Saturday.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Barracks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked army barracks and killed many people. During the attack, 13 soldiers, 18 civilians including women and children, and 100 Boko Haram insurgents were killed.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 4, Ogun
description: About 4 persons were reportedly killed by Fuy Fulani herdsmen. A 5-year-old Ajimoh Adisa was said to have been shot a month before Alade Eyo and Bondu Oladejo were also cruelly murdered by the herdsmen.It is assumed that Mr. Yomi Akinola the Geography teacher was among the people killed.

title: Bureau De Change, 22, Adamawa
description: Gunmen attacked a bureaux de change and killed many people. Meanwhile, soldiers killed 12 of the escaping gunmen in a shoot-out. Among those killed were 2 Boko Haram commanders, Abdul Baki and Abdulrazaq Mubi, who have been on the 'wanted list' of the army since 2011.
place: Digil Village and Border Town of Mubi

title: Herdsmen Kill Man, Bayelsa
description: A middle-aged man and a cement dealer, Mr. Ebamugha Akeni, was killed by a group of Fulani herdsmen following an argument over the blocking of the road with cattle.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill, Akwa Ibom
description: Some Fulani herdsmen were reported to have shot a man, Ofonime Micheal Asuquo dead, when youths of the area asked them to take their cattle away from their farmlands.

title: Boko Haram Kills 4, Borno
description: 4 people were killed and over 100 houses burnt down when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village inhabited by a Christian minority.

title: Army Kills 8 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers were reported to have killed 8 Boko Haram insurgents during a gun battle. During the encounter, 3 vehicles, 3 AK 47 riffles were burnt, while many people sustained various degrees of injury.

title: Army Kills Many Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers discovered some Boko Haram insurgents where they were burying their dead colleagues in a village and killed many of them. The incident happened in Konduga LGA, but some paper reported Kaga and Kodunga LGA. Also, the actual number of insurgents killed was not given, but the report stated that scores of the insurgents were killed in the air raid. We assumed that 40 (2 scores) of insurgents were killed.
place: Mainok and Mada Areas, Around Mudube Village.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (40 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 )

title: Army Kills 25 Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Nigerian Army killed 25 Boko haram insurgents following a tip-off that they were going to attack a village.

title: 4 killed, Plateau
description: At least four people were feared killed, during an attack carried out on a Village by suspected members of Boko Haram.
place: Tixkan Village in Kurra Falls Gashish District.

title: Boko Haram Kills 9 Commuters, Borno
description: Boko Haram members attacked and killed 9 commuters. The insurgents ambushed the passenger bus and killed its 9 occupants.

title: Youth Leader Dies, Bayelsa
description: Godsgift Atama, a youth leader was shot dead during a communal crisis between Akumoni and Ayamabele.

title: Boko Haram Kills 5, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked motorists and killed 5 travellers.

title: Vigilante Leader Dies, Sokoto
description: A vigilante leader, Isa Gebe, was killed by cattle rustlers during a night attack on the village.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Military Bases, Borno
description: Scores of people were feared dead when Boko Haram members attacked an Air Force Base and some Army facilities in the state. During the attack, 24 insurgents, 20 military men and 6 civilians were reportedly killed, bringing the total number of death to 50. Subsequently, another source reported that the insurgents killed 80 persons while scores of the attackers (assuming at least 2 scores) also died.
place: Pompomari Military Outpost, NAF Base Headquarters Gate, Staff Quarters Outpost, 333 Artillery Regiment, 707/Airport, Kofa Outskirts, and Michika.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 13 cattle rustlers, 1 policeman and 1 vigilante member were killed during a shootout between the security operatives and some Fulani herdsmen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (15 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Web Newspaper (15 )

title: Gunmen Kills, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked a fishing community, killed 7 fishermen and injured 15 others.

title: 16 Die, Zamfara
description: 18 people including 15 cattle rustlers, 2 policemen and 1 bandit were killed in two separate events. This incidence was backdated by 2 weeks from the date of the newspaper report since the report stated that the events happened within the past 2 weeks.

title: Boko Haram Kills, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect members attacked a village and killed 17 residents.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: No fewer than 40 people were killed when gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen invaded 4 communities.It was a reprisal attack linked to event IBD001242.
sources_of_information: The Punch (32 ) , Other newspaper 2 (37 ) , Nigerian Tribune (40 ) , The Nation (45 ) , Independent (62 )

title: Farmers vs. Herdsmen, Sokoto
description: 1 person was killed when some farmers and Fulani herdsmen in the same neighbouring communities clashed. Since no date was reported for the incident, this event was backdated by 2 days of its report.

title: Army Kills 40 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Over 40 Boko Haram members were killed in an offensive by the military. The sect members were killed during offensive air and land raids of their hideouts.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (40 ) , This Day (40 ) , Daily Trust (51 ) , Other newpapers 1 (51 )

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Delta
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 2 young men. The victims, Champion Ofuyah and Ufuoma Titi, were murdered while they were in the company of the herdsmen on their way to the community town hall. The date of the incident was not given, but from the report it appears it is a very recent incident. We assumed it happened 2 days before it was reported on 2013-11-24.

title: Gunmen Kill 6, Yobe
description: 6 people were reportedly killed by unknown gunmen during a robbery incident.

title: Gunmen Kill 3 Civilian JTF, Adamawa
description: 3 members of a vigilante group popularly known as the 'Civilian JTF' were killed by unknown gunmen. Since no date of incident was reported, this event was backdated by 2 days of its report.
sources_of_information: This Day (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , The Guardian (6 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 12, Borno
description: Boko Haram members attacked a village and killed 12 persons. The attackers ambushed the villagers and set many houses on fire.

title: Police Kills 4 Boko Haram, Gombe
description: 4 members of the Boko Haram sect were killed in a gun battle with the police. A policeman was also killed during the incidence. The gun battle occurred when the insurgents attacked the police station with heavy arms.
place: A Police Station in Bojude Town.

title: Cattle Rustlers and Herdsmen, Plateau
description: An attack by some cattle rustlers led to the death of 2 herdsmen.

title: JTF Kills 2 Boko Haram, Kano
description: 2 members of the Boko Haram sect were killed by operatives of the Joint Task Forces (JTF) in a gun duel. The insurgents were killed during a cordon and search operations by the JTF.
place: Gayawa General Area of Ungongo, Along Kankara-Sheme Road.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: Army Kills 20 Boko Haram, Borno
description: 20 suspected Boko haram members were killed when Soldiers of the Special Forces have raided their hideout.

title: Army Kills 20 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 20 Boko Haram insurgents during a gun battle. During the clash between the Army and the insurgents, 1 soldier was killed.

title: Soldiers Kill 9 Boko Haram, Borno
description: 9 Boko Haram insurgents were killed in a shootout with soldiers of the 7 Division of the Nigerian Army.

title: Boko Haram Kills 9, Borno
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect attacked and killed 9 farmers. After killing the farmers the insurgents set their farms ablaze. The attacks were carried out within 7 days. The actual date of the attacks was not given, but from the report the event took place between 13 and 20 of November 2013.

title: Boko Haram Kills 26, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents stormed some villages and killed 26 people. Only one out of the 3 Local Government Areas attacked was selected for accuracy in results.

title: Herdsmen vs. Vigilante, Kwara
description: 4 people including a Yoruba man and 3 Fulani were killed in a communal clash between a local vigilante group and the Bororo Fulani herdsmen.

title: Fulani Invasion, Benue
description: 35 people were killed when heavily armed Fulani herdsmen invaded 7 communities. However, there are various reports on the death toll.
place: Ello, Okpagabi, Ogwule-Ankpa, Ogbangede, Ekwo, Enogaje and Okpanchenyi.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (35 ) , Other newpapers 1 (35 ) , Nigerian Tribune (32 ) , Vanguard (36 )

title: Boko Haram, Soldiers Die, Kano
description: 7 persons were killed when JTF raided a hideout of Boko Haram members. Those that died included 5 Boko Haram members and 2 soldiers.

title: Army Kills 7 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 7 Boko Haram insurgents during a simultaneous military operations against the sect's members in their hideouts.
place: Gamboru Ngala axis and Bama Kelani.

title: Vigilante Kills 8 Herdsmen, Borno
description: 8 Fulani herdsmen were mistakenly killed by a vigilante group that hunts for boko haram members.
place: Tumbun Gini-Fatori Village, Abadam District, border with Niger

title: Fulani Gunmen Kills, Plateau
description: A mother and her 3 children were killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Village, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 20 residents. Also, the villagers mobilised themselves went after the insurgents and killed 7 of them.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (27 ) , Nigerian Tribune (27 ) , Daily Trust (27 )

title: Boko Haram Kills Christians, Borno
description: Christians were killed by Boko haram during an attack on a village.

title: Boko Haram Attacks Wedding Convoy, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents ambushed a wedding convoy and killed 30 persons including the groom, his family members and friends.
place: Bulakuri Village, along Bama-Banki-Firgi High way.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (30 ) , Vanguard (30 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Other newpapers 1 (13 )

title: Gunmen Kill Pastor, Edo
description: Unknown gunmen killed Philip Afemikhe, a pastor of Christ Apostolic Church (CAC). The gunmen stormed the residence of the pastor in hoods, broke into his room through the window and shot him dead.

title: Boko Haram Kills Army Doctor, Yobe
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked the Joint Task Force (JTF) and killed one Lt. Dr. Garba Bukar Bala, an Army Medical Officer in the process.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 1, Katsina
description: A 27-year-old man, Ibrahim Lawal, was shot dead as Fulani herdsmen clashed with villagers.

title: Army Kills Many Boko Haram, Borno
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army in conjunction with the Nigerian Air Force ambushed and killed scores of Boko Haram insurgents. The actual number of deaths was not given. It was however reported that scores were killed in the incident. Since a score is 20, we assumed that at least 2 scores, which is 40 deaths was recorded.

title: Boko Haram Kills 4, Borno
description: 4 people including security personnel were killed in an attack on a military check-point by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Kills 21, Yobe
description: 21 persons including soldiers, police, civilians and insurgents were killed in multiple attacks carried out by Boko Haram sect members. However, another report says the Army killed 21 insurgents. An Army source put the casualty figure on the part of the insurgents at 70.
place: NNPC Mega Station along Damaturu-Maiduguri Road; A Mini army barracks, along Maiduguri road; Police Area Command; Police CID, Mobile Police Base and an office along Guija Road, Damaturu.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (21 ) , The Punch (13 ) , This Day (21 ) , The Guardian (21 ) , Other newpapers 1 (70 ) , Vanguard (128 )

title: Villagers and Herdsmen Clash, Kwara
description: Crisis broke out when a herdsman was alleged to have killed a villager along a farm path while a reprisal attack lead to the killing 3 other herdsmen.

title: Army, Boko Haram Kill 74, Borno
description: The Army launched both air and land attacks against Boko Haram and killed 74 insurgents. The sect members were attacked at one of their most deadly camps. The encounter also led to the death of 9 soldiers.
sources_of_information: This Day (74 ) , The Punch (69 ) , Daily Trust (74 )

title: Boko Haram Kills 18, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 18 persons and injured 12 others. The insurgents stormed the village with Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and petroleum bombs and set some houses and shops on fire. Most of the victims were women and children.

title: Boko Haram Kills 10, Borno
description: 10 people including 3 vigilante youths were killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an attack on 2 villages.

title: Army Kills 37 Boko Haram, Borno
description: The army killed 37 Boko Haram insurgents during a coordinated air assault on the insurgents' camp.

title: Boko Haram Kills 20, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked motorists and passengers and killed many of them. The insurgents were dressed in military uniforms and operated with carrying AK 47 riffles.

title: Army Kills Terrorists, Borno
description: The army intercepted a bomb-laden car during coordinated raids on Boko Haram terrorists' camps. The Army shot at the the bomb-laden car with a rocket propelled grenade (RPG), which caused it to explode killing its occupants. The number of persons inside the car was not given. We assumed there were at least 2 occupants. The raid took place 3 weeks before it was reported on 2013-11-10.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Niger
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen were shot dead by a vigilance group.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill 9, Taraba
description: 9 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during an attack on a community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Kill Village Head, Nasarawa
description: A village head, Saleh Tanko, was killed by suspected Fulani herdsmen.

title: Nollywood Actor Shot Dead, Edo
description: A Nollywood actor, Flavian Okojie, was shot dead by unknown gunmen 3 weeks after his wedding. The incident happened in October 2013. Since the particular date of the incident was not reported, we assumed it happened in the middle of October (2013-10-15).

title: Fulani Gunmen, Kaduna
description: 50 residents of several communities in a local government area were massacred by Fulani gunmen. The attackers overran the communities, killing and maiming several people.
place: Mafan, Telak, Kirim, Danti, Mayit, Zandian, Dajak, Tinga, Mogwai and Dugurang

title: Army Kills 40 Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed 40 Boko Haram insurgents during a pre-emptive attack. The insurgents were planning to carry out coordinated attacks before they were rounded up by the soldiers.

title: Gunmen Kill Man, Akwa Ibom
description: A man called Dafe was allegedly shot dead by unknown gunmen.

title: Fulani Gunmen Kill 30, Benue
description: 30 persons were killed by suspected Fulani gunmen. During the attack about 8 villages were burnt down.

title: Boko Haram Kills 4, Yobe
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents killed 4 residents during an attack on a village.

title: 21 Die in Cattle Rustling, Plateau
description: 21 persons were killed during a cattle rustling attack. The victims included a family of 9. 12 of the rustlers were also killed in a reprisal attack by vigilante members. One Mr. Tsok Gwom and his entire family including his wife were killed.
sources_of_information: This Day (21 ) , The Nation (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (25 )

title: Gunmen Kill Man, Taraba
description: Unknown gunmen killed a man. Mr. Christian Eze was shot dead in front of his shop.

title: Cameroonian Soldiers Kill Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers from Cameroon killed 180 Boko Haram insurgents during a border patrol. The insurgents were killed around the Nigerian border with Cameroon. The attack was launched against the insurgents after they killed 2 Cameroonian soldiers on patrol in the border community.

title: Communal Crisis Kills 2, Imo
description: 2 persons were killed in an intra-communal strive. The crisis resulted to the alleged fictionalization of the natives. The victims included one Mr. Chinedu.

title: Boko Haram Kills Nurse, Guard, Borno
description: Boko Haram members laid siege on a town and killed a nurse and a prison guard. The nurse, Ahmadu Alabeji and the prison guard, Abba Sastaawa, were killed in their residence.
place: Gadamayo Ward, near the General Hospital.

title: Army Kills 30 Boko Haram, Borno
description: The army launched a pre-emptive attack on a Boko haram enclave and killed 30 members, including an Amir (leader) of the sect.

title: Boko Haram Kills 5, Army Kills 15, Borno
description: 5 civilians were killed by Boko Haram insurgents while 15 of the insurgents were killed in a counter attack by the 7th Division of the Nigerian Army. However, the Sun reported 30 insurgents killed.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (20 ) , Daily Trust (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (30 )

title: Vigilante Vs Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: A clash between vigilante and cattle rustlers claimed 9 lives. The violent clash occurred after cattle rustlers attacked the village. Those who died included 5 vigilante members. We assumed the the incident happened 2 days before it was reported since the actual date of the event was not given.

title: Police Kills 2 Robbers, Katsina
description: 2 armed robbers lost their lives as a result of an exchange of fire with police. The armed robbers were among cattle rustlers that earlier attacked the community. Since the date of the incident was not given, we assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported on 2013-10-07.

title: Army Kills 186 Boko Haram Insurgents, Yobe
description: 186 Boko Haram insurgents connected with the bloody massacre of event IBD000805 were killed in recent attacks by men of the 7th Division of the Nigerian Army.
place: Benisheik -Damboa axis in Borno and Goniri

title: Boko Haram Kill Drivers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed and killed 3 truck drivers when they drove to a riverbed to lift sand.

title: Boko Haram Kills Soldier, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members murdered a soldier from Niger Republic. The soldier was part of the West Africa Force based in Nigeria: the Multinational Joint Task Force.

title: Gunmen Attack, Zamfara
description: Unknown gunmen attack a village and killed several people including the district head.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A Lance corporal David Usman, was killed by Boko Haram insurgents during a military operation. This event is related to the event recorded in PAR011378.

title: Police Kill 2 Robbers, Kogi
description: The police shot dead 2 members of a 9-man armed robbery gang that specialised in using Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) to rob banks. During the gun duel with the gang, a police corporal, Samuel Olaiya, who was on guard at the bank was shot dead. The robbers killed were Malik Ejima and Ismaila Suberu.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 5 cattle rustlers and 37 cow owners were killed within the past 73 days (about 2 and half months) of its report in the newspapers. However, the report was not specific on dates and places of the events. Therefore, 2 days that connected September and October (2013-09-30 to 2013-10-01) were adopted as dates of occurrence. Furthermore, since Tsanu village have recorded the highest number of deaths arising from cattle rustling in recent times, we adopted it as the place of occurrence.

title: Boko Haram Kills Travelers, Borno
description: Boko Haram members killed travellers who were returning from the market. The attackers slit the throats of their victims.

title: Boko Haram Kills 7, Borno
description: Boko Haram members killed 7 villagers. Many houses were burnt as the attackers overran the entire village.
place: Gava West, a village behind Mandara Maintains.

title: Boko Haram Kills College Students, Yobe
description: About 50 students of the School of Agriculture, Guijba were killed by Boko Haram members at 12 midnight when most of the students were fast asleep. There are different reports on the number of deaths. Independent reported that 3 policemen were killed alongside the 40 students. The two teachers killed allegedly taught Islamic Studies: Mallam Ali Musa Yin and Mallam Al-Hassan Abubakar
sources_of_information: The Punch (50 ) , The Guardian (44 ) , Independent (43 ) , The Nation (40 ) , Daily Trust (62 ) , Other newpapers 1 (65 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (78 )

title: Herdsmen and Farmers, Benue
description: 33 persons were killed in a violent clash between herdsmen and farmers. Fulani herdsmen invaded some farming communities and killed many people.

title: Gunmen Kill Female Butcher, Edo
description: A butcher, Mrs. Bose Iwinanogie, 44, was killed on her way to work by unknown gunmen.

title: Gunmen Kill Mobile Policeman, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen killed a mobile police sergeant attached to the wife of a member of Delta State House of Assembly, Mr. Dan Mayuku.

title: Boko Haram Kill Pastor, Yobe
description: A pastor, Yohana Agwam (55), his son, Dauda Yohana (35) and Mohammed Shugaba (25) were killed by gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect.

title: Vigilante vs. Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed during a clash between vigilantes and suspected cattle rustlers.

title: Gunmen Kill Lecturer, Kano
description: A lecturer of Department of Chemistry at Federal College of Education, Kano was killed by Unknown gunmen in his uncompleted building.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: Extra-judicial Killing: A 29-year-old man, Umar Abdullahi, was arrested by soldiers or Boko Haram activities during a raid f. He was shot dead before his father. He was shot at the back after a brief interrogation by the soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Victim Dies, Kano
description: Mr. John Nnamdi Ezebuala died in Kano State Teaching Hospital from injuries he sustained in the Kano bomb blast (IBD000324).
place: Ibo Road, New Road and Church Road in Sabongari

title: Boko Haram Kills Policemen, Kano
description: Boko Haram terrorists shot dead 3 policemen on night duty.

title: Soldiers, SSS Raid Building, FTC (Abuja)
description: 8 people were killed when a combined team of soldiers and State Security Service operatives sacked a purported Boko Haram enclave in an uncompleted building. Other newspapers reported different numbers of death. Survivors of the killing and indeed many of the reports have, however, debunked the claim that they were Boko-Haram members.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (8 ) , Independent (9 ) , Nigerian Tribune (7 ) , Other newspaper 2 (12 ) , Vanguard (10 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 22 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents in 2 separate attacks. There were different newspaper reports on the number of casualties.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (22 ) , Vanguard (34 ) , Nigerian Tribune (24 ) , Other newspaper 2 (20 )

title: UNILAG Lecturer, Lagos
description: Mr. Cyril Oseloka Ikemefuna was shot dead by unknown gunmen outside house.

title: JTF vs. Boko Haram, Yobe
description: 9 Boko Haram members and a soldier died during a fierce encounter between troops of 3 Division Special Operations Battalion and Boko Haram terrorists. Equally, the wife of a Divisional Police Officer was burnt to death in her home.

title: Boko Haram Killing in Benishiekh, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect members attacked and killed residents, including security operatives. The attackers burnt houses, shops, vehicles, offices and other valuables. 16 soldiers and Boko Haram commander Abba Goroma are said to have been killed.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (50 ) , The Guardian (150 ) , Vanguard (87 ) , Nigerian Tribune (143 ) , Daily Trust (202 ) , Other newspaper 2 (142 )

title: 4 Boko Haram Insurgents Killed, Adamawa
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents who were arrested by Youth Vigilante died in the custody of the Army. The insurgents died from the injuries inflicted on them by the vigilante youths.

title: Kidnapped Octogenarian, Enugu
description: The decomposed body of an 84 year-old Madam Adiza Ogbo, wife a traditional ruler, who was kidnapped by unknown gunmen was recovered from a shallow grave. There was no report on the date she died. Therefore, it was assumed that she died on the day she was kidnapped.

title: Boko Haram Kill 3 Commuters, Borno
description: Boko Haram members killed 3 passengers and robbed others of cash and food items. The victims were traders and other travellers.

title: Boko Haram Ambushed Army, Borno
description: An army officer and 15 soldiers were killed in an ambushed by Boko Haram sect members. During the encounter, about 150 insurgents were killed by the soldiers.

title: Gunmen Kill 6, Bauchi
description: Cattle rustlers killed 6 persons. During the attack the gunmen also ambushed some members of the Danga Vigilante outfit and killed 1 of them.

title: Army Kill 10 Terrorists, Borno
description: Army troops killed 10 members of the Boko Haram sect during an air strike. The air strike was launched on 2 camps belonging to the sect.

title: Boko Haram-Vigilance Clash, Borno
description: No fewer than 17 persons were killed when Boko Haram and members of the civilian vigilance group clashed. Many civilians were killed in the attack and about 5 members of the Boko Haram sect were also killed by the Army.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (18 ) , Nigerian Tribune (13 ) , The Punch (17 ) , The Nation (14 )

title: Police Kill Cattle Rustlers, Katsina
description: A Joint Special Intervention Force of the Police shot dead 2 cattle rustlers after a tip off.

title: Herdsmen Kill 2, Nasarawa
description: A 9-year-old boy, Obushi Maikasuwa and a woman, Mrs. Bilikisu Abubakar were attacked by some Fulani herdsmen. The woman died while she was being rushed to a hospital.

title: Army Kill 50 Boko Haram Members, Borno
description: 50 members of the Boko Haram sect were killed in a bloody encounter with Military Troops of the 5 Brigade of 7 Division, Nigerian Army. The bloody encounter was a reprisal attack by the Army as in event IBD000612.

title: Boko Haram Strikes, Borno
description: 20 people were feared dead, when suspected Boko Haram terrorists launched separate attacks on 2 communities. Weekly Trust, however, recorded 24 casualties in the same event for which the JTF retaliated by killing 50 insurgents.

title: Gunmen Attack, Plateau
description: Unknown gunmen killed 6 people in 2 compounds.

title: Boko Haram Kills 24 Civilian JTF, Borno
description: Boko Haram members ambushed and killed 24 members of a youth vigilante group who were on a search mission for the sect.

title: Boko Haram Kills 20, Borno
description: 20 people were killed when gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram attacked them in their various houses while asleep.

title: Robbers Kill Night Guard, Lagos
description: A night guard, Ahmed Lawal, was killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram vs Vigilante, Borno
description: 4 members of Boko Haram shot dead 6 members of vigilante youth (Ismail Alhaji Bunu (36), Malam Goni (27), Buzu Mohammed Modu (20), Jibrin (30) and Bukar Bako (20). The victims were shot dead during a mid-night raid by the sect.

title: Boko Haram Kills 14, Borno
description: About 50 armed Boko Haram members attacked Bama and killed 14 pro-government youth vigilantes. The Youth vigilantes were lured away and killed by the sect dressed in military camouflage.

title: Boko Haram Kills 3, Borno
description: 3 people were killed by Boko Haram insurgents with knives and machetes instead of guns, apparently to evade security operatives and youth vigilantes. Saturday was assumed to be the day of incident since it happened during a weekend.

title: Civilian JTF vs. Boko Haram, Borno
description: 2 Boko Haram suspects who disguised as women to escape the wrath of the Vigilante youths (Civilian JTF) were apprehended and killed by JTF.

title: 1 Dies in Communal Clash, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen killed 1 person in a farm. The deceased, an Eggon, was killed by some Fulani herdsmen while he was working on his farm.

title: Insurgents Attack Police station, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked a Divisional Police station with Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) and petro-bombs. During the attack, 2 policemen, 4 residents and 7 insurgents were killed.
place: Divisional Police Station in Gwoza and Gamboru Ngala community.

title: Gunmen Attack, Enugu
description: 8 persons were killed after unknown gunmen opened fire on traders. The hoodlums stormed the market in commando style and shot at traders. Vanguard listed those killed in the attack to include a member of the vigilante group, Sunday Eze, two women and two other men.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (5 ) , Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , Other newspaper 2 (6 ) , police (2 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen Versus Community, Enugu
description: 1 person died following a fatal clash between Fulani herdsmen and their community. The clash was the result of an alleged rape of a woman by a Fulani herdsman.
place: Adarice Farms, Ugbo Okpoja Village, Adani.

title: Library Staff, Edo
description: A staff of Edo State Library Board, Mr. Ebowe Felix was murdered by unknown gunmen
place: 1, Inne lane, off Ehizomwangie Street, Off Eghosa Street, Erhunmwunse Road, Benin City.

title: Gunmen Kill Businessman, Lagos
description: A businessman, Bosun Olukoya, was killed by gunmen while returning from a nightclub. He was trailed to the entrance of his house and shot by unknown gunmen. He was rushed to a nearby hospital before he was flown to South Africa for further treatment 3 days later. The victim unluckily died on arrival in South Africa.

title: JTF Kills 4 Terrorists, Borno
description: Operatives of JTF and members of the Borno Vigilante Youth Group (BVYG) killed 4 suspected Boko Haram members.

title: Bokio Haram Attacki/Rituals, Borno
description: Gunmen numbering up to 50 and suspected to be members of Boko Haram stormed a village and slaughtered 44 people. The assailants were said to have removed the two eyes of some of their victims, and decapitated some others.
place: Dumba Village on the outskirts of Baga

title: 2 Policemen, Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen killed 2 policemen.

title: Boko Haram KIlled, Gombe
description: The Police shot dead 7 suspected members of Boko Haram sect during a clash.

title: 27 prisoners poisoned, Yobe
description: According to a medical source at Sani Abacha Specialist Hospital in Damaturu, 27 bodies were brought to the hospital from the Guantanamo detention centre, and "all had white foam in their mouths which was a clear case of oral poisoning". The prisoners were suspected to support Boko Haram and allegedly poisoned by the security forces. Nor precise date given, only the month of August.
place: "Guantanamo" detention centre, also called Sector Alpha
sources_of_information: hospital (27 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (27 )

title: Bandits Bomb Bank, Delta
description: 1 person was killed when armed bandits attacked a bank.

title: Boko Haram Attack Residents, Borno
description: Members of the Boko Haram, including foreign mercenaries killed 11 people during attacks on Police and civilians. 1 of the insurgents was also killed by members of the Borno Youth Volunteer Vigilante Group (Civilian JTF). However, another source reported 18 deaths.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Enugu
description: 2 Fulani herdsmen struck a commercial motorcyclist conveyed with a machete, abandoned him in a bush path and made away with his motorbike.The day of the incident was not given but assumed it happened in the middle of the month (15-08-2013).
place: Opi Junction along Enugu -Makurdi expressway to their camp at Idodo Agu Ekwegbe.

title: Vigilantes Kill, Delta
description: 3 suspected armed bandits were killed during a gun duel with men of the Red Bar Vigilante Security Organisation.
place: Warri/Sapele road, opposite Total filling Station, Warri.

title: Cattle Rustlers Kill 9, Zamfara
description: Cattle rustlers killed 9 vigilante members. 8 of those who were killed were from Maitsaba village. They had gone to Tsanu to assist its residents to counter cattle rustlers when the incidence happen.

title: Massacred in Mosque, Borno
description: Boko Haram members killed many people during attacks on a mosque and several villages. The sect members who wore army and police uniforms opened fire on the worshippers in a mosque, killing many of them. It was reported that between 31 to 63 persons died in the attacks on the mosque and villages.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (63 ) , Vanguard (44 ) , This Day (60 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , The Punch (56 ) , The Guardian (31 )

title: Communal Clash, Benue
description: A communal clash between the Jukun and the Kubawa led to the death of 2 persons. The crisis was said to have occurred on a market day.

title: Gunmen Kill Captain, Rivers
description: An Army captain, Mr. Joseph was assassinated by unknown gunmen. It was reported that the gunmen trailed the captain from Aba road until they caught up with him at a traffic jam where he was shot dead.

title: Bandits Kill Policemen, Edo
description: 2 Policemen, an Inspector and a Corporal, identified as Kennedy were killed by gunmen suspected to be robbers in an ambush.
place: Ogba Junction, along the Benin-Auchi road

title: Soldiers and Policemen killed, Yobe
description: Suspected members of Boko Haram stormed a roadblock mounted by the Joint Military Task Force and killed 4 soldiers and 2 policemen.

title: 20 Killed in During Attack, Borno
description: 20 persons were reportedly killed in clashes between the JTF and the Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Hunter Kills Colleague, Ekiti
description: A 30-year- old hunter, Mr. Musibau Mustapha, mistakenly short his colleague, Sunday Ijasa. He mistook him for an antelope.

title: JTF vs. Bokon Haram, Borno
description: 37 persons were reportedly killed in coordinated fresh Boko Haram attacks. Some of the victims were killed by the JTF. Other papers reported 36 and 35 deaths. While the Newspapers reported that 2 soldiers were killed, Daily Independent subsequently reported that 35 soldiers were killed in the separate attacks. Army claims to have killed Boko Haram and Shekau's deputy leader, Momodu Bama.

title: Herdsmen kill 2, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded some villages in Agatu and killed 2 persons.

title: Boko Haram Kills 8, Borno
description: 8 persons, including a lecturer at the College of Education, Waka, were slaughtered by Boko Haram members. The sect invaded the town after escaping from their camps in Sambisa and other camps in Borno and Yobe states, during a military raid.
place: Kadafur Cinema area and other wards in Waka.

title: Gunmen Kill 16, Nasarawa (1)
description: 16 people were killed by gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen.

title: Bomb Blast, Kano
description: Several persons were killed and many others injured in 3 coordinated explosions that rocked the city of Kano and targeted churches amongst others. The blasts occurred in 3 different locations predominantly inhabited by non-indigenes. However, there is disagreement between the JTF, residents and hospital management, over the number of deaths. Based on the various sources, the number of deaths ranges from 10 to 45 or even 75 according to traditional Igbo leader Chief Tobias quoted in National Geographic. Official figure is 22. Ansaru jihadists (and not Boko Haram) perpetrated the attack and killed 24 persons according to Francis Collomp, who was hostage of the group in Kano when it happened. Francis Collomb lated managed to escape his kidnappers. See: Collomp, Francis [2015], L’évasion, Paris, XO éditions, 302p.
place: Bus station, Ibo Road, New Road and Church Road in Sabongari.
sources_of_information: The Nation (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (10 ) , Vanguard (45 ) , Other newspaper 2 (50 ) , Other newspaper 3 (75 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (24 )

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killings: 35 men were arrested on suspicion of being Boko Haram members and shot dead few days later. They were murdered in their communities.

title: Fresh Attack on Agatu, Benue
description: 8 persons were killed in a fresh attack on Agatu community by suspected Fulani herdsmen.

title: Boko Haram Kills, Borno
description: Boko Haram members handcuffed and burnt to death 16 Christians in a church.

title: Boko Haram vs JTF, Borno
description: In retaliation to event IBD000313, suspected Boko Haram members shot sporadically at a civilian crowd and killed more than 25 including 5 vigilante youths. However, some news papers reported 20 deaths.
place: Dawashi Village (also spelled Dawashe), near Baga

title: Gunmen Ambush Vigilante, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen ambushed and killed a member of the Borno Vigilante Group. The vigilante group were conveying suspected Boko Haram sect members to JTF camp in Maiduguri when they fell into the ambush.However, another newspaper reported 6 deaths.

title: Gunmen Kill 2 Brothers, Sokoto
description: A filling station manager, Stephen Oloche and his brother, Onyila Oloche were killed by unknown gunmen on their way from work.

title: Boko Haram Hunters, Borno 1
description: Volunteer Vigilante youths Group, otherwise known as Civilian JTF arrested and set ablaze an alleged notorious Boko Haram sect member.

title: Boko Haram Hunters, Borno 2
description: Volunteer Vigilante Youths Group set ablaze a suspected Boko Haram insurgent. The vigilante also known as civilian JTF claimed that the victim confessed to have killed more than 70 people, including their loved ones.

title: One killed, Plateau
description: 1 person was killed by cattle rustlers while STF was holding a meeting with Fulanis and other locals over the increasing violence in the area.

title: Gunshots in Mosque, Borno
description: There were shootings by suspected members of Boko Haram in the premises of a mosque in Maiduguri. A minor was reportedly killed in the fracas.

title: Army General's Cow, Kaduna
description: Nemesis caught up with some unknown gunmen as they were overpowered by hundreds of villagers, who killed some of them, while the rest fled. The gunmen were said to have arrived at Madauchi village at about 1a.m to invade the residence of a prominent villager with the intention of stealing his cows.

title: JTF Raid Boko Haram Hideout, Borno
description: JTF and members of Borno Vigilance Youths Group raided Boko Haram hideout and killed 7 of their members. The raid was carried following an intelligence report from Maiduguri residents.

title: Bandits Kill Policemen, Kaduna
description: Gunmen attacked a Divisional Police Station and killed 2 policemen.

title: JTF Kills 3, Jigawa
description: Operatives of JTF killed 3 suspected Boko Haram members during an early morning raid.

title: Boko Haram suspects, Borno
description: The Joint Task Force killed 30 suspected Boko Haram terrorists during a shoot out also, three suspected Boko Haram terrorists who were on their way to Jigawa state and other parts of the northern states on a suicide mission were captured by vigilante youth group popularly referred to as “Civilian JTF” at Borno Express Motor Park.

title: Bandits kill 5, Katsina
description: 5 people were killed by armed bandits in separate attacks in different locations. The bandits initially killed 4 persons. They later made a come back to slaughter a 17-year-old boy on the same day.

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 11 people died during a clash between peasant farmers and Fulani herdsmen. Many houses were burnt in the clash.
place: Hausawa, Sangaya and Gbagbo under Yelwan Ediya district

title: Boko Haram Commander killed, Sokoto
description: A top commander of the Boko Haram sect popularly called Buwayayye (meaning the untouchable in Hausa language) was killed in a gun duel with a team of security forces comprising soldiers and operatives of the State Security Services (SSS).

title: Herdsmen Kill 3, Nasarawa
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen invaded some Tiv settlements and killed 3 people identified as James Orjime, Mrs Timbee Unzughul and a Personal Assistant to the Commissioner for Community and Rural Development, Mr Godwin Mbatsav. This incident is related to the communal clash that took place the day before, in a Benue/Nasarawa border town. See event IBD000180.

title: Man Kills, Beer Parlour, Benue
description: The victim, Mr Msughaondo Lamana, was reportedly beaten to death by unknown gunmen, who were armed with clubs, knives and guns at Sunny Beer Parlour, Kyado.

title: Fulani herdsmen, kill, Benue
description: Invasion of communities by Fulani herdsmen left scores of people dead. The herdsmen who were reported to have come from neighbouring Nasarawa state were armed with sophisticated weapons, and shot and burnt any structure on sight. This attack came few hours after a similar invasion on Iyordye Akaahena village.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (34 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (40 )

title: Gunmen attack school, Yobe
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect yesterday killed 29 students and an English language teacher during an attack on a boarding school in Mamudo. It was learnt that some students were burnt alive in the attack. The English language teacher, identified as Mohammed Musa, died after he was shot in the chest.

title: Tiv vs Fulani,Benue
description: A renewed clash between Tiv farmers and Fulani herdsmen claimed twenty lives. Some armed Fulani herdsmen in a convoy of vehicles from Nasarawa state, dressed in military camouflage invaded some Tiv villages when most of their young men were in the farms.
place: Nzorov ward, Iyordye and Akaahena village

title: JTF, Top Boko Haram Commander, Borno
description: Operatives of JTF killed members of the Boko Haram sect during an encounter with the group in their main enclave in Maiduguri metropolis. Those killed include the main Amir of Bulabulin Nganaram, who was on the wanted list of the JTF with a N10m bounty. Amir Bulabulin is said to be responsible for the killing of a teacher and 3 students of Sanda Karami secondary School in Ruwan Zafi. Since the specific number of those killed is not stated in the report, we assume at least 2 were killed.
place: Bulabulin Nganaram, Aljajeri and Faluja areas of Maiduguri metropolis.

title: Prison brake, Ondo
description: 2 civilian killed and 175 inmates freed in an attack launched by a gang of unknown gunmen about mid night in Prison, Akure.

title: Boko Haram vs Naval Officer, Borno
description: Corporal Abubakar Umar was captured and slaughtered by Boko haram. The video of his killing was later found in YouTube. It was reported that the victim disappeared over a year ago. Therefore, this event is backdated to July last year.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Delta
description: A woman was killed by Fulani herdsmen who have been ravaging the farms of a community. It was reported that the herdsmen, always armed with guns and dangerous weapons, have constantly been destroying the farms of the community, killing and raping women. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed it happened in the middle of the given year.

title: Boko Haram kills, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents attacked 7 hilly communities in Borno and killed many people. The communities were attacked with IEDs and petroleum bombs.
place: Gathahure, Hwa'a, Tihezeh, Hrazah, Hembe, Kunde and Gjigga on the Mandara hills.

title: JTF kills Boko Haram, Borno
description: Suspected outlawed members of Boko Haram were killed during a confrontation with the men of JTF in the outskirts of the troubled town of Maiduguri.

title: Lawmaker's guard, Imo
description: Victor Mere, a security guard of a lawmaker was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in his World Bank Estate home within the Owerri Municipal Council.

title: Gunmen attack tribunal's convoy, Nasarawa
description: The convoy of the chairman of the Code of Conduct Tribunal, Justice Danladi Umar, was attacked by gunmen.The security personnel attached to the chairman engaged the gunmen in an exchange of gun fire, which led to the death of one of the bandits.

title: Boko Haram Ibadan Traders, Borno
description: 25 persons were reportedly killed by the Boko Haram Islamic sect. 9 of the victim were foodstuff traders from Bodija market in Ibadan, Oyo state capital. The report identified the nine traders as Seye Adegboyega, Jelili Popoola, Ojo Mosobalaje, Fatai Kareem, Femi Oyetunde, Ninalowo Saheed, Saburu Lanlehin, Lekan Oladokun, Sola Adeoye. The remaining 16 victims were said to be Hausa fish traders. The incidence occurred in Munguno part of Borno. We put Guzamala local government but we are not really sure.

title: Boko Haram vs JTF, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents ambushed security operatives attached to the JTF and killed a soldier.

title: Fulani gunmen attack, Plateau
description: A gun duel that lasted for 7 hours between insurgents and the Security Task Force in the villages of Balgang, Karkashi and Magama claimed 37 lives out of which 20 were insurgents. However, the Security Task Force claims there are only 28 deaths as reported in Td2013-06-29p7.
sources_of_information: This Day (70 ) , Independent (32 ) , The Guardian (34 ) , The Punch (68 ) , Vanguard (51 ) , police (10 ) , Nigerian Tribune (70 )

title: Gwoza Operation Claims 1 Soldier, Borno
description: A specialised operation by the JTF to hunt down the leader of the Boko Haram sect, Abubakar Shekau, claimed the life of Major A.T. Fambiya. Major Fambiya was killed during the unsuccessful operation in the Gwoza hills.

title: District head, 12 killed, Borno
description: The district head of Old Maiduguri local council of Bornu and 12 residents were killed by Boko Haram members. The Boko Haram members used IEDs and petroleum bombs in the operation which took place few hours after members of the Presidential Committee on Dialogue and Reconciliation arrived in Maiduguri.

title: Students Murdered, Yobe
description: In a school hall, 5 students and 4 teachers were murdered by alleged Boko Haram gunmen.

title: Boko Haram attacks on Residents, Borno
description: A local church pastor and other residents who sought refugee in a Police transit camp were killed while waiting for a security situation to normalize. From the Punch report, we put the number of fatalities to 20 since there were no acute figures of the dead victims quoted in the reports. The refugees had fled violence that happened in Maiduguri and killed 22 people between 10th and 16th of June, 2013.
place: Limankara, Kunde, Hwa'a, Gathahure, Gjigga, Kurana Bassa and Demboa.

title: Students, teachers, Boko Haram, Customs Area, Borno
description: 4 teachers and 2 students were killed by suspected Boko Haram gunmen.
place: Private secondary school, Customs Area, Maiduguri.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: Extra judicial killings: 47 Boko Haram detainees died in a detention facility from suffocation. They were placed in the same small cell . Some of them remained standing for over 24 hours, leading to their death before the next day.

title: Students, Boko Haram, Jajeri, Borno
description: 5 students sitting for NECO exam at Ansarudeen Primary/ Secondary school, allegedly killed by Boko Haram.
place: Ansarudeen Primary/ Secondary school Jajeri ward.

title: 13 fishermen killed, Borno
