description: 13 fishermen are killed by Boko Haram. They are relatives of those who have been arresting members of Boko Haram. They leave some fishermen alive and tell them to relate the killing to the youth vigilante.

title: Boko Haram killed 22, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram insurgents killed 22 people, including 9 students who were writing examinations, and 13 persons comprising fishermen and tea vendors in a farming village of Alau Dam.

title: Students, teachers, Boko Haram, Damaturu, Yobe
description: Seven students and 2 teachers killed by suspected members of Boko Haram.

title: Killing by Fulani herdsmen, Enugu
description: Residents in fear of Fulani herdsmen,allegedly robbed and raped women. In one of the recent assaults (date not stated), the Fulani Herdsmen killed 2 residents. We have adopted 2 days before the event was reported in the newspaper (2013-07-17)

title: Robbers massacre, Oyo
description: A group of armed robbers shot dead seven occupants of a Space bus attending functions in Iseyin. The robbers couldn't have been brutal if not that the driver of the bus hit one of the robbers in an attempt to escape.

title: University of Uyo Crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: A violent demonstration led to the death of student(s) of the University of Uyo.

title: Boko Haram insurgents kill Reverend and three others, Borno
description: Boko Haram members attack four communities, Hwa'a, Kunde, Gathahure and Gjigga. They set ablaze four local churches. After torching another church in Hwa'a community, they kill Reverend Jacob Kwiza of Church of Christ in Nigeria, after demanding him to convert to Islam and the consecutive refusal. After killing the reverend, they kill in separate attacks two district heads and the principal of day secondary school.
place: Mandara Hills, 151 kilometers south of Maiduguri

title: Auto Crash Kills Students, Akwa Ibom
description: Five (5) officers of the National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) died in an auto crash on their way to intervene in University of Uyo Crisis ( linked to P2013-06-21p18)

title: Soldiers and vigilantes killed, Kaduna
description: Armed bandits in a pre-down raid, killed two soldiers and three vigilantes, conflict resulting between Fulani nomads and farmers.

title: Gunmen kill five villagers, Benue
description: Unknown gunmen kill 5 villagers and cart away 43 cows belonging to a catholic diocese. According to the Secretary of the Myetti Allah Cattle Rearers Association, the gunmen are not Fulani herdsmen.

title: Fulani gunmen kill four villagers, Kaduna
description: Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani, kill four villagers. Many are displaced, and have fled away for safety. This killing may have links with a previous event that occurred the previous Wednesday, when the armed men were repelled by members of the village, and got injured.

title: MASSOB members die, Anambra
description: MASSOB imposes a sit-at-home in order to mourn the Igbo killed by Boko Haram. According to Vanguard, members are enforcing the order when they see soldiers. They try to flee but crash their bus, dying instantly. The number of deaths depends on the sources of information. Vanguard claims 2 deaths in the bus accident, reporting the official version. The Guardian, reporting the MASSOB version, rather claims 3 deaths caused by the military, which would have allegedly killed the bus passengers, as well as 3 other deaths due to fights between the military and the MASSOB members.
place: Bida Road (MASSOB's version of the accident), Modebe Avenue (official version of the accident), Bridgehead (MASSOB, extra deaths due to fights)

title: 29 killed in a clash between Boko Haram and the JTF, Borno
description: 29 persons, including 16 insurgents and 13 civilians, were killed. The latter are killed by Boko Haram gunmen on Friday. Among the 16 insurgents killed, 8 are killed right after the killing of the civilians by the JTF, and 8 are killed two days later again by the JTF.
place: Hausari Ward and Biu road Bridge

title: Fulani gunmen, Nasarawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked and killed two people, burnt several houses and rendered scores of people homeless.

title: JTF kills 2 Boko Haram members, Borno
description: Troops of JTF kill two suspected terrorists of Boko Haram, including an almirul (local leader), who was captured by ctizens in Maiduguri as he has terrorised them. The first JTF's aim was to destroy the training camps and hideouts of Boko Haram in Borno, and it is now seeking to arrest the fleeing insurgents.
place: Bama road Motor Park and Maloni ward

title: JTF Boko Haram vigilantes, Borno
description: Soldiers shot dead 8 suspected Boko Haram gunmen on 2013-06-06. In a related event, suspected Boko Haram members attacked a group of vigilantes in Maiduguri killing 13 of the youths before they were resisted by security forces.

title: Fulani gunmen kill 8 persons, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen has attacked three communities - Tse Akor, Tse-Kondon and Tse Umega-, killing 8 people, displacing 12,000 people, and razing properties and houses. Three camps for migrants have been created consequently, in Gbajimba.

title: 4 killed in communal conflict, Cross River
description: Four people in Inyima community are killed by the people of Adun. Many parts of the village are razed, and people are still missing. 3 persons are hospitalised. The story started when, some days before the incident (Thursday), an Inyima youth was caught stealing in the Adun community in Obubra LGA. Mkpani community denies involvement in the crisis but is suspected to have supported Oyadama fighters against Inyima.

title: Gunmen members of Boko Haram kill two, Borno
description: Insurgents kill two persons and torch two churches in Hrazah and Hembe communities.. They used Improvised Explosive Devices and petrol-bombs to set the churches ablaze.

title: Gunmen members of Boko Haram kill district head, Borno
description: The district head of Dala Amderi, who is also the protocol officer of the Borno State Government, in charge of Maiduguri International Airport, is killed by gunmen members of Boko Haram. According to The Guardian, the gunmen were chanting "God is great" before shooting in the head the district head.
place: Residence of the District head in Dama Alamderi Ward of Maiduguri Metropolis

title: 17 killed by Fulani herdsmen, Benue
description: 17 people are killed in Akough village during a batch of armed Fulanis' attack. They also burn houses, and raze the Akough market.

title: Shekau's associate found dead, Borno
description: An unamed Boko Haram leader's associate is reportedly dead. He was about to cross the Lake Chad to go to the Niger Republic with two other insurgents.

title: Two killed as Fulani herdsmen attack Tiv communities, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attack 6 Tiv peasant settlements in and around Kadarko, killing two people.

title: 3 Bokom Haram insurgents and 1 soldier killed after a military crackdown on Boko Haram, Borno
description: 25 insurgents are captured by the military, 3 insurgents die and one military personnel is killed during the fight. Boko Haram was about to launch a terrorist operation on Maiduguri when it happened. The operation was therefore done to prevent a mayhem in Maiduguri, but also in order to capture and destroy Boko Haram assembly points.

title: Sea bandits kill 1, Delta
description: Gunmen have killed a 30-year-old boat driver, and injured 10 persons.

title: 10 found dead as Chevron contractor's vessel sinks (offshore)
description: Jascon#4, a vessel belonging to Chevron's contractor, West African Ventures Limited, capsized and sank. 10 persons died.

title: Murder of 5, Lagos
description: Monday Ikudenyibo was alleged to have murdered Shola Hausa, Isiaka Promise, Idowu Olumegbon, Bola Akeju and Hammed Alex during a crisis.

title: Boko Haram members kill security operative in Borno
description: Gunmen, members of Boko Haram, shoot dead a security official who is a staffer of the Department of State Security (SSS)

title: Gunmen kill father, son and beggar, Borno
description: Three gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram shot dead a trader, his son and a beggar

title: Fulani herdsmen kill 7, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen kill 7 people and burn houses of several villages of Tiv farmers

title: Ombatse gunmen kill two Fulani herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Two Fulani are killed by gunmen members of Ombatse, who were on their way through Wadugu community

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 20 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen attacked a community. The attack was a reprisal attack for the murder of the traditional ruler and 4 other Fulani herdsmen. Among the victims are 2 soldiers (Lieutenant Chinedu Anyanwu and another soldier), a Fulani traditional ruler, Alhaji Habibu Domo and 18 others.

title: Troops kill several Boko Haram members, Borno
description: Several insurgents were killed by the army deployed to Maiduguri and Sambisa Game Reserve, under emergency rule (more than 3600 soldiers are deployed). The number of insurgents killed is vague. There might be some soldiers killed in the event.The location of the event is not precisely given, and one may only know that the bombings take place around the Boko Haram camps, that is to say in Maiduguri and in the south of Maiduguri, to Sambisa Game Reserve.

title: Bandits kill 3, Kwara
description: 3 persons are killed by bandits who raid three banks in the town. They escape with an unspecified amount of money.

title: Fulani gunmen kill 11, Kaduna
description: Gunmen believed to be Fulani herdsmen raid a village, killing 11 persons. They come shouting Allah akbar, and shooting sporadically at people.

title: Fulani attack claims 40 Idoma, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen kill 40 Idoma people, during the funerals of several police officers killed during the Nasarawa mayhem. Many inhabitants have fled their houses.

title: Bandits kill pregnant woman, Rivers
description: A pregnant woman is shot dead by armed men who attack her in order to steal church offering.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna 3
description: 13 people were killed when suspected Fulani gunmen attacked 5 villages.
place: Afang, Tangang, Zangan, Zakum and Tsokung

title: One killed in market crisis, Ebonyi
description: A crisis is triggered in a market as a policeman shoots a man inadvertently in the hand while trying to regulate the traffic jam. The policeman is severely beaten, and a group of other policemen intervene, killing one man in the process, arresting 28 persons.

title: 55 killed in Boko Haram's attack on Bama, Borno
description: 55 people, including 22 policemen, 14 prison officers, 2 soldiers, 13 insurgents, 3 children and one woman, are killed in Bama, when Boko Haram members, numbering between 300 and 500, have attempted to attack the city of Bama in order to seize the military facilities. More than 100 prison inmates are freed by Boko Haram. Arms and ammunitions are recovered from the suspects during their flee to Banki, a town bordering Cameroun.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (55 ) , This Day (55 ) , The Punch (55 ) , The Nation (55 ) , Vanguard (55 )

title: Security men killed by Ombatse, Nasarawa
description: Security men were killed by the Ombatse militia. They were on their way to arrest members of this militia, who were reportedly forcefully initiating Eggon tribesmen into the cult system. According to the Sunday Trust, 71 policemen and 10 SSS operatives were killed. For the Nation, 45 policemen and 10 SSS operatives were killed. For This Day, 100 security operatives were killed, including 10 SSS. The Punch reported 103 security men killed, including 10 SSS. A memorandum submitted by the Nasarawa State Police Command to the Judicial Commission of Enquiry into the May 7 massacre mentioned 63 policemen and 10 State Security Service (SSS) operatives killed in Lakyo village.
place: Lakyo near Lafia, the Nasarawa state capital
causes_of_violence: political issue, religious issue, land issue
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (88 ) , The Nation (80 ) , This Day (100 ) , The Punch (103 )

title: Boko Haram gunmen kill 10, Adamawa
description: Religious clash causes 10 victims. 6 are killed in the market, and four others are killed in a church.

title: Guard shot dead during kidnapping, Ebonyi
description: A consultant pediatrician, Dr. Pius Chuka Manyaike, is kidnapped by unknown gunmen. His security man is shot dead by the kidnappers when he tries to prevent them from gaining entry into the hospital.

title: Fulani herdsmen kill 6, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen kill 6 Tiv herdsmen, destroy their homes worth millions of Naira. The head of the village is presumably dead.

title: Boko Haram gunmen kill 4, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members kill two Islamic clerics and two residents of the town of Ngamdu.

title: Boko Haram kill LG chairman, Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill the acting Chairman of Dikwa LGA. The day after, the 92 year-old first minister of Petroleum Resources is kidnapped.

title: Gunmen kill two, Adamawa
description: Unknown gunmen shoot dead two persons and injure several others when they attack a shop.

title: Boko Haram kidnaps and kills one policeman, Borno
description: One policeman is kidnapped and killed. His remains are dumped the following day. He was attached to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra judicial killings: More than 1,400 corpses were taken to one of the mortuaries from Giwa barracks. It is assumed the victims were extra-Judicially killed by soldiers. The deaths occurred between May 1st and July, 2013. Therefore, this event is assumed to have happened on June 30th of the same month.

title: Boko Haram kill traditional ruler, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of Boko Haram kill the district head of Lawanti Ward in Bale. His wives and children are compelled to watch the scene.
place: Bale district, 165 kilometers south from Maiduguri

title: JTF kills top Boko Haram chief, Borno
description: A top commander of Boko Haram, Mohammed Chad, who is in the wanted list of the JTF, is killed in a shootout, involving the JTF and the SSS.

title: 17 killed in security forces/Boko Haram violence, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram members and 7 policemen are killed in a violence involving these two groups.

title: 3 people are killed after gunmen invade a town, Adamawa
description: 2 cops and one gunman are killed in a shootout between the police and unknown gunmen, who attack the residence of the home town of Adamawa State Governor (Murtala Nyako). They also steal two banks, and attack a local court, as weel as the police station.

title: Boko Haram raid a bank, in gunbattle with JTF, Yobe
description: At least two policemen and five suspected members of Boko Haram die after a shootout during the raid of a bank. The insurgents cart away more than N9 million. 5 policemen and 20 gunmen die in the attack (source the Punch).

title: Fulani cattle destroy farm crops, farmer murdered, Kogi
description: Five minutes after a farmer warns Fulani herdsmen to leave his farm whose crops were eaten by cattle, he is killed in revenge. The farmer is murdered one week after his wedding. The following day as the culprits are not found out, Irate youths burn Sabo Market in retaliation, forcing Hausa traders to leave.

title: Communal crisis, Delta
description: Three persons have been killed and scores injured in the headquarters of the Local Government following a leadership tussle by rival youth groups.

title: Attack at police, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen attack a police barracks, killing a policeman and injuring another.

title: Lawyer, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen trail and shoot a lawyer (Jibrin) dead.

title: Chairman of tricycle operators
description: The Chairman of tricycle operators (Kolapo Olatunji) about to enter his car, is murdered by unknown gunmen. His car is riddled with bullets. Another person sustains gunshot wounds. He was in charge of collecting money in the area and was also deeply involved in local politics.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Yobe
description: Extra-judicial Killing: 64 detainees were taken from a detention facility and shot dead by soldiers. Amnesty International reported that the detainees were executed in revenge for the death of 2 soldiers during a deadly combat that same day.

title: Pastor, Enugu
description: A Pastor (Victor Nnaduagwu) is shot dead by unknown gunmen and thrown in Enugu river.
place: he lived at Ilukpe Street, Asata, found dead in Asata stream
lga: Enugu South, Enugu North, Enugu East

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 35 suspected Boko Haram insurgents were killed by JTF.

title: Fulani kill Tiv farmers, Benue
description: four Tiv peasant farmers are ambushed and killed by Fulani herdsmen.
place: Imande Jem village, a farming community located on the University of Agriculture, Makurdi (UAM)-Gbajimba Road.

title: Boko Haram storm Maiduguri, kill 3 Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members riding in tricycle ambush a resident (Abubakar) near a shop kill him and snatch his vehicle. Few after two of the attackers die in a road crash. The sect members shoot at the son of the state former Deputy Governor, Shehu Abubakar injuring him.
causes_of_violence: road accident, political issue, religious issue

title: JTF v.s. Boko Haram, Borno
description: After a soldier (Lance Corporal Olomoja) was shot dead by unknown assailants in the early hours of the evening of 16 April 2013 in Bulabulin Ward of Baga, 195 to 200 people (mostly civilians) die during a clash between the militant Islamic sect Boko Haram and the Multinational Joint Task Force (Nigeria, Chad, Niger). Quoted by Senate report part B8, the Nigerian army claims only 37 victims. 2000 homes, 62 cars and 284 motorcycles and tons of foodstuff are also destroyed. One soldier and 30 Boko Haram members are reportedly killed. Another story told by Nigerien authorities is that an MJTF patrol was ambushed and killed 3 Boko Haram members. Boko Haram retaliated and killed 8 Nigerian soldiers.
sources_of_information: The Punch (195 ) , Other newpapers 1 (228 ) , The Nation (185 ) , judiciary (37 )

title: Boko Haram suspects, Damaturu, Yobe
description: Over 60 bodies deposited by the military at the Sani Abacha General Hospital mortuary in Damaturu, most likely detainees who suffocated in their cells or who were shot and killed by soldiers because they were suspected to support Boko Haram. Amnesty International claims that a total of over 950 people died in detention facilities run by the JTF in Maiduguri and Damaturu from January to June 2013. As we don't have more precisions on the deaths of these suspects, we only retain the data on Damaturu.
place: Damaturu city, Presidential Lodge detention centre, commonly referred to as 'Guardroom'

title: JTF clash with Boko Haram , Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attack a police station. After one hour encounter, 4 Boko Haram members and 5 police men were killed.

title: Efraya and Ajasor clash, Cross River
description: Efraya and Ajasor communities fight over a piece of land which belongs to the state government. Five people die.

title: Tiv and Kutep ethnic crisis, Taraba
description: At least six people going to fetch firewoods are missing during an ethnic clash.
place: In Yantu Development Area, Tse-Azer, Mbayange, Tomatar and Kashimbilla villages; residents refuge in Chanchange

title: Boko Haram terrorize 3 border communities, Borno
description: Boko Haram on Tuesday evening, unleashed terror in Dikwa, Gwoza and Bama communities killing four Christian members of the State Feeding Committee (BOFC) including a cleric’s son (Iliya). In a seperate attack, a examination officer, Mallam Ayuba Yusufu, a teacher, his wife and child are killed
place: Dikwa, Gwoza and Bama are border towns with Republics of Cameroun and Chad.

title: Fulani v.s. Tiv farmers, Benue
description: Three persons are reportedly killed in a fresh outbreak of bloody conflict between suspected Fulani herdsmen and native Tiv farmers. The attacker burn dcwn huts, houses and farmlands.

title: Boko Haram kill resident, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members trail and kill a resident at close range.

title: Boko Haram attack resident, Borno
description: Boko Haram members on motorcycles kill one resident waiting at a bus stop.
place: Ngoshe, Pulka-Kughum road, on Cameroon border

title: Boko Haram kill clerics, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill two muslim clerics .
place: at the Kandahar and T-Junction areas

title: MEND kills 13 policemen in Bayelsa
description: 13 policemen deployed at the burial ceremony of the late mother of ex-militant leader (Kile Selky Torughedi aka Young Shall Grow) are killed during the ceremony.The ex-militant leader refused to be part of the move by MEND to resume militant activities in the creeks over the recent jailing of MEND leader, Henry Okah, in South Africa. He was recently appointed as a Senior Special Adviser (SSA) to the Bayelsa governor on Marine Waterways Security. Up to 15 policemen and two militants are killed (according to Vanguard). A militia group, led by one ‘General’ Jaspa Boro (Jnr), has claimed responsibility for this attack

title: Farmer, Borno
description: A resident of Agapalawa, said that Boko Haram members come on two motorcycles and headed towards the house of a farmer and kill him.

title: Boko Haram raid a bureau-de-change in Borno
description: JTF kill three Boko Haram terrorists after they attack a bureau-de-change, robbing foreign exchange and the car of the manager.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna 1
description: Many people were reportedly killed during an attack by Fulani gunmen. Since the number of victims were not specified, it is assumed about 10 people died during the attack.
place: Kirim, Zabgan, Tangan, Zilan and Mafan.

title: JTF raid Boko Haram hideout, Kano
description: Following a tip off, security forces raid a terrorists hideout where they kill 14 insurgents. They recover a car that wired with explosives.One soldier is shot dead during the operation

title: Fulani attack communities, Kaduna
description: Invaders suspected to be Fulani herdsmen, heavily armed, launch an attack at two villages. 4,000 people flee heir homes to neighbouring villages following that attack which leads to the burning of their houses. There are reportedly 10,000 refugees from the violence.
place: in Mafang and Zilang villages; refugees move to Amisi Primary School, Fadan Attakar and Mifi villages.
sources_of_information: This Day (19 ) , The Guardian (19 ) , The Punch (28 )

title: UNIMAID Professor , Borno
description: Bandits storm 202 Housing Estate and a Church, killing Prof. Murtala Mohammed of the Mass Communication Departmment of the University of Maiduguri and a security guard of the church.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Bauchi
description: Boko haram insurgents shot sporadically into different directions and killed 7 people. 4 of the attackers were killed.

title: Attack in another village, Plateau
description: As STF men are deployed in Bokkos, Fulani gunmen and mercenaries invade a village in Fan district.

title: Worshipper dies at mosque's attack, Yobe
description: Unknown gunmen open fire at a mosque, killing one worshipper observing the evening prayer. Two persons are injured.
place: open mosque at Filin Allah area

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: An attack on some villages by Fulani herdsmen left 30 people dead. The victims were mostly women and children.

title: Fulanis attack two villages in Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen who hire mercenaries from Niger Republic and Chad ransack and burn two villages at night. 20 people are killed including two policemen who fight with the attackers. Upt to 24 people are killed.
place: Mangor and Matol, farmers/herdsmen residing close to the Bokkos Fertiliser Plant

title: Boko Haram v.s. JTF, Yobe
description: Four suspected Boko Haram insurgents and one vigilante (Malam Idi Danbanga) are killed in a gun duel with JTF officers.
place: in Geidam town: security posts and central market

title: Attack at bus stop, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen driving a rickshaw launch an attack at a Bus Stop killing a female phone recharge card vendor and a man. The attackers previously killed the rickshaw operator, taking away the vehicle.

title: Boko Haram attack police station, telecom, Yobe
description: Boko Haram sect torch the Bara Divisional Police Station, the council secretariat complex and telecom masts of MTN and Globacom, killing a policeman.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Kaduna
description: 180 people were killed during an invasion by Fulani herdsmen. The attackers took over the invaded communities.

title: Boko Haram attack businessman in Borno
description: Boko Haram attack the residence of Alhaji Umar Ali Adam Kolo, a businessman, and kill his chief security officer

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 3 people were shot dead when they attempted to escape from Boko Haram detention camp. The terrorists followed the escapees on a motorcycle and shot at their Gulf car. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Gunmen raid Ganye town in Adamawa
description: Unknown gunmen take over the town attacking residents, police station, prison, bank and more. Its is reported that about 30 dead bodies were recovered including that of a former commissioner of police (Adiei Bila) prison officials, police personnel and others. Some inmates have been freed.
place: Ganye Police Station, residence of the Divisional Police Officer (DPO in old Gongola State), prison yard, library, education authority and a bank

title: Boko Haram Kills 2, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked and killed the Assistant Controller of Ganye prison. Mr. Adiel Billa, a former commissioner of Health, was also killed at his residence.

title: Fulani militia attack two communities in Plateau
description: Suspected hired Fulanis launch an overnight attack in two villages. At least 20 people are killed during the massacre.
place: Attakar and Dajak villages, Ganwuri District

title: Communal clash, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen kill two Tarok men. 35 persons are feared killed in the ensuing interethnic clash.
place: The Tarok men were coming from Langtang North to Kardako (Wase)

title: Police kill robbers, Delta
description: A police patrol codenamed Dragon 12, with Dragon Monitor One, ran into a gang of robbers. Two bandits are killed.

title: Boko Haram kill tea vendor, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect shot dead a tea vendor (name withheld) at his shop.

title: Gunmen Attack, Kaduna 2
description: Many were killed when some communities were attacked by Fulani gunmen. It is assumed that about 10 people died since there was no specific number of victims reported.
place: Kirim, Zabgan, Tangan, Zilan and Mafan.

title: Civil Defence Officer, Yobe
description: Unknown gunmen shoot dead an officer of the Nigeria Civil Defence Service Corps (NCDSC), probably trailed from the mosque.
place: in his house at Tudun Wada area

title: Unknown gunmen kill DPO, son, Kano
description: A female DPO (Esther Tarimo), wife of a retired police officer, is killed as she goes to pick her 7 years-old child from school. The child is killed too.

title: Suicide bomb blast at bus terminal, Kano
description: Terrorists bomb an interstate bus terminal, killing 22 to 75 persons, wounding dozens. Five Marco Polo luxury buses are destroyed. One of the bus belonging to Gobison Motors had on board over 70 passengers. Two suicide bombers (alleged to be members of Boko Haram, which did not claim the attack) drove a Volkswagen car.
place: Park along New Road in Sabon-Gari

title: Boko Haram attack JTF, Borno
description: A bomb blast hit the patrol vehicle of JTF killing 6 soldiers, injuring four others.
place: Roundabout of First Bank, Kashim Ibrahim Way

title: Schools attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists launch attacks on three schools, killing three female teachers. Three students are injured.
place: in the Shehu Sanda Kyarimi Secondary School around Ruwan Zafi ward of the metropolis, in addition to the killing of two teachers in Mafoni Primary and Secondary Schools.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 3 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen in reprisal attack for the killing on 2 of their men.

title: Boko Haram attack Gwoza prison in Borno
description: Boko Haram attack a prison and set all the inmates free. One civilian is killed by stray bullets.

title: Army kill 3 commanders of the Boko Haram, Sokoto
description: Soldiers have killed three top commanders of the Boko Haram Islamic sect. (Asalafin, Danladi and a bomb manufacturing expert nicknamed "Doctor"). Danladi is believed to be the vice-president of the sect while Asalafin is the minister of defence.

title: Trader, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen shoot a trader dead in the metropolis.

title: Attack on police station, Borno
description: As Boko Haram attack a police station with arms and explosives, four terrorists are killed and five policemen injured.

title: NSCDC officer, Benue
description: A Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corp is shot to dead by unknown gunmen while working on his farm.

title: Ansaru execute 7 abducted expatriates during rescue mission, Bauchi
description: A splinter group from the Boko Haram, Jama’atu Ansarul Muslimina fi Biladis Sudan, (JAMBS), announces the murder of seven foreign expatriates abducted in Bauchi State, on February 16, 2013. The leader of JAMBS, Abu Usamatal Ansary, states in a message his decision following attempts by British and Nigerian Forces to rescue the hostages, by the presence of five jet bombers and intgelligents agents.
place: three Lebanese, citizen from Britain, Greece, Italy and the Philippines kidnapped from a Lebanese Construction Firm, Setraco, at Jama’are, in Bauchi

title: Gunmen shoot 4 in Kano
description: Unknown gunmen in tricycles shot four people dead in three separate incidents.
place: 1/Dakata 2/ near Customs barracks 3/ Hotoro Primary School (2 casualties)

title: Army kill Boko Haram members in their hideouts, Borno
description: JTF kill 52 Boko Haram terrorists in two different days in the last 10 days as follows: 20 on March 3 (event 10925) 32 others the following days, including the death of 2 soldiers. Many arms and amunitions were recovered during the last Friday's operation. Items recovered include 3 Anti Aircraft Guns, 10 Rocket Propelled Grenade Tubes, 3 General Purpose Machine Guns, 17 AK47 Rifles, 3 G3 Rifles, 1 Pistol (Lama), 20 RPG Bombs, 12 RPG Chargers, 1x 36 Hand Held Grenade. Others are: 1 Teargas Rifle, 33 AK 47 Magazines, 11 FN Magazines, 3 G3 Magazines, 11,068 Assorted Ammunitions, 2 Technical Vehicles with mounted Anti Aircraft Stands, 1 Box of weapons cleaning kit, 4 Swords and 2 Knifes, 5 Walking Talkies, 4 VHF Hand Held Sets, 1 Multi Links Router and assorted uniforms and kits.

title: Militants attack Sterling oil Barge in Delta
description: Unknown gunmen suspected to be Niger Delta militants attack an oil Barge belonging to Sterling killing four soldiers on escort, a retired naval officer and two civilians; this happens in a climax of river robbery attacks, community agitations, and community demands. The militants probably steal oil products from the barge.
place: around Patani near Bifurcation, 200 meters away from Fung Tai camp in Patani

title: Tiv farmers v.s. Fulani herdsmen, Benue
description: Fulani kill two persons during Uvir fishing festival.

title: Boko Haram attack police station near Cameroon, Borno
description: As Boko Haram terrorists attack a police station and a bank, eight civilians and two policemen (Abubakar Digire Ahamdu and his deputy) were killed.
place: Gwoza town, near the Cameroonian border. Targets : Mobile Police Training Camp (MPTC) and Mainstreet Bank

title: Traditional ruler, Borno
description: Boko Haram murder a traditional ruler (Lawan Kafu).

title: Islamic terrorists, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attempting to bomb a military barracks were killed. On the wanted list were Abu Saad (N10million), Abba Kaka (N10million), Abdulmalik Bama (N10million), Umar Fulata(N10million), Alhaji Mustapha (Massa), Ibrahim (N10million), Abubakar Suleiman-Habu (a.k.a Khalid), N10million; Hassan Jazair N10million, Ali Jalingo (N10million), Alhaji Musa Modu (N10million), Bashir Aketa (N10million), Abba Goroma(N10million), Ibrahim Bashir (N10million), Abubakar Zakariya (N10milion), and Tukur Ahmed Mohammed (N10million), Boko Haram Commanders and , Imam Abubakar Shekau (N50million); Habibu Yusuf (a.k.a Asalafi) N25million; Khalid Albarnawai (25million); Momodu Bama (N25 million), and Mohammed Zangina (N25million), five members of the Shurra Committee

title: Mopol commander, Enugu
description: The new Kwara CP (Chinwike Asadu) is murdered by unknown gunmen ambushed near his residence. His driver and orderly are injured.

title: Boko Harm vs Foreigners, Borno
description: 7 foreigners (Carlos Bou Azziz, Brendan Vaughan, Silvano Trevisan, Konstantinos Karras, Ghaida Yaser Sa’ad (F), Julio Ibrahim El-Khouli and Imad El-Andari) were abducted from a construction site in Bauchi and taken to Sambisa forest where they were killed. Mohammed Usman (known as Khalid Al-Barnawi), Mohammed Bashir Saleh, Umar Mohammed Bello (known as Abu Azzan), Mohammed Salisu (known as Datti), Yakubu Nuhu (known as Bello Maishayi), Usman Abubakar and a lady were arrested for the abduction and murder.

title: Boko Haram commander and 3 others, Borno
description: A top commander of Boko Haram and three lieutenants were killed by JTF, operation Restore Hope.
place: Kasuwan Kajii area of the metropolis

title: Boko Haram attack community in Yobe
description: An attack reportedly launched by Boko Haram kills six persons.

title: Fire, Oyo
description: A grandmother (Olunisi Anike) and grandson (Waris Ajasa) die in fire disaster at their home.

title: Boko Haram lauch 8 IED's at police station, Borno
description: Boko Haram attempted to bomb a police station. Residents in the area reported at least 15 dead bodies.

title: Religious crisis, Taraba
description: Argument between two footballers degenerates into a religious clash (Muslims vs Christians): 5 persons die.

title: Killing and abduction at AGIP oil site, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen kill two policemen on escort and abduct four staff of Agip and Sterling companies.
place: AGIP oil field located in Okpai/Beneku, Kwale

title: MOPOL (Umaru Ali Jenga), traffic warden, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect kill a Police Mobile Training Camp, PMTC, commandant, (Umaru Ali Jenga) and a traffic warden (name withheld).
place: in Gwange ward of the metropolis at his Lagos Bridge residence; the traffic warden is killed at Bama road, at his duty post.

title: 7 expatriates abucted, 1 security staff killed, Bauchi
description: Gunmen attack a Lebanese construction company site (Setraco) and seize 7 foreign workers (Italian, Greek two Lebanese, British, a Filipino, Union leader in Setraco). A Nigerian security guard is killed. Before that operation, the gunmen attack and blow up a police station. Ansaru, an Islamist group who emerges in June 2012 confirm they are behind these kidnappings.

title: Passenger Dies, Plateau
description: Mr. Wagley Dauda was short dead by a member of a Special Task Force on Jos crisis after he boarded a taxi to a bus terminus.

title: French hostages, Borno
description: Scores of lives were lost in connection with the search of French hostages kidnapped by Boko Haram. Kidnapping in Cameroon, near WAZA animal park. Hostages brought to Nigeria by Boko Haram; hideouts burnt in Ummarari and Jajeri, suicide bomb at JTF van,Gamboru Customs road

title: Cult Clashes Claim 10, Lagos
description: Bloody cult clashes between Moshalangbe Boys of Iwaya and Makoko Boys led to the death of 10 persons. Some of the suspectets; Lekan Olaiya, Edum Adeshina, Kazeem Igbalaiye, Irelola Shokeye, Kamilu Oladimeji, Darli Adewale and Bakare azeez, said the crisis started during the 2008 LGA elections during which they were sponsored by politicians. Among the dead are Oduayo and one Mr. John who were killed while playing football.
place: Makoko and Iwaya Areas of Yaba.

title: Boko Haram kill a councillor, Borno
description: Boko Haram murdered a councillor Alhaji Kalla in Maiduguri Metropolitan. He was trailed to his house and was killed in the presence of his wife and children.

title: North Korean doctors, Yobe (expatriates)
description: Suspected Boko Haram member behead and slit the throat of three North Korean medical doctors.

title: Cocoa merchant, Ekiti
description: A cocoa merchant is assassinated in his farm by suspected Fulani herdsmen (otherwise called Bororo).

title: Filling station attack, Cross River
description: A seurity guard , injured during a robbery attack, (Joseph Ogbor) kills a robber with the arm of one of the bandits.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 30 people. Several houses including the palace of Emir of Kwandere were razed down.

title: Boko Haram kill 6 park rangers in Borno
description: In reprisals of the raid destroying two training base in a game reserve, Boko Haram members kill 6 park rangers at the staff camp.

title: Forest guards, Borno
description: Two forest guards accused to be JTF informants were assassinated by suspected Boko Haram members.

title: Boko Haram kill 8, Borno
description: Fighters in two trucks open fire and kil eight people, seven cilivilians and a policeman. They target a bank and a police station.

title: Shot after morning prayers in Borno
description: Boko Haram riding in two tricylces kill two residents after they leave the mosque.

title: Extrajudicial killings, Borno
description: Soldiers in search of Boko Haram suspects, allegedly kill a teacher (Adamu Usman) and his friend, an auto-Mechanic (Adamu Babayo). Their bodies are lying on a road.

title: 50 Fulani raid communities, Nasarawa
description: Ten people die, 15 are injured as Fulani herdsmen attack two communities.
place: Iga and Rutu communities in Nasarawa Egon and Doma

title: JTF kill Boko Haram in training base, Borno
description: Army kill Boko Haram members in a training camp. A security staff was killed too. The attack was launched by air (helicopter) and infantry.
place: Sambisa Game Reserve in Bama and Farin-Ruwa Forest South West/East in Damboa

title: Offa/Erinle crisis, Kwara
description: After an incident, Offa and Erinle border communities clash leading to 10 deaths. In a land crisis background for three decades, the fight erupts after the vehicle of a native of Erinle hit a vehicle of an Offa indigene.

title: Farmers clash with Fulanis, Benue
description: Idoma farmers raze the settlements of Fulani herdsmen , killingthree of them and 8 cows, after cattle destroy farm produce and spoil the water.
place: farmers from Amla and Emichi communities, Amla village

title: Boundary crisis, Ebonyi
description: An Ebonyi community attacks another in the border: 8 people die and hundreds are displaced.
place: Ebonyi (Ndiagu Amagu) is accused to collaborate with police to attack their neighbours (Adadama in Abi LGA, cross River)

title: JTF kill 2 Boko Haram, Boko Haram kills mother, Borno
description: In reprisals, members of Boko Haram kill a woman after she hides two other members of the sect, pursued and killed by JTF.

title: Ethno-communal clash in Plateau
description: A fight between Tarok an Fulani leaves 17 Fulanis dead. The crisis erupts after a decomposing corpse is found in the bush.

title: Gunmen Kill Man, FCT (Abuja)
description: A man, Aminu Abba Ibrahim, was shot dead by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram kill hunter at a market, Borno
description: Boko Haram launch an attack against local hunters who sell their bush meat and pork meat which is forbidden for Muslims. The attack might also be a reprisal because hunters vigilantes work with the security forces against Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram kill civilians, Kano
description: Boko Haram in motorcycles open fire at people playing an outdoor board game.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 7 people were killed during a dispute over destruction of farm crops by herdsmen. About 200 people were displaced after the clash.

title: Gunbattle at a checkpoint, Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen kill a policeman and an 8 years old girl hit by stray bullets. Several policemen and civilians are injured.
place: Ungwar Sosa, suburb of the metropolis

title: Boko Haram kill informant, Kaduna
description: Boko Haram kill an informant after they warn him by a letter sent in September 2012.
place: they trail him in a mechanical workshop, Bulunkutu area

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Kogi
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed a Mali-bound Nigerian Army peacekeepers who were travelling in luxurious buses and killed 2 soldiers. The insurgents hit the convoy with Improvised Explosives Devices (IEDs) before firing at the troops.

title: NURTW deputy chair, Oyo
description: The deputy Chairman of NURTW (Alhaji Kamorudeen Beyioku) dies following gunshots fired by unknown gunmen.
place: dies at UCH hospital of ibadan
lga: Ibadan North East, Ibadan North, Ibadan North West, Ibadan South East, Ibadan South West

title: Lawmaker, Gombe
description: Unknown gunmen attack the residence of a lawmaker, House Committee Chairman on Public Accounts (Alhaji Abdulhamid Waziei Doho). Representing Kwami East Constituency, he was minority leader of the State House of Assembly Congress for Progressive Change. His daughter sustains injuries.
place: At his residenceTudun Wada area of the metropolis

title: Naval officer, marine coordinator, Lagos
description: An ex naval officer (Johnson Kayode Olanrewaju) is murdered by unknown gunmen. After 13 years with the NigerainNavy, he had worked as marine security coordinator for exxon mobil producing ltd

title: Gunmen ambush JTF, Yobe
description: A soldier is killed in an attack with explosives by unknown gunmen.

title: Farmers vs. Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 2 people were killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers over the destruction of a farmland by herdsmen. 5 houses were burnt down and properties destroyed.

title: 2 Die in Boko Haram Blast, Borno
description: 2 girls died from a heavy blast after they were moved from Sambisa to Gwoza by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Boko Haram Beheads 2, Borno
description: Dawoud Muhammad and Muhammad Awlu were gruesomely executed in a video posted by Boko Haram Islamic sect. The victims were murdered for serving as spies for the military. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram vs Policeman, Yobe
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect invaded a police station and killed 1 policeman. The date of the incident was not reported. However based on the report, it is assumed that it happened 2 days (2014-12-19) before it was reported on 2014-12-21.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombers, Borno
description: 2 Boko haram suicide bombers detonated explosives in a market and killed 60 people. A male and a female suicide bombers were reported to have carried out the heinous acts. 43 persons died in the explosion according to a report by Amnesty International.
sources_of_information: The Punch (60 ) , Independent (70 ) , Vanguard (67 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (43 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 16 people.

title: Boko Haram Bombers, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko haram suicide bombers killed 23 persons when they attacked a Muslim Shi'ite procession in one of the major towns. The death toll hit 82 in the latest report.

title: Boko Haram Kill 21, Borno
description: 21 people were killed by Boko haram during an invasion. The victims were killed after the insurgents overpowered soldiers sent to combat them.

title: Herdsmen Attacks, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a village, raped women and killed 4 persons. The armed men also destroyed farmlands during the attack.
place: Tse Shima Village in Mbatsoho community.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 18 people were killed when herdsmen invaded a community. Dozens of people have been killed in the area in recent past.

title: 2 Drown, Borno
description: 2 persons got drown while fleeing from Boko Haram attacks. The victims fell into the river following a false alarm raised about the invasion of Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The army engaged Boko Haram insurgents who attempted to take over a community and killed many insurgents. Some soldiers were also killed during the confrontation. Based on the report it is assumed that 25 persons, including 20 insurgents and 5 soldiers, were killed.

title: Boko Haram Kill 5, Borno
description: 5 residents were killed when Boko haram attacked their community. The attacked was triggered by the removal of hoisted flag in some locations.

title: Vigilantes vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 8 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by local vigilante members in a shootout after the insurgents invaded a community.

title: Gunmen, Bauchi
description: 2 people were killed when heavily armed gunmen attacked and robbed a filling station. According to another version, alleged Boko Haram members ransacked the local police station to take weapons on 19 June 2014 and killed 3 passerby in the ensuing shootout, as reported by Galadima, Habu & Aluaigba, Moses (ed.), Insurgency and Human Rights in Northern Nigeria, Kano, Center for Information, Technology and Development, 2015, p.159.
place: Zunnuraini filling station, Giade, old Kano-Maiduguri Road, on the fringes of the Bulmo Forest (Balmo).
sources_of_information: Independent (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (3 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Community, Enugu
description: 2 people were killed by a retired police officer when a community clashed with Fulani herdsmen who invaded their farms. It is assumed that the incident happened 2 days before it was reported since the date was not reported.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Gombe
description: A female suicide bomber and a soldier were killed during an operation.

title: Boko Haram vs Farmers, Adamawa.
description: 5 farmers were killed during an attack by Boko Haram insurgents. The attackers invaded their farms shooting sporadically on people at sight.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers killed some 50 Boko Haram insurgents in an ambush. The insurgents were on their way to attack some villages when they were ambushed.

title: Boko Haram kills 19, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram fighters came to a village and killed 19 people. According to Amnesty International report, house, cars and food items were burnt during the attack.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A clash between soldiers and Boko Haram insurgents resulted in the death of 61 people including 52 terrorists and 9 traders.

title: Military Fighter Jet, Adamawa
description: A little girl was killed when a military fighter jet damaged a church building during a foiled Boko Haram attack.

title: Farmers vs Fulani Herdsmen, FCT (Abuja)
description: 4 people died during a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. Herdsmen destroyed some portions of a farmland and the farmers mobilized and attacked them.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: 45 people were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village. The fake preachers deceitfully assembled the victims and shot them.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community and killed 2 people.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 3 villages and killed over 80 villagers. It was reported by some media sources that Christians and Muslims in these communities took up arms against one another, leading to the killing of many people. Amnesty International source reported 154 deaths in 2 attacks on the villages.
place: Attagara, Aghapalwa (Agapalwa) and Ngoshe (Goshe) Villages. Plus, possibly, Aganjara.
sources_of_information: The Punch (100 ) , Other newpapers 1 (80 ) , Other newspaper 2 (300 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (101 )

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Adamawa
description: 60 people were killed when Boko haram insurgents bombed a bar and a brothel near a military base. Casualty rate varies by different reports. Amnesty International reported 18 deaths.
sources_of_information: The Punch (60 ) , Vanguard (40 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (18 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 Boko Haram insurgents were killed by soldiers who were ambushed by the insurgents. Many soldiers had previously been killed in ambushes.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a shoot-out with soldiers.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages. EYN Church was attacked during a Sunday church service and killed 9 villagers. However, 4 insurgents were killed by villagers.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 42 people were killed in Boko Haram attacks on 3 border villages. the insurgents have been on killing spree despite the state of emergency imposed on the area by the FG.

title: Boko Haram Kills Emir, Borno
description: The Emir of Gwoza, Alhaji Idrissa Timta, was killed when Boko Haram insurgents ambushed his convoy. 2 policemen in the convoy of the Emir were also shot dead by the insurgents.

title: Gunmen vs Businessman, Lagos
description: A businessman, Chief Bright Igwebu, was shot dead by unknown gunmen.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 51 persons. The attackers invaded the village with pick-up vans, motorcycles and Armoured Personnel Vehicles.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages and killed 9 people. The village was attacked with pick-up vans, motorcycles and armoured personnel vehicles.

title: Gunmen Attacks, Plateau
description: Gunmen attacked a village and killed 4 members of the same family. The family was asleep when the attack took place.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: A Boko Haram attack was repelled by soldiers, killing 31 of the insurgents. However, 2 soldiers were killed during the attack, bringing the number of deaths to 33.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village with AK-47 riffles and killed 9 residents. According to Amnesty International report, 7 corpses, all men, were discovered with gunshot wounds after the attack.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (8 ) , The Punch (9 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (7 )

title: Boko Haram vs Soldiers, Plateau
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents killed 4 soldiers of the Special Task Force (STF) during an ambush.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Heavily armed Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 20 people.

title: Boko Haram vs Security Forces, Yobe
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a police station and a Military base and killing 45 people including 24 soldiers and 21 policemen.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (45 ) , The Punch (40 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (24 )

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 24 people. The terrorists invaded the village market with assault riffles and explosives.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages and killed 21 people. 1 of the insurgents was killed by soldiers who came to repel the attackers.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A joint force of soldiers and youth volunteers popularly called "Civilian-JTF" repelled a Boko haram attack on a village and killed more than a dozen. It is, however, assumed that about 15 insurgents were killed.

title: Auto Crash, Ondo
description: A student of Adekunle Ajasin University, Segun Adesuyan, was killed in an auto crash. He was killed by a reckless driver close to the school.

title: 7 Boko Haram Insurgents, Borno
description: 7 Boko haram insurgents who were mysteriously arrested by women were immediately lynched by angry youths and some local vigilantes. This incident was preceded by the killing of 4 bread distributors.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Taraba
description: A clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmer led to the death of 16 people. Several houses were also burnt during the attack.

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Katsina
description: 2 Boko Haram members were killed by soldiers during a shootout.

title: Student Killed, Abia
description: A student of the Abia State Polytechnic was shot dead by unknown gunmen suspected to be cultists. The date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that it happened 2 days (2014-05-23) before it was reported on 2014-05-25.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 3 villages and killed 30 people.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked 2 villages and killed many villagers in their farmland. The victims were killed by the insurgents because they were suspected of being members of an anti-Boko Haram vigilante group.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents ambushed a village and killed 30 villagers.

title: Bomb Blast, Plateau
description: Over 100 people were killed in a twin bomb blast in a market. The 2 bomb blasts occurred almost simultaneously few metres apart. The blasts came from 2 vehicles wired with explosives by persons suspected to be Boko haram insurgents. Amnesty International reported 101 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (118 ) , The Punch (150 ) , police (46 ) , Other newpapers 1 (200 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (101 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 19 villagers. The insurgents attacked the village with assault riffles and burnt down many houses.

title: Communal Clash, Taraba
description: 6 people got killed in a communal crisis in which some Fulani herdsmen were suspects.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Zamfara
description: 30 bandits who operate from their hideouts in a forest were attacked and killed by soldiers. A soldier also died in the shoot-out.

title: Soldiers vs Thiefs, Kaduna
description: 40 people were killed after some soldiers raided a village in search of thieves. The troops were drafted to curtail incessant cattle rustling and armed robbery in the area. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Bombs Bridge, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents bombed a bridge linking Nigeria with Cameroon and killed 30 people.

title: Army vs Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 48 cattle rustlers were killed in an ambush by soldiers, who were drafted into a hideout forests of rustlers. The state has been experiencing attacks of cattle rustlers since last year.

title: Soldiers vs Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: 18 cattle rustlers were ambushed and killed by soldiers. This incident is linked to event IBD002744.

title: Palace, Kaduna
description: 2 men, Yusuf Idris and Yahuza Yusuf were beaten to death by mob after arguing with a community chief over referring to Fulani people as Boko Haram.

title: Army vs Bandits, Kaduna
description: 17 bandits were killed during a gun battle with soldiers. The troops were deployed to the area to flush out some armed gangs.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community at night and killed 300 people. The insurgents attacked a local market, with Armoured Personnel Carrier (APC0, IEDs, Petrol bombs, assault riffles and Rocket Propelled Launchers (RPGs). Amnesty International source reported a total of 401 deaths.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (300 ) , Independent (310 ) , Daily Trust (354 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (401 )

title: Snakebite, Borno
description: 2 of the girls abducted by Boko Haram in IBD002535 died of snakebites. The girls had escaped with few others from Sambisa forest where they were held captive for days. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: 6 In Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: 6 people were shot dead by Boko Haram insurgents during an attack on a community. This came after the insurgents were repelled by security operatives from attacking the University of Maiduguri.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Abuja
description: A bomb exploded in a transit bus and killed 30 people. This is the 2nd bomb blast being detonated in the area within 2 weeks. Amnesty International reported 13 deaths including the bomber.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (20 ) , The Punch (30 ) , Independent (20 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (13 )

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 19 Boko Haram insurgents were killed during a shoot-out with a Counter Terror Squad. The insurgents opened fire on soldiers at a check point.

title: Cattle Rustlers, FCT (Abuja)
description: A Fulani community leader was killed by cattle rustlers during a raid on a settlement. About 53 cows were stolen during the attack.

title: Boko Haram Kill 8, Adamawa
description: 8 people were killed during an attack by Boko Haram members. Houses and 2 churches were also burnt.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram sect killed 1 person and burnt many houses and shops.

title: Herdsmen vs Farmers, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some communities and shot dead 5 farmers. The victims were attacked while working in their farms.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: 40 Boko haram terrorists and 9 soldiers were killed during a fierce gun battle. This recent attack came as soldiers increased the search efforts to rescue abducted school students.
sources_of_information: Independent (49 ) , Daily Trust (44 ) , Other newpapers 1 (40 ) , Vanguard (44 )

title: Boko Haram Vs 3 Civil Servants, Yobe
description: 3 civil servants were killed during an attack by Boko haram insurgents. 5 women were also abducted.

title: Boko Haram Bomb Blast, Abuja
description: Olalekan, a victim of the Nyanya bomb blast (See IBD002521), died after 2 weeks in the hospital where he was receiving treatment. More deaths have been recorded after the blast that was attributed to an attack by Boko haram terrorists.

title: Boko Haram Kill Soldier, Borno
description: A soldier was killed by Boko Haram insurgents during an attack. Classrooms and hotels were also set ablaze by the rampaging insurgents.

title: Boko Haram, Taraba
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 17 people. The attackers had military uniforms, burning down many houses and killing people indiscriminately.

title: Boko Haram vs Party Leader, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents shot a Local Government council Chairman of All Progressive Congress (APC), Alhaji Modu Janga and another party's youth leader, Alhaji Abba. The two victims died.

title: Bomb Scare, Yobe
description: A blind man, Malam Abdullahi, was killed by a stray bullet fired by soldiers at a checkpoint. The soldiers mistook a loud sound from a burst tyre as a bomb explosion or Boko haram attack.

title: Boko Haram vs Emir, Traders, Borno
description: An emir who sent a "Save Our Souls" plea to the government and his guard were killed by Boko Haram insurgents. 18 traders coming back from a local market were also killed during the rampage.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: A village head and his guard were killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked his district. The village was shot dead in his bedroom

title: Boko Haram Explosion, FCT (Abuja)
description: Several people were killed by an early morning bomb explosion by Boko Haram at a popular motor park . The busy park serves as a major terminus to commuters from satellite towns. Many of the victims were workers who had wanted to report to their workplaces. Meanwhile, another report has linked to one Samantha Lewthwaite (White Widow), the widow of 7/7 suicide bomber, Germaine Lindsay. One of the sources reported that 3 of the bombers were among the dead. Amnesty International reported 71 deaths.
sources_of_information: Independent (72 ) , The Punch (89 ) , Other newpapers 1 (200 ) , The Nation (150 ) , Nigerian Tribune (102 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (71 )

title: Boko Haram, Bauchi
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked a community, burnt many houses and shot 1 person dead.

title: Boko Haram, Jigawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents invaded a town, attacked a police station and killed 9 people. The attackers has previously warned the people not to send their children to school or accept vaccination. They were asked to close down all football viewing centres.

title: Boko Haram 11, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram militants killed a Village head and 10 others.

title: Boko Haram, Jigawa
description: 7 policemen and a guard were among those killed when Boko Haram insurgents attacked a police station and a Sharia court. The attack focused on Muslims and not Christians, unlike the mob action of 27 June 2001, when 15 churches and 14 Pastors’ residences were burned down (no one was hurt in the fires)

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 5 soldiers were killed in an ambush by Boko Haram members. During the incidence, it was also reported that scores of the insurgents were killed. Based on the report, it is estimated that at least 2 scores (40) of the insurgents were killed, making a total death figure of 45 deaths. Although the date of the incident was not reported, from the report it is assumed that it happened 2 days (2014-04-07) before it was reported on 2014-04-09.

title: Boko Haram Attacks, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a village and killed 22 people. The attack was carried out on a cattle market day when they shot sporadically.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Zamfara
description: Cattle rustlers killed some 215 people during a meeting. This was a second attack in a short period. The meeting was meant to address security challenges pin the state.

title: Boko Haram Kills 20, Yobe
description: Boko Haram insurgents attacked a Mosque and killed 20 worshippers. However, some reports stated that the event took place in the village and not in a mosque.

title: Herdsmen Kills 6, Taraba
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some villages and killed 6 people. Several settlements in the affected villages were burnt down.

title: Boko Haram vs Travellers, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents blocked a highway and killed 7 people that included some innocent passengers and drivers.

title: Army vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 50 Fulani herdsmen were killed during a shoot out with soldiers that were deployed to the area.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 4 suicide bombers, 2 other suspected terrorists and 15 civilians died during a foiled terrorist attack on NNPC facility. 3 cars laden with Improvised Explosive Devices exploded when soldiers fired at them and killed the bombers.

title: Protesters, Kaduna
description: 2 protesting youths who insisted on perpetrating a jungle justice against some Fulani arm smugglers were shot dead by soldiers. About 24 Fulani herdsmen were arrested with weapons in connection with the crime.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 4 farmers were killed by a group of marauders.
place: Tse Getim and Uzer villages, Tombo ward.

title: Boko Haram Recruite Men, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents killed 4 youths while trying to forcefully recruit them as members of the sect.
place: Yasku village close to Alagarno, located south of Jakana.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: 107 people were killed in separate attacks by some Fulani herdsmen. The assailants numbering over 300 came in 2 batches. Some of the assailants were dressed in military uniforms. The date of the incident was not given but it is assumed that it happened 2 days before it was reported.

title: Boko Haram Detainees, FCT (Abuja)
description: 21 Boko haram detainees in a prison were shot dead by DSS operatives during an attempted jail break. The insurgents had overpowered a guard and seized his riffle.

title: Boko Haram 4, Borno
description: Boko haram terrorists in a motorcycles attacked a village and killed 4 people. The attackers had earlier issued a threat letter to the village head early in the month, asking the residents to vacate the village.

title: Gunmen, Benue
description: 19 people were killed when gunmen attacked a village. There have been several killings in the area by suspected Fulani herdsmen.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Adamawa
description: Military troops engaged Boko Haram sect members in a gun duel. 4 of the insurgents were killed.

title: Gunmen Attack, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen shot 3 school children of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Ottonna, killing Precious Ottonna and the driver instantly.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: The General Officer Commanding the Tiv militia group, O. Orwamga, and others were killed during attacks carried out by some Fulani herdsmen. There were foams in the victim's mouth, which suggested that they might have been killed with a chemical weapon.

title: Kingship Tussle, Ogun
description: 4 people including Chief Amodu, Baba Sotinyo and Mosuru Ogunseye were killed during a kingship crisis between Oba Fatai Alani Matanmi and Oba Lasisi Aremu Ogunseye. This event is backdated by 2 weeks as it was reported in the paper.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bombing, Borno
description: The Volkswagen saloon car of 2 suicide bombers rammed unto a police highway patrol van, killing 5 officers and 3 civilians.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Benue
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked some villages and killed no fewer than 25 persons. The evil operation was carried out early morning.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: A soldier lost his life when military troops over-ran some Boko Haram camps around Mandara mountains and Sambisa forests.
place: Around Mandara Mountains and Sambisa Forests.

title: Cattle Rustlers, Plateau
description: 7 cattle rustlers were killed during a shoot-out with some Fulani herdsmen. A youth was also shot dead by members of the Special Task Force (STF) during the attack.

title: Tiv vs Fulani, Benue
description: 52 people were reported killed in a clash between Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Taraba
description: 7 people were killed during an attack carried out on a village by some Fulani herdsmen. Several houses were also burnt in the process.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: The Army killed 18 Boko Haram insurgents in a shoot-out with members of the sect. The actual date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report, it is assumed that the incident happened 2 days (2014-03-23) before it was reported on 2014-03-25.

title: Boko Haram Bombs Market, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect members detonated a bomb in a market, killing no fewer than 29 people.

title: Boko Haram Attack Passengers, Borno
description: 2 passengers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents after they launched a fresh roadside attack on travelers. Several passengers had been killed by terrorists who usually ambushed their vehicles.

title: Fighter Jet, Borno
description: 5 civilians were killed when a military fighter jet targeting suspected Boko Haram members attacked a village with explosives. Another source reported 10 deaths.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 30 Boko Haram insurgents were reportedly killed by Special forces of the Nigerian Army. The insurgents were moving in 15 trucks loaded with fighters to attack a village when they ran out of luck as they were ambushed by the troops (See IBD002281).

title: Boko Haram Kills 27, Borno
description: 27 people were killed by suspected members of the Boko Haram. The insurgents attacked 2 communities and killed many residents.
place: Fulatari and Kanumburi wards of Gamboru town.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 40 Boko Haram insurgents were ambushed and killed by special forces of the Nigerian Army when the insurgents were on their way to attack a village (See IBD002280).

title: Fulani open fire at a bus, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen kill four people (Gyang Pius, Markus Davou, Yohanna Bature and Monday Kimtong) travelling in a bus.

title: Fulani vs Eggon, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen fight with Eggon farmers, after Eggon youths retaliate the death of a member of their community. Death toll: 1 Eggon, 5 Fulani

title: Boko Haram kill Police Woman, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill a female police officer (Sarah Mala) a catholic and JTF informant. They slit her throat at her residence (see event PAR010662).

title: Farmers vs Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 16 Agatu farmers were killed by Fulani herdsmen in a reprisal attack over the killing of their people.

title: Raid in two communities, Zamfara
description: Unknown gunmen raid two bordering villages, killing 10 persons. engaged in the subhi (morning prayers). Fulanis herdsmen may be behind these attacks.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked farmers in their farms, wounded a young man and raped women and girls. 5 of them (Fulani) were killed and their camps were burnt.

title: Boko Haram Terrorists bomb military checkpoint, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be terrorists ambush troops deployed in the area. Seven security operatives and five gunmen were killed during the encounter. According to the Independent, 13 Boko Haram members and one soldier were killed.

title: Communal Clash Claims 4, Kaduna
description: Many people were feared dead in a communal clash between Fulani herdsmen and Gwari inhabitants over a land dispute. During the clash, a traditional ruler, Dr. Sa'ad Usman was seriously injured. It was reported that many people were killed, but the actual number was not given. Based on the report, we assumed about 5 persons were killed.

title: JTF vs. Boko Haram in Yobe
description: JTF (Operation Restore Order III) kill four suspected Boko Haram members. During the gunduel, one JTF looses his life. Four AK47, one double barrel gun, 16 magazines, 380 rounds of ammunition, two gas cylinders and several IED making materials are recovered.

title: Prison, police post, School and governor's lodge attacks in Adamawa
description: Unknown gunmen attack the prison before setting the Divisional Police Station and the government Education Authority Complex and the Governor's Lodge ablaze. 20 persons are killed. Out of the 35 inmates freed, police re-arrest 11 of them.

title: Boko Haram attack a village, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill 15 villagers in their homes. Among the victims, a Police Traffic Warden and children. The incident happened in a village located between Baga Motor Park and Maimalari Military Barracks on Baga road. More people were killed in Telari (as reported by Daily Trust, on Dec 29)
place: Musari village on outskirts of Maiduguri.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (15 ) , The Nation (15 ) , Vanguard (15 ) , Daily Trust (18 )

title: Boko Haram Killed 7 Civilians, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill seven persons.

title: Boko Haram member killed, Yobe
description: JTF kill a Boko Haram member during an encounter. Other suspects escape, injured. Items recovered include five ak 47 rifles, 211 rounds of ammunition and ten magazines. A Mitsubishi Canter truck, IEDs materials, medical supplies and police uniform.

title: Boko Haram bomb factory, Kaduna
description: A bomb factory was destroyed by JTF after they receive an alert. Five Boko Haram sect members were killed. On the scene 20 rolls of bomb detonating cords, Mark 4 rifles and pump action rifles were recovered.

title: Security guard, Kaduna
description: A security guard in ABUTH is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Ogun
description: Fulani herdsmen invaded a border town and killed 2 people who prevented their cattle from grazing on their farmlands.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Ogun
description: Rampaging Fulani herdsmen invaded a community and killed a teacher identified as Yomi Alade. The victim was a teacher in the community high school when he was killed.

title: Chief Murdered, Delta
description: Chief Emmanuel Chukwudi was murdered by unknown gunmen. However, a prominent politician in the community, Chief Beedoff Odumosor, was implicated in the murder case and arrested by the police (see IBD002624).

title: Two nigerian killed, French engineer abducted, Katsina
description: 30 heavily armed men of Ansaru group storm the residence of expatriates, contractors of Vergnet SA, (French renewable energy company). A neighbor and security guard are killed as a French engineer (Francis Collomb) is kidnapped. When they flee the kidnappers bomb the police station. According to Francis Collomp, 2 policemen and 1 fifteen years old boys are actually killed by the group. Francis Collomb will manage to escape on his own. See: Collomp, Francis [2015], L’évasion, Paris, XO éditions, 302p.
place: Rimi is 25 km from Katsina. Vergnet is working on a wind project in Katsina
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , Daily Champion (2 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (3 )

title: Boko Haram attack military post , Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members shoot at soldiers guarding GSM telecom masts, one of them dies. They also attack a primary school.
place: Chezcon hotel area, school at Bolori ward.

title: Ward Head, Brother, 3 others killed by Boko Haram, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill simultaneously a ward Head, his brother, a mason and two policemen living not far.
place: the five victims are killed around 9 pm when most people are indoors. Pompomarin Gomari area

title: Boko Haram attack police station, Yobe
description: Gunmen, suspected to Boko Haram attack a police station and a branch of Unity Bank before attempting to attack the emir’s palace (Emir of Fika, Alhaji Muhammadu Abali Ibn Muhammadu Idrissa) at about 3.00 a.m. A DPO iwas killed. JTF and police launch a repelled action, killing 13 suspects. This incident is possibly linked to the Boko Haram attack in Kano, January 2012, which was led by 45 combatants coming from Maiduguri (PAR8952). 5 of them were arrested in Postikum on their way back to Maiduguri. A commando liberated them according to private sources in Maiduguri.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, political issue, religious issue

title: Boko Haram attack State official, Borno
description: A Borno State official (Peter Hamidu) was trailed and killed at his mechanical workshop. The victim was member of the State Agricultural Development Programme.
place: Ruwan Zafi ward, on Dikwa Road

title: ANPP Member, Kano
description: A lawmaker, ANPP member of the Kano State House Assembly representing Gaya constituency (Danladi Isa Kademi), is murdered by unknown gunmen on motorbike. He was the former ALGON chairman, former chairman of Gaya LGA. The killers (Ibrahim Lawal 24 and Alhaji Sale Kura, 54) are paraded by police on January 02.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Alhaji Yahaya Mamuda popularly called 'Malam Malam' was shot dead by Boko haram insurgents during an attack on an eatery. He was shot dead when he attempted to escape from the insurgents.

title: Boko Haram murder blind man, Borno
description: A blind man accused by Boko Haram to be an informant working with JTF was murdered in presence of his family.

title: JTF kill Boko Haram subcommanders, Borno
description: JTF kill four sub-commanders of Boko Haram sect in different parts of the capital city. Two were experts in manufacturing IEDs. Arms and assorted ammunitions were recovered, including IED gas cylinders. Two soldiers were wounded.
place: Sabon Gari Sabon, Layin Gwange, Dala Sajeri, Sulemanti areas

title: Gunduel between Boko Haram and JTF, Borno
description: Boko Haram members, riding a tricycle attack a JTF outpost leading to a gun duel. Four terrorists and a security agent were killed.

title: Boko Haram attack police station, Borno
description: 50 gunmen chanting God is great (in Arabic) bomb a police station with IEDs. 2 policemen were killed.
place: Gamborou/Ngala, border town with Chad Republic

title: Boko Haram Commander, sub comanders, Borno
description: JTF and the police Force Dog kill a Boko Haram commander, Abdul Kareem Ibrahim and two of his sub commanders.

title: Boko Haram attack three churches, Borno
description: Suspected 50 Boko Haram members attack churches and slit the throat of civilians inside their homes, chanting Allahu Akbar. Then they set the houses on fire. Also see event in PAR010507

title: Boko Haram raid a community, Borno
description: After Boko Haram raid a community at the eastern border between Nigeria and the Niger Republic, killing six persons, five Christians and a Muslim policeman. All the villagers flee, their homes are totally destroyed.
place: Attack at Ghashagar, the villagers take refuge near Diffa

title: Boko Haram attack several official spots, Borno
description: Boko Haram attack Rann, the headquarters of Kala Balge. Five policemen were killed (including Corporal Emmanuel Kwaya, Ishaku Sam, Yahaya Mohammed). The gunmen carted away rifles from the police station. They attack the official resident of the Caretaker Committee Chairman, Central Primary School and Government Lodge. They destroy telecommunication mast (MTN, Glo and Airtel).

title: Suspected Boko Haram attack SARS detention facility in FCT
description: Gunmen attack FEDSARS detention facility and free 30 detainees. Two policemen and five civilians are killed in the ensuing gunduel.

title: Ex ANPP boss, Alhaji Tar Kusurambe, Borno
description: Former ANPP boss, Alhaji Tar Kusurambe is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: District head Mallam Zanna Mulima, Bauchi
description: Zanna Mulima, district head of Gudumbali is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: JTF, Boko Haram cross fire, Borno
description: A gunbattle between security forces and suspected Boko Haram insurgents led to the death of a soldier, an immigration officer, three Boko Haram members and many civilians. A resident saw 20 bodies on the ground. More than 40 persons were arrested.

title: Boko Haram attack the border, Borno
description: As Boko Haram attack a border town, five policemen and five civilian were killed.

title: BH kill Defense Corps personnel, one other, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill NDSC personnel (Mallam Shettima) in presence of his family and a resident.

title: Boko Haram kill five in Borno
