description: Boko Haram burnt the home of one Joel Temai and attacked several residences. During that attack, they slit the throats of at least five persons, mostly children. The assailants struck five houses 7 hours later and killed additional 7 victims.

title: BH kill 5, Taraba
description: Five people are killed by Boko Haram trying to attack a church.
sources_of_information: This Day (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Daily Champion (3 ) , Daily Trust (10 )

title: BH kill retired clergy, Borno
description: Boko Haram murder Reverend Ilaisha Kabura, 70, from COCIN Church in presence of his family.

title: BH Commander, Borno
description: A Boko haram Commander for the North-East and North-West of Maiduguri (Ibn Saleh Ibrahim) and his lieutnant are killed by JTF. Three weeks ago they killed General Mamman Shuwa.

title: BH kill traders, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill three Ibgbo traders.
place: inside their respective shops, Bulabulin ward of Biafra area

title: Gunmen attack communities, Kaduna
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen kill six members of a family.

title: Extra-judicial killings, Borno
description: Soldiers arrest 400 people suspected to support Boko Haram. Only 70 allegedly survive. No precise date given in November 2012.

title: BH kill university don, director in Ministry of Land, Borno
description: Boko Haram launch an attack, killing a university don (Alhaji Babagana Kola) and a director in the ministry of Land and Survey (Mallam Yerima).
place: Umarari and Galadima wards of the metropolis

title: Suspected Boko Haram bomb a market, Borno
description: A blast hits the cattle market, killing a repairer of refrigerators at his workshop.

title: Gunmen kill 5 in Yobe
description: Vulcanisers are killed by unknown gunmen.
place: Unguwar Kolori Gaidam, at their residence

title: Chinese nationals, Borno (expatriates)
description: Two Chinese construction workers are ambushed and killed by unknown gunmen.

title: JTF kill Boko Haram members, Yobe
description: JTF raid one of Boko Haram’s hideouts, kill four members, arrest four others.

title: Gunmen on rampage, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members torch a school and kill two policemen.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Gunmen on rampage, Kano
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill three persons including a policeman.

title: Retired general, Borno
description: A retired Nigerian General, Mohammed Shuwa, (a key figure in the 1960s civil war) , is murdered by unknown gunmen at his home in the restive northeastern city of Maiduguri, the military said.

title: Ex associate to governor shot in Borno
description: An associate of the former Governor Modu Sheriff of Borno State, (Alhaji Mustapha Fulawama), his driver (Alhaji Labaran) and one other person are murdered by unknown gunmen.
place: in front of his residence at Polo GRA

title: Zamfara robbery
description: Twenty people are killed and two others are badly hurt by a gang of bandits who raid a village.

title: Boko Haram kill headmaster, others in Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members cut the throat of the Headmaster of a School, Musa Magazai in presence of his family, and one Mallam Galtamari, along with his two children.

title: Policemen murdered in Plateau
description: Policemen on duty are shot dead by unknown gunmen. Two other policemen are injured during the attack.

title: JTF Kill Innocent Residents, Borno
description: JTF is accused of killing 15 boys playing football, by a Senator (Ahmad Zannah, Borno Central) himself accused to shelter a Boko Haram commander. Another incident that was reported by the same source had it that 30 civilians were killed when some soldiers were killed by Boko haram explosion. The soldiers avenged the death of the commander by invading the community and killing several civilians, an accusation they refuted. See event in PAR010250.
place: playing football on a field in the city
sources_of_information: The Punch (15 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (15 )

title: BH hideout raid, Borno
description: During a raid, JTF kill four Boko Haram members at their hideout and recover explosives. According JTF spokesman in Borno State, Lieutenant Colonel Sagir Musa, the following items are recovered: large quantity of assorted IED materials, one AK47 rifle, a box filled with charms, gas cylinders in various sizes, car key remote control switches for detonating IEDs, two bags of fertilizer, one generator and welding equipment.
place: IED factory at Gwange, Sabon Layi area

title: Bus attack, Bauchi
description: Fulani herdsmen attack a bus, killing four people, burnt to death.

title: Boko Haram kill son of former LGA secretay, Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill Abdulrahaman, son of the former Yobe State Permanent Secretary for Local Government and Chieftaincy Affairs, Alhaji Mustapha Sheriff. The victim is attacked a market where he went to buy a ram for the Sallah celebration.

title: Boko Haram multiple attacks in Borno (expatriate)
description: Suspected Boko Haram members launch different attack in the state capital. A Chinese construction worker is shot dead, along with two other persons. Three soldiers and ten civilians are killed too.
place: the Chinese expatriate worker killed in the morning at his company's construction site (CGC), Lagos street axis. The eight civilians include a pharmacist, automobile technician and some traders. The pharmacist is killed at Old Maiduguri, five persons are killed at Bayan Quarters and two others at Abbaganaram area; The soldiers are killed at a checkpoint

title: Boko Haram multiple attacks in Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members launch differents attacks. Three soldiers and ten civilians are killed
place: Eight civilians including a pharmacist, automobile technician and some traders. The pharmacist is killed at Old Maiduguri, five persons are killed at Bayan Quarters and two others at Abbaganaram area; The soldiers are killed at a checkpoint

title: Vigilantes vice chairman, robber, Kano
description: Local vigilante kill a suspected robber, (Bako Isiyaka), during a gun battle between his 20-man gang. The armed bandits had been carrying attacks on market days in the area. The vice chairman of the vigilante group in Doguwa Local Government Area (Adamu Sabo) is killed too.

title: Army vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: 6 people were killed by JTF operatives over the murder of their colleagues, including a commander, in an IED reportedly planted by Boko Haram. It is assumed that no fewer than 2 soldiers were killed in the explosion.

title: Boko Haram suspects, Potsikum, Yobe
description: According to Amnesty International, 1 Boko Haram suspect, Shuaibu, dies because of ill-treatment in military custody at the "rest house" in Potsikum in October 2012. No precision of date.

title: District head, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill Alhaji Mala Kaka, the Shettima Kanurebe and district head of Gwange in Maiduguri metropolis while attending to a guest (brother-in-law of former minister of the FCT, Engineer Abba Gana) in his house. The guest is injured.
place: Fezzan, a densely populated area not far from the Shehu's palace in Maiduguri.

title: Abductee dies in kidnapper's den, Rivers
description: One of the three persons abducted by unknown gunmen dies in the kidnappers’ den. The development comes just as the State Commissioner for Power, Augustine Wokocha is freed. The deceased (Richard Ihua-Maduenyi), a College director, dies following lack of medical attention. Ransom is paid before Wokocha, kidnapped on October 13, 2012, is freed.

title: Fulani attack villagers in Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen clash with Berom, leading to the death of at least 14 persons (including an old woman). Four more people are killed on the third day of the clash. The reconstruction of a portion of a building on a praying ground is also a source of conflict between Hausa (Izala sect) and indigenes. Berom youth demolish the repaired portion leading to a brawl (October 11)
place: Killings at Ranghol in Sopp ward, Dallyam village in Tahoss District and Lotton village (2 victims) in Jol ward, family of 8 killed in Makera, grandmother kille in Sara village. On the third day, two people are killed in Rakung in Riyom, while another two in Gurando near Kura Falls; all the incidents happening simultaneously.
sources_of_information: This Day (14 ) , Vanguard (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (14 ) , The Punch (18 )

title: Army avenge the death of a soldier, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members hit a JTF vehicle with an IED. The explosion kills the leader of the patrol team which leads to reprisals. Soldiers burn at least 50 houses, shops and vehicles in the area. 31 persons are killed (including the Lieutenant and terrorists). The victims, mostly civilians were burnt inside their houses.
sources_of_information: The Punch (31 ) , Other newpapers 1 (31 ) , Daily Trust (31 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (70 )

title: Gunmen kill two pub customers, Kaduna
description: Two people are killed by unknown gunmen in a pub.

title: JTF kill BH sect's leader, 30 others in Yobe
description: Field commander of the fundamentalist sect Boko Haram, Abubakar Shekau, aka Bakaka, is allegedly shot dead by JTF along with 30 other members. Ten others are arrested.

title: Ghanaian, Borno
description: A source reports the death of a Ghanaian, by suspected Boko Haram members.

title: BH kill Chinese, Borno (Expatriates)
description: Three Chinese construction workers (cooks) were killed by Boko Haram as they return from the local market where they had gone to buy meat and other items.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , This Day (3 )

title: BH kill police corporal in Kaduna
description: Boko Haram kill a police Corporal attached to the Area Command.

title: JTF kill two gunmen, Borno
description: JTF kill two gunmen, members of the sme group, few aftrer Abaganaram massacre.

title: Massacre at university of Adamawa
description: The Federal Polytechnic is attacked as elections of the leaders of the students' union are hold two days before. Gunmen invade the home of dozens of students and butcher them. Several victims were candidates to these elections but the attack may also be linked to radical islamists Boko Haram or to ethnical problems. A survivor reports the death of 40 persons the first day and 22 others the following days from injuries or from fright.
place: Hostel where the students live, near the campus of the university
sources_of_information: The Punch (62 ) , The Nation (40 ) , The Guardian (48 ) , This Day (46 ) , New Nigerian (46 )

title: BH vs. JTF, Kaduna
description: An early morning raid on a hide-out of Boko Haram members leads to a crossfire between the sect and a joint operation by soldiers and security agencies leaving two members of the sect dead.

title: Police, Niger
description: Two policemen are gunned down by unknown gunmen in a moving car which sped off immediately after the shooting,
place: at Kpakungu Roundabout in Minna; the victims are taken to hospital, where they later die.

title: Bomb factory, Kaduna
description: A bomb factory used to manufacture and store IEDs, allegedly belonging Boko Haram explodes, killing three of its members. It happens as JTF was storming the building. 10 cars and five houses are destroyed in the explosion. A leader of the sect, Sheik Hussaini Mohammed, escapes.

title: Boko Haram commander, Adamawa
description: Joint army-police security (Operation Restore Sanity) kills a key commander of Boko Haram sect (Abubakar Yola, aka Abu Jihad).

title: JTF kill 35 Boko Haram suspects, Yobe
description: Men of JTF (Cordon and Search operation) kill 35 BH members and arrest 60 others in the State capital. Guns, explosives, ammunition, army and police uniforms, mobile telephone SIM cards, vehicle number plates, and drugs are reportedly seized from the sect’s hideout. Following the shootout, JTF said the curfew in Damaturu and Potiskum has been relaxed in both towns.
place: gun battle apparently taking place in the Kandahar, Pawari and Pawari Cemetery areas of the city.

title: BH kill medical directors' son in Borno
description: Boko Haram sect, storm the clinic of the Chief Medical Director of Umaru Shehu Ultramodern Hospital, (Doctor. Samuel Ville), killing his eldest son (Emmanuel) aged 26.

title: Boko Haram terrorists commanders , Borno
description: Top commanders coordinating activities of the Boko Haram sect in Mubi and Yola (Adamawa state) and in Yobe state, are killed by JTF.

title: Prison Controller (Alhaji Ibrahim Jarma) and Warder, Bauchi
description: A former a Controller General of Prisons (Alhaji Ibrahim Jarma) is attacked by unknown gunmen. One prison warder is killed in the process. Ibrahim Jarma later dies from his gunshots.

title: Boko Haram spokesman Abu Qaqa , Kano
description: JTF kill the spokesman of Boko Haram (Abu Qaqa). Two members of the sect are arrested.
place: Abu Qaqa was driving from Gombe, trailed by a joint team of army and SSS, he is intercepted and killed at a checkpoint at Mariri

title: NSCDC (Ismaila Yerima) and family killed in Kano
description: Unknown gunmen kill an intelligent officer attached to NCDC, his wife ((Aisha) three year old child and a physically challenged younger brother.

title: Gunmen invade a community in Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen storm a community killing at least three people (including an Igbo grocery trader)
place: Malali, a suburb of Kaduna metropolis, Shop of the trader located along Ghana Road

title: Army kill robbers, Imo
description: Soldiers kill four bandits at a popular ground, and apprehend 50 persons.
place: Opposite Ghost College near Assumpta Catholic Cathedral

title: JTF kills seven BH member in a gunfire in Borno
description: Boko Haram members are killed in reprisals after they attack several patrol vehicles. JTF arrest 13 terrorists.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Flood in Niger kill 2 Fulani herdsmen, Niger
description: Two Fulani herdsmen are killed by flood following excess water in hydro electric dam.

title: BH kill 16 in Yobe
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect kill 16 people includiing the Yobe state government protocol officer Mallam Adamu. They also destroy several mobile communication masts (around 24) at various base stations of Airtel, Glo and Etisalat in Potiskum and Damaturu with IEDs.
place: various base stations of Airtel, Glo and Etisalat
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Cleric, Sokoto
description: A popular islamic cleric, Malam Liman Danda Birkitawa is killed by unknown gunmen. Two other members of Liman’s family, also shot in the attack, are injured.

title: BH multiple targets in Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram attack and burn the police headquarters, several vehicles, the Cocin church and the residence of the Unit Commandant of the Army. One Police Sergeant and two civilians are reportedly killed.

title: Military intelligence officer
description: Suspected Boko Haram member ambush and kill a military intelligence officer.

title: IED attack, Borno
description: JTF kill five suspected members of Jama’atu Ahlis Sunnati Lidda’awati Wal Jihad (Boko Haram) after a blast targeting the police patrol. Some shops aroung burst into flames. Two soldiers die too.
place: blast in Ruwan Zafi area, Bola junction JTF Operation Restore Order patrol team

title: BH kill three in Borno
description: Member of the Islamic sect Boko Haram kill three persons in two separate attacks

title: Bomber explodes, Borno
description: An IED concealed in a wheel barrow explodes, killing the bomber, a suspected Boko Haram member.
place: West End, Ramat Square General Area

title: 20 slaughtered in Yobe
description: Crimes are reported in the state capital in the last few days. Boko Haram claims responsibility for several killings.
place: Worst hit areas include Ajari, Powari, Gwange, Nasarawa and Jerusalem wards respectively.

title: CBN staff, Imo
description: A retired senior official of the CBN Bank is shot by unknown gunmen an later dies at hospital. During the operation, his wife is abducted.
place: in front of the New Market, Douglas Road

title: Community mosque police, Borno
description: Two suspected Boko Haram members trail and kill a policeman attached to a community mosque.

title: Residents kill one bandit in Yobe
description: The residents, victims of the Gashua floods kill one of the Boko Haram members who attack a bank. The policeman they shoot at dies during the following night from injuries.
place: Gashua attack of the Nigerian Agricultural and Cooperative Bank in Sabon Gari ward of the town.

title: Boko Haram attack a mosque, Borno
description: An Islamic cleric and a worshipper are shot dead inside a mosque during the morning prayer.

title: Boko Haram kill one at a Mosque , Borno
description: Suspected BH members shoot dead a member of the BETC council, (Zanna Kaselama).
place: At the community mosque during a night prayer

title: Old man killed in error in community crisis, Lagos
description: Gunmen kill a 60 years man (James Ariyomoye) in error, mistaking him with the uncle of a youth in detention camp who should be freed after payment of a bail. The nephew (Shaggy) was involved in a community crisis over leadership in which 8 people were killed.

title: Two factions of young thugs clash in Yobe
description: A clash between Boko Haram and fake BH militants (acting under the aegis of the Islamic sect) leaves nine persons dead.

title: JTF vs. BH, Borno
description: JTF, engaged in a gunbattle with members of Boko Haram, kill 20 islamists in their hideouts. One soldier is killed in the shootout.

title: JTF vs. BH, Yobe
description: JTF, engaged in a gunbattle with members of Boko Haram, kill 2 insurgents.

title: Policemen, Bauchi
description: Two policemen patrolling near a police check point are shot by unknown gunmen and later die at hospital.
place: Gubi village along Ningi-Kano road. The policemen die in ATBUTH

title: BH bomb police station, Sokoto
description: The Islamic sect, Jama’atu Ahlis Sunnah Lidda’awati Wal Jihad, (Boko Haram) attack a police Station, killing six policemen, including a Superintendent of Police and the terrorist himself.
place: on Shagari, near the residence of fomer President Shehu Shagari

title: BH kill a cleric, Borno
description: After he is warned to vacate his residence, a cleric (Ali Samari) is killed by Boko Haram. The deaceased was also a wristwatch repairer.
place: trailed and killed at his residence

title: Suicide bomb attack at checkpoint, Yobe
description: A suicide car bomber attack a military checkpoint, killing six soldiers (JTF) and 2 civilians. The attacker dies too.
sources_of_information: Tide News (9 ) , The Guardian (9 ) , The Nation (9 )

title: Oil platform attack, Rivers (Offshore)
description: Gunmen storm a Dutch oil industry vessel off the coast, killing two Nigerian navy sailors and kidnapping four foreigners. The vessel (JASCON 33 a crane barge) belongs to Sea Truck Oil Servicing Company based in Rotterdam. Those kidnapped are from Indonesia, Iran, Malaysia and Thailand. One source reports the death of one of the foreigners.

title: Police Inspector, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen kill a Police Inspector (Abdullahi Shehu Itas).
place: in front of his house along Zango area, a suburb of Bauchi metropolis.

title: JTF raid BH hideouts after several attacks, Borno
description: Members of the Islamist sect, Boko Haram launch several attacks in the state capital. JTF responds by raiding the hideouts of the sect, killing 2. 26 terrorists are arrested while different arms are recovered. The same day, BH attack a patrol of JTF who kill 2 terrorists; Total casuaties: 11 persons (7 civilians and 4 BH members).
place: 1°BH attack homes of civilians at Gwange (2 victims), Ajilari (3 victims), Bulumkutu (1death) and Gomari (1death). 2°JTF raid the hideouts of the sect at Biafra Bulabin, Kasuwan Shanu and GRA where they kill two terrorists. 3° BH attack a JTF patrol at Shehuri.

title: BH attack police station in Borno
description: Members of the Jamatul ahlis Sunnah lid Daawa wal Jihad aka Boko Haram, attack a police station in the headquarters of the Lga killing four policemen. They set the building ablaze and also burn the local government secretariat. Many are injured.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: Vanguard (4 ) , Independent (4 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (5 )

title: Gunmen kill two, Borno
description: An airport tower operator, (Joe) is killed while conveying his children to school. One hour after unknown gunmen kill a patent medecine dealer in the same area.

title: BH kill policemen in Bauchi
description: Boko Haram kill three policemen (two inspectors and a corporal) on patrol. The fourth escapes in the bush with his rifle.

title: Fulani Herdsmen Attack, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen grazed on Tiv farms and when challenged killed about 35 people. Properties were also destroyed.

title: Cameraman, hotel staff, trader, retiree shot in Borno
description: Four persons are killed by gunmen: 1/a cameraman with the Borno State Ministry of Information, Mallam Abubakar Mohammed, around Customs area; 2/ a worker with the Maiduguri International Hotel at a notorious spot of the Boko Haram sect close to his home; 3/ two other victims are a panel beater (Baba Ayo) and a retired civil servant in front of his home.
place: 1/Customs area 2/ Bulumkutu, 3/ Baga market and Gwange

title: BH attack a market in Borno
description: Boko Haram members launch an attack at Monday Market, killing four traders, injuring several others.

title: BH attack JTF in Borno
description: Boko Haram members attack a military patrol van, killing two officers.
place: near Kofa Biyu on Sir Kashim Ibrahim Way

title: Twins slaughtered in Yobe
description: Unidentified persons (suspected to belong to Boko Haram) kill twins, 15-years old. The same day, a school is burnt.
place: Nasarawa ward. Yobe Children's Academy is burnt (30 classrooms)

title: BH attack a community in Kaduna
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attack a village located on the outskirts of the capital city. The Head of the village escape as the gunmen reach his residence. Following the violence, the Emir of Katsina on the Federal Government calls for the demolition of a settlement of Gonin-Gora in Kaduna South sheltering some tribes who commit the crimes in Kaduna.
place: Mahuta village. Gonin-Gora is a mini-Nigeria with people of different Nigerian ethnic nationalities such as the Gbagyi, the Igbo, the Igala, the Yoruba, the Tiv, the Nupe, the Atyap, the Efik, the Ijaw, the Calabari, the Ham-Jaba people, the Itsekiri, the Uroboh, the Idoma, the Bachama, the Adara people, the Bajju, the Zurus and the Hausa Fulani Christians.”

title: Lebanese, Kano (expatriate)
description: A 26-year-old Lebanese (Osaman Hamdam), storekeeper of a plastic company dealing in mobile phones, is murdered by six masked gunmen as he had no money to give them. The dead victim was about to marry in Lebanon the following week.
place: Sharada Industrial area of the metropolis

title: Fulani herdsmen massacre many in Plateau
description: The Senator (Gyang Dantong) representing Plateau North District, is murdered along with other persons (Gyang Fulani, the majority leader of the State House of Assembly) when gunmen attack a mass burial for the victims of Saturday's raid. That raid was lauched by suspected Fulani herdsmen in nine Christian villages where more than a hundred people, mostly women and children, are slaughtered and burnt. The disputed fertiles lands oppose Fulani nomads and indigenes for a long time. JTF repell the attack and kill several Fulanis all dressed in military uniforms. Toll on Saturday: more than 64 + 21 assaillants killed by JTF (Operation Safe Haven). Toll on Sunday: 20. On 11th, two more villages are attacked are attacked (45 houses burnt): 140 more people are killed, lying unburied. (New toll:140 added to total). According Red Cross 5,500 persons are displaced, and 25 villages affected by the massacre.
place: Nine villages in Barkin Ladi are attacked (Kkakuruk, Kuzen, Ngyo, Kogoduk, Ruk, Dogo, Nyar) One village in Riyom is attacked (Maseh) Tse and Shong attack on 11th Mourners are murdered during funerals : Massey village in Riyom
sources_of_information: The Nation (244 ) , This Day (244 ) , The Punch (240 ) , PM News (344 ) , Independent (240 )

title: General Sylvester Iruh killed along the road in Ogun
description: Brigadier General Sylvester Iruh (ex Commander, Army Records, Lokoja, Kogi) is killed on his way home after attending funerals, He is attacked with arrows and daggers by two men who came from under the bridge during a breakdown, as he is about to change a faulty tyre. At least four other persons of the convoy are injured. The attackers who steal money and mobile phones from their victims, reportedly, are carrying sticks like Fulani herdsmen nomads with bows and arrows in their bags.
place: on the Long Bridge on Lagos-Ibadan Expressway (Werewa)
sources_of_information: The Punch (1 ) , PM News (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Police post, bank attack in Adamawa
description: Boko Haram bomb a Police post (they throw four different IEDs) where three policemen die and attack a commercial bank (no casualty).
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Ethnic clash over sex worker, Ogun
description: A bloody clash follows the dispute between a Yoruba and an Hausa over a sex worker (Other source reports a conflict between two Yoruba people). More than 30 vehicles are destroyed. 3 men are killed including at least one Yoruba. 200 Yoruba demonstrate on the streets when the crisis erupts. APC station in front of Dangote cement factory to safeguard the company from attack. Over 40 persons are injured.
place: in Ibese community (Yewa North); all the shops in the Oja Oba Dangote community market are looted.

title: Ethnical crisis, Bauchi
description: After Hausa Fulani shoot three persons along the road, members of Sayawa community slaughter 13 cows belonging to Yunusa Sale (Hausa) community. Toll: 2 people dead. Despite the relocation of the HQ from Tafawa Balewa to Bununu there is no inter-ethnic peace. The spokesman of the Hausa Fulani community, former Chairman of the Lga (Alhaji Aminu Tukur), complains the theft of the cows and maltreatment of his people by JTF.
place: 13 cows are slaughtered in Lere and in Zwal

title: BH massacre workers in Borno
description: Boko Haram slash the throats of people working at the building site of the new Mosque and Islamic centre. One person survives.
place: Shehu of Borno Central Mosque, Shehu's palace

title: JTF raid BH hideouts, Yobe
description: A combined team of policemen and soldiers raid the hideouts of Boko Haram. During the gunbattle, 2 soldiers, 2 policemen and 3 islamic sect members are killed.
place: Nayinawa Nyanya ward of the metropolis

title: JTF kill BH after police post attack, Yobe
description: Army security forces (JTF) kill four Boko Haram terrorists in the metropolis and arrest undergraduate students at the university. A securiy man of the university is killed. The terrorists earlier had attacked a police post, killing two persons; stray bullets hit a mother and her child.
place: Students arrested at the Federal Polytechnic premises of Damaturu. Police post attacked at Sabon-Fegi ward in the metropolis.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Jailbreak in Yobe
description: Gunmen, suspected to belong to Boko Haram attack a prison and free 40 inmates. According security sources, seven prisoners and one warder are killed. Several gunmen are killed too in the gunbattle but their members cart away the bodies (at least two).

title: Road bandits, Kaduna
description: Motorcyclists travelling from Abuja to Kaduna, divert from the highway for more security but are attacked in a bush path. Four persons are killed and intervention of police saves one.

title: Gunmen kill villagers Plateau
description: Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani herdsmen, ransack a whole Christian village and kill a family of six persons including baby and children.

title: BH kill a NIS officer, Borno
description: I. S., an immigration officer working for the Nigerain Immigration Service (NIS) is killed as entering a mosque for early morning prayers. His family reports to Amnesty International that he was killed by Boko Haram and received threats before his death.

title: Police post attack, Kano
description: Gunmen (with a car and three motorcycles) supected to belong to Boko Haram open fire at a police checkpoint as they were ordered to stop. Policemen repell the attack though one officer is shot dead. IEDs are found inside the vehicle abandonned by the fleeing gunmen.
place: Madobi Roundabout, by Sani Abacha Youth Centre, Dorayi Quarters
sources_of_information: This Day (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Suicide bomber, Bauchi
description: A suicide bomber, belonging to Boko Haram sect, dies after the IED he carries explodes opposite ANPP Secretariat. He had travelled by public transport for more than 393 km with the bomb.
place: Explosion along Gombe road. Dies at Abubakar Tafawa Balewa Hospital

title: Factions of canoe toll collectors clash in Lagos
description: Factions (Ibro or "Downtown Boys" vs Shagi or "Shagi Boys") collecting money for canoe parks and selling sand, clash leading to the death of three persons; many injured. Ibro is the faction of the Baale of Ilaje, Kayode Aiyetiwa, and Shagi is the faction of the son of the former Baale, Segun Opere popularly called Shaggy. The fight starts on 19 June where five persons are killed, on 22, two more dead victims and on 23, three are killed. It is alleged that over 15 persons die in the crisis.
sources_of_information: This Day (3 ) , The Nation (15 ) , The Punch (5 ) , Daily Trust (8 )

title: Security chief, Gombe
description: Unknown gunmen riding commercial tricycle kill the acting Director of Security Matters, Government House in the office of the governor (Adamu Mamman).
place: Kumbiya quarters at the residence of the deceased
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , PM News (1 ) , Daily Champion (1 )

title: Multiple churches bombing, Zaria, Kaduna (2)
description: Suicide bombs allegedly lauched by Boko Haram at three churches in Kaduna and Zaria make 74 dead: Chikun (4 dead) Zaria (3 dead) 9712 Kaduna (71 dead) 9734 Sabon Gari (20 dead, according other sources). Casualties rise to 100 on 20 June.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , This Day (3 ) , PM News (3 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (21 )

title: Multiple churches bombing, Sabon-Gari, Kaduna (3)
description: Multiple suicide bomb attack on three churches by Boko Haram: Other simultaneous bomb attacks on churches in Chikun (4 dead) in Zaria, 3 dead (see event 9733), in Kaduna, 71 dead (see event 9712), Sabon Gari (20 dead). Casualties rise to 100 on 20 June.

title: Suicide bombing at church, Chikun, Kaduna (4)
description: A suicide bomb attack on a church kills four persons. A soldier is among the victims. As youths vandalize mosques and properties belonging to muslims, army kills two protesters. Other simultaneous bomb attacks on churches in Zaria, 3 dead (see event 9733), in Kaduna, 71 dead (see event 9712), Sabon Gari (20 dead). According to NEMA, death toll exceeds 100 on 20 June .
place: Shalom Church International in Trikaniya. The bomb explodes at the premises of the building.

title: Army kill Boko Haram members, Kano
description: JTF kill five BH members, including a woman, in their hideout.

title: Herdsmen Attack, Enugu
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community, killed 1 person and abducted 6 people including a woman.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Other newspaper 2 (1 )

title: Fulanis killed by farmers, Taraba
description: Suspected Bachama farmers from Numan area murder 13 Fulani herdsmen in reprisals for the killing of farmers. The Bachama Socio-cultural group, Pene-Da-Bwatiye, has recently issued ultimatum to Fulani nomads to quit their land.
place: Fulanis are killed while crossing River Benue, in the neighbouring villages of Kana, Bujum, Yitti and Mayo-Lope of Lau

title: Cleric shot in Gombe
description: Unknown gunmen kill a cleric, Mallam Sani Dabanfulani as he was having dinner.
place: at Barunde quarters, at his home

title: Boko Haram kill ex police chief in Kano
description: The Islamist group Boko Haram kill a former DIG (Deputy Inspector General (Abubakar Saleh Ningi). His driver and bodyguard die too in the attack. He was returning from his plastic factory at Sauna Kawaji.

title: Army kill BH members, Borno
description: JTF reportedly kill 16 suspected Boko Haram members. Some unknown source reports that more than 66 persons die.

title: Kidnapped German dies in Kano (expatriate)
description: A German (Raupach Fritz Edgar) kidnapped in January, is killed by his captors during the rescue operation.The captors, members of the Sura Council where holding their meeting (the highest decision making organ of Boko Haram). The German is executed when the abductors notice the presence of JTF forces reportedly unaware of the presence of the expatriate, throwing IED on them. The victim was working with Dantata and Sawoe Construction Company Ltd before his abduction, on January 26. Six kidnappers are also killed in the raid.
place: Danbare area opposite the new campus of Bayero University

title: Boko Haram vs Man, Borno
description: Boko Haram insurgents abducted a 15-year-old boy, Baba Goni and shot his uncle dead. The date of the incident was not reported. However, based on the report it is assumed that it happened 2 years (2012-05-31) before it was reported on 2014-05-31.

title: Attack at a relaxation spot, Kano
description: Gunmen attack customers at Filin Kashu relaxation spot, killing three of them and injuring one other. The attack coincides with the visit of Vice President Namadi Sambo to the family of the late Islamic scholar, Sheikh Mudi Salga. The attackers, suspected to be Boko Haram members were threatening to kill anyone opposed to their "doctrine".
place: Gidan Hamisu Gurgu, Gaida village, Gada Kwanar Cashew in Panshekara, Sharada industrial area
sources_of_information: This Day (3 ) , Vanguard (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )

title: Superintendent of police, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen shoot a policeman (Manu Birma) dead at his residence in the presence of wife and children.

title: Cleric, retired prison guard, Yobe
description: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram kill a Muslim cleric (Usman Muhammed) at his home. Thenin the surroundings, the attackers break the home of a retired prison guard and kill him.

title: Communal clash, Cross River
description: Ikpanaya community of Akwa Ibom State, with the help of Fulani herdsmen invade people of Ntan Obu. They destroy churches and kill over 40 villagers. Four mobile policemen and the village Head of Ntan Obu Ukpe in Eniong are allegedly beheaded. According to the Chairman of Odukpani council, Stephen Asuquo, the remote cause, is the struggle by Ikpanya (in Ibiono, Akwa Ibom) for the land that belongs to the Ntan Obu (Odukpani, in Cross River. That land is fertilized with alluvial products.
place: 2000 indigenes of Ntan Obu are refuging in several communities of Odukpani

title: JTF kill BH member, Borno
description: A Boko Haram member is killed by army forces during a shootout.

title: PRP Chairman, Borno
description: The chairman of the PRP (Alhaji Amodu Gombe) is shot dead by unknown gunmen
place: at Ungawan Yashi area of the state capital

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 1 person was killed and 13 shops and houses were burnt in an explosion reportedly planted by Boko Haram insurgents.

title: Village head, Plateau
description: A village head is killed and several people injured as suspected Fulani herdsmen raid a village, despite the presence of army in the area.

title: Fulani herdsmen attack community, Benue
description: Fulanis and mercenaries attack Tiv community, burning down houses and farms. Whilst 8 people are killed, the traditional ruler of Nagi denounces the nonchalence of the authorities.

title: Attack on a drinking spot, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen riding motorcycle kill three pokers players at a drinking joint, injuring 5 others.

title: Prison officer, Borno
description: An assistant Comptroller of Prisons (Usman Laskarima) is murdered by unknown gunmen as he was chatting with some friends at a relaxing spot.
place: close to his house at Bundum area of the metropolis

title: Director, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen murder an assistant director with the Board of Internal Revenue in the Metropolis after snatching his car. The deceased is allegedly a member of the Shia Islamic movement led by Sheik Ibrahim Elzkzaky.
place: at his residence around Kofar Gadon Kaya area

title: Shiite leader, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen kill Mohammed Ali, a civil servant who was the local leader of the Zaria-based Shiite Islamic Movement of Sayyid Ibrahim Zakzaky. Mohammed Ali was allegedly a former close companion of Mohammed Yusuf, the founder of the Boko Haram sect.

title: Prominent member of BH, Borno
description: JTF kills a prominent member of the Boko Haram sect in the metropolis of the state capital. They arrested 2 persons in the operation.

title: JTF kill one BH member, Borno
description: JTF foils an attack from Boko Haram at a market, killing one suspect, arresting two others. Two members are injured while trying to escape with a tricycle. Two traders of the market are reportedly killed too.

title: Musician, Kogi
description: A popular musician, Yusuf Momoh Jimoh is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: Inspector of Police, Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen kill an Inspector of Police, Tanimu Barde.

title: Wedding, Borno
description: JTF storm a wedding ceremony organised by Boko Haram members. During a shootout, three guests (civilians) are killed.

title: BH kill prison wardens, Borno
description: Boko Haram broke into a prison and set inmates free. Two prison wardens are killed in the raid.

title: Bandits ransack a village, Plateau
description: Armed men attack a village and kill one Titus Tonga.

title: Fulani detainees, Nasarawa
description: Unknown gunmen storm a police station and kill two Fulani nomads detained in the prison's jail. The victims (Umaru Mohammed and Adamu Sule) were arrested by a vigilante group after their cattle were grazing on a farm belonging to a member of the group.

title: Fulani raid communities in Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen and gunmen in military uniforms invade six communities, setting houses ablaze, killing at least 13 villagers.
place: Tahoss, Bangai, Sopp, Angwa Werem, Danjol, Gwom

title: Boko Haram kill Evangelist, Borno
description: An evangelist of Redeemed Christian Church of God is attacked by BH and dies.

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 2 people lost their lives in an explosion that was reportedly planted by Boko Haram. Several houses were burnt.

title: DPO, Enugu
description: Unknown gunmen kill a DPO (Okey Otoedu) during a night patrol.
place: Ojinator along Awka/Oji River old road by a filling station

title: BH Attacks Students, Kano
description: A group of Christian students holding an early morning service were attacked with explosives and gunshots by gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members. About 20 people were reportedly killed during the attack.

title: BH kill Lecturer, Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill a lecturer with Sir Kashim Ibrahim College of Education.

title: Electrician, Yobe
description: An electrician (Nura Muhammad alias OPP) is killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Police inspector, Yobe
description: A police inspector (Ibrahim Mari) is murdered by unknown gunmen.
place: at his house at Gwange ward

title: Boko Haram Explosion, Borno
description: 1 person died in an explosion that was allegedly planted by Boko Haram. 4 houses were burnt in the incident.

title: IED factory explodes, Borno
description: The explosion of a bomb making factory kills five Boko Haram members.

title: JTF kill 2 BH members in Borno
description: JTF kill two Boko Haram members while the gang attempt to attack military posts. They arrest one member, set ablaze a car-wash structure an a shop belonging to the sect and recover arms and ammunitions.
place: Abaganaram ward of the metropolis near the new prison

title: Gunmen kill JTF, Kano
description: A soldier (JTF) in mufti visiting family members, is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: Attack of a community, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attack a village, killing two residents both vigilantes.

title: Shopkeeper, Kano
description: A shop owner is trailed and killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Security man, Kano
description: A night watchman for A S A Nagero Transport is hacked to death by unknown gunmen.
place: at his duty post on the premises of the company

title: Cleric, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members shoot a 92 years cleric dead.

title: BH attack a bakery, Borno
description: Boko Haram members attacked a Kasmi Bread factory, killing seven people on the spot, six civilians and a Custom officer. They drove their car into the building.

title: JTF kill BH in Borno
description: After a tip off, JTF raid the hideouts of Boko Haram sect and kill one of their members. An A K47 rifle and IED's are recovered.
place: security forces raid the hideouts of the sect at Pompomari in the metropolis

title: Trader, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen shoot a trader dead in the Monday Market.

title: BH kill young man in Kaduna
description: A young army applicant is killed by suspected Boko Haram members in front of his house. The victim was waiting for result of his application.
place: Makarfi Road/Makera in Rigasa, a suburb of Kaduna

title: Lecturer, Kaduna
description: A senior lecturer (Basil Makama) with the Department of Estate Management (Nuhu Bamali Polytechnic, Zaria), is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: BH launch an attack in Nigeria-Cameroun border, Borno
description: Three civilians die alongside a police officer and an immigration officer as fundamentalists (Boko Haram) attacks security facilities: a police station, Nigerian Immigration Service (NIS) office and a Customs outpost.
place: Banki, a Nigerian bordering town bordering Cameroon

title: BH kill businessman, Kano (2)
description: Suspected Boko Haram member kill a businessman (Yusuf) as he was parking his car.

title: BH kill businessman, Kano (1)
description: Suspected Boko Haram member kill a businessman (Joshua Emma) at Sabon Gari Market, in front of his house as he was brushing his teeth.
place: in his home at Sharada quarters

title: Ex-Guber aspirant, Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen murder and ex-Guber aspirant (Alhaji Kabiru Muhammad), owner of a petrol station.

title: BH kill Abu Qaqa II, BH spokesman, Kaduna
description: Islamic sect, Boko Haram, Abu Qaqa II (Mohammed Anwal Kontagora), is killed on the instruction of the leader of the sect, Abu Shekau, for attempting to back out of their reign of terror.
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: JTF v.s. BH, Borno
description: JTF kill three Boko Haram members in a gunduel after the sect members kill 11 persons in a market place on 4 April.
place: Bulabulin area of the state capital, hideout of the sect members

title: Doctor, Lagos
description: A doctor working in a privale hospital is murdered by unknown gunmen in a revengeful action, probably after a mother dies after delivering her baby.

title: BH kill lecturer, policeman, Kaduna
description: Boko Haram kill a senior lecturer (Muhammad Abdulsalam Abubakar) and an ASP policeman (Salisu Ahmed).
place: Lecturer at his residence Dan-Madami road, Karshi, Kolta, Rigasa, policeman at his sitting room, Danmadamin Street

title: SSS Policeman, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen kill an operative of the Borno State Command of the SSS (Ibrahim Malgwi), attached to JTF, Operation Restore Order.
place: Abbagaram ward, at a barbing salon (TBC)

title: Mercenaries attack village, Taraba
description: Over 200 mercenaries attack a village, killing 8 persons, injuring 5 others. Both Fulanis and Tiv farmers complain these gunmen were recruited from outside. Soldiers (93 Battalion, Adda Barracks in Takum) deployed deployed to secure an area during the crisis between herdsmen and farmers are killed. Their camouflage uniforms are stolen.

title: Council boss, Borno
description: The Caretaker Commitee Chairman of Chibok LGA Council in Borno, Wanasgu Kachuwa, is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: BH attack bank, police station, Borno
description: Boko Haram robbed a bank and set a police station ablaze. Policemen are among those killed.

title: SSS v.s.BH, Kogi
description: JTF (RRS, Airforce Apachy Helicopter) raid Boko Haram members hideouts. 9 members die and 2 SSS operatives killed too.

title: PPMC William Enoh, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen, maybe militants abduct Warri Area Manager of PPMC William Enoh and kill a soldier on escort (Uman Asufa) his security aide and four police inspectors. The gang is later paraded by police. (in May 2012).

title: Father of BH spokesman, Borno
description: Boko Haram kills the father of the former spokesman of Boko Haram, Abu Dardaa "Qaqa", who was arrested by security agents on February 1. The dead victim, Abdullahi Bello was a retired Deputy Comptroller of Prisons. Another ex-prison Officer is killed.

title: JTF kill 2 BH members, Borno
description: Two gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members who launch an attack were killed by JTF

title: JTF kill 3 BH during police station attack, Yobe
description: Police repell an attack of Boko Haram on the Divisional Police headquarters and various security outfits in the area. 10 IEDs are used by the sect members. During the attack, a policeman, Corporal Fada and three BH members are killed.The gunmen also destroy an army lodge, a Korean's residence in the area, set a patrol vehicle ablaze. Moreover, they attack a satellite prison and set free 12 out the 14 inmates.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, political issue, religious issue

title: JTF kill 2 BH members in Kano
description: JTF repell an attack of Boko Haram members about to launch bombs. One of the wired vehicle explodes in their den, killing at least two members of the sect.
place: Sabuwar Gandu (Sabon Gandun) Phase One area, Abaganaram and railway quarters
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , The Punch (3 )

title: Civilians, Borno
description: Unknown gunmen kill two civilians near a cinema

title: BH kill retired police inspector, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to belong to Boko Haram storm the residence of a retired police inspector killing him along with two of is friends. This killing follows the failed attack of one of the locations of JTF.
place: Dala Kafani a suburb of the metropolis

title: Fulanis attack villages in Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen allegedly kill no fewer than 20 people in their host community. They destroy farmlands, ambush and kill villagers, rape women. Koro people of Migili in Obi Local Government Area, Nasarawa State have asked the Federal Government to relocate the Fulani herdsmen in the area to avoid incessant killing of their people by the herdsmen.
place: Doka (Atukpo), Akoma (Kponwa), Yelaw (Igbabo) all in Ekye Development Area, Jenkwe area, Duguru town
sources_of_information: The Punch (20 ) , Other newpapers 1 (18 ) , police (10 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (10 )

title: BH kill DSSS members, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill a cleric (islamic scholar, Mohammed Alhaji Bukar) and a cobbler, suspected to be informants of the Department of Security Services (DSSS).

title: JTF kills BH member, Borno
description: One Boko Haram member is killed by JTF in a shoot-out.

title: Army kill BH members, Kano
description: JTF kill nine and arrested two suspected Boko Haram members who attacked a police headquarters, a Divisional Police Officer and set fire to a nearby bank when soldiers strike.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Gunmen storm residential area in Kano
description: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen on a motorbike shoot at a crowd playing cards. Three people die including a policeman.
place: at Freedom Radio Junction, Sharada Quarters

title: Masquerade custodian, Kogi
description: Malam Muhammed Jaguda, an Ogu Clan night masquerade custodian is kidnapped and killed by unknown gunmen.
place: Corpse found a few kilometres from Okene town on the Okene-Ajaokuta road.

title: Herdsmen Kill Woman, Delta
description: A 55-year-old woman, Mrs. Okotie Margaret, was killed by Fulani herdsmen when she tried to prevent them from grazing on her crops. She was stabbed to death by her assailants.

title: Police Corporals, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen kill two riot policemen attached to Special Task Force, Safiyanu Suleman and Thomas Kozah.

title: Mopol kill a gunman, Kaduna
description: A policeman attached to operation Yaki kills a robber suspected to belong to Boko Haram sect out of a gang of four. The masked men were scaring a whole residential area. The three other members sustain injuries.
place: Barnawa area, Ungwan Yelwa community in the suburbs of Kaduna

title: Security Officer, Yobe
description: Security Officer, Bawa Dungus, is murdered by unknown gunmen. People around him knew he was a target to die.

title: Boko Haram kill businessman, Borno
description: Suspected BH members attack and kill a businessman in an electronic market.
place: Babanlay area near the Monday Market

title: Fulani clash with farmers, Borno
description: A clash between suspected Fulani herdsmen and farmers over grazing fields leads to the death of two persons.

title: Boko Haram kill two policemen, Kano
description: Boko Haram riding motorbikes kill two policemen and a soldier in the major northern city. During the attack, soldiers kill one of the assaillants.
place: Checkpoint along Malam Aminu Kano Way, Gwammaja area
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 ) , Business Day (3 )

title: Army and BH shoutout, Kano
description: A group of 7 people shelter in a filling station during a crossfire between Boko Haram and army. The incident happens 30 minutes after gunmen attacked the Rijiyar Zaki police station. Alhaji Rabi’u Sulen Garo the owner of the petrol service station tells he was ordered to lie down with the three dead bodies and others injured. The soldiers flee the scene with the corpses.
place: NNPC Mega filling station, Rijiyar Zaki on BUK Road

title: Attack of a police station, Kano
description: As unknown gunmen attack a police station one person is killed.

title: Road accident, Delta
description: Emu Idiyo Isoko returning from a meeting over the crisis in Uzere, dies in a road accident. 17 others are injured.

title: BH kill ASP policeman, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram kill a senior police officer, Ali Mohammed, in charge of the Anti Robbery Squad
place: He was on his way to the mosque for the Juma’at prayers when he made a stop at the state low cost to make a purchase

title: BH attack banks and police station, Gombe
description: Gunmen attack two banks and a police station with guns explosives. Four policemen including a DPO, Superindendant Abubakar Sadig and three civilians are killed in the attack suspected led by Boko Haram.
place: at the Ashaka Cement Factory in Bajoga town

title: Communal clash, Nasarawa
description: Eight villagers, including a retired Army officer, Ajohol Adoonkor, are killed by unknown gunmen, three days after nine persons are killed nearby in a market place. A total of 17 persons are killed in an alleged farmers and herdsmen's clash.
place: 1/ Nine die in Kadarko market 2/ Eight die in Tse Yaji Village near Kadarko Town

title: Unknown gunmen attack artisanal area of Borno
description: Unknown gunmen on tricycle launch an attack in one part of the capital city. Four persons, two artisans and two fridge repairers are killed during the attack.

title: BH kill village Head, Yobe
description: A village head, LGA chairman of Yunusari is attacked by Boko Haram while visiting his brother who is killed along with a security man.
place: Home of the Yunusari LGA chairman's brother at Bilalla, Geidam Lga

title: Briton, Italian hostages, Sokoto (expatriates)
description: On 7 March, army storm the hideouts of Boko Haram in Zaria and arrest Abu Mohammed, one leader of Boko Haram faction splinter faction (Jamaatu Ahlil Sunna Lidawati wal Jihad, calling itself Al Qaeda) while they are holding a Shura Council (the sect's highest decision making body). The sect leader dies following bullets injuries two days later, allegedly in SSS custody. Five sect members are arrested and an SSS operative, shot in the crossfire, dies from injuries. Abu Mohammed masterminded the kidnapping of two expatriates, a Briton (Chris Mc Manus) and an Italian (Fanco Lamolina) abducted in Birnin Kebbi on 12 may 2011. Despite information Abu Mohammed gave, the hostages are killed by their captors during the rescue operation organised by United Kingdom and Nigeria special forces (Army, SSS.The kidnap was kept secret by both governments. The hostages were engineers for an Italian construction company. In August, the kidnappers who release a video to a Mauritanian press agency showing one hostage, pretend the governments did not answer their demands. The kidnappers were under instruction to kill the hostages as soon as army was around their hideout. Abu Mohammed, linked to Al-Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb (AQIM). Eight of the kidnappers were reportedly shot dead and eight others captured.
place: Hostages killed at Mabera area, near eastern bypass, in the suburbs of Sokoto. Hideouts of Boko Haram in Layin Hanwa area (Zaria, Kaduna). B. Stabilini Visioni construction company, Nigeria Ltd, was engaged in the construction of the Kebbi branch of the Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN

title: Boko Haram attack Commissioner of Police, Kano
description: Boko Haram attack the private residence of Imo State Commissioner of Police. At least three policemen are feared dead during the gunfire.
place: Chiranchi Quarters/Dorayi Quarters along Panshekara road
sources_of_information: Vanguard (3 ) , The Punch (2 ) , The Nation (2 ) , Daily Trust (4 )

title: JTF kill Boko Haram members, Borno
description: Boko Haram who try to set a primary school on fire are killed by police. Later another school was burnt. Abu Qaqa claims responsibility for the burning of all the schools as authorities target Islamic schools.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Shot by JFT in Kano
description: Irate mob protest the shooting to death of a motorcyclist by JTF deployed to secure the area against Boko Haram terrorism. Mustapha Sani, 25, is shot in the head and chest by soldiers.
place: at a checkpoint outside a bus terminus

title: Fulani invade Tiv community, Benue
description: Reprisal attacks by armed Fulani herdsmen on the indigenous community. The crisis breaks, reportedly on 3 April, when Fulani grazing cattle destroy farmlands. A large stock of cows are killed by angry farmers. In a revengeful attack, Herdsmen burn down over 25 houses, farmlands and other valuables. 3000 people are displaced, namely in Cross River State. 45 persons are killed.
place: they attack Tse-Ayande, Chille, Mma-Kpe, Tse-Bboku, Tse-Kpar and several other areas. Some communities are in Guma lga. Deaths in Tyotegh council ward. Tthe crisis has spread to Mbakyondo village in Makurdi. Hundreds of residents of Mbakyondo village have fled to Adeke village some 5 kilometers from Makurdi and others take refuge in Cross River.

title: Boko Haram kill four in Borno
description: Boko Haram carries out two attacks, killing four people including a mother, her son, and two others. In a second attack, a trader is killed at a marketplace and a tailor is slaughtered with a knife.
place: in different areas 1/Zannari Ward 2/the following day in Gamborou Market

title: Boko Haram bomb makers die in explosion, Borno
description: An explosion rocks a house used as a bomb factory for the islamists sect Boko Haram. Three bomb makers are killed.

title: BH kill police officer(SSS), Borno
description: Boko Haram trail and murder a police officer (Ibrahim Steven Malgwi).
place: in a barbing salon Gidan Yashi area of Abbaganaram street

title: JTF kill Boko Haram members, Borno
description: Four suspected Boko Haram members, also known as Jamaatu Ahlil Sunna lidawat wal Jihad are killed by JTF members. The members of the Islamist sect were on their way for deadly missions and did not stop at checkpoints.

title: Police stations attacked by Boko Haram in Adamawa
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members attack several police stations. In the process, one policeman, Lukman Ahbdullahi and an attacker are killed. The A.K 47 rifle of the deceased is stolen.

title: Officer of the Nigerian Immigration Service, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram sect members kill Kolawole Olayinka, an officer of the Nigerian Immigration Service on his way to work at the passport office in Maiduguri.

title: Vigilante group leader, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members shoot a vigilante group leader, Ward head, Muhamadu Wanzam, 60, dead, after he prayed in the mosque.
place: trailed from the community mosque to his residence where he is killed. The killers flee towards Gashua road

title: Gunmen kill two, Kaduna
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill two men and wound a woman.

title: Boko Haram kill three policemen, two civilians in Adamawa
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill three policemen at a police outpost. They steal arms and ammunition and kill two civilian youths as they escape.

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, Kaduna
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill a policeman and make away with his gun. A tyre vulcanizer is injured.
place: along Samaru Road, near Excel Universal College in the Kakuri area

title: Boko Haram launch 40 bombs in Gombe
description: Bombs and shooting attack of jail and police station kill some 14 people including 4 policemen and 10 civilians.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Boko Haram attack a mosque, Kano
description: Boko Haram attack mosques during Moghrib, fourth daily prayer by Muslims. Five worshippers die in the attack.

title: Boko Haram kill cleric in Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attack an area of the town, killing a cleric, Malam Mai Tatabara at 7.30 pm.
place: Pompomari ward of the capital city

title: Boko Haram kill Arabic teacher in Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attack an area of the town, killing an Arabic teacher Modu Goroma at 8.00 pm.
place: Ajeri ward of the capital city

title: Gunmen kill one in Bauchi
description: A group of unknown gunmen kill one Hassan Maigoro.

title: Boko Haram kills a Christian in Borno
description: Police discover the body of Shetu Haruna Malgwi, a 79-year-old Christian woman with a note in Arabic left on her chest reading: “We will get you soon". Her killers slit her throat and place a Bible under her feet.

title: Boko Haram kill policemen, Niger
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill two policemen, a Constable and a Corporal watching over a highway aroud midnight in the capital city. The attackers riding on a motorcycle speed away after the killings.
place: close to the NNPC Mega Station, along Eastern Bypass
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (2 ) , Daily Champion (2 ) , The Guardian (2 )

title: Gunmen kill policemen attached to IGP at a checkpoint, Kano
description: Policemen attached to the security of Inspector General of Police, Mohammed Dikko Abubakar are killed by suspected Boko Haram members dressed in police uniforms. The US ambassador,Terence McCulley told AP that his country would not provide military assistance to Nigeria in its battle against Boko Haram but is considering opening a consulate in Kano to improve the country’s image among a people still suspicious about Western influence.
place: Gwandu Albasa within the family house of acting Inspector General of Police, Mohammed Dikko Abubakar, BUK road by Island after Gidan Murtala
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , PM News (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Daily Champion (4 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Boko Haram bomb a market, confront JTF, Borno
description: Suspected members of the Islamic sect storm a fish market in the metropolis, open fire and set IED bombs. After a gunduel with JTF, at least 30 persons are killed, 8 assaillants, traders, children and a medic. The spokesman of the terrorist group, Abul Qaqa claims responsibility for the bomb attack.
place: Baga Fish Market of the metropolis

title: Boko Haram kill District Head after death threats, Yobe
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect murder the District Head of Geidam, Mustapha Geidam after the Maghreb prayers. He was a former protocol officer to Senator Bukar Ibrahim. It is alleged that Boko Haram sent him a letter threatening him to death unless he moved from his palace.

title: Boko Haram kill Sheik, Borno
description: Members of the Boko Haram sect murder a 60 years Islamic cleric, Sheik Saina Alhaji Ajiya.
place: At his residence in front of his family

title: Director of Finance mistaken for Boko Haram, killed in Kaduna
description: Army mistake the Director of Finance and Administration at the Ministry of Information, Pastor Isua Kiforo, for a Boko Haram terrorist and kill him at a check point. The late pastor served at several churches
place: Dies after recuperating at 44 Military Reference Hospital, Living Faith Church, Kakuri and Barnawa

title: Boko Haram kill two policemen, Niger
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill an inspector of police and a sergeant attached to Wushishi Housing Estate Police post.

title: Police corporal, Niger
description: Unknown gunmen kill a Corporal attached to Maje Police station.

title: Boko Haram vs Army, Borno
description: Extra-judicial Killings: About 100 soldiers from the Multinational JTF Headquarters arrived a community and opened fire on civilians , killing more than 200. The killing was to avenge the killings of 2 soldiers by Boko Haram in the community.

title: Boko Haram kill seven, including 2 Chadians, Borno
description: A crossfire between army and Boko Haram during the week-end kills seven persons: a Chadian and his wife, a Shuwa Arab, an Islamic Scholar and three of his students.
place: in Old Maiduguri (Jere LGA) gunfire around Gamboru market

title: Cattle traders, Ogun
description: Armed robbers disguised like Fulani herdsmen strike on a remote area of Abeokuta and kill six cattle traders, stealing their money and valuables.
place: Igboora-Sokoto Road, around the Ogun-Oyo states border area

title: JTF kill Boko Haram members, Borno
description: JTF kills 12 Boko Haram members in an encounter. They first burn a house and begin a house to house search. The head of the village is brutalised because he does not divulgue names. JTF later reports that they raid the area after their patrol vehicle collides with an electric pole.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (12 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (12 )

title: Boko Haram launch three bombs, Borno
description: Boko Haram carry out three separate explosions targeting members of the Operation Restore Order in Borno. The operation fails as the car transporting the IED explodes killing the four suicide bombers. In the meantime Boko Haram kingpin, Kabiru Umar aka Kabiru Sokoto is re-arrested by SSS and army. His real name being Kabiru Abubakar Dikko. Other sources reports that 2 of the victims are soldiers.
place: Kwanan Yobe area around Customs Barracks

title: Boko Haram kill an opposant, Kano
description: Gunmen kill a man who publicly criticises Boko Haram islamists. The victim, Alhaji Muhammadu, 60, is killed by two men in motorcycles as he leaves the mosque.
place: Hoton Fulani area of the Capital City

title: Boko Haram storm a house, Borno
description: Boko Haram attack a home, killing Ebira man named Dele, from Kogi State and Ore, from Kabba in Kogi State.

title: Boko Haram attack a Police Station, Kano
description: BH bomb a police station, wounding a policeman. Three members are killed.

title: Security operatives kill Boko Haram members, Kano
description: JTF storm a house, manufacturing IEDs, pursuing Boko Haram members. Seven members of the sect are killed.

title: Ex LG Boss, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill the former chairman of Damboa Lga, Alhaji Lawan Kabu going to attend the third day prayer session in memory of his father. Two other persons attending the burials are killed too.

title: Boko Haram divided, Borno
description: Six persons die following an alledged division between Boko Haram members. Moreover six explosions rock the city. Abdul Qaqa, the spokesman of the sect declares that he is not under arrest and that the members who betray the group would be executed. 30 persons are on his black list (for betrayal)
sources_of_information: Vanguard (6 ) , Daily Champion (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , The Guardian (7 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (7 )

title: Boko Haram kills 4 in Kogi
description: Boko Haram set a police station and a bank on fire. A medical personnel at Ajaokuta Steel Company Medical Centre and three fire fighters are killed.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Village attacked in Kaduna
description: Unknown gunmen attacked Ungwan Musa village, killing two persons, injuring several others. One of the dead victims is Hussaini Kayit; one Victoria Adamu is injured.
place: Ungwan Usman village on the outskirst of Zonkwa HQ of Zango-Kataf LGA

title: Boko Haram attack Army, Police/ Ansaru emergence, Borno
description: Boko Haram Islamic Sect invade the Nigerian Air Force, NAF barracks and bomb Gambouru-Ngala police station (Ngala LGA). Five persons including a soldier and two policemen (Air Force officers ) are killed. Past Governor of Kano State, Mallam Ibrahim Shekarau may be one of the sponsors of the sect. A breakaway faction of Boko Haram sect emerges calling itself Ansaru (Ansarul Muslimina Fi Biladis Sudan). Their motto is Jihad Fi Sabilillah, for the Protection of Muslims in Black Africa, whose leader is Abu Usamamta Al'Ansari. They disagree over Boko Haram methods.
place: Air Force Officer killed in Polo, Another man killed at Monday Market

title: Family perish in road accident, Benue
description: A family who leave their Damaturu home during Boko Haram attacks die as their private car collide with a trailer on their way back home. The parents, children and house maid die except one son who is on the danger list at a hospital.

title: Boko Haram kill a policeman in Kaduna
description: Two suspected members of the fundamentalist group, Boko Haram, riding on a motorcycle, kill a policeman.

title: Police station attack, Kano
description: Hoodlums suspected to be Boko Haram members attack a police station

title: Army kill 11 Boko Haram members in Borno
description: JTF kills 11 suspected Boko Haram members, one of them being injured, treated at the hospital. This is reprisals after the death of a corporal the day before. (see event 8993)

title: Boko Haram attack police station kill Corporal, Kano
description: Boko Haram fundamentalist sect members attack police station, killing a corporal. (see event 8992). JTF kil four suspected Boko Haram members in return.

title: Boko Haram leader, Uzairu Abba Abdullahi, Kano
description: A combined team of soldiers, policemen and security personnel kill Uzairu Abba Abdullahi, a textile merchant suspected to be a leader of the Islamic sect, Boko Haram; his pregnant wife is killed too. Mass Communication graduate of Bayero University, Abdullahi is reportedly one of the planners and executors of multiple bomb blasts and attacks in Kano. One of his sons is arrested.
place: at his residence in Hotoro. The scene of the battle is near the farm and horse stable of Chief Deinde Fernandez, Garsan Fulanin Kano

title: Boko Haram members, soldier killed, Kano
description: During a shootout in a hideout of Boko Haram, two members of the sect and a soldier are killed.
place: Tsamninya, Kano a hideout of Boko Haram sect by eastern Bypass

title: Boko Haram members killed, Borno
description: Police reportedly shoot dead four members of the Islamist sect Boko Haram and recover explosives stored in a car.

title: Yusufiyya (Boko Haram) kill registrar, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be members of the Yusufiyya sect known as Boko Haram kill a registrar at the Borno state High Court.

title: Boko Haram unleash several bombs in Kano (3 expatriates)
description: Members of extremist Islamic sect Boko Haram, with the complicity of Nigeriens and Chadians members, launch about 20 bombs in the city of Kano. 70 p. cent of the victims are Muslims. This attack may be linked to the arrest of a Boko Haram preacher and his son at Kuruna Asabe a few weeks ago. The sect threaten some attacks if their members detained (about 100) in jail were not released. The militants set free between 50 to 100 members held in police and Immigration cells, mostly Nigeriens and Chadians due for deportation from Kano State. Aid agency involved are JNI, Red Cross, Kano State Emergency Management Agency. A journalist of Channels Television is killed while recording the mayhem. All the victims are civilians except 29 policemen, 3 SSS operatives, two immigration officers and one Customs officer. Three expatriates, one Indian and two Nepalese nationals are killed too (source: Human Rights Watch, Jan. 23, 2012). According to Daily Trust, the expatriates were three Indian nationals, staff of Real Camp Limited. For Red Cross, at least 50 people are injured. Three days after the wave of attacks, 10 unexploded car bombs are found in the city targeting security agencies. During the raid, a soldier kill one Uzairu Abba Abdullahi, a business man, and his pregnant wife at their residence. They suspect him to be a Boko Haram member. The final toll is likely to be about 250. In an audio player on January 25, Boko Haram leader, Abubakar Shekau, claims responsibility for the coordinated bombings and shootings and issues new threats.
place: The areas attacked are Zaharada, Bayero University Road , Bompai, the State Police Command in Bompai invaded by 50 men dressed in military and police uniforms who kill 100 persons, the SSS headquarters at Sardauna Crescent, police stations at Yakwa on Zaria Road, Fegge, Naibawa and Jedijedi, Farm Centre and the Immigration Office.
sources_of_information: The Nation (178 ) , Daily Trust (250 ) , Daily Champion (186 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (185 ) , Independent (200 ) , The Guardian (200 )

title: Boko Haram attack a pub, Yobe
description: The Boko Haram sect extremists attack a drinking joint, killing one person, injuring several others. Soldiers arrive on the scene and confront the attackers who flee.

title: Fulani kills policeman, Delta
description: A Hausa-Fulani herdsman stabs a policeman to death during an argument. Another sources reports a cow belonging to a Fulani is stolen in a cow market. The cow vendor stabs one to death, prompting the mob action who eventually lynch two Fulani herdsmen to death.
place: on the Direct Labour Agency Road

title: Boko Haram attack a military checkpoint, Borno
description: Two JTF staff are killed with AK 47 rifles at a military checkpoint. The attackers are reportedly Boko Haram members riding tricyle. One of the dead victim may be a hospital worker, and the others, Boko Haram members.
place: Ajilari Railway cross, Zinari, along Gomari area
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (6 )

title: Boko Haram kill Chadians, Yobe (3 aliens)
description: The Islamic sect members (Boko Haram) kill labourers, Chadian nationals, in their homes.

title: Boko Haram kill two, Borno
description: The Islamic sect members kill two Christians in their homes.

title: Boko Haram attack on a pub, Gombe
description: Boko Haram kill two persons in an attack inside a pub. (see event 9035)
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: Fulani herdsmen attacked a community for killing their cows and killed 10 people. Properties were destroyed.
place: Doka, Kwara and Ungwan Yaran mada

title: Boko Haram attack a pub, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram launch an attack in a pub, killing two persons including a policeman.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, political issue, religious issue

title: Boko Haram attack a bus, Yobe
description: Unknown gunmen attack Christians fleeing Maiduguri, mostly Igbo traders travelling in a bus as they stop at a petrol station. The gunmen operate in motorcycles, firing at the victims, their faces covered with black clothes.
sources_of_information: Independent (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (4 )

title: Policeman killed in Yobe
description: According to police, a DPO is killed as unidentified gunmen attack a local beer joint. Other source reports 5 policemen an one bartender are killed in that attack. Gunmen, suspected Boko Haram members according to police, flee on a motorcycle.
place: Beer garden, Modern Motor Park, near the Central Market
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (5 )

title: Boko Haram kill three in Bauchi
description: Boko Haram sect members kill three people in a Christian community, the Sayawa. Their mud houses are burnt.

title: Communal crisis, Chief election in Ebonyi
description: A tussle over chieftaincy leads to the death of one person in Ndieche community. Youths and stakeholders do not agree with the reelection of the current tradition ruler, Charley Nwaiboko.

title: Boko Haram kill five policemen, Yobe
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill at least six persons, including five police officers relaxing at a pub and a teenage girl.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (6 ) , Other newpapers 1 (8 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (8 )

title: Secret police, civilian, Borno
description: Boko Haram Sect gunmen kill a secret police operative along with his civilian friend as they leave a mosque

title: Boko Haram kill students, Borno
description: Two students of University of Maiduguri are killed by three suspected Boko Haram members.
place: in Mairi ward Christian residences South of the University campus

title: Poker players, Borno
description: Three poker players are killed by suspected Boko Haram members. Seven others are injured.

title: Boko Haram kill Igbo, Adamawa
description: Suspected gunmen from the radical sect Boko Haram attack an Igbo community. 20 traders gathered for a meeting are killed.
place: Rural Town hall 2/ Bomb blast at Deeper Life Church making no death
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (20 ) , This Day (14 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Boko Haram attack church, Adamawa
description: Islamist terrorists attack a church and kill Christians during a mass, including the pastor and his son.
place: Christ Apostolic Church, Nasarawo Parish, Jimeta area of Yola
sources_of_information: This Day (12 ) , The Nation (16 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (17 ) , Business Day (13 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (19 )

title: Boko Haram attack church in Gombe
description: Boko Haram Islamic sect, kill 6 worshippers in a sectarian attack during the church service. About 19 persons are injured.
place: A Deeper Life Christian Church, in BCGA area

title: JTF kills Boko Haram members, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram islamists who gun down two members of a household are killed by JTF when they attempt to escape.
place: The civilians killed are Musa Durkuwa, an 80-year-old retired civil servant, his son, Usman Durkuwa, a teacher at the Himma School. Durkuwa’s wife is injured

title: Boko Haram kill head of the Shehuri neighbourhood, Borno
description: Despite a state of emergency in some parts of the state, 2 Islamist sect members kill the head of the Shehuri neighbourhood.

title: Boko Haram attack police station in Jigawa
description: The Islamist sect members attack a Divisional Police Headquarters killing a teenage girl and injuring a policeman. Then they burn down the building.
place: The town is on the border with Yobe State, where Boko Haram has carried out a series of bombings in recent times.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, political issue, religious issue

title: Boko Haram kill one in Borno (2)
description: Islamist sect members kill one civilian.

title: Boko Haram kill one in Yobe
description: Islamist sect members kill the leader of a neighbourhood.

title: Maiduguri mosque area bombed, Borno
description: Four die as blast rocks Maiduguri mosque. It is alleged that it is followed by gunshots between JTF security forces and gunmen. Spokesman of Boko Haram Abul Qaqa, claims responsibility of the islamist sect for the attack.

title: Night attack, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attack a village and kill three members of a Christian Berom family, parents and their baby, while sleeping.
place: Wereng village in Kuru Station. Gunmen enter the family bedroom and murder them with machete. Lawmakers in Riyon report that Fulani settle and train regularly with sophisticated weapons in Rankum and Rafin Acha. They took that land from Jol community.

title: Boko Haram bomb four churches in Niger
description: On Christmas day, a bomb explosion followed by an inferno target four churches, leaving dozens of catholic mainly Igbo people dead. 35 other buildings are damaged by the blast. 73 people are receiving treatment in 12 hospitals in Abuja, Madalla, Suleja, Zuba, Kwamba and Kubwa. The attack is claimed by Boko Haram to avenge the deaths of Muslims in Jos during the Eid el Fitri celebrations. VIDEO SOURCES video source: Daily Trust http://youtu.be/G7g9QzzewDM video source: Euronews http://youtu.be/kR_SWOZgdyg
place: Madalla, Theresa’s Catholic Church, at the border with Abuja, FCT St Barnabas's Anglican Church, Madalla Methodist Church of Nigeria Redeemed Christian Church of God (RCCG)
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (43 ) , Daily Trust (40 ) , Tell (40 ) , The Nation (43 )

title: Policeman, Plateau
description: A policeman on duty is killed as a bomb planted inside the Mountain of Fire Church explodes. Boko Haram said it carried out the attack.
place: bombs explode simultaneously at Kabong and Angwan Rukuba areas of the city
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: Explosion, Borno
description: Boko Haram Islamists launch several bombs. Civilians and policemen are among the victims.
