causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: Vanguard (16 ) , Independent (15 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (20 )

title: Varsity student, Delta
description: Unknown gunmen kill Obaro Ekane a pharmacy student of Delta State University, Abraka. The girl was strangled to death with a chain.
place: Ozoro, corpse discovered about two weeks ago in an uncomplete building

title: JTF launches an attack against Boko Haram in Yobe
description: After a bomb rams into a military convoy, a confrontation between Boko Haram members and JTF ensues, killing at least 53 people. Victims are soldiers (four deaths), policemen, members of the islamic sect and civilians. A policeman, assistant commissioner of police was among the Boko Haram sect members killed.
place: A suicide bomber rams into a military convoy at the gate of the State Security Services in the capital city
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (53 ) , Vanguard (59 ) , Independent (56 ) , Other newpapers 1 (70 )

title: Bomb blast, Yobe
description: An explosion at a local bomb making factory kills one suspected Boko Haram member. A least five other explosions kill between four and ten persons on December 22, including policemen and JTF member.
place: The explosive device explodes at Pompomari area near the palace of the Emir of Damaturu
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Daily Champion (10 ) , The Guardian (4 )

title: Fulani attack village, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen raid a community, nine days after the attack of Kukum Daji in the surroundings. They use firearms and machetes. A pregnant woman and her infant, cut with a machete, survive.

title: Suicide bomb attack, Borno
description: Three Boko Haram members are killed by their bombs explosion. IED, AK 47 rifles, ammunition are recovered from the scene of the blast.

title: Police vs. muslim sect, Kano
description: Policemen are killed in a bloody clash with suspected Boko Haram members. Four muslim sect members and at least 3 police officers die while 14 persons are arrested.
place: Darmanawa quarters. Police search suspects at Unguwar Dabai, Rijiyar Zaki quarters

title: Gunmen kill 5, Borno
description: Five people are murdered by unknown gunmen firing from a car.
place: Gamborou II area. Two of the victims are found inside a gutter with bullets in head and chest.

title: Boko Haram kill Air Force members, Kano
description: Suspected Boko Haram members attack Air Force Comprehensive School. Two attackers and four Air Force members are killed.
place: Darmunawa quarters, Nigeria Air Force Base at Kwa village in the outskirt of Kano

title: SSS, target of Boko Haram, Borno
description: Gunmen, suspected to be members of Boko Haram sect, kill two people and injure three. They open fire on people playing cards in front of a GSM shop. Two people die, including a Head Teacher of COCIN Church Primary School in Polo, Mallam Caleb.The gunmen, according to investigation, were targeting a State Security Services, SSS, personnel who visits the shop, especially at night.
place: murder at Santimari Polo Road. A bomb exploded in Gwange, Layin Bus, at the same time.

title: OPC protest against Boko Haram, Lagos
description: OPC members gather in the streets to protest against Boko Haram terrorism. It turns violent as hoodlums terrorize the rallye, during which one person is killed.

title: Assassins Kill Pastor, Delta
description: One Pastor Felix Abiodun Otubu was assassinated by unknown gunmen in his way from his office .

title: Boko Haram kill Inspector, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill an Inspector of Police with the Borno State Police Commande returning from night duty. The victim was attached to the residence of Galadima Modu Sherif.
place: close to the Gwange Police Station

title: Suicide bombing, Bauchi
description: About 100 Boko Haram members attack police stations, banks and a local chief hunter's residence. They launched over 20 rocket propelled bombs. Six persons are killed including a policeman, a soldier, a civilian and three others suspected to be members of the suicide bombers.
place: 218 km North of the Bauchi state capital Attacks on Police Area Command, mobile police base, police station, Azare Area, Guaranty Trust Bank and Intercontinental Bank and he residence of a local thief catcher, Ali Kwara who was a security adviser to a minister of the FCT in 2007-2008
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: Business Day (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Vanguard (6 ) , Daily Trust (6 )

title: Attack of a mosque, Borno
description: Gunmen inside a car attack worshippers inside a Duriya Tandari mosque. 2 worshippers observing Ish'i (late evening) prayer are killed. Abul Qaqa, the spokesman of the Jama'atu Ahlis Sunnati Lidda'awati Wal Jihad (Boko Haram) exonerates his members from the attack. The mosque belongs to members of the Jama'atu Izalatul Bid'a Wa'ikamatis Sunnah.

title: ANPP Youth leader, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill a bridegroom, Maduga Borikmen at a wedding ceremony. AK 47 stray bullets also kill a politician and injure two persons. The victim was former councillor from Shehuri North under Lamisula ward in Maiduguri and currently the Chairman of Borno ex councillors forum. The spokesman of the Jama'atu Ahlis Sunnati Lidda'awati Wal Jihad (Boko Haram) claims responsibility of his group for this murders. The groom may have spied the sect and planned some arrestation of its members.
place: the name of the leader is also found as Muguda Burusknel
sources_of_information: This Day (2 ) , The Punch (2 ) , Daily Champion (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Police sergeant, Jalingo
description: Edison Dauda, a sergeant returning from duty at the Taraba State House of Assembly, is killed by unknown gunmen operating the same way than Boko Haram members.
place: The victim was riding on a bike and shot in the heas at the Angwan Yanmusallah area

title: Protocol officer and herbalist, Borno
description: Members of Boko Haram kill a protocol officer from the Borno State Government House along with an herbalist.
place: The protocol officer died on his way to his house at the Gwange ward in Maiduguri but source does not mention where the herbalist is killed.

title: Boko Haram night attack, Yobe
description: Police headquarters and other buildings are bombed by Boko Haram members. In the fire exchange between the police and Boko Haram members, four policemen are killed as well as two other people.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Banks attacks, Ogun
description: Heavily armed bandits attack no less than four banks and cart away money before succeeding to escape, leaving at least three people dead. Among them are members of the vigilance group in the town.

title: Father and daughter killed, Edo
description: The father and daughter of a lecturer at the University of Benin are attacked and killed by unknown gunmen at their residence. The man was a retired staff of the Ministry of Agriculture.
place: Aviomo Crescent, Oko Central, Benin City

title: Tiv, Fulani clash, Nasarawa
description: At least four persons are killed in a clash between Tiv communities and Fulani herdsmen. A Fulani and an Agatu were first killed, then there was a reprisal attack on tribesmen, including Tiv and Madas.
place: Kadarko; Angwan Yara Mada and Doka

title: JTF, Boko Haram clash, Borno
description: Three soldiers die in a clash between officers of the JTF and members of Boko Haram. Some civilians are also injured.

title: Berom, Fulani clash, Plateau
description: During an attack in Razat village, 7 persons are killed by Fulani. Then new hostilities between Fulani herdsmen and Berom natives leave at least 10 persons dead (between 10 and 20 depending on the sources of information). Among the deceased is a police officer. The STF arrests over sixty people and imposes a 24-hour curfew in the area.The pastor of the Evangelical Church Winning All alleges that Muslims and accomplice commit the violence, and 37 corpses are recovered
sources_of_information: The Punch (19 ) , The Nation (17 ) , Independent (19 ) , The Guardian (27 ) , Other newpapers 1 (45 )

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 4 people were killed when Fulani herdsmen trespassed into farms owned by Agatu, Tiv and others. Houses were razed and farm produces destroyed by the invaders.

title: JTF, Boko Haram crossfire, Borno
description: At least one child is killed during a crossfire between Boko Haram members and men of the JTF. One source also mentions that two soldiers were killed.

title: Boko Haram kill student, Borno
description: Three suspected Boko haram members kill a 18 year-old Islamic student. The student was said to be an informant to the police.

title: Monarch and wife killed, Kaduna
description: A village head and his wife are allegedly murdered by unknown Fulani gunmen. Consequently, hundreds of women organize a peaceful demonstration through the streets.
place: Apiakashi, Takum District, Fanstuma Chiefdom, 3km south of Kafanchan town

title: Boko Haram attack Police Station, Borno
description: Over 20 Boko Haram gunmen attack and bomb a Police Station and the office of the FRSC, leaving at least two people dead.

title: Boko Haram kill head's brother, Borno
description: Members of Boko Haram invade the residence of a village head and kill his brother and another person.

title: Fulani herdsmen vs farmers, Katsina
description: After Fulani herdsmen invade the village of some farmers with their cattle, a fighting leads to the death of one Fulani. A revenge attack follows in a neighbouring village where another Fulani is killed.
place: Maje village (Jibia) and Dutsin Safe village (Kaita)

title: Two die in crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: Following a crisis caused by a lawyer who claimed that people of Effiat owed allegiance to Efik in Calabar, two persons die.

title: Boko Haram kill police inspector, Borno
description: Sect gunmen stop a police inspector's car, order his family away and shoot him to death.

title: Traditional ruler and others, Kogi
description: A traditional ruler, his wife and six other members of his family are killed during a communal crisis. A protester is also shot dead by the brother of the traditional ruler.

title: Boko Haram suicide bombers, Borno
description: Three Boko Haram suicide bombers die while attacking the JTF Headquarters and destroying part of the buildings.

title: Boko Haram attack, Yobe (1)
description: At least 63 people, most of them being security agents, die in simultaneous bomb attacks and shootings targeted at police headquarters, other governmental buildings, banks and also churches. At the time, it is the highest number of people killed in a single attack by Boko Haram.The attack is believed to have been carried out by about 300 Boko Haram members.
place: Gashua road; Damaturu-Maiduguri road; Jerusalem neighbourhood (churches)
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (100 ) , Daily Champion (90 ) , The Nation (90 ) , This Day (136 ) , New Nigerian (100 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (130 ) , Other newpapers 1 (200 )

title: Boko Haram attack, Yobe (2)
description: Two people are killed and five wounded in a Boko Haram attack.

title: Boko Haram kill soldier, Borno
description: A soldier is murdered by suspected members of Boko Haram.

title: Boko Haram kill cleric, Borno
description: Two suspected Boko Haram members attack a renowned cleric (Sheik Ali Jana'a) at his residence and kill him. On the same weekend, bombs targeting soldiers explode but no casualty is recorded.
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , Independent (1 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (1 )

title: Boat capsizes, Lagos
description: A commercial speed boat capsizes and two passengers drown. PM News doesn't give a precise date for the accident. According to Vanguard, it dates back to the beginning of October.
place: between Kirikiri waterside and Aloro village

title: Boko Haram kill reporter, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members kill a reporter (Zakariyya Isa) in front of his residence. In another source of information, a leader of Boko Haram explains that the murder was carefully planned because the journalist was spying them and giving information to security agencies.
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (1 )

title: Boko Haram kill four persons, Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill a prison guard and three other civilians in three separate attacks.
place: barbing salon in London Chiki, Shehuri and Abaganaram wards

title: Thieves burnt alive, Delta
description: Two bandits are set ablaze by an angry mob while trying to snatch a vehicle.
place: Ugbori area, Olu Palace junction, Ajamogha
lga: Warri North, Warri South, Warri south west

title: Assembly member killed, Borno
description: Gunmen kill Modu Bintube, a member of the Borno State House Assembly, in front of his house. One source of information suspects the gunmen to be Boko Haram members.

title: Boko Haram bomb MOPOL, Gombe
description: Following a bomb attack on a MOPOL base, a policeman and three attackers are killed. Fifteen vehicles are burnt and a building destroyed. The attack could have been carried out by Boko Haram members.

title: Boko Haram kills vigilante, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members kill Ali Banga, the leader of the Borno State Vigilante Association (BOVA).

title: Boko Haram kills policeman, Borno
description: Boko Haram gunmen trail a policeman to his home and kill him.

title: Boko Haram kills prison guard, Borno
description: Two Boko Haram members kill a prison guard.

title: Bank robbers kill policeman, Borno
description: A policeman is shot dead by bank robbers suspected to be Boko Haram members, who attacked the same bank and killed four policemen in March.

title: Bomb blast, Borno
description: Bomb explosion kills at least a slodier. The bomb, which hit a JTF vehicle, is suspected to be thrown by members of Boko Haram.

title: Mob kill Boko Haram suspects, Borno
description: Mob kill two suspected Boko Haram members.

title: Kinsman killed, Ebonyi
description: A kinsman is killed by a Joint Military/Police patrol and three others are arrested. Over 200 community members protest outside Government House and headquarters of State Police. Fulani herdsmen claim they were held hostage by the villagers. There is no precision about the date of the event, which may have happened one week ago.
place: Okpuma village in Amangwu Edda autonomous community

title: Boko Haram kills 3 in Borno
description: Boko Haram shoots three traders dead, including a patend medicine seller. The spokesman of Boko Haram Sect Abu Qaqa, asks for the release of its members in detention as a condition for talks with the government, the establishment of Shariah Law in all Muslim states of Nigeria. He rejects the mediation of the Sultan of Sokoto who is not "the authentic Muslim leader in Nigeria". JTF shuts the fish market and the timber market.
place: Baga Motor Park fish market and Timber market (Timbershed), medicine seller shot in Jajeri ward.

title: Priest at St. Theresa Catholic Church, Nasarawa
description: Reverend Fr Clement Tarwough, is murdered by unknown gunmen.
place: Bridge between Wamba and Akwanga accross Buku River

title: Boko Haram kill lawyer and another one in Borno
description: Boko Haram muslim radical sect members kill a lawyer and an employee of the state emergency management agency.

title: Fulani clash with Hausa traders, Niger
description: Fulani herdsmen reportedly attack and rob Hausa traders on their way to buy animals at the local market. Four people are killed.

title: Boko Haram, Babakura Fugu, shot few after Obasanjo's visit, Borno
description: The sect leader inlaw of ex Boko Haram leader, M. Yusuf shot in 2007, is murdered three days after the visit of former president of Nigeria, O. Obasanjo.

title: Principal of secondary school, Kaduna
description: Thomas Kure, the principal of Meyir Secondary School is slaughtered by a friend during a crisis following the theft of a sheep in the community and the murder of one Yahaya Ahmed, set ablaze during the riot.

title: Boko Haram kills 3 in Borno
description: Three persons including Yakubu Ilya, a retiree civil servant, the Director of the Borno State Civil Service, Turmda Malgwi and a young man are killed by sect members.

title: Boko Haram raid a bank, a police station in Bauchi
description: Boko Haram members raid a bank carting away an undisclosed amount of money. They also explode a police station nearby. 5 policemen, a civilian and a guard on duty a the entrance of the bank are killed.

title: Deaths after a riot, Borno
description: Soldiers stationned in Biu go on rampage after a military officer is killed by believed Boko Haram members. At least 3 people die and many shops are destroyed.

title: Tsaro task force kill Boko Haram member, Adamawa
description: Soldiers of "Operation Tsaro" kill two motorcyclists suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect.

title: UN House bombed by Boko Haram suicide bomber, FCT
description: A bomb explosion rocks the headquarters of the United Nations in Nigeria’s capital. The suicide bomber, safety guards and UN staff are among the casualties. Hundreds are injured. MEND claims responsibility for the operation.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: The Nation (20 ) , Vanguard (25 ) , The Punch (18 ) , This Day (23 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (80 )

title: Boko Haram raid a bank in Adamawa
description: The sect storm two banks, killing four policemen, one soldier and seven civilians. They flee with a big amount of money.
place: at First Bank Plc and UBA Plc
sources_of_information: The Punch (12 ) , This Day (16 ) , Vanguard (20 ) , Daily Trust (18 )

title: Corps Member, Adamawa
description: A Corps member, Stephen Enyinnaya Nwosu mistaken for a Boko Haram member was killed by a soldier. This event is related to event PAR008254.

title: Boko Haram kill pregnant woman, Borno
description: Boko Haram members murder a State accountant, seven-months pregnant. She was staff of Ministry of Finance.

title: Police killed by bandits, Akwa Ibom
description: Robbers kill 2 policemen they meet on traffic jam after a bank robbery.

title: Boko Haram kill ANPP Chief, Alhaji Isa Marguba, Borno
description: ANPP Chief, Alhaji Isa Marguba, 70, is shot dead by Boko Haram sect members, when he returns from the mosque.
place: after the Tarawih prayer, at Alamjeri ward

title: Boko Haram kill policemen, Borno
description: Boko Haram kills three policemen and a civilian watching television in a parlour.
place: Bolori ward of the state capital

title: Crisis in Benue Cement Company, Benue
description: Faction of a trailer driver's union clash inside Dangote Factory after the death of a leader and the okada driver. 50 trucks are burnt. The ensuing crisis hits Tse-Kucha community. The crisis may be link to a dispute between a food vendor and a transporter who did not pay the food. Third hypothesis: an Hausa driver do not pay diesel to a Tiv vendor, argument ensues, leading to 20 deaths.

title: Boko Haram suicide bomber, Borno
description: A suicide bomber is shot dead before he could explode the bomb-laden vehicle at the police state command.

title: Boko Haram kill Islamic cleric Borno
description: Islamic cleric, Liman Bana, 65, trailed right from the Mosque to his residence is murdered by Boko Haram gunmen in presence of his family. The killers flee to Gambouru, a border community town with Chad.
place: in Ngala, a border community town with Chad, 140 kilometres Northeast of Maiduguri, trailed from the Ngala Central Mosque to his residence,

title: Fulani kill Berom in reprisals, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen launched an attack on Foron community while they are asleep, killing Berom Christians, all family members. (see event 8187)

title: Friends shot by Boko Haram in Borno
description: Boko Haram shoot dead two friends, Mallam Nurudeen Umar and Sulaiman Bangini

title: Bomb blast, Borno
description: Members of the Jama'atu Ahlis Sunnah Lidda'awati Wal Jihad, also known as Boko Haram launch a bomb at a military vehicle. Two persons are killed.

title: Boko Haram, JTF, Borno
description: A taxi driver is killed in an exchange of fire between JTF members of the Joint and those of the Boko Haram sect shortly after a bomb explodes. Many churches are destroyed. Two persons are reportedly injured.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Boko Haram vs. JTF, Borno
description: Boko Haram members engage JTF, patrolling in the area, in a shoot out. The two sect members were in a Honda car and the driver was carrying a riffle. One suspect dies during the crossfire.
place: Gomari Coastin ward of the Maiduguri Metropolitan Council.

title: Blast and market inferno, Borno
description: An explosion which rocks a market and the crossfire between Boko Haram sect members and army leaves 13 civilians dead. 3 soldiers are injured. According another source, the military operation following the blast kills 44 persons. Amnesty International reportedly accuses army of the killing of 23 people.
causes_of_violence: fire/explosion, crime, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: The Guardian (13 ) , Daily Trust (44 ) , The Nation (23 )

title: JTF kills Boko Haram member, Borno
description: JTF, Operation Restore Order shoots a Boko Haram member dead, injuring one civilian.
place: Gwange, close to Gwange IV primary school

title: TASUED: cultists rape girls, publish on facebook, Ogun
description: A crisis rocks TASUED university. Students take on the streets after police kill one of them while chasing cultists who molest and rape some female students, belonging to the cult group Red Rose. The pictures of the nude victims are published on Facebook.
place: At Ijagun. Riots breaks out within the premises of the Federal Polytechnic. The girls are kidnapped and raped in a bush nearby
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Boko Haram bomb attacks in Borno
description: The Boko Haram sect members launch two bombs into a moving military patrol vehicle, injuring two soldiers. JTF reprisals kill 3 persons who may be sect members. The residents are angry that national forces cannot secure the town. Other source report two more bodies are evacuated by NIMA, not far from the scene of the incident.
place: 1/ along Baga road 2/ opposite UBA bank
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, religious issue, political issue

title: Fulani and cattle, Imo
description: Fulani herdsmen invade a community with their cattle, destroying crops. Several woman are raped and two persons killed.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Adamawa
description: Boko Haram bombed a beer garden.

title: JTF raid Boko Haram members, Borno
description: A combined police and military task force raid against Boko Haram group makes 30 dead including a little boy. The attack was in retaliation to the abduction and murder of 8 people by the insurgents.
sources_of_information: This Day (30 ) , Vanguard (41 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (0 )

title: Boko Haram, Niger
description: Boko Haram insurgents bombed the All Christian Fellowship Church and killed 3 worshippers. The attackers threw a locally made bomb into the church premises after Sunday church services.

title: 3 Boko Haram, Bauchi
description: Police kill 3 Boko Haram members in their hideouts.

title: Boko Haram kill 7, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill two policemen, a soldier, a customs officer and three civilians
place: One policeman is killed at his home, another at the Gwange police station; the soldier is killed at London Chiki

title: Boko Haram storm the state capital, Borno
description: Boko Haram kills 10 persons in the capital city, attacking a police station. The Chairman of Ijere lga, Alhaji Mustapha Baale, ANPP, is among the casualties.
place: Baale is killed on his way home. Boko Haram struck at Wulari Police station, Mammy Market

title: Security man lynched, Lagos
description: Armed bandits lynch Musa, a security operative, to death during a robbery raid.

title: Oil Crisis, Delta
description: A crisis between a community and SPDC, led to the death of 5 youth leaders and properties worth millions.

title: Boko Haram attack Customs, Borno
description: 10 Boko Haram members attack and kill three Customs officers during a meeting.
place: Customs office outside of the building

title: Musa Mai Hannu Daya, Borno
description: Murder of a civilian by unknown gunmen.

title: Hoodlums attack motorists, kill pregnant woman, Ekiti
description: Hoodlums suspected to be Fulani herdsmen ambush motorist to dispossess them of their belongings. A pregnant women, motorcyclist's passenger is killed.

title: Boko Haram strikes in Katsina
description: Armed men suspected to be members of Boko Haram sect attack a police station and a commercial bank with arms and explosives. However, the force PRO, Olushola Amore, a deputy commissioner of police, reports that the bank attack was a purely robbery incident. Some of the money stolen is distributed to people outside. Six policemen including the Divisional Crime Officer and two civilian are killed.
sources_of_information: Other source (private security firms, etc) (8 ) , Daily Trust (5 )

title: Boko Haram kill one in Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members riding on motorcycles fire several Kalashnikov gunshots at people playing card under a tree. A nurse is killed on the spot, four others are injured.
place: Gomari Bus stop in Maiduguri Metropolitan Council

title: Boko Harm kills Civil Defence officer, Borno
description: An officer of the Civil Defence Corps, Usman Baba Abba, is killed by Boko Haram members.

title: Boko Haram kill a security staff in Borno
description: A security personnel driving his private car is shot dead by suspected Boko Haram members.
place: Gidan Dambe Bama Road in Maiduguri Metropolitan Council

title: Boko Haram attack relaxation centre, Borno
description: Boko Haram militants attack a relaxation centre, killing two persons. Three of the injured persons later die.

title: Suicide attack in police HQ, FCT
description: A lone suicide bomber suspected to be a Boko Haram member, detonates an explosive at the police headquarters. A traffic warden and the suspect are killed, 33 vehicles are burnt, 40 damaged, 90 cars destroyed. Independent newspaper reported that 2 dozens (at least 24) including the male suicide bomber and 2 ladies were killed in the attack.
place: Police headquarters in Asokoro District, Louis Edet House

title: Raid in Taraba
description: Unknown gunmen attacked and kill one police inspector and two finance clerks while returning from Jalingo with staff salaries.

title: Bomb blast in Borno
description: A bomb planted by Boko Haram sect members explodes killing four children and two others.

title: Boko Haram attack in Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen riding on motorcycles kill four people with a Kalashnikov rifle.
place: Bulunkutu ward, in a liquor outlet at 8.25 p.m.

title: Boko Haram kill two pastors, Borno
description: Boko Haram Islamic sect members kill the Pastor of Church of Christ in Nigeria, Rev. David Usman and the assistant secretary of the church.

title: Prison warder, Bauchi
description: A prison warder attached to zone C headquarters of the Nigerian Prison Service is killed by unknown gunmen.

title: Explosions rock Borno
description: Boko Haram members set off four bombs in the state capital. One bomb explodes in front of a police station, another in front of a church. Six Boko Haram members, three civilians and a soldier are killed.
place: Three members of the sect were in a car which exploded in front of Saint Patrick’s Church. Gwange police station is attacked

title: Sunni cleric, Boko Haram, Borno
description: An Islamic cleric, Sheik Ibrahim Birkuti, is murdered in his home, allegedly by Boko Haram. He belonged to the Wahabbi group, a splinter faction of Sunni Muslims more peaceful than Boko Haram sect. The name of the cleric is also know as "Ibrahim Biu", or, perhaps, Imam Ibrahim Ndotti of Dibal Mosque.

title: Bomb blast kill policeman, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen bomb a police station, leaving a police corporal dead.

title: Boko Haram kill Shehu of Borno's brother, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect kill Alhaji Abbah Anas Ibn Umar Garbai El-kanemi, a younger brother of the Shehu of Borno, Alhaji Abubakar Umar Garbai Al-Amin El-Kanemi.
place: the gunmen attack the prince in his house at Gangamari, near the Shehu’s palace

title: Triple explosion, Bauchi
description: At least 14 persons die, 40 are injured in several explosions that occur in different places of the town. Some policemen are among the casualties. Authorities suspect Boko Haram. See event 7932
place: Triple explosion at Mammy Market, Shadawanka and 33 Army Brigade Barracks
sources_of_information: This Day (14 ) , The Nation (13 ) , New Nigerian (14 )

title: Bomb blast, FCT
description: 2 persons die in an explosion after the inauguration of President Goodluck Jonathan. 11 people are injured. Authorities suspect Boko Haram.

title: Herdsman, Plateau
description: A member of the cattle breeders association, MACBAN, reports the attack of Fulani herdsmen by Berom youths while pasturing 500 cattle. One of them dies, another is wounded and seven cows are slaughtered.

title: Boko Haram kill 4 policemen and 9 others, Borno
description: 70 Yusufiyya sect members, popularly known as Boko Haram attack a police headquarters, police barracks and a bank, using Kalashnikov rifles and explosives. They are overpowered by police when they later attack a church. Four policemen, one prison warden and eight civilians die during these assaults.
place: Damboa Divisional police headquarters, police barracks and the First Bank branch; then attack Mashamari Church

title: Boko Haram Kill police, Borno
description: Boko Haram killed a policeman on patrol.

title: Peace Corps, FCT
description: Boko Haram kill three Peace Corps member as an home-made bomb explodes. Six suspects are waiting for trial.

title: Bank robberies, Delta
description: A gang of 25 armed robbers storm four new generation banks killing four persons and injuring eight others. They cart away over N84m, belonging to Unity, Oceanic, Zenith and Skye banks in Amai. Two of the bandits were also gunned down by the police while others escaped with bullet wounds.
place: The gang escape through the Ogume-Obiaruku road

title: Delta Chief, Vincent Chinyere Aminomwan
description: Vincent Chinyere Aminomwan, Elema of Obi Anyinma community is killed following a bloody fight in the community over sharing of royalty from an oil prospecting company, Pan Oceanic Oil Services. 16 houses are burnt in the process. On29 June 21012 Thisday newspapers reports that the crisis claims 30 lives (no precision on dates). Some members of Abavo royal family, the incumbent Obi (Alhaji Uche Irenuwa) could not be a true descendant of the lineage whereas he gets money from Pan Ocean Oil Company.
place: Obi-Anyinma is a subsidiary of Abavo community

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members ambush a policeman in an a local mosque.
place: Dala Alamderi suburb of the state capital

title: Police ordelies, Niger
description: Unknown gunmen murder two policemen, Sergeant Yakubu Musa and Constable Akogu, attached to the Suleja local government Chairman, Mohammed Umar Maddalla.
place: at the residence of the local government chairman

title: NURTW chairman, Ibrahim Dudu Gobe, Borno
description: Boko Haram gunmen kill the Borno State Chairman NURTW, Ibrahim Dudu Gobe and wound his son.
place: They trailed the victim Bama Road Motor Park, right from the community mosque to his Mairi Kuwait ward residence

title: Cleric, Sheikh Goni Tijjani, Borno
description: Boko Haram gunmen kill a cleric, Sheikh Goni Tijjani, who was close to the state governor’s father, Galadima Modu Sheriff.

title: Cleric Mallam Alhaji Abur, Borno
description: Boko Haram gunmen kill a cleric, Mallam Alhaji Abur, who was a critic of the Boko Haram Islamic sect.

title: Boko Haram kill prison warders in Borno
description: Radical Islamic Sect Boko Haram members kill two prison warders.
place: at the new Prison in the city

title: Boko Haram kill a policeman and a child in Borno
description: Radical Islamic Sect Boko Haram members have gone on the rampage again in Maiduguri, the Borno State capital, killing a high-ranking police officer guarding the state government headquarters. A child opening a garage door dies too.

title: Boko Haram kill a prison warder and a trader in Borno
description: Islamic Sect Boko Haram members kill a prison warder and a trader in front of his shop.

title: April post election crisis, Kaduna
description: A pupil accuses her teacher of killing her father, dressed in woman attire, after the April elections.

title: Fulani Herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: 30 people were killed by Fulani herdsmen during a reprisal attack on a Tiv community for the murder of one of them. Several people sustain different degrees of injuries.

title: Police inspector, Borno
description: A police inspector, Elias Dawa, is killed in a gunduel by a Boko Haram member, later apprehended.

title: Boko Haram kill four, Borno
description: Two suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack a residential area, kill two soldiers before being chased by JTF. Two civilians also die, including a child. Five other persons, including two soldiers, are injured.

title: Bomb at INEC's office, Niger
description: A bomb explosion rocks Suleja office of the Independent National Electoral Commission. 25 to 40 people, mainly National Youth Service Corps members, are killed and 400 people are injured. SSS suspect Boko Haram.

title: Bomb explosion, Kaduna
description: A bomb explosion claims the life of one of the bombers, Yahaya injuring the other, Mohamed, Al-Qaeda network (Boko Haram) is suspected. The suspects expected to explode four bombs.
place: Mahuta, a suburb of the metropolis near the National Eye Centre

title: Eve of election in Borno
description: 13 people, including security operatives and officials of various political parties, ar killed on the eve of National Assembly elections. 10 people riding motorcycle (Boko Haram) lay siege on the Shani Divisional Police HQ.

title: Boko Haram kill two, Borno
description: Suspected members of the extremist Islamist sect, Boko Haram, kill two young men, Babaji (24) and Sadi. Seven children are also injured. This seems to be a revengeful mission: on 2 April, after the aborted parliamentary elections, Babaji has disarmed gunmen about to kill a local politician in Budum quarters.
place: in a surburb of Maiduguri. The killers invade Budum in Shehuri North on two motorcycles and shoot the two victims

title: Dawn attack in Plateau
description: Unknown gunmen carry out an attack on miners, farmers, police, leaving three people dead and many others injured. One policeman, on special mission for the elections sustains several machete cuts.
place: Mararaban Forom, one farmer was watering his crops

title: Boko Haram kill ANPP chieftain, Borno
description: Boko Haram sect member kill an ANPP chieftain, Alhaji Modu Gana Makanike, the Gwange II Ward Chairman of ANPP after a political meeting at the residence of another chieftain. The murderers miss their target, the actual being the special adviser to Governor Ali Modu Sheriff on political affairs Alhaji Baba Kura Habeeb attending the meeting.
place: after a political meeting at the residence of another chieftain at Gwange III of Maiduguri metropolis.

title: BH attack army, Borno
description: Boko Haram attack soldiers on routine patrol; One soldier is killed, 16 others injuRed.

title: PDP supporters, Ekiti
description: Two members of the party are murdered during a rallye by assassins dressed in police uniforms. The victims were supporters of the PDP House of Representatives's candidate in Ekiti South Federal Constituency 2, Femi Bamisile.
place: 20 km to Ilogbo, at a rallye in Umuo Ekiti

title: Night guard, Ekiti
description: A 70 years night guard, Pa Lawrence Adebayo is murdered by unknown gunmen.

title: FRSC staff, Imo
description: Unknown gunmen shoot and kill a Road Marshal while another is seriously injured.

title: Aide to the ACN candidate, Benue
description: Unknown gunmen killed Emmanuel Ajibo, an aide to the ACN senatorial candidate for Benue South, Lawrence Onoja.

title: Cleric, Borno
description: A Maiduguri based cleric, Ustaz Ibrahim Ahmed Abdullahi Gomari is murdered by unknown gunmen. The victim was known for his sermons against Boko Haram.
place: in front of his house at Gomari area, situated on Maiduguri-Damaturu road; other source reports he is killed at his Gomari Mosque close to his residence

title: Attack on communities, Bauchi
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen in black uniforms attack several communities, killing five persons.
place: villages attacked are Arewa, Kutaru, Malanchi, Gongo, Gumel, Kardam and Tafawa Balewa

title: Abduction, Ebonyi
description: Unknown gunmen abduct three Development Centre coordinators, killing one person in the operation.

title: Boko Haram kill policemen, Kaduna
description: Boko Haram members invade the private residence of a Divisional Police Officer, Mustapha Sandamu and killed two policemen guarding his house, take away their riffles.
place: Rigasa area on Abuja Road, at the resident of Magajun Gari Police station DPO

title: Boko Haram kill police inspector, Borno
description: A police Inspector is gunshot by two suspected Boko Haram members operating on a motorcycle.
place: Dala Ward at the residence of the victim

title: Fulani attack community, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen invade a community around midnight and kill 17 Berom villagers. The leader of the invaders, Musa Haruna is also killed by youths of the community. 7 people are injured and 19 cows rustled. That offensive is a swift revenge attack after the combined police/army STF team, Operation Safe Haven, killed a Fulani herdsman during a night raid. This leads to the arrestation of 60 persons.
place: In Belle Village near Dorowan Tshoho in Fan District. 14 people die on the spot, four other on their way to hospital

title: Boko Haram members killed in Borno
description: Five Boko Haram suspects die during a gunfight with the police. One of the financiers is killed too. Arms coming from Chad and Cameroon are recovered.
sources_of_information: The Punch (5 ) , The Nation (6 ) , This Day (6 )

title: Expatriate Nigerian and lecturer, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen kill a Canada based Nigerian Pius Gbarazia and a lecturer at the State College of Arts and Science in Port-Harcourt, Clement Kemte Faah.
place: in front of Faah's family's home at Yeghe

title: Boko Haram associate, Borno
description: During a criminal operation, Boko Haram organisation kills one of their members in error.
place: during the attack of a residence in Bulumkutu, belonging to one John Musa

title: Crisis over relocation of varsity, Ekiti
description: After the community propose the relocation of the new Federal University from the Ikole-Ekiti to Oye-Ekiti violence breaks out. Four protesters are killed by police forces.
place: Ikole-Ekiti. The Ikole police station in Idi-Ose is burnt. In Iloka area of the city one Hilux van belonging to SRS is set ablaze

title: Raid in Ekiti
description: Police kills a member of a robbery gang who just attack a music producer, F-Major, a NYSC, Jude and trie to rape a girl, Tonia. The other bandits escape.
place: Oke-Ila area of Ado Ekiti. The bandits fleee close to Olobe Primary School.

title: Fulani Herdsmen vs Farmers, Nasarawa
description: 1 person was killed by Fulani herdsmen after some farmers were accused of killing their cows. Houses and farm produce were also destroyed in the process. Some girls were raped by the invaders.

title: Fulani herdsmen's revenge in Benue
description: After Tiv farmers kill Fulani cattle, about 200 herdsmen assisted by Chadian mercenaries launch a massive retaliation's attack. More than 25 homes are torched, ten persons killed and over 20,000 persons displaced. The conflict spreads to Makurdi (see event 7419). A new attack occurs on February 11 making 7 more dead victims. The death toll in the conflict rises to 36 on 25 February.
place: the rampaging herdsmen riding on horses and motorcycles arrive in Tyotegh village. Attacks in Gbaange/Tongon, Hyonghtee/Ijaha and Senghev District. The invaders enter through Doma Lga in Nassarawa and camp in Gwantashi island for several days.
causes_of_violence: cattle grazing, crime, religious issue, political issue
sources_of_information: The Guardian (28 ) , This Day (24 ) , The Nation (18 ) , Vanguard (36 )

title: Fulani herdsmen's revenge in Benue (2)
description: After Tiv farmers kill Fulani cattle, herdsmen lauch a massive retaliation's attack. More than 25 homes are torched, ten persons killed and over 3,000 persons displaced. The conflict spreads to Makurdi where two farmers are killed (see event 7418).
causes_of_violence: cattle grazing, crime, religious issue, political issue

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, daughter in Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill a deputy superintendant of police and his six-year-old girl.
place: near the NNPC mega station at Abbaganaram area of the city

title: Boko Haram attack policemen guarding a dam in Borno
description: Two muslim extremists believed to belong to Boko Haram sect are killed as they attack policemen guarding a dam. One policeman is killed.
place: Road block at Pompomari Housing Estate

title: Boko Haram kill ANPP candidate, governor, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shoot dead ANPP candidate Fannami Modu Gubio, Governor Ali Modu Sheriff's brother, a former Chairman of Ngala Lga, two security officers, three ANPP members and one other person. During the arrestation of 19 people, one policeman is killed. ANPP is the ruling party in the state and is believed to win the Governorship April general elections.
place: Gunmen operating on motorcycle follow the ANPP candidate from the mosque.
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , Daily Champion (7 ) , The Punch (7 )

title: Hausa clash with UNIJOS students, Plateau
description: A clash between some Hausa youths and students of Village Hostel, University of Jos, degenerates, resulting in the deaths of 14 people including four students. Over 20 houses are burnt. The crisis starts when Hausa boys going to burials stab two students leading STF to fire at hundreds of protesting students.
place: Two filling station were burnt and some residential houses especially at Angwa Galadima in Farin Gada are set on fire.
sources_of_information: The Nation (14 ) , Other newpapers 1 (15 ) , Daily Trust (15 )
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: Police attacked in Jigawa
description: Unknown gunmen coming from a bush attack policemen on duty, killing one Sergeant, Oguche Jonson. The victim, shot in the leg later dies in hospital.
place: Gunmen come from a bush close to Unguwar-Wanzamai village along Dutse-Shuwarin road

title: Islamists kill officer, Zamfara
description: Gunmen suspected to belong to Islamist sect Boko Haram kill a policeman guarding voter registration equipment.

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, Bauchi
description: Boko Haram members kill a policeman guarding a voter registration site.

title: PDP Chieftain, Sokoto
description: Unknown gunmen assassinate PDP Alhaji Abubakar Danda Mana, Chieftain and Deputy Treasurer of the party.

title: Boko Haram kill JTF in Borno
description: Boko Haram members operating on motorcycles attack and kill a soldier on his way to visit a relation.
place: the armed sect trails him from a mosque to his relation's residence at Ruwan Zafi ward/Jajeri
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , Daily Trust (1 )

title: Mopols, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen yesterday shoot three mobile police officers dead. The policemen attached to the Swift Operation Squad were escorting pilgrims to the International Airport going to Israel. One Mopol dies on the spot while the two others die at Teme hospital.
place: along the G.U. Ake Road (Eliozu axis)

title: Fulanis invade villages, Plateau
description: The neighbouring Lgas are struck by violence after clashes in Jos South on Sunday 9 and Monday 10 January. Suspected Fulani herdsmen invade villages, set houses ablaze at random. Five people are reportedly killed.
place: Fulani herdsmen storm four villages, Nyarwai (3 dead) , Fagawang (2 dead), Ding in Barakin Ladi Local Government Area
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (5 ) , The Guardian (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Daily Champion (5 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (5 )

title: Dawn invasion, Plateau (2)
description: The neighbouring Lgas are struck by violence after clashes in Jos South on Sunday 9 and Monday 10 January. Suspected Fulani herdsmen invade villages, set houses ablaze at random. 13 people, mostly children are hacked to death. Another source reports that the attackers, "strangers" ore mercenaries, are assisted by Fulanis and soldiers. Soldiers receive as reported a lot of money from Fulani community. Villagers in Wareng call the FG to replace soldiers by mobile policemen.
place: Fulani herdsmen storm Kuru Tasha village in Riyomwhen the inhabitants are asleep.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (13 ) , The Guardian (13 ) , The Nation (13 ) , Daily Champion (13 )

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill a policeman constable, Amos Tangurda, attached to COCIN Church, injuring the watchman, Mallam Akilahyel Solomon.
place: Bulunkutu, Gomari ward, near the Maiduguri International Airport

title: Boko Haram kill police corporal, Borno
description: Boko Haram members kill a policeman, Corporal James, trailed by the two men who operate with motorcycles.

title: Akpan Akpanudo, PDP aspirant, Akwa Ibom
description: Unknown gunmen killed a House of Assembly aspirant for Mkpat Enin Lga, Akpan Akpanudo. The House of Assembly primaries for Mkpat Enin has been postponed. As reported on january 07, some PDP chiefs and ward executives are arraigned for that murder: Bernard Udoh, Chairman of the House of Representatives Committee on Lands and Transport, Ekong Sampson, member of the House of Assembly and the Mkpat Enin Lga chairman, Mfon Nkanteen.
place: killed on his way back from Anua, Uyo Hospital, where he worked.

title: Bomb Blast at New Year's Eve, FCT
description: A bomb lauched by Islamic Sect Boko Haram at a relaxation spot kills four persons, injures many.

title: Boko Haram kill seven in Borno
description: Members of radical Islamic group Boko Haram attack a police patrol team, killing seven to eight persons; eight people are wounded. See also event 7216
place: The vehicle transporting the bomb was burnt to ashes at a bus station in the Dala area, Ruwan Zagi district. Two persons were also killed at Alamderi near Baga road and three police were later ambushed and killed at Muna Motor Park along Ngala road. An attack was also launched at the Railway Quarters; at Umarari Borehole, north of Baga Road, another person was shot and killed.
causes_of_violence: crime, fire/explosion, political issue, religious issue
sources_of_information: Vanguard (7 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 ) , The Punch (8 ) , Daily Trust (8 )

title: Human rights activist Chidi Nwosu, Abia
description: Unknown gunmen shoot and kill a Human Rights activist, Chidi Nwosu in his hometown. The victim was the founder of Human Rights for Peace & Justice Foundation. On May 6, 2009 he accuses the Governor of Abia State Chief Orji of plotting to assassinate him which is denied.

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, 2 others in Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram Islamic fundamentalists fire shots at the Teaching Hospital, killing a policeman on duty and two civilians.

title: Communal crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: A clash between Idua Ukpata and Esukma communities during the traditional wrestling festival organised by the youths of Esukma leads to the death of seven people. A community leader in Oron, Chief Esang Umoh, says: "The people of Eyo Abasi had sold a parcel of land to the Idua Ukpata people, but a gas company wrongly paid compensation to the Idua people without informing the landlords from Eyo Abasi".
place: Esukma people home are razed as well as the palace of the village head of Udung Okung in Eyo Abasi
causes_of_violence: land issue, oil distribution, fire/explosion, crime
sources_of_information: The Nation (7 ) , This Day (10 ) , Other newpapers 1 (6 )

title: Churches bombed in Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members bomb churches during Christmas Eve. See event 7216.

title: Christmas Eve explosions in Plateau
description: Nine explosions and reprisals attacks rock the town on Christmas Eve, killing at least 80 persons and injuring many more than 100. See event 7218. Security agencies discover persons manufacturing bombs in Nasarawa Gwom. An Islamic group, Jama'atu Alhlus Sunnah Lidda'awati Wal Jihad (Boko Haram) claims the responsibility for the bombings.
place: The brother of two dead victims was at Sauki Relaxation Centre to have a drink when the explosions went off. First explosion at Agwa Rukuba. Second and simultaneous explosion at Gada Biu; Third explosion near Sacred Heart Catholic Church at Kadong (or Kabong); another bomb was said to have exploded at Nasarawa Gwom, Jos North; other blasts at Tina, Dogon Dutse, Rikkos, Gadabiu, Abattoir and Dogon Karfe, littered with dead bodies. Houses are burnt in Abattoir and Anglo-Jos. The death toll is confirmed by five hospitals in Jos. At the Church of Kadong in the village of Gada Biyu, a youth is also killed by the army on 25 December when the local people try to stage a demonstration. See the book of the catholic archbishop of Jos, Ignatius Ayau Kaigama: Peace, not War. A Decade of Interventions in the Plateau States Crises (2001-2011), Jos, Hamtul Press, 2012, p.88.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (80 ) , The Nation (84 ) , New Nigerian (80 ) , This Day (80 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (107 )
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: IED Kills Child, Plateau
description: 1 child was killed by Improvised Explosive Device (IED) when a group of children were playing with an object which turned out to be IED. Several children were injured in the incident.

title: Boko Haram crossfire with army, bus passengers hit , Borno
description: Nigerian army clashes with members of Boko Haram Islamist sect. Two of their members and three civilians die in the crossfire.

title: Fuel crisis, soldier kills tanker driver in FCT
description: A soldier kills a tanker driver during the NUPENG strike movement.

title: Massive attack in Ayakoromor, Delta
description: JTF, Operation Restore Hope, raid a community in search of militants. They use heavy machine gun fire and aerial bombing. Hundreds of people are displaced. Buildings and provisions store are set ablaze. FJHD led by Oghenejabor Ikimi, a lawyer, claims 150 deaths, calling Amnesty International to help stopping these killings. According to the leader of NDPVF, Asari Dokubo, over 100 people are killed by Nigerian forces, elders of the community confirm the massacre of about 150 persons in Ayakoromor and hereabouts, in villages only accessible via the creeks. Right activists claim the rape of women during the raid. On 14 december, JTF admit the siege, and the killing of over 51 persons, and 100 others missing. The number of displaced people is 10 000.
place: The refugees flee in Warri, Ogbe-Ijoh and Ughelli,
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (150 ) , Independent (150 ) , Other newpapers 1 (150 ) , The Nation (150 ) , Daily Trust (150 )

title: Robbers attack traders, Borno
description: Police kill two robbers who attack traders and villagers and recover arms and ammunition. According to Commissioner of Police, Muhammed J. Abubakar, the bandits come from Chad and Cameroon.

title: ATBU university lecturer, Bauchi
description: Unknown gunmen gunshoots an elder lecturer with ATBU in Bauchi, Suleiman Abubakar.
place: At the entrance of his residence in Federal Low-Cost Housing Estate by six people. The 45 years victim dies at the hospital

title: Policeman and soldier killed by Boko Haram
description: Suspected Boko Haram members kill a policeman (Ramat Mohammat) and a soldier (Salisu Jibrin) on their way home after duty .
place: Killed l around Dala Bus stop

title: Mosque, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram members open fire in a mosque during Juam'at prayer. Three persons are killed in the process.

title: PDP council crisis, Ekiti
description: After the dissolution of 16 local governments by Governor Kayode Fayemi on October 28, the sacked councillors attempt to resume duty in compliance with PDP Chairman Bola Olu-Ojo's directive. A crisis breaks out inside PDP secretariats, workers and members of ACN preventing Mrs Tosin Aluko to enter. She escapes, injured. A bit later, the newly appointed chairman Olubunmi Omole eventually succeeds in assuming office. Two people die in that crisis, allegedly killed by OPC serving an unnamed politician.
place: at the secretariats of Ado-Ekiti, Ido/Osi in Ijero

title: Boko Haram kill soldier, Borno
description: Two unknown gunmen riding on a motorcycle shoot and kill a soldier, Bashir Mohammed, attached to 231 Battalion of the Nigerian Army Biu.

title: ACN aspirant's home bombed, Delta
description: Governorship aspirant on the platform of ACN, Jude Eruke Ukusare, escapes death as unknown gunmen bomb his house, but his mother, 73, and 9 years niece are roasted alive in the bomb blast.

title: Raid in a warehouse, Rivers
description: Two customers are killed as a gang of robbers raid a warehouse. The bandits also shoot and injure the security man before carting away with N120,000.
place: Bonbecco Peak Milk Depot, 6 Emenike Street, Mile One

title: Foiled UBA bank raid, Ogun
description: Four persons die during a bank raid. When the gang force their way into the hall, police and vigilantes rush to the scene opening fire on the bandits shooting two of them dead. When the gang escape, they kill two civilians.
place: in Awa, Moborode commercial area, Fologbade street. Vigilantes are working with Obanta Sage and Security Vigilance Group
sources_of_information: The Guardian (4 ) , PM News (6 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Boko Haram member killed by police, Yobe
description: Boko Haram members attempt to set a police station ablaze but are ovepowered by the police. One member of the sect is killed.
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (1 )

title: Fulani clash with Berom, Plateau
description: Fulani herdsmen clash with Berom farmers after herdsmen coming to graze their cattle chase Berom women from their farms in Tanchol village. According to the Plateau State chairman of the MACBAN, Muhammad Nura, the natives attack Fulani herdsmen leading to the death of one young Fulani, Hudu Rabo, and 30 cows. The villagers allegedly use sophisticated weapons.
place: Clash in Gero Tsohuwa village near Tanchol village.

title: Boko Haram kill policeman, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram militia kills a police inspector, Kashim Bukar by shooting him in the chest.
place: At his Ummarari residence after being trailed from a football match viewing centre

title: Cultitst at university, Enugu
description: A final year mass communication student of the IMT, Henry Uzuagu, is killed in an encounter with two rival cult groups: the Neo Black Movement of Africa also known as Black Axe and Blue Berets, known asTwo-Two. The crisis erupts during the Students Week. Another source reports the rivals groups are Black Axe and Vikings.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , The Guardian (3 ) , Independent (6 )
lga: Enugu South, Enugu North, Enugu East

title: Mopol killed by Boko Haram, Bauchi
description: Boko Haram members kill a policeman attached to the private residence of Bauchi State Commissioner for Special Duties Musa Badara. Boko Haram denies the crime. On 24 October, a source reports that three policemen are killed.
place: Low Cost area in the Metropolis
sources_of_information: The Nation (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: Yusufiyya kill cleric & student, Borno
description: Gunmen suspected to belong to Yusufiyya (Boko Haram sect) kill a cleric Sheikh Bashir Mustafa and his student, Alhaji Sunoma, during a wedding ceremony.
place: in the cleric's house at Layin Gidan Hajiya Mai Tuwon Yasin in Gwange ward of the capital city
sources_of_information: New Nigerian (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (2 )

title: Local Council senior staff, Borno
description: Mamman Zannah, a senior staff of Bama Local Council is killed by men supposed to belong to Boko Haram organisation.
place: at his New York ward residence

title: ANPP chief Alhaji Awana Ngala, Borno
description: The Borno State chairman of ANPP, Alhaji Awana Ngala is murdered by suspected Boko Haram members. They also attack a policeman, Sergeant Isa Omale and Hussain Iliya of the NSCDC. A private source reports the deaths of the police sergeant and the NSCDC corporal.
place: A. Ngala is killed at his Simari residence, the two officers are attacked in Pompomari residential estate at the residence of the Speaker of the Borno House of Assembly, Goni Ali Modu
sources_of_information: The Guardian (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (2 )

title: Cult war: Black Axe vs. Blue Berets, Edo
description: Gunmen belonging to Black Axe and Maphites killed seven AAU students. According to another reports, Black Axe was confronting Blue Berets. The crisis begins during the Students Week. See also event 6970 and 6972.
place: The victims are shot at different locations of Ekpoma University town

title: Communal clash over land, Anambra
description: A communal crisis rocks Obosi community over the control of land sale. Two rival factions in the community engage themselves into supremacy gun battle leading to the death of at least three people and the destruction of property worth N100 million. The house of the Governor, Omezie Chukwurahn, is vandalized.
place: On of the victim is Obosi from Mmakwum village. Two people are macheted to death

title: Damilolo Agbede: extra-judicial killing, Ondo
description: The son of past Chief Registrar of the State High Court, Elder Olusa Agbede is killed by a SARS policeman when returning from a night club, omitting to stop at a check point. Police alleges he was the leader of a six-man robbery syndicate specialising in snatching cars. Damilolo Agbede was a Part Three Policical Science student of Adekunle Ajasin University.

title: Boko Haram kill two, Borno
description: Suspected members of Boko Haram, riding motorcycles plot to murder Mai Bulama (Gwaidamgari's Ward Head). Instead, a trader Ba'Abdu Maigoro, a kolanut seller sitting in front of a mosque, is killed. Another victim, a grain seller has been shot around his shop. He dies few hours later.
place: Gwaidamgari behind Railway Terminus quarters in old Maiduguri on the outskirts of the metropolis
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Chief Jimmy Omogberem, Kaduna
description: A lawyer, Chief of the state chapter of the Niger Delta Peoples Forum, Jimmy Omogberem, is killed by unknown gunmen.
place: at his residence, Jim Close, Ungwan Maisamari, Malali

title: Telecom base attack, Abia
description: Unknown gunmen attack a Base Transceiver Station and kill two Ericsson petroseal engineers, one driver, two mopol, a rigger on top of the tower and the site security guard. The armed-men wanted the key of the petroseal car.
place: Involves Ericsson and MTN companies; Station (BTS) located at the Gabby Oil, Aba road
sources_of_information: Daily Champion (7 ) , Daily Trust (6 ) , This Day (6 )

title: Bank raid, Delta
description: A gang of robbers raid Ogwuashi-Uku branch of the First Bank Plc. and steal over N28 million. They operate one hour after the opening, killing three persons including a pregnant woman and a security guard; many other persons are injured. The bandits escape with the money, unhurt.
sources_of_information: Vanguard (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , Nigeria Delta Standard (3 ) , Daily Trust (3 )

title: SSS officer & family, Kano
description: Alhaji Garba Bello Hadejia, the assistant director of the State Security Service in Sokoto, his wife and three of his kids are murdered by unknown gunmen. Nothing has been stolen inside the house. Two other children escape with injuries. On 15 September, one of the surviving sons, Bello Garba Bello, known as Baba, confessed he was the murderer, after his brother, Farouk, 11 years gives a tip-off to police. The suspect, involved in drug abuse, has poor motives for his act.
place: at their Kundila Housing Estyate Home, Off Zoo road, Kano.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Governor’s aide & Fulanis, Niger
description: Director-General of Servicom in Niger State, Alhaji Saidu Ibrahim is hacked to death while trying to separate a group of Fulani herdsmen engaged in fighting.
place: Saidu Ibrahim was on his way to Bida from Minna when he meets a group of Fulanis in Sabon Daga village around Kateregi

title: Islamists attack prison, Bauchi
description: About 50 Boko Haram sect members storm the Central Prison to free their colleagues involved in the Maiduguri crisis of July 2009 and awaiting trial. Two prison warders, a policeman, a soldier and a civilian are allegedly killed and 732 prisoners escape. 150 of these prisoners are suspected members of the Islamist sect. As the violence in 2009 was one-sided and out of proportion to the group's action, it is said that many Boko Haram sympathisers used to work for the Bauchi and Borno governors as private militias, so the problem could be related to the coming general elections of 2011.
place: Prison adjacent to Emir's Palace. Mobile Police brings casualties at Abubakar Tafawa Teaching Hospital

title: Boko Haram kills an ASP in Borno
description: Boko Haram members riding motorcycles, kill a retired ASP cop, Zannah Kyari. They also shoot another Bulama a village warden in Konduga Lga, in the leg, leaving the victim for dead. He is currently recuperating.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Business Day (1 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (0 )

title: Boko Haram kills two Chiefs in Borno
description: Members of the Islamic sect kill two local disctrict chiefs called "Lawan" accused to be police informants.
place: The Chiefs are slain behind the palace of the Shehu of Borno

title: Boko Haram kills a trader, ward Head targeted, Borno
description: A trader, Alhaji Modu is killed as the disctrict head of Kalari area in Limanti Ward of Maiduguri, Lawan Zanna Mohammed Kagu is targeted in front of his residence after the sunset prayers. An hour after that murder, another Bulama is targeted around Kabarmaila near the Maiduguri New Prisons, four persons are injured in the second incident.

title: Police, AVS vs. bandits, Anambra
description: Gunmen trail a school principal returning from a praying session in Imo. As they fail, they abduct a girl at a market. In that process, they meet a police patrol and AVS vigilante team. Three policemen and three AVS die in the ensuing gunbattle.
place: the girl is abducted at Amichi Market

title: Policeman, Yobe
description: Suspected members of Boko Haram sect kill a policeman, Barde Amos, at the home of the Governor, Ibrahim Gaidam.
place: at the home of Yobe State Governor
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , The Guardian (1 ) , The Nation (1 )

title: Policemen, Borno
description: Two policemen attached to Bulumkutu Division, on a night duty, are killed by suspected Boko Haram sect members.
place: around the Gomari Airport Friday Mosque

title: Bandits, Abia
description: JTF kill robbers who attacked at least three banks.
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (4 )

title: Land dispute (2), Benue
description: A land crisis involving two communities, who hired mercenaries in Vandeyka leads to the death of five persons.

title: Petrol station owner, Lagos
description: Malo, Chief Executive Officer of Malo petrol station and his driver are shot by unknown gunmen.
place: at Agric bus stop, along Lagos-Ikorodu Road, near St. Augustine’s Catholic Church

title: Community attacked in Plateau
description: Two cousins, Yakubu Fwan and Victor Dung going to work at Yola and Jalingo with PW construction company, are killed after their car breaks down. Assassins recognise the victims were Berom people; the are attacked inside their vehicles during the night. Two relatives escape the massacre by running in the bush. They report the dead bodies were placed in the middle of the road by Fulanis to be run over by cars.
place: at Sabon-Giba a village in between Toro and Nabordo. Berom ethny from Razat community?

title: Religious crisis, Taraba
description: Christians opposed to the building of a mosque within the premises of the Police Area Command, a public land, destroy the place. In retaliation, Muslim community burn several churches. The crisis leads to 6 deaths. On 15 July, 12 more bodies are recovered.
sources_of_information: Business Day (8 ) , PM News (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (18 )

title: Communal clash, Kaduna
description: Fulani herdsmen attack Kizachi community, sharing its boundary with Riyom Lga (Plateau state). They kill five persons including the primary school teacher and burn several houses.
place: At Kizachi, Chawai, Damakasuwa area boundary settlement between Kaduna and Plateau States.

title: Pregnant woman, Imo
description: Unknown gunmen stabbed a pregnant woman, mother of three, to death after they had sent her a phone call.
place: at her shop along School Road

title: Medical doctor, Rivers
description: Doctors of UPTH hospital protest the killing of one of their colleagues, Dr. Chinda Igondah, by unknown gunmen.
place: UPTH, the victim worked with the department of Surgery

title: Thugs clash in Kogi
description: Two factions of political thugs clash for political differrences. In the crisis, three persons lose their life, including a pregnant woman hit by a stray bullet.

title: Land and Obaship tussle, Ogun
description: Violence breaks out after a High Court judgement, ceding parcels of land to Chief Fatai Alani Matanmi family. The crisis is also linked to the contest of Ado Odo throne, opposing Aworri to Egba communities: 3 to 6 persons die. 13 people are involved in the attack of the traditional ruler of Ijoko, Oba Lasisis Kolapo Ogunseye and his relatives. Three chiefs in Ogun led the mayhem: Simon Kehinde Williams, Abidemi Jimoh and Fatai Alani Matanmi.
place: Oju-Ore Ota. Violence spreads to Sango and Ijoko where are the disputed piece of land
sources_of_information: Independent (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Vanguard (3 ) , PM News (6 ) , Daily Champion (3 )

title: Bank Manager, FCT
description: A manager with Finbank plc, Tasiu Boyi IS shot dead by unknown gunmen
place: Killed shortly after he left the garki area 7 premises of the bank

title: Attempt jail break, Kaduna
description: Between 2 and 15 prisoners die in an attempt jail break in overcrowded prison. 70 inmates have been injured. They start a fire in the prison where Christian Praying Assembly General Overseer Rev. Emeka King is being kept and may be behind that crisis.
sources_of_information: Daily Champion (15 ) , This Day (10 ) , The Punch (15 )

title: Benin Chief, Edo
description: The chief of Igbekhue kingdom, Friday Osazuwa, is murdered after bandits storm his warehouse.
place: Orhionmwon, Igbekhue Kingdom. His warehouse located at number 3, Goroti Road, off Upper Sakponba Road

title: Robbery raid in Jigawa
description: Three persons including a 12 years boy die during the robbery of a shop, while the bandits attack the shop owner, a provision dealer.

title: Two bandits, Rivers
description: Police kills a notorious robber and kidnapper, Gift Onwugbuta and Opurum Anael tracked down since November 2009.

title: EFCC, Enugu
description: Unknown gunmen shoot dead an operative of EFCC, Eze Edoga. Four others are currently at hospital. The bandits ambush the team returning from a trial involving Kema Chikwe, the husband of Nigeria’s Ambassador to Netherlands and former Minister of Aviation, for fraud over plots of land.

title: PDP Chieftain, Oyo
description: Unknown gunmen kill Alhaji Azeez Adebgile, 55, PDP Chairman in Atiba Lga.
place: in his room at Odunerin compound around Akodudu area of Isale Oyo

title: Herdsman, Ogun
description: Fulani herdsmen and natives of the community clash after herds of cows ravage the farmland. One herdsman is murdered.

title: Land dispute, Ondo
description: Boundary on a farmland opposed Oyinmo Community in Ikare to Akungba Community in Akoko until the owner of the land, Pa Moses Ijashina, an old man was murdered. His eyes and teeth have been removed, his head broken and the body was shot and cut with cutlass.
place: Oyinmo Community in Ikare, Akoko North-East vs. Akungba Community in Akoko, Akoko South-West
lga: Akoko North East, Akoko South West

title: Intercommunal crisis, Akwa Ibom
description: Villagers from Idua Ukpata/Afaha Eduok allegedly attacked women from the host community Eyo Abasi over claims of ownership of a fishing port called Inekong which led Eyo Abasi youths to retaliate. The violence was sponsored by a politician, linked to the chairmanship elections.12 people were killed in the mayhem. No fewer than 40 houses were razed, with property worth N60 million destroyed.
causes_of_violence: political issue, crime, land issue, market issue

title: Ethno religious riots, Plateau
description: A new crisis erupts in Jos, 14 months after violence made hundreds deaths. Armed Muslim fundamentalist youths, shouting "Allahu Akbaar" attacked Christians worshippers going to churches in Nasarawa Gwong. Riots began in several areas of Jos North and extented to Bukuru metropolis. On Sunday, 17 January, around 10 casualties were recorded; this figure rises to 200 on 19 January (including 150 Muslims in Kuru Karama), 300 the following day according to Human Rights Watch & AFP. 250 people have been arrested. According to Red Cross and other relief agencies between 3000 and 17000 people fled their homes. Houses, mosques and churches have been burnt down. People were killed by fake policemen, fake soldiers, real soldiers disguised as fake's and by mob. On the border of Christian south, Jos is predominantly Christian, Hausa Muslims being minority. Vice President Goodluck Jonathan ordered army to reinforce security and keep on curfew in the area. General Abdulrahman Dambazau, chief of army, pledges to stay out of politics (BBC); Local politicians are accused of orchestrating violence to rig elections and drive Hausa Muslims out of the state. A mosque official and human rights activist told Reuters that 460 people have died, confirmed by the Red Cross. Reports say that violence have spread to Pankshin where public buildings, places of worship have been burnt (source: Channelstv) on 22 January; on 26 January as police confirm 362 deaths, more than 500 are reported. Fresh violence burst on 23 January after a soldier killed a youth sitting in front of a house. On 28 January, BBC reports that the crisis was fueled by 145 different heinous text messages addressed to both religious communities. On 29 January, the death toll is 400 and 18000 displaced (IRIN Africa, Nigerian Red Cross) 600 for the Guardian (1000 injured and 3000 displaced). On 08 February, Tell reports that nearly one thousand people died in the mayhem and, according to NEMA, at least 40,000 people were displaced. According to Jana Krause (A deadly cycle: ethno-religious conflict in Jos, Plateau State, Nigeria, Geneva, Geneva Declaration,2011, p.42), a memorandum lists a total of 968 Muslims killed: 206 in Jos North, 578 in Jos South, 144 in Barkin Ladi, as well as Bassa, Mangu and Riyom LGAs. According to Adam Higazi (The Jos Crisis: A Recurrent Nigerian Tragedy, Abuja, Friedrich-Ebert-Stiftung, Discussion Paper n° 2, 2011, p.28), Muslim religious authorities registered a total of 969 Muslim killed in January 2010, including 182 in Kuru Karama and Kuru babba on 17 Jan. 2010.
place: ECWA, Yan Trailer and Saint Luke’s Churches in Nasarawa Gwom; other areas affected by the crisis are Bauchi Road, Dutse Ukwu, Congo Russia, Sarkin Mangun, Sabon Layi, Alikazaure and Massalacin Jumaa. Bukuru market, a large commercial area to the south of Jos, was burned to the ground, with at least 1,000 shops and homes destroyed in the inferno. Up to 150 Muslim have been slaughtered and dumped in wells, in Kuru Karama village, 30km (18 miles) from the city of Jos, killed by mob on 19 January (source: HRW 10/01/23)
sources_of_information: Tell (1000 ) , The Guardian (600 ) , The Punch (362 ) , Daily Champion (460 ) , Vanguard (464 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (460 ) , Other newpapers 1 (550 )
lga: Bassa (Plateau), Barkin Ladi, Jos North, Jos South, Mangu, Pankshin, Riyom

title: Boko Haram first terrorist attack, Borno
description: 4 persons are killed by alleged Boko Haram members according to Adibe, Jideofor [2013], « What Do We Really Know About Boko Haram? », in Mantzikos, Ioannis (ed.), Boko Haram : Anatomy of a Crisis, Bristol (UK), E-International relations, pp.9-15. No precision on precise day in January 2010. This incident was not reported in the press. This is allegedly the first attack of Boko Haram since the extra-judicial killing of its leader Mohamed Yusuf in July 2009.

title: PDP groups clash in Benue
description: A crisis engulfed a local council of the state after supporters of two major PDP politicians fought. Both groups, allegedly hired militia men from Taraba.

title: JTF vs. Ijaws, Delta
description: Ijaw youths have been killed by security operatives of JTF at Chevron's site. The crisis began as police prevented workers from entering their residence in the complex because it was not closing time. Another private source reports that a bus conveying Chevron workers failed to stop at a security checkpoint in the plant and an argument was engaged beween the bus driver and security guards. Crowd grew with anger and police opened fire at people. Two Nigerian workers have been killed. In retaliation, Youths set the plant's buildings on fire. Following the incident, Chevron's Makaraba-Utonana crude oil pipeline has been attacked which has affected the delivery line from Abiteye to Escravos.
place: Escravos gas Project of Chevron Nigeria Limited
sources_of_information: Other source (private security firms, etc) (2 ) , Independent (4 ) , The Nation (2 )

title: Farmers clash with herdsmen, Nasarawa
description: A fight broke out between peasants and herdsmen on December 6 after cattle were driven into a rice field, resulting in the death of a farmer. The crisis broke again as Fulanis hired Jukun gunmen from Taraba and Ebiras from Kogi to lay ambush around the village. Over 30 persons died during that quarrel. Houses and properties have been razed down. MOPOL 38 anti-riot policemen and soldiers have been deployed. Federal government plans to settle a grazing route runing through four states, Nasarawa, Plateau, Benue and Ebonyi to put an end to these conflicts.
sources_of_information: This Day (40 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (32 ) , Daily Trust (70 )

title: Police station and bank, Ogun
description: A Divisional Police Officer, Simon Otene, has been killed by a gang of men who attacked the police station and tried to raid the bank sharing the same fence with the police station. The bandits reportedly came to set free some armed robbers allegedly detained. Two other policemen were killed in the operation.

title: Bakassi returnee, Cross River
description: Okon Edet Okon, 45, a Nigerian returnee, died after being tortured by a Camerounian gendarme. Okon, a fisherman, has been accosted by a gendarmes patrol team asking him N10,000, which he did not have. They distroyed all his equipment, sank his boat, beat him and abandoned him thinking he was dead. Few after he has been rescued by fishermen, he died. 17 Nigerians were killed by the gendarmes between September and November this year" and many more are being hunted down as they flee Abana, Atabong East /West and other areas in the crisis-torn peninsula. Repartition will be made according to this information. According to the Secretary-General, Nigerian Union in Cameroon, Prince Aston Arung, 21 Nigerian fishermen have been confirmed tortured to death by Cameroonians Gendarmes.

The crime have been committed by vigilantes from Umuchukwu with the help of police, according to the the leader of Nkerehi Town Union, Joseph Anunobi. 5 people died, 15 have been injured, seven houses burnt and properties destroyed.
