title: Movie star kidnapped, Anambra
description: Three persons were feared killed when unknown gunmen kidnapped movie star Peter Edochie on his way to his hometown, Nteje, in Oyi lga. After N10 million ransom has been paid to abductors, the Nollywood star has been released

title: Business man in Delta
description: A marine and haulage magnate, Lucky Ojo has been murdered by unknown gunmen
lga: Warri North, Warri South, Warri south west

title: Boko Haram members, Katsina
description: Police in Katsina kills two members of Boko Haram, also know as Nigerian Mujahideen, Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet) in an exchange of gun fire.

title: Islamic sect expands attacks (2), Kano
description: Violence spreads in three more states in the North as followers of Boko Haram Islamic sect (Western Education is a Sin), also know as Nigerian Mujahideen, Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet), confronts with police. While hundreds of people die in Maiduguri and Potiskum, three members of the sect are killed during the attack on the Wudil police station. Among those injured are a DPO and a MOPOL. Almost all the 50 attackers are arrested, including a 14-year old girl.
place: 3 persons are confirmed dead in Wudil, Kano State, and two others died in Potiskum, Yobe State
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (3 )

title: Islamic sect expands attacks, (3) Yobe
description: Violence spread in three states in the North as followers of Boko Haram sect confront with police. According to a private source, three policemen and a fire service staff member are killed in Potiskum, while seven policemen sustain injuries. Insurgents (around 50 youths) also free suspects in police custody. Some of them use motorcycles laden with explosives driven by a suicide bomber to attack the Potiskum police station.
place: at least 2 deaths in Potiskum, Yobe State
sources_of_information: Independent (43 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (43 ) , Vanguard (43 )

title: Islamic sect expands attacks, Borno
description: Violence spreads in the North-East as followers of the Islamic sect Boko Haram (Western Education is a Sin), also known as Nigerian Mujahideen, Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet), confront the police. Nigerian soldiers retaliate and bomb at least, 200 persons in Maiduguri; 3 are confirmed dead in Wudil, Kano State, and several others die in Potiskum, Yobe State. In Maiduguri, insurgents target government buildings, schools, mosques, churches, prisons, and the Borno State Independent Electoral Commission: a total death toll of 600 is recorded on 29 July. The leader of the sect, Mohammed Yusuf, is reportedly using some residents of the Maiduguri Railway Terminus Areas (MRTA) as human shields. Rebels from Chad, Cameroun and Niger joined the islamist militants, according to a private source, most of weapons coming from Chad. More than one thousand soldiers coming from the Third Armoured Division, based at Rukuba Barracks in Jos, are deployed in Maiduguri. An assault in a Mosquee makes about one hundred casualities. Captured by security forces, Mohammed Yusuf, is executed by police in custody. On 30 July, a total of 800 casulaties is recorded by the media (repartition as follows: 407 in Maiduguri, 43 in Yobe, 350 in Bauchi); on 02 August a Nigerian military official Col. Ben Ahanotu declares that about 700 people were killed in Maiduguri; on 03 August, according to the Red Cross 780 people have lost their lives in Maiduguri, in addition to 269 in the four districts of Boori, Old Maiduguri, Shehuri North and Yerwa; as it is reported on 06 August, the father-in-law of Yusuf Mohammed, Baga Fugu Mohammed, has been executed and buried in a mass grave. Sanni Umaru becomes the new leader of Boko Haram on 9 August 2010. According to Amnesty International, March 2011 report, a week of clashes between members of Boko Haram and security forces in Borno, Kano, Katsina and Yobe states left more than 800 people dead in July 2009, including 24 police officers. A sergeant, a prison warden and five police officers on training at the college were killed. More than 30 vehicles and a number of mosques were burnt. 29 churches were destroyed. Inmates of the prison were freed. The Administrative Committee of Inquiry into the Boko Haram Insurgency in Borno State claimed that 1,118 people lost their lives during the 5 days fighting in Maiduguri. But as often in Nigeria, the government never published the report. Appointed by Governor Ali Modu Sheriff, the Commission of Inquiry was led by Ambassador Usman Gaji Galtimari and documented that 1,118 people were killed in Maiduguri and Jere LGAs from 27 July to 1 August 2009, with those unaccounted for bringing the total up to a possible 1,387. Out of the 1,118 victims, the government (NSCDC) buried 446, including 154 bodies deposited in front of the Umaru Shehu Hospital and 109 at University of Maiduguri Teaching Hospital. Mohammed Yusuf himself was buried along Boma Road after Dal on quarry site. The NSCDC also estimated that relatives buried 22 corpses by themselves. 8 bodies were found separately in various locations. The Galtimari report listed the loss of: 2 soldiers, 24 policemen, 5 officers of the Prison Service, 1 State Security Service contractor and 2 customs staff. In addition, Boko Haram killed 35 Christian residents of Maiduguri in July 2009 (37 according to Human Rights Watch (HRW) for Borno State as a whole).
sources_of_information: New Nigerian (500 ) , human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (1049 ) , The Nation (700 ) , Independent (407 ) , police (1118 )

title: Fundamentalist Islamists' attacks, Borno
description: During the violence unleashed by Boko Haram sect (Western Education is a Sin), also know as Nigerian Mujahideen,Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet), the militants kill a police officer. See also event 5109.

title: Fundamentalist Islamists' attacks, Borno
description: During the violence unleashed by Boko Haram sect (Western Education is a Sin), also know as Nigerian Mujahideen,Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet), the militants burn down a police headquarters, a church and customs office, leaving an unknow number of dead. See also events 5109 and 5808.

title: Muslims vs. police, Bauchi
description: Members of Islamist sect Boko Haram (Western Education is a Sin), also known as Nigerian Mujahideen,Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet) launch synchronized attacks across the city after midnight. They first strike Dutsen Tanshi police station to seize arms. The attacks kills 51 people, both militants and policemen. The Taliban also strike the Federal Low-cost Housing Estate and kill soldiers. Most militants are poor and the sect network offers free education for their children supplying the network with new militants. Red alert is put in the neighbouring Plateau State. On July 29, a death toll of 600 persons is recorded since the clash starts in Maiduguri; (on 30 July, a total of 800 casulaties (repartition as follows: 407 in Maiduguri, 43 in Yobe, 350 in Bauchi); on 31 July, Boko Haram Islamic sect leader Muhammed Yusuf is reportedly killed by police in custody; his followers take refuge in Chad; on 30 July, a human rights group, Civil Rights Congress, reports that the number of casualties is about 400 in Bauchi. Private source reports that at least 176 members of the muslim group are detained by police. On 9 August, Sanni Umaru declares himself the new leader of Boko Haram movement. According to a private source, they destroy the police station; over 40 sect members are killed, an over 200 arrested.
place: Attack of several police stations (Dutsen Tanshi), governemental buildings (Federal Low-cost Housing Estate). They also attacked police officers' home, prison guards, prisons.
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (400 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (300 ) , Independent (350 ) , This Day (150 ) , Other newpapers 1 (200 ) , The Guardian (200 )

title: Boko Haram's sect militant, Borno
description: Hassan Sani Badami, a senior Boko Haram sect's militant (Western Education is a Sin, also know as Nigerian Mujahideen,Taliban or Al Sunna Wal Jamma: Followers of the Prophet), is shot dead by the police. The police claims that he killed himself during the explosion of his home-made bomb.

title: Farmers vs. herdsmen, Benue
description: The police have reported the killing of five persons in an armed conflict between Tiv farmers and Fulani herdsmen ; about 500 villagers had been displaced in the process. Fulani herdsmen who re-located to Daudu, a major town in Guma council on the Malurdi-Lafia road. The Fulanis wrote a petition to the State Police Command, alleging that new fighters are being deployed to kill them and their cattle. Presence of mobile policemen is reported in Kwande whereas police faces fighting in Guma
place: in Tse-Ande village in Mbayar/Yandev district of Guma

title: Communal crisis in Benue
description: Nyieev and Uyougho communities, each supported with militias, fought over land: 3 persons died and 760 are homeless

title: Okengwen vs. Obehira, Kogi
description: To prevent recurring clashes in Okene, masquerade activities were indefinitely banned in the area. However, one parade have been organised and used to terrorise the rival community. The crisis hardened after reprisals: 8 people died

title: Bandits, Delta
description: Two notorious robbers have been shot dead by police

title: Communal crisis, Ebonyi
description: A renewed dispute between Ezillo and Ezza communities claimed the lifes of 2 persons; 3 others are feared missing

title: Bank customers's robbery in Ebonyi
description: A bank customer's gang robbery has been dismantled by police. Two bandits were shot down at gun point after they stole N1.29 million

title: Communal clash in Benue
description: A communal crisis between the people of Nyiev in Turan community and Uyoo in Nanev clan over a fertile piece of land and witchcraft led to the death of two persons. The two communities allegedly engaged the services of militiamen.

title: Communal clash in Benue
description: A bloody crisis between the Hausa Fulani herdsmen and Tiv farmers has claimed the lives of no fewer than 8 persons. The crisis blew up when Fulani nomads arrived with cattle to graze heightening the tension between both communities as Fulani residents use large quantities of water
place: In Adaka village some few kilometers away from Makurdi town

title: Communal clash in Benue
description: A communal crisis erupted between Mbagen and Mzorov communities over ownership of farmlands. Many houses, farmlands and property worth millions of Naira have been destroyed and eight people died

title: Communal clash, Rivers
description: The conflict between two border communities of Nkim and Nkum, over farmland has claimed the lives of five persons. “Nkum people alleged that the Nkim people were encroaching on their farmland and also part of the land which the Nkim people are living on belong to them. This claim is being disputed by the people of Nkim, and this led to the crisis,” Okoro Agba, told an Igbo resident of the area

title: DPO, Ogun
description: The DPO in charge of Lafenwa Police Station, Adesola Okesola, was killed by unknown gunmen
place: in front of the police station

title: Community clash, Benue
description: A crisis erupted between a female student and another one, a Tiv over who should fetch water first in a borehole. After she complained to police, the Tiv has been arrested. The Tiv community went on rampage, leading to the death of seven persons

title: PDP Women Leader, Akwa Ibom
description: Lady Maria Ikpe, PDP's Women Leader in Akwa Ibom State has been assassinated in a kidnap attempt by 5 unknown gunmen. She survived the last attack in December after being shot on the head. The murder might be politically motivated, as she was said to be very powerful within the party and the community

title: Religious crisis over parking space, Bauchi
description: A religious crisis started as 2 factions of Izala Islamic sect disagreed on the place where to hold the Juma'at prayers. According to other sources, the disagreement then opposed muslims and christians over a parking space between the Church of Christ in Nigeria and a Friday Mosque. 11 people were burnt out of which 6 christians; a dozen of churches and one mosque have been set ablaze. The following day, on February 22, two churches, Deeper Life Church Ministry and Truth and Transformation Bible Church, were burnt by Muslim youths: one more person has been killed despite the curfew imposed in seven wards of the capital. The Nigerian Red Cross Society distributes food to hundreds of families (up to 5000 persons) displaced. Death toll : 12 persons. A source reports the disagreement between two islamic sects
place: The crisis at the origin located in the Railways and Makama extensions of the Federal Low Cost Housing area of the metropolis; Churches burnt in Bayan Gari. 13th person killed along Dutse Tanshi road; Many people fled in Jos. Deeper life Church Ministry and Truth and Transformation Bible Church both in Bayan Gari are burnt by irate youths.
sources_of_information: Independent (11 ) , police (11 ) , Daily Champion (11 ) , The Punch (11 ) , Vanguard (11 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Footballers' team, Delta
description: Thirteen footballers and their supporters were on Friday evening murdered by some unknown gunmen. The deceased identified as footballers and supporters of Ocean Boys Football Club in Bayelsa State, were said to be travelling for a football match slated for Sunday in Ughelli before they were ambushed by the assailants. Football supporters belonging to different cult groups clashed overnight
place: ambush at Uvweru community, East/West Road, near Ughelli. Clashes followed in Ughelli at Opolo area and in a night club in Kpansia

title: Bureau de change's raid, Ogun
description: Bandits arriving at a bureau de change ordered its Chairman, Alhaji Amidu Usman, at gunpoint to surrender all the money in his vault.The bandits killed one person who attempted to escape

title: Murder and tension, Plateau
description: After two corpses have been discovered, rumors of fresh attacks threatens the metropolis heightened by a letter signed by Idris Ibn Mohammed on behalf of JIC calling for a total Jihad against Plateau State because of the unfulfilled promises made to the Jasawa Association: create a chiefdom for the Hausa/Fulani community within Jos, install an Emir for the community, create a LGA out of Jos North for the Hausas with headquarters in Angwan-Rogo
causes_of_violence: land issue, political issue, religious issue
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: Bush Boys leader, Rivers
description: Sunny Opuabe, the leader of the Bush Boys a.ka. Peace Makers has been shot dead by unknown gunmen. While the Bush Boys were accused of working for ANPP, the Vigilante were said to be working for the PDP. Both groups struggled for the control of Okrika, a major Ijaw clan
place: along Aboloma Road at a drinking spot

title: Shot in Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen killed two persons overnight

title: Death at University, Abia
description: After a crisis erupted in ABSU university, two persons died and many were injured. Cult groups operating inside the university killed the porter for a handset. Youths of his village organised a protest in the university resulting to the death of the student

title: Police kill robbers in Kaduna
description: A team of Operation Yaki, a security outfit, killed two robbers while they were operating. One man died after these bandits cut him with a machete
place: Federal Housing Authority, Goni Gora, in the outskirts of the capital city

title: Attack on Shell, Total vessels in Rivers
description: Heavily armed militants on Saturday night invaded the crude oil loading platform and shot at several vessels. A security source said the gunmen, who came in speedboats, stormed the platform at about 10.pm and opened fire on an oil tanker, “Front Chief,” belonging to Total Oil Nigeria Limited. Some of the vessels and tugboats attacked within the loading terminal vicinity included Premier Njasi, MT Front Chief and two service boats; Wax Bill and MV Gabriel. It was feared that the captain and one of the crewmen of the tanker belonging to Royal Dutch Shell have been killed during the attack. It was also feared that the entire crew on Wax Bill might have been abducted as the vessel was found adrift near Total Amenam Field on January 18.
causes_of_violence: political issue, crime, oil production, oil distribution
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , The Punch (2 )

title: PDP crisis, Ogun
description: Adeboye known as Lobito, a musician and youth leader in Ward 9, Ijebu North LGA, was reportedly killed in retaliation for the death of the member of a rival group. The crisis between the supporters of the governor and his opponents has been fuelled by Wakilu Kuku, a councillor from Ijebu North LGA who condemns illegal deductions of allocation by the state

title: Islamic groups clashed, Kaduna
description: Clashes between rival Islamic groups, the Salafiyya (allegedly linked to Osama bin Ladin) and the Shiites (led by Sheikh Ibraheem el-Zakzaky) killed at least five people and wounded dozens more on Friday. Trouble started on Tuesday after members of the radical Shi'ite Islamic Movement in Nigeria were accused of attacking the convoy of the Emir of Zaria, Alhaji Shehu Idris. Tuesday was Ashura day, commemorating the 10th day of Muharram in the Islamic calendar when the grandson of the Prophet Mohammed was martyred. No evidence that the Salafiyya was linked to the jihadist sect Boko Haram.
sources_of_information: Daily Champion (7 ) , The Nation (5 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newpapers 1 (5 )

title: Traditional stool, Lagos
description: A crisis erupted inside a community over traditional stool disputed by 2 Baales (chiefs)

title: Militants vs. JTF, Bayelsa
description: A foiled attempt to blow up a flow station which produces an average of 10,000 barrels of oil per day, led to the death of 3 bandits and one soldier

title: Iyalode of Yorubaland, Ogun
description: Unknown gunmen visited the home of Iyalode of Yorubaland, Mrs Alaba Lawson and stabbed her security guard, Alhaji Yusuf Abdsakim, to death.

title: Communal crisis, Benue
description: A chieftaincy dispute led to the death of 7 people, 50 houses burnt and more than 500 displaced. Following the death of the village head, two influential families using militias struggled for the vacant stool

title: NURTW clash and ethnic crisis, Ondo
description: Ugbos and Mahin people, members of NURTW disagreed over where to site a motor park; the crisis took an ethnic dimension : Mahin youths stormed the residence of High Chief Oliha in Igbokoda and 2 people died during the fight which broke out

title: Communal clash, Rivers
description: A chieftaincy tussle between two factions led to death of 5 persons. A notorious cult gang leader involved in the crisis has been arrested.

title: Policemen, Delta
description: Bandits attacked a pools agent in a lonely spot of the road; 2 policemen on escort died in the ambush. Robbers fled with money

title: Communal Crisis,Taraba
description: Crisis between Tarok and Kwala people at border have claimed the lives of 10 people
place: at border settlement between Taraba and Plateau States, Dongo-Rua in Dampar district of the council

title: Farmers vs. rearers, Katsina
description: Farmers and Fulani cattle rearers clashed in Bakori, killing 4, and in Faskari, a 70 year man was killed in a reprisal attack. Fulani herdsmen fled the area after the incident leaving their herds of cattle which were detained at Mairuwa Motor Park pending the confirmation of ownership of the herds.
place: in the villages of Gidan Bakori, Barde and Kwantakwaran

title: Ethnic-religious clash over elections, Plateau
description: Christians from the PDP were declared winner of the State elections but Muslims from the ANPP contested the results. A clash ensued, homes, mosques, churches were burnt. Tensions oppose Christians or animists natives and settlers from the Hausa-speaking Muslim North vying for control of fertile farmlands. A muslim charity said it collected more than 300 bodies, the information minister for Plateau Nuhu Gagara reported 200 dead; according to the Nigerian Red Cross, 10,000 people fled their homes and camped in various locations of the metropolis. On November 30 Agence France Press reports that 381 bodies were yesterday placed in a mosque. On December 1st, a Muslim official at the main mosquee, Murtala Sani Hashim reports 367 bodies. Healths officials report at least 400 bodies; other sources report 500 buried in mass grave, on 1st December. On December 30, Agence France Press reports that the police carried out more then 90 summary executions in the course of suppressing violence. Human Right Watch reports that at least 130 people have been killed by policemen and soldiers. On 29 july it has been reported that "sectarian attacks in Jos claimed nearly 1,000 lives". Mercenaries are said to have been brought from neighbouring states (maybe linked to Boko Haram). Muslim religious authorities in Jos registered between 469 and 632 dead amongst Hausa/Fulani; Catholics, 23. Stefanos Foundation named 103 Christians dead in Congo-Russia, Nasarawa, Rikkos, Sarki Mangu and Tudun Wada. Ajibola Plateau State Judicial Commission states that 312 people were killed, including 118 Christian Ibo and 31 Yoruba.
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (632 ) , Daily Triumph (500 ) , Independent (1000 ) , Daily Champion (500 ) , This Day (350 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (400 ) , Other newpapers 1 (400 )
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: INTELS Chief, Rivers
description: The Deputy General Manager of INTELS Ltd., Mr. Chuks Ihuoma, has been shot dead by unknown gunmen
place: at the entrance of his house, in Rumubekwe Housing Estate

title: Siege, Kwara
description: Robbers laid siege on a road barricated by the bandits: they dispossed people and escaped: 10 people were killed

title: Gang leader, Lagos
description: A gang leader has been killed by police as the bandits were attacking travellers on the expressway

title: Corps member, Edo
description: A 29 year-old NYSC member, a graduate of Agric Economics, Miss Osaze Omorodion was murdered by unknown gunmen who fled the scene with 2 mobile phones
place: Benin city at the family house, Okungbowa Street, off Siluko Road

title: Journalist, Nasarawa
description: Nigerian journalist Eiphraim Audu from NBS was shot dead by six unknown gunmen near his home ; the gang had previously raided the football club nearby. Christian lobbies claim without evidence that he was killed because he was a Catholic likely to take the position of a Muslim as general manager of NBS.

title: Catholic Priest, Delta
description: A Catholic Priest, John Mark Ikpik who was going to settle an accident case involving a vehicle belonging to his church has been shot dead in his head by bandits who stole his Hyundai car and fled; the same gang shot 3 mobile policemen in a separate operation
place: Isiokolo; the car was later abandoned in Ohruwhorum, in Udu LGA

title: Trans-border armed robbers, Borno
description: Borno vigilante group killed six suspected trans-border armed robbers wearing military uniforms and armed with sophisticated weapons while police reportedly shot one of the 20 armed bandits that attacked a police officer, Javan J. Bahar

title: Lagos bank robbery
description: Bandits fitted out with army camouflage and sophisticated weapons stormed a bank. They shot into the air at the entrance of the banking hall. As some okada motorcyclists threw missiles on them, they fired gun shots in retaliation, killing five people and wounding another six.
place: Orile-Iganmu area, Odonade bus stop end of the Mile 2 Orile expressway

title: Auchi Poly student shot dead, Edo
description: Arsonists set ablaze a Mercedes Benz 190 car belonging to the institution’s ASUP chairman, while a faction of the union was in struggle with the management of the institution. During the crisis, a cousin to the welfare secretary of the polytechnic ASUP has been shot dead in his room

title: Bakassi crisis (expatriate)
description: During an attack in 3 speed boats, Cameroonian gendarmes clashed with rebels calling themselves the Niger Delta Defence and Security Council (NDDSC). Naval forces riposted, killed 10 attackers, captured 8 others. According to other sources, 24 gendarmes and a French soldier were killed and following reprisals, 21 militants have been shot dead
place: Kombo-Abedimo, Ine Nkankure, Ine Iwang and Zion, near Abana

title: Bandits on the road, Enugu
description: Robbers operating along the highway killed two persons travelling in commercial buses

title: Extra-judicial killings, Enugu
description: A team of policemen and vigilantes operatives killed an undergraduate in a search operation of bandits. Residents of the village protested
place: near Amechi street, near the home of the victim
lga: Enugu South, Enugu North, Enugu East

title: ANPP candidate, Lagos
description: The ANPP candidate for Yagba Federal Constituency to the April 2007 election, Dr Olubayode Olufende Aworo has been killed by armed-robbers. Proprietor of Roland Hospital in Lagos Island, consultant to international humanitarian bodies, he was returning from a ceremony to Ota when he was ambushed by the bandits

title: Communal clash, Enugu
description: Uwenu and Uwani communities clashed. Many houses were destroyed during the crisis, 2 schools have been closed and people fled the villages
sources_of_information: The Nation (12 ) , The Punch (12 ) , This Day (12 )

title: Communal crisis, Cross-River
description: Peasants and youths disagreed wih chieftaincy and politicians over the sharing and distribution of the palm oil in the area; a confrontation between youths and police led to the death of 2 policemen

title: Murder, Taraba
description: A car dealer, Emmanuel Idris, has been murdered by unknown gunmen
place: in his house at Abuja Phase II area

title: Biafra Day, Abia
description: 3 people died as MASSOB celebrated Biafra, reportedly shot by police; MASSOB declared that more than 2000 members were killed between May 2000 and April 2008 by security forces all over the country. More than 1000 members are in detention and attacks against the movement did not stop. From 23 to 31 May, peace meetings will be held in Igbo lands, as announced by the coordinator, M. Ikechukwu Ekwe. On 2008-05-14 it has been reported that 1044 members have been shot in Onitsha in 2006 and 2007. A Major crisis appears to have engulfed the Movement, with the director of information, David Mac Davies alleging on June 04 that MASSOB leader, Chief Ralph Uwazurike has betrayed the struggle. Davies, who announced his resignation from the Movement, accused Uwazurike of having been compromised by the Federal Government, which, he said, made the leader to abandon about 130 members of MASSOB currently languishing in detention.
sources_of_information: The Nation (3 ) , Daily Champion (3 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Bandits in Kwara
description: Robbers specialized in motorists' attacks have been killed by police and vigilentes

title: Hoodlums, Taraba
description: Police killed four suspected bandits in a gunbattle; 14 arrested

title: Police Chief, Edo
description: Tony Odidi, CSP, brother to Council Chairman, Stanly Odidi, was murdered by unknown gunmen

title: Communal crisis, Benue
description: Mbalan and Kendev communities clashed over the property of lands. Both communities were supported by armed militias leading to 20 deaths
sources_of_information: Other source (private security firms, etc) (20 ) , The Guardian (20 )

title: Benue communal crisis
description: New clash between Mbatange-Mbalagh community of Gwer and Kendev-Mbamar of Konshisha after an ambush leading to the death of 4 students of the College of Education, Oju in Gwer

title: Communal crisis, Delta
description: Crisis erupted during the election of the executive of Ekpan Youth Association and the community leadership. A Dissenting group, under the aegis of Ekpan StakeholdersGroup engaged in a battle which led to 4 dead

title: Bullion van's attack, Ogun
description: A gang of 10 robbers attacked a bullion van belonging to a new generation bank and shot the driver in the arm. The driver carried on driving the van into town, followed by the bandits and police. The fierce 30 minutes gun battle made 7 deaths; at least 7 people were rushed to OOUTH hospital

title: Fulani herdsmen clash with farmers, Anambra
description: Farmers were trying to chase herdsmen whose cattle were grazing on their farmland. The fracas made 9 dead

title: Briton, Lagos (expatriate)
description: A British national in charge of West African gas pipelines has been killed by unknown gunmen. All the passengers, another Briton and an American were robbed
place: Nigeria/ Benin border, Seme road, in a traffic jam

title: Bullion van, Enugu
description: A bullion van was attacked by a gang of robbers: a policeman and 3 bank officials were killed. After the attack, one petroleum attendant was killed as he was delaying the bandits

title: Police custody, Niger
description: A violent protest erupted after PDP announced the results of the LGA elections in Bukana Ward. A suspect arrested in connection with the crisis died in police custody after having been beaten.

title: Gunmen on rampage, Delta (2)
description: Gunmen opened fire at policemen attached to the immediate past president of the UPU Chief Benjamin Okumagba. An Inspector and a sergeant were shot dead by the rampaging bandits. It seemed to be a revenge mission (see evt 3252)

title: Benue communal clash
description: 4 persons are feared dead and several others injured in a renewed clash between Tiv community and Fulani herdsmen following an alleged pollution of a community dam by a group of Fulani herdsmen: the latter were bathing into the drinking water dam : 3 Tiv and 1 Fulani died in gunfight
place: Orkpe, Mbakur, a village some 10 kilometers South East of Makurdi

title: NTA worker, Anambra
description: 20 armed bandits invaded the studios of Nigerian Television. They stole personal belongings from the workers injuring them with machetes. One worker who recognised one of the robbers has been killed

title: Oil worker murdered, Rivers (expatriate)
description: An oil worker, Harold Manilla has been murdered as gunmen/militants attempted to abduct him. He was forced into gunmen's vehicle and died, beaten to death. The bandits abandonned the victim and left. One militant has been caught by neighbours alerted by the victim's wife cry of help
place: at the residence of the victim

title: Kwali Council Chairman, FCT
description: Mr Samuel Gwamna Mari, areal Council Chairman has been murdered by 4 unknown gunmen while his orderly and driver sustained serious injuries during the attack. The police orderly later died at the Gwagwalada Specialist Hospital in Abuja and as reported on 2008/04/07, 9 persons are in police custody for these murders
sources_of_information: The Guardian (2 ) , Daily Trust (1 ) , The Punch (1 )

title: Businessman, Sokoto
description: A 52-year old businessman, Anthony Otulu has been killed at his residence by unknown gunmen; business competitors might be responsible for that crime

title: Communal clash, Zamfara
description: 30 Fulani herdsmen coming from Niger invaded a village with 5000 cattle and destroyed farm produce. When farmers prevented them to go into the farms a gunbattle was engaged, killing 7 people including 2 policemen

title: Traders clash in Anambra
description: A crisis in the Electronics Dealers’ Association degenerated to rioting; it concerns elections into executive offices: 2 deads

title: Bauchi riot
description: A riot opposing Christians and Muslims about the building of a mosque made 1 dead; houses, churches, mosques were razed and curfew imposed by the governor; on 2008-03-07 it is reported that 11 people were killed in the Yelwa crisis
place: In the state capital, Yelwa Kagadana area

title: Foiled supermarket raid, Lagos
description: A gang of 6 robbers attempted to storm a supermarket. Police and vigilantes prevented the success of the operation and one robber was killed. A retired army officer was among the bandits

title: Robbers terrorise a community, Ogun
description: 20 bandits stormed a community in 5 vehicles; 2 girls, 16 and 4-year old were killed

title: Robbers vs. police, Lagos
description: Robbers invaded a bank and were about to enter the strongroom when police arrived. After a gunbattle 2 policemen died and their arms were stolen by the bandits

title: Jigawa Governor's aid, Kano
description: Unknown gunmen hacked to death Alhaji Alqasim Ahmad Gwaram, the Special Adviser to Governor Sule Lamindo of Jigawa State as he was returning from the mosquee
place: Kano, Naibawa quarters, at his private residence

title: Gbaraun massacre, Bayelsa
description: Military men suspected to belong to JTF raided a community during 5 hours killing 38 Ijaw people and destructing properties. The community wants the Presidency to set up investigations. The corpses of the slain people have been taken away by the invading soldiers

title: Murder, Lagos
description: A young girl, was murdered by unknown gunmen at the entrance of her father's house, as she urged him to open the gate
place: 12, Adewunmi street, Alaro Estate, Meiran, Ojokoro

title: Fulani herdsmen vs Hausa farmers, Jigawa
description: After a dog incident, a Fulani village was razed by the neighbouring community. At last 2 villages were destroyed

title: Oil terminal attack, Akwa Ibom
description: An export oil terminal has been attacked by about 60 militants. One pregnant woman was killed in the crossfire between navy and bandits who snatched 2 machine guns. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack

title: Police woman killed, Yobe
description: Armed-robbers stormed a house and stabbed 6 times a nursing widow who is still alive. A police woman who was visiting her has been killed by the bandits
place: behind legislators quarters along Gujba road

title: Lawyer assassination, Lagos
description: A lawyer resting in an eatery was shot dead by unknown gunmen

title: Naval College staff shot dead, Rivers
description: A Naval College staff was attacked by unknown gunmen at his ancestral home. This death could be linked to cultist issues but also to a violent disagreement between this man's community, Nwebiara community, and Barako community

title: PDP member killed, Oyo
description: Segun Oladimeji, PDP chieftain, close associate of Alhaji Lamidi Adedibu of Ibadan and member of the House of Representatives as Lagelu/Akinyele Federal Constituency representative was shot dead by two men. The men arrested in connection with the murder are all from an opposition party and almost all of them were either candidates in the last election or are running in forthcoming council polls. However, Oladimeji's son linked the assassination to intra-party crisis. Action Congress condemned the murder.
place: in front of the PDP secretariat, Ejioku village, along Iwo Road
sources_of_information: Independent (1 ) , The Nation (1 ) , New Nigerian (1 ) , Other newpapers 1 (1 ) , This Day (1 ) , Vanguard (1 ) , The Punch (1 ) , Daily Champion (1 ) , The Guardian (1 )

title: Gunfight at petrol station, Delta
description: After organising a road block (event 2385), an armed gang, including Hausa/Fulani herdsmen attacked a petrol station. The 15 year gang leader, one policeman and another bandit were killed. The 3 other bandits fled with gun shot wounds

title: Youth kills 5 women, Imo
description: A young man massacred five women with his cutlass. 3 belonged to his family. He was injured by the police when he resisted his arrest and died on the way to the hospital.
sources_of_information: Independent (6 ) , The Punch (6 ) , Daily Champion (6 ) , Vanguard (5 )

title: Massacre in Rivers
description: The Hausa Community declare it lost 38 men in a planned massacre by cultists sponsored by the administration of former Governor Peter Odili. Through ACF families ask for compensation
place: Yam zone, Creek road market and Gambia Street Port Harcourt

title: PDP member shot dead, Delta
description: Rex Ezonfade, member of the PDP and Director General of the Albert Okumagba Governorship Campaign Organisation, was shot dead by unknown gunmen in front of his apartment complex. The assasins seem to have been led by a former army officer.
place: Crystal Palace Estate, NNPC Housing Complex Road, Warri, He died at Shell Clinic
lga: Warri North, Warri South, Warri south west

title: Businessman, FCT
description: Unknown gunmen shot the director of Zulahatu Petroleum Company, partner with United Arab Emirates businessmen who were about to invest in Nigeria

title: Chieftaincy dispute, Bayelsa
description: Chieftaincy dispute in the community of Peremabiri leading to 2 deaths. The crisis is linked to Agip royalties paid to the community recently.

title: Students killed by cultists, Edo
description: Several students may have been killed in a cult-related crisis. The Federal Polytechnic Rector denies the deaths.

title: House to house robbery, Benue
description: Gunduel between a gang of 20 robbers and anti-robbery policemen who killed 6 bandits, partly recovering the loot

title: Ex-Councillor murdered, Akwa-Ibom
description: Mrs Marie Ata Udo, Ex-Councillor has been murdered by unknown gunmen

title: Agric teacher, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen killed a senior agric teacher in his classroom. He may have been victim of a communal conflict in his Rumuekpe Community in Emuoha LGA

title: Road bandits, Yobe
description: Robbers blocked the road twice the same day. One traveller was killed

title: Communal clash and Royal father's Death, Rivers
description: 4 communities were said to have erupted in crisis claiming 8 to 12 deads, including the murder of a Royal Father (traditional ruler) in Kpor community. Cult groups have been called to fight over Chieftaincy tussle

title: Benue/Cross River border clash: Mbakpeghe vs. Bebe
description: Land dispute between Mbakpeghe in Benue and their Bebe neighbours in Cross River State making 3 deads; the dispute erupted after the Bebe sold a fertile land to Gob Logo Company Limited, producers of cassava chips; 50 houses were torched: hundreds of residents of Mbakpeghe Village had fled to Adipko, headquarters of Kwande; 5000 displaced in Benue crisis

title: Land dispute : Konshisha, Benue
description: This land dispute involved 3 villages ; 5000 displaced in Benue crisis

title: Benue/Ebonyi boundary crisis: Agila vs. Ngbo
description: Invasion of Agila community of Benue by Ngbo of Ebonyi. They vandalized a school and a church, 2 people were mutilated to death. The dispute concerns a piece of land
sources_of_information: The Nation (2 ) , The Guardian (2 ) , New Nigerian (2 )

title: Youth's leader, Rivers
description: Unknown gunmen shot dead a youth leader. Residents in the community fled in large number. 2 other people died

title: Fulani hedsman, Kebbi
description: For 2 years hoodlums attack Fulani herdsmen on the bank of River Niger, border zone between Nigeria and Benin Republic. A 18-year boy who pastured his father's cattle was killed while 70 of his cows were stolen

title: Communal crisis over burial, Benue
description: Bloody communal crisis over funerals. A family about to bury a member were attacked by indigenes opposed to the burial because the deceased was a settler. 3 people were macheted to death, several huts burnt

title: Benue/Cross River clash : Ikyurav Ya
description: Ikyurav Ya community of Kwande were attacked by their Cross River neighbours ; 5000 displaced in Benue crisis ; on 07/20/07 it is reported that the land is rich in precious stones and the owner has been killed : the crisis made 14 deads

title: Robbers beaten and burnt by youths, Delta
description: After having a car accident, bandits were operating and trying to get another car when armed youths overpowered them, beat and set them ablaze. Robbers killed a businesswoman before being caught
place: Ekurede, Itsekiri junction on NPA Bypass

title: Militia operation in Benue/Taraba border
description: Land crisis on the boundary against Tiv community

title: Bandits' attack, Nasarawa
description: Fulani men suspected to rob citizen and motorists during the past 3 weeks, several people including a policeman died

title: Communal crisis is looming in Cross River
description: A village has been attacked by mercenaries of neighbouring villages. Several deads. The crisis seems serious in the area

title: Mayhem in Oyo over Council poll 2
description: Thugs went on rampage, killing people and burning houses, cars and kidnapped several persons linked to the state governor, A. R. A. Ladoja. People died during factional crisis between members of the NURTW. The factional chairman of NURTW loyal to Governor Ladoja, A. G. Abubakre and others with him were detained at the home of controversial policician A. L. Adedibu.

title: Oyo crisis
description: After the mayhem the day the Chairman was inaugurated, 5 people have been adbucted and one killed.

title: Community clash in Bayelsa
description: Akamas from Brass clashed with Koluamas from Southern Ijaw over fishing ports; Many buildings were burned, 4 people died. This crisis lasts for 3 decades

title: Police station's attack in Enugu
description: Shoot-out between police and bandits while they were attacking the police station : 2 policemen and 2 bandits died
place: inside the Nigerian Railway Corporation Compound
lga: Enugu South, Enugu North, Enugu East

title: Bank raid in Lagos
description: Bandits raided a commercial bank, killed 3 policemen and 2 civilians

title: Land dispute in Delta
description: Umuesele community is in disagreement with Umuebu over a land the Supreme Court judged in the favour of the latest. Neighbours, the Eniozus got involved in the crisis, killing Umuesele members, burning houses and a petrol station. 8 deaths, 3 according to police, including 2 beheaded

title: Civilians killed by soldiers
description: Chased by soldiers and trying to explain they were not bandits, 2 men on business trip were shot, one died

title: Fundamentalists kill policemen in Kano
description: Armed muslims, called Taliban (also know as Nigerian Mujahideen, Boko Haram (Western Education is a Sin), Al Sunna Wal Jamma (Followers of the Prophet) attack a police station and gun a truck transporting police officers; a DPO, his wife and policemen are killed. Invaders flee in Kano waterworks, Challawa. After 24 h siege, army is deployed, 30 militants are killed during the shootout. The incident comes four days after the murder of a prominent Islamic scholar, Sheik Ja'afar Mahmood Adam by unknown assailants at the Dorayi Juma'at Mosque in Kano. These fundamentalists, allegedly come from the Sudan, Chad and Maiduguri in Borno State; they are supposedly trained in Mauritanian camps by Al'Qaeda organisation. They claim to avenge the killing of Sheik Ja'afar Mahmood Adam. At the Kano State Judicial Commission of Enquiry, a witness says that attackers were only 7, including a woman carrying a baby, and not 150 or 500 as alleged by security forces. According to him, they first killed 10 policemen, then 13 Mopol.
place: Panshekara police station, Bayero University road
sources_of_information: New Nigerian (42 ) , Other source (private security firms, etc) (63 ) , Independent (40 ) , The Nation (42 ) , This Day (42 ) , The Punch (42 ) , Vanguard (42 )

title: FRSC officers
description: Thugs invade FRSC office at Aria Road, Sharada, and take away a patrol's team vehicle and uniforms belonging to the command. 4 officers are shot during the operation. It is later revealed that the attackers are most likely "Boko Haram" members.
place: at Kano Sector Command HQ, Zaria road, behind Unity Bank
sources_of_information: This Day (4 ) , Independent (4 ) , Daily Trust (4 ) , Vanguard (4 )

title: Police station besieged
description: Bandits stormed a police station taking away arms and ammunition. 2 policemen killed in the operation

title: Land dispute in Logo, Benue
description: Land crisis between 2 villages, clash claimed 3 lives, several homes and farmlands have been razed.
place: Kpav and Mbashaha villages in the Ugondo district.

title: Police/robbers gunduel
description: Kwara state police engaged themselves in a gunduel with a gang of 30 bandits who stormed Jebba and its environs for several months, one died during it.

title: Boy 9-year
description: boy has been murdered by armed bandits who stormed area where he lived.
place: at Idahosa state in Benin city

title: Youths vs. cultists
description: Clash arised when youths dicovered than Lion Zone boys cultists hijacked their sand excavating job. Youths shot dead 6 cultists including their leader Gabon. 2 men have been arrested in relation with this crisis

title: Owu chief
description: Meeting between the Olowu of Owu and Obas in Atan turned to blood with the shooting of 3, including an Owu chief, Adedotun Sowole, and the son of the Baale of lyana Iyesi. Clash might be linked with the fact that the Olowu installed last year 11 obas, leading to political crisis between Owu and Awori communities.
sources_of_information: New Nigerian (4 ) , This Day (4 ) , The Nation (4 ) , The Guardian (4 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Soldiers vs. bandits
description: Bandits stormed a military checkpoint, taking away service rifles and killing 2 soldiers pertaining to Operation Restore Hope
place: at Delta Steel Company, on Orhumworhum road, Ovwian Aladja.

title: Woman, daughter in Ogun
description: Mother and daughter taken in hostage and shot by unknown gunmen

title: Street urchins vs. commercial bus drivers
description: Street urchins and commercial bus drivers crisis over who had the right to collect tolls from motorists, making one dead; this crisis followed the fracas on Ojuelegba and Okokomaiko the previous day

title: Delta clash over cattle
description: Clash between Fulani herdsmen and Enhwe Community over crops destruction by cattle

title: Police woman
description: A police woman has been raped and murdered by bandits in presence of police husband
place: 17, Suru Street, opposite secretariat of Agege local government

title: PDP primaries : "Aliade massacre"
description: Violence over the annulment of the results of the state House of Assembly, which announced Dr Ayar Gwer winner before to be reversed in favour of Asema Achado. Mobile policemen held for responsible
sources_of_information: Vanguard (10 ) , The Punch (10 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , The Nation (7 )

title: Street gangs war makes 4 deads
description: Crisis between factionnal groups of street gangs paralysed area and made 4 deads.
place: Gaskiya street in Ijora Badyia area

title: Sectarian crisis
description: Fundamentalist Muslims clash over Mandiri music in Islam

title: Hallmark, first Atlantic
description: 3 bandits and their leader tracked down

title: Robbers attack motorists
description: Armed bandits attacked motorists to steal money and rape women. Death toll: 5 deads.
lga: Etinan, Ikot Abasi, Mkpat Enin, Uyo

title: Bodo cultists clash
description: Renewed crisis between the two rival cult groups Dewell and Degbam

title: Anambra renewed crisis
description: Gunbattle between police and armed robbers. 1 man killed in Akpapa forest, 1 in Fegge, others downtown. Massob denies involvement
place: Akpapa forest, Fegge at Silas Works road, Inland town of Onitsha

title: Okija renewed crisis
description: renewed chaos

title: Bodo renewed crisis
description: Fight between 2 rival cult groups
sources_of_information: human rights organisation, humanitarian organisations (4 ) , Vanguard (2 ) , This Day (2 )

title: Ogoni crisis
description: Hostility resurgence between 2 rival groups, Junior Vikings Confraternity and Degbam. These 2 gangs are affiliated to 2 prominent Ogoni politicians, Kenneth Kobani (State Commissioner for Finance) and Gabriel Pidomson (a member of the Rivers State House of Assembly)

title: Anambra crisis
description: Governmental troops of 300 men are now deployed in Anambra to cope with terrorists who invaded the State : a bank has been stormed in Nnewi and Broadcasting Service had been under gun shots ; one soldier died

title: Emuhu, extent to Onitsha crisis
description: Okija traditional ruler invited militaries from Onitsha to take over Emuhu village. A mayhem followed, as youths killed local vigilantes, robbed and destroyed properties.

title: Catholic cleric
description: Clergyman gunned down by suspected armed bandits

title: MASSOB, Police, NARTO, Anambra
description: After a meeting at Akpaka Forest Reserve, MASSOB protests against police recent raids in Okpoki and Fegge areas to prevent their movement; 7 members die during the riots that follow on 16 June. 5 more killed on 17th. NARTO also involved in violence. MASSOB strongholds at Nkpikpa Layout, Ogbaru, Atani Road, Nkpor and Three-Three. Troubles going on. Threats of showdown in Fegge. Massobs claim 20 dead quickly buried in Awada. Secret killings in Akwa, burial in mass grave. NARTO and AGPA accuses Governement to fuel the crisis. Total 30 dead up to 03/07 and 16 dead from 27/06 to 30/06. CLO alleges extra-judicial killings and torture. Soldiers making atrocities are asked to withdraw. For Tell monthly magazine, 25 more killed since 4th July, including 4 policemen. 7 people dead on 5th. Renewed violence: Massob claims 27 dead at Ugwaugba area 7th July. 6 Massob members shot by police July 10th, 2 more on 11th. Massob claims 99 young Igbos shot by police (38 by 82 Division of Nigeria Army executed on 8th near Idaw river, 24 killed at the State Criminal Investigation Department, Awka and 37 executed at the 302 Artillery Regiment at Onitsha). According to NOPRIN, a joint police-army patrol execute 14 youths, including a pastor, at Iyiowa Odoekpe, bodies buried in a mass grave near the police barracks in Onitsha. One policeman is also abducted and killed by suspected Massob's hoodlums, at Silas Works road, Fegge, on 17th, 7 traders have been killed, and robberies involving uniformed men have been committed; 4 policeman killed by Massob in 2 weeks. On 21th, Massob loses 2 activists.On 29/07, Massob declares 129 members shot. On 31/07, they declare 1302 persons missing and 271 Massob members shot. On 23/08 Massob declares 760 members shot (22 in Fegge, 36 in Akpaka, 11 in Idemili, 33 in Okpoko, results unknown for Iko, Awkuzu, Nsugbe, Aguleri, Umuleri, Odekpe, Atani road). On 06/09, Massob claims 200 members shot since army deployement, 2 months ago; on 29/09 police confirms12 policemen and 30 hoodlums dead; on 03/10 a man (non-Massob member) declares he participated to the killings of 7 youths In Akpaka forest; on 18/10, 7 Massob's members have died in cells; on 25/10 Massob alleged that over 2800 innocent members of the group were murdered during the mayhem in Onitsha by soldiers and police. On 14/05/2008 Massob mentions 1044 members killed in Onitsha massacre in 2006/2007.
place: Onitsha, Upper Iweka, Onitsha-Owerri Expressway,Okpoko, Obodo-Ukwu, Fegge area, Ugwuagba Market, Okpoko suburbs.
sources_of_information: Daily Champion (2800 ) , The Week (760 ) , Tell (46 ) , Independent (31 ) , police (76 ) , Vanguard (19 ) , The Punch (40 ) , The Guardian (767 ) , The Nation (760 )

title: BH burn a police station, Borno
description: Suspected Boko Haram militants on Friday set a police station ablaze, killing at least one person.

title: Army kill Boko Haram suspect, Borno
description: JTF kill a suspected Boko Haram member in a gun battle. Army warns that anybody who harbours the sect members would be punished.

title: Boko Haram kill 3, Borno
description: Boko Haram kill three persons, injure a soldier.

title: PDP stalwart, Delta
description: Paul Atie, a former Transition Committee Chairman of Patani Local Government is shot dead by unknown gunmen. He was a frontline crusader against the fourth term aspirations of some legislators from Patani, Bomadi and Burutu areas. The slain politician was also the publicity secretary of Raymos Guanah 2011 Campaign Organisation.
place: shot at a petrol station; the robbers make away with his car

title: Premier League match, Rivers
description: Two Ogoni communities clash (B-Dere and K-Dere) during a football match, over the disappearance of a mobile phone. The crisis is linked to cult rivalries (Deebam versus Deewell) and land tussle, according to Ogoni sources.
place: In B-Dere, at a Viewing centre

title: Land dispute, Benue
description: A land crisis between Kendev community in Konshisha and Mbatsenge community in Gwer Lga over the control the border farmlands leads to the death of eight people. Fighting breaks out after a farmer had planted crops in a disputed farmland and was killed. Two days after, three persons are murdered and the following day, four more persons are killed. Over 200 residents flee the areas.

title: Fulanis attack Berom village, Plateau
description: People suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked a village during the night; one person was killed.

title: Police clashes with army over Fulanis, Plateau
description: Soldiers and police confront over the arrest of Fulani herdsmen who take refuge at the Police Staff College after being accosted by security men. Army has gone to the college in two armoured personnel carriers to arrest the herdsmen. A pandemonium ensues between army and police. Soldiers shoot two persons one of which dies on the spot.
lga: Jos East, Jos North, Jos South

title: Inter-ethnic attack, Plateau
description: Several hundreds of armed Fulanis launch simultaneous attacks in four villages near the state capital. They butcher mainly women and children from christian Berom community with machetes and burn them. Some 500 Christian people are killed in that revenge attack. On 9 March, 380 people get mass burial in Dogo Nahawa while 36 other corpses wait to be buried in Zot. The Chairman of the Recovery and Evacuation Committee, Solomon Zangwith declares the death toll may be 600 victims. Plateau State Governor, Jonah Jang accuses army of complicity. The crisis is linked to the indigene-settler dichotomy.
place: Shen district of the LGA. Most of the dead in Ramsat, Zot and Dogo-Nahawa villages are women and children. Zot village is wiped out, almost everybody has been killed. On 23 March, it is reported that more bodies have been found in Dogo Nahawa.
sources_of_information: The Nation (500 ) , Daily Trust (500 ) , Independent (500 ) , The Punch (600 ) , Other newpapers 1 (500 )

title: Bakassi returnee (15), Cross River
description: 17 Nigerians were killed by the gendarmes between September and November this year and many more are being hunted down as they flee Abana, Atabong East /West and other areas in the crisis-torn peninsula. Repartition will be made according to this information.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits raided a community and killed a 45-year-old man. They reportedly shot sporadically before hitting the victims. Some people were also injured.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed 1 person and injured 3 others. The attack occurred less than 24 hours after the arrest of a 32-year-old man who attempted to procure ammunition from the FCT for bandits operating in the state.
place: Mashayar Zaki Village along the Gusau–Dansadau Road

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: The 8 Division Nigeria Army/Sector 2 Joint Taskforce North West, Operation Fansa Yanma killed 11 bandits and recovered a large cache of arms. This event was backdated by 2 days since no date was reported for the incident.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 3 (11 ) , The Guardian (11 ) , Other newspaper 2 (11 )

title: Bandit Attack, Zamfara
description: Bandits attacked and killed two community members and also fired indiscriminately, forcing residents to flee. This was in retaliation for the N20 million levied on the community by bandits.

title: Army vs Protesters, Adamawa
description: Soldiers allegedly killed 9 female peaceful protesters who were demonstrating against banditry and demanding the government’s action against armed groups. Many others were injured. Armed denied any involvement and blamed the crisis on a land dispute between the Bachama and Chobo communities.
place: Tingno, Suwa, Balaifi, Wami 1, Wami 2 and Waduku
sources_of_information: Other newpapers 1 (9 ) , Daily Trust (7 ) , Nigerian Tribune (9 )

title: Youths vs Vigilante, Delta
description: Four people died while several others were injured, and parts of a hotel were set ablaze during a clash between youths and vigilantes. The crisis started when a vigilante killed a youth while forcing them back to their hotel rooms after they complained of excessive heat and needed fresh air. The victims included a hotel guest and 3 others.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (4 ) , Nigerian Tribune (4 ) , The Nation (4 )

title: Gunmen Attack, Sokoto
description: Five vigilantes were killed, while two others sustained gunshot injuries, and six persons, including two married women, two teenage girls, and two young boys, were abducted by gunmen. It was subsequently reported that soldiers killed 11 bandits during the attack. Among the gunmen killed was a wanted and notorious terrorist kingpin, Kalamu, Turji Bello's second in command.
sources_of_information: Nigerian Tribune (5 ) , Other newspaper 2 (16 ) , Daily Trust (16 ) , Vanguard (16 ) , The Punch (13 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops of Operation HADIN KAI (OPHK) successfully foiled an attempt by Boko Haram terrorists to carry out an attack and killed several insurgents, including a notorious Boko Haram/ISWAP commander.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits raided a community and killed 4 vigilantes and 1 civilian. They also abducted 6 people, including 2 married women, 2 teenage boys and 2 teenage girls, as well as rustled cows.

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Boko Haram terrorists killed one person who resisted abduction and kidnapped over 20 onion farmers, including women and children, who went out daily to work on the farm.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Bandits killed 2 people and kidnapped an unspecified number of people. The community came under attack after a neighbouring Gatawa community in Sabon Birnin was raided. See the event in IBD033903.

title: Bomb Explosion, Borno
description: Four teenagers who were playing with an IED died when the device exploded. They were identified as Awana Mustapha, 15; Malum Modu, 14; Lawan Ibrahim, 12; and Modu Abacha, 12. It is assumed that the IED must have been abandoned by Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters.

title: Banditry, Taraba
description: Troops of Headquarters 6 Brigade, Nigerian Army/Sector 3 Operation Whirl Stroke killed 2 bandits and destroyed their hideout. They also arrested a key suspect linked to criminal activities in the area and recovered an AK-47 rifle and 21 rounds of ammunition.

title: Land Crisis, Delta
description: A long-standing boundary dispute between Edjekota (Ogor Kingdom) and Otor-Ewu again spiralled into violence, where 2 people were killed, and many others were injured. This incident is linked with IBD033890.

title: Boko Haram Suicide Bomber, Borno
description: An Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) suicide bomber reportedly killed five soldiers who were manning a checkpoint. The attacker was believed to have been hiding in the Mandara Mountains before the attack.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (5 ) , PM News (5 ) , The Nation (5 )

title: Police vs Youth, Kogi
description: Bandits killed 2 residents, while police operatives reportedly killed another two residents during a protest. Shortly after the attack by the bandits, youths took to the streets in protest, and in the process, lost 2 men.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (4 ) , The Punch (4 ) , Other newspaper 3 (4 )

title: Bandits Attack, Kogi
description: Two people, Williams Onimayin and Olowo Memonbiayere, were killed, and ten others were abducted following coordinated attacks by bandits.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Soldiers killed 5 bandits during an operation. They also recovered weapons, motorcycles, and Baofeng radios used by the bandits.

title: Land Crisis, Delta
description: A long-standing boundary dispute between Edjekota (Ogor Kingdom) and Otor-Ewu claimed a life. Many others were injured. This incident is linked with IBD033891.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Sokoto
description: Soldiers, with the help of vigilantes, killed 2 bandits and arrested 3 others. They moved in after receiving the community’s alert of an attack.

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Bandits raided different communities and killed 5 people. While 3 were killed in an attack on Jamroro settlement, 2 others were killed in Oeagi and Takete Isao. Some people were injured while others were kidnapped.
place: Jamroro settlement, Oeagi and Takete Isao

title: Boko Haram attack, Borno
description: NAF airstrikes killed several terrorists and destroyed the terrorist vehicles at a known terrorist enclave. The NAF, in coordinated intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance missions, noticed a revealed repeated terrorist movement and a concentration of vehicles concealed under vegetation, identifying the area as an active terrorist logistics hub before carrying out the strike. It was assumed that 20 terrorists were killed in the attack.
place: Dabar Masara, located in the Southern Tumbuns

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Church Attack: Bandits attacked a branch of the Evangelical Church Winning All (ECWA) during service, killed a worshipper and abducted many others. Subsequently, it was reported that local hunters killed 4 of the attackers.
sources_of_information: Daily Trust (1 ) , Vanguard (5 ) , Other newspaper 3 (5 ) , The Punch (4 )

title: Soldiers vs Boko Haram, Borno
description: Soldiers under Operation Hadin Kai reportedly killed 21 Boko Haram/Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists after ambushing a logistics convoy. The operation was conducted in collaboration with the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) and local vigilantes.
sources_of_information: The Punch (21 ) , Nigerian Tribune (21 ) , The Nation (21 ) , Vanguard (17 )

title: Boko Haram Attack, Borno
description: Troops repelled an attack by Islamic State West Africa Province (ISWAP) terrorists, killing and wounding several of them and also neutralising two vehicle-borne improvised explosive devices (VBIEDs). They recovered arms and other items during the operation. It was assumed that 20 of the terrorists were killed.

title: Banditry, Zamfara
description: Bandits killed one person and abducted 7 others during a raid on a community. Another person sustained gunshot injuries. The community has suffered repeated attacks by bandits for the past month.

title: Banditry, Sokoto
description: Troops of the Nigerian Army’s 8 Division, in collaboration with local vigilante groups, reportedly killed a notorious bandit kingpin, Kachalla Kallamu, during a coordinated operation. Kallamu, who was one of the closest associates and a senior lieutenant of a bandit leader, Bello Turji, was killed alongside a major logistics supplier to bandits.
place: Between Girnashe and Kuka Tara villages under the Tsabre ward

title: Herdsmen Attack, Plateau
description: Suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked a community and killed 4 children identified as Precious Joshuah, Isa’ac Joshuah, Mary Joshuah, and Eve Sambo.

title: Banditry, Kogi
description: Suspected bandits killed two and abducted several people along farm routes. Residents believed that over 10 farmers were kidnapped by the attackers.

title: Soldiers vs Bandits, Benue
description: Troops of Operation Whirl Stroke (OPWS) killed 3 bandits, among whom were Sughter Abelebe and Sughnen Abelebe. The gang erected an illegal roadblock along the road before they were intercepted. This event is backdated by 2 days since no date was reported.
sources_of_information: Other newspaper 2 (3 ) , The Punch (3 ) , Other newpapers 1 (3 )
